title: my favorite game ever! ÊàëÊúÄÂñúÊ¨¢ÁöÑÊ∏∏ÊàèÔºÅ

review:
I‚Äôve never enjoyed games where you do quests and have a major storyline, but this game is SO GOOD. The stories are amazing, as are the characters, and all of it meshes together to make it an awesome game. The animation is top-notch. I was always so amazed at how they add even the smallest details, like how when you go up stairs the characters slow down. The elements the characters have adds a whole level to the game, but they didn‚Äôt copy it the way others have. Each character has a unique part of that element when they use it. The world is such an amazing place, and as you travel along, you feel like you‚Äôre actually discovering a new world. The pulling characters system is such a great idea, and while I get very frustrated if I can‚Äôt get the character I want, it‚Äôs really exciting to get it when I do. The multiplayer system is such a great option as well, and it lets you help other players or get help from people. The game being FREE is just another aspect that gets it so much support from me. While you can buy items in the shop, there‚Äôs absolutely no reason you need to buy things in the game other than to get them easier.
All in all, just play it. A lot of different people enjoy this game, and if you‚Äôre reading this, you‚Äôre probably considering downloading the game, so please do.
title: Such a Great Game

review:
They desperately need to change the resin system.  Up to about AR 45 it might not seem like a big deal but when you get to end game content it is really frustrating to have to wait over 20hrs for about 10-20min worth of game play which is often disappointing due to the RNG system. The RNG system wouldn‚Äôt be an issue if a very large amount of resin was available or a massive cut to the cost of basically everything that costs resin. I just want to play the game and have fun rolling the RNG system for artifacts but I can‚Äôt do that cause of the resin now that I‚Äôm AR 50. If they don‚Äôt fix this soon, this incredible game is going to fizzle out. Very limited game play mixed with low rewards in the end game will be this games demise.

To Mihoyo who will probably never see this. This is bad business on your end. If someone can‚Äôt truly farm for an artifact or character/weapon experience, than why would they spend their money on a new character once they are AR 50 or higher? The process of acquiring the gear for a new character and leveling them and their gear up becomes a gigantic chore that takes away from the ability to increase any current character‚Äôs strength.
eg: I didn‚Äôt bother rolling much for Eula and multiple other‚Äôs because I didn‚Äôt have the resources to level them up without holding back on the character‚Äôs I need to be stronger for spiral abyss.
title: Amazing game but‚Ä¶

review: I started playing this game because my wife enjoys it and wanted me to help her with some of the tougher bosses haha. Suffice to say, we‚Äôre both practically addicted at this point üòÖ this game provides hours and hours of fun, and updates regularly with new content, so theres always a reason to keep playing. I can see why people end up spending an awful lot on the gatcha mechanic, but i‚Äôve been managing just fine earning my primogems by grinding. While there is the option to spend money, this is by NO means a ‚Äòpay to win‚Äô kind of game; regardless of how many cool characters you collect, if you want to complete the story, beat tough bosses, and upgrade your fav characters and weapons, you have to actually invest your time and get good. which i appreciate! I‚Äôve been having a blast with it, and the fandom for this game (on twitter, tiktok, and tumblr especially) is very funny as well haha. if you liked breath of the wild at all, you‚Äôd probably enjoy this as well and pick it up very easily. I can see why some may think its a rip off, as a lot of the in game mechanics are VERY similar, but i will say this game has an entirely unique story, and a ton of things that make it a Very distinct game from BOTW. I would say its a game that would greatly appeal to anyone who enjoyed BOTW though, so check it out!
title: Incredibly Fun

review: The game starts out pretty fun, there was lots to do and I was wishing all the time because of how easy it was to get primos. But I‚Äôm AR 55 now, and I‚Äôve stopped playing for a while because the game has gotten more boring, and it‚Äôs so hard to get primo gems other than events and some of the story or world quests. I‚Äôve been keeping up with the new updates and saw that Sumeru was gonna come out. I‚Äôm Arab, and I was excited to see that it was based off of the Middle East / South Asia. But I was so disappointed to see you guys doing the same thing Aladdin did, mix up Middle Eastern and South Asian culture, there was barely any good culture representation  of South Asian / Middle Eastern. Also the biggest thing, why are all the characters pale? The Middle East is diverse and not all people from there are tan some are paler or on the darker side of the spectrum, but there was only ONE character that was only a bit tan. And none of the characters had traditional clothes, or curly hair, and there was no Arabic / Hindi dub. I also didn‚Äôt see much rep for South Asia either. And being completely honest, coming from an Arab I expected much better. I don‚Äôt Know if this is racism, or just Hoyoverse didn‚Äôt do the proper research but either way I think this should be fixed.
title: The new update‚Ä¶ just no. ( I rated this a 5 stars so hoyoverse sees this )

review: As the title says, Genshin is a pretty unpolished game in some areas. The lack of rewards during the anniversary, the resin system, the artifice to system (which was almost seemingly implemented into the game to work against the players progress) are all evidence of a game leading to failure. Quite frankly, this game would have been dead months ago if resin wasn‚Äôt a way for mihoyo to time gate some of the game‚Äôs LITTLE content. You might be wondering how I can say that the resin is a bad system while also acknowledging that it‚Äôs what keeps the players playing, but my point is that players feel like they‚Äôre missing out opportunities to get artifacts and whatnot and that they feel that they‚Äôre actively killing their account by NOT draining their resin, so they feel forced to play to prevent that. One of the main reasons this game is still going actually is because there‚Äôs no competition for the game to compete with. Honkai? Not open world. Blue protocol? Doesn‚Äôt exist yet. Tower of fantasy? Not out yet. ZZZ? Not out yet, and even if it was it‚Äôs also CREATED AND OWNED by Hoyoverse (Honkai too.) They‚Äôre literally competing with themselves. As soon as an anime rpg open world game comes out which is very well done and isn‚Äôt plagued by the same problems Genshin is, then the game will really be hit hard player wise. It‚Äôs player return count is already dwindling every time a new update comes out. This isn‚Äôt even half of my issues with this game.
title: Rough.

review:
Genshin has been one of the best games ive played and will be for a while the fan base yeah can get a little wild at times and yeah i disagree with somethings but over all one of the best times ive had  mostly all the people ive played with were kind and the characters were great the story was amazing and i felt at ease and happy the whole way through i was an F2P and ive made it all the way to AR 56 and almost cleared spiral abyss with 35 stars the whole game was fun and i enjoyed every second

but all good things must come to an end with genshin taking up to all my storage i cant keep playing and once inazuma came it was over but the day before the update i did my last wish and tripled crowned my childe on his b-day :D but now since i dont have a pc or anything else to play genshin on i guess its over the road has ended and my time is over i would have loved to play the new update i was even saving for yoimiya but i guess its time to leave ill still stay in the fandom but never be able to play :( good bye genshin ive had my fun but goodbye i wish everyone who reads my story luck to get whatever 5* you want now or in the future goodbye take your time on everything no rush all journeys must come to an end but the memories we made along the way will stay with us till the end.. o7
title: So long partner o7

review: Genshin impact is a great game. very fun to play, engaging story, and aside from being a BoW clone it has an element of uniqueness to it. Over all a great game, but just not quite there on mobile. Has a lot of lag, but on top of that doesn‚Äôt provide the must haves for mobile gaming. The game doesn‚Äôt provide an option to rearrange ur hub layout, which is super surprising Bc this is a simple service that is provided by almost all newer mobile games. The game isn‚Äôt claw sensitive, for example if ur using an archer and you do an aimed shot, the game doesn‚Äôt allow u to hold the shoot bottom with one finger and aim with another which is really annoying. It‚Äôs not always a problem but it definitely get in the way. The game also isn‚Äôt compatible with a controller which is also surprising. It‚Äôs seems like the games has an obsolete approach to mobile gaming which is weird Bc the game legit just came out. Aside from the hiccups it‚Äôs a great game, just a way better game on every other platform. Take for example Fortnite mobile, epic was able to take the experience players had on pc and console and give it to mobile players. To the point where some mobile players were able to out preform some console players. That‚Äôs was amazing on epics part. Genshin hasn‚Äôt be able to make the game comfortable to mobile players and that why I‚Äôm giving it a 3. If this was a review on p4 I‚Äôd give it a 5. Devs not to make the game a better experience on mobile
title: The game doesn‚Äôt translate well to mobile

review: It‚Äôs a great game, incredible storyline, and absolutely astonishing graphics that are just alluring. Though I feel as if this game is P2W (Pay 2 win) and as a F2P (Free 2 play) person on the game, it feels unfair. We battle mobs, get chests, and in the mail get food but barley any primos unless there are events and let‚Äôs add that we almost never get primos from the chests, waypoints, or things we do. We get okay amounts for the main quests and sometimes side quests, but to get characters we want for banners? It‚Äôs barley enough. I‚Äôve tried multiple ways to get primos, but they never worked. What really just bothers me is the fact that the primogem or genesis crystal prices are VERY high for barley anything, and I don‚Äôt want to pay for something that‚Äôll probably get used quickly with the chance of not even getting the characters I want. It‚Äôs also unfair to have to play HOURS on a game to barley get rewards. Finally, the chance of not even getting the characters we want. It bothers me to think that I save up to loose the 50/50 or my pity drops until the guaranteed. If we can‚Äôt get good characters, we can‚Äôt develop well in the game. Let‚Äôs also add that if we do get a good character, if not given correct weapons or artifacts, they will be really weak. Other than these few issues, I find the game really good.
title: Great game! Just few issues that bother me‚Ä¶

review: I never write reviews but this game deserves 5 stars and it especially does now that spoiled brats are rating the game 1 star just because a free game didn‚Äôt give them a tesla for anniversary. I also never spend money on games but this was the first game that made me want to spend money because it is that good and I feel like the company deserved it. You can enjoy this game entirely for free though and still get lots of cool 5 star characters and weapons. You will get tons of primogems (currency used to get the rarest weapons and characters) just by doing quests, achievements, and having fun playing the game. Gacha system aside, Genshin has stunning graphics and an even better soundtrack. They consistently release a new major update to the game every 40 days so you will never be bored. I‚Äôm still in awe that this masterpiece which is now my favorite game was free right from the beginning. Anyone complaining about anniversary rewards should remember how generous Mihoyo is already‚Ä¶ Seriously it‚Äôs a multi-platform game with free major updates every 40 days and they still give tons of primogems to us. People who compare Mihoyo to EA obviously haven‚Äôt played EA games. If they were like EA, Genshin would cost $60 and every update would be DLC instead of free AND we‚Äôd have to buy Genshin 22 for $60 the next yearüíÄ
title: My Favorite Game

review: Hello, so um I started playing this game for a week and a half and it‚Äôs very impressive to be honest. I love everything about it although there‚Äôs not much I can say because this game is already amazing as EVER, the animations of the characters are hella awesome but problem is when it gets to the animation part it lags and slows down the animation and the voices are still going on- and when I log in and start playing for like 5 to 10 Minutes it just restarts and I‚Äôm back in my background of my device I have this problem ever since I started Genshin Impact. I‚Äôve played Honkai Impact as well but no problems with it. At the same time I‚Äôm also thinking if it‚Äôs just that something may be wrong with my device... I put it to 5 stars cause I love this game already even though it lags and crashes down for some reason I KNOW that you guys are improving everything about this game and that‚Äôs cool it‚Äôs just a bit frustrating because I kept going back and fourth log in and then out, I hope you guys can fix this problem sooner or later?.. but I‚Äôll still keep playing Genshin Impact because I have already sell my soul to it lol ( I‚Äôm not good with feedbacks but hope this explains enough of my problem, I‚Äôm sure other people are having the same experience as me as well!.. ) and so thank you for reading this.
title: Amazing game ever!! but one problem...

review:
I absolutely love this game and have spent more than I would like to admit on it. It‚Äôs one of my all time favorite games. That being said this anniversary they showed up that they do not not care about their fans with the rewards they gave. Worse yet is their silence and deleting of comments they don‚Äôt like so I guess I‚Äôll give a bad review even though I love their product. in addition  they have released a character who clearly needed more time in the oven and looks like they don‚Äôt play their own game when designing. They have changed the skill descriptions after players summoned a character to fit their narrative on why it doesn‚Äôt work with certain things. In the year I have been playing endgame has been non existent and most of what you do is chores to get your meager amount of currency to get stuff and get better and better artifacts that there is nothing requiring you to be so well built . I highly recommend this game if you want a good casual phone game that can be played on other devices. That being said know this company doesn‚Äôt respect you are your time with them. They will always give you the bare minimum resource wise. I did not want to make a bad review but at this point they are not listening to their fans and actively silencing people.

Edit : they ended up giving some extra rewards so I‚Äôll give them back a couple stars
title: Amazing Game but this company is being greedy

review: This game is really addicting, and really fun to play! The graphics are absolutely wonderful, and the character‚Äôs outfits and personalities are really great too! The amount of effort put into this game is astonishing, and in my opinion the game itself has no problem to it, except for the fact that it does take up a lot of storage, but that isn‚Äôt something that could be helped, and in my opinion it was worth it. I really love how the game is actually playable even if we don‚Äôt pay money, since in some games, we might have to pay money to unlock some things, but we don't necessarily need money in this game to get a lot of characters, since the game already gave many ways to earn primo gems! I was also looking over the 1 star ratings, and I thought that they were all ridiculous, with most of them just asking for a certain character. I do think that it would be great if MiHoyo can make some clarifications if there is a ‚Äúcanon‚Äù MC, since there has been a few people who think that Aether is the canon MC, while others believe that there is no canon MC. It would be great if we can actually get a response from the developers about this situation instead of people continuously debating on the canon MC. Anyway, thank you for you time reading this review, have a wonderful day/night!
title: Amazing.

review:
This game plays like a Breath of the Wild clone with completely optional gatcha elements. The fact that you can have a party of four, with each member having unique elemental skills and weapons specialties for whatever puzzles and enemies come your way. Plus the story of finding your lost twin and learning about the seven Archons is really engaging. And while the game‚Äôs PS4 counterpart lacks cross-save compatibility, it might prove useful to content creators who wish to do a Let‚Äôs Play of Genshin Impact.

That said, I gave this game four stars. The reason for this isn‚Äôt because of some minor glitches that allow items to just float in midair (like what happened to me lol), but because of overheating issues on my IPhone SE Second Generation and the amount of battery life it siphons compared to some of my other apps. For mobile users such as myself, this game could definitely use a Battery Saver feature in the options menu. Could help with the battery issues, especially since once it overheats to a certain extent, the phone can lose charge... while it‚Äôs charging.

Thank you for your time reading this, looking forward to more story content, and while I wouldn‚Äôt use the possible controller compatibility feature, I‚Äôm sure others would look forward to that. I hope you take this constructive criticism and implement it into future updates
title: Some wrinkles to iron out, but otherwise decent

review:
This game is by far, one of the most amazing games that I‚Äôve played. They added so much detail into this game and the animations and real 3D motions are amazing. The updates, features of this game is simply the best along with beautiful characters that you grind for. 
If I were to make a suggestion, it‚Äôd be to have an alternative where you aren‚Äôt required to download everything from the start. The issue with the current version is that it‚Äôs required to download the full version once you get to a certain point and can‚Äôt play if you don‚Äôt have it downloaded. I‚Äôd love to keep playing in the level I‚Äôm currently at, but I‚Äôm running very low on storage space but I can‚Äôt play unless I download it which I can‚Äôt. Hopefully you will make an alternative way to play the game while saving a bit of storage. If you can make this happen, I will never ever even have to think about deleting genshin impact because its the best game I‚Äôve ever played! P.S. Any chance you could make it available for Macbook players to download Genshin and not just PCs? I know the Macs might over heat but I‚Äôd love to be able to play on computer. (Partially because of the fact that my computer has more storage) Thank you so muchhhh! Keep doing amazing creating/developing your game!
title: Amazing but please read!

review: I give the game 3 stars because it‚Äôs actually entertaining and addicting but there are lots of things I don‚Äôt really like in the game. First of all some unrealistic things. When you are swimming and the character OBVIOUSLY can stand up and stop swimming, they keep swimming.. Also that when you‚Äôre in Inazuma doing an Inazuma quest, the thunders still hit you when talking to people in the quest‚Ä¶ Now I would like to talk about the characters‚Ä¶ every single NPC girl is either an adventurer with black or brown short hair or also a seller with blonde hair. There are not black people in the game (I wouldn‚Äôt consider Xinyan). And this‚Ä¶ I haven‚Äôt seen any ‚Äúflat‚Äù girl in the game that is not a short character. And (I am not being homophobic)the boys BARELY dress like boys and act like ones. There is nothing wrong with not doing it but there is barely people in the game like that. I think it should be easier to get level up materials. I am AR 35 (EXP 14,000/7,000) and my characters are mostly on LV 40 but some are on 40/50 because I can‚Äôt find materials to level them up. I am stuck on this rank and for me it doesn‚Äôt really makes sense that all the extra EXP it‚Äôs made into mora‚Ä¶ 7,000 mora it‚Äôs too little for all the effort that I put into it.. I can‚Äôt complete the ascension quest 2 because it keeps telling me I am under level. And well I play the game because it‚Äôs too addicting but I don‚Äôt like it.
title: I don‚Äôt like it but I play it

review: I know that title sounds very questionable, but this game is amazing. Firstly, it‚Äôs free to play which is really shocking because the graphics, character designs, and overall how nicely the game runs is excellent quality. For BotW I had to pay $60 and didn‚Äôt even play for more than 2 hours, but Genshin Impact is completely free! Paying for primogems is completely optional and doesn‚Äôt effect gameplay at all. Second, the storyline is very intriguing. Some may argue that once you get to high Adventure Ranks and wait for the story to be updated it can be boring, I disagree. There are plenty of commissions and quests to keep you entertained. Plus, there are domains, bosses, spiral abyss, and events! Another thing is the characters. Each character is unique, has a fantastic design, and interesting gameplay. Seeing a character in a quest has me saving primogems for their banner every time! Speaking of design, Teyvat is such a large and beautiful world. Sometimes I just walk around and take it the sights. The songs, the view, it can be an action packed liar or a tranquil mountain. In conclusion, Genshin Impact is definitely worth the download and it‚Äôs completely free, in fact it‚Äôs probably one of the best games out there and my personal favorite. Download Genshin Impact, it‚Äôs absolutely worth it.
title: Better than Breath of the Wild

review:
I was on the fense about getting this game for a while until finally I decided to give it a try. I was pleasantly impressed to find out that not only were their advertisements true to the actual game (as most others simply lie), but the gameplay itself feels fully fledged. This is the sort of game you‚Äôd expect from a console, and I gotta say it‚Äôs nice to see the effort that went into this. The combat style is engaging and fun. I also love that while it sticks to the familiar mobile trend of having in-app purchases, the game itself was free and my experience has thus far not been dampened despite the fact that I have not spend a single penny on it. It has given me little need to do so, and that‚Äôs awesome. I must also note that I am playing this on a more powerful phone as I understand that others have complained about lag, and I don‚Äôt blame them, this game file is HUGE, but is you are fortunate enough to experience a lag-free gameplay, (if not something close to it) then it really is beautiful. As mentioned before, the advertisements you see about this game are true. I loved hearing the side stories of the characters, as well as their own tutorials on how to use them. Very well done. I hope they stay true to this for the times ahead.

Also, Paimon is adorable and NOT food!üòú (To each their ownüòâ)
title: Truly Stunning Mobile Game

review:
Pros: The game is beautiful with amazing graphics, exploration, music and unique characters. The storyline is interesting and (mostly) well-written, and higher-rarity characters are not 100% required to finish everything in the game. It has simple mechanics and interface, meaning that even if you don‚Äôt normally play video games, you can still pick up on what to do pretty quickly. There is plenty of content for you to do when you *first* start. Will keep you entertained for hours, days, weeks, months, maybe years.

 Cons: you get burnt out a while after finishing the storyline and some farming for your characters. Artifact system has WAY too much RNG which is one of if not the system that burns players out most. Events are limited and once they go away, the important lore (and rewards) go away as well. Endgame is basically nonexistent. Little to no interaction with playerbase; company is very greedy. Extremely expensive (although that‚Äôs not a surprise). Characters are region locked, making Inazuman (and potentially others) characters inaccessible to new players who might have obtained them. Diversity is lacking and one character (Dori) is *possibly* orientalist.

 Overall, very beautiful and entertaining game. However, there are quite a few things that could improve it to make it even better.
title: Outstanding With Drawbacks (pros&cons)

review: I have been playing Genshin for two years and I love this game so much. I have played with both family and friends and they still play and are enjoying it. There is so much to do like daily commissions, fighting bosses or enemies, or leveling up characters. When not doing those things you can do some of the many quests, archon quests, story quests, or world quests. All the different quests can give you rewards from large amounts of primogems (the items used for getting different characters and weapons) to mora (the currency in the game) and exp books. The characters in Genshin are also amazing, from their design to play style and lore there is so much to learn about them. Like the traveler that you play as, the differences between them (I used them because you pick between Aether, the boy and Lumine, the girl). The different places you get to go like Mondstadt, the nation of anemo and freedom is based of Germany. You can see the references in the lore, architecture, and nature there. This game always has so much to do even at higher ars ( ar stands for adventurer rank)! This game is like a must play for people that like gacha and/or anime games. If you do or even don‚Äôt like Genshin you can always try some of HoYoVerses other games, like their newest one Honkai: Star Rail!
title: Playing For Two Years

review: This game is worth playing. Excellent adventure. I‚Äôve even put money into this game which is unusual for me. Some things I want to recommend: 1. I like how you have the option to offload used data to free up space. If you already finished a bunch of missions with audio and video cut scenes, this is awesome. Instead of offloading, wouldn‚Äôt it be better to allow players to download things AS they play instead? I mean, some missions you can‚Äôt play to until later anyways. Also, sometimes player audio is annoying. I‚Äôm tired of listening to Bennet‚Ä¶ 2. Also, great job on allowing the players to set the video settings for high or low based on their preferences and the way it helps prevent in-game lag. I‚Äôm playing on an older iPhone, and this helps!!! 3. An adjustable set of controls would help prevent me from pressing the wrong keys all the time too! 4. Pleeeeeease, work on your dialogue. I haven‚Äôt seen late-game dialogues, but early on it is terrible. You can literally skip 40+ pages of dialogue and complete the quests without having missed anything important. Not a joke. I enjoy the missions and backstory, but some of it is monotonous and pointless. 5. Sometimes farming domains for artifacts or talent materials, etc. is REALLY boring but basically required. I don‚Äôt enjoy it. I loathe it.
title: Amazing, but always room for improvement

review:
Dear developers, I‚Äôd like to start by thanking you for such an amazing game. I‚Äôve learnt a lot of things in the game, the culture, traditions and style of each regions which represent specific locations in the world, my english dictionary has grown quite a lot, as well as Japanese. I‚Äôve learnt a lot about other peoples‚Äô troubles and how everyone solves their problems so I can use the knowledge in real life. The game also makes my day, it brings joy to me everytime I start my computes or phone and I see the Genshin icon. So again, thank you for the delightful experience.üíû

On the other hand tho, as you‚Äôve already seen from the other reviews and considering your 4.4 star rating (which will likely change depending on your next anniversary rewards), you most definitely have to bump up the amount of rewards we receive, especially Primogems. Its extremely hard to defeat some bosses to gain certain materials for some people, and by giving us more Primogems, we‚Äôll be able to receive more characters and beat enemies and monsters rather more easily, which is also good for you because people might stress about it, get angry and leave a bad review, and even quit. 

Thank you for reading, please take the last recommendation into consideration, thank you.üíû
title: Thank you.

review: Amazing game! Started playing just a few weeks ago and it is very addicting! I am almost overwhelmed with the amount of content and things for me to do! The art and graphics are absolutely breathtaking and the combat and gameplay are for the most part exciting and fun. Sure, the gacha drop-rates are not the best, but there are certain guarantees so it‚Äôs still very possible to get good drops with enough time and work. Recently, people have been bombarding the game with poor reviews due to the 1st Anniversary events that are going on right now; the rewards they are offering are apparently not living up to fans‚Äô high expectations. They are offering 10 free wishes as log-in rewards as well as a festival event where you can track down chests and defeat monsters in order to obtain a good number of primogems and items. In addition, they recently sent the first of four thank you messages to all players that came with a sizable 400 primogems and a new glider skin. Still, many fans are not happy with their rewards and have resorted to writing bad reviews of the game, which is just immature and wrong. I personally stand by miHoYo‚Äôs rewards‚Äîit‚Äôs their game and they are free to do what they want with it‚Ä¶we should be grateful to have gotten the rewards we did!
title: Don‚Äôt Listen to the Bad Reviews of the Entitled

review:
People are calling this game ‚Äúanime Legend of Zelda,‚Äù which is pretty much true. It is so fantastic and honestly I‚Äôm so in love with it. The storyline, combat, graphics, everything is great! The fact that you can switch characters to fight certain elements is something that I really like, especially with the really amazing voice acting that comes with it. I haven‚Äôt been this invested in a game in a while and I‚Äôm ready to play it through and through. I haven‚Äôt found any glitches yet so far so that‚Äôs Great!
     One thing I will say, though, is that I really am excited for this to come out on Xbox and the Nintendo Switch. I kind of hope it could come out on Mac but Mac has been kind of complicated recently and various games have been becoming incompatible with it due to new updates. I also would love it if mounts were a thing. Even if horses can‚Äôt be programmed into the game, at least a hoverboard or something that goes equally as fast as the running speed. This game, I understand, just got released so there‚Äôs still obviously more things to do, so I can‚Äôt wait to see what more there is to come! I love everything about this game, I forgot to say how glorious the music is, too, and I‚Äôm just honestly amazed. Anyways, weeb/geek rant over. I‚Äôm just too happy with this game.
title: Absolutely Fantastic

review: Genshin has something for everyone. I am an artist and musician and tech theater lover and it has literally all of those things. ( the tech was in the summer 2023 event. So fun!) the art is inspiring and gets me out of artist blocks. The music deserves every award it has gotten and more. It is not a hard game to do and is a good starter if you don‚Äôt really play RPG games. If you do play RPG games it is still great because you can play it to your own different styles and strengths. Like with the puzzles in events that really make you think. Every character is unique to fit people‚Äôs different play styles and the story‚Äôs are always a joy. I can not get over how good the writing is in this game!!!!! It is so beautiful and artfully done to convey the feeling of the story. And if you don‚Äôt like the quest your doing than just stop‚Ä¶ the game is very chill and won‚Äôt make you feel like you have to finish anything. All in all it is a wonderful game that I think gets a lot of flack for no reason. There is one problem that has stood out to me since I started playing though. There is not a lot of diversity in the characters and I hope in Natlan ( next rejoin) they will change that. But still I recommend it to anyone who has read this far! Have fun playing ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è
title: I love this game so much

review: I don‚Äôt know why people are eating this game 1 star‚Ä¶it‚Äôs honestly an amazing role playing game- the graphics are to die for. The animation is clean. The details to character design and animation are so eye catching! The stories are creative and unique and every character has their own amazing story quest! All though everything needs it fixes I have 1 or 2- first in the beginning I had a hard time figuring out what artifacts and what weapons I should give my characters because I didn‚Äôt understand what ‚ÄúDmg‚Äù ‚Äúcrit‚Äù and any of that stuff meant- so maybe a quick option in the corner to tell you how they work would be awsome! And if there already is one maybe make it more obvious! I‚Äôve been playing the game for a year and I‚Äôm still stumped on this part of the game! Second‚Ä¶I feel really disappointed when I spend all my time farming primos for a character and don‚Äôt get the 5 star I want- I feel that there is no fix to this but I‚Äôm really really really hoping for venti this banner and I‚Äôm not aloud to spend money on games‚Ä¶so maybe more re-runs? Or make 50/50‚Äôs more easy to obtain a character because for people who can‚Äôt spend money in the game it‚Äôs really hard to get 5 stars and make a good team! So that‚Äôs my only request!
title: Why are people rating this 1 star?!??

review:
This is one of the best games I have ever played, mobile or otherwise. The game is beautiful, the music is spectacular, the acting is decent, the game has interesting systems and mechanics, has interesting and highly customizable equipment/stats and has a great curve for learning to build and balance a party. The exploration is amazing and rewards you for paying attention to your surroundings. Sometimes the tangible rewards are lacking in uniqueness, but the feeling of solving the puzzle or finding a random boss fight is great. I hope for true boss encounters in the future and larger dungeons, but this is a game I will be coming back to for years.
The whole story can be beaten with free characters and items, and a decent amount of premium currency is given for playing the game to allow you to acquire a few more characters. If you want to get into the optional content most is possible for free, but paying allows you to have more fun and a more tailored party with better synergy. Seeing my first 5-star character‚Äôs ultimate ability for the first time was amazing. It felt like I was setting the whole battlefield on fire. That said, it is a long and involved game and can feel somewhat daunting. It is mostly single player and I really wish multiplayer was in a better place, because my friends really just wanted co-op.
title: One of the best

review:
I adore this game, the controls are easy, there‚Äôs a lot to learn but it‚Äôs made fun with balanced rewards and a lot to explore! I play the game every night together with my family and we make it a family thing, I‚Äôve even recommended the game to my friends. 

That‚Äôs where I run into my own personal issue, the storage space bug. I have to assume it‚Äôs a bug of some kind because I recommended the game to my best friend who had shown interest in becoming a player. However, even after buying extra phone storage space, restarting their phone, deleting and reinstalling the app, quite literally everything I can think of, it still won‚Äôt let my friend download the full game. They can play the demo and load it up, but it gets to about 55% before it pops up a Insufficient Storage Space Error: 9005. 

I know the game is hefty, I mean, the map is huge and all interactive with multiple levels. That‚Äôs part of the appeal to me, but the only thing that makes sense is that it‚Äôs a bug preventing her from downloading the game. Until this is fixed, I unfortunately cannot give it a full five stars. If anytime has any idea how to fix this, please let me know! I adore this game and I want to get a lot more people to play it, but it makes me a bit nervous knowing that them not even being able to download the full game will be a factor in whether or not they play.
title: Amazing Game, but‚Ä¶

review: When I first saw the game, I thought I‚Äôd be able to customize my character in similar ways to other games I‚Äôd played (changing physical appearance, ability, etc.); yet as I played the game, I found myself still enjoying it despite not having this ability. The story, animation style, battle tactics, monsters, and characters are all lovable and delightful! It feels like being in a movie or playing one of my Xbox games. Really well done to the creators. So far, my favorite character is Lisa for both her charm and powerful lighting strikes during combat. Keep up the great work! I would like to suggest the ability to possibly change clothing on characters as well so that it feels more personalized if that‚Äôs alright. One downside I will note is having to walk everywhere and how gliding takes up physical energy. I can understand swimming and such, but gliding? Yeah right. Anyway, walking around to different locations without having something shoot at or lunge at you is a bit much. Overall, I still enjoy it despite the walking aspects. Perhaps you guys could create different elemental mounts? Like not your traditional horses and stuff. I‚Äôm talking about like birds, lions, or unique creatures like that. Again, I‚Äôm no game designer and I figure they don‚Äôt want to hear my peas and cues, but just food for thought. Still love the game and the graphics. Well done!
title: A pleasant surprise to play!

review: The game starts pretty easy but gets incredibly harder as it updates, i started without knowing anything about it and didn‚Äôt know how to make characters stronger besides leveling them up and leveling the weapons up. I would‚Äôve liked a warning about how annoying it is to make characters stronger but it was my fault for not doing research. For an anime game that profits off of visuals when it comes to scenery and characters the scenery is done really well but the characters lack a bit of diversity and seem to follow only 5 different formats wich is small girl, medium girl, medium guy, tall girl, tall guy. And although I love it I wish it was at least even. It seem a lot of people are mad because of how non diverse it is when it comes to poc. I think they should remember that this is just a game. And although it‚Äôs based on real places it doesn‚Äôt owe anything to anyone. It‚Äôs supposed to be a different world so obviously it‚Äôs mechanics are different. We will probably get more poc but i think people are taking things too serious for a game. And if they just carelessly make poc it would make even more people mad. You guys should remember it is a game that‚Äôs meant to be fun and getting all serious about representation might make the represent us bad instead of doing it carefully
title: It‚Äôs good

review: The game itself is absolutely amazing. Good combat and what not, but the business practices are outright horrendous. It‚Äôs not bad because it‚Äôs a Gacha game, that in it of itself is loot box territory but it‚Äôs the fact that the company outright refuses to listen to community feedback. They make it almost impossible to truly have the most fun without spending money. Not only that but, rewards for very big events are laughably inconsiderate. Take the anniversary situation for example, you can only get anything truly worthwhile if you‚Äôre an artist or content creator, well newsflash not everyone is. And even then your chances of actually getting anything are still statistically almost 0%. I don‚Äôt understand what their aversion to giving the community literally anything is. They have never really given the community as a whole anything that great. It even lures you into thinking you‚Äôll get something cool in your birthday only to find that when that day comes you get a cake that really doesn‚Äôt actually do anything. Like I get it you have to make money so you can‚Äôt constantly give away free stuff, but every once in a while wouldn‚Äôt hurt you‚Äôve made billions already. I have had this game since it launched and never have I seen them do anything really all that good for the community, in respect to events or anything, in fact most events are also community run, they don‚Äôt actually do anything!!! It is extremely frustrating!
title: Great but bad practice

review: I'm starting this off saying 4 stars because although i play on pc and never have storage issues, i do know when i use my phone it lags so hard my phone literally glitches. Other than that it's insanely good. Mihoyo/Hoyoverse had done so much with the storyline and the cutscenes and graphics are absolutely insane. The storyline gets me everytime. It's immersive. I go into every patch update thinking, "ah okay i'll play for an hour or two just to get the new island unlocked". Suddenly it's 5am.! There is just so so so much to do it's amazing. I've been playing since patch 1.5 (AR57), as of writing this we're in patch 2.5 and this game has grown so much. I don't think newer players will ever get bored. 8/10 in my book. Well you might ask, "why not a 10/10.?" well for one the storage issue but also the lack of primogem sources. I pay into this game a lot so i personally don't care but for f2p and low spenders it makes it incredibly hard to get good units, including 5 stars and sig weapons. Other than that I love this game. I've been playing for almost a year and i do not regret it. If you're looking for a fun, immersive, game that will lock you in, PLAY GENSHIN IMPACT. and if you EVER struggle.. well that's what co-op and endgame players like me are there for. Step into the vast world of Teyvat and have some fun.!
title: So.. To start off, great game.

review:
I love everything from, the story, the enemies, the music, and the abilities. It‚Äôs all amazing. I‚Äôve been playing Genshin for a while now and have been amazed at the story and how the characters look. The scenery is also beautiful. There is so much content for new players and vets. This game has kept me entertained during the boring days and always connects me with kind people. I finally am going to get Kazuha after a long year and am so happy. The pity system is fair and there are many opportunities to get primos. The game is so well made with its giant world to explore and amazing character designs. The abilities are very versatile and would fit anyone wants. I overall recommend this game to anyone interested. I doubt you would regret it! 
-I notice that many new players go for characters that are said to be super strong but you should go for a character that you find fun and enjoy playing. Getting a meta character is good for damage but can get boring if it isn‚Äôt your play style. Go for whatever character you want but always do the trials first to see if you really want them. -One think I would like Hoyoverse to add is a artifact load out that can save what artifacts you use for a character and can easily be equipped.
title: Fantastic game. Would recommend to anyone.

review: This game is great. The story, the visuals, the characters, the voice acting everything having to do with the actual gameplay is amazing and I love it so much. But‚Ä¶ there is a huge flaw that come with this game and that is that it takes up a massive amount of space on what ever device you are playing on especially for Mobil players. I actually can‚Äôt fathom how people are able to consistently play this game on mobil without having to delete every other app on their phone or other Mobil device. The game itself as listed in the description only takes up like 3.7 GB of storage but once downloaded you need another probably‚Ä¶.. 10 - 15 GB for the documents and data and even if you have that much space with every game update (that comes every 1-2 months) you need to download more data consisting of like another 3 GB each update. (All of this info pertains to Mobil but my friend downloaded it on PS4 and it was 90GB of data). Another thing is that if you don‚Äôt update the game you can‚Äôt play at all, it locks you out until you have enough room to update because most of the updates are story based and keep you moving on in the game. I really wish it it wasn‚Äôt such a huge game, I mean I understand why, but I actually can‚Äôt play because there just isn‚Äôt enough room on my iPad to keep updating even with almost EVERY SINGLE APP deleted.
title: TAKES UP SO MUCH SPACE

review:
To be completely honest, I absolutely love this game in so many different ways! I feel like Genshin Impact has such an amazing story line and plot that fits along with every aspect. I love the top-notch graphics and scenery which creates such beautiful visuals that really brings the entire game to a thriving life‚Äî Not only does the outstanding graphics impress me, but the background sound effects and voice lines are also extremely beautiful! The characters are also highly detailed with different features that distinguishes them each, I even adore that each character has their own story and background to which shaped them to who they are present. Totally recommend this game if you want to play an RPG game with engaging fighting scenes and stunning scenery. Not only just the sceneries I suggest, but also the story lines and the lore all behind it, almost every quest and plot connects to the unraveling mysteries that lie within Teyvat! That is what really makes Genshin Impact such an engaging game that keeps you occupied in your journey through a vast‚Äî and stunning world that will take you everywhere.

Barely any mistakes or imperfections I see within the game. If you seem interested, please give it a shot and experience the artistic and magnificent world of Teyvat!
title: One of the best Gacha/RPG games!! :D

review: Absolutely beautiful! The scenery of the open world is breathtaking. When accompanied with brilliantly written soundtracks, the scenery is basically given life! Majestic mountains and waterfalls, lively villages are all results of careful pairing between the soundtracks and design. Even if you aren‚Äôt too keen on fighting enemies, just running along in the open world and exploring is a pleasure. The exploration portion of the game is well thought out too. There are many puzzles to solves, getting surprised with the weird locations at which they place treasure chests, and world quests with great backstories. The backstories are also well written, many providing players with reasons to look back and experience it again. I really have to give the designers of the characters a hands down, the designs are top notch. The voice actors are chosen well and the background of the characters really breathes life into them. There are many reasons to love (or hate in some cases üòÇ) each character. The fighting mechanisms should be relatively easy for players to get used to. I enjoyed fighting certain enemies and how certain characters really enhance or diversify my play style, although some enemies are downright scary or annoying (I‚Äôm looking at you dendro slime!). Overall, the game is truly fascinating and should be given a try!
title: Definitely a must-play

review: I‚Äôve been playing since the start of 2022, I absolutely love the characters her, the world of teyvat and the lore in this game but sometimes it really bothered me how they weren‚Äôt even trying to make a dark skin toned character for the released region of Sumeru. Sumeru is basked on Middle eastern, Soutth Asian and Northern African cultures. Though they ‚Äútried‚Äù to make some dark skin tones such as Kaeya, Xinyan, Cyno, Candace, etc. but I never feel like they are actually dark skin, I have a friend who‚Äôs skin is similar to that but was usually White other than getting herself tanned slightly. I come from an SE Asian and the inaccuracy in the skin tones are really not it for me. The game itself gets very boring as time to time. All I do now is do my daily commissions and log off. But I rarely do that now since I‚Äôve lost interest. There‚Äôs no point in playing unless you have characters that does 10x the damages. Whenever I was gonna work on my account, I was usually not on the day to farm for the talents, etc. The domains thing with the day limit really annoys me, but maybe it‚Äôs just me. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I love the game but I don‚Äôt usually plays it anymore due to the lack of excitement, I love the characters and the lore like I have said. It‚Äôs pretty exciting to play when you are an early player so I do recommend you playing! 3/5 stars for me due to the racism and the lack of excitement.
title: A great game at start but‚Ä¶

review: This is by far the best game I have on my device. And I play it all the time! The creators certainly were not lazy when it comes to building the world and the characters, and making them believable. One of my favorite things about this game is just how much stuff you have to do! Unlike other games where you only have one main quest to do this one gives you several! So if you don‚Äôt have a Hugh enough level or adventure rank to do a certain quest there are several different things you can do, to pass the time. Also all of the characters, feel believable, and none of the plot feels forced. Also some of the food seems like it would be so delicious that I want to try it in real life! Also all the different monsters, mini bosses, and bosses are so creative that it actually feels like something that would be real in a different world. Also I really like how the game doesn‚Äôt necessarily tell you everything so you have to figure out some stuff. Honestly I tried to think of anything bad about this game but I couldn‚Äôt find anything that wasn‚Äôt extremely minor. In conclusion I swear this game is the new ‚ÄúLegend Of Zelda‚Äù of our time and will be just as famous! And would recommend getting this if you like fantasy story games!
title: My favorite game!

review: I am redoing my review because it‚Äôs been months since I started, a recommendation in itself. The graphics are stunning, the fighting is lots of fun, but progress is slow. It takes time to grow and level. The world rank which increases as you progress is a great idea as it keeps it the fights challenging. The teapot house is incredible. I wish you could fit a little more in it but it‚Äôs really fun to experiment with and so nice to have parts of the game that can provide a little break from combat.. It‚Äôs also really nice to have parts of it that are useful like crafting and forging. I hope you will keep adding to the utility of it.I think it would be neat if you had some training features. Overall I probably wouldn‚Äôt change much about the game except I would make the drops a bit richer and I would improve the teapot editor. It can be very frustrating especially when you are dealing with floating elements. Also a lock feature would be helpful. I haven‚Äôt done much in the way of events yet, but hoping to do more. Btw, the loads allowed aren‚Äôt nearly enough in many cases in your realm. On autumnhold peak, you have multiple sections. I get one laid out and I can‚Äôt use the others. Things like fences should take up less.
title: Nice graphics, lots of fun, but a grind

review:
First of all, I just want to say that this game is a true work of art! The characters have great diverse personalities, the graphics are absolutely stunning, the story line and all the other leveling and adventures and or quests are all genius. miHoYo should be very proud of the work they did on this game, because it‚Äôs amazing. However, there are two things that I don‚Äôt like. First, the download. It takes A WHILE. If u are reading these, and are thinking ‚Äúmy games taking a while....‚Äù it‚Äôs not just you. The game is SO content packed that  it takes so long to download. Then, there‚Äôs the in game download. This may occur only in certain devices, but the second download takes a while too. IMPORTANT- if the second download keeps stopping and throwing you out, it may give you a notice that you do not have enough device storage space. That happened to me when i tried getting this on my chrome book. The final thing that bugs me a bit is the difficulty of certain things. Like, it‚Äôs SOOOOO hard to get a five star. And some quests are a bit more challenging and annoying then others.. so watch out. 

Anyways, even with the negativities, this addictive game is worth every minute! Again, AMAZING game! Absolute genius! Ty for reading! Have fun!
title: Almost complete perfection

review: I started playing this game when I finally got a device that could handle it back in 2021, I was so excited to finally start playing with my friends and did play up to AR 45 but then I had to drop when I was getting more busy and it had grown too large for that device which I needed to use for daily stuff so I deleted in 2022, jump skip to somewhere in 2023 I redownloaded but after so long I didn‚Äôt have that much interest but after some time I got more back into the game and by march of this year the new characters and the archon quests I had left I came back for and to explore new lands though I missed a lot I got back into it and I‚Äôve been saving for the Nave or ‚ÄúFather‚Äù especially sense I lost 50/50 last time I‚Äôm at I‚Äôd say soft pity but now the update is here unfortunately there simply is no storage left and sense it‚Äôs app update I‚Äôm not sure how much I'm missing out on but my device is mostly right now taken up by genshin and I can‚Äôt play it now. So I‚Äôd be warned you‚Äôll want a device that‚Äôs 94 or 128 GB for this game. Yes people do have complaints about not enough content in the game or not much free stuff which is all up for debate but sense I can‚Äôt change the game to be less I‚Äôd just say to be aware if your 32 GB or 64 GB
title: Great game just not so friendly any more for mobile storage anymore

review: Hello I‚Äôm gonna start this off by saying this game is great, I absolutely love the graphics and the work you put into all the characters, bosses, etc. But there is a few problems I do have with the game, past AR 45 (leveling system that they use for the game) has not much content other then waiting for new characters and quests to come out, mostly while we wait all we really have is collecting all the oculi (used for leveling up statues of the seven) and chests which really isn‚Äôt that fun to do. Now don‚Äôt get me wrong this is a great game and the graphics are amazing and all around is a pretty good game yet the game lacks content after you reach AR 45 and above once you add more regions though then the game will be more fun and interactive out of the 356 days I‚Äôve had this game I truly enjoyed every minute of it. Overall great game, few flaws, also if your expecting me to bash them over the anniversary rewards that‚Äôs no way to get what you want and if I‚Äôm gonna be honest getting a free 5 star (typically the best characters) takes the joy of getting it away if you already know your gonna get it. Have a wonderful day developers and anyone who‚Äôs reading this and continue making this game a wonderful experience thank you!
title: Great game overall, few flaws

review:
Tl:dr Beautiful game but sucky leveling system and impossible special items.

So I downloaded this game because I‚Äôd heard and seen so many good things about it. The graphics, open world and storyline are absolutely stunning. But the storyline came at a huge time expense. Complete the first chapter by level 3? Can‚Äôt proceed in the story till level 5. Finished chapter 2 by level 8? Sorry can‚Äôt continue till level 11. And believe me when I say the leveling system is slower than cold molasses. It took me literally 3 weeks of clearing daily quests and side quests before I could finish chapter 2. And another 4 weeks before I could finish chapter 3. Then there‚Äôs the issue of the character and weapon enhancing system. After a certain point weapons and characters need special items in order to continue advancing in power. Well let me tell you after searching and unlocking the current entire map (at the time anyway) and trading with people and crafting and going to the in game shops that exchanged special items for the items you needed I could not get my characters/weapons to progress any further to the point where I kept dying every 2 seconds. If you‚Äôre willing to put these things aside for the story and graphics then be my guest. But most people don‚Äôt have the patience to sit there and grind out something and get nowhere. That‚Äôs why I gave this a 3 star.
title: Good game but. . .

review: I really love this game but sometimes I kinda feel a little bad about some people complaining about the drop rates. I agree that this game is an amazing game for a free one. Which I think would probably make it one of the best mobile games. Although this is kinda of a complaint, this doesn‚Äôt mean I don‚Äôt like the game. You should keep in mind that a lot of games have flaws and I know people are always trying to fix them. Since there will be a lot more regions and places to explore, you would probably need better characters and equipment right? Since the game will get a whole lot harder in the future (and have a ton of more content), I feel like increasing drop rates or adding things for f2p people who don‚Äôt want to put money in the game. I‚Äôve been playing since the release and even though I don‚Äôt always play, I‚Äôve only gotten a 5 star character and sword. And I have only spent my primo gems on summoning which I think is saying something. I do know that 5 star characters and weapons aren‚Äôt always the best but usually, they have good base stats and abilities. I do like using 4 star characters though. Although, keep in mind that this issue will probably be resolved in the future because there will probably be more chances to get better characters and weapons and 4 stars aren‚Äôt all that bad anyways.
title: Maybe increase the drop rates?

review: I honestly love this game and the characters design and gameplay is amazing! But I honestly have a few problems, the first problem is that, getting 5 star characters seems a little bit too hard! It‚Äôs difficult to get 90 pity in 1 banner and to just loose my 50/50 to another 5 star, it hurts and I‚Äôm pretty sure other people who really want their dream character can relate. The second problem is the character designs, in my opinion I think we need more plus-sized and darker skin tone characters and sometimes I feel like the designs are stereotypical! Im really tired of mihoyo just having one different design and then they change it for something that they‚Äôre not and I‚Äôve heard a lot of people saying ganyus og design was plus-size and you changed it. Third problem is sometimes when your adventure rank is higher the quests get WAYYY harder then they need to! Kinda the dragonspine quest and a lot of inazuma quests and boss fights. My last problem is storage, for mobile players Genshin can take up more than 13 GB, which is a lot and I‚Äôm pretty sure Genshin is killing a lot of mobile players storage, including me. But other than that, I love this game and I cant stop playing! I hope you realize the problems soon mihoyo.
title: A amazing game‚ô•Ô∏é but..

review: This game is a whole wonderland of amazing and gorgeous. The graphics are exquisite and the fact that such perfect quality graphics can run at such a high frame rate on a phone is just incredible. Truly some of the most difficult feats a game can manage, yet this one does. On the PC, the experience is even better. The soundtrack, the individuality between the characters (birthdays, names, voices, stories, etc.), the multitude of different weapons, all with different animations with different characters; it's all just so wonderful. Unfortunately, while this game is definitely a 5 star rating, in my opinion, it could use some work. Keybinds, while they're all customizable, fail to recognize mouse buttons as keys, and therefore render my mouse buttons pointless. I'd like to use those buttons, y'know. Also, I think the game could do well with more outfit choices. Currently, only Barbara and Jean have different purchasable outfits (to my knowledge), and as someone who looks forward to character customization almost as much as the whole game, I'd like a larger selection. Those are just my opinions, though! Still a beautiful game. Growing up on World of Warcraft, this game reminds me a lot of it, and that makes me like this game even more.
title: Absolutely Astonishing... but

review: I've searched the app store for months for an open-world game with good graphics, good characters, and fun battle mechanics, and this game comes along out of nowhere and immediately checks all of those boxes! This game is gorgeous, there's so much to do, and I ended up falling in love with each and every unique character. I have to admit, though, the chance to unlock a 5-star character is a little too low for my taste, but what makes up for it is the fact that you can play through the game without paying a cent for new characters and still have a wonderful, fun-filled experience. I also wanna note that this is a very large game that needs a lot of space and battery to run at its full potential. But I think that a few gigabytes of space is definitely worth it for this amazing title. Even if there's no enemies to defeat, I still find myself immersed, just exploring and taking in the beautiful scenery. There's even extra lore in the form of books to collect and read! The amount of content given to you at the start is incredible, especially for a free-to-play game, and new stories and characters are added regularly! In times like these, this is the perfect game to unwind with, and I can't wait to see what's in store for this game in the future!
title: One of the Best Mobile Games of the Year! üíñ

review:
Hi! You may know me as K o k I c h i or LunaMoon and yes I do play genshin all my pics are from my gameplay but let‚Äôs get onto the best things about the game, THE GRAPHICS KILL ME WITH BEAUTY ITS WAYYY BETTER THAN POK√âMON UNITE GRAPHICS
