title: I love this game!

review: I love the game! Genshin is one of those games that off of the top of my head I can say confidently that it‚Äôs one of my favorites. I started about 3 months after the game launched and def helped me pass the time. The game‚Äôs story and characters are very well written. The problem lies more in storage and in how much the game can offer to those who don‚Äôt spend a dime on gacha. Storage for the game is close, if not, almost impossible to achieve for the majority of players. Most have pointed out that they‚Äôve had to delete picture/videos or other applications just to download. As for the game not being that F2P friendly, I do spend money on the game so this isn‚Äôt really coming out from my point of view, but I will repeat what others have said.. with exploration, commissions, quests, etc, the game usually only gives enough to guarantee 2-3 of the highest rarity characters. Yes while players could save up, there are others who once they skip the character, would have to wait a long while for a rerun (For example: the character Ms Eula). Also considering the amount of players who don‚Äôt have that much time to play the game to begin with, possibly because of school, jobs, or family/friend quality time, they can‚Äôt spend much time on the game grinding.
title: Very good but not that F2P friendly

review: I know this game is fairly new so I hope they fix this soon. This game is an amazingly fun open world experience and at the beginning and there is so much to do. But when you get to a certain point you sort of run out of things to do and you find yourself in a tedious repetition of just doing your daily commissions etc. at the ar 40 and up stage. It gets too easy in open world to the point where you are two shotting the bosses. The game encourages you to get stronger when there is no point to get stronger because you can already beat the games content. Another thing is the gap between f2p and p2w. Neither are better or worse but there is a substantial difference between the two. It costs about $300! To get 1 5 star! That‚Äôs outrageous and totally not worth it. We do need whales in the community to support the company but it‚Äôs like $20 for like 7 summons. Thankfully the game has added a lot of new content in the newest patch and those that will follow so there will be content. The biggest problem is the power creeps. Every new character is substantially stronger than the other so we are basically just wasting our money because the next character will be so much better than the last. Overall this game is very enjoyable but I want mihoyo to address these problems
title: Great game with some flaws

review: I first downloaded this game bc my friends were really into it. When I first figured it out the game I thought it was hopeless. I felt that I would never get my dream characters bc it was to hard. But then I found out the best ways to get primos, and the concept of not wishing every single time I get 160 primos. Then I started finding what characters I liked and I was gonna pull for. And ofc it‚Äôs a beautiful game and then graphics are amazing. Even playing on my phone they are still amazing. Not just the characters, the quests and exploration are also super fun. I‚Äôve only been playing the game for 3 months so I‚Äôm still kinda early on. The one thing about this game that could be a problem is the amount of storage it takes up. I can‚Äôt even download it on my iPad bc it takes up 20+ gigabytes. But if u have a device where you have enough to download it, it‚Äôs totally worth it. And if u don‚Äôt like it u can just delete it and u have all ur storage back. I would also like to add that it at least for me is way less addictive then other popular video games. Now it is still addictive. But I find that I don‚Äôt feel I have to play for hours everyday. To conclude this review, I love this game a would definitely recommend it!!
title: Love it

review: I think the game is super fun and in the past few weeks I‚Äôve already gotten to ar 31! I love the characters and story lines, the only complaints I have are about the gacha and the mobile app. The gacha system isn‚Äôt too bad compared to other but it definitely isn‚Äôt the best. To get a 5 star character you want is extremely hard if you don‚Äôt have luck. Having to spend money for more primo gems to get something good is inevitable. Every 90 wishes guarantees you a 5 star but that‚Äôs only if you‚Äôre wishing on the same banner. And that 5 star isn‚Äôt guaranteed to be a character. The free characters you get while playing the game are descent, but the characters obtained from wishes are definitely more desirable. The mobile app is great except occasionally it glitched and kicks me out of the game. The loading screen had been working fine until recently, whenever I try to play I have to wait on the white loading screen for about 2 minutes before actually being able to play. Which isn‚Äôt bad but it definitely isn‚Äôt practical. The other thing is when one of the story lines includes ‚Äúanimations scenes‚Äù or some bigger scenes it always glitches on my iPad. Which is such a bummer because I would love to see the beautiful scenes ü•∫. My I pad is fairly new being a gen 7 so I guess there are some glitches to be expected since it‚Äôs mobile and not a pc. But overall I love this game to death and the cute characters that come along :))
title: Runs pretty good on mobile üíÉ

review: Ok I LOVE this game. The story is super immersive and really cool, not to mention that the gameplay its self is really enjoyable! But, it takes up sooooo much space. My device has 32 GB of storage and over half of it is dedicated to this game. I can‚Äôt update it anymore because of the sheer magnitude of every new update. And this problem is probably the only one you‚Äôll see causing significant issues if you play mobile, like me. The game runs fine, in fact, amazing for a game being played on mobile. But Unless you have loads of space, I suggest you play it on PC or console. Other then the fact I can no longer play the game unless i upgrade my storage, I 100% recommend it. Though, take my warning and don‚Äôt end up in my situation. I‚Äôve played the game on all platforms, and while mobile works best for me, PC is good to, if you know the controls. Playing it on consoles also works, and that‚Äôd be my second method to play. And once you make an account with Mihoyo you don‚Äôt have to worry about making more, since one account works for all platforms. So that‚Äôs super convenient. All in all this is more of a warning/suggestion to those who want to get this game on mobile. It works great, but make sure you have the space.
title: Great game! But-

review: I‚Äôve had Genshin Impact for about 2 years now and I‚Äôve only just got caught up with the archon quests. This took a lot of dedication for me, even to just get through the chasm quest. I strictly remember asking my friend to help me with the the quest to get to inuzama (or is it inazuma?) because it was just too long and boring. Now, I get how this may not be a fair review because I have ADHD and the attention span of a squirrel, but that‚Äôs not the entire reason I gave it 4 stars. The grind you need to do to get primos and good artifacts makes many players lose their interest, including me. It‚Äôs fun up until you realize that your build is absolutely terrible and you need to farm artifacts for days just to get good stats. Primos on the other hand, it‚Äôs basically ‚Äúthe grind is real(ly miserable)‚Äù. For F2P players (unlike me), it‚Äôs merely impossible to get a 10 pull unless your really determined and dedicated. I used to find myself searching and digging for chests so much for primos that it makes up for the majority of the expiration percentage. Fountain did make it easier to find chests and get primos easier though. Overall, this game is wonderful. The quality of the music, quests, characters, scenery, gameplay, and plot is great. I‚Äôd definitely suggest this game to friends.
title: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, it‚Äôs a great game! But‚Ä¶

review:
I preordered this game and forgot about it until it popped up after being released. I tried it out, having played many games on my phone before and didn‚Äôt expect much. I was quickly blown away by the visuals. I got into the story, which I don‚Äôt usually, and have found many ways to play the game if one objective becomes tiring.
However, there are 2 main things that I think should be kept in mind when determining if this game is right for you. The first is that this is a full fledged console game that is also on mobile. Therefor, the file size is going to be quite large. I think like, 8gbs for me currently? It being a full game on mobile also means that the controls can be difficult. I‚Äôm fine with them now, but it took a while. 
Second, keep in mind that mihoyo would like money for this game. It‚Äôs f2p, but that does come with the drawbacks of less and lower quality characters and equipment. But I play the game the explore, follow quest lines, and kind of just chill. If you‚Äôre expecting something special/new every time you play, you‚Äôll have to spend money. 
For a free game with a million things to do/ focus on/ explore, I‚Äôve had a ton of fun and been overwhelmingly impressed. 
*iphone SE 2nd gen*
title: I‚Äôm happy, but you might not be

review: Ok so I‚Äôve been playing genshin around early 2021. And let me tell you, this game made my boredom leave me. It was still pandemic season so I was still stuck at home. Every time i finished online school I would go straight to genshin because of how fun it is. But there are pros and cons. Let me start with the pros. The first thing is, that we have an open world and can explore. And we get primogems just for exploring teyvat. Sometimes when we finish some events we a get free character or primogems. Which can be used for wishing/resin. Same thing with quests. Now for the cons, the first thing I especially want to talk about is the difficulty for the quests. Some of the quests can be so confusing and so hard for no reason? The first 3 nations quest were easy. But, when the chasm came out. The difficulty when up and up. Which makes things for players difficult. And sometimes have to search up tutorials because on how hard it is. Sumeru and the chasm are hard quests. And I‚Äôm still stuck in the chasm because of how hard it is. I‚Äôm not saying to make all the quests easy, I‚Äôm just saying to make it less difficult for new players or players that are coming back to the game. Thank you. And enjoy your day ‚òïÔ∏è
title: I‚Äôm not sure

review: This game has a lot of engineering in its creation. Very well balanced for long term play. It is not pay to win, that is balanced as well, dumping cash doesn‚Äôt get you much and not fast. This game is designed to give you long play times and many distractions to draw things out even more. With world puzzles big and small, hidden treasures for days, the grind is completely manageable if you pace yourself. There is something for everyone in this game. The regular events will keep you entertained and distracted from all of the other places you still want to go explore. This dev team really has big thinkers behind them. The cons must be strategic as well. Paimon has a secret purpose to make things easy for them. So, be nice and try to just let it go. The Hoyolab companion app is a must when you start to feel lost, they thought of everything there too. Basically, if you find a moment when you ask yourself how am i supposed to ever X? There is a way, you just didn‚Äôt find it yet or think to look, it is covered in companion app. Careful, it feels like cheating sometimes. A must play! Open world, co-op options, non linear, land puzzle galore fest. Oh yeah, lots of storyline plots and quests. Immersive role play interactions as well.
title: A masterpiece!

review:
My game was hacked about a year ago and I was desperate in getting it back, I checked the forums and many others had the same issue, I was crushed. It seemed like there was no way of me getting my game back at all. The mistake was that I had not linked my game ID to any email‚Ä¶ so I had no way of getting it back from the hacker. HOWEVER, I got in contact with the devs by email and explained my serious situation. I proved to them who I was and that my game was with a character named ‚Äúthis‚Äù and my game ID was ‚Äúthat‚Äù, I even sent them screenshots that I had taken that had my game ID in the bottom corner! Within a few days time, I was able to get back in AND link an email! I got my game back and I am so grateful! That was in late 2021. The devs are AMAZING!
Gameplay-wise, I am IN LOVE with the characters and the story! This is by far the best game I have ever played! And I am a serious gamer, have been for years! My one wish is that I could enjoy the game on my Switch, but the mobile version is amazing, too! If you are wondering if you should get this game, STOP WONDERING and just download it! You will not regret it! And be sure to free up your schedule, you‚Äôll be obsessed with this game in no time at all! ‚ú®
title: Absolutely amazing service! (game was hacked)

review: Genshin impact is a very fun game to play at your leisure. It has everything one could ask from a game; great looking characters, exploration, monster farming, and etc.. but genshin impact struggles the most with it‚Äôs endgame content. It has already been a year and spiral abyss is the only true endgame content in the game. The game is updated every 6 weeks and there is events so it‚Äôs not totally dry. Big but though, what is the point of farming and grinding when we have nothing to test our artifacts/abilities? People will start being able to easily full star spiral abyss and then that‚Äôs basically it for endgame content. There is no reason to farm or progress any further optimizing builds and everything. The only thing that keeps this game alive is it‚Äôs consistent updates and events. If this game wasn‚Äôt updated as frequently as it is then it would‚Äôve been dead after a few months. Overall it‚Äôs a fun experience until you reach endgame and can easily clear spiral abyss. After that you will be consistently doing daily commissions and using all of your resin day by day which gets boring real fast. The events sometimes are fun but they are really hit or miss. I recommend this game to those who want to casually explore the story and contents of this beautiful game, not recommended for those looking for an endgame hard difficulty content.
title: Fun but no endgame

review:
Honestly this is one of my favorite games. However I feel like there are just a couple of things that would make the overall gameplay experience a little bit better and truly get that last star for me. First day I feel like the every day bosses are too expensive to farm when compared to the need to farm other resources like talent books artifacts and weekly bosses. 
In my opinion what should be done here would be to negate the cost of every day bosses so that they‚Äôre easier to form and don‚Äôt require resin. The other thing I feel is it the wish system is also too expensive for F2P players. Most gotcha games that I‚Äôve played are not  as expensive and I find that this fact really discourages me from wishing unless I really have to. Also the whole 50-50 system and the potential to lose to another unwanted 5 star again turns me off form wishing it‚Äôs always nerve-racking to wish for thise special characters. 
I think two things here would be beneficial one if you wish and get a five star your first five star should be a character on the banner I also think that wishing costs should be cut down to 75 primo gems rather than the normal 150 I think this would promote more wishing and more opportunities to get a character
title: I love the game but‚Ä¶

review: I‚Äôll start by saying this is a great game. Seriously fun with a wide variety of characters great story minus the Aranara. But when you you reach world rank 6 stay there there‚Äôs no benefit to going higher other than being absolutely destroyed by enemies higher than you. Things necessary for your characters abilities are on a weekly rotation which realistically isn‚Äôt too bad, but when you literally grind the same enemies into dust a thousand times for one characters abilities to reach 10 it makes you begin to wonder when you‚Äôll have fun again. Leveling your characters can be a bear it‚Äôd be better if actually fighting with them and the like actually gave decent experience but it is so insignificantly small that you‚Äôd have an easier leveling up Pok√©mon using xp share. For the weapons you can only level them up with items that you can craft but again by the time you reach world rank 8 your already screwed and there‚Äôs no bonus drops of rewards whatsoever. Right now double drops is in effect and my mother and I are getting litteray bottom of the barrel ability upgrade books and we need higher rarity to even upgrade I do not want to spend hours to grind out a single ability upgrade. I do not hate this game but it is my recommendation to everyone and anyone DO NOT GO PAST WORLD RANK 6 you will have a bad time
title: Needs balancing

review:
I have enjoyed majority of my time playing this game, it checks all the boxes of: Puzzles, Adventure, Collecting, Dungeon Delving, Secrets, Lore, Beautiful Scenery and Characters and Art. Should you play this game? YES, it‚Äôs free‚Ä¶Unless you have a gambling problem. We all should know by now how addicting ‚ÄúGacha Games‚Äù are, you see a character/weapon you want and you try and try again rolling for them but can‚Äôt seem to get them and finally you just decide hey maybe a few more rolls will get me them if I buy more premium currency‚Ä¶and just like that you fall into a trap. But besides that, it‚Äôs like Mihoyo (game dev) keeps making the wrong decisions. Between anniversary rewards fiasco, the current fiasco (KFC glider event, just look it up) and having great in game events that are TEMPORARY even though having them permanent would have gotten them praise from the community. Then also not fixing bugged characters/content that the community has stated OVER AND OVER for them. It‚Äôs just a mess beyond other things I won‚Äôt mention‚Ä¶I‚Äôve lost faith in spending money in game.
Besides all this crap, if you can stay free 2 play, and get past the slow beginning of story and leveling adventure rank, this game is phenomenal‚Ä¶and I am sure you will love it.
P.S. do not look on social media for Genshin, there are extremely toxic people.
title: Incredible Game, Company slowly turning players against them

review: A huge open world with a truly massive amount to find, deceptively-simple-yet-engrossing mechanics and gameplay, unexpectedly-high production values, beautiful graphics; the list of reasons to like this game goes on and on. Even the gacha system manages to avoid being obtrusive or even annoying, providing the player with enough in-game currency to routinely make use of gacha draws without requiring any financial investment, and unlike most gacha games the characters and items acquired through the storyline and side-quests are enough on their own not just to enjoy the game, but to thrive; the one thing that I have not seen the game provide automatically that can be considered necessary (a heavy-weapons user to break up rocks and mining deposits) can be swiftly acquired early and for free from a special, beginners-only gacha draw. Genshin Impact isn‚Äôt just good for a free-to-play game, or good for a gacha game, or good for a phone game (though it is all of these things); Genshin Impact is good by any standard.  My only regret is that I couldn‚Äôt find a way to link my account on the PS4 to the one my phone uses (the two versions of which are almost indistinguishable; no cut-rate port from more powerful machines here!).
title: By far the best gacha game I have ever seen, let alone played.

review: I love genshin, at this time I‚Äôve only played for a couple days but I‚Äôm alr hooked, my one Hangup was that it was so hard to get registered. Also I wish that hoyoverse would tell you when u download the app that you wouldn‚Äôt be able to access the full version with the storage you had. Thankfully now I have the app on another device that has lots of storage, the graphics are freaking amazing and even though I‚Äôm a little confused I have tutorials and my friends (who also play genshin) to ask for help. The characters and storyline is amazing, and I hope this review gets more people to play this. Because really, you dont need to be an anime nerd to absolutely love this game. One of the best (is not THE best game) I have ever played, (and I‚Äôve only played for a couple days!) the amount of detail in this game is amazing (just wanna reiterate) it‚Äôs got raw materials scattered around the environment, they even added animals, like crab and fish and other creatures that are probably made up. The music and soundtrack in this game also makes it feel like a real world! I love the camera feature too, it lets you really capture to essence of this beautiful scenery into your camera roll. -Toast_Demon
title: This game is awesome but a little warning?

review: To everyone who rated Genshin 1 star yesterday, I hope you know that changed literally nothing. The game does not premote pedos. Venti, for example, takes on the form of a human that is NOT a minor. The same is for ganyu and xiao. Neither of their human forms are minors. Of course, there are charecters like klee and diona, but they have nothing offensive other then their skin color. This brings me to an issue. During the recent Sumeru event, we got charecters that should have been darker-skinned. However, we got charecters like Kusanali that were whiter that chalk. Pleas make charecters have darker skin. But, its an amazing game.  To everyone saying that there is not enough content, this game was not designed for you. It was designed for people to get online to do their commissions or a bit of the archon quest during a quick break for maybe 5-10 minutes. Also, you have to take into account all of the work they usually do. This game has INSANE graphics and has mouthwatering food, a wide spread of personality through charecters, and a huge map plus a customizable teapot to build in. Plus, genshin is now giving us long awaited charecters and a entire anime. Although some things are wrong, this game is altogether an amazing platform.
title: AMAZING GAMEEE JUST ONE ISSUE

review:
So, to start off, Like many other people, you should prioritize players‚Äô opinions instead of doing stuff nobody asked for. For example, many people are complaining about the resin system, though this is not much of a problem for me, it is for people with a high Adventure Rank. The banner system and story is nice and organised, but you should make it easier to get 5 stars, or atleast make a banner that in which you can only get characters, Also, The game is great but honestly, get your priorities straight, or else you might lose your mobile community. For example, most people are not gonna have enough storage space to be able to update the game once you finally finish the game. It says that the game itself is 4gb but in reality, it download over 14gb of data. You might say thats normal, You might be right, but thats an absurd amount of expectancy of determination from mobile players, people who bought 1tb of storage space on an iPhone are very lucky, but im not one of those people, also, it says that your game only supports iPhone 8 and beyond, but im on an iPhone 6s from 2015, and the game works just fine. 

Side note: i used to play on ps4, but not now.
title: Mihoyo/hoyolab/hoyoverse, please get your priorities checked.

review: Let‚Äôs get this out of the way: Genshin Impact is a beautifully crafted game with obvious love and passion behind it. The stories of the characters are compelling, the soundtrack is phenomal and ethereal, and the combat is satisying and challenging at the same time. I have played this game since launch and followed its progress since beta. I will not deny that this game is great. HOWEVER. I cannot help but worry about the direction this game is going. There seems to be more interest in putting more banners out and releasing more new characters and weapons than developing the amazing the story that got experienced gacha players like me amazed in the first place. This current event, the Lantern Rite, was so hyped up and I was finally ready for more interaction with the characters and the scenery of Liyue. Instead, we got missions with NPCs and barely any interaction with the characters of Liyue. Mihoyo, this game and the combat is fun, however if there is no more content for people to enjoy then eventually they‚Äôll leave. We need replayable enjoyable content that isn‚Äôt spiral abyss, is FTP friendly, and engages the already existing characters. I really want to see this game succeed more and push the boundaries of gacha, but it will not happen if there is hardly any focus on story and character development in a game which thrived on that at launch.
title: A beautiful game with great potential... BUT

review: I love Genshin Impact, their graphics, their gameplay, open world exploration, all of it. But every good thing has a bad side. Although Genshin has beautiful graphics, open world, etc like I said before, the file size is huge for some people. Especially mobile players such as myself. This problem isn‚Äôt only on mobile either, both mobile and pc players suffer this large file issue. And I do understand that you have to expect a large file size with this kind of open world and everything, but it makes a lot of people unable to even play the game due to its size. I‚Äôve been playing Genshin for a while so when I say I understand, trust I do. This issue has been a long while one as the files get bigger and bigger. Sooner or later if the file size isn‚Äôt reduced or somewhat compressed, a lot of Genshins mobile or pc players with low space won‚Äôt be able to keep up anymore. I myself can‚Äôt even play on certain devices due to the amount of space it takes up. I know they‚Äôve addressed this before, but especially with the Sumeru and the Sumeru Desert, the file needs to be compressed. Please address this issue as it‚Äôs causing many players issues and not being able to play. I do praise Genshin for its quality and it‚Äôs pull to keep players in, but if this is not addressed, their players will drop!
title: File Size

review:
hello, i‚Äôm not the type to usually write reviews but i found a few things that i think need to be improved. don‚Äôt get me wrong, i love the game. the story's are great and graphics are out of this world, however i noticed a few things that make you lose a star. 1) the storage: this game takes 30 GB and that to me is insane. i understand that this game has lots of updates and new things coming in month by month and whatever, but the storage takes to much space on my iphone. 2) primogems: i know that some games like this want money to play. it IS completely free for play but in order to get nicer weapons and characters you will most likely have to BUY the primogems, and i‚Äôm not the type that spends money in game. 3) wishing: i know that there is a rule or something that says if you wish 70 times or something like that you get a five star character, i find this incorrect. i have 3 five stars when in reality i should have 10. it in extremely difficult to get the things i want in game. i would love to see changes in the game and i don‚Äôt think im the only one. i think to make it a better game and to make more people play it then you should start by fixing some of these things. i do love the game and hope to see changes soon. 

M&M
title: great but‚Ä¶

review:
I really do wish I could rate this higher. First off, though, is I‚Äôll list the things I found very good. The graphics are great during game play and the storyline is interesting.

Now, sadly, the things I find lacking. I play on a first generation iPad Pro updated to iPadIS 15.0, so I would think the animated opening and cutscenes would play well. They don‚Äôt. The are s]choppy and staticky and I only get about a quarter of the animation and barely half of the dialogue and music. Second, the game controls are abysmal. Much of the time when I think I‚Äôm moving towards a navigation point, I‚Äôm moving away from it. And I don‚Äôt mean having to follow paths to get there. I mean I aim my pointer towards the waypoint, start moving and I get further away instead of closer. I have similar issues with combat, especially the magic as I‚Äôll tap the button while facing my enemies and the spell shoots off to the side. Trying to use inventory is equally laborious and nonsensical. After barely two days of trying to play and getting hopelessly lost beside a cliff face, I uninstalled the game. Which brings up one last gripe. I downloaded the app, which then needed to download a 163 megabyte patch, then an 8.6 gigabyte chunk of game data before I could even attempt to play. If other people like the game, I‚Äôm glad for them. While I like most JRPG-style games, this one, sadly, is not for me.
title: I wish I could give a better review.

review: This is by far the greatest mobile game out there, and at first I thought it was another anime game, but upon further inspection and some gameplay I‚Äôm now addicted to it, and it‚Äôs a pretty good game to be addicted to, from the high quality art and views to the rich backgrounds that make a character who they are is just mind-blowing, because the media had never seen anything like this. While playing the game though, I realized some things. If you‚Äôve played legend of Zelda breath of the wild, you‚Äôll understand, but if not, just follow along. I feel this game gives a very clear legend of Zelda breath of the wild vibe to it, because they are alike in ways like a survival game and that you loot and scavenge for materials and you can face monsters around the map, and that you can CLIMB(something you don‚Äôt see in an everyday game) swim and lots of other ways to get around the island. It‚Äôs also similar in the fact that you can glide, although it is taken a lot more seriously. Now, don‚Äôt get the wrong message, legend of Zelda breath of the wild will be a part of my childhood, so the fact that it gives me that vibe makes it so much more better. I hope that mihoyo will make lots of more games like this in the future and I wait for what‚Äôs in store!
title: Best game with a hint of that Zelda vibe

review:
The game generally will be fun for new players. Since they would have a lot of content to go through, however, as soon as you reach the end game, there is nothing to do‚Ä¶ from the company POV ‚Äúthey don‚Äôt want to create stress on players‚Äù and they did that by making the game generally easy then  without adding new challenging content beside the abyss.
It seems they are targeting casual players, and that wasn‚Äôt always their vision on the game since during the first year, the game had much more fighting events, they created complicated damaging system, it‚Äôs hard to build a character, and it has a complicated RNG system for the artifacts. All that would not attract casual players. But since then they changed the game vision probably it‚Äôs a business decision ‚Äúto make more money‚Äù by  raising the middle finger for the old players who really believed on the game since it‚Äôs first days. 
In my case, I played the game two years now and It takes forever to build your characters with god tier artifact, and it takes too much money to get a signature weapon and consolations.. but after you spending all this money, time and effort. Their is no challenging content all of what i spent was pointless. 
And yeah their is a cap on the Rank last AR is 60. The stupidest idea ever‚Ä¶

title: I love this game, but I have a few special requests

review: The title says it all folks‚Äî but seriously‚Äî I was really hesitant to play when I first found out about it because it was SO popular that I was worried I wasn‚Äôt gonna like it and I‚Äôd feel bad. I finally downloaded it a two months ago as a surprise for my boyfriend‚Äôs birthday and I am AMAZED. Now before we get any further I have to mention that I do hyperfixate on things and that may cause me to sway in favor of the game as it is my current one. However! The game has far surpassed my expectations and is the first game I‚Äôve ever been able to play for hours on end daily without feeling burnt out and bored. The story-based fantasy concept and characters really make this game special. (I‚Äôd be lying if I said I didn‚Äôt have favorite characters) The voice acting is top notch, featuring familiar actors that make it just that much more incredible to me. The art style is fantastic and the game mechanics are so well done. Honestly‚Äî I‚Äôve gotta say‚Äî it‚Äôs my favorite game. I‚Äôve gotten so attached to the lore and the characters that it‚Äôd be very hard for me to put the game down until I‚Äôve had my fill for the day. (Plus the Hu Tao rerun has me so excited!!!) Thank you Mihoyo for making such an awesome game!!
title: ‚ú® The best mobile game I‚Äôve ever played ‚ú®

review: This game is great at the start since there is a ton of content to go through and fun characters to unlock/play with. However, once you start getting to late game, there is just not enough content to keep you entertained. The game becomes too easy and the only repeatable content is the spiral abyss which many players have maxed out completely. Genshin Impact simply turns into a grind. On top of this, the developers of the game do not really show any care for the players. They do not listen to them as many make great suggestions for improvement from small quality of life changes to modes that could entertain the players over a longer period of time. In addition, their lack of care has become incredibly apparent due to how they‚Äôve treated their anniversary. Genshin Impact has been game of the year, yet they don‚Äôt reward their dedicated player base appropriately (with rewards that fall significantly short of any other Gacha game). In response to this, the players have become highly disappointed/enraged and are making this very clear. However, Mihoyo has chosen to ignore everything. They remove all comments on any website mentioning the incident and have not even given any acknowledgement to the players or their feelings. This leads me to believe that there is simply no future for this game, which is quite disappointing given how well polished it is.
title: Good start, but lacks late game

review: Start of the game is unique, good lore and story at the beginning getting the point of the bat easy to understand and fun to learn. It progress once you move into liyue and inazuma. Tutorial is simple and easy to understand. Each character have backstories that you can choose and voice lines you can play. Large RPG game even though it‚Äôs not finished, amazing graphics and quests. The higher AR (Adventure rank)you are the more you get and learn, fun to play with others and fun to explore around, now that I‚Äôve listed most of the good things I‚Äôve experienced here‚Äôs some of the cons, it‚Äôs extremely time consuming, the rewards are somewhat unfair in some of the events and levels. It‚Äôs extremely Pay to win too (Whaling) there‚Äôs characters that you have a chance on getting during things called Banners. There‚Äôs easy pity and hard pity, the way you can get wishes is with primogems, to acquire these you need to either explore, to missions/quest or buy them. For most people you need over 50 wishes to even have a chance for a 5 star character, 1600 primogems for 10 wishes, 160 for 1 wish. Whalers usually spend large amounts of money to get these characters to get the advantage rather normally getting them, showing them on social media to some that haven‚Äôt even been able to get them, or some that even lost the 50/50.
title: It‚Äôs aight ig

review: I think people forget this is a free game. There isn‚Äôt always going to be new stuff constantly. It‚Äôs the player‚Äôs fault for speed running the game. It‚Äôs continuously being updated and it has a massive road map. Complaining about finishing it all isn‚Äôt going to do anything for you. Mihoyo isn‚Äôt going to suddenly add new stuff just because you‚Äôve done everything. I agree there should be permanent mini games and such but it‚Äôs a free game you‚Äôre not going to get some amazing perfect no lag game that‚Äôs this big for free. The exploration is amazing and sometimes i just go through and walk around for fun. You don‚Äôt need to spend money to play but that is the point of the game. All gacha games are meant to be spent on. Yes there are f2p options but if it has gacha there‚Äôs an incredibly high chance that you aren‚Äôt going to get free rewards and free characters. They don‚Äôt want to give free things because that‚Äôs the point of the game. You‚Äôre supposed to save and make smart choices on who you want to roll for unless you do spend lots of money. This game is amazing and it get way too much criticism because of how greedy people are. They aren‚Äôt going to cradle you and give you prizes just for playing their game.
title: amazing game

review: I have been playing this beautiful open world game on my mobile phone for a while now. I love games where I can explore and this is perfect for that! I don‚Äôt have any lag issues (as long as my phone battery isn‚Äôt dying). I have heard people complain about the gachapon system, but I‚Äôve only put in a small amount of money and I‚Äôm happy with what I‚Äôve got back, you get free characters that are fun to play (my Lisa is level 70 and she‚Äôs one of my favorites), and they give out prims so that you can still use gachapon without using real money. My biggest complaint is the resource intensity, you have a team of 4 characters, you can only get their level-up-resources on certain days, and you can only dungeon run so many times a day (due to resin).  If your whole team needs the same day, it can be really difficult. And if you‚Äôre say level 50, and you get a new character, you have to get all those resources and enough in-game-currency to level up that new character before you can play it, cause if they get attacked by a level 55 monster (which is perfect for your over all level), and they‚Äôre only like level 5, they‚Äôre going to die. So I find the restrictions on resources annoying. Otherwise it‚Äôs a great game!
title: Beautiful and fun game!

review: I‚Äôve played a lot of games, and often get bored easily. but mihoyo has done it again. Honkai is a great game, but it can‚Äôt compare the the open world, free playing style of genshin. i play mobile and console and both are fantastic and besides a few harmless( and hilarious) glitches the game and its graphics are incredible. i‚Äôve been playing for about three months plus now, and i‚Äôve logged in every spare moment. I love finding the Geoculus/Anemoculus and i often find myself exploring rather than doing quests! The story itself is no slouch. I adore the way each character fits into the story somehow and manages to add to the plot of the main story. Plus the excitement of new characters/reruns every two weeks keeps you hooked! Leveling is hard when you‚Äôre a new player, but once you get to level 18-20 and you‚Äôre familiar with mechanics and artifacts‚Äîyou can‚Äôt help but fly through the levels. Besides the fear of being too under leveled in your own world, the f2p (free to play) choice and co op are so enticing that a friend of mine convinced our whole friend group to join! if you‚Äôre even considering downloading this game, you should try it out asap. you won‚Äôt regret it! (unless you fall into the hands of the gacha system;;; i‚Äôm no longer f2püò™)
title: Best Open World game

review: I started playing not too long ago because my siblings play a lot and introduced it to me! I‚Äôm so glad they did! The graphics is unbelievable and they update so much so you won‚Äôt always get bored a lot! Some people say it crashes ur phone or it‚Äôs too glitchy! Well..I‚Äôm on phone and it doesn‚Äôt crash for me maybe try updating or play on a newer device! The characters are so cute and the quests are so challenging but that‚Äôs what makes it fun! You can have a collection in the game or even level up your characters. It does take lots of battery but that‚Äôs a small problem. Also, it takes long to download because it‚Äôs a open world game which is so cool! My favorite character right now is Diona!! So cute!! You can also play with your friends or help each other out! What‚Äôs even better is that now you have a daily reward!! I also saw some comments on like why or how to get swords or characters, well by doing quests or commissions! You can buy wishes in the shop or get them as a reward!! By wishing you can get cool stuff and by telling if something is good they rate it off by stars. Like some of the characters are 5 stars for example. (But they are really hard to get) I hope this review was helpful! Stay safe!
title: It‚Äôs such a addicting and fun game!

review: I‚Äôve played for about 2 hours now and I‚Äôm ready to write a review. I‚Äôve played many open world games in the past, and many have had their ups and downs. Then Genshin Impact came. Patiently day after day I would wait eagerly for the game to launch after seeing it appear on the App Store. While the download did take a little while in the beginning, the wait was more than worth it. The game is just absolutely beautiful, from the environment to the designs of the characters them selves. The game brings you in to another world full of color and adventure. The music is soothing to the ears as I walk the lands of Teyvat moving from quest to quest or finding a monster to beat. The game is smooth when it comes to combat controls and the layout of everything in general is very appealing, not like other games full to the brim with buttons and menus. This game reminds me of The Legend Of Zelda : Breath Of The Wild. (For those who have played it would see what I mean haha). The only con I can see with this game is that my phone overheats a bit. Overall I can‚Äôt wait to see what you guys have in store for us players. If you‚Äôre still reading this quit right now and get this game. You will not be disappointed. This will be quite the adventure to behold.
title: At A Loss For Words ...

review: Somehow runnable on mobile and ipad despite the details. Great character designs, story, and overall a really fun game. However, once you finish all the story quests there's nothing left to grind until they make another update. It then gets really boring and frustrating to wait for the banner you want and getting primogems is impossibly hard as it requires over 10k primos for 1 5* while each day you get 60 per commission and with the chance of not getting the character you want means you have to grind months just for one character. Higher ranks take forever to get, and they rarely give out interwined fates, or primogems, they only give us wishes for the standard banner when you level up. Nonetheless, it's a very enjoyable game when you first start but gets really demotivating, and without spending money getting anything you want may take months of patience, which I can say I don't have. I'd love for event reruns, or make them permanent like the Scaramouche one. And adding more gears and small co-op minigames like the hide and seek one. It'd also be fun to be able to play the lyre without doing the windblume ode event, as it is a very old event many people did not particpate in. Thanks!
title: Amazing game but...

review: I‚Äôve been playing genshin for around a year now and let me tell you, it is one of the most beautiful games you will ever see. I still remember to this day when I first arrived in liyue and sumeru and especially inazuma. it is a truly amazing game with beautiful music and storylines that are very complicated if you like that. However, with the many perks there are slight problems. For example the farming for artifacts, characters, talents, or even weapons can be exhausting if you play often. it can become repetitive and while some people enjoy that, many people(such as myself) can get very bored or frustrated. And also the amount of storage needed to download this game is a little ridiculous for any phone. Last time I hade this game on my phone, it was 47GB and has surely increased since the addition of Fontaine. so I do suggest playing on computer/console unless you pay for a phone with more storage, you can barely keep anything else on it with your phone. if you are looking for a phone game similar to this i would suggest Honkai: Star Rail. Moreover, this is an amazing game with an amazing community(for the most part) and I do highly suggest this game.
title: Great game, but definitely play on computer.

review: Genshin Impact is a game that honestly blew me away. It was my friend who got me into it but I had always wanted to play. The game is beautiful-Every region, although basic-Is filled with things that set it apart from the others. Every character has their own personality and you can see how much time and effort went into the creation of this game. There are a few downsides-Along with every game. As of 4 months in-You can find out what spawns where and when. The daily commissions, two of them are always the same. ‚ÄòWhy Hit Rocks?‚Äô And ‚ÄòStraight To The Heart‚Äô. I would like some variation-Like those two commissions appearing randomly rather than every single day. Also the fact that when I‚Äôm playing I‚Äôm rarely challenged by anything. Any mobs that are below my level or even above my level isn‚Äôt really a challenge. The combat mechanic of this game is slightly plain and there isn‚Äôt really anything that sets it apart from any other combat in any other games. Other than that, it‚Äôs a beautiful, polished game that is definitely worth my while and i‚Äôve been playing this way more than any other game. Definitely download worth, and definitely worth the amount it take up in your storage.
title: !PLEASE READ!

review: I really do enjoy this game, I played it nonstop for quite a long time and always come back to it after taking a break. But some of the problems I just cannot get over, it‚Äôs ‚Äúf2p‚Äù but if you actually want any of the limited characters you basically have to spend money for them and it‚Äôs not fair that your enjoyment should be based off of having money to waste on a video game. And the fact that there are still no more than four characters with even slightly darker skin is ridiculous, particularly with Sumeru literally being based off of the Middle East and Northern Africa. Yes the game is based in Asia where colorism is very prevalent, but the game developers cannot pretend that they don‚Äôt have a huge international audience and this is the most basic level of inclusivity to ask for. And not to mention that I‚Äôve been wanting to play again but literally can‚Äôt because it insist that I don‚Äôt have enough storage to download the new gameplay, despite the fact that I have over 10G available. How did I not have enough last week to download new data but had enough to run the full update today? And then again cannot play because it says I don‚Äôt have storage, the issue is not fixed after multiple times deleting the app and even resetting my device. Do better
title: Needs some serious fixes

review:
Has anyone ever considered that the creators can‚Äôt be everywhere at once? 
I mean, seriously? Y‚Äôall are getting out of hand with these negative reviews and comments, but have you ever considered the mere sliver of a thought that they can only provide so much for us? Has anyone thought about the fact that some aspects of this game operates on luck and patience?
Has anyone else realized that they get so much at the exact same time that they can only focus on one thing at a time? They can‚Äôt be here, there and everywhere at the same second. That‚Äôs not how this works. We‚Äôd be lucky to get an aquatinted fate and 100 primos, and you guys think you deserve more just because you‚Äôve been here since the first beta‚Ä¶
I was in awe when I pulled my first 5 star, and pure luck alone got another five star off a different banner that I didn‚Äôt know I had pity for. My point is, this game revolves around patience and luck and work, not greed and gamble and anger. 
Truthfully, do it like I did. Spend a week off the game and take a deep breath if you feel entitled to more than what they‚Äôre giving, because they can only do so much, million dollar brand or not. You guys need to chill out and get over it.
title: For those entitled‚Ä¶

review:
Iv been playing Genshin Impact since it‚Äôs first ever update. It has been a game iv enjoyed and have had fun with for a long time. I‚Äôve put money into It multiple times and have dedicated hours to playing it. One of the things that has kept me playing is the characters and beautiful world. 
However, the game has its mechanic flaws and already had a lack of representation for both skin tones and body types. But with the upcoming nation it has already made it clear that they will not be providing the same level of research, care, and representation that is present in the previous regions. The lack of representation is extremely clear now. Many many fans of the game hoped that the release of Sumeru would provide us accurate portrayals and skin tones associated with the swana region it‚Äôs based on. Instead we have been shown a jumbled mess of countries thrown together. Mondstat is based on Germany, Liyue is based on China, and Inazuma is based on Japan, why couldn‚Äôt they have picked a specific country and accurate representation for Sumeru as well? All the npcs we have seen so far in the game and through teasers are all white with no hint to any characters having a variety of skin tones. This has upset me and many fans of the game. Frustrating enough that I will no longer be spending money on this game and am considering not playing at all unless changes are made. This game is hurting many people.
title: Lacking representation for the cultures it bases itself on

review: its a fantastic game and probably the best mobile game out there. The character design is amazing and the gameplay is fantastic. The only issue I have is that whenever I try to change my party setup it crashes EVERY TIME. This is the main reason I dont do domains as often. I wish we had a feature where we could quickly change our party without having to open the whole menu. update: with the new inazuma update, i cant even open my part without it crashing anymore... im stuck with two electro characters to fight baal with and i cant change them. please make it easier to change our party so mobile players dont crash. make the animation less complex or something. anything. Adding to this: Mihoyo is a company that dies not care for their fans. Though it is a mobile gaming company, they have made no progress towards making it easier to play on mobile. Playstation players also get no progress towards the things they have asked for. Mihoyo also seems to have forgotten their own anniversary of one year for this game. All we get is 10 wishes. thats it. With the major growth of this games fanbase, and the amount of money they make from the character banners, they have PLENTY of reason to give us better rewards.
title: crashes a lot

review: To be honest, I wasn‚Äôt too interested in the game at first. But then once I started watching my sister play more often, I began to get more interested. So, last year, I downloaded the game and got started. One thing I didn‚Äôt like was that when I made my first account, I wasn‚Äôt able to get back in after a while. So I had to make another. I was actually a little glad about it! Only because not being able to get back into that account made me start a better account. That better account is my main account now. I recently found out I was able to get back into my old one, and so I did. I ended up getting Yoimiya on there and she‚Äôs pretty fun to use! Though I barely use that account anymore, I sometimes like to use it from time to time. Other than that, the game is overall great and I highly recommend it! I do wish that the amount of storage that it takes up would be reduced someday. But that‚Äôs not my decision to make. I also don‚Äôt understand how a few mechanisms work, but that‚Äôs the fun in it! Trying to find out how things work is pretty fun to me! Overall, the game is 100% getting a 5* review from me! <3 (also love Rizzley‚Äôs[Wriothesley‚Äôs] bakeryü§≠)
title: I love the game a lot!

review:
The only thing I have with this game is that I wish that you could change the apprentice of the first character. Like changing the eye colour, the cloths, the hair, and the skin colour. But for the other people you should be able to only change the cloths. Also I wish that you could make more wishes, to get more people and more things. Lastly I wish that there were more weathers like rain, thunder, snow, hail, and maybe storms where u have to take cover and it will destroy things. Also I think there should be an easier way to change the characters in the group like a simple button maybe I‚Äôm just blind but I don‚Äôt think it is there. Also when you play on an iPad it keeps glitching out and I have to start a lot of things over. I‚Äôm in the middle of a legal and then all of the sudden it glitches out and I have to start that little bit over. I don‚Äôt know if it is the game, or my divice, but it needs to be fixed. Thank you for reading and I hope you make these changes!!üòé

P.S. if u want to make another character u should do some sort of mermaid and when they go into the water they change and when they get out they go legs
title: One more thing then perfect.....

review: Great game, fun to play but ever since the 2.0 upgrade my game has 999 ping almost 24/7 and I have perfect WiFi connection. Y‚Äôall need to figure out how to fix the server lags because I also have a bunch of friends who are always complaining about their game lagging for no reason. Also when I have 999 ping on time trials and challenges it‚Äôs very annoying and angering when I can‚Äôt do any damage or anything yet the time trial still continues and I almost always fail them because of the lag. Also, y‚Äôall need to add more content more frequently. It gets annoying and boring when I finish quests and all I can do for the next month or so is just farm‚Ä¶again very very annoying. Last issue I wanna rant about‚Ä¶is obtaining new characters and weapons, it‚Äôs kind of unfair how you guys barely give away primo gems anymore like you do when a new player joins. It‚Äôs very hard and time consuming trying to get enough primo gems for certain characters and then not even getting anything good from the wishes. I just feel like y‚Äôall need to raise the rates of characters and better weapons so it‚Äôs easier for F2P players to enjoy the game more. Besides those few issues this game is great and I love playing it but the lag makes it no fun and the constant and long farming while waiting for new content is really annoying and makes me not want to play this game anymore.
title: Horrible lag

review: This game keeps you involved and interested! Their updates and new quests keep it interesting and a challenge! My only complaint is how hard it is to advance levels, weapons, talents etc the higher you have your characters and AR. Much Higher rewards for higher AR. Players put the effort into the game reward on that. The different characters to obtain are a lot of fun if you can get them. It is rather difficult to obtain 5 star characters unless you pay for unlimited primogems. I think the pity should be a little more player friendly than money making. Not everyone can afford to play this game as they would like to! This should be equal among all. I think resin should increase with level advancement as well other leveling items! The higher AR the more Resin you can acquire in a day. The game is amazing and I play every day due to this reason, even though sometimes boring waiting for new areas, releases, etc. Much luv to the developers! You‚Äôve all put a lot of effort into this game. A few tweaks and it could keep people interested. Also the data to keep up with the game is outrageous! You will need a bigger data form then 64 to keep the game going!
title: Perfect in the best for a game!

review: I think this is a good start, a better start for China to European and American countries, I grew up in China, people here are very hostile to foreigners, especially Americans and Japanese, that day I and my relatives saw two Indian men on the street, my relatives said why foreigners don't get out of China, I don't understand, But now many people are wise, Chinese people have no way to communicate with foreigners because of the restrictions of national network security, they were born to study in a school that is not as good as the cage, they start class at six in the morning and finish class at eleven at night, the teachers in the class put everything on the foreigners' oppression of Chinese people, let us work harder and harder. Nowadays, Chinese people can't afford to buy houses and cars, people's high education is not worth anything in front of the relationship, everyone is full of hatred, and this game opens a door, a door for China to slowly and wisely go to the world.
