title: An insignificant Chinese player

review: I‚Äôve been playing genshin impact for almost 2 years now. The beginning was really fun! Although completely my fault, I got so addicted to the game, I wouldn‚Äôt put it down. Within 2 weeks of playing I hit AR 30. I regret that very much. If your a new player, or just a random person looking to play this wonder of a game, take it slow, this game has content you wanna take your time on. There‚Äôs 4 regions unlocked currently with 3 more regions coming out. Take your time in this game! The pros however, amazing graphics, beautiful character designs, and REALLY GOOD open world. This was my first time playing a mobile open world game. I‚Äôve experienced games like Zelda and Pok√©mon before, but I was so surprised how well the graphics were ON my phone and iPad. From starting the game till now, honestly just walking around Mondstadt, Liyue, Inazuma, and Sumeru is all the entertainment I need. Acting like an NPC is really fun believe it or not HAHAH. Lore wise, I enjoy most of the archon and story quest lore. However the world quests, there are some you should definitely read through, but the rest are infuriatingly long. Characters are super enjoyable, specifically the pyro and cryo characters. Overall great game!
title: Pros and Cons

review: So, new player here. I‚Äôve seen this with many other reviews in many other games, where the inexperienced players misunderstand something and they criticize the game for something that shouldn‚Äôt be criticized. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm sorry if there‚Äôs any problems in this review. Anyway, I want to talk about the problems first. In the cutscenes, like the starting intro (where you explain your story to Emergency Food, aka Paimon) it was lagging like crazy. Literally every three seconds the screen would freeze, or the animation would sort-of glitch. The same thing happened when Emergency Food and I read the gliding manual that Amber gave us. I‚Äôm annoyed by this because it‚Äôs hard for me to clearly understand what exactly is going on! The audio keeps running during the freeze and then after it doesn‚Äôt match. The other thing is very small- the graphics are kinda girly... A pet peeve, if you will. I know this is your style and everything, so you shouldn‚Äôt change it. But just a little thought. Other than that, the game is great. Weapons look awesome, characters are amazing, the storyline is awesome. Progression at first is fast, and slows down after, which is a good feature to hook players at first but not make it too easy. I like this game!
title: New Player

review:
I‚Äôve been playing Genshin since early 2021, and I gotta say it‚Äôs been a nice experience! If you get over ‚Äúbuilding‚Äù your characters feeling like a chore you work hard to get a character, then you gotta get a weapon, and good artifacts and level all those things then level talents and it‚Äôs just‚Ä¶ a lot. And when you start to get more and more characters it becomes incredibly tedious. And the resin cap makes it impossible to get everything you need as soon as possible and that‚Äôs a bit frustrating. And then there‚Äôs the absolute lack in representation for the wide range of skin colors. I feel like at the start, when I started playing this wasn‚Äôt much of an issue. But with it being a year now and still barely any new skin tones besides snow, peach, and slight tan it‚Äôs getting annoying. I get there‚Äôs a standard in Eastern Asia surrounding skin color but I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs fair because they have characters from different cultures then fail to represent them properly? With almost all the new semuru characters being incredibly pale despite the fact they are inspired by places like Egypt, India, Southern Africa. It‚Äôs disgusting how they make them all barely even tan and it needs to be fixed immediately. If they decide to take inspiration from these cultures for their characters, then the least they could do was give them an accurate skin color. 

Until then one star.
title: Liked it at first, but the lack of diversity?

review: I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact since January - initially drawn in by the gorgeous anime graphics, character design, and story. However, in recent months, my interest has greatly plummeted. The poor mobile optimization i could look past, as gameplay wasn‚Äôt too impacted beyond needing to re-boot after it‚Äôd crashed a few times a session. But, it‚Äôs gotten to the point where the game is unplayable - literally. This is a brand new iPad, and I can‚Äôt last 30 seconds in co-op without the game crashing. I haven‚Äôt even gotten into how stingy this whole game is. Going into domains is a massive gamble and even when you get the pieces you want (which is also absurdly pitted against you, by the way) there‚Äôs still a chance they‚Äôll roll into junk you can‚Äôt use. It used to be so exciting to do tasks and quests and receive primogems to wish, but nowadays the rewards are so minuscule (barely 1/4 what a wish costs, or less!) that it‚Äôs not even worth wasting my time on. And the anniversary rewards? This has got to be some kind of prank, right? MHY spends millions upon millions of dollars on *twitter stickers* but oohhh noooo they can‚Äôt give us more than one ten pull on an anniversary because they‚Äôll go broke :,( sniff sniff. I‚Äôm so sick of being so, so deeply disappointed over and over and over again. Be better, MHY. I‚Äôd say take a page out of DevSisters‚Äô book.
title: Was incredible. Not anymore.

review:
Update: I‚Äôve now been playing this game for almost three years straight and can honestly say it‚Äôs more than just a game to me. It‚Äôs the only game I play, a part of my (almost) daily routine, and a huge destressor. The addition of genshin into my days has added so much joy and happiness. It just keeps getting better and better. 
‚Äî 
I‚Äôve played this game everyday for two months straight. It is just an amazing experience that can‚Äôt even be put into words. The graphics are LITERALLY breathtaking. It‚Äôs like cutscene-level graphics, but all the time. I‚Äôve never wanted to jump inside a video game so badly. The music is literally magical, it‚Äôs just so calming and beautiful. Touching stories, entertaining characters, extremely fun fighting, and a landscape that you can spend months exploring before having seen/collected everything. Finding 10 chests from walking around for 5 minutes is so fun. There‚Äôs a perfect mix of challenge and relaxation, and the best part is YOU get to decide what you want your gaming experience to be. You need to play for yourself, seriously just try it. (Also people need to stop complaining about gacha and resin. Stop being entitled)
title: Amazing, Beautiful, Top-tier

review: I love this game. However, I‚Äôm incredibly disappointed (but not surprised) with the new leaks. Much of the player-base was hoping for hoyoverse to finally give more representation to darker skin tones with sumeru, given that the region is based on the middle east, south asia, and north africa. However with all of the characters from that region that have been shown so far by hoyoverse themselves or have been shown by leakers, they are mostly extremely pale and a lot of their outfits have been said to be culturally inaccurate or offensive (ex: dori, who is a stereotype). It‚Äôs a shame that the company wishes to use these cultures but not actually put any care into respecting them and representing them like they did with inazuma and liyue. It‚Äôs extremely frustrating, especially since hoyoverse usually does not listen to their fanbase regarding improvements that could be made to the game. It‚Äôs absurd that out of the *huge* cast of characters, only two could be considered to have darker skin (and those two characters are constantly whitewashed in official art). Even then, we have not seen any characters with skin tones that are darker than those two characters. Most of the cast is extremely pale, and it‚Äôs not that there can‚Äôt be pale characters, but it‚Äôs that there is VERY little representation for darker skin tones. I hope that there will be changes, but if not I‚Äôm hesitant to continue spending any money on this game.
title: Hoping for new changes in Sumeru

review: So. The only problem I have with this game is the overwhelming lag that this game brings to the phone. If you guys could really fix this, I‚Äôd be very happy, cause I was Interested to see all of the amazing animations that you guys could bring to such a magnificent game as this one. Plus, it should be brought to my attention that you should get the material for wishes easier. I have been trying my hardest, but I always seem to get nothing, although I just do quests and stuff that don‚Äôt have them. (I understand that this is a very early version of the game, and your improving it.) Also, VERY. good job on the character models for this game. Honestly, this is the first ever good RPG game, making the fact that all the others were not very good, since it limits you to a lobby, not experiencing the world, and just fighting. I would also like to add, something That would improve this game a lot is if you guys had different Customizations. Like Clothes, Wing Gliders (there are 3 available so, I guess I have a wrong point there) And much more! It would seem to me so fun if there was a whole variety to this game. Also, Amazing game on the characters. I really like all of them, and I favor this game a lot. As being one of your big fans, please take these ideas into suggestion and improve the game early on! I would love to see this game being one of the most played games in the world ! ! I hope the best of luck to you guys!
title: Amazing! But...

review:
there are just so many problems now that even rating this game with one star is too much. not only is there no communication from the game‚Äôs company themselves, but there is also a HUGE lack of representation within their playable characters and nps. they are building each new region to be based on these very cultural areas and refuse to even do the bare minimum of giving proper skin tones. 

more specifically with their upcoming region, sumeru. with the recent livestream showing off their architecture for sumeru, that is based off south asia and north africa, there are NO dark-skinned nps OR characters to be coming out from leaks , which proves that the game‚Äôs company do not care about them offending and disrespecting the real life people from the places they are basing their games‚Äô regions off of. the characters that we are aware of from leaks are seen to be EXTREMELY orientalist & islamphobic and goes to show that the company has no remorse for those they are profiting off of.

i‚Äôve been an active player for over a year, have given this game my own money , and for this misrepresentation to come out of this with no regards or apology or change from the company, it tells us as players that the company does not care about our concerns and judgements. it is very disappointing, but i will no longer be publicly or financially supporting this game until there are changes made and i hope others do the same
title: lack of proper representation

review:
i didnt get this game originally because i heard it was pay to win which by the way is NOT true. this game is absolutely gorgeous and amazing, it combines good storytelling with adventuring and even cooking (which has very quickly become my favorite part). the game is also absolutely gorgeous on its own and the community is very kind as well! about the pay to win claims, it isnt pay to win. yes there are things you can buy with real money but its nothing you cant earn in game with just a little patience. the events are amazing and they dont hesitate to shower you in rewards for the things youve accomplished, whether it be a simple event like just giving a guy some stuff every day for rewards or an entire event including brand new lore and characters (even some map expansion as well!) they are both so entertaining and engaging. i have severe adhd so despite open world games being my favorite, they can bore me due to not having anything in them but despite this huge map it isnt always bare. there's enemies, loot, random quests, ingredients, etc. and it does wonders for my adhd. im struggling to get everything written down but...

tl;dr highly recommended, the best open world game ive ever played (also not pay to win!)
title: a game that shatters expectations

review:
i‚Äôm re-writing my previous review, haha. so genshin is cool & all but when you get to rank 30 or higher, the limit for resources (artifacts) or farming in general ends up being tedious for f2p. i‚Äôve spent $20 and don‚Äôt plan on spending more, but the amount of resin needed for everything is excessive. i‚Äôve progressed quite a bit since the launch of the game, so for other players who don‚Äôt really enjoy grinding their exp.. its easier for them to lose interest altogether. the advantage is the game is basically at your own pace, so if you wanna grind for anything (its up to you) or following the story is decent.

update: i‚Äôve played for three years.. i‚Äôve spent more than $20. my opinion is still the same, AR 50-60 will be tedious for f2p or any player, it doesn‚Äôt have to revolve around $. for new players, genshin will have more content than when it launched. for old players, its just a filler patch and waiting for new 5*s, 4*s, etc. at least that‚Äôs how it feels to me and at the end of the day it‚Äôs just my opinion. as an older player, i‚Äôve taken breaks from the game, i still come back cause i feel nostalgic, but it‚Äôs not that enjoyable anymore. i‚Äôd like to see mihoyo add real ‚Äúendgame content‚Äù because the content we have now is limited to events, TGC (a card and dice game), and abyss.
title: minor issues!

review:
Y‚Äôall this game is breathtaking and so incredible. I cannot express how much I love it. I‚Äôve been playing since December of 2020 but I finally decided to write a review. The graphics are so beautiful. Like Breath of the Wild level. This game is not just a mobile game. The gameplay is so good and fun and the story is very interesting. It‚Äôs an open world exploration game so there‚Äôs lots of stuff to do. 
HOWEVER: just a quick heads up, this game comes with lots of updates as it‚Äôs an ongoing game that‚Äôs adding onto its story and game as we go. This means that it will take a good chunk of memory and that the whole map, story, and cast of characters isn‚Äôt released yet. 
Yes, there is a gacha system where you wish for more characters, but it‚Äôs not unfair to free to play players. I‚Äôm free to play and I‚Äôve gotten good characters (and even a five star one!) so you don‚Äôt need money to enjoy it. 
I love this game so, so much and it‚Äôs worth every minute of your time. I still have a hard time believing it‚Äôs free too. Not one of those ‚Äúfree to start‚Äù games where you eventually need to spend real money; this game can be played without spending a single penny the entire time.
title: If I could, I would give this 10 stars

review: This is the best game I have ever played. There is always something to do and countless possibilities ranging from ascending and upgrading characters to fight, to exploring the wonderful and seemingly infinite world of Teyvat. Using different elements you can fight and create teams, fighting bosses and smaller enemies as well as playing with others in co op. You unlock teleport waypoints and Statues of the Seven to move more easily across the map and just adventure through the beautiful and ethereal scenes and animation of this stunning world. The quests that you can do are also amazing, following one archon quest that follows the story of the traveler (you) and involved the intricate stories of each person there, and of the tales and creation of the 7 archons in Teyvat. The thought and creation put into each character and their voice lines and story is truly amazing, and each part of that adds to the interactiveness and the beauty of the game. While wandering through purple covered mountaintops, windy cliffs, rocky caverns with glowing tapestries across the walls, or an amazing sunset at the roof of a building, you always will find that the beauty of the game is what makes it so special and amazing.
title: Amazingly beautiful in every way

review: There are a lot of problems with this game but the unfairness in and out-game that goes towards F2P and Mobile players is insane. First off we have the insane amount of space this game takes up. For it to be in the 2.1 era it takes up too much space. Another thing is how money grabbing this game is. This game is based off luck, sure but not everyone is lucky, especially me. If the gacha system works as it says to work, a player shouldn't have to reach full pity to get a single 5* character. I am also F2P so i have to miss atleast 2 banners to get a 5* that isn't even guaranteed. The new weapon system isn't even circling around F2P either, only for people who bring you money. With the events which only give you 430 primos each event, a player doesn't even get a 10 pull unless they spend zero primos for a MONTH straight. A little bit over an entire banner. Also, why does this game break so often? Every polearm in the game can get stuck on something small like a boulder in the open world. This game has so many issues but is only biased to fix the ones that affect people who pay. Weapon banner system, the ENTIRE resin system, like?? Fix your game dude like not everyone can or will spend their entire life savings on a game that barely cares about its players.
title: It's Unfair...

review:
When I saw other people playing the game and say how cool everything was, how the graphics are amazing, the story is engaging, when I got the game I was excited. But when I actually opened it the screen was black. So I thought that this is just the opening screen but when I started to play, everything around me was black and I can only see a certain section of where I was. It made me really uncomfortable and I felt pain that I couldn‚Äôt play the game. I had really high hopes to be able to play it but I couldn‚Äôt. So since I wanted to play it I continued to but when I got to the part where I got sucked up in the tornado and had to fight the dragon, that‚Äôs where I gave up because my whole screen was just black and I couldn‚Äôt do anything. So when I went to the app on the App Store I saw that you would have to have the iPhone 8 or up, I got kinda mad because not everyone is able to get the newest phone. Some people don‚Äôt have that kind of money (like me). So the MAIN BIGGEST thing you can do is to let the game be playable on all mobile devices so that way everyone can be happy and play. I know this game is new and all and you guys have a lot of reviews but I think this is a main one to do or at least think about. Hope you guys see this review and react to this. üòä

Also your other game (HonkaiImpact) is REALLY good so I thought this game was gonna be good.
title: I expected it to be better

review:
Even tho I just started a few months ago I worked hard to level up to play with my friends and that was challenging obviously and then when I was playing with other people I wanted to change my character and there were four other people and I couldn‚Äôt see my character on the side where it‚Äôs supposed to be and I was kinda annoyed 
My second thing is about the wishes i know a lot of ppl write about this but I feel like it gets harder the higher adventure rank you have and I get pretty annoyed by this because I have multiple weapons I don‚Äôt need and I save up for weeks and get weapons and I feel really angry by this so if possible there should be a way for it not to be different for each adventure rank 
My third thing to say is that I don‚Äôt know why but i feel pimon (sorry idk how to spell it) should be obtainable because she seems like the type of character who would be useful in dogens (helpüò≠) and seems like the water type character or maybe there would be other characters like her because it doesn‚Äôt make that much sense to me why she‚Äôs there she doesn‚Äôt really help that much that‚Äôs just what I think tho
That‚Äôs all I wanted to say ü•≤ü•≤ü•≤ü•≤ü•≤
title: It‚Äôs good but I don‚Äôt understand something‚Äôs

review: I find myself playing losing track of the time the story line keeps you wanted to play more pros they do not have a pay to win aspect you can get everything free been playing two days and I already got a 5* so don‚Äôt let the reviews say other wise yeah normally the drop rates are low but they have events that boost up to 50-75% so save and use during those like I did and the 4* characters are still just as good u want to have a variety of different squads as you progress another pro which seems to be underrated is the voice to chat with npcs I think many will agree sometimes u just wanna skip through and sometimes u don‚Äôt feel like reading not to mention you feel more immersed into the game hearving different voices as you progress with different characters the only con I really think is the no mount system while it‚Äôs still beta hope it comes in future but they‚Äôre are ways around this some characters increase your stamina for entire party so u can run longer and climb higher so they doing everything right I‚Äôm a firm believer in making a game good enough free some players choose to purchase to support versus having to purchase just to progress so this game get a a+++
title: Great f2p game

review: As it says, yes, this game deserves 4 stars at best. Number one, the music is absolutely delightful and I genuinely appreciate how much effort was put into the music and game. Number two, the main storyline is decently good? The characters have wonderful appearances too. There‚Äôs only one problem, and everyone knows what that is, Mihoyo is not grateful enough for their fans. You‚Äôve had dedicated players for a year and made thousands of dollars‚Ä¶ and then we get‚Ä¶ pretty bad rewards that anyone could‚Äôve easily paid for. I feel like as an f2p player these rewards were meant for f2p people, there is no way people spend hundreds of dollars on this game and get 10 wishes and a couple Mora, we don‚Äôt need mora Mihoyo, I have literally 1 million mora all I want is primogems. Let‚Äôs also talk about the fact that Mihoyo gives us better rewards when they fix bugs than the anniversary rewards altogether. Primogems are SO hard to get as an f2p player and some of the things we do for just a couple of primogems is insane, especially when we get achievements and mainly only FIVE primogems for them, FIVE. Trust the community knows you guys wouldn‚Äôt lose a penny for raising the primogems we get for anything and everything.
title: This game deserves 4 stars at best

review: I love genshin impact so much, and the characters are amazing. However, it is not free to play. Getting primo gems is way too hard, and the amount of pity you have to work up to is insane. Even with 100 dollars, it only gets you 50 wishes. Wishes are also too expensive, 160 primos for one. Mihoyo is very stingy with the amount of primo gems in events and commissions. It‚Äôs very hard to play once you get to a higher ar. I have explored most places, and I cannot get more primo gems unless I spend money. I‚Äôve been saving for about a month and I came up with one ten pull. The amount of money needed to get five stars is insane. If you lose the 50/50 with the money you spent, you have to spend over 100 dollars to get the character you want. They should get rid of the 50/50. It just makes you mad when you lose the 50/50, and spending money twice to get the character is maddening. Another thing is that you have to buy the battle pass if you want the bottom rewards. It is very unfair, it should be unlocked. This is not a friendly game for players who can‚Äôt spend money on it. I have spent at least 800 dollars on it and have gotten some characters, but it is not worth the money. The pity scale is too high and so is the price of wishes. This is a good game, but not for you if you can‚Äôt spend money.
title: My favorite game, however is not free to play

review: This game was proven to be the next game to reach #1 upon successful concepts in character design and uses along with regions to explore and mysteries to solve in stories. Not to mentioned weapons characters have to use and enemies & bosses to defeat. What ended up being half is often times the loading screen gets stuck after all the protocols as to downloading updated file, verification within the file and the save file being loaded and ready to go are dealt with and ready to begin play that the loading screen would reach halfway thru the earth symbol and stays there for eons to come. I did the best on my end to make sure game runs smoothly thru tablet restart, network reset and app restart, which all of them perform smoothly at the time. I would pray the game would no longer be required to go to the loading screen with the elements logo that would impose a favor of being stuck on the half earth logo again. Otherwise, game is successful in all other aspects, which certainly win me over to playing this game. By removing an requirement as that or perhaps another means of loading screen where it is different from the original, I would then be able to give praise to a game like this and be able to play once more.
title: Loading issue aside successful gaming mobility

review:
I started playing this game so I could join in on something my teenage daughter loves and invited me to play with her. I enjoy the game enough that I‚Äôve managed to almost catch up to her even though she had a major head start üòÖ. I love the characters, the core mechanics, and the variety in the world. I have come close to quitting a few times when the archon quest would have a challenge l couldn‚Äôt overcome and I‚Äôd get stuck for months. The anti-Raiden Shogun training being a prime example. There was no possible way to move forward in the story without completing the training, which for some reason I simply could not do for months on end. If there were alternate tactics to complete the challenge, it would have been so much better. If it weren‚Äôt for my daughter, I would have given up. 

The puzzles also bother me because there is often no way to discern the logic of the puzzle. Some of the puzzles have enough context that I can actually figure them out, and it‚Äôs very satisfying. But more often than not, I end up having to find a video tutorial that walks me through the very random answer.
title: Enjoyable but would be much improved with alternate paths

review: honestly, i love honkai and genshin so much. hoyoverse has given me a long term source of entertainment, and each game gives a different vibe and suits a different demographic. though genshin is a gacha, the game give you enough currency where (if you grind hard and long enough), you can get through all of the content and pick up enough limited 5 stars to do so. with that being said, there‚Äôs definitely a lot that needs improvement, such as endgame content apart from abyss and a reworked resin system. it‚Äôs so hard to improve character artifacts due to the rates, and to distribute your resin throughout all the bosses and materials on top of that is a nightmare. i also believe there should be some other way for endgame players to earn primos, as right now im in a spot where there‚Äôs no more to explore and im clearing abyss every rotation. however, seeing hoyoverses improvement with honkai, I have high hopes they will slowly make changes to benefit their players. with that being said, im in love with the coziness (at least for now TT) of the storyline and gameplay, and the landscape and designs itself are stunning. great game to pick up with summer coming up!
title: overall, highly recommend.

review: The feeling of opening this game for the first time and experiencing everything is not something I‚Äôve ever been able to recreate with anything else; it‚Äôs truly a one-of-a-kind experience. And, over the 6 months (ish) of playing this game daily and progressing through the story, I‚Äôve found myself wowed again and again. Seeing Liyue Harbor for the first time, going to Inazuma with Beidou and Kazuha and experiencing everything there, seeing Sangonomiya Shrine for the first time‚Ä¶ this game truly is gorgeous. The soundtrack is amazing, the characters are all very fun to play as, the story line (even with its holes and not so great moments) is better than most main-stream media I‚Äôve consumed, and the events are incredibly fun. Overall, this game has been a net positive for me (though perhaps not for my grades, lolololol). All of that being said, however, the Gacha element does hinder this game; you can complete the game without ever wishing, sure, but that does hinder your ability to complete certain aspects of the game. Also, the lack of endgame makes progressing somewhat unenjoyable, with most in-game content being delegated to limited time events.
title: Beautiful game, but there are a few issues

review:
Really have been enjoying my time with this game the world is absolutely stunning, the dialogue I find to be quite humorous and the gameplay is overall really fun. I especially love the way the elements will interact with each other adding another layer of thought behind party builds. However this game is very very very very greedy surprisingly for a mostly single player rpg with very limited co-op. The rates for the gacha are actually absurd the rate for a 5* character/weapon is a measly 0.6% which would be acceptable if you didn‚Äôt have to get a character 7 times to actually fully unlock their constellations(abilities,talents, passives etc.) as well as the 0.6% being split between characters and weapons so realistically there‚Äôs a 0.3% chance of pulling a 5* character and 0.3% for a 5* weapon; so unless you have 10‚Äôs of thousands of dollars to spend on the game to actually get the characters you want your best bet is to be f2p and just go for 4* characters that way you may be able to unlock there full potential (constellations)
Hopefully that will be addressed considering the recuperated the development cost in 1 week of the game being out. If not I don‚Äôt see much longevity for this game which is a shame because it has limitless potential if the devs can see past the money bags.
title: Beautifully designed, with great gameplay but.....

review: ‚ÄúGo touch grass‚Äù I play Genshin for the story and it is breathtaking the amount of detail you can travel practically anywhere you desire in the game, if not it will be unlocked in the future. And underground the detail, the design, mechanics of the game. I love the underwater swimming they added it‚Äôs so beautiful along with all the creatures and enemies to fight. EVEN THE ENEMIES HAVE BACKSTORIES the amount of Easter eggs and detail within each and every part of this game. You can even find references to past stories within enemies (dendro and anemo slime representing collei and sucrose from a past event on starsnatch cliff ) enemies heartbroken before you slaughter them or enemies simply sleeping, having a drink, playing etc. how each character can interact with the world considering that Xiangyun it‚Äôs gonna make exploration so much fun. I am astonished by how beautiful with game is and the fact that it is COMPLETELY FREE to play and the things locked behind pay to play are just stuff that you can boost characters abilities and truely see how much damage you can make yourself do. I really am looking forward to future nations. I honestly hope that everyone can enjoy this game as much as I do.
title: Ethereal

review: I have always loved Genshin, and I was so excited for the new region of Sumeru, but I‚Äôm beyond disappointed in the designs of the upcoming characters. The lack of diversity is blatantly racist, with Sumeru being based off SWANA, the characters should NOT be as pale as they are. It is not a true representation of that region, the characters there should be a representation of the real people who live in the region Sumeru is based on, and they are not. Genshin seemed to take so much care in the representation of their Chinese and Japanese based regions, but isn‚Äôt taking the same attitude with Sumeru. It is absolutely unacceptable to use a real life region as inspiration and then refuse to give a real representation of its own people, you cannot just use bits and pieces to pick and choose to your liking.  The Sumeru characters should have darker skin tones to properly represent the people they‚Äôre inspired by. The lack of diversity has been a problem even before the announcement of the playable Sumeru characters, as even the NPCs supposed to be from Sumeru are not good representations of the people in the region they‚Äôre based on. Even within the current playable characters there is issues of racism, Kaeya and Xinyan, the only two darker skinned characters out of 50 playable characters, are commonly whitewashed in official art. Until Hoyoverse steps up and gives us the correct representation, I will no longer be financially supporting Genshin Impact.
title: Sumeru

review:
Ignore any other negative review. Yes the game takes a lot of storage, for a mobile game Genshin Impact has a HUGE amount of detail, the map is huge, and it‚Äôs overall worth it all. The story is VERY enticing. Yes, it IS a gacha game, but that doesn‚Äôt kill the fun. Yes you might miss out on a character you wanted but that‚Äôs okay. Even now as an adventure rank 57 player I still use characters that have since way fallen out of meta. It‚Äôs about strategizing, and if you can‚Äôt put just a little bit of effort into learning mechanics and team building you might be disappointed at your damage. But learning how to boost team damage and completing quests is fun. Not going to lie, the game IS a grind, but even that‚Äôs all part of genshin altogether. It might pain you at times but if you wanna deal big damage then that‚Äôs what you‚Äôll have to suffer (unless you have extreme luck lol). 

Tldr: even free to play players can enjoy the game and do well, i was free to play til Adventure rank 50 and enjoyed my time as one, im just a very low spender now and it doesn‚Äôt really change much, the game is fun regardless. Give it a shot, go in and have fun thats all. Everything Genshin has to offer is worth it.
title: Amazing game

review: Genshin is an amazing game that I‚Äôve loved since I picked it up. The graphics are really good, even if you‚Äôre on mobile (I‚Äôm using an old iPad), the characters are likeable, and the gameplay is fun and engaging. I do have a few problems with it though. After you finish the main archon quests, the only quests left to do are world and story quests, which get tedious and boring after a while. Except for events, there‚Äôs hardly anything to do other than farm domains, and you can‚Äôt even do that after a while because of the resin limit, which, by the way, is a mechanic I really like. Using resin to limit how much farming is allowed to be done really helps players from milking everything out of the game early on. Another thing: free to play players have a hard time getting good five star characters. I found that I rarely got what I wanted when I tried to be free to play. I could hardly get to high enough pity as a f2p, and when I did I still had to gamble losing my 50/50. Even with all those things, it‚Äôs still a great game that I recommend to anyone who is willing to put time and effort in. That said, it‚Äôs fairly addicting, so make sure to manage your time right!
title: Overall great! Just a couple complaints.

review:
Genshin Impact is a beautiful game made by incredibly talented artists, but your enjoyment quickly dries up when you realize how little the people in charge care about player satisfaction. I'm an AR55 player who's been playing on and off since launch, and there have been very few quality of life updates. Some character abilities work very inconsistently (ex: Xinyan's tier 3 shield and Sara's teleport both don't work as intended, both have been issues since the characters were released and have yet to be acknowledged), but only bugs that are useful or entertaining for the player get fixed (ex: Kokomi's walking on water infinitely, a fun bug that makes exploring more fun and which MiHoYo has announced plans to fix immediately, when other characters like the ones I just mentioned have literally broken abilities and MiHoYo doesn't care).

There's very little transparency with MiHoYo. They tell players basically nothing and do everything they can to sweep player complaints under the rug.

Especially with the recent decisions made by MiHoYo to be stingy with anniversary rewards, especially the meager community event rewards that are locked behind RNG and nowhere near proportional to the work many content creators put in, I can't in good faith recommend this game to anyone. Don't give this greedy company your time and energy, and most importantly do NOT give them your money.
title: Beautiful game, awful company

review: First I really love this game but unfortunately I don't own a PC so I play Genshin Impact on my Apple iPad. Thing is it crashes way too much especially after the inazuma update. I've been trying to co-op in domains in inazuma but it crashes the minute I try to co-op. It wasn't this bad before the update and I have a few friends who play Genshin Impact mobile but they don't have any problems with crashing. Maybe it's because I'm using an Apple device but I lowered every setting in my game to prevent it from crashing even more but it still crashes. Every time the game has a survey I always keep saying to fix the crashing issues for mobile players like us cause not everyone has a PC or PlayStation to play the game on. Unfortunately nothing has been changed and I've been asking this for a long time but no one has done anything about it. I know that the Genshin Impact designers or whatever is already busy doing stuff that concerns the game but if you guys have the time please fix the crashing issue for us mobile players. It's really annoying to keep on crashing when you really enjoy the game which I really love this game but the fact it keeps on crashing even more after the update is very frustrating so please I beg you to fix it.
title: Crashes way too much on mobile

review:
This game is absolutely beautiful. The animators definitely spent a great deal of care and time in bringing this game to life. The aesthetics of the world and everything within is outright amazing! The characters and NPCs all are unique as well. I spent so much time just exploring the rather large area of the world right out of the gate rather than jumping into the story line. To everybody that‚Äôs thinking of doing the same, as it is quiet fun to do, I recommend at least going along and getting your wings and first couple team mates before you do begin to adventure around. Just need a few of those perks in order to complete a number of.... well I‚Äôll say encounters so as not to spoil anything. This is in my opinion the perfect open world game for mobile. But with all the praise there is also a downside; this game is an absolute monster on battery life. Make sure you have a power source nearby if you want to dive into this world. Trust me, if you start roaming around, time and battery life will go before you even realize how long it‚Äôs been. 

Would recommend the developers to include a battery icon and clock visual in game so players can monitor both as they play. Otherwise this is a perfect game to me.
title: Well worth your time!

review: Honestly, when I started to play the game, I thought this game was really similar to another specific game I played, which made me dislike it for a bit. But I fell deeply in love with the characters, the gameplay, storyline, events, and the imagination while I played. I mean, I get to experience culture in this game, like how Inazuma is based on traditional Japan, Liyue based on China, and Fontaine based off of France. The wishing system is really fun to play, with and the game is really challenging as well. The voice acting from every language available is so well done, and sounds like you‚Äôre really inside the story, and makes me on the edge of my seat for more exciting voice lines. I‚Äôm a mobile player, so personally I would take caution when downloading the game because it takes up a lot of storage but it is definitely worth the storage. Genshin Impact changed the way I looked at RPG games, and it makes me want to explore more of this game. I‚Äôve gotten really far in the game and I can‚Äôt wait to see what‚Äôs in store for the future. Thank you Hoyoverse, for letting me have a game to remember for my life. Hopefully my grandchildren won‚Äôt call me weird.
title: A game of a lifetime

review: First of all, this game is stunning. I‚Äôm playing on iOS & I hear from friends & gamer reviews it‚Äôs even more insane on PS5 & PC. It‚Äôs like a playable anime which is so fun. There are tons of options so if you get tired of interacting with one aspect of the game there are so many other side quests, storylines, puzzles, dungeons, builds for your characters, etc. But the cool thing is very few of them have to be played linerally to advance forward. I‚Äôve already unlocked & opened nearly all the tp points on all of Tevyat ( including the dread frozen bits which some people don‚Äôt do until way later it‚Äôs hard) that I can for my level but I‚Äôm still new in the game so it gives me places to wander off & explore when something might be a bit too tough to beat at first. Tons of free drops & things given out. So far the money I *have* spent to support the game & developers as thanks has been worth it. I downloaded Genshin when it first came out but it didn‚Äôt have enough to grab me at first. Now it‚Äôs become something fantastic. One of my favorite games I‚Äôve ever played & I‚Äôm a Gen X raised on the rise of Atari as a tot. lol
title: First game I‚Äôve found you really can CHOOSE F2P or P2P!

review: I read a couple of the 1 star reviews and I‚Äôm not sure why people even wrote them. Genshin impact is a open world rpg with crazy good graphics and an absolutely massive map that has area specific mechanics, different dungeons, and much more. To add to it, the game has tons of characters and things like artifacts and other materials which can be farmed for. Each of these little details just makes the game more enjoyable and unique compared to other gacha games. Like have you ever seen a gacha game this massive? And even if have seen one like this, it wouldn‚Äôt be as detailed as Genshin Impact. All I have to say to the people without enough storage is that not having storagr sounds like a you problem. Just get more storage or don‚Äôt get the game. No need to falsely rate the game without playing it. In conclusion, I really like Genshin Impact and it is an amazing game with cool mechanics. It even gets characters and new places at a good rate which makes the game enjoyable even if you feel like you might want to quit. Overall this is an amazing game that I would definitely recommend to any open world rpg lovers or anyone that just wants to play a new game.
title: 1 star reviews.

review: So, obviously this game is not finished development but I do have some things to say. This game is very fun! I like to join my friends and play together, the story of the game is also very interesting and nice. If you haven‚Äôt tried it out, you definitely should. The community has a lot of funny jokes, and are very nice, although some can be very rude or toxic. So this game is a really good game if you want a fun open-world exploring Gacha game. But, This game does not give out much rewards and there aren‚Äôt a lot of options to get the in-game Gacha currency Primo gems.  This game is free, but you will probably spend money since it is hard to get Primo gems, and if you can‚Äôt afford spending money on a game, it‚Äôs pretty hard to get good characters and weapons from the Gacha. I feel like this game should include more ways of getting Primo gems. Another thing I don‚Äôt like about this game is that if you have played for a long time and finished most of the quests, explored a lot, and leveled up a lot, then you have nothing to do. The only thing you can really do is to wait for a new update, play with friends, and help other people with stuff in Co-Op. But this game is a really good game and I'm looking forward to more.
title: Amazing, needing changes

review:
now, don‚Äôt get me wrong, i LOVE genshin. the scenery, LEGENDARY, SPECTACULAR, FLAMBOYANT!!! chefs kiss to be exact. the action and battle graphics : YES! YES AND YES! The character designing and settings? 10/10. üôå they‚Äôre extremely unique. THE PLOTLINE? GOD YES. THE LORE?????? YOU DONT UNDERSTAND HOW LIFE CHANGING IT IS. it is F2P (free to play) friendly of course, if you really get into it. it‚Äôs just that playing genshin is like taking a big risk. genshin requires quite a lot of space on pc , mobile, etc. that is not the problem. genshin impact is one of those games in which you seem to consider ‚Äúgambling‚Äù but for strengths. it‚Äôs an action but also a luck game, it requires being able to understand numbers and certain terms. also don‚Äôt explode your computer just to play this game üòÄ it happens more often than you‚Äôd think. On the bright side, there are GREAT social and interactive events in which you can be in co-op or multiplayer and interact with other players. 
also, careful with the fandom, it‚Äôs got different sides.
 either way, hoyoverse has come a long way, I‚Äôve been playing genshin since 1.3, now it‚Äôs come to 2.6, in just a short span of time, it‚Äôs began to increase WIDELY in popularity. good job, hoyoverse.
title: playing genshin is the best and worst thing that‚Äôs happened to me.

review: A great game that seems to be easily able to expand on content over time. The combat is extremely fun and dynamic. Finding gear for your character is random, but with it comes a great feeling when you finally get the one you want. The world is gorgeous and filled up with things to grab/fight! I give the game 4 stars because the resin/primogem system rewards you with a ton of items at the start, but takes that level of reward away over time like a shady drug dealer. The rates for characters are awful given the price point for a shot at them, especially after you‚Äôve spent money on the one time bonus gems packs. The more they add characters, the less likely you get the one that would fit perfectly in your team so that leaves me worried about the future of the game. I‚Äôm also going to be keeping a close eye on balance in the game. I want my money spent now on the game to be just as worth it if I had saved it till next year. Please value our spending on your game. I see myself having a lot more fun with the game and look forward to challenging content in the future. PLEASE INCREASE G√ÇCHA RATES AND RESIN CAP/RECHARGE. Thank you <3
title: A couple changes and it‚Äôs a must play

review:
I have been playing this game since it came out and it has been one of the most amazing games I have played. The graphics look so good ( like you would see in anime) and you get to explore new cities, get characters ( that look so cool), began this journey where your trying to find your twin sibling ( you can choose the brother or the sister).
I was trying to find a fun and exciting game and I found out about this which I‚Äôm glad I did. When I started playing this game it was going good but I started having problems where when I have to level up my character I have to find things before I level them up ( defeating a cube, a big flower plant, ruin guards). When I try to defeat them I can‚Äôt because they would be on a higher level and I try different strategies to defeat them ( and do them over again) and I watch videos to see what other people do but when I try them it doesn‚Äôt work. This also happens when I‚Äôm trying to level up my rank ( I‚Äôm currently rank 35 and I have been stuck on it for a few months and I can‚Äôt defeat the domains) Can you please try to make the fighting easier? that would help out a lot. I still love this game thank you for making it.
title: I love this game soo much but‚Ä¶

review: I‚Äôve seen this game pop up quite a few times on my ads and out of curiosity gave it a go, when you run into anime games it‚Äôs common to have low expectations along with the common negative aspects of 3D Anime, but this game absolutely blew me away, the characters are loveable, goofy, and fun to interact with, the gameplay mechanics are simple yet doesn‚Äôt hand feed you the playthrough. The world building is absolutely astounding, The fact you can go to every single NPC and each one have their own stories, their own lives and original dialogue makes this world that much more immersive, I can‚Äôt imagine how much effort this team must have put into that alone. The soundtrack is beautiful, the graphics are simple yet fun and overall it is a very addictive game, the only reason I give it 4/5 would be the crashing and bugs, it is still a very /very/ new game and I presume they will be fixed in the future but it is extremely frustrating when you have such a wonderful world ready to play and it crashes every two minutes, with this you just have to be patient but if I could change anything in this game I would try to fix the crash bugs, But overall a very fun and immersive game!
title: A World building masterpiece
Amazing game! Just some things.

review: Genshin Impact is by far one of the best games I have EVER played. There‚Äôs a few minor things here and there that I would request have some work put into them such as making traveling around the world of Teyvat a bit less boring for players after hitting a certain AR, putting in an option that allows players to go back and watch all of the cutscenes including the ones from special events that they may have missed out on because of being too low level, or maybe even giving us some more original resin and freemogems to farm domains and bosses and blossoms with? Like I‚Äôve said before, this game is beautiful and amazing and absolutely my favorite game to play right now, but it‚Äôs starting to drag and get boring and I‚Äôm stuck at AR 50 because it takes forever to get your levels up once you get past AR 30-35+ and unless you spend hours upon hours upon days building almost every character you have, the ascension quests are basically impossible to beat. Hopefully MiHoyo will listen to their players‚Äô requests and pleas and somehow make at least a few of the many requests possible ü•∞ü•∞‚ù§Ô∏èü§ó
title: One of the best games I‚Äôve ever played!!

review: I‚Äôve been playing genshin for a while after finally logging in via Apple login, and I must say, I am very happy with the game! I actually managed to get some pretty good characters via wishing. I just wish that some of the bosses in the domains, such as an electro hypostasis for the AR ascension quest 1, had longer time to beat the revival crystals! I find it frustrating because the boss would be at about 100 hp, and then I have to scramble around to beat the revival crystals. Sigh! Though, I do enjoy raging over them and trying my hardest. ‚ù§Ô∏è With my hyperbloom-based team, it‚Äôs easier to heal and do damage without taking myself, though some domains prefer your traveler to use different elements for them. ‚ù§Ô∏è Ciao! - Your favorite fandom-lover, Xire/Xeno/or my Genshin nickname üß∏ also, Xiao‚Äôs rerun is September 27,correct? I‚Äôll try to save for him or Venti ~ <3 ALSO AJAIAKKAJSKAA Fontaine update is deadly- 12 GB- Istg I use a mobile Apple iPad pls - Eee I got Scaramouche after a long time, tho I wish we could have like events to get 5 stars for free, like Xiao could be obtainable for doing this kind of quest, like using his trial character to kill this many enemies in this amount of time maybe 6 times to get him? Just a thought, bye, Ty
title: Opinions~ ‚ù§Ô∏è

review: Ok.. so we all know there is some cons to every pro in gaming. Well it‚Äôs basically a Japanese gotcha game. You don‚Äôt have to throw money at it but you can be rewarded for everything in the game which is slower. But the real reason for this review is the combat.. it‚Äôs amazing! Four party members to rotate in combat and different elements to play mix and match with. You can go for pyro-electro for explosions for massive AOE damage. There is an element to every character and they transfer to the next chosen character in battle. The targeting is pretty spot on to. Most games have this weird tap to cycle target but this one doesn‚Äôt. It lets you do everything on your own. The biggest con that this game has to begin with is grouping with your friends. The game doesn‚Äôt allow you to group till adventure level 15 (not character level 15). When you are able to get with your friends man it is so much fun cause the mix and match of elements is pretty crazy for the amount of things going on in the background. I give this game an honest 8/10.. The reason for is the gotcha system to pay to get ahead is a gimmick.. but other than that it‚Äôs super fun and would highly recommend to anyone and it‚Äôs free to play.
title: The combat is awesome!

review: Genshin Impact is a fantastic game.  From the get go, its absolutely beautiful and the attention to detail in each and every frame and background is astounding.  The story is captivating and every quest is interesting and not boring at all.  It definitely is a game that will keep you wanting to play more and more.  The way that the game changes weather and time is also beautiful as well.  I‚Äôve watched sunrises, sunsets, battled in the rain, fought numerous amounts of monsters, all within a MOBILE game.  The game is such an amazing mobile game that it feels like you‚Äôre playing on an actual console (or on the computer).  Paimon is definitely the most annoying character out there and RNG is the worst way to try and get characters ever because I have terrible luck BUT EVEN SO, the game is so much fun to play you will have trouble putting it down.  Each character also has unique abilities and there is so much to learn in this game.  Definitely would recommend and I‚Äôve had the most fun playing this game over all other games that I have ever played on a mobile phone.  Hands down, if I could give it 10/5 stars, I would. (But please, make Paimon less annoying, please).
title: So good it might be ruining my life

review: It‚Äôs like the love child of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, Monster Hunter, Fire Emblem and Skyrim! Although the game has 4 player coop it is very much a solo experience. It plays like an actual game you would buy for the Nintendo Switch (of which is coming later). There is also a PC version which I recommend the most because it feels the most native, like it was made for it originally. It supports controller too! The game is cross platform save, meaning you can play with someone whose on their phone even if you‚Äôre on pc and even if you switch to a phone yourself ‚Äî you‚Äôll still have your save! There is voice acting for Chinese (The original I think? The only one to have the protagonist‚Äôs voice over in his profile‚Äôs story section), English (it‚Äôs grown on me and I really like some of the characters voices), Japanese (this is the most popular because of anime), and Korean (I also really like this one!). You can choose the female twin (Lumine) or the male twin (Aether) at the beginning, there is no difference except personal choice. I chose Aether because he reminded me of Link. I highly recommend Genshin Impact. You seriously won‚Äôt regret trying this game!
title: It‚Äôs so good!

review:
The game is a gorgeous world with plenty of explorations to make. I have plundered quite some time into the game over the past few days since launch. It is absolutely interesting and fun to play. However, there are some design I, as a player, would like some change on. 
First, about monetization, it is absolutely fine to expect making a lot of money from this game consider the development cost and everything. However, one thing this game does not differ from many other Chinese games is a hard effort cap in gaining characters. I have played effortlessly on gaining in-game currencies but I would say it at maximum gives one draw each hour of gameplay. With a 0.6% chance, you barely gain any 5 star characters by only playing. Before the game launches, I was honestly expecting to see more monetization options on skins and other customizations, instead of on characters.
Second, about protagonist gameplay, personally I would like the protagonist ‚Äútraveler‚Äù to have more weapon options, the ability to wield two elements at the same time, and cross-element skills.
Third, vehicle, bike, horse, or anything. :)
Fourth, about map improvement, currently the in-game map does not display any progression on one time collections or any collection.
title: General thoughts

review: Genshin Impact draws you in like no other game. Since day one I have been blown away by the graphics the story and the level of detail put into this game. Not only are the graphics stunning the characters and their back stories are as well. There has been a ton of thought put into this game from the smallest blade of grass to the highest mountain top, everything you look at is detail oriented. This game is free to play, and they do not disappoint their players either. With thousands of quests and many different ways to earn in game currency they offer also a five dollar package that also gives you currency. I am not want to normally spend endgame, however, this game deserves every single penny that I spend on it. From the five star and 4 star characters to the Packages you can buy to upgrade them this game gives you everything that you ask for anymore. If I could give this app 10 stars I would I have never been so satisfied with a game in my whole entire life since the final fantasy series. Thank you for all that you guys do and I cannot wait for the next available character banner. I‚Äôm saving up those primogens! ‚ù§Ô∏è
