title: Hi suggesting.

review: People are very disappointed with what‚Äôs going on. Us Genshin players feel like we‚Äôre being ignored by the company. I‚Äôve spent three years of my life and who knows amounts of money. Yet we have to fight with Hoyoverse to get any quality of life features that we desperately need. Meanwhile HSR comes along and is giving out free 10 pulls every single patch. It wins an award at the video game awards, and then gives its players a free five star character that‚Äôs OP. Meanwhile when Genshin wins same exact award, we don‚Äôt even get a 10 pull. People are even starting to boycott the game! Typically the quality of life features that are added to the game are just to help new players, not us players who have been here from the beginning. I‚Äôve been playing the game since September 2020. I‚Äôve seen people come and go yet I have stayed. All I‚Äôm asking for is better treatment from Hoyoverse. It seems as if HSR players are treated as gods or kings, whereas we Genshin players are treated as peasants or beggars. (Maybe even as livestock) The lead producer (Cia) needs to either start giving us the same type of rewards as David. (HSR‚Äôs lead producer) Or he needs to step down, and let David take over the position. At the bare minimum, we need to get a free pull every single version\patch just like HSR. (Even that‚Äôs not completely fair, considering they have a better pity system than Genshin.)
title: Things need to change. NOW!!!

review: I have been playing this game for a very long time and have spent a decent amount of money to not only support the game but also the developers. Throughout the game you can collect a secondary currency known as primogems and the amount you get is negligible. It takes hundreds of chests to just get one 10 summon. And they are a one time only find. The events do not give you enough to even guarantee you get a 5 star in general let alone the actual banner character itself. Even during their lantern rite festival which is meant to be a time of thanks for the support. We are given a single 10 pull. And they really stuck it when they offered the Chinese players 3 intertwined fates (the currency used to summon characters) bare in mind you need 90 to guarantee a 5 star character 50% of which can get you the banner character. The team behind this game does not care about community feedback let alone respects or appreciates the players. 10 pulls for global. And an additional 3 for the Chinese players is just ridiculous and honestly disrespectful. If they were to just say 10 summons and quality of life changes and end game. That would have been an insane thing to give. But I highly doubt they are going to bother. I‚Äôm still going to play the game but I will not be spending like I have until changes are made.
title: Game refuses to respect players time and money

review: The games great, I played it on my moms ipad for a few decent moments and the animation was smooth, no lag. Im amazed that there can be a mobile game this good, but Im disappointed that on the ipad I played on, brand new by the way, without anything on it, deleted all photos and all other games, I was still kicked out every 5-10 minutes. I couldnt actually gain progress because it wouldnt save the things i did in simply 5 minutes, which is reasonable, but I dont think thats a problem I should have to worry about. Then, I tried to play on my iphone 7 to find it doesnt show water or sky, its black, and you can only see a half a chunk away. Of course, this is only for iphone 8s or lower, as it says in the game description. My problem with that is I dont understand why that would happen?? Iphone 7 or 6 is a phone i see a lot of people owning so its disappointing that it means a lot of iphone users cant play. I then tried it on my computer, and my moms computer, and yet again can only be in for a few seconds and get kicked out of the game almost as soon as it loads up. Genshin is amazing yes, but Im sad I have to save up for an entirely new computer to play it. Please fix these flaws.
title: I wish it worked for more IOS platforms

review: Mihoyo, Genshin Impact is a great game. So great, that instead of curtains, I have a picture of Venti hanging over my window. But in order to convince my parents to pay for a five star every few weeks I have to make an entire slideshow trying to convince them they‚Äôre not wasting their money, you might say ‚Äúoh, just grind primogems, it‚Äôs not that hard‚Äù but taking honors classes, being in NJHS, playing 3 sports, and learning flute and guitar, doesn‚Äôt leave much time to grind, I have a friend who has nothing but free time, and we spend very similar amounts of money even though he plays much more than I do, every 5 star has cost us between 100 and 200 dollars. I hqve every 5 star besides Albedo and Mona, he has every 5 star besides Ganyu and Diluc. Not to mention with all the money you have to get from these insane prices, why does the game still crash every 10 minutes on iPad, I would play on my computer, but that‚Äôs even worse since the graphics, even at their lowest setting give my computer the equivalent of a seizure, making archery impossible, and causing the game to freeze when using Diluc‚Äôs alt. I find these things to be very annoying and hope they will be fixed in the future, thank you for reading until the end, have a good day/night!
title: Hear me out.
developerResponse: {'id': 21425790, 'body': 'Sorry to hear you did not like our game.\nIf you have any suggestions you can contact our CS team via Genshin_CS@mihoyo.com.', 'modified': '2021-03-03T13:39:12Z'}

review:
Has some of the worst pull rates I‚Äôve ever seen in a gacha. You can spend $450 on genesis crystals and still not get the character you want. The sad part is people are spending thousands of dollars to get these characters and the developers know the low rates bring profits. They‚Äôve figured out that people will pay massive amounts of cash to win, even if the rates are nearly impossible. People will literally spend themselves into debt to get these characters. Developers know this and take full advantage of it. 

The developers constantly ignore player feedback and don‚Äôt care what anyone thinks. Imagine paying a PS5 for each 5* character you want. That‚Äôs how much people shell out per character. It should be illegal to take advantage of people this way, but then again, if someone‚Äôs dumb enough to pay that much it‚Äôs hard to feel bad for them. All I will say is don‚Äôt get sucked into the trap, people. Stay away. 

If you ARE going to play this, I strongly recommend spending absolutely nothing. You should still be able to clear most of the game and not go broke in the process. Seriously, don‚Äôt spend a single dollar. It won‚Äôt get you anything anyway. Not with an 0.6% pull chance. The game itself could have been good, but the predatory design is wrong and not something I can support. For me, it‚Äôs too hard to enjoy the game knowing how greedy this company is.
title: Cash grab scheme

review: as a kid, I grew up with beloved games, like dark cloud, two, Final Fantasy nine, Chrono, Cross, Chrono, trigger and more. I have found very few modern games that are like those. And even less on mobile. Genshin Impact is different. Genshin Impact reminds me of those games, but with a little modern twist to it. it is charming, the world is beautiful to explore and looks and plays a lot like games from level five like dark cloud two. The characters are charming like in square next games. And though the game has some really really big issues when it comes to storytelling like how way too much story is dumped on the player at the beginning of the game in such a bad way that it literally made me bored just sitting there hearing about how this tiny fairy child thing and the main character met. But outside of that this game is absolutely amazing. I love the focus on exploring like Zelda games and and yet a balance between the exploration and the story with characters that seem to have backgrounds to explore and personalities to explore. All in all this is a game worth playing for anyone who enjoys a game and wants to explore the world of that game.
title: I come from jrpg

review: Genshin Impact is probably one of the best games I ever played and there‚Äôs so many reasons why. The game has very good scenery, multiple things to do, and so much more. There‚Äôs a whole lot to explore, so many characters to wish for, lots of quests to do, you‚Äôll just stay busy on this game. Not only will it keep you busy, but you‚Äôll also have a lot of fun during that time while playing. The game has nice storylines, it‚Äôs easy to learn how to play, and its updated often. I love the fact I can spend my money on this game because it‚Äôs not a waste. One thing I hate about this game though, is it takes up so much space and I have to basically delete my whole phone for it. Not only that, but I also don‚Äôt like the updates much because I had recently bought the 5 dollar pack for 300 genesis crystals and 90 primos every 30 days, and I had about 20 days left. Now the new update has came, and I don‚Äôt have enough storage to get the new update. I think the creator should make the game to where it doesn‚Äôt take up so much space, overall the problem I have, the game is amazing and I would recommend it.
title: Genshin Impact

review: Such a love hate relationship with this game. Early game wonder and excitement in the huge world along with the addictive combat mechanics made this an amazing experience. This is quickly soured by the way main gameplay elements are locked behind grind walls / paywalls in the form of limited characters. I don‚Äôt think this is necessarily a abs thing, because it makes every players experience somewhat unique and makes getting a specific character / weapon SUPER exciting and satisfying, so much so that it can lead gambling / addictive tendencies. However, as someone who made it well into the endgame, the late game grind / gameplay balance is just not worth it. A full patch (6 weeks or so) of daily grinding / mediocre story content and full participation in the mediocre events is very mentally taxing, all for a small chance to get the next new character on the next banner (which is where most of the new gameplay / fun comes from). This is coming from someone who did buy the battle pass and welkin blessing, which made the wait slightly more rewarding. While I don‚Äôt regret spending the money I did, I find the end game experience pretty disappointing, and it did not seem worth the enormous grind.
title: Love Hate

review: Granted, the game is fun. But after spending hundreds of dollars and playing for hours, something happened to my account. Not sure what, but the game was reset on my iPhone and all of my progress was gone. No big deal, stuff happens, so I reached out to customer support. After numerous messages explaining what happened, providing all information they asked for and all proof of in-app purchases, I got a message saying they fixed my problem and my account was recovered!! I was so excited, I logged in right away. To see the starting cinematic again. And be confronted with a level one character and no in-app purchases. So I repeated the process, this time with a bit more frustration but hey, things happen. Same deal. They recovered my account!!!!‚Ä¶.. which consists now of a level one character and nothing else. No matter how many times I provided them with pictures, data, proof of purchase, they just claimed they did it, gave themselves a pat on the back, and then I was left with a steaming pile of nothing. So I quit. There are games that are just as good and treat their player base the way they should be treated. To those who are going to play despite this review, just make sure to take screenshots every 5 seconds and expect nothing if your account ever encounters something like mine. Good luck.
title: If I could give zero stars for customer service, I would

review: First, let me just say this game is absolutely fantastic and fun to play...for a week or so. Once you hit around Adventure Rank 30 you will become gated so hard by the resin (energy) system that you can only play for 30-60min a day with meaningful progression. Resin refreshes at a rate of 1/8min so you can regenerate 180 resin per day. All content that you need to grind (Mora [in game currency], character exp, weapon enhancement mats, skill enhancement books, world bosses, weekly bosses, equipment dungeons, etc) costs 20-60 resin each! Be careful spending money in this game because they have cleverly hidden this restriction since you can play an unlimited amount through exploring the map in the early game. It will not become apparent how painfully limiting this energy system is until you have finished the current main storyline (AR30). If you are an extremely casual player who can only play an hour a day, then yes you will be able to enjoy the game for quite some time. But if you are gamer that loves to progress as much as possible and level up all your characters then you will hit a brick wall. Even if you spend money to refresh your resin, your money will only net you a few extra minutes of playtime. One star until the devs fix their energy system and actually allow people to play their game without having to spend hundreds of $$$. Such a disappointment because this is one the best games on mobile
title: Great game but MAJOR FLAW

review: I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact for about a year now and the day I downloaded this game I fell in love with it. The graphics are amazingly beautiful, the story line is great, the characters are super unique, there is a huge open world to explore, and tons of monsters to fight. In the beginning leveling up was easy but now in the later game becomes a lot trickier to get the materials to level up your characters. So if you don‚Äôt like grinding and fighting bosses over and over again maybe don‚Äôt download it. But I‚Äôm okay with that sort of thing, but another aspect of this game that I love is the huge open world because I love exploring. The movement options are very open and I loved that you eventually got to explore underwater. The elemental reactions are very useful and it was so fun wishing for better characters to upgrade my team. One thing I do wish this game could add is the ability to take away the levels of a character and add the levels onto a different character so I didn‚Äôt have to grind so much to find chests. Overall this is a great game for you if you love exploring, fighting bosses, and getting new characters!
title: Amazing!

review: Good game, good graphics, there‚Äôs better management for storage, deep lore. Combat is amazing and you can tell a lot of love has been placed into this game, very small details aren‚Äôt overlooked :) . Although you are limited on how much you can farm, and artifact drops are hard to get your ideal artifact. However there are some big differences when you compare it to another game created by same company. Not to mention anniversary rewards are so little. Farming primogems in this game is very time consuming and not that easy, even as end game player. It‚Äôs very easy to get burn out on this game, and there is no ‚Äúend game‚Äù. Once you‚Äôre at the end, you wait until they update next storyline or do the daily events, farm, log off. Some achievements in my opinion are ridiculous, or just some side quests in general. But don‚Äôt let this discourage you to play, because when you start and enter a whole new world. It‚Äôll be a time where you would be immersed and having fun exploring :) . I do think they should touch on and edit the beginning of game quest as it‚Äôs rather buggy. And something similar to forgotten hall in hsr, as that was fun.
title: Great game

review:
HIIIII~! My name is Emma, I just recently started play Genshin about a month ago. I was at a really dark spot in my life, and a lot of my friends knew that I had the heart of adventure, and I really just overall needed a free place to just be myself and experience, different world buildings, in overall, just help my mental state. After downloading this app, I absolutely could NOT put it down! I absolutely fell in love with the two main characters that override the Lore. we are all travelers, and I believe every single one of us is unique in our own simple way, this game is really amazing and not only does it bring out the best in people, but it also helps people who go through day-to-day problems! Genshin is by far one of the most beautiful and unique experiences I have ever had in a game before, I truly believe that this game needs to be spread worldwide and needs to be known for the quality of it. I believe the workers behind this game deserve anything in life. And if it wasn‚Äôt for them making this game then I don‚Äôt know what that dark time in my life would‚Äôve been. 

Thank you, Gen, and stay safe, travelers! üíö
title: ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ ‚òÖ

review: I‚Äôve had Genshin impact for a few months now and I absolutely love it however some quests and commissions plus character trials are too difficult. For example the quests where I‚Äôm timed are way too hard I almost always fail and can‚Äôt complete them on time. I also don‚Äôt understand what‚Äôs the point of doing commissions if they reset every 4 hours. I keep getting the same ones over and over again and it‚Äôs really frustrating because I know I‚Äôve already done them. Some of those are also timed so that makes them even more difficult and frustrating. I‚Äôm having a hard time leveling up my characters too because I don‚Äôt have enough mora to level them up because I‚Äôm not able to complete my quest and commissions which makes it hard to complete quests and commissions that aren‚Äôt timed as well as character trials. I‚Äôd really appreciate it if the developer or developers of Genshin impact read my review and looked into these issues I‚Äôm having and fixed them or at least gave me some tips on how I can do them without having as much issues as I‚Äôm having now, please and thank you!
title: A few concerns

review: This is probably one of the best games I‚Äôve played period and the fact it‚Äôs available on iOS is AWESOME. I originally started playing on my boyfriends phone which the game runs so smoothly on, but when I wanted to play it myself on my phone it crashes about 14 times within a hour in which my progress is not saved and sometimes when I load back in my character has plummeted to their death from gliding. If I am running through Liyue if I don‚Äôt wait the respective 15 seconds for the next 3 blocks to load I will also fall through the map (I.e at any bridge or uneven pathway) and end up dying or having to reset the game. Also during any ACTUAL cutscene it struggles and will freeze and the audio gets choppy and glitches out so I don‚Äôt get to see it at all, all the while my phone so hot when I am playing for longer than half an hour my phone will get almost unbearably hot. It would be pretty cool if The developers could create a low graphic mode to attempt a fix at the problem, I‚Äôm not tech savvy but I will be playing this game for a while and it would be so convenient if my game didn‚Äôt crash. Overall it is a great game and it‚Äôs worth it‚Äôs salt. But apparently my iPhone 9 doesn‚Äôt seem to be able to handle it.
title: I love this game

review: This game is easily the best one I have ever played, especially since it‚Äôs able to be played on mobile. I literally got a new phone to play it. The graphics and music are absolutely stunning. I will listen to the soundtracks on Apple Music because I love them so much. Whether you are a free-to-play player, or you spend money on it, you can do anything. Each boss has its own challenge to it and it has never failed to amaze me. There isn‚Äôt one thing in the game to complain about. I‚Äôve fallen in love with every single character they‚Äôve released and I know I‚Äôll love all the ones they continue to make. They constantly add new and exciting quests and challenges every single update, each one better than the last. Each character and quest has such good background and lore behind them. Everything is so well written and thought out. The voice actors are also incredible no matter what language. If you have never played, you are missing out on so much. I cant even explain how addicting and fun this game truly is. Please give it a shot, I know you never be able to put it down after you do.
title: Gambling addiction at its best

review: I don‚Äôt know if this is intended but Mona‚Äôs dodge initially goes towards the enemy instead of the direction I‚Äôm trying to go. Whenever I use her ult the joystick disappears and I have to lift my finger and hold down to move again. This is REALLY annoying especially when I‚Äôm in a sticky situation where I have to back up that very second after casting the ult but I have to take that second to reactivate the joystick. Mona‚Äôs recovery takes longer than other characters...why? I‚Äôve actually tested this in the stone chamber domain. Once the Cryo mages dance (summons ice shards that orbits the mage) I constantly get knocked around until I‚Äôm out of the range, meanwhile when I use someone like chunyun, after the first knock up, he recovers pretty quickly (just like everyone else except Mona) and can dodge the second knock up. Next, I want to talk about her ‚Äúmirror reflection of doom‚Äù. This ability is weird with ranged enemies. Let‚Äôs say I activate this skill and it‚Äôs sitting between me and the ranged enemy, sometimes they redirect to the taunt but most of they shoot past the taunt and target me. If a solution can be made for the issues I‚Äôve explained, it‚Äôll make mine and probably other‚Äôs experience more enjoyable!
title: Mona problems

review: For an open world game, the quality, character designs, music, and word setting is pretty good. I like it alot, and play for a few hours or less, so I have plenty of game content to go through.  However, my main problem is storage. While, I have plenty of it to play on my tablet, it‚Äôs a pain to backup on the cloud. My internet speed is fast, but it still takes too long that I decided to pass. I‚Äôll play the game still, but no backup on the cloud, for now. Gacha rates could be better. There should be an option to earn characters and weapons through quests (King‚Äôs Raid style), beside gacha. This would make the game player friendly since more options are better to pleased players. Storage problem gives me mixed feelings to get into any future games by this company. While, Honkai: Star Rail looks beautiful and fun, I‚Äôm hesitated to try it as well. Some may like this game on mobile, but while playing a bit, Genshin Impact feels it meant to be on consoles, PC, and physical copies more. It would be much easier to deal with, while adding new events. If the game ever comes on Switch, I would like to play it there more than mobile though.
title: Like the game, but too much storage!!

title: OML I CANT EVENNNNN

review: Genshin Impact is one of my all time favorite games. It‚Äôs just the right mix of intense, fun, and difficult, and it makes me just went to keep coming back for more. The Wish stars in this game are even, too. Unlike other games, there is a good chance you will get something decent from every pull of a wish. I‚Äôve already gotten 2 characters and I‚Äôve only been playing for 1 1/2 months. The map and teleport waypoints are useful, because some other games make you walk or drive everywhere. I like how there are random camps of the enemy‚Äôs to keep battling and raising your points to level up. With brings me to the Adventures Guide. You get all sorts of rewards when you level up, and you can use some of those items to upgrade your weapon, or even get some Wishes. To me, there are no problems with the game. It does not get repetitive at all for me. There are no issues with the gameplay, and the game is always smooth and the graphics are amazing. There was a good amount of storyline at the beginning of the game and that storyline is starting to slack off, but I like the gameplay still beyond belief.

title: Genshin is a very good game

review: I‚Äôve started to play this game a year ago, and left to the staggering amount of storage and data it took. Now, rejoining back to the game, I can see so many aspects that were overhyped and simply awful. First, you would believe that with how fast it takes to download the app, you *wouldn't* be greeted a massive data installation. The data took over half an hour to install. Second, I would find it a lot more convenient for transportation besides waypoints, because some quests in the game would take an ungodly amount of time. Third, the gacha system is way too time consuming to grind for a new character, let alone an ensemble of characters that the game has. Currently, I‚Äôm on Eagle Pass in the game, and the climbing system broke to a point where I can‚Äôt reach the next level. I can‚Äôt tell if it‚Äôs a puzzle, but suspecting the point to climb to get to the next level, I‚Äôve tried every place to climb, and it‚Äôs absolutely unreachable. The tasks will take hours to complete, and even then, if you stop midway through a cutscene, you‚Äôll have to rewatch the entire cutscene AGAIN. The game is full of unnecessary time wasters, and I definitely wouldn‚Äôt recommend the game to people who just want to quickly sit down and play a good RPG.
title: An overrated mess.

review:
So! I play this a good bit. Great game! But the gacha part of this game is never in your favor.
Everyone remember Hu Tao‚Äôs rerun? Well! I saved up to 12,800 primogems to wish for Hu Tao do the math. 80 wishes and I didn‚Äôt obtain Hu Tao. I got Ganyu in her rerun after I paid to get the crystals to get primogems! Short answer for how much money I spent to get Ganyu. A LOT. This games odds are stacked against you. From leveling to getting new characters. If you never use the wish system you are simply stuck with Aether (or Lumine), Amber, Kaeya, and Lisa. Unless the story calls for it. You will NEVER get another character in this game. The game relies on something called relics, weapons, and leveling. Don‚Äôt worry about weapons though! The wish system will pump those out more than character‚Äôs so you‚Äôre good there! But relics? Sorry bub you have to do domains to get good relics to help you in your quest! But‚Ä¶YOU GUESSED IT. That system also relies on RNG to get stuff you actually need to make your characters effective. Game also gets harder the more you get your adventure rank up. So more grinding! As I said without relics or good weapons you may as throw rocks at whatever you‚Äôre fighting. They did a good job with odds of getting characters in Honkai impact idk why the system works the way it does now. Good luck getting yelan. Quick way for developers to make money off you.
title: May the odds never be in your favor!

review: Genshin impact to me is a beautiful game, the gameplay is amazing, all kinds of puzzles and the music is relaxing to me. I played this game since around the time covid started, and it was so fun to me. I still play to this day and I must say, it‚Äôs got many ways to get primogems and with all the events that happen I can farm better and it‚Äôs just a lot of fun I personally think this game is unique. Genshin impact is truly an amazing game to me, all the quests are countless! Though at time I did get stuck on many quests, I still like the game. If your into puzzles this game may just be for you, it has some pretty hard quests. I have gotten stuck on quite the amount of quests. Genshin impacts quests are unique and the different elements are pretty cool, and the character gameplay is unique aswell. I personally love it and yet I still would give it a 5 star. The character designs are so cool and they keep coming! I personally think in my opinion, this game has a lot of memories and it has a great storyline so I would recommend it for a lot of people. For me I say it‚Äôs a 5 star for the gameplay, music, and puzzles.
title: My true opinion on this game.

review: Genshin impact may have given me gambling issues when pulling but this game changed me in a good way though. New events are super fun and very good ways to get free primos which is amazing since high ars have trouble getting primos since they usually done half the quests and explored as a f2p I‚Äôm very happy with the game when I log in I don‚Äôt know what to do first spend resin, artifact farm, boss farm, story quests, or explore I‚Äôm ar 40 and I still think the game is awesome! title: Love the game !

review: I like it. It reminds me of a more simplified version a Final Fantasy. However, it is too difficult to level up, and even when you‚Äôve leveled up, it‚Äôs still very difficult to defeat monsters that are much lower level than you. additionally, there aren‚Äôt that many quests or tasks that help you gain a lot of XP. Each provides very little so it takes a long time to level up. normally games start to become difficult with leveling up around level 50/60. This one starts becoming this way around level 14 or so. The quests become unlocked at various levels, usually spaced a couple of levels apart, which as mentioned it‚Äôs very difficult to level so you may go days in between the actual story quests, that means days of grinding on low level monsters which gets boring very quickly. It‚Äôs also difficult to obtain materials to level up and level up weapons. Good concept, great graphics but without addressing these things I won‚Äôt be continuing to play. It‚Äôs already difficult enough to play games without forking out a bunch of money in game. Makes it hard for true gamers to enjoy games nowadays. Not like before where you pay a flat rate and no in game purchases. I‚Äôd rather have the latter.
title: Room for improvement

review:
I gotta say I was a big Hu Tao main back last year. I loved Genshin back then and would play it every day, every hour. However, I started losing interest because you leaked the entire map of Sumeru, which made me lose all excitement about the map. Honestly, I preferred the Genshin where every update was mostly a mystery, that way I get the thrill. Now that you‚Äôre just exposing everything, it‚Äôs worthless playing if people online are just gonna spoil the game. Since Sumeru released, I lost total interest in the game, I tried going back, but it was boring to know what happens next since it has already been leaked. I can‚Äôt play this game without having a poker face, and I feel like I shouldn‚Äôt even be playing anymore. 
Let‚Äôs just say, I hate Sumeru, and all the characters and storyline. I may be sounding immature for saying that I hate the entire region and everything in it, but I can‚Äôt see myself ever getting excited or happy in that region. The Sumeru leaks, updates, and fandom ruined everything for me about Genshin. It made me lose a part of myself that I will probably never get back.
title: This game got boring, kinda hate it now.

review: I have been playing Genshin Impact for almost 2 years now, and I must say that this is THE BEST game I have ever played. I‚Äôve tried so many other games, and so far this is the only one that‚Äôs stuck around. It is honestly hard to get bored! Sometimes you may lose motivation when farming Primogems to then use to pull for new characters and weapons, but not often will there be a moment when you don‚Äôt want to move forward in the game. I wish that there was a better way for me to say just how much I like this game. Even the frustration from battling bosses and solving puzzles quickly resolves when I get the satisfaction of receiving good rewards. That definitely comes into play the most when farming for artifacts üòñ. It is quite the challenge getting your perfect artifact especially with the resin issue. It will definitely take multiple runs of a domain to find even a decent artifact! But when you finally get the artifact you were looking for, you feel great. I am so grateful to the game developers for their hard work and I am so proud that their game is getting the popularity it deserves! Thank you Hoyoverse!
title: yes

review: This game is simply beautiful, it‚Äôs fun and well written. Aside from the little hell spawn that is Paimon, I love all the characters and find them engaging and well designed. It looks great on ipad and even better on PC (though I‚Äôd love to see it come to MacOS), and while it does look great on PS4 as well, Sony, as always, refuses to play ball so there‚Äôs no cross save available for it. I‚Äôm really enjoying the world so far and am quite intrigued to see how it will open up. So why not 5 stars? As with all gacha games, the method of acquiring new heroes is even more annoying than Paimon. I really enjoy Mihoyo games, they‚Äôre top quality stuff and really entertaining, but as much time as I put into Honkai Impact, I just couldn‚Äôt bring myself to keep playing because it would end up costing upwards of $500 to get the character I was actually looking for. As much as I‚Äôm loving this game, I worry the same will happen. I would gladly pay $60 for this game and $20 for every expansion they added and like $5-10 or whatever for skins if it didn‚Äôt have those god awful random loot mechanics. It‚Äôs a wonderful game, but knowing I‚Äôd likely have to reach into my pockets for it to give me a 5 star hero is going to keep me from giving it a 5 star review.
title: Pretty darn good

review: i can‚Äôt say that i‚Äôm not obsessed with this game: i 100% am. i just think there‚Äôs a lot to be worked on. the boss drops are so stingy it hurts. the amount of primogems/fates you get is so stingy as well. i understand being stingy to a degree; you need to make money one way or another, yes, but making it so you have to grind for months on end if you‚Äôre a free to play player for a what? 90 wishes? i‚Äôve seen people grind for 4 months straight and only get 180 wishes out of that, which yes is good! but if we got a little bit more primogems with specific quests or challenges that would be so much more worth it. like the spiral abyss, 100 primogems per 3 stars is really good and that makes a lot of sense!! but you‚Äôre telling me that i‚Äôm only going to get 100 primogems after getting to Adventure Rank 35? unbelievable. besides how stingy the game is with primogems and loot drops, it‚Äôs utterly amazing. the storyline and characters are great and it‚Äôs definitely addicting! the resin refill time/amount of resin is baffling. it takes a long time to refill your resin (unless you have primogems, but f2p usually don‚Äôt spend them on resin) and you only get 160. that‚Äôs hardly enough to farm for 4 characters ascension materials and talent books.
title: it‚Äôs good, but there‚Äôs somethings they could fix.

title: We will be reunited quests problems?

review:
ive had this game since it released and it is honestly the best game ive ever played(ive played a lot). the story line is really good and theres always twists and turns in it. the voice acting is amazing and full of emotion(not cringey) and i actually grow attached to the characters. it's open world which i love, you can play with friends which i also love, its not p2w at all, and u can take ur time without feeling like u have to catch up. i love building the characters and every aspect of the game. the bosses and enemies aren't overpowering so u wont get stuck somewhere. i honestly didnt think i would like a game where u pull for characters but this game changed my mind. im honestly shocked this game is free. 
i do have an idea that would be cool to see. it would be awesome if you guys could add adventure teams or ‚Äúgroups‚Äù where friend‚Äôs can join or create their own teams and visit each others world and fight together and get rewards for it. even i think that would help keep ppl playing and get more attached to the game if they grew closer with other players and make memories together.
anyways great game i dont see myself quitting anytime soon!
title: BEST GAME EVER NO CAP

review: i was skeptical at first, because most games that look this beautiful are usually false advertisement. But, this game truly is as beautiful as it looks. It is absolutely so fun, and there is so much to do when it comes to both main and side quests. It is an open world type game, so look for hidden gems and chests, too! Just exploring is beautiful and all the stories somehow fit together. Ranking up is fairly easy, but it still can be a bit of a challenge, which is great. You don't want something you can just blow through. They have great in-game shops where you can spend coins you find from just exploring. Hardly would you have to ever actually use real currency to play or profess, which in itself is amazing! The voice overs and the characters you can both earn, and win through Wishes are so great, and some of them are so adorable lol. I've already found quite a few I favor. This game is great to pass time and I highly recommend it simply because it's relaxing, yet has a lot of combat, exploration and just all around goofy fun, too. It's free, so it wouldn't hurt for anyone to just give it a try. You'll fall in love, trust me. <3
title: It's actually quite amazing, really.

review: Ok so I want to start off by saying I started playing when the game first came out and I‚Äôve only been consistently and pleasantly surprised and impressed with this game. As the game progresses it only gets better and better, from the start I was shocked at the amount of detail in the story and the smooth gameplay, the characters are all unique and the voice acting for all of them is AMAZING!! And the game is constantly updating and there‚Äôs always something new to do and fun challenges are always coming. Though the storage needed is also ever evolving so is the sheer amount of content and game in general. I can‚Äôt express enough in words how much I love this game and I can‚Äôt wait for more as the time passes and new content is available!! Trust me and try it, just trust me you will love it!!

title: Obsessed

review: When I first started Genshin, I enjoyed it very much. The initial grind was rewarding, exploring Teyvat was fun, and the stories of Mondstadt and Liyue were enjoyable and well written. Though once you start to get up into higher AR ranks, grinding for artifacts and weapon materials becomes almost like a chore. When you are lower you seem to have so much to do, but when you‚Äôre higher it‚Äôs like all you can do is sit there and wait a month or two for a ‚Äúnew‚Äù event to come out which has similar mechanics to older, previous events but just with some new story line that is hardly entertaining. Inazuma‚Äôs story pales in comparison to Mond and Liyue. Raiden was a decent villain, but her redemption was rushed and almost felt like they wanted us to sympathize with her just so that they could sell her off to us in the gacha. Also, as a mobile user I sometimes have issues with turning the screen. I am not sure if this is my phone‚Äôs fault or if it‚Äôs the game. But it refuses to turn sometimes when I am fighting. Overall Genshin is a very nice game visually and has wonderful voice acting, also it has many lovable characters to choose from, but after the initial excitement of the game you will start to get a bit bored.
title: Good game, but needs a lot of improvement

review: I am absolutely in love with this game!! The graphics are so smooth and beautiful. The scenery is very well done. The animations are pretty as well. Everything is so beautiful. I wish they could release Genshin Impact on Xbox though but, that‚Äôs the company‚Äôs decision to do so. Anyway, I wish I joined earlier so, I could‚Äôve grinded for primos and characters earlier. My friend joined before the game got big and they have all the 5 stars! I‚Äôm so jealous. Their account got hacked but, thankfully, they got it back and I‚Äôm happy for them! Some people have trouble with using the characters, especially Razor, for some reason but, I‚Äôve never had any problems with it. Maybe because I play mobile. Most people play on PC and sometimes the FPS is really bad. I‚Äôve tried downloading it on my computer before and it downloaded but, as I said before, the FPS is bad but, my computer is pretty old so that also might be the problem. Overall, this game is amazing and I totally recommend it for new players! Just remember you might get a gambling addition when playing XD. Well, new players and old players, have fun!! Love you guys! (platonically of course) <3
title: I love it!!

review: This game is by far the best for a free game, the story is amazing, the graphics are stunning, the music is beautiful, however, my slight complaint with this game is similar to ramƒìn‚Äôs review, yet again another game that is lower quality on mobile. Same thing happens on my gen 7 iPad and I at least think it would be fair to fix the animation cutscenes from stuttering, the rest I can deal with, but the stuttering is just too annoying... don‚Äôt get me wrong, like I said at the beginning, this game is very fun and enjoyable when all is added up, not to mention it‚Äôs ranked as the #1 game (as of January) in the App Store and has a lot of positive reviews. I just wish I don‚Äôt have to have a pc just to get a better experience out of it. Oh yeah, and also I‚Äôm stuck on adventure rank 31 because the COMMISSIONS ARE TOO FRIGGIN HARD, how do you think I‚Äôm supposed to make my way over to someone who ordered food AND defeat 3 Pyro slimes including a mega slime in under 2 minutes?! so to the person who wrote a review with the title ‚Äúyou won‚Äôt regret downloading this game‚Äù I have a statement for you, the only thing I‚Äôm not going to regret is uninstalling this game! How disappointing üòí. I‚Äôm sorry if at this point I‚Äôm sounding like an App Store Karen, but I don‚Äôt see a point in putting this game in the mobile App Store if it‚Äôs not fully playable for MOBILE USERS. Thank you for at least reading
title: Really should start thinking about the little guys

review: A few suggestions‚Ä¶ Hi, it‚Äôs me I commented about this game I believe a month ago. It was brought to my attention that I should suggest a few things to make this game better than it already is, don‚Äôt get me wrong this game is a very well done game and deserves more than a 5 star review believe me, but I‚Äôd like to add a view suggestions. Let‚Äôs start out with #1. When a player gets Co - op mode and everyone seems fine at first but then as your progress your unable to play with other people, and we get very confused then we figure out we must do quests to play Co - Op. The thing is, the second quest bugs everyone on mobile and or who have Lumine. ‚ÄúTrails in Tianqu‚Äù is the quest needed to complete  in order to be able to play with people again, for me it‚Äôs impossible to come Pete this quest because I‚Äôm on mobile and I also have lumine and in order to complete the time challege you need a geo character which I have only noelle. I cannot play until I login on computer which I complained about in my previous review. The second recommendation is to add crouching, crouching can be useful to dove attacks and to plunge onto enemies. This is all I have to say for now. Great game, I love it.

review: I have played this game since it‚Äôs opening basically whenever some sort of glitch happens with my account and I report it nothing is ever compensated for me even when I lose money and my patience! glitches in this game are incredibly common, and most of the time they take my in game currency! Recently,I was skipping through some of the prologue because it was so time lapsing, and all of a sudden the wishing menu came up, and since my fingers were typing so fast, I accidentally clicked the wishing button, but the screen popped out while I was a minute conversation with another character, and I could still hear the speech in the background. in this game if you make a certain amount of wishes, you get a character and I have been saving for a long time to save up for an upcoming character. I was incredibly close to my pity, and since I made this wish I lost my pity and my chances of getting this character since I‚Äôve been saving for so long. I do not recommend playing this game if you‚Äôre gonna spend money on it!
title: Upset and the team doesn‚Äôt help

review: This game is really fun! There are lots of things to do in the game. I love the scenery and the playstyle of various characters. There are a few problems though, grinding primogems is hard late game where there are not lots of quests to do. You end up spending hours to grind a few hundred primogems. It is hard to grind without feeling tempted to spend money. The female characters outfits are almost always way too revealing, and I think you can make a good looking outfit without revealing clothes. I would also like more dark characters, it would make dark skinned people feel more respected. There is no one of African descent as a playable character yet there are characters of every other racial/ethnic group. Most of the time the suggestions to make the game better are ignored and some people start to quit. If Mihoyo listened to the community, they would gain more players. Overall, the game itself is fun and interesting and keeps me occupied for a long time, if Mihoyo listened to our feedback, they would get more players to join and would get people to play the game while keeping old players at the same time.
title: Very great game!

review:
1. The render distance could be fixed, for example over at Dragonspine the mountains look completely rendered and high quality and keep in mind they are way over a mile from you sometimes but in the kingdom of Monsdadt you could be less then a mile and it looks like a Ps1 game
2. The characters, the characters when you are playing them are very high quality but when your talking to them through dialogue there is no details the cloths are basically painted on there skin but when you are in a normal fight your characters, your teammates characters and the monster are perfectly detailed so that does bug me a lot
3. The game is hard to actually make look good without constant crashing. The game when you have it in high quality settings is rlly good but at the same time you open your wishes and bam crash which greatly annoys me. It would be nice if you could add a feature where you could see what settings would cause your games more lag so that way you can make your game look good with more control.
That‚Äôs about it the rest of the game is pretty good and I enjoy the game besides those issues
Great job Mihoyo
title: Over all the game is good but some issues

review: I‚Äôve heard a lot of bad comments about ghenshin impact and the comments I here specifically are:1  ‚Äúit‚Äôs a paid to win game‚Äù or 2 ‚Äúthe characters that are five stars/ the newer characters are way to strong. it‚Äôs frankly not true,  for starters yes, you can trade in money for primogems and outfits but you can‚Äôt defeat the game, and their is only and chance of getting the characters you pine for. they do this in every game. Give you a opportunity or option. you don‚Äôt even haft to use money it‚Äôs a game where they give you free primogems monthly so you have enough to draw characters and events so everyone has a chance to get some from playing the actual game. secondly  the reason people call certain characters 5 star is because if used rightly they can become a main in your team and are a not easily obtainable character. title: Why I truly believe Ghenshin impact is a good game

review:
When I say non-gamer, I mean the last time I played an RPG was On a game boy advance or PS2. Obviously you can still use those systems now, but technology has allowed for games to develop far more than what I‚Äôm used to. That being said, as much as I find these sorts of games to be interesting to play, the interface is unfamiliar, the stories are elaborate and the game as a whole just feels overwhelming to play. NOT Genshin Impact. 

My entire time of playing this game I‚Äôve thought how easily accessible it is to people who normally don‚Äôt play these types of games. The graphics are amazing, the music is relaxing, the story is engaging and everything is easy to follow! The beauty of being able to play across platforms makes it THAT much easier to fall into the depths of this game. I‚Äôve missed my stop on the bus going home twice within the first week of playing because it was so addicting. 

Any person who plays games or RPGs might probably say that there are many games that are like that once you give them the chance. And there probably are, I‚Äôm in no position to say. BUT I will say if you wana try to get into RPGs, Genshin Impact is a wonderful place to begin.

And all of the npc‚Äôs in the trailer for sumeru are also paper color. And from the‚Ä¶. (if you know you know) there is only going to be 2-3 more darker skinned characters in sumeru, despite it being a region based on North Africa and South Asia. I know that not all of the people there are of darker skin. But it goes the other way around as well. Not all of the people there are paper color. review: Hello, I‚Äôm here to deduce your questions about Genshin Impact storage! First, I recommend playing this game on a computer if possible, but if you find this circumstance that you only have a mobile device or are only willing to download on mobile, this is for you. To get straight to the point, I am both a mobile and PC player, but Genshin Impact for ME on mobile takes up 25GB and another 10GB for data that goes into ‚Äúsystem data/other.‚Äù Every update I must have atleast 5-7 GB of free storage. But for this game, If it says you don‚Äôt have enough storage for Regular Genshin which is about 2 GB, I would say have atleast 20GB. You can judge from there about how much space you need. Genshin is sometimes glitchy and it takes 20GB+ but sometimes takes 2GB. Although please don‚Äôt take any of this to be official. Circumstances may vary against others but from what I‚Äôve heard, others also have Genshin eating up their storage just like me. (And FYI, If you also find you‚Äôre battery to be going down to fast when playing genshin, set your graphics to 60 if you‚Äôre highest is 120, and 30 if you‚Äôre highest is 60 FPS, FPS takes battery life the faster the higher.) I hope this helped.
title: Hi, to the people who are having trouble with storage.

review: MiHoYo has done a very poor job in proving they are receptive to the community‚Äôs concerns about a number of things over the last 2-4 months. It goes to show just how little they care about providing an actual enjoyable experience to their user base. The game has seen the release of some of the worst characters to date and when players voices their concerns through the appropriate channels, they intentionally deleted or hid the criticism. The 1-year anniversary is literally one day away and MiHoYo has made zero effort to mark the significance of this day. The player-based helped this game get as popular as it is. They deserve a show of appreciation. It is laughable that MiHoYo thinks they can give players copy-paste rewards from a previous event and consider this sufficient. Not to mention the fact that they didn‚Äôt even bother to send out a notice to all the players to mark the occasion. It goes to show they really do not care. Seriously consider if you‚Äôd like to give your precious time and money to a company that is so tone deaf and out of touch with it‚Äôs target audience. These are incredibly bad choices and accepting them sets a bad precedent about what they can and will get away with in the future if there isn‚Äôt appropriate pushback.
title: Zero communication and willingness to listen to player-base

review:
The character designs, game play, lore, and amazing music and voice acting make Genshin Impact my favorite game thus far. After a full year of playing, I am staying enjoying it every day. The amount of care and effort, and the attention to detail put into this game is insane. I think the pacing of new content is just right, where you don‚Äôt feel overwhelmed with too much all at once but you also aren‚Äôt stagnant and bored for a long time. If you binge the game in one go and play non stop, of course you‚Äôll get burnt out and tired (like any other game). But if you take it at your own pace and enjoy the story and music and scenery, it‚Äôll be a fun time for a long time. 

The music is probably my favorite part of the game. They put so much effort into incorporate regional instruments and culture into each piece of music, and further more the music are performed by live orchestras from each area the regions are inspired by. (The London philharmonic for Mondstat, Shanghai philharmonic for Liyue, and Tokyo philharmonic for Inazuma so far). 

I can‚Äôt wait to see what else will come and foresee playing this game well into the future!
title: My favorite game

review: I really love this game! The graphics are amazing, the battles are fun, and the voice acting is really nice to listen to. However, this game also has a few problems. One of them is the immense crashing. Every 5-15 minutes, the game crashes and it's getting really annoying. If it helps, sometimes I see red or green lines on the buildings before the game crashes. Another problem is the battery usage. Only this game drains too much of my battery and sometimes my iPad starts overheating. I've checked the other apps ands it's only this game that's causing the problem. Also, the enemy spawns sometimes takes way too long. For example, there's this quest where you have to unlock a tri-seal. The Meaty tribe has this sort of challenge and you get 1 minute and 35 seconds to defeat 10 enemies. The problem is, the enemies take too long to spawn and the result is 50 seconds of battle time. And those 50 seconds are becoming shorter because of the spawn time of the boss, so I can't pass the challenge. Please fix this, especially the crashing. I will hate to have to delete this game because of it.
title: Love the game but...

review: As a long time player I honestly love the game and enjoy it. I do wish that it didn‚Äôt use gacha systems though as I‚Äôve lost so many 50/50‚Äôs even when I spent money (I do not suggest as it is not worth itü•≤) the pity system is kind of nice but it takes so much time just to build it. I also wish there where more ways to get primogems because I‚Äôm broke and genuinely need better characters lol. I love the community and enjoy how helpful everyone is with everything and how funny but wholesome the game can be. (Story wise and just playing with friends or strangers) However with so many updates coming out it‚Äôs really hard for my friends who play on phones to keep the game as they don‚Äôt have enough storage space. I wish that they would bring the game to more platforms such as The Nintendo switch or maybe Xbox because so much of the player base is only on phone. It genuinely breaks my heart seeing so many people have to leave the game just for the sake of their storage space. At this point you need a whole phone just dedicated to playing it. So please Mihoyo add this to more consoles. But otherwise this game is very fun and enjoyable.

It destroys my storage, my sanity, I can‚Äôt stop playing, I‚Äôve had weeks long episodes where all I can do is play this awful game. Not to mention that it‚Äôs just racist, the few characters with darker skin are constantly being whitewashed, like for Dehya‚Äôs back story when they showed her as a child, they literally made her white, why??? she isn‚Äôt white??? Also for the entirety of Sumeru which is supposed to be based the Middle East, South Asia, and Northern Africa, there are hardly any npc‚Äôs that are people of color and even few playable characters. And considering how much effort they normally put in to portraying different culture with the accuracy they deserve, they fall extremely short when they portrayed Sumeru. Also their gambling system is awful, poor rates of actually getting the five star featured on the banner, this would be forgivable if you were able to earn more primo gems in a free way; but with the current system set up as a free to play player you have to save for at least three months to get the character you want, if you want two different characters who have banners close to each other you either buy primo gems or have extremely good luck. title: I love the game but

review: When I first heard Genshin Impact, I thought it‚Äôd just be a boring game of having to go with the starter characters and etc, but when I delved into this game the game was really fun. Not only do you get to do your own thing, such as procrastinate from doing a quest you cant get passed. I know lots of other games wont allow that & you MUST complete the main quests to be able to do other things. However, Genshin Impact does not do this, instead they just let you go hunt for treasure chests to level up, (it‚Äôd take longer to level up if you just do that). The game is absolutely F2P friendly. The downside of this is that ‚ÄúCo-Op‚Äù the resources and work you‚Äôve done in another player‚Äôs world does not TRANSFER over to your own world. That is such a bummer since me and my friends enjoy going on adventures together. title: Phenomenal!

review: Genshin Impact is a good game, but it takes up a lot of storage. I know a majority of mobile players complain about this, but it really does take up A LOT of storage. As a F2P (free-to-play) player, it‚Äôs pretty hard to resist spending money on this game with so many characters. Most of the 5 star characters are very OP, but because they‚Äôre 5 stars, they are harder to get. That means that you have to farm Primogems (a currency for wishing) all of the time to save up enough just for a 5 star character that you might not have even wanted (because there is a 50% chance that you get another character) I know a lot of people wrote reviews about they not getting the character they wanted, or things that people who never played the game can understand, so if you‚Äôve never played this game before, you‚Äôre welcome for writing a decent review that you can understand. If I could go back to the past, I would just finish the main story and stop playing. I think that way I wouldn‚Äôt waste so much time farming for a video game character that I think is cool, and get burnt out. But, I do like how much effort was put into this game. The graphics are amazing. Sadly most people playing on mobile might not even be able to see the amazing graphics because of the horrible lag.
title: Good game

review:
I was very curious about this game and heard it was an open world RPG, so I had to try it. I regret nothing. I love it. I love more than Breath of the Wild. Okay maybe not more than Breath of the Wild, but it‚Äôs definitely up there. There are so many lovable characters and the story goes on forever. There world is pretty big and I believe there‚Äôs even more of it that I haven‚Äôt unlocked yet. Best: it‚Äôs free and doesn‚Äôt have a single ad. It‚Äôs the game of my dreams. The combat system is well thought out and interesting, there is a wide variety of enemies, and there‚Äôs even dogs and cats (that you can‚Äôt pet, but oh well).
My one problem: the game crashes all. The. Time. It doesn‚Äôt matter what I‚Äôm doing, I‚Äôll get a good 10 minutes of gameplay and boom, crash. Most of the time everything saves before it crashes and I don‚Äôt lose any progress, but when in the middle of a fight or conversation, I‚Äôll have to start over, which is a pain. Also not the best thing when playing in co-op. It‚Äôs frustrating, but I guess it‚Äôs a small price to pay for greatness. A large price to pay for greatness? A medium sized price.
Overall, wonderful game. Definitely recommend.
title: Amazing game, one problem

review:
The hate and backlash this game is receiving at the moment is absolutely shameful and have absolutely nothing to do about the beauty of this game. It‚Äôs a shame that I call myself a part of this greedy and toxic fandom. The company owes us nothing to give us major rewards for a year anniversary. This should be a moment of joy for Mihoyo and instead they are receiving hateful comments and reviews by greedy players looking for a handout. 

This game is absolutely gorgeous to be able to play for free. Lovely graphics that are pleasing to the eye (and I should know! I get chronic migraines yet I haven‚Äôt gotten one while playing yet), enjoyable fights, gorgeous cutscenes (a few that I have even cried at), and an awe inspiring story behind it all. And guess what? This game isn‚Äôt even finished yet. Only three of seven regions have been released with more content and more story to be discovered. I would highly recommend this game to anyone, those who like to play for free, or those who pay to play. 

Ignore the hate and give this game a shot. I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôll fall in love with the lore and characters.
title: Ignore the hate - Game is an absolute joy to play

review:
I love Genshin it is one of my favorite games, but there are a few problems with it. First of all the biggest problem is resin. Most of the important resources required to progress are locked behind Resin. The problem with this is that it RECHARGES SO SLOW! It takes 8 minutes to obtain 1 resin. So to get 5 resin you would need to wait 40 minutes! And that‚Äôs only a 1/4 of the resin you need to obtain anything! Second of all primogems. This is a gacha game. And primogems are essentially the material you need to do ‚Äúpulls‚Äù and use the gacha system. Mihoyo starves us on these. We get about 2 ‚Äúpulls‚Äù per 3 week event and 1/3 of a pull each day (for doing daily quests). That‚Äôs it. Sorry to go on a rant. I gave it  four stars because honestly I enjoy this game. It‚Äôs not bad by any means, but these issues are pretty big If you wanna enjoy the game long term.

Extra: If you spent money (which not many are willing to do) you can somewhat get around these problems. Buying the battle pass for 10:00 dollars can give you massive amounts of resin locked resources (this can require a lot of grinding though ).And welkin blessing can give you a massive amount of primogems for its 5 dollar cost.
title: Amazing game but‚Ä¶

review: Overall, I‚Äôm very impressed with the quality of this game. The graphics are so beautiful, and it is very aesthetically pleasing whenever I play. There is a bunch of cool characters and an amazing storyline to play through. When I first downloaded Genshin Impact I was skeptical, and didn‚Äôt really know what it was. Now, after only a few days of playing, I am officially addicted. You can explore the map, battle monsters, collect cute, new characters, and complete quests to progress in the story. I am absolutely in love! However, there are a few small mistakes that the creators may have overlooked. At one point while summoning Dvalin, Paimon was talking to Lumine about her sister, when Lumine only has a twin brother. The game must‚Äôve thought that I was playing as the brother, but I wasn‚Äôt. That‚Äôs about the only mistake I‚Äôve found in the game, just pronouns. Otherwise everything seems perfect! I notice that the creators are frequently updating the game, which is always great to see. This game is by far my favorite RPG, and I would definitely recommend playing it. Thank you for creating this masterpiece! üíó
title: Amazing game!!!

review: Look man, it‚Äôs an anime type game. BUT it‚Äôs low key addictive. I‚Äôve been playing off and on since 2020, taking 6 month breaks sometimes. I had fun with the game, but i felt like i wasted my time in some areas. I didn‚Äôt like how much you have to gamble just for a 50 percent chance to get what you want, and have to do more gambling trying to make the character actually good. I did really enjoy the challenging gameplay and the character and world design, yet i felt stumped with some puzzles and quests. The one massive reason i kept coming back was the fact that my friends and i would play so much together and have a lot of funny moments. Now though, i‚Äôve cut ties with one of those friends, and i haven‚Äôt been talking to the other as much anymore. As much as I want to grind the game, i am a (basically) free to play  player, i only spent 5 dollars on welkin so i could get that fire girl with the bow and a massive gyat. would rate 5 stars if hoyoverse 1) changed their name back, 2) made it easier for f2p players to get their favorite characters easier. If you read all of this, thank you for your time, and have a great day.
title: Roller coaster of a game

review:
So my best friend is OBSESSED with Genshin Impact. She had been telling me for a while to download it. It looked fun so I thought it was worth a shot. 3 days ago I downloaded it.  
But, after I finished making my account it brought me to a screen that said I didn‚Äôt have enough storage. I have the standard 5gb but only 2.5gb were used. So I looked it up and found out the game requires 12gb of storage. So I bought 50gb of storage which is more than enough. Unfortunately when I went to the app it said I still didn‚Äôt have enough space to download the full version. I deleted it and reinstalled it but it was the same thing. I watch TONS of videos but nothing seemed to work. Also my phone is pretty new (iPhone 12). I tried to play the non-full version. It was very fun and I could see why people love it so much. Eventually though it told me the only way I could continue playing was to download the full version. So I clicked on it and it brought me to the same ‚Äúyou don‚Äôt have enough storage‚Äù screen. That was yesterday and I still haven't got it to work. I‚Äôm really disappointed not only because I bought all that storage for it to not work, but also because I REALLY want to continue playing this game. Please tell me if there‚Äôs a reason for this!
title: Great but‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

review: PC player here. I played this game when it released and did not follow the story at all, just explored. I got bored of the game really quickly doing this, but a week or two ago my friend told me to get back on, i forgot my account details and made a new account and i ended up getting ar 25 in 2 days. The games story is just so addictive, id find myself saying, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll get off after this quest,‚Äù and i would end up playing deep into the night sometimes even skipping meals. Then i went on vacation with my family leaving my computer at home, i then remembered that genshin has a mobile version which ive been using to perfect my characters artifacts and do commissions (in my freetime ofc i wouldnt ignore family). Most mobile versions of games usually turn me off of the game in general like pubg, minecraft, and though i‚Äôm ashamed to say i played it... fortnite, but genshin mobile has only made my interest in the game skyrocket seeing as i can improve my collection constantly even when i cannot reach my computer. Great game and its worth the 4 gigabytes out of my 32 that it takes up.
title: Surprisingly Good

review: First off this game is amazing! I have been playing since day 1. This game has loads of things to do for newer players. It‚Äôs an open world gacha game. This game is amazing because you get to explore around the world and fight enemies, there‚Äôs also an amazing storyline. Of course like all gacha games though, in order to get all the characters you want being a f2p can be hard. Genshin constantly has new content. But there are some downsides for those who really want to get into genshin. First off the fan base can be really toxic, please don‚Äôt listen to them and play the game however you like. Second of all this game requires a lot of downloading and storage if your device can‚Äôt handle tons of data I don‚Äôt recommend this game. Also the gacha system and the way of getting the ‚Äúcurrency‚Äù to pull for characters is a bit annoying. There is a pity but if you are planning on being a f2p the chances of constantly getting the characters you want is difficult. Overall though this is an imagining game that is rarely dry of content. I promise once you get into genshin you‚Äôll love it.
title: Great game, but be warned!

review: Ok, right of the bat, I don‚Äôt like Japanese styled games. I‚Äôm just not a fan of the art. But one thing I love is Breath of the Wild legend of Zelda. BOTW is a Japanese game at its heart but has kind of American graphics. It is my favorite game of all time. But, this game...... is exactly like BOTW but Japanese and mixed with the new hyrule warriors. You can switch people but it‚Äôs still you. You can glide. Sounds like the same world audio, (like the grunting of climbing a mountain sounds the same in both games). It is not my favorite game, but my favorite mobile game. I would rather pick BOTW if I had to but, full disclosure, I actually don‚Äôt own BOTW but have deafened ganon multiple times with on my friends switch without any intervention, so I‚Äôve experienced the story, so i would recommend BOTW if you already have it but don‚Äôt want to pay and have the almost same experience this game is amazing and worth the 8 GIGS!! It takes to download. (READ HERE) But, I haven‚Äôt finished the story, not by a long shot, so the story may be good but I don‚Äôt know. The BOtW story was really good. But the story may be the turning point if you are into the story part of open world games.
title: Didn‚Äôt have good expectation. That said, this game annihilated my expectations.

review: Genshin is my favorite game so far. Whenever I‚Äôm bored I like to play, and there‚Äôs a lot to do. I think all the mechanics in the game are great, and that only a few things need to be changed. I think that there should be more things that are similar to the abyss, since higher ranked players are unable to get primogems as easily. Also, with the weapon banner, it is annoying that the fate points don‚Äôt carry over after the banner changes. I think it should, since for F2P players it is harder to get primogems then those who spend money on the game. I also think that there aren‚Äôt enough year round 5 stars. There is a 50% chance you‚Äôll get the character on the event banner and a 50% you‚Äôll get 1 of 5 5 stars. There should be more, different 5 stars that are similar to the year round 5 (Jean, Diluc, Qiqi, Keqing, and Mona), there hasn‚Äôt been a new one for a while, and players that have been playing for a long while most likely have all of those characters already, along with constellations. Overall genshin impact is a really good game, and I highly recommend it to others.
title: Fantastic Game

review:
They went an entire year without buffing electro element and starting with update 2.0 they‚Äôve begun treating the players like nothing but money bags and have been actively gimping newer characters because they think people will just take their wallets out anyway, this has CONTINUED in 2.1 where the newest archon is a joke and her element is still incredibly mediocre. And as for the anniversary rewards? Despite the billions they‚Äôve made in a year the most they could manage to give the players in return is a 10 pull (from logging in for 7 days mind you) and a sad amount of gold and xp crystals, they quite simply don‚Äôt care or value the players anymore now that they game has blown up and it‚Äôs incredibly disappointing. 

The game continues to suffer from a lack of replayability and despite a years worth of feedback on the resin system and there being literally nothing to do after completing the one and done story stuff, they‚Äôve refused to add anything permanent that isn‚Äôt heavily limited while flat out ignoring criticism and feedback about the weaker characters which has unironically CONTINUED into 2.0 since launch, 3 characters in a row have been garbage now while older ones who have always been weak remain untouched.
title: They‚Äôve stopped caring about releasing quality characters NOR do they listen to the players anymore

review:
Some things I want to say right off the bat‚Äîamazing graphics, great storyline, beautifully designed characters, and awesome playstyle! It is very engaging and there‚Äôs a million things you can do. If you like exploring, there‚Äôs a giant map for you to poke around in. If you love combat, there‚Äôs tons of bosses and enemies out there. Genshin even has a customizable ‚Äúhouse‚Äù you can obtain (for free, of course). And the characters‚Äîalthough sometimes their in-game kits are disappointing, their design never is. 

Sure, this game is a gacha. But as someone who has spent zero money on the game, I can tell you that this is not a pay to win game. I have seen some reviews from parents complaining that their kids spent money without their permission, but honestly, how is that the game‚Äôs fault? Everything is accomplishable with the characters you get for free, and simply playing a couple times a week on the weekends will get you enough ‚Äúwishes‚Äù to get the characters you like. 

Lastly, yeah, this game takes a lot of storage. That comes with the territory, in my opinion, since the scenery is so beautifully made and incredibly detailed. So consider yourself warned, I guess.
title: Good Game!

review:
I‚Äôm not sure how to explain how wonderful this game is in words, but for anyone interested in any ‚Äúanime-styled‚Äù open world games, this one takes the cake. I‚Äôve been playing this game for two years now and I have only just chosen to write a review. At this time only 4.2 has been released and the story only gets better as the game goes on. Some things I do wish were implemented into this game, however, would be for character to have the ability to walk with their equipped weapon in their hands, because at this time, weapons are automatically transferred to the back of the said character once they begin walking. Another feature I REALLLY WISH for would be customized sitting animations for each character (or at least 5 star character)  it would make 5 star characters much more desirable and cool in comparison to 4 stars, and it adds to their personality. Neuvillette for example, sits with crossed legs in storyline, but he sit like any other male character in game.

If anyone reads this, thank you for this wonderful game and happy holidays.
