title: Best Gaming Experience I‚Äôve Ever Had

review:
With the addition of controller support this game is now the best thing on the app store. You can play this game as little or as much as you like. There is no energy system outside of resin to just play. You can play 100% for free. Although you will likely never see a 5* character. And they are very strong. There is also no sign of Venti or Klee in the game which is very disappointing. I stopped playing the game because of no controller and now i have lost my chance to acquire 2 of the best characters. But even without those 2 or a 5* character the game is just amazing. Huge open world at console quality, lots of events, crafting, boss fights, co-op and a growing character roster. This game proves what ios gaming could truly be.

 The only reason it is 4* is because 5* is reserved for perfect. And underneath it all this is still a gacha game with elements that can really only be unlocked with cash. Im all for giving you 60 bucks for a game and even buying expansion packs that include new characters and areas. To ask people to spend 100‚Äôs for a .06% chance to get a character or item is the most insane thing. Luckily this game is still enjoyable without using the gacha system.
title: Best game on app store

review: This open world game has been a gleeful experience and it has kept me busy for at least a year now this open game world isnt like any other games where its just one little area where everything is to easy and quick to complete or obtain u definitely have to work for stuff in this game the graphics are amazing the storyline is beautiful and the characters have amazing designs and each ones has there own backstory and quest this is definitely a game i would recommend to anyone! Great job thank you for ur work on this game mihoyo. New events are always coming out new characters,quest,enemies,and areas come out often too the wishing system in this. Game is great a little frustrating when u rlly what a certain character but it just makes u work harder for it five out of five is what i would Give this game every time thank you for a alp that i didn't get bored With in 20 mins looking forward for the future of this game <3 the chat features kinda annoying with the clearing of the messages unwanted. I have been playing since version 1.3
title: Perfect scores all around uwu

review:
I absolutely love this game! It is absolutely fun and I never see myself getting bored. The graphics and character design are beautiful, there is so much attention to detail and a lot of stories to hear from the NPCs. 

However, I am AR 44 and I don‚Äôt have many 5-star characters. I only have Mona, which I am fine with but I don‚Äôt use her a lot. I am also an F2P, meaning that I don‚Äôt spend money on this game. I feel like players who pay for stuff in the game have a higher advantage than those who don‚Äôt pay to play this game, especially on the wishing banners where the chances of getting a 5-star character are slim unless you have a lot of primogems and fates.

I‚Äôm not asking for much but to just increase chances of getting a 5-star in one 10-pull or at least make it more fair for those who don‚Äôt have the money to spend it on the wishing system. Perhaps you can decrease the amount of primogems needed for one intertwined/acquaint fate or make it more easy to gain primogems, because from someone who is broke, I can‚Äôt get 5-stars and I don‚Äôt have the best luck at this game.
title: Love the game but..

review:
Hello. I‚Äôm new to the game but I can give you a good rundown of how it‚Äôs going so far (2nd release day). So far, I do have to say that the graphics/visuals and the audio as well are amazing! At first I had trouble loading the beginning cut scenes, but after that, I never had trouble with lag our audio glitches. The visuals are bright and beautiful, much better than most games out there currently. Now as for the gameplay itself, I am a newbie to this game, but it focuses mostly on grinding levels for many different characters and completing many different quests across the large world map. I love running across the map and not having to stop for any loading screens, it‚Äôs all one big world!

Now there is something for the developers to work on, as this is rated four stars and not five. As in many other reviews, there are many, many times where I will just be playing and either the screen will freeze or the game will completely crash. That gets quite annoying. 

Now I do understand that this is only the second day off of launch, so I will give them grace... hopefully they can fix the crashing issue, then I will rate it 5 stars!
title: Really good just lots of crashes.

review: This game is really good overall but there are still many issues 1. I feel like there‚Äôs way too many enemies and hilichurl camps because I see them almost everywhere 2. The game can get really laggy because just now I got disconnected 4 times and this could be very bad for boss fights 3. I hate that some quests make travel halfway across teyvat and it‚Äôs so annoying because I don‚Äôt even get awards that actually make it worth it 4. I feel anxious whenever I‚Äôm in a boss fight like the one with the ruin guard it took so long and it was nearly impossible 5. I also hate that almost every single quest includes a boss fight with a strong enemy and it could also take hours 6. I don‚Äôt like that most daily commission quests involve fighting and combat I just want it to be a peaceful game like in the ads 7. Another thing about the ads is that they don‚Äôt tell you anything about fighting or combat they just show you teyvat and all the characters but nothing about the actual gameplay Even with all of these setbacks Genshin impact is still a great game overall but I still want the developers to fix these major issues
title: Overall good but

review: I was just a beginner at the time and I kept getting lost and wondered how my luck was so low and that‚Äôs when I watched tuts and how to improve and now I have the new character YAOYAO  and more! This fantasy game is so worth the download and time into the full version! I play this 24/7 on my bed everyday and it gets so fun when you can actually go on missions, I think this is my favorite fantasy game out of all of them! I couldn‚Äôt download this game because of storage but when I got the storage to download it again I immediately logged into my old account to see how and where I was. I wasn‚Äôt doing so great but it gets so much fun after a few days! but one thing I would add is that theirs in and out glitches during the game, sometimes it randomly crashes and it could happen because of bad internet but it gets better if your on hotspot because it‚Äôs your personal internet and you can share it with Genshin and the crashes will barley happen anymore. Anyways. THIS IS SO WORTH THE DOWNLOAD!! I recommend so badly if you like fantasy games, thank you <3
title: AMAZING!!

review: As a high AR player with two low AR friends, this game gets pretty boring. I actually quit a while ago, and switched to Honkai Impact 3rd (great game btw.) My friend with the lowest AR (around 25) also finds the game boring, except in Co-Op. That's surprising coming from them, because they're pretty easily entertained (And very funny.) Also, primogems are too hard to get. Especially for F2P's, some people can't just dump their entire wallet into a game. As a low spender (used to be F2P, but Xiao and Herrscher of Sentience ruined it haha), it was still extremely difficult to get primogems. As for Honkai, there's many different ways to get crystals. Although the prices to pull are higher, the availability to get crystals is epic. Back to Genshin now (Not a paid advertisement, I promise), I do love the story, and characters. Xiao is my favorite. But there has to be at least SOMETHING other than the Abyss portal thingy (forgot it's name) and events to do at AR 50+ (sometimes lower!) I don't have high hopes this'll change anything, but for new players, just letting you know, treasure the fun you get from Genshin, because it probably will slow down when you get to a high AR. Saying this as an AR 56 player. Have a good one! -Slayer Player
title: Gets boring

review: So when I first heard about it and that it was free I checked it out played it for a little then the next day I played for a long time and I noticed I never really got addicted to these kind of games but somehow this game manage to be super good then others and I‚Äôm surprised it‚Äôs free because of how good the game is! I started getting into the thoughts of other people starting rumors about a certain character and all that and it got more interesting the more I played it, I told my cousin about and she downloaded it then her dad did then her cousin Eva did then her grandma and they all enjoy the game though I wish that we didn‚Äôt have to be such a high rank to join friends but overall I love everything! I highly recommend this game to people who love adventure but chill vibe to a game, I love how we can choose our gender as well! I love Venties style and I feel he looks so cute! Thanks for making this game possible ü•∞ Thank you for your effort and time into the game everyone sure does appreciate the hard work put into this gameü´∂ Love Olivia‚ù§Ô∏è
title: A great choice for a exciting experience and game!

review: As a Genshin Impact player and lover, I adore all the features the game has. Although I would like to suggest one thing. Earlier in my Genshin experience, I started to love and learn all the characters the game offers, but it was a struggle for me to get the character(s) I wanted. I understand that every player can‚Äôt get the character(s)/items they want. And with that being said, I would like to suggest a Trading system where all the players can trade character(s)/items/etc. At a certain Adventure Rank, players are able to trade items as the same value. A character for a character, an Item for an Item, you get what I mean. If the person that has the desirable Item (say a Character) and the other person does not have a character that the other person wants, they should be able to trade in the same amount of values as the Character such as, Artifacts, Weapons, Food, Wishes, and etc. I have been thinking about this feature a lot lately and all of my friends that are also players think it would be a great feature as well. just a little suggestion :)
title: suggestion

review: To say that this game is addictive is a HUGE understatement. The graphics are beautiful and the story is very engaging and interesting (for the main storyline). There are a lot of small details in every character‚Äôs design that make you stop and think. However, as good as this game is, being f2p is EXTREMELY difficult. They are very stingy with rewards to their players. A single wish cost 160 primogems, but for those who have finished exploring and such, you can only earn 60 primos a day through daily commissions. This alone wouldn‚Äôt be so much of an issue if it weren‚Äôt for the limited amount of time on wishing banners. After the banner ends, the five star character is unobtainable unless MhY decides to give them a rerun. On top of this is the 90 wishes. Considering you can get about one wish every two days, 90 is far out of reach for older players. MhY being stingy with their players is nothing new. We saw it with the rewards given for the 1 year anniversary and we saw it again with how fast the primogem codes expired from the newest livestream. The codes expired in less than 24 hours. I know personally I was working during the livestream, so when I got home to watch the recording, I was disheartened to learn that the codes had already expired. Not all of us can drop everything for MhY sake.
title: Game is good but MhY is SO stingy

review: I usually don‚Äôt write reviews but this is a special occasion. I am a whale turned casual that has spent 10s of thousands over the years on dozen of different Gacha games and while all these games have had their good and bad aspects about them all respected and went all out for the anniversary. No matter how well or bad your Gacha is received and doing the anniversary was also event/celebration you as the company/dev gave back to the fanbase/community that supports, spends and plays your game and Mihoyo and Genshin have pretty much spat at that concept. From lackluster rewards that is equivalent to one multi summon after you log in for 7 days, to collecting 20 primo for having 15 ppl click on your ‚Äújourney link‚Äù to having a chance to win 100k Moro and one resin refill. These rewards if you want to call them that is beyond lackluster and worse than that some are RNG based. It‚Äôs insane and laughably that this dev/company would offer this as some celebration for the community that has made them massively more wealthy and successful. This review will stay 1star until this is changed or addressed and furthermore bugs and QOL changes are finally announced for problems the community has been asking / complaining about for the better part of the year. What a complete joke this situation and this game as become.
title: Worst Anniversary in Gacha history

review:
PARENTS: STOP ALLOWING CHILDREN UNDER 12 TO PLAY! It‚Äôs against MiHoYo rules, and they‚Äôre not safe! There is a minimum age requirement, you know! 

I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact daily since 2021. The game itself is very challenging, time consuming, and attractive‚Ä¶. definitely worth trying for the mature player. What takes off a star, and really should take off more, is vicious player abuse, LGBTQ hate, hate and bullying in general, and lewd obscene behavior, statuses, and player names. 

Doxxing attempts are a problem. I‚Äôve had several people try to get my private information including telephone number, address, pry about personal life, sexual orientation, etc. and you can bet that they‚Äôre streaming that live on Twitch. Players bypass obscenity controls and hit you up for sex or discuss it graphically for laughs. Now imagine your 10 year old kid in that environment. Global statistically, the average player in Genshin Impact is 35 years old and male... and a lot of kids are panhandling players to pay credit card funds for Primogem game currency both in game and online in the official HoYoLAB community‚Ä¶ so you can imagine what they‚Äôre getting exposed to.
title: Split Review

review:
Still not sure how they made this a mobile game. Pretty much a free to play breath of the wild. The graphics are breathtaking and somehow the game still runs really well on my iPhone 8plus. The world is huge and being added to as I am writing this review. There is so many small side quests, puzzles, and objectives. The world is well done and the small treasures you find just feeds your brain dopamine and you can‚Äôt stop. The main story itself is alright with nice animations and cut Scenes. The game play itself is also really fun with a pretty neat combat system.

There are some downside with this game. If you binge play this game (like 40hr/week) you will likely run out of things to do within 2-3 weeks and then have to wait for the new map expansion. There will still be things to do during that time but definitely not enough to keep you playing at your 40 hour/ week  pace. But if you take things slow and investigate/explore the world as you slowly progress the main story and not rush and binge play you will have high quality entertainment for a long time.
title: Best mobile game in a while

review: The game is ridiculously beautiful, there‚Äôs no mistaking there‚Äôs a lot of effort put into this, alongside the top tier Japanese voice actors. The designs, world, all of the exploration aspects are very detailed and it‚Äôs a very good open world. However I have a bit of concern that from the Wish rates this game will turn into a pay to win, with the abysmal drop rate. Granted, you can get characters from progressing with the story, however, there‚Äôs no denying that there is this feeling that you can just cruise early and be ridiculously op from the start, it can break a hardworking player‚Äôs spirit, and hopefully the devs will take this into consideration, and make sure that all players will be given equal satisfaction so that whale players can still be whales and free to play players don‚Äôt feel like their hard work becomes obsolete. I feel this game has a very good potential and it would be a waste to see the joy ruined by a pay to win, since the team really put a lot of effort into this game. Personally I don‚Äôt mind giving support to the devs by making small purchases now and then, but I‚Äôd rather not have my hard work flushed down the drain just because the game says ‚Äúpay to win, baby‚Äù.
title: A little message to the devs

review: If you go through the 1 star reviews, 90% of the criticism is because people don't have good enough phones to play the game - that's how much content there is. Graphics, gameplay, and the story line are incredible for a free mobile game. I've been playing for a year now and although there are frustrating aspects of the game, it keeps you invested and consumes a lot of time to get good. I'm still at the beginning stages of the game, I haven't even finished half the in game content. Some of the fan base is kinda weird but even if you're not a weeb or a "waifu" you'll still enjoy the game, especially if you like hand to hand combat in games. Lots of different options to choose from, whether you're a strategic player or a "smash and grab" type fighter, you can choose swordsman, bowman, magician, etc. The story mode is incredibly fun. My only real criticisms is that the in game currency is not really enough for free players. Forces you to buy things to have a competitive chance in a lot of the "non-story" mode events.
title: Excellent Free Mobile Game - If you have 1/2 TB or more space

review: First the general gameplay is awesome and the game is explained to you through story quests and you at first do 5 different quests to get 3 other starter characters apart from Lumine or Aether whom you already have chosen from the beginning and you can go on quests to get primogems which help on your road to discover new characters which you do by wishing. Yes you do get some free characters along the storyline but the main characters come from standard wish banner, character event wish banners, and weapon banners. This game may seem like it is not free roam but it truly is and there is an absolutely gigantic map that you can unlock teleport waipoints and statues that can heal when you‚Äôre near them you can play in different regions with Archon Quests and that‚Äôs how you can unlock inazuma which is so beautiful. There is so much to learn about this game and I‚Äôm not usually that one to play complicated games but I found it‚Äôs so fun to play when bored! Download this guys! You won‚Äôt regret it and the game explains itself. I forgot to mention there‚Äôs co-op st a certain level!
title: Yes this game deserves my 5 stars

review: This game has a very good story line for those who like to know the story of the game, it has a large map with treasures and games all over the place, the enemies are diverse and many for those who are here for combat, and has an awesome gatcha system for those who like that. The gatcha system has weapons from 3-5 stars on the weapons and standard banner, and characters from 4-5 stars on the character banner and standard banner. On the character banner, you are given a 50/50 chance of getting the featured character or getting a standard character. If you get a standard character, the next 5 star is the featured character. On the weapons banner, you have a 50/50 chance of getting your selected weapon or getting any other weapon. Once you fail twice you get the one you want as your next 5 star. It‚Äôs overall a great game for anyone, and it has great music for everything, so if you‚Äôre worried about the large amount of storage it takes up, think about all the things you can do with this game!!!
title: Great game for people who like exploration, fighting, gatcha, or story lines

review:
This would be a great game if it was not for the totally crappy wish system that is used to obtain new characters and weapons. Early on you get a lot of characters, but that tapers off around chapter II.  Players end up investing a ton of time earning primogem in order to buy fates,  just to get crappy duplicate weapons or the same characters over and over. It is really flawed and disappointing.  Once my characters were between level 50/60, I spent 70 wishes over a two week period and did not get one new character. 
Also never received a 5 star weapon from  any of the wishes the entire time I played. I had to forge and level up any weapons that were worth having, like the dragonspine spear, which is a ridiculous process (like the gae bolg in final fantasy 14). So disappointing. I even dropped wishes during promotional periods where the drop rate was up too. Nada. 
At a certain point you need more characters to progress and they just don‚Äôt drop. You can run the abyss for big primogem hauls but once that is done, you have to look elsewhere. This is to the point where the game is no longer enjoyable to play.  Developers are just hoping players get impatient and spend real cash for additional primogem. No thanks. Fix the character drop rate, get  rid of the stupid gamble, and this could be a great game.
title: Genshin‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

review: I never thought I‚Äôd play Genshin Impact as much as I do now. It was always something I scrolled by or saw other people hyping up and didn‚Äôt really think it was all that great. I clearly stand corrected as I‚Äôm almost adventure rank 40 and I‚Äôve caught up on all the archon quests. I started back in May but then fell of it. Then I really picked it up late august to September. I‚Äôd say that‚Äôs excellent progress! I wish there was a feature that let you reclaim resources and materials used on characters you don‚Äôt really play with anymore though. Like you could get back all the mora you spent for ascension and upgrading your character as well as whatever was needed to ascend and upgrade, that would be really cool and save on some of the grindiness if that makes sense. I‚Äôm all for grinding but when I‚Äôm low on resources and can only get so far collecting, I‚Äôd like to be able to reset a least played character back to level one and use their materials to upgrade a main character that I play with constantly. Just some food for thought, everything else about this game I‚Äôm in love with!!
title: Love it!!!!

review:
This game is by far one of my favorite open world mobile games! With all the details, fantastic voice acting, the scenery, everything is perfect! I‚Äôve played maybe 10 minutes so far and I‚Äôm already hooked. I gave the creators many hints with a tweet and feedback saying this game would be amazing if it had controller compatibility. I don‚Äôt want my fingers all over my screen covering all the beautifully crafted visuals! I really do hope they add controller compatibility to mobile or just put it on Xbox one please!

But, I know I‚Äôve only played 10 minutes and I‚Äôm already writing a review. The reason why is because I‚Äôve played multiple MMOs and open world games. The first 5 minutes literally got me hooked because of how they executed the intro. And not even that, the small details in the game like climbing trees to get to higher up fruit! The voice acting is amazing, and the characters are so far adorable, even the monsters! I can‚Äôt say to much because I haven‚Äôt played an hour or two yet, but this game is definitely worth playing if you‚Äôre a huge ‚ÄúSkyrim‚Äù like person! (Cause I am)
title: Needs controller compatibility!

review: I have always wanted to play a Massive open world game on my phone. It‚Äôs been years of searching for games on the App Store and I found a few games that were good, but they were not exactly the kind of game I was looking for. I was looking for a game where you have freedom instead of following a single storyline, I was looking for Amazing graphics in a game, and I was looking for something that is long and satisfying. This game has gone way past my expectations, from graphics, to gameplay, to story/side quest, to exploring freely. There‚Äôs just so much to do, I look forward to playing more and getting new updates to add even more improvements. Keep up the good work! (Also a few suggestions to make it better, Add more side quest that has some useful rewards maybe, and maybe a friendship or couple system to make it more realistic; like more interactions throughout the game, most likely with online people, oh and one more thing; even more characters and weapons which will draw more people on as well as keep players playing for who knows how long) thank you.
title: Long awaited Game!

review: Okay so i‚Äôm gonna cut it short i love the game from the beginning to the new updates the game is beautiful and requires a lot of work obvi but i really hate the wishing system like i‚Äôve been saving up for a long time to *try* to get 1,600 primogems and what do i get for it? i get one 4 star. I say more characters well more 5 star characters should be on the standard banner like ones that have been in the game for so long but also the ones that have only gotten 1 re-run or none at all like klee. We also have requirements for certain things if you have the wrong people on the wrong team it‚Äôs useless to even pull for them. i say put a permanent event in the game like the mixing event with mondstat the job in my opinion should be permanent and on saturdays or weekends we should get maybe 20 or more primogems if we do it for the whole week. after a while of playing and waiting on events the game is pointless it get boring and tiring doing commissions are all the same it gets boring. Also, listen here not every character has to be white make them darker skinned darker not mixed not tan DARKER PLEASE.
title: Great game but 2 major problems i have

review: I downloaded this game on December 24th of 2021, and as of now I‚Äôm on AR (adventure rank, level) 57, but mostly because I‚Äôve been on hiatus on this game occasionally. I think all of the archon quests take as much time as they should and the plot is very planned out that it made me feel all the feelings. All characters are well designed from their looks to their backgrounds, their personalities vary, but some were the same but the same goes to irl lol. The fighting works with weapons, levels, talents, and artifacts. Each character has a few things: a vision, role, and weapon type. Visions include: Anemo, Geo, Electro, Dendro, Hydro, Pyro, and Cryo (and maybe some potential new visions in the future). There are also delusions which take away at people‚Äôs life source and ages them to their death. This game contains the following roles: shielder, battery, healer, DPS, sub-DPS, and buffer. The weapon types: bow, sword, spear, claymore, and catalyst. The banner‚Äôs change every 20-so days, which I see is fair. Very often, they add events like Windtrace (hide and seek in co-op/friends) and some others that you can do completely alone.
title: Top tier

review:
I don‚Äôt normally write reviews but this game blew me out of the water. I‚Äôve been playing rpgs for years and I never stick with one for more than a couple weeks, but I‚Äôm so captivated by the sheer amount of things to do and detail in this game there‚Äôs never a dull moment. The character design is insanely detailed, there‚Äôs not a single undynamic character. You‚Äôd think with the amount of npc‚Äôs  there‚Äôd be many that you can‚Äôt talk to; but every single one I‚Äôve encountered tells you paragraphs of actually interesting story that is going on in this persons life. You can even go find the family members that they‚Äôre talking about and fawning over in their dialogue, and they‚Äôll share with you the other side of the story. It looks like breath of the wild for gods sake!

It‚Äôs a gorgeous game, with a gorgeous community to match. Mihoyo  is a wonderful company from what I‚Äôve seen and I adore their work on this game. It‚Äôs easy to drown in the serotonin you get from this game, so be careful! 

I highly recommend it, my favorite game to date on pc and mobile.
title: My favorite game, been playing it for 100 days straight

review:
I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact for about a year and a half, I first downloaded back in December 2020. As time went on, and updates passed, I enjoyed the game as it was‚Äî but it soon became a major storage issue for my phone, taking up almost 70 gigabytes of extra file storage. Genshin is originally marketed as a PC game, so I understand why PC players may not have those issues and continue to play freely, but because of my storage, I had to delete the application in order to software update my phone. Will I redownload it? Perhaps on a tablet, or something that can handle the amount of files, since I really do enjoy the game. I just wish there was a way that the mobile phone version was able to take up less space and still be the amazing game it is today.

Overall this makes me disheartened, because I was looking forward to Ayato‚Äôs banner and saving for it, but I can‚Äôt do anything about it until I free up more storage (somehow) or find another device to play it on (which makes me grateful for the cross-platform for Mobile-iPad-PC. I have c1 level 80 Raiden and a level 90 Venti! Which is a big deal to me, since I‚Äôm not really much of a grinder).
title: Amazing Game, but Storage is Heavy

review: This is one of the best games I‚Äôve played in years. Yesterday I spent almost 8 hours playing. I starting reading the reviews and saw a minor trend. Some people were saying they experienced graphic and audio lag and black spots. I‚Äôm using the iPhone 11 Pro Max and experience no issues. It‚Äôs the most graphically stunning game I‚Äôve ever played on a phone. So if you if don‚Äôt have some power under the hood of your phone it may be difficult for you. With that being said this game is so refreshing. It breaks the static mold of mobile gaming today. It‚Äôs so underwhelming playing the same card based energy consumption model over and over that unoriginal developers have been using for years. Baffling how they seem to believe that we enjoy our games all playing the same with the same inherent limitations. Surely they must play games themselves. With the power that phones and tablets can come with today finally a developer has started utilizing it. Hopefully this is a turning point and other developers will see this creating a new model for mobil gaming. Thank you miHoYo for this epic creation!
title: Epic...Better than most console games

review:
for context, this is coming from an Adult hardcore player in the 'late' game who's spent over $500 USD in a year period. I DO NOT RECOMMEND anyone to spend any kind of money in this game, I will explain why...
GI it's a great concept for a game in itself, being managed by the worst company I've seen in my gaming history, yes I see you MIHOYO! Best way to describe them: a greedy, anti-consumer, and misleading corporation. 
This game is geniously designed for two types of players, 1. Casual free to play and 2. Heavy spenders in the thousands of dollars. This game is not catered for us hardcore players who spend lightly on a monthly battle pass. There's literally no grey area. At the start of the game you are overwhelmed my the amount of content, it gives the impression of a full on RPG game with plenty hours of gameplay, but there comes a threshold we call the 'late' game when there's nothing to do! it is literally 30min of daily grind. Unfortunately content updates are not substantial enough for hardcore players to be entertained for long.  So back to the original idea, you will have a great time with this game in two scenarios, if you don't spend any money (zero) and not rush through the content, or on the other hand you spend hundreds of thousands of dollars so you can refresh the in-game 'currency' used for the gated content.
title: The bad and the ugly...

review:
To start: This has NOTHING to do with the anniversary.

When the game starts it‚Äôs amazing, so much to explore, and the game feels endless. The memories this game have given me and so many others are nothing short of magical. If Genshin wasn‚Äôt live service, this would be an easy 4.5/5 for sure. But it‚Äôs not. This game has the worst returns for real life time that I‚Äôve ever seen. 8 minutes for 1 resin. With that you can less than 1 level on your weapons. 1 hour and 20 minutes for nothing. A domain is 20 resin (2hrs 40min) for 1 bad 5star artifact, or a minimal amount of talent/weapon ascension material. Then there‚Äôs the expeditions. 20 real hours for items that could be easily obtained within 20 minutes of casual play. And the Adventure rank system‚Ä¶ pathetic. The months of effort and time to rank up ONCE past 55 earns you the i game equivalent of pennies. The fact that none of these changes - or those that have been brought up by the playerbase numerous times - have not even been acknowledged is disturbing. Especially for a game that is constantly updated. I love the memories this game has given me and for them I am thankful. But I can never and will never recommend this game to ANYONE, for how poorly it responds to the community.
title: One of the Worst Live Service Experiences

review: Overall, this game is stunningly beautiful and the game mechanics are well thought out and in depth compared to even most AAA titles. However, where this game falls short is the fast of how much it costs to be able to upkeep the game itself. If you are a person who gets dedicated to a game and wants to grind, this game might be too much you. The amount of investment to level a single character to maximum level will literally take months of daily grinding using the little bit of Resin they give you. The worst part of it all is it seems the developers realize this and refuse to change their flawed system that they have implemented on their players. The response to us not having enough Resin was met with an increased cap of Resin... but that doesn‚Äôt fix how long it takes to refill? Even without the Resin issue there still character tomes (xp) Imbalance issues, Mora income imbalance issues, heck even basic character xp issues from combat. I will reiterate that this game is beautiful and a blast to play but for long term investment it just doesn‚Äôt seem worth it. For now it will take my spot for the Gacha that I play but will be looking for other games to take its place as the grind is far too great.
title: Fantastic game, Long term investment needs work..

review:
I adore this game and all of its beautiful characters and environments.  It‚Äôs my comfy game that I come to in order to relax and enjoy the stories, as well as the battles.  I think they‚Äôve stayed consistent with the quality of characters and regions. 

I do have a complaint, and it is a common one- resin.  What a pain.  I wish I could do more farming for artifacts and other materials.  AND/OR they could open up all domains all days of the week.  It‚Äôs frustrating to plan out when I can farm for a certain character or weapon, and then end up blowing through resin in almost no time.  I don‚Äôt want to buy more primogems for it either.  I already blow those on characters, and it takes a lot to earn them.   I understand the gacha model, but come on .. we are so hooked and so loyal, you could give us all a little boost in the resin department/or other ways to earn it that aren‚Äôt so time consuming.  Please and thank you.

I am an adult with a full time job and I love coming home to Genshin.  I just dislike having to wait certain days to level up my new faves.
title: A beautiful game

review:
I honestly kinda had high hopes for this game when i downloaded it because i watched some game plays about the game But it didn‚Äôt turn out well, This game is going to need major bug fixes for the mobile before doing anything else with the game like updates and so on. And i know i should play on the ‚Äúrecommended‚Äù version of the iPhone but you cant expect people to go out and buy some expensive phone just to play some lame game. 
For more the opening of the game is my first impression. I just ended up with a nice headache because i used headphones. The audio was.. like all scratched up or, i don't know how to put this and the animation or video or.. whatever you want to call it was stopping non stop. The only smooth part of it was the character picking and picking your name. Then once i finally loaded up i was surrounded with darkness, that made it really uncomfortable. 
I‚Äôll still and try to play the game and might leave another review. all i want is the mobile experience for ALL versions of the iPhone to be improved and not just the iPhone i want all the different platforms experience to improve if ey are having this same problem 

And sorry if this sounds all weird, random or doesn‚Äôt sound right. I don't have the best English.
title: Meh...

review:
I actually really enjoy this game! This is the first time i‚Äôve played a game like this, so it‚Äôs definitely challenging as well as a fun experience! Although, there are quite a few problems with co-op. 

Starting off, quite a few players haven‚Äôt been able to join their friends‚Äô worlds. When one requests to join their friends‚Äô world, the friend doesn‚Äôt receive a notification that someone is requesting to join their world. Secondly, when my friend joins my world, i‚Äôm suddenly not able to talk to the npcs. This is a huge hinderance since we want to do quests together! Even after my friend leaves and comes back, it still won‚Äôt work. As for me (since it‚Äôs my world), it takes me quite a few times to leave and come back to get the npcs to work again! Lastly, there should DEFINITELY be more co-op story quests available. As to my knowledge, there are no co-op story quests, which is a bit heart breaking. 

I want to enjoy having fun with my friend with not only world quests (which we rarely get to do since the npcs don‚Äôt work during co-op), but with story quests too! I genuinely hope the creators take not of the reviews from the players so we can all have a fun time.
title: Co-Op Bug

review:
For the amount of time I have been playing this game I have come to realize that it isn‚Äôt really intended for mobile device users. Now don‚Äôt get me wrong, the design of the game is amazing! You really feel like you are living in a fantasy world, the music and landscape are wonderful. Though, I have been continuously having the problem of the game just not loading. I have to keep closing and reopening the app to be able to proceed, otherwise I will spend 3 minutes at a black screen with fantasy music playing. That may not sound so bad, but 75% of the time I am trying to play the game I encounter this problem. So warning to mobile users, beware of this problem and not just dive in immediately. Consider using a PC if you have one. I should also tell you that it does not just impact the amount of time it loads, but it also takes away from the amazing animation. You end up just staring at the beginning of it and hearing the scratchy noises of the narrator of that animation.

Then again, this game is amazing! I totally recommend playing it. The characters that you meet are very easy to get attached to and there is no shortage of quests.
title: Not what I expected...

review:
I love this game! It has beautiful features and really good quest, weapons, and Characters, BUT! Whenever I try to pull for a character and I get a gold, Their I get‚Ä¶ A WEAPON!!! And im on a CHARACTER banner, trying to get Venti or something! But the fact that Genshin made it so that WEAPONS ESPECIALLY 5 STAR WEAPONS WHEN IM TRYING TO GET A 5 STAR CHARACTER!!! But 3 star weapons are understandable in the CHARACTER banner, but when ever I do get a pink/purple Pull or a golden pull, I almost NEVER get a 4 star or 5 star CHARACTER! So I ask of you Genshin! Please just make a update so that 5 star weapons AND MAYBE 4 star weapons MAYBE, can just stay on the WEAPON BANNER instead of interrupting the chance of getting a really cool 5 star character! So just make it so that 5 star weapons at least 5 star weapons TO STAY IN THE WEAPON BANNER, AND STAY OUT OF THE CHARACTER BANNER. Especially for people who have NO LUCK like me T-T its hard to get the good characters and its rare! Like for me I HARDLY GET CHARACTERS!!!! I only get weapons! And I dont think its fair to a bunch of people either! So again PLEASE fix this!!! Otherwise really great game
And i hope you continue to grow the game! Good luck and bye
title: I Love the game but‚Ä¶

review: I love Genshin so much, but there are a few irks. The lack of melanin in characters is alarming.. and also the cultural appropriation. Not to mention the file space on mobile. As a mobile user myself, there were rumors or ‚Äúleaks‚Äù going around stating that come the 2.8 update players would be able to delete past files to free up storage. While I do not know if this was ever true or not, I wished it was. Sadly that rumor has been debunked and now Im deleting precious photos, videos, apps, and so much more just for this game. I would appreciate it if Genshin was just a little more mobile friendly :D. I would also like to see a change in character design and skin color. POC (People of color) characters have been scarce and if there are poc characters, theyre harmful stereotypes. It would be lovely to see POC characters increase amongst the other characters PROPERLY. Now, hoyoverse if you think melanin characters wouldnt make bank, youre wrong. I would love to pull for a POC 5 star in the game and see them with a proper design and playstyle that isnt harmful. Though tjere is a rise in melanin characters, theyre only NPCS. It would be much appreciated if they were the actual playable characters. But overall this game is a wonder. Truly plenty of space to explore, and lore to speak of. Really just lets your mind wander.
title: Love the game but..

review: Ill have to admit, I wasn‚Äôt a big fan of genshin when I first downloaded the app. I thought it was too hard and I could never rank up. But now, I find the game really fun! The places you can explore makes it better. Such as Mondstadt, Liyue, Inazuma, Dragonspine, Etc..But overall the story quests are amazing. I just redownloaded the game to try it again. I‚Äôm now Adventure Rank 24, and I‚Äôm trying to do the Liyue Archon quest. So good so far. Plus, every character has their own design. And with Ayato coming out soon, we‚Äôll be able to do more quests. The entire lore of this game is awesome! Venti, the Anemo God, also known as Barbatoes. Zhongli, the Geo God. And Raiden Shogun, the Electro God. All of the gods are 5star characters. You‚Äôre able to get good weapons and good characters as well. Such as Fischl. Fischl is a 4star Electro bow user. I used her to fight bosses all the time. The pity system is also great. The highest pity you can go up to to get a 5star character or weapon is 90. Not that bad, now is it? Overall, the game is amazing! If your looking for a fun RPG story game, this would be the one!
title: Amazing RPG action game overall!

review:
How about add a pvp system or a multiplayer pvp system in game? 
Because some players like me likes this game about everything about it like the characters, graphics, the animals roaming around and we can actually make them our food oh and the mobs all over the map and also roaming around not like any other games I have ever played. But I feel like there is something missing, which is pvp. I love the game‚Äôs battle system where u can actually doge skills but we are only playing with NPCs which we can get use to because they are programmed to fight like how do fight. But pvp is gonna be a challenge or unpredictable of how the players move. I was think of a rank system where the more you win the higher and much harder players there will be and maybe a 1v1-4v4 match up? And the lobby will be you world and invite your friends on your lobby and start the match up while you are doing what ever you‚Äôre doing on the world then it will tell you to get ready when you are matched up with another then to you to another world/area.
title: Ideas for genshin impact

review: I really love the game and I‚Äôm enjoying it quite a lot. It‚Äôs really a fun game and I like the variety of missions that you can do as well as the characters in the game. I especially enjoy the characters the most. My only complaint on the game is that I‚Äôve noticed that when you choose to play as the male traveller the characters you interact with still refer to you as female when voiced but the captions do refer to you as male. So I would like to see that resolved in a future update, if possible. I like that I was able to choose the gender of my character giving it a RPG feel to the game which I really love. However,  I‚Äôm not fond of how because I didn‚Äôt select the female character the voices of the characters I interact with don‚Äôt follow the dialogue of the game captions so I‚Äôll hear them calling me a girl or hear them say ‚Äúhope you find your brother‚Äù but when I read the dialogue I‚Äôll be reading the opposite. The upside is that I‚Äôve noticed that Paimon seems to get the genders right so at least my travel companion doesn‚Äôt refer to me as the wrong gender. Lol.
title: My personal opinion on Genshin Impact

review: I love the game, I enjoy most everything about it. I just can‚Äôt play it a lot because of logistical reasons. It takes up about 50% of my storage which wouldn‚Äôt be a huge deal except for the fact that I have couple other problems. I would maybe play more when I‚Äôm on the go, to and from places except that it gets really laggy, I understand that it‚Äôs a big game, but it is also laggy when I‚Äôm at home‚Ä¶ The game also drains my phone battery, which once again, I understand that it‚Äôs a large game,however, that doesn‚Äôt change the fact that it isn‚Äôt very convenient for me. I do happen to have an Xbox though, and I do use one of my wireless controllers to play on my phone. It works just as well with my controller as with the touch commands. What I‚Äôm trying to say in a round about way is that you should put the game out on Xbox. That would fix all of the problems that I am having on mobile. Again, I do love the game, but it would be much better if I could just play it on my Xbox console because of the storage and the cleaner game play. I appreciate you taking the time to read this and I hope you have a great day.
title: Too much space and kind of laggy

review: ive been playing genshin for over a year now and its great! i play nearly everyday and its all i do in my free time. however i do have some issues with it. its NOT free to play friendly at all. grinding for primogems (the gachas currency) can take WEEKS to be able to get enough for a ten pull if youre a late game player. you need at LEAST 90 pulls for a guaranteed 5star. i think this system would be pretty good for the players if it didn‚Äôt take 160 primogems for 1 wish, seeing as though opening one chest can give you anywhere from 2-10 primogems. another thing i have an issue with is the absolute massive amount of storage this game takes up. i play on both pc and mobile and its an issue with both platforms. this game takes up 20 GB so far, 1/3 of my total storage, AND ITS NOT EVEN FULLY RELEASED YET. the mobile player base will probably die out within this year because of how much storage this game needs. pretty soon ill have to buy another storage card for my pc because it‚Äôs almost filled. genshin is the only game i even play on the computer and its still a MONSTROUS amount. i think this game needs LOTS of improvement, but these are just my biggest critiques.
title: very fun but‚Ä¶

review: This game is fantastic at the start. However the biggest turnoff is when you get closer you endgame, you‚Äôll see how this game is limiting you to build any character stats. Just like any other mobile game there is some type of energy system. Well this game has it, you are discouraged to keep continuing to upgrade your character as you have to wait or pay your way to grind. Grind? Did you hear that? The grind in this game is far worse than any other rpg I‚Äôve ever played. The energy system combined with RNG elements from getting the perfect drops for your character is insane. You can be grinding for months and still haven‚Äôt got the stats you want for one character. I‚Äôm currently suffering from burnouts endgame, mainly since I really can‚Äôt enjoy building my characters and lack of challenges. This game is predominantly story-focused and adventuring. You will find your self not challenged in the story. The only challenge in this whole game is an arena mode, called spiral abyss. Which you have to fight through 12 floors and rinse and repeat. It‚Äôs a pain to have RNG elements and energy system tied together. It‚Äôs a pain to catch limited events to farm a currency to roll on an another character. Mihoyo needs to do better, otherwise I can‚Äôt justify playing this game years to come.
title: It‚Äôs great but.. ENDGAME..

review:
This game is so good I could lost so many good things about it. First of all the fighting part of the game is tons of fun. The fighting is just hard enough to not be impossible, also I like the different abilities you could have as different characters. One thing I‚Äôm confused about though when I play I look at the characters area and I see one of my unlocked characters says it‚Äôs I have a trial for it. You might have to fix that(unless it‚Äôs supposed to be like that). Another thing I love about the game is the adventures, you can go so many places to without running out of fun. It‚Äôs also a lot of fun to do the adventure quest ones where you have to go find the fight. The collection of differ things from chests and barrels is also super fun because you never know what you get. The cooking in the game is fun because then it‚Äôs easy to get health back but I feel like the cooking should be a little harder because it‚Äôs just time it right, and it‚Äôs pretty easy to do. 

This game is just so amazing I could keep on writing about so many different details. (It was worth downloading 5GB of space for this game)
title: Amazing game

review: I love the game, and I think it‚Äôs so fun to play! To unlock more map, to story quests, fight bosses, get new characters, level up artifacts and characters, do fun character storylines, etc! There is so much art built into this game that any anime lover would love, and if someone finds themselves looking for a challenging game, this is it! Yes, yes, it is so time consuming, and includes a lot of hard work, but it‚Äôs all so worth it! I normally play a game for a little then get so bored of the storyline or anything with it, but in here, I feel so accomplished and happy unlocking new things! In which I never due with most games, this one keeps going on and on, and no matter how long it takes me, I am looking forward to new updates, and more characters, and my main goal, is to get some of the best characters yet! (Except for Qiqi, if you Genshin players know what I mean..) I hope whoever sees this, will go and try this game out, as I‚Äôve become so addicted to it! And have fallen in love with this games storyline! Thank you for reading this if you have made it this far<3 BYEE
title: Best game eva <3

review: Genshin Impact is an amazing game with an even better story. Well, now it has an even better story. Mondstadt was fine, Liyue was basically a fetch quest, I just didn‚Äôt like the Inazuma one, but Sumeru was where the writing team really stepped up their game. The Samsara was beautifully written, I could actually respect their intricate plan(Unlike Inazuma), and the introduction of Nahida was done amazingly. And so far, Fontaine is doing well too. The first one showed off signs of the Justice system being terrible, and the second one introduced what I assume is gonna be the biggest thing in the entire Fontaine story from here on out. And if not, the biggest instrument in the lore of Fontaine. Keep it up writing team! Other than that, I also enjoy the story quests, especially Yoimiya‚Äôs quests, and the smaller quests were also pretty good. The combat is‚Ä¶ eh, I don‚Äôt play for that part. It‚Äôs fine? Other than that, the only reason it‚Äôs my second favorite game is because it has none of the space efficiency and nostalgia of Cookie Run: Kingdom. Luckily, my dad has a PC.
title: My second favorite game

review: I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact for almost a year now, and the gameplay is fun, the story‚Äôs are good and the characters well written (mostly). My one problem is how pale they all are.  The darkest playable character in the game is Xinyan, and she hasn‚Äôt been given any black features other than her skin, and while she does have a little more melanin than the other characters, it isn‚Äôt right to excuse the colorism that is going on in this game. Almost all the characters are pale white or very very pale tan, including characters that are inspired by darker people (for example: Candace). People have talked about it many times but we never see the issue being addressed or solved. This is especially a issue because the regions (Monstadt, Liyue, Inazuma, Sumeru, Fontaine, etc;) are different regions where they should have different skin tones but don‚Äôt. In real life, Most people in Asia arent even pale white, but a mixture of tans, brown and blasian people, so why can‚Äôt this be shown in Genshin Impact? It would improve the game so much and there would definitely be more players if you actually listened to this. Please solve this issue because not just everyone in the world is pale.
title: Love it but need more inclusion

review:
Apple store editors choice and well deserved. A flagship title for the appstore and an amazing game all around, have yet to find an aspect about the game i don‚Äôt like. it‚Äôs jam packed with hours upon hours of exploration, quests, it‚Äôs regularly updated and not pay to win. large open world games like this are especially hard to come by and for a ios/android title it really sets the bar high. it‚Äôs got plenty of mechanics in place to keep you intrigued and wanting to go out and complete quests to level up your characters or their gear. 

the only reason i deducted a star is because of the lack of customization, a must have in any open world RPG. there‚Äôs no character creation, no special moves to choose for the characters you have unlocked, and not even outfits. the closest thing the game has to customization is changing your glider. not to mention the glide function had a lot more potential than it was given

Don‚Äôt let that negative aspect ruin your experience however, it‚Äôs still honestly even trumps some console and PC games in my opinion and i believe anyone who avidly or even casually games on their pocket device should try it out.
title: Editors choice and well deserved.

review: I love Genshin Impact I really do. I love the type of games where it‚Äôs an open world and you can do whatever and go wherever you want, I love those types of games. Genshin was really fun and addicting and well written in the beginning but as I started to play more, it seemed like there wasn‚Äôt really a storyline anymore. And if I wanted to continue the storyline I would have to grind my adventure level for like 30 minutes just to level up once. Mihoyo idk if you guys read your reviews but just update your game more instead of adding characters. Make the upgrading mechanic a little easier, maybe add other ways to upgrade. And I know a lot of people can agree with me on this one: add character customization please. Let us be able to customize our hair, skin tone, clothes, weapons, shoes all that stuff. The next time you update your game ADD CHARACTER CUSTOMIZATION. Overall the game is pretty good. There are some minor downfalls but it‚Äôs really good. So I‚Äôm giving it 5 stars. Great job on the game Mihoyo but please just add some more stuff to the game.
title: I really love this game

review:
An incredible game that reminded both me and my friends of hits that came before, such as Breath of the Wild and Assassin‚Äôs Creed. 
I started the game on ps4, and quickly got it on all my devices. It still shocks me how a game that has such intense world building and story can be played simply from my phone. I was intimidated by the game at first, and all of its features, but quickly picked up the many fun controls and features. The game is a breath of fresh air for not just mobile games but the industry in general. A game thats free to play, has generous gacha mechanics that aren‚Äôt insanely impossible, and has such an immersive story is one sure to secure its place within gaming history. Each character, both exclusive to the story and events, have a history and a past, talents and themes that match who they are, and talented voice actors. Some of who you may recognize from other games (such as Ryuji‚Äôs VA from Persona5)! 

The game is so much fun and is worth the hype. There‚Äôs a reason why the internet and gaming communities in general went crazy for this title and it‚Äôs deserved!!
title: Incredible Game

review: ive been playing genshin impact since xiaos banner (im ar 55), and one of my biggest issues is the resin system. i have to farm multiple times daily because i dont have enough resin (this is with fragile resin and transient resin) to farm for my characters ascension , their weapons , AND their talents. i have to farm talent level ups , weapon level ups , and heros wit + character ascension materials. i simply do not have enough resin to do all of those things without having to wait days at a time. i would also like to mention the horrible pity system , and the impossible to get primogems. theres a certain point in the game where its so hard to be f2p , and its easy to quit. it could take about a month for someone whos f2p to get just a simple 10 pull without help of events/updates/gamecodes. our anniversary rewards are a complete joke unless mhy has something planned. we got the same rewards for the lantern rite‚Ä¶im not ungrateful for the 10 fates i just wish there could be something more given to us as players. other than these issues i love the graphics , and i love the storyline. both are amazing and i wish i could replay a lot of the main/character quests ^^ i also really love the character designs they are really cute !
title: i love the game but

review:
It‚Äôs challenging on my iPhone 6‚Äìprobably because it‚Äôs a lower end device‚Äîbut it still runs and it‚Äôs fantastic on my laptop. It‚Äôs a free world RPG with magic, character building, a fun gacha component (that‚Äôs difficult to understand at first but easy to use for free when you figure it out), interesting world building and characters, and beautiful graphics and music. The first anniversary rewards *are* disappointing so far, but it‚Äôs truly not a big deal, and the recent 1 star reviews based on that are extremely embarrassing. 

The game is free, so just give it a shot if you‚Äôre not sure about it. Despite what the complainers cry about, the game is perfectly fun and playable without spending a dime. I would recommend not going through it too fast though‚ÄîI completed the first two regions very quickly and didn‚Äôt have much to do in terms of exploration or achievements before the next region was released, but major updates happen every 6 weeks, so if you pace your gameplay just right you won‚Äôt run out of content.
title: Great fantasy RPG‚Äîignore the recent complainers

review: It is up to personal preference but it is too much of storybook or movie for me. The gameplay it has is redundant collection, long walks to waypoints you usually don‚Äôt have yet type of games. It has tons of cutscenes and dialogue screens. It has a decent story but in my opinion it‚Äôs overbearing. Now I don‚Äôt want to narc on this game,  I liked the combat and characters I started playing Genshin the first week it came out. But I have just grown tired of the routine like gameplay. It has great graphics and the characters overall are likable. But backing up, the missions that aren‚Äôt story quests are usually the same old mission you have played 20x before. The side quest are long enough to be actual storylines themselves and the spacing of way points in is bothersome. They usually get you kind of close to where you are going. But some quests have you out where there is 30 minutes of climbing and no waypoint to avoid climbing forever. So if you are a story driven player this game is for you. but if you like unique fights you mostly face the same enemies. Cutscenes and run about missions throw you into the action then pull you right back out of it. I wanted to love Genshin but it just isn‚Äôt my game, not that it‚Äôs Mihoyo‚Äôs fault they can‚Äôt make everyone happy no matter how hard they try.

title: My thinking of Genshin Impact!

review: I would definitely game if you like RPG and action stuff. I started playing in March and the gameplay is amazing! But, there are some  problems with the game. #1. Wishing, Let‚Äôs be honest, We all hate losing a 50/50 to a character like Diluc, Jean, Qiqi, Keqing, Or Mona. I find it really annoying because I lost my 50/50 for Zhongli and Yelan. But at least I got a new character! #2. Graphics, I remember before I changed onto this iPad, The graphics were really low. Even with it all on high it would lag a lot and it was still low quality. title: Great game but..

review: I love this game! It has consumed me for weeks.  I‚Äôve been looking for a game that actually has a RPG gameplay with grinding and an open world for forever. Plus it‚Äôs not pay to play or one of those games where you have to rely on other players to proceed or beat bosses.  It does have a co-op mode which is easy to use during special events, but not mandatory to win. The story is nothing special but you can skip through dialogue if you‚Äôre bored and still complete everything without confusion. My only real issue is the advertising that this game has seven continents to explore when there are only two. Once you finish those you‚Äôre just left with no missions and wondering where to go next and what you need to find! Eventually I went online and asked where I go next and I found out that the game is still being developed that the other continents aren‚Äôt open and it‚Äôll be months and months before they do.  I think that should be made apparent or you just should talk about how you can explore all 7 continents.

The only problem is the storage. I would‚Äôve started much earlier if I had the storage on my phone. Tried to download the game SO many times, and now I play it on my new laptop! I became a venti main the moment I got him! I hate how people turn all of it about race and skin color, knowing that they wouldn‚Äôt give a crap if there were super dark colored characters in a nation representing pale people. They‚Äôre being racist themselves, and not even realizing it. The characters are beautiful and people don‚Äôt know how to just enjoy the game, and they make EVERYTHING about race. I love this game, keep it up! I might start on Honkai too soon, depending on how much daily grind there is. -A random Barbatos main
title: Best thing I‚Äôve ever been forced into!

review:
Genshin impact is easily one of the BEST open world games I‚Äôve seen, and it is successful to be entertaining. I think the characters are great, and they have interesting backstories. However, I don‚Äôt like how anti free to play the game is. Yes it is simple to play as a free to play, but if you want a 5 star character it‚Äôs a completely different story. Primogems are annoying and tedious to get as a free to play, and when you get them you often only get a few. Let‚Äôs say it‚Äôs 2021, and the raiden shogun banner just came out. I have 1673 primogems. I can afford 1 ten pull, and It took me 4 hours to get my primogems. I get nothing good, I grind for 7 ten pills which is enough for the 50/50! I get Diluc. The game is honestly just begging for money, and I hate it.

Another topic I really hate, characters. Specifically, the female ones. 
Every female character you see with interesting, sad, or traumatic backstory is depressed. They show almost no emotion other than being flirty or bored. But traveler fixes them, woohoo! 
I just think that honkai showed a characters emotions much better than genshin does, and I wish that could be changed.
title: Great game, but..

review:
I downloaded this game and started playing at the beginning of 2.0. The first thing I saw was of course, the loading screen. title: Absolutely Phenomenal

review: This game is very popular and I love it too. The story line, setting design, character design, etc. There are some things I have some issues with mainly with WiFi and downloading. WiFi for genshin needs to be strong so you don‚Äôt lag out, but lots of people don‚Äôt have really strong WiFi (coming from a mobile player) The downloading also takes pretty long at least an hour. Though, I‚Äôm okay with part of this because the game is really detailed it needs all of this. Improvements could be made and I do have suggestions. Such as the anniversary gift, not many people enjoyed it because the gift was to many people for f2p people. title: Love it with some suggestions

review: Ok, you guys have definitely raised the bar with mobile games. I‚Äôve been playing rpg games, open world games, mmorpg‚Äôs, gacha collect games, and etc for years without being satisfied in the long term. However, this game right here has definitely raised the bar. From the moment I first downloaded it, to now, I‚Äôve been honestly impressed. The graphics are amazing, the gameplay is beautiful, the characters are unique, the interactions are very well thought out, and the storyline is very intricate. I also love the way that you can incorporate elements and combinations to turn tides in battle, and the way that different characters have different things to offer in terms of combat. EVEN THE MENU SCREENS ARE BEAUTIFUL. I definitely see myself playing this for years into the future and I hope that you guys make more content as we go on and add events and things. You‚Äôve earned it. This is the most beautiful, immersive, enjoyable game on the mobile market for me. Oh, and I heard there will be controller support? Kinda excited to see that added to the game since I mainly play on controllers. üëåüèæüëçüèæ
title: Finally!!!!!

review:
It‚Äôs an overall very good game. It has nice graphics, the characters are diverse, there are lots to do in the game. I am a casual f2p gamer. I love the open world and able to collect various things. On the other hand, you basically have to dedicate lots of time if you want to be good at this game or spend money. I don‚Äôt have time to even do commissions everyday, so I guess it‚Äôs my lost. But when I do have time to play, it‚Äôs a lot to catch up with and I have to skip multiple banners to even get close to getting a 5 star and even if I get it. My first 5 star took 120+ pulls. I know I‚Äôm unlucky but that‚Äôs ridiculous. A lot of the hidden mechanics of the game, such as the pity system, is sometimes hard to understand for players like myself. It‚Äôs sometimes overwhelming. Also, the UI is extremely confusing. It is difficult to navigate and everything is super cluster. It‚Äôs endless menu options. Can we also get a ‚Äúskip dialogue‚Äù and activity status options please?

This game is just right up my ally. It‚Äôs just hard to keep up with, like the in-game gameplay and external events. (Sorry it‚Äôs long ü§™üß¢)
title: Neat lol

review:
I‚Äôll be honest, this game spoils the player base. And I love it. The amount of care and details that go into everything- from the lore, actual books that you can read, the npcs different actions depending on the nation, each characters well throughout design (both in appearance, attacks, personalities/voice lines, and elemental skills).  
There‚Äôs a lot to do. Wanna go fishing? Wanna farm to better your characters/personal level? Wanna go on story quests to get to know the characters? Or hangout events, or world quests, or the main quest, or the events. You can cook, make a house, catch critters, fight monsters, delve into the complex stories and theories. Hunt for the most aesthetically pleasing character. 100% the map. Beat the spiral abyss. Explore the nations. And, most importantly, find your lost twin. 

I play nearly every day, and have been playing since the game came out. Each update welcomes new events or even open world locations. Not to mention that it‚Äôs still going! 
I got the game without any understanding of what it would be like, and I love it!
