title: Amazing game

review: I just want to say how much I admire the work that was put into creating this game for mobile. The level of detail and overall immersion involved in this game really can make you wanna play for hours just discovering the land! I mean yes the combat system is by far one of the best that I have encountered not only amongst RPG genre but for many other combat involved games as well, Genshin Impact takes the cake! My only suggestion as for something to make the experience even better, would be controller support. I‚Äôm sure you folks down in development have heard this a million times over, but please would you consider at least adding it for a short time and letting us, the players, decide if we like it or not. There are many of us who prefer mobile or can‚Äôt afford consoles so for you to make this one a mobile was a huge one up for the mobile community. It‚Äôs just that some of us still enjoy remote control playing. If you could please hear us out, it‚Äôs the only thing we are asking. Oh and of course PVP!! Because who doesn‚Äôt love PVP! And then maybe co-op campaign?
title: OUTSTANDING! I HOPE IT LASTS FOREVER!

review:
This game doesn‚Äôt know whether it wants to be a Gatcha game, an online interactive game via external web events, or a single-player RPG. It doesn‚Äôt make a good hybrid out of any of these paths because Hoyoverse is constantly stretching in different direction. For example, why splinter and fragment both storytelling and collectible opportunities into multiple events outside the game? 

This issue as a whole doesn‚Äôt too heavily affect current players. But for returning players, I frankly have no interest in anything that‚Äôs coming out for Genshin. Somehow, I fondly remember being enraptured by the Liyue and Monstadt areas. But, upon returning, I‚Äôm plopped into in-game quests with no context whatsoever. I have quests in Fontaine despite never having visited the region, even if the quest description says I have. I‚Äôm barraged by a multitude of web events also out of context. Frankly, these issues aren‚Äôt novel or unique in the game industry, but Genshin‚Äôs always-online and constantly updating nature exacerbates the issue. This state of the game is disappointing for returning players, and I haven‚Äôt even gotten to the inconsistent storytelling quality, overly talkative Paimon, detached protagonist presence, etc.
title: Confused Identity

review: This game can be very tiring, boring, repetitive, and angering. The chats censorship needs to be worked on because bullying and rude comments are very very common with people you co-op. Hackers get into accounts quite easily and mod the game with many inappropriate things but the creators haven‚Äôt really done much to prevent this. Despite all of these things it can be a very good game to play. It‚Äôs for sure one of my most favorite games. While working on the main quests it‚Äôs very interesting but there is a lot of unnecessarily long conversations between the characters, same with the side quests. The voice acting is pretty good and most of the characters have well thought out stories, personalities and each individual life experiences. I haven‚Äôt found any plot holes or things that haven‚Äôt really made sense. Graphics are great and most of the events are fun. A open world game which is great for when you‚Äôre bored and have nothing to do. I like that this game gives you space to think and imagine the relationships between each character. I‚Äôve grown to really like the puzzles on the game.
title: Mostly good

review: I love this game, i even made a new account due to not being able to log into my old one. I‚Äôve been enjoying restarting the game playing on the ps5. However later into the game I‚Äôve experienced some bugs. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs because of the updates but what seems to happen to me a lot is i will get attacked and lose hp during dialogue when i am unable to move. I don‚Äôt know why this is happening but it‚Äôs a serious issue and it‚Äôs very frustrating so please fix this. Another issue going on for me is the enemies following me outside of the radius where the i should fight them. I‚Äôm not sure how far it is but i know they shouldn‚Äôt be following me into an area where there are other civilians and where only conversations takes places. I do not like being attacked when I‚Äôm supposed to have conversations to progress in the story. Other than the couples of issues I‚Äôve been experiencing recently the game is amazing. Graphics are beautiful and i enjoy the puzzles in the game. It‚Äôs makes it more interesting during quest instead having to fight all the time.
title: This game is bugged

review: Honestly, I love this game so much. It consumes so much of my time and it got me through Covid. However, it takes up so much storage, and it‚Äôs hard to have access to all the fancy computers required to play the game. I have a Nintendo switch, but the promised port never came. I got C3 Diluc today and the gatcha rates are just embarrassing. I was pulling for albedo, a character I‚Äôve wanted since I started playing, and I got diluc again, the only standard character I‚Äôve ever gotten. I‚Äôm not complaining about losing the 50/50 because it happens, and that‚Äôs how the game makes money. However, the rates are horrible. Being F2P is a nightmare if you want to hit big numbers and it‚Äôs really hard to get through the game. Other than that, the graphics, soundtrack and character details are stunning, even if there is a bit of a pixelated lag every now and then. I would completely recommend this to anyone looking for a fun action RPG. love this game to death, but please please please don‚Äôt hesitate when helping out F2Ps with getting characters and weapons that can suit their team.
title: Honest Opinions from an AR 51 Genshin Player

review: I adore this game. The artstyle, combat, story. It‚Äôs all really amazing, and if you‚Äôre looking for a fun I open world game to play I can‚Äôt recommend this enough. It‚Äôs free on all platforms and has cross save, so it‚Äôs great on the go or at home. One issue though, resin. Resin is an awful system. You get limited amounts a day then you have to wait hours for it to restore. Resin is used for almost everything you grind, money key limes, exp key limes, domains, events. For all the things you can do with it you don‚Äôt have near enough of it. After you do the main story the game relies on you to grind your characters up, and get new ones to incentivize playing but you can‚Äôt for more than an hour because the resin system prevents long term gains. You should add a system where you can stack resin if you‚Äôre not using it, or increase the cap. Anything to make resin a resource that drains less quick. I want to spend hours grinding on your game but the resin system prevents that. Though that being said, there is a lot of things that don‚Äôt use resin such as side quests, main quests, and exploring so it‚Äôs still a great game despite this system.
title: Great game, mediocre system.

review: While the game has outstanding overall production (which is be the one thing that will reel you in to play the game) it‚Äôs not until you invest a ton of time into the game do you realize it‚Äôs mediocracy. For an open world game, it is a very bland experience. While the sights are nice to look at, the exploration is terrible because of how little the game rewards you for exploring. You‚Äôre basically running around looking for chests that included nothing more than exp fodder. The progression is also terrible, probably one of the worst I‚Äôve seen because of how many materials it takes to completely build a character while the game hardly gives you the necessary resin to do so. The rng aspect of the artifact drops is also horrendous. While the game is open world, it gets old rather quickly because of how you manually have to run around the map and collect food ingredients, ore, enemy mats and such. It is a very monotonous and tedious task to do this on a daily basis. Gameplay is rather average; it has the same fundamentals as it‚Äôs predecessor Honkai Impact 3rd. Having listed all my gripes of the game, I believe my rating of the game is justified. In my opinion the only praise-worthy aspect of the game is it‚Äôs production.
title: Pretty but..

review:
I love this game and it is currently is one of my favorites. I definitely recommend. A lot of people have talked about it‚Äôs pros so I‚Äôm not going to spend a lot of time on that and get straight to what I don‚Äôt like. Hopefully the developers may see this. 
One thing I dislike is that characters true potentials are locked behind constellations. The only way to unlock constellations is to win that character multiple times through a gacha system, which is incredibly hard to do unless you pay a crap ton of money. I think constellations should be more accessible, with other ways to unlock them. For example, with primogems, an in-game currency. Or, you should be able to trade characters you do not want for constellation material. 
Also, I‚Äôve never been a fan of gacha systems. It‚Äôs incredibly frustrating not getting what you worked / paid for. I think the rates could be a bit better. 
Other than that, the game is awesome. Those problems are a bit annoying, but do not overall ruin the game and it‚Äôs still worth playing.
title: Amazing, but constellations need to be more accessible

review: I know there‚Äôs more content coming out which is great but once you finish the story so far the games true character comes out. It‚Äôs nothing but a cash grab. Once you have beaten the story everything left to requires money to do. Console quality graphics and story. Mobile game mechanics and monetization.  This game is a gacha game meaning there‚Äôs a gambling element to it. For characters and weapons. Compares to other games in this category the rates for pulling characters and weapons are FAR lower than other games and the cost for pulling is twice as much as most other games. Character progression is gated behind an energy system on top of a grinding system. Most other games of this type are far more generous with their energy system.  It gets worse. You can spend hundreds trying to get a specific top tier character you want but only to realize that the character is in balanced to the point where he is out classed by mid tier characters. Once the entire players base is up in arms about this the developer responds basically with ‚Äúlol git gud‚Äù. So my advice for everyone is enjoy the game for what it is. Take your time to go through the story and don‚Äôt spend a single time. Use the free rolls you earn and don‚Äôt spend another time trying to pull anything else. It‚Äôs just not worth it.
title: Great starting out. Terrible endgame.

review: I‚Äôm quite surprised with the production quality of this game. For the internet to brush it off as a BotW knock of does it a disservice to the overall experience. Sure there are mechanics like climbing and use of a glider, gathering materials spread through out the over world, and the general environmental design and look similarities. But due to the combat and now the narrative is progressed, it‚Äôs a far different experience. It‚Äôs has taken good aspects of BotW and established it‚Äôs own game, I consider this to be a homage with extreme similarities than just a knock off trying to piggy back on BotW popularity and polish. I myself brushed it off as a BotW copy cat, but I was very surprised to be wrong about that. Now I hope the gacha mechanic doesn‚Äôt sour the overall experience and make it worth while for free to play players. Though like Arknights, I hope this game becomes something the player wants to put in their own hard earned money due to how well made this game might be. But this only has bouts been released, and the studio probably are planning to hold events like other gacha games, adding to the game.
title: Not what you expect

review:
in over 20 years of gaming, I‚Äôve never found a game that I‚Äôve been able to play so long and get so much out of. New content comes out every couple of months, and you can get full enjoyment out of the game even without paying a penny and without any ads. Yes if you pay money you can get the benefits faster, but not so much as to drastically distance paying customers from non paying. And since it‚Äôs not a competitive game, paying provides no real advantage other than speeding things up maybe 2-3x. 

People complaining that it doesn‚Äôt give enough rewards and gives less than other games are just being greedy and childish. This is by far the most balanced gacha game I‚Äôve played and their rewards are more than enough for players to get a five star character every other month or so without paying a penny. And paying a modest $5 per month can double that. No matter how much they give, people complain and want more. That is the definition of greed.
title: played this game longer than any other

review: Quit removing my reviews! Half of the reviews on here are paid reviews from bots. I can't believe everyone is completely satisfied with the current game mechanics. The artifact crafting system has to be the worst crafting system in gaming history. You can not alter the stats, and it just consumes twice as many artifacts. Not to mention the game is constantly working against you by giving you defense artifacts, when you desperately need crit. Good luck trying to do the abyss with all defense artifacts on your main dps character. Once you get past the poor artifact system you're faced with primogem exhaustion. The developers give primogem crumbs for rewards while making a unfair 50/50 system that will exhaust you out of fate wishes. Not to mention it takes 90 wishes for a guaranteed 5 star, but it might be the 5 star you want. You have no say who you lose your 50/50 to. Not to mention it takes 100$ for only 50 wishes. The game is designed to work against you... There's no end game content, so once you beat everything, you're just sitting there with a empty quest log until the developers release a new patch. Wait until the developers stop caring and stop supporting this game and start taking down servers. All that money you wasted will be for nothing!

review:
I‚Äôve seen plenty of ads for Genshin Impact and I wasn‚Äôt sure if it was like some other mobile games where the ad and the game are completely different. Safe to say, GI is exactly like it‚Äôs ads.
The world is beautifully crafted and fun to explore. The combat is engaging and is based off not just mashing the melee button but figuring out which characters element will give you an advantage against whichever enemies. 
This is a great game to have on your phone if you‚Äôre on the go but it‚Äôs also just a great game in general and has become my go to when chilling on the couch.
Keep an eye on your battery though, I played so much already that within a few hours I received the battery low message while in the middle of a fight. 
It‚Äôs a beautiful game with an interesting world and fun as h**l combat. If you have the space, download it and give it a try. There are in app purchases but nothing is mandatory for playing the game. I‚Äôve already sunk a few hours in and I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll sink many more into the lovely world.

I love this game and the story and the characters. The startling lack of representation outside of pale Asians and white Europeans, however, is a HUGE issue with this game. The next major update of this game is planning to mash several Middle Eastern and North African cultures into one, which is horrible and wrong. Plus, there is no acknowledgement of any African or Latine or Hispanic or Caribbean or Indigenous countries or cultures in this game at ALL. Nearly every single character in this game is pale, it‚Äôs like Hoyoverse is afraid of people who aren‚Äôt. Many video game developers have finally began to represent and acknowledge the diverse cultures and races that live around the world, why doesn‚Äôt Genshin reflect that? People of every race and shade love this game and it‚Äôs disheartening that those of us who are Black, Latine, Native, and outside of East Asia are never represented. For the Sumeru update, or for further notice, please bring on a team of developers and writers from around the world and fairly represent the different countries and people of the world individually as our cultures beautifully are. If you can do that for Japan, China, Germany, and France; please consider doing that for other countries as well, people are hurting at your decision and we want to see you do better. Thank you.
title: We deserve fair representation too, Hoyoverse!

review: I‚Äôve just got to say, this is an amazing game! The graphics are TOP TIER, the storyline is great! I love open world games. This game overall is great! What I don‚Äôt like is the gatcha system. It‚Äôs almost impossible to get any five star characters without paying a lot of money. I think that‚Äôs one BIG flaw to this game. The next thing I have an issue with is leveling and gaining experience. It‚Äôs getting more challenging as you progress through the game. Some people will just be stuck on AR 54-56 for months. To gain any kind of EXP you need resin, and domains cost 20 while bosses cost 40 and you have to make do with only the 160 you get which is really kind of crappy. It‚Äôs repetitive and that‚Äôs one of the reaosns why people are losing interest. I used to spend hours on Genshin grinding away and leveling through, but now I only spend about 30 minutes because there‚Äôs just nothing to do. Sometimes I just don‚Äôt even bother to log in anymore. I feel that with the way things are going, people will lose interest and stop playing Genshin all together, and that‚Äôs just sad. I really love this game but, I wish I could enjoy it more.
title: Awesome game but with a few struggles

review:
Storage is a huge problem for this app. I believe that in the 2.8 patch, its an option to delete the saved dialogue from quests (which shouldve been implemented right away). But the problem with this, if it was even added at all? You have to download the full game, including that saved dialogue first. Which doesnt make sense- in Honkai, your able to download the basic resources and then download voice&story if you wish later on. Genshin shouldve done this- it wouldve caused a LOT less trouble. Instead, your forced to download the full 15/16 gigs and THEN, if the feature is even available this update, possibly delete it. Genshin itself is a good rpg/exploration with a pretty good storyline. The storage space and lack of representation is the real problem. Would like to play a rerun of my favorite event before im unable to download it at all, but considering that ive spent literal hours trying to make space and download the game, i dont think im gonna be able to. Disappointing.

Edit: I‚Äôve discovered that i CANT actually download basic resources. Considering they‚Äôve done this with Honkai, id honestly expect that they would have added it WAY earlier in genshin. Spent 2 hours clearing up space just to delete again, wish it didnt take up about 15 of the 32 gb i have.
title: Storage.

title: I LOVE THIS GAME! just one problem.

review: Genshin is an AMAZING game, and it‚Äôs pretty much the only thing I play these days. The graphics and animations are amazing, and the voice acting is top notch. I love how the quests always have some sort of storyline behind it, and I always feel more urged to play, just to find out the ending! The whole wishing concept is also amazing, I remember being so excited to get my first five star, Kokomi, through it. Of course, I won‚Äôt forget about the adorable Paimon. Honestly, she just makes the game ten times better by adding comedy and just helping out. The new update is also so cool! I may or may not have a crush on Gorou. The game definitely deserves to be 5 stars. The only thing I would say is the fact that the amount of data it uses on my device makes it very long to load, especially if I don‚Äôt log on for a while. I would suggest making the loading screen with the elements take less time because I always need to swipe up and try again. Otherwise, it‚Äôs a great game and keep up the good work!!!

review: This is literally my favorite game. BUT THERE ARE IDIOTS THAT ARE NOT THANKFUL. Mihoyo is giving us our rewards. I know. It is a craze. title: Amazing! But for some other fans‚Ä¶

review: This is a super good game for being on a mobile device! I love everything about it except three things! I wish that there was a way to fully customise whichever sibling you choose to play as (hair, face, body, etc.), another way besides teleporting and gliding across the world (or running) I‚Äôve seen some mobile games add creatures such as horses or mythical animals that you can collect and I would personally love love love to have a horse and just run through this world! It‚Äôs already so beautiful and amazing I don‚Äôt want to teleport and the running is just a little too slow for my personal taste (It‚Äôs perfect when you‚Äôre in the city parts though!) and gliding to me is just meh. My last thing is pets! I would love to have some pets that could maybe help you out when you fight but in return you have to feed them food that you make or raw meat. If I only had to pick one of these three options I would totally go with the ridable creatures! Overall though I do really like this game. I normally get tired of a game after playing it for a few minutes but this one surprised me. I can‚Äôt wait to see what else you guys add to it!
title: Great Game!

review: I really really love Genshin Impact, the graphics are unlike any I‚Äôve seen in a mobile game, it‚Äôs really impressive. it‚Äôs super fun to fight enemies and switch around your characters to create different elemental reactions and the different fight styles & gameplays of the characters add a new fresh experience every time. Co-op is very fun to do as well, and ik there‚Äôs going to be future updates that‚Äôll add new functions to the friends list like being able to chat with your friends and set notes for them. the only thing that I‚Äôd like changed is the artifacts and if maybe there were just an easier way to assign them to characters without individually having to look at each of the stats and what set bonuses they provide, but that‚Äôs just my own insight since I take a lot of time and consideration into choosing artifacts for my characters so it‚Äôs rather tedious and I have to focus hard everytime I set apart time to do so üòÖ final rating: the graphics are truly beautiful, love the characters and gameplay, the story is interesting and the cutscenes are honestly amazing ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: avid Genshin Impact Player ‚ù§Ô∏è

review: Fun and full of adventure. Genshin Impact is a RPG game. It has an anime style with beautiful scenes. You fight monsters and there's lots of characters you could get. Some are stronger than the others. They are marked by star ranking and colors. Purple is really good, blue is ok. Its Free and fun to play. My personal feelings for it is that I love the action but there's a lot of talking. Sometimes I just skip throws and hope for the best. The more you play the more you level up. The more you level up the more stuff you unlock and gain to upgrade your character and the weapons for your character. This Game reminds me of an anime I watched a long time ago. Sword Art Online. It's almost the same. Except in Genshin it's not Vr and there's not that many monster variations and you are not able to create your own character. What I like about Genshin is that it's a free map. You have missions to accomplish but it doesn't force you to complete them automatically. You can be given a mission and then do whatever you want. You can either explore the world and hunt and cook or you can carry on with the mission.
title: amazing

review:
i‚Äôve been playing genshin since late 2.7, and am writing this an hour before 4.0 Fontaine comes out. the graphics, characters, voices, and lore are beyond anything i could imagine. granted, there are also some problems. for one, spiral abyss has slowly but surely become less f2p-friendly- i‚Äôm a low spender on ar 57, and spiral abyss is incredibly difficult still. there‚Äôs also the issue with power creeped characters, and some characters are so bad they aren‚Äôt even viable (dehya‚Ä¶ what did genshin team do to you‚Ä¶). there‚Äôs also the gacha system, which kinda ruins the game for those who don‚Äôt have the financial freedom to spend thousands on this game. commissions are repetitive and chore-like. these are only some problems, but the positives outweigh the negatives by a lot. character designs and personalities, and the open-world exploration are top tier. the only price? 30GB! i don‚Äôt have a problem with it as long as most of it is used to enhance the game. thank you for reading my long review.
-loyal kazuha main
title: awesome game, incredibly addicting

review: After I achieved AR 56, I can proudly say that this is a game well worth my time. Although these days I play mostly periodically (especially when a major update comes out), this game is truly something magical. I am engrossed with the main lore and sub-plot involving the characters. Speaking about the characters‚Ä¶ They are so well crafted, with not only aesthetically-pleasing design, but also intriguing personalities. And of course, what has drawn me in this game was initially the open-world dynamics. It is such a breath of fresh air to come back to this game and feel a sense of wonder that I‚Äôve felt in lower AR levels. However, one criticism that I have with this game is the overall gameplay. Although this gameplay can be switched up with events, overall, completing commissions to get primogems becomes rather boring. There is little to no variety in slaying monsters and the like. So I would suggest incorporating more ways to gain primogems, so that everyone‚Äôs experience is more dynamic with less monotony. But otherwise, solid game! Amazing.
title: Genshin, My Beloved

review: I love this game, I really do. But the fact that there are no black people in the game is why I‚Äôm giving this a one star. Sumeru is based of South Asia, yet you couldn‚Äôt give us ONE black character? I‚Äôm super disappointed in hoyoverse. No, Cyno and Dehya are not black because they aren‚Äôt pale white like everyone else. The dendro archon IS LITERALLY THE COLOR WHITE. I hope, as a black person myself, that you don‚Äôt expect us the wait around and take every bribe you give us because you can‚Äôt add one dark skin character. Candace was based of an amazing black princess and you white washed her. She is not black. I‚Äôve seen white people darker than her. This a disappointment to me and the genshin community. The fact that you pulled this with sumeru out of all places, and you gave us a lightbulb for an archon, is sad. You never listen to your player base whenever we ask for something. Just because you‚Äôre a multi million dollar company doesn‚Äôt mean anything when it comes to your player base. If you guys try this with Natlan, me and many others will not hesitate to leave this game. This is a disappointment to every poc person waiting for representation, only to see this. Please get your act together, or this won‚Äôt be the only one star review you‚Äôre getting.
title: No skin tone diversity

review:
Okay, first of, let me say Genshin Impact is an amazing game and you should try it out! (if you have enough storage space). You almost always have something to do in the low ar‚Äôs.

However, Mihoyo doesn‚Äôt seem to pay attention to feedback, so it‚Äôs always the same cycle of farming for a character for weeks, if not a month or two, then getting the character and the cycle restarts. And that‚Äôs if you‚Äôre lucky enough to get the character, which isn‚Äôt all that high of a chance, seeing as you have to pull 40 times to get to 90% pity. Unless you use money or you‚Äôve been farming for 6 months, you won‚Äôt have nearly enough primogems for that. And if you lose the 50/50 it‚Äôs pretty much over. 

Genshin Impact is a wonderful game to play, especially if you like fighting and leveling up characters without the gore and stuff. But soon you‚Äôll find that if you want to get good at the game, you‚Äôll need to spend money on the game, which isn‚Äôt great since many items are a bit overpriced. This os only my opinion of the game, you should definitely try the game out of you want your own experience to go off of.
title: Overall Great, but lacking‚Ä¶

review:
Amazing game. I‚Äôve been playing for like 5 months or so now! Fav game ever. Except the new inazuma update‚Ä¶Being AR 30, well I‚Äôm not THAT left out. But being low in my archon quests‚Ä¶:(
Basically, I‚Äôm upset because all my friends are on inazuma, and I‚Äôm left out in all the events, and can‚Äôt even ascend Baal, because I can‚Äôt farm for her materials. 

If you are looking at reviews before download‚Ä¶
Genshin is amazing! Beautiful graphics, stunning characters, and more. If you would like to be a ftp, this game supports you! Sometimes it‚Äôs a little hard, with all the temptation, but it‚Äôs much easier then other P2W games. And, the wishing system is super fun! I love getting 50/50 pity on limited banners. Artifacts are kind of hard to get actually good ones. But, the amazing thinks are also about co-op, and so much more. I really really enjoy genshin. But a clear message, I have not played till AR 60. Nor unlocked inazuma. I‚Äôm still lazing around in Liyue. But genshin is a great game. I really recommend! (Ignore the 1 star reviews. It‚Äôs 5 year olds confused of the controls‚Ä¶)
title: Great game!

review: I‚Äôm gonna start off by saying great game great graphics 10/10 but what I think would make the game even better to everyone would be like to add maybe this is just a suggestion but pets and mounts since there are alr mythical creatures it would make sense to add mounts like horses dragons slimes even which would make travel 10x easier and faster and enhance the gameplay the companions would auto attack anything u attack and they would have a health bar same as the player and a level system and evolve system I think this would add to the diversity of the game that‚Äôs just my idea tho pets and mounts would make the game more unique I should say there would also be a rarity system between the pets maybe add eggs that are discoverable and purchase able and the eggs would give a random rarity since it‚Äôs open world this would make the game way better imagine running into a wild animal that your able to tame a tame feature would be amazing great game tho love every part of it these are just two features I think would make the game way better
title: Maybe pets and mounts

review: I‚Äôve been playing Genshin for quite some time now and there are only a few features that bug me otherwise this games is amazing! The open-world experience, the quests, every aspect of it I love. However when I fight bosses for things that‚Äôll help my characters grow, for example artifacts. Artifacts are a really useful way to up your characters stats so they become stronger or whatever aspect you‚Äôre focusing on upgrading. Sometimes you don‚Äôt get those artifacts and instead your left with a whole lot of resin wasted, and resin takes a while to replenish, 8 minutes for 1. So in theory 16 hours for all 160 to replenish. Anyways where I‚Äôm going with this is trading, I think a trading aspect would be super great for the players! Maybe someone has an artifact you don‚Äôt and they have a weapon you don‚Äôt, trade request bam! And then they trade. This would make obtaining artifact sets a whole lot less of a hassle and would be an amazing feature to add! Thank you for reading! -sincerely, GaryTheCanary
title: Absolutely love this game, however‚Ä¶

review:
A couple of years ago I stumbled on a tumblr page with venti‚Äôs picture in it, at the time the comic was small and barely started and when I read it I loved venti instantly, the sad thing was how ever was that the blog post got deleted and couldn‚Äôt remember venti‚Äôs name and so I couldn‚Äôt find anything about that comic. 

A few years now and I was bewildered when my brother showed me the game and I was over the moon to see the adorable sprite once again, and by now who ever reads this review must realize that this game is my most favorite in the whole world, everything about it is just so beautiful and best part ? I got venti üíöüçÄ‚òÅÔ∏è the whole project it self is very inspiring especially that I feel that the game had set the bar very high for the market to actually produce very good quality games and not something random and mindless.

title: A beautifully made master piece

review: The game was great at first but with time it started rotting. With all the nations we have Liyue is the only one that gets the best lore or attention from the company, while all the other nations are ignored or left with mid lore, Something a high schooler can write for their creative writing if they try hard enough. Not to mention lack of representation, they‚Äôre currently making a new region which is Sumeru, a country inspired after Indian/Middle Eastren culture. You‚Äôd expect the major skin tone of characters would be dark, no? However most of the ones leaked today are extremely light. White washing is a very common theme in Asia especially countries around here, so what they‚Äôre doing is not helping. Not to mention them mixing Indian and middle Eastern culture alone is so wrong on many levels. All the other regions were inspired after only one country alone but sumeru is mixed and messy bc of lack of research and respect. Honestly expected more from this game, it was so good at first but now it‚Äôs terrible. Don‚Äôt download it, not worth it at all it‚Äôs time consuming and has bad rng for both farming certain material in game and pulling for characters you want, don‚Äôt download especially if you have gambling addiction or struggle with those kind of things.
title: Lack of diversity and representation.

review:
This is the first multi-platform game to ever really capture my attention and keep it.
I‚Äôve been grinding out working on my characters and team, and I love to see their growth. Not to mention the story is very cool and keeps us busy as players.
However. In recent game play we‚Äôve seen the boss ‚ÄúChilde‚Äù get his difficulty lowered to make it more accessible for all players. Which is awesome. But there‚Äôs a boss in particular, the Oceanid is ridiculously overpowered. Even with a team of 3 level 60 characters, a level 50 healer, and a level 3 world my team was absolutely obliterated in under 2 minutes. I can‚Äôt even fight this thing anymore to level up my healer because of how strong it is. I know how you stack your team plays a big part in this game but you should still be able to at least be able to fight and make progress. It‚Äôs ridiculous.
I ask the game developers to consider taking a second look at the stats and difficulty of the Oceanid and consider lowering it‚Äôs difficulty like Childe‚Äôs
title: Amazing game but I have one complaint

review: I've played Genshin a lot, the most obvious issue is that this is possibly one of the most Grindy types of Mobile gacha games I have ever experienced, I haven't had terrible luck at all but it honestly is far too much to even get a singular summon, let alone 10 just to have a minimum chance at getting a character you like. This game almost forces you into that pay to win mindset just to be successful or get what you want. Free to play should be a lot more relaxed, so as an overall it should give out more of it's own in game currency. This brings me to the other issue, the game doesn't really have any good events or rewards, especially with the recent anniversary, it is almost empty feeling and the grind for leveling up characters is even harder, many resources often not even being able to be accessible easily, leaving you many times, more often than not, heavily under leveled. As of now I am unwavering in this review and until I see change I won't change or remove this review and if you see this review disappear, most likely the developers have removed it to silence us.
title: A bit too Grindy amongst many other issues

review: I love this game. The characters, story, and gameplay are all fun and engaging. I was enjoying nearly every moment I had with this game up until now. When the 1 Year Anniversary hit, I was hopeful for some kind of fun celebration between the players and Mihoyo, that included rewards and events. Instead, I was met with disrespect and a slap to the face, followed by childlike ignorance of a major problem. The rewards were almost nothing, and the events required either essentially free advertising, or hours of work by artist for only a chance to receive anything in return. There was hardly even a celebration at all, and it truly felt as though Mihoyo spat in the face of those who have supported their game since the beginning. The way the company is treating this issue is outrageous, and I am thoroughly disappointed. Deleting negative reviews, banning accounts that speak up, shutting down the Reddit page, it is all truly disgusting behavior. In due time, I'm sure this review will be taken down as well, but I want to get my word out there, as I am a player of this game and deserve a voice. I hope that someday, Mihoyo will make up for their mistake and apologize, as the scar left within the community is a deep one that will take a long time to heal.
title: Great Game, Abysmal Treatment of Playerbase

review:
A chinese company making a free to play game that captures all the best aspects of JRPG‚Äôs & breath of the wild! This is one of few times the gatcha system didnt dissuade me from playing. The game has a great original soundtrack, combat system, & (something Botw lacked) voicelines for practically everything (& in multiple languages)! To top it all off, the game is cross-compatible w/ ps4, pc, mobile; cross-save for mobile & pc, & a tba switch date! All of this free so i dont understand how anyone could give this game anything but five stars. The story & dialogue are better than most retail games lately & the cutscenes are as beautiful as the world that‚Äôs created. There‚Äôs gonna release more content for free. I could go on about how astounded i am by this game & i recommend to anyone who enjoys PvE & multiplayer. I have an iphone xr & it runs super smooth & my phone doesnt get as hot as i thought it would. 

my only negative critique is the lack of keybinding/being able to edit the location or functionality of the mobile controls.
title: it‚Äôs not a knock off; it‚Äôs inspired by!

review:
Genshin Impact is an absolute feast for the senses, boasting gorgeous visuals, a vast open world to explore, and a diverse cast of characters to discover and recruit. Personally, I found myself enchanted by the game's lush landscapes and immersive gameplay, losing track of time as I embarked on quests and battled formidable foes. The combat mechanics are fluid and satisfying, with each character offering a unique playstyle that adds depth to the experience.

However, I have some reservations about the game's gacha system, which can feel overly reliant on luck and may tempt players to spend real money on virtual currency to obtain desired characters or items. While the game is technically free-to-play, the temptation to invest in microtransactions to enhance the gaming experience may be a turn-off for some players.

That said, despite its monetization model, Genshin Impact remains a standout title in the RPG genre, offering hours of entertainment and a sense of adventure that's hard to find elsewhere. Whether you're exploring the vast landscapes of Teyvat alone or teaming up with friends for co-op challenges, is a journey well worth embarking on.
title: A magical adventure

review: I‚Äôve played since Kaedehara Kazuha‚Äôs release and it‚Äôs been a very fun game! Very nice art design and gameplay. I love how the elemental reaction makes it easier for players to crit or just for the damage to be way better. The banners last a while which makes it easier for you to save up for another or the same wishing banner. The wishing system is a little complicated but once you play for 1 month or longer, you‚Äôll understand that you need to get a standard 5 star character to be guaranteed. Theres no character better than another, which means you can build any character and get good damage. People say the starter character, Amber, is horrible but she is really good with Constellation#2. The co-op system is really fun but I wish they the partner could stay while we unlock a statue. I also want it to be possible to talk to npcs during co-op. Another thing I want the Hoyoverse to do is make the possibility of the 3 starter characters; Amber, Kaeya, and Lisa, to be higher in the wishing system. Besides that, TCG is great and the game is too.
title: Nice game, just a few more features players need/want.

review: I‚Äôm not really a ‚ÄòGamer‚Äô. When I tell veteran gamers that I only really play handheld games (switch, DS, Gameboy, possibly game cube or vintage consoles) they kinda laugh. Controller games are just hard for me to play and learn, as well as not having direct access to certain consoles or high enough RAM computers. So if you‚Äôre a GAMER‚Ñ¢Ô∏è you might not like this game. But if you like handheld or mobile games you probably will like it. The graphics are really nice even on my iphonex and the story isn‚Äôt super complex and is easy to follow. You get to fight cool bosses and the map is pretty easy to follow which I like. The characters are really cute also! All around a pretty easy going game. I‚Äôve never played Breath of the Wild, but my partner has and he says that some things are similar about this game to that one but like‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs still a bit different. (If you‚Äôre a mega BOTW fan then maybe you won‚Äôt like this game idk). If you‚Äôre a newbie gamer or like simple relaxing games or want to try open worlds I think that this a great one to start with!
title: Love It!

title: Good game but some things about it..

review: Genshin Impact is,just such a good investment for you‚Äôre time. There is just so much content,so many updates and events to look forward too all the time! There is just one issue that I have with the game is how much storage and space it takes,and how much lag I experience while playing sometimes,however that‚Äôs the only complaint. There is always something you can do in the game. You can really never be bored. I think the lag and whatnot might just be on my end,considering the devices I use to play genshin are a bit outdated and I‚Äôm getting a new laptop and iPad Air, so hopefully that will help with the lag. If found myself spending hours on this game when expecting to really only play it for like 30 minutes a day. Honestly,not a game to install if you are often short on time üòÖ. But this really is an amazing game,and the amount of content and quality that this game contains,is worth the storage space and lag. Thank you for reading <3. Have a great day/night :)

title: Here My Review

review: Ever since I first started this game, I was hooked. From the cut scenes, fighting animations, to the character designs, and astonishing open-world scenery. This game is breathtaking and always has me entertained. I have been playing for a year now, and I can say I am an expert to the ins and outs of this game. I am always there for any updates, and livestreams they hold on twitch. And to make this game more addicting, there is a gacha system encouraging me to pull and spend all my primogems (in game currency ) just to have a chance to get a special character with abilities like no other. I can‚Äôt wait for new updates and more content to play. Since this game has a story line, it will come to an end eventually. Meaning there wont be more in terms of story. However I will keep supporting this game until the very end. Please play it, even if RPG isn‚Äôt the type of genre of game you like, it‚Äôs still a great game to try plus it‚Äôs free so you don‚Äôt need to spend any money unless you ultimately feel like you want to.
title: This Game Is Amazing, Would Reccomend

review: So when I downloaded this game from the PlayStation Store it didn't seem very interesting I was also kinda mad that it took so long to load but once I saw the opening cutscene and tutorial I took everything back the animation is perfect the movements are fluid and the and the character designer is obviously very skilled also (character spoiler alert) Paimon explains the basics in a way that is easy to understand the vast amount of content in this game is astonishing I just wish you could crouch this game reminded me of Botw and it all flooded back to me how a lot of people hate this game because it's a lot like Botw for example Botw only has 3Ô∏è‚É£ elements while GI has 7‚É£ and an elemental combat system in conclusion this game is amazing,  perfect and chalk full of content to keep you busy I would also like to thank the voices for the characters(character spoiler alert 2) Zach Aguilar (Male twin), Corina Boettger(Paimon), Kelly Baskin(Amber), Laura Faye Smith(Noelle),  Josey Montana McCoy(Kaeya), Mara Junot(Lisa) and Sarah Miller Crews(Female twin) I wish I could list more but those are the only characters I have. Also Ima say this now IT'S FREE
title: I am addicted

title: Whyyyyyyyyyyyyy

review: Really cool game. Would recommend everyone to at least try if not get it. It really is fun and awesome. Graphics are great, and there is so much things to do. I do wish the ‚Äúwish‚Äù feature to get new characters was better. The main reason though I didn‚Äôt give this 5 stars was because the game keeps crashing. I have this on my ipad (not my phone since I thought it would be too small to play and enjoy the game) and I have very good internet but every 5-10 minutes or so it keeps crashing. I tried factory resetting which some sites tell you to do for this game but nothing worked. It wasn‚Äôt so annoying at first since as I said I would get 5-10 min of gameplay before it crashed but it was pretty quick to start back up and it picked up right where you left off. But as I get further into the game and get timed challenges with so many enemies to defeat, it would crash at the end and I would have to restart the challenge from the beginning. Please fix this muihoyo cause it‚Äôs almost impossible to do anything with the game crashing.
title: Awesome game but...

review: This game has a lot of rpg content including exploration, fishing, and cooking. However, you must use a gacha pull to get characters other than the first few provided to you. Many of these first few are not highly rated characters at all. To fully unlock the character, you need to pull the same character 7 times to fully unlock. This equates to about 600 pulls for the lowest tier character (my average with my average luck) and about 1100 pulls for the higher tier characters (since you get an unwanted 5 star character almost every other 90 pulls). If you pull the same character, you are only ‚Äúreimbursed‚Äù 5 of a currency, which you can convert for 1 pull, for the low tiered characters and 25, which converts to 5 pulls, for higher tiered characters. Oh, if you are paying money, it costs about $200 for 90 pulls. It also equates to many months of event participation for f2p players. Yes, it is a player‚Äôs choice to spend money, but the company should not call it a reimbursement when they are refunding about 1/10 of the cost, especially when majority of the pulls are rather useless weapons.
title: Decent for f2p but terrible for pay2play

title: The game was amazing I enjoyed the adventure

review: I almost never write app reviews, but I just really feel the need to say how much I love this game.  I‚Äôve never played any game for this long (8 months now, I think), but Genshin Impact has kept me so engaged because of the story and characters, as well as the astounding amount of constant new content even when the next piece of the story is far off form being released.  The characters are easily my favourite part of the game, they‚Äôre all so beautifully designed just like the scenery and they‚Äôre all so easy to get attached to, especially since the voicelines almost let you interact and build relationships with each one.  Aside from that, the gameplay is really fun and the whole thing is so beautiful, and the gacha system is one of the easier ones I‚Äôve encountered to be honest because there‚Äôs so many ways to get the currency for it.  Absolutely incredible game, planning to stick around until the whole thing‚Äôs been released and I know I won‚Äôt regret doing so for a second!!
title: Possibly my favourite game ever

review: i absolutely adore this game, i have been playing it for a while and found it before it even got popular, i only play on mobile for right now but there seems to be a glitch in my game, every time i go to complete the wangshu quest it‚Äôll say ‚Äúquest area reached‚Äù but whenever i see the glowing light on the floor that i assume i‚Äôm supposed to press it wont give me the option to press it, i also have another issue, i‚Äôm a rank level 25 but i‚Äôve gained enough exp to have leveled up to rank 26 by now but i am unable too. i was supposed to reach about 4000 exp to level up but i‚Äôm currently at 5000 and it continues to get higher. i am just unable to level up and finish this one quest and it‚Äôs kinda disappointing bc i really enjoy this game. i‚Äôve logged out, i‚Äôve deleted the game off my phone and i‚Äôve even reported it as an issue already but nothing has been fixed so i‚Äôm just stuck:/ which is really upsetting bc this is a comfort game and i wanna continue to story quests but i just can‚Äôt if i cant even get up to rank 26 bc of my games glitch :/
title: I love this game

review:
Alright, this has got to be the BEST game I‚Äôve ever played on my phone. It‚Äôs incredibly immersive, expansive and so finely-detailed for a game that‚Äôs adapted to the iPhone. It‚Äôs like playing an actual console game on your phone. No lagging, no annoying ads to watch or skip, no required in-app purchases or pay-to-play/win nonsense. It‚Äôs got a Zelda BotW vibe, mixed-in with maybe some Kingdom Hearts/Final Fantasy elements. 

The developers put so much detail in the game, and it shows. There‚Äôs voiceovers, a free-roam environment to explore, tons of quests to complete, etc. Honestly, I‚Äôm blown away that this game is free. Games like this is so rare nowadays, where develop quality games for others to enjoy first and foremost, and cashing in on the game from it being less of an emphasis. Not saying we all deserve free games, but it‚Äôs easy to see how money-hungry game developers are nowadays, and are willing to churn out a mediocre game year after year for the sake of money, and expecting people to pay top dollar for them.

I HIGHLY recommend this game.
title: Absolutely stunning

review: I think this is an epic game, the graphics are unreal and the story is amazing. I just have a problem with how this keeps crashing every time I play, my phone over heats like an oven and I think part of that may be because of its big map and top graphics. Although the game is good, it‚Äôs just really annoying that this just keeps crashing. Even tho this is meant for pc, I think they should make this version just different so it‚Äôs more suitable for the phone. Other then that, this game has no problems and is a great game, and for new players I recommend not wasting all your resources on leveling all your character, first aim to get al l the characters, then play with them, and then decide which ones are the best although in the process you will have to level up some of your characters but you only have to level up your two mains. But until then just save as much resources as you can. You can use the premogems to get wishes which you can use to unlock characters and weapons. Also you can play with friends after adventure rank 16
title: Great game but...

review: I've been playing this game for quite I long time, im up to date with all the quest and I would be considered a end game player. First the scenery is well put together, they take things from real life and put them together to make beautiful scenery, mondstat is Germany, liyue is China, Inazuma is Japan, sumeru is kinda a mix of things but rainforest and desert areas, and fontaine is France. The quest div into the lore of the game and every quest matters and its beautiful. Every character has their own backstory and lore, my favorite is wanderer because he has so much packed into him. The game play is so fun, the way you have to build your characters makes you really get into the game. Now if your on the fence because people say this is a "pay to win" game it's not. You don't have to pay at all, I'm a complete f2p and I have gotten some of the best characters in the game. The only differents between the 2 players is that f2p players have to actually farm for primos. Which is honestly just fun. So I would try this game out
title: This game is beautiful

review:
This game is such a good game to keep you out of boredom. You can play with friends and family, or anyone! It's got a great storyline with all the nations. All the characters are amazing to play as, some are better than others but they can all be played better as well. The leveling up is also very fun. Something that I absolutely hate about this game is the differences is skin tone. The characters like cyno, Kaeya, Candice, and Deyha have the littlest of color. All the characters are basically white-washed. It's not my favorite part, but in further updates I'm hoping that they are putting in more darker colored skinned characters instead of whitewashing them all.
This game is absolutely perfect if your bored, or for fun! Its perfect for anyone, no blood or gore mostly family friendly and very funny. I started at 9 and I was hooked. I know that if an open world rpg then this game would be wonderful. And if you don't like open world rpg's than you should still try because it's amazing and can get you hooked.
title: Absolutely tighnari

review: I love this game with a passion and have been playing for almost 1-2 years now. I find the game graphics beautiful and the character designs are wonderful, yet at the same time the characters are the issue about the game. Of course we have some issues based in storage as it takes a lot, also the pity system isn‚Äôt very f2p friendly. The biggest issue about the game nonetheless is the lack of representation. Throughout the lore we can see the nations are based off real places and cultures, yet they tend to stereotype it in places and refuse to make any characters that aren‚Äôt white except for two extremely lightskinned people. The community has been asking for so long for representation to be made for the poc community, and when we finally think hoyoverse will give the people the representation it needs for South Asians and Middle Eastern cultures the company shuts us out. All white and pale characters and still 0 representation the community is dying for. It‚Äôs obvious the game is racist and/or doesn‚Äôt care about the community. I find that a MAJOR flaw in any game, if hoyoverse were to fix this, I‚Äôd be willing to give higher ratings, but for now I absolutely will not until they listen to their community and other cultures.
title: Lack of representation.

review: Honestly Genshin Imapact is an beautiful game but the problems I have currently is the lag and the controls. Every time I need to fly up with the wind shooting up in the air to help you fly up is very annoying.I try to fly up but I always get lags and it just puts me against the wall and I fall down and my charachter dies. I feel like this game is just so frustrating. I try to find out why the lag happens but my internet is fine and it always says ‚Äúreconnecting to server‚Äù and it‚Äôs so annoying when this happens because I have to go all the way to the first spawn point and  I had and go back to where I need to go. Honestly I have been trying to make myself like Genshin,and I do! It‚Äôs just the game I feel like is so frustrating especially with younger kids and it can make them rage quit üòÖone time I was in a mission and I was 334 m away from my destination but then a HUGE lag happened and I went back to the start at 500 and I was sad because the monsters I had to fight on the way were so hard to defeat! title: Eh

review:
The game was super fun when it first came out because it had so much to do. The game is a still very high quality and solid combat. The issue is the publisher. After 1 year of playing everyday I can‚Äôt really recommend this game anymore. The hype is over. After 1 year of loyalty and $600 I put into this game‚Ä¶ it is pathetic how little the publisher does to fix the game. There are bugs still out there for 10month old characters‚Ä¶ system design issues and more. The publisher is getting lazy and doesn‚Äôt fix problems anymore. I believe they have the mentality now that instead of improving the game and addressing issues and feedback for the players they can just do whatever and a player is just a number that they don‚Äôt need because the game is still popular. Also fixing older characters doesn‚Äôt generate money so why bother. I will also mention that compared to every other gacha that I‚Äôve played, genshin is the stingiest. The login bonus is a joke and their anniversary event is so sad. For example, guardian tales is another gacha that I played this year and they gave out over 200 free summons‚Ä¶ Genshin is giving out 10 summons for the anniversary‚Ä¶

Now look at what they did to yae post release     ‚Ä¶
title: Fun game but don‚Äôt bother at this point

review: I‚Äôve been playing since launch. It‚Äôs fun and addictive for a while but the gameplay loop starts to take its toll after you‚Äôve built your 20th or so charecter. The cycle of get currency gamble for x charecter, build charecter to beat content and get more currency to get more charecters may be fun for some. But there is no end game beyond that. This is a gacha game through and through. Overworld rewards are paltry and everything you collect is fodder to feed the rng. Don‚Äôt expect to find a legendary weapon in the woods or suddenly find a quest in a book or anything like that. The combat is fun but the effects can be overwhelming to the point where there‚Äôs nothing but chaos on the screen and you are basically just using the same maneuvers blindly. There are different weapon types but each type works the same within its category, polearm users typically use charge attacks, claymore users spin around etc. combos never really deviate from the normal attack 3 or 4 times, skill then burst, then switch charecter rinse and repeat. It has great graphics and if you love anime girls/boys you‚Äôre gonna love collecting but that‚Äôs it, that‚Äôs the game.
title: It‚Äôs not Elden Ring.

review:
Hi i‚Äôm pretty og in this game, I started playing around a week after it came out. But ever since the anniversary rewards incident genshin had been getting a bad wrap, I know i speak for the larger community when i say we don‚Äôt want people to lose their jobs or have other games taken down. That vocal minority are not and do not represent the larger community. Genshin is a game about exploration in the early game, then it turns into a study game where you figure out how the different systems in the game work, and then it becomes a routine. I‚Äôve loved this game since it came out and will continue to love it but if you don‚Äôt enjoy the game, or the community please don‚Äôt attack mihoyo or anyone affiliated with them. Even if genshin has some scummy money grabbing tactics avoiding those is something we‚Äôre just going to have to deal with in the world we live in. I didn‚Äôt expect to come here and say all this but i truly do love this game and anyone looking to give it a try definitely should

sincerely 
-NotLance
title: Genshin is a great game

review: I loved my first couple of months playing this game. The world and characters are rich and well crafted, especially for a mobile feature. Unfortunately, the drop off past AR50 is stark. The game is clearly designed to get you to form addictive habits and normalize casual spending, and it‚Äôs dark the way these patterns manifest. Perhaps even more importantly, the dev team has completely ignored user feedback about a wide array of bugs and issues, including auto-targeting problems, lack of constellation toggles, resin gating for time gated content, diminishing rng returns in domains, etc. I would recommend this game up until AR50, but then run far far away, before you get addicted and do something you might regret. Lastly, and just as a side note, the management team for this game is completely non-responsive to the playerbase, basically insulting us with their silence in the face of outcry about pervasive issues and insulting mechanics. Better management is needed asap. Corporate greed is ruining this game, just like everything else in this world. Where are the tech otakus to save us? Just my 2¬¢. Fingers crossed we see change soon! If so I‚Äôll gladly return!
title: Starts strong and then drops off hard

review: I really like this game, but I just had a terrible run in with their customer service. I‚Äôm pretty sure their customer service is completely automated or something. So I was trying to buy a $100 pack so that I could try to get Hu Tao and since this was my first purchase, I‚Äôd have the first time buyer bonus. However, right after I bought it, it failed and charged my card. Tried logging out and reliving to no success. Because of that, I asked my credit card for a refund. However, later I eventually received the full amount of the primogems plus I got my refund. But because of this, I received a notice that I had tried to do refund abuse, blaming me and then also putting a negative balance on my primogems. I thought this was fine but when I tried to ask if I could still reinstate my first time bonus since I basically did not get to buy it, their customer service line basically did not answer my question and kept on blaming me for refund abuse when it was clearly a glitch on their game. Never have I seen such terrible customer service. Ridiculous! I‚Äôm not sure if Mihoyo just doesn‚Äôt care at this rate since they‚Äôre raking in millions of dollars, but this is definitely not sustainable.
title: Great game, terrible customer service!

review: genuinely this game is ok, but it can get pretty boring when u finish stuff, the game is still ongoing and if you catch up with everything you have to wait a whole year to wait for a new main region. they normally release one around the end of summer. but omg the way this game is so stingy with theyre rewards?? its a chinese company so they do stuff for chinese new year and obviously thats an important thing in china but they give such small rewards. 10 wishes can get you about a four star and probably itll be a weapon and thats all?? ive played for a couple of years because i spent a tiny bit on this game and i dont want it to go to waste, but the prices are so unfair and unworth it. 100 can get you 80 wishes for thr first time you buy that choice, after that youll only get 50 till they reset it. 80 wishes only gets you 1 five star, and unless youre guaranteed theres only a 50% chance you‚Äôll actually get the five star you want. but of course theres othrrs ways to get stuff which is unlocking things around the map, until you get everything youll have to wait for events, quests, or new areas to be released. the story is ok as well but its all really repetitive, idk how others feel abt it but id prefer if things around the world in the game got more effected by what happens in the main story quests. after they finish everyone goes on like nothing ever happened as if they weren't all about to die or smt its just boring when it all ends the same. my opinion tho fr

review: Why does this game have to require me to spend so much money in order to get who I want when I do decide to spend money I worked for. I just spent 165 dollars for venti and got jean and a bunch of 4 stars instead of venti. I don‚Äôt need jean I need venti for my xiao but now I just threw 165 dollars down the drain for this game. I just want the rate of getting the feature 5 star to be higher. 100 dollars WITH bonus is enough to get 81 summons, 70 is where you hit soft pity which is a 50/50 chance for a five star but not the feature ones just the select few and him so you could possible get someone other than the one you want. 100 dollars without bonus would get you around 40 summons and if you were sitting at 0 pity you might have to spend 200 dollars just to hit soft pity at 70. title: I don‚Äôt understand why

review: As you can tell from above, this is my first review on App Store and I have no regrets and am proud that my first review is of Genshin Impact. As an artist, this game encaptures my eyes with its creative character designs and personalities. I love the scenery in the game and it is great for photography. As a writer, the story lore is complex and amazingly funny at times. The dialogue and voice actors in different languages all have their strengths and weaknesses. Their diversity in voice languages and text is another thing that stands out. I have played this game since its early days and I am sure I will continue to play (as a high adventure rank player) despite there being a lack of content at times since I am already up to date with most of the things in-game. Highly recommend for those who like to invest in characters and see them do big damage! I am also F2P and a lucky fellow to get the five stars I want. It's not hard to get five stars (in my opinion) as long as you have the time and patience to farm for primogems.
title: My First Review

review: I started this game out of curiosity due to the ads popping up everyday back in 2020 or 2021 when albedo was out in December. I ended up loving this game so much and I‚Äôm mostly playing for the story unfolding. All the major story arcs are amazing and even quests that tie into the main story with more lore is just great. One thing that could be fixed would be the resin system. There should be a faster loading resin time, as well as having more resin in a day, or at least building up for the next day. Also, the artifact/weapon domains should be much convenient such as choosing to get which artifacts you need or at least being allowed to have a higher chance of a particular artifact. Lastly, one thing that is also quite inconvenient is that when you are doing a quest, it may become unavailable if a character in that quest or the area for that quest is also being used for a different quest. We should be allowed to continue playing certain quests regardless if the characters or the areas are being used elsewhere. Thank you
title: Amazing story

review: i love it so much and i‚Äôm super addicted. this may seem like a super small issue but whenever i get notifications that say ‚Äúoriginal resin replenished‚Äù ITS NEVER REPLENISHED. i will have like 30 resin and be disappointed. i‚Äôll see the notification and then log on to make condensed resin but i don‚Äôt even have enough resin to make condensed resin.... also as someone who plays this game excessively i‚Äôm a high adventure rank and it gets to the point where there is just NOTHING TO DO. i‚Äôll log on and do my faults for like half an hour and then log off and it‚Äôs so disappointing but that‚Äôs really just because i‚Äôm a no life lol. i‚Äôm a zelda freak and this game does remind me of zelda but is unique at the same time which is why i really like it but i would like it even more if it was released as a finished game with a whole storyline and plot with more story quests. i like being able to COMPLETE a game like this but we‚Äôre just left on a cliffhanger with every story quest that gets released. :,)
title: the game is amazing but this one thing really annoys me lol

review: My graphics before this 1.3 update have been great even set at medium as the game still looked very sharp. However, after this latest update, when I logged back in, the loading screen and in-game graphics look very weird. The graphics look blurry and are wavy and soft. Also, the pixels (don‚Äôt know what you would call it) surrounding the character and ground seem to slightly shake. The slight shaking and blurriness together makes me feel sick. I have tried toggling with the graphic settings and setting them back to what I had them at, but it still looks weird. I even deleted the app and re-downloaded it because I know that sometimes it will fix itself, but it has yet to do that. I am hoping that this is only temporary and that it does not have to do with my phone (IPhone 8, though still should work fine). Genshin Impact is a lovely game though, and I am really enjoying the storyline and adventure ! This was the only issue that I had, hence the 5 stars. Hopefully it will be fixed next maintenance.
title: Graphics Update

review: Wow where do I even start? This is a great game for a lot of reasons! For one, there‚Äôs a giant world to explore with endless side quests and treasures to find! If you‚Äôre trying to level up you could do things such as fight monsters, do daily commissions, side quests, co-op, or challenges. Basically there are endless things to do! And with all the characters and weapon upgrades there‚Äôs always something to work toward. I myself have spent a few hours fighting monsters trying to get primogems to get characters. On the subject of characters, I think the idea of a completely chance-based system to get a character makes the game a lot more fair than games that just let you pay to get them. If I have any complaints, it‚Äôs that it can be difficult to get enough primogems to do wishes. Sure if you grind enough challenges youll eventually save enough up but maybe it would be better if we could get a few more per chest. Like maybe instead of 2 per common chest, it could be 5? Well I‚Äôm rambling- uh this game is great, download it!
title: One of my favorite games!

review: This game is amazing, I love it so much. But I‚Äôm gonna get to the point, I think that everyone should get a new type of character, preferably a shifter type. And some side stealth missions. Shifters can shift into other forms(hilchurls, cats/dogs, other enemies) and stealth missions are unlocked at adventurer rank 15. Stealth missions are missions that require a stealth character(shifter) and you can buy a shifter for 1500 primo gems. I feel that‚Äôs a good price, or put it in a pack so people can get it with primo gems. I would love it but give a higher chance of getting a character because I rarely get any characters with wishes. I am adventurer rank 18 and I only have my base 4 and 4 other characters. I wish I had the chance to get a small character but that‚Äôs besides the point. I really enjoy this game and I‚Äôm sure others will too. This game just needs a little push to get even more popular and that‚Äôs exactly what I think this game needs. Thank you for reading this! Much appreciated, and thank you!
title: Amazing, some suggestions!

review: I downloaded this game the day it came out, and I gotta say I‚Äôm pleasantly surprised. The gameplay is pretty good and simple, the music is nice and fitting, the graphics are great for a mobile game, I like the anime aesthetic, the voice actors are good(at least the japanese ones), and open world games like this are my favorite. It feels like Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild but with magic. The story is relatively engaging and there are mechanics that make it feel like a survival game, like cooking, climbing and hunting. Some downsides I can think of are that the game is really big. Right now, it‚Äôs sitting at 7.12 GB of storage and took around half a day to download. Another downside is the rarity of the good characters. I have pulled quite a few times so far (around 30-40 times) and have gotten no characters, only items. And the last downside I can think of is that sometimes when alot is going on, the FPS drops like crazy, but that‚Äôs expected for such a big game. Overall though, this game is good enough to get 5 stars from me.
title: Good experience

review: This game is one of the best I‚Äôve ever played. It‚Äôs very diverse and fun to play, and there are lots of characters to unlock. But, I have one complaint about the wishing feature. A while back, there was a character that I wanted very badly. I played this game all day, for as long as I could just trying to get intertwined fates. And I only got to wish 4 times. Getting intertwined fates takes so much time, and I wasted so much of my time trying to collect them. I never got the character that I would die for. I mean, I get that it‚Äôs supposed to be a challenge to get them, but at least please make them easier to acquire. I understand that it takes time to get them, but during that event, I probably spent a week overall on that game just trying to collect intertwined fates and get the character I wanted. Now this was a while back when I was younger, so I wasn‚Äôt the smartest at making choices. I could‚Äôve just given up, but I still believed that I could get him. Still, overall, this is an incredible game and it‚Äôs a lovely experience!
title: Amazing game!

review: I'm really loving this game so far! It's fun and the characters and graphics are awesome! Then, I noticed something... In the storage section in the settings of my iPhone... Genshin Impact takes up more than 3x more storage than the app with the 2nd most storage. I just got it TODAY and it's 7GB already. My next closest is photos with 2GB. I don't think the number will go down. Most likely it will go up as I play more. I wish it was less storage but I tend to use up storage a lot so I can't just games above 5GB. 5 is pushing it but 7 is ridiculous! I like to have all my games within a 2GB limit but if it's one of those can't live without and it's 5GB or less then I'll keep it. But I don't think it's worth the storage take up. If you're on mobile and you don't have a problem with the storage thing then I think you should definitely get this game because it's really cool. But, if you're like me... Then this game might not be worth it to you. I will have to delete this sadly but it's a really great game. Just not worth the storage.
title: Mobile Storage

review: I love this game it‚Äôs amazing!! I got into cause of my bother, I love to explore the wonderful world of Teyvat it‚Äôs awesome, there‚Äôs something about the way they created this game, the effects, the elements, everything I love it!! And the story with the twins, it‚Äôs so good, who would‚Äôve thought?! There‚Äôs nothing I‚Äôd rather do than play this game. title: Erllo There, Faline Here.

review: The game is overall fun when there‚Äôs a new event or you‚Äôre a new player. Although there‚Äôs a few issues that I think that should be worked on. The primo gem system is overall not very good and annoying to collect. Leveling up to high levels is really annoying because after playing for so long you get only a bit a mora, a few xp books and one or two standard banner wishes. It‚Äôs overall bad for that system. But the most thing I dislike is how much space this game takes up. Sure it‚Äôs a good game to grind and play but it‚Äôs not worth deleting important images and apps just to update it and just fill up your phone and make it overheat. Besides all of that I liked the early game better. Edit: another issue I have thought about is genshins lack of dark skinned characters. Sumeru is based off an area where people often have lots of melanin in their skin but most of the released characters are as white as paper, even the archon. The npcs of sumeru themselves are darker. It has gotten to the point where I think hoyoverse is just racist with the lack of appreciation towards people of color.
title: It‚Äôs okay

review: Don‚Äôt get me wrong- Genshin Impact is one of the most graphically beautiful, well crafted and well plotted, filled out game I have ever played. The stories of each character are full of anguish and sorrow and strife, the views and landmarks breathtaking to say the least and the gacha system and game play well made. But I do have a few problems. For one, there isn‚Äôt a whole lot of diversity. At first they had all white characters, and they have quite a few characters, except for two light characters repeatedly called strange and weird. Now, after all the diversity controversy stuff they have strived to fix their mistake and have added multiple beautiful characters with darker skin. However none of them have dark skin- only light brown. Of course there‚Äôs nothing completely wrong with that, it would just be nice to see more diversity. My second problem is that the plot line is a little predictable. I don‚Äôt know fault the game for that however as it is derived from a manga. My last problem is how unlucky I was. Ughhhh
title: I love genshin impact... except for a few things
