title: Weird things happened to me after playing for 3 minutes

review:
A lot of people get angry over things that I personally think are a tad bit odd. Like the game isn't about collecting waifu‚Äôs or a massive co-op fest. 

 Its a single player game with an amazing story and lore that has a gacha system. You don‚Äôt need to pay to win, you can beat every boss with just the first 4 characters. 

 The story is beautiful and as a person with siblings I can relate to it a lot. I love the people we meet along and way and I love learning about everyone‚Äôs background

 I love the open world too; its so expansive and amazing. The characters fit in with the world it isn‚Äôt like the world or characters are too realistic or too cartoon‚Äôed to fit.

 I enjoy the long journey and look forward to the future nations. The character‚Äôs are all so unique and pretty, and I have hope there will be character‚Äôs with darker skin in the future.

 I also love the cooking and teapot area! The food looks so good, and I love the details added to it. The teapot has so much potential and I hope they increase the amount you can have in a room.

 Although the system can be annoying I‚Äôve been playing for about 9 months and got 34 characters without spending. You can get the character‚Äôs you‚Äôd like if you try hard or i suppose get lucky.

 The only thing I‚Äôd hope for is the option to replay cutscenes they must have took so long to make and I‚Äôd like to see the traveller as she fights Dvalin with Venti again!

 I‚Äôll be a long term player! Ty for your game Hoyo!!
title: Honestly just what I love

review: This game has been one of my favorite games of all time, I started over a year ago and the quality and detail of this game is insane. What my problem is that out of 51 characters, not even Including the sumeru characters, there are no darkskin or even darker characters, the darkest character is Kaeya and he‚Äôs barely tan. I understand that liyue and inazuma are both Asian based nations but the fact that not one of mondstadts characters or sumerus new characters are even slightly dark, there have been many people who have brought up this point and that many people are getting fed up with how no one at hoyoverse seems to want to listen or take action. this is 2022 we should not be having to constantly remind you that there needs to be a wider range of skin tones. also the fact that hoyoverse is reusing the same models over and over again, and I feel like the character designs are getting a bit lazy. It feels more like just putting random characters out there to make money. It‚Äôs a shame that such a great game is ruined by the limited diversity and ignorance that the hoyoverse team is projecting.
title: no diversity

review: So I‚Äôve been playing since the second week of release. I saw this game as a side game, not my main game (*ahem* insert ID5‚Äôs rip-off of a game) which REALLY affected me in the long run. I‚Äôm behind while others are at AR56 and I‚Äôm at AR45‚Ä¶ This game is jam packed with content if you‚Äôre a beginner! Us since release players didn‚Äôt really‚Ä¶ but if you consider joining now, please do! The main key is to collect the characters you love, not the meta (though of course your account can be based on that). I have Venti who I wanted since release but I couldn‚Äôt accumulate enough primogems so I ended up getting our wind god at his rerun! This game is mainly based on doing activities such as adventuring to untouched or top-secret areas. It can get political which is my favorite tbh (bc you don‚Äôt deal with right wingers or leftists hehe). The only downfall this game has is the fact it heats your phone up pretty badly. I have an iPhone X 256gb so it‚Äôs not my storage but just the game. It‚Äôll crash sometimes but it‚Äôs mainly only after you‚Äôve played for more than 3+ hours on mobile.
title: Been playing since release

review: A lot of the 1 star reviews have to do with scaramouch (however you spell his name), not getting the 5 star character you wanted, taking too much space, and laggy. Scara is not even out yet so that‚Äôs a dumb review, the banner character is not a guarantee and this is a gacha game so deal with that, I play on an iPhone and haven‚Äôt needed to delete or uninstall apps so idk what device people are using, and I only lag when my wifi is at one bar. Every other time my phone is perfect and doesn‚Äôt overheat. Don‚Äôt quite me but this game was initially intended for pc and mobile. They knew it would take up a lot of space later on. Why do you think golden apple was deleted? So that it already had space to bring in Inazuma. This game surpassed phone storage a long time ago and is slowly becoming pc and console games only. All the lag and overheating and storage problems are mobile only. Mobile is limiting this game and that should be a basic understanding we as consumers should see.

title: The Gacha and Character System

review:
I‚Äôve really enjoyed the exploration and the story aspects of this game. But man the grind! You literally need to plan your days around grinding for mats for characters and weapons as only certain mats are found on certain days of the week. Some of the larger non story quests have huge, visible impacts on the world around you but are never mentioned in the main story or by most NPCs. It takes you out of the immersion. Also although it‚Äôs mostly unneeded to enjoy the game, the gotcha system is the most unfair, inaccurate mess of a lie and in todays age I‚Äôve no idea how they‚Äôre getting away with it. Part of the issue is they mix weapon with character pulls and another huge issue is you can pulll 100 wishes and not get a single character. 

I‚Äôve really enjoyed the story for the most part, I wish there was a skip button for some stuff though that isn‚Äôt that engaging though. I could nitpick more but honestly between the grind and the unreal gotcha mechanics I‚Äôm thinking about uninstalling it and just watching lets plays instead or wait until the anime comes out.
title: Engaging story but it‚Äôs work to level up characters

review:
I love this game! I have it it on mobile and on PC. Though the main problem that most people are complaining about is,storage. It is true that it takes up a lot of storage but it didn't bother me. What is really good about this game is the story, how it works, and how frequently it updates! The story- the story is rich in action, and the plot is very good. How it works- the instructions are very clear and the player (hopefully) understands clearly. Updates- the updates aren't just "fixed bugs" there us much more, it updates almost every month and the updates are very interesting (see the newest updates!) 
There is one problem that isn't that big of a deal but may be infuriating to others, it crashes too much. When I first started it crashed like every 10 mins or so. It made me very frustrated but then after a bit it became a mild issue.

Thank you for reading my review! Hope you have a good morning,night,evening,or whatver time it is!

title: Help?

review:
I loved this game so much for the plot and graphics, for the open world and characters, I remember enjoying this game SO MUCH. I played since November 11, 2020 and this game became a chore. Inazuma was the last region I felt so happy about. After Sumeru came out I played for a while and got bored easily. Everything felt the same and not enjoyable. 
Also genshin‚Äôs quests are really boring and long. If they made less text and more action it would be nice. I‚Äôm literally so bored while reading all those dialogs between characters and running from one character to another to talk. For example in a new game from them ‚ÄúHonkai Star Rails‚Äù all the Dialoges and interactions are FRESH, they have silly jokes and your answer do actually matter because characters will react differently. Besides being silly and changeable they are not that long and boring. That is the reason I like quests and events in Honkai Strls much better. If genshin just became less repetitive, the events and quests/dialogues became more fresh like Honkai‚Äôs then I would give that game 5 stars.
title: Repetitive and became a chore

review: I‚Äôve been really enjoying the game so far on my phone. One of the biggest draws is that you build your party to your play-style. I love being able to switch to various party members to maximize the elemental combinations. You do have to be a bit lucky at times in getting characters that work for you but it‚Äôs fairly easy -so far- to get the means for the 10 items ‚Äúwishes.‚Äù It‚Äôs primarily single player ‚Äúworld‚Äù that allows you to have other join your world (or you theirs) once you reach a certain level so you have the option to co-op. There are times where certain mechanics are frustrating (you dodge an incoming attack that hits anyway and it becomes a chain of knockdowns with no escape) but that happens with any game. This is one of the few games that seem truly f2p and is one of the few games that has earned my respect enough to debate donating. I just wish the formatting of the PS4 account linking would allow for cross-save between mobile and the console
title: Very enjoyable and customizable

review: I would just like to start off by saying an amazingly well written and programmed game. I play both on PS4 and mobile but far prefer the console version. This game is a true open world game which is rare in games nowadays, with the amazing storyline and side quests. If I had any complaint about it, it would be about the fact that after level 20 leveling up gets increasingly difficult, repetitive and time consuming. Most side quests have to be found by just walking around I would like it more if you added more features to the map like possible side quests or explorable areas for more experience points to help with leveling. I also feel like there should be more mobs it gets a little repetitive fighting the same kinds on repeat though I understand since the game is fairly new. The last thing I would add is a monster dossier that‚Äôs probably one of my favorite thing about games I love being able to see all monsters I‚Äôve fought/unlocked and also a little backstory on them.
title: Ways to improve upon your game

review: Honestly love this game to pieces! The world-building and story-telling are both stunning and the visual effects pop off the screen. There are so many cool and unique characters to collect and the levelling up system is easy to use. I like how creative some if the designs are and how much variety there is between characters of the same element. Your gameplay can really change depending on which twin you choose and who you main. I personally like the close-combat style that comes with the sword-wielding characters and a friend of mine likes the ranged attacks, which makes for perfect team gameplay. The multiplayer gameplay is also really nice, although a wish you were able to do a bit more with it story wise. My biggest critic would be that there are so many cats and dogs but no way to interact with them! I wish you could pet them or play with them during downtime. Other than that I love the game. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys fantasy and battle games.
title: AMAZING GAME!!!

review: I‚Äôve been playing over a year, and it‚Äôs a fun game honestly. There‚Äôs a lot of content for beginner/mid players and the community can be really helpful with exploring and building characters. The stories are heart wrenching at times and the scenery is absolutely stunning. But unfortunately there‚Äôs a lot of issues that need to be fixed. The teapot load limit, characters lack of diverse skin tones, sexualization of characters (women and children) and lack of content for late game players who have finished all of the quests. The adventure rank rewards are really sad as well, you‚Äôd expect to at least receive a ten pull for reaching adventure rank 60 but you only get a few blue wishes. Getting characters you want can also be extremely difficult if you have not saved up months of primos and you are not guaranteed. The weapon banner is a whole other war zone I don‚Äôt even want to get into. So unless you plan on spending money or spending hours of your time (or your whole life) on this game then I wouldn‚Äôt really recommend it. Otherwise, good luck because you‚Äôll need a lot of it.
title: It‚Äôs a 50/50 (haha get it?)

review: How are you as a now global company going to base an entire region off Middleeastern/south Asian cultures and then fill it with paper white characters and orientalist designs? It‚Äôs embarrassing. I loved playing genshin and was looking forward to Sumeru since I saw how culturally rich liyue and inazuma were for example. What did I expect when the only dark skinned characters are kaeya and Xinyan and even Xinyan is stereotyped as being scary? Not to mention those characters are four stars and get no attention. Get it together. I know you have the funds and it isn‚Äôt hard to research. You did it with the previous regions and put in so much effort into Yunjin to accurately showcase Chinese opera. But it comes to Arabs and south Asians and suddenly you drop some stereotypes and call it a day? I saw the WEBTOON with how the one villain looked like a stereotypical Arab. That was the one time they made the character dark skinned, have an ethnic looking nose, and ‚Äútraditional clothing.‚Äù And he was the ‚Äúugly villain.‚Äù I regret ever spending money on this game. It‚Äôs a waste of your time. Even the endgame content itself is nonexistent. Hoyoverse never listens to its fans even after wanting to expand globally. Get it together. Im going to pull for kazuha and wait the ‚Äúsumeru‚Äù characters out.

title: makes me broke but in a good way lol

review: This game has 3 types of people who can enjoy it long term. 1, the casual who literally just wants fun gameplay (which this game has, but please get it on your pc or PlayStation.) 2, the ‚Äúwhale‚Äù who is more than willing to spend $2-3k (USD) to get the best version of the character they want (you make wishes and get characters/weapons; duplicate characters and weapons give ‚Äúconstellations‚Äù and ‚Äúrefinements‚Äù respectively) but you have to get 7 of any character (6 Constellations after you first get the character) to max their constellation. This makes the 5 star characters in the game about $200 to even get a chance of getting them once. All in all, it‚Äôs a good game. But the people who control the prices of Genesis crystals and the amount of event rewards (the games gacha currency) are SUPER selfish. They will not reward you for being part of their community. They will only reward you for giving more money than you should ever give to a game like this.
title: It‚Äôs an addicting game, but it has an aggressive monetary standpoint.

review: Let me get this out of the way. First, YOU NEED A STRONG DEVICE to even run this game properly. iPhone 8 Plus and above will do the job. Sexond, the gacha, THE GACHA RATES ARE LOWER THAN FGO. Though you get a lot of currency to pull near the start, I recommend saving and not immediately rolling the gacha unless you‚Äôve already decided to pay up. Third, BE CAREFUL REROLLING, YOU MIGHT GET BANNED because bots are rerolling accounts which are being sold. Fourth THIS WILL BE GRINDY I played in the beta, and most other players will agree, it takes time and many resources to build teams, and I specifically said it with a plural word. Fifth, YOU WILL NEED MULTIPLE UNITS for end game since dungeons have different effects which will benefit specific characters. I think I mentioned most of the things that WILL RUIN most people‚Äôs experience, now for the good stuff. This is MiHoYo‚Äôs third major game, Honkai impact blew my expectations and standards for a mobile game, and I know this will do it again. I wouldn‚Äôt have imagined an open world mobile ga,e like this when I first downloaded Honkai. THIS CAN BE AN AMAZING GAME, it just needs time...
title: NOT FOR EVERYONE, but is great for some

review: I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact for a long time and I know how greedy Mihoyo is when giving out free primogems, but this is just sad. Most games would celebrate their first year by being more generous and letting the community have fun. But giving away only 10 wishes and having events or contests where people have to spend hundreds of dollars or spend a lot of time for these contests only for the chance to win the cheap awards or 100 primogems. 100 PRIMOGEMS IS NOT EVEN 1 WISH. I‚Äôve played other faces games that give massive awards during special events, but this is just disappointing. Genshin Impact is a fun game and has some great stories, and this was one of the first games I‚Äôve spent money on. It seems like Mihoyo doesn‚Äôt really care anymore with Baal not collaborating with Beidou and Kokomi just being one of the worst characters in the meta. I really don‚Äôt want to leave this game, but please LISTEN TO US AND DONT INGORE US. The players and content creators of this game deserve that much.
title: The Genshin Impact Anniversary is just disappointing

title: This game filled a void that nothing else could

review: Genshin Impact is a wonderfully thought out game. Just by the loading screen I‚Äôm blown away. Every touch added to the game makes to so much more beautiful. I love the voice acting, the art style, the story and character designs. Each character looks like much time and effort was put into them, along with the story. Each frame of this game is something wonderful and just pure eye candy. Everything about Genshin Impact deserves a 5 star rating. I‚Äôve only just started the game, so I have no complaints what do ever. I have an iPhone 7, and it doesn‚Äôt lag, and the graphics are still very nice. title: Beautiful!

review: i remember my brother playing this a while ago when it first started and i would watch him play it and be like ‚Äúoh wow this game is so complicated how does he play it!‚Äù 3 years later i‚Äôm with my cousin and i decided to download genshin, let‚Äôs just say the next day my brother made me an actual account and let me tell you, i was ADDICTED! the game was soooo fun and i understood most of it and the more more i played it the more i thought this game was amazing the graphics the stories between the twins is so cool and really pulled me in and still now i love it and genshin is a open world game so you can also join others worlds and do battles together and that was amazing i got lots of new friends and i‚Äôm so happy that hoyoverse made a game like this because i was honestly getting bored of roblox and other games and there‚Äôs so many things in the game to focus on so it‚Äôs like your never gonna get of this game! 10/10 if your ever bored play this game you will NOT regret it!
title: Best game i have ever played üò≠

review:
It was very fun at the beginning, but once you progress more, you realize how much this game lacks. When you are in co op mode, the only thing you can do is fight. I don‚Äôt even mean domains either. Spiral abyss? Not in co op. Claim adventure rank rewards? Not in co op. Unlock statues? Not. In. Co op. When my friend had to do adventure rank quest, the trial was so long she lost complete battery before completing the electro hypostasis. Which is why I began grinding for her when she couldn‚Äôt. Over the past few weeks, I have been doing her commissions, but every time I have almost killed all 18 monsters? Hahahahaha- NO. The game decides to crash the exact moment I killed it. When I got back in, I had to do the commission. Again. And I had less health than when I tried the first time, and I froze to death in the dragon spine commission.

Enough ranting. Despite all the flaws, I guess the game is still fun, just lacking some features I would like. (As in, Let us do more things in co op please??) I still really enjoy the game, just maybe not as much as before. Please read and consider my review. Thank you HoYoverse!
title: Used to be better

And my second favorite character has to be Yanfei! Yanfei is a pink haired girl and I want to say she‚Äôs a librarian like Lisa but I don‚Äôt quite know The fights are kind of hard if you‚Äôre going until like a temple but overall it‚Äôs really fun to keep rething and still having the thrill of fighting this game helps you take all your anger out and it‚Äôs just amazing so I would consider downloading it five stars!
title: This game is the BEST!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

review: I have spent a lot of time playing this game since it was recommended to me 2-3 months ago, and I have made lots if progress, reaching Inazuma, unlocking the bottom of the Chasm, have level 60+ characters, etc‚Ä¶ Lately, there has been a massive connection issue, where it will start loading, and damage will only register onto me, which means my character dies when the opponent dies if enough damage was done. Not only that, but although it may be integrated this way, I have begun to grow distant from this game after reaching AR 40 and having to deal with level 70+ NPC enemies, and bosses. I main as Razor and Bennet, and although having done around 50 pulls on the Ayaka banner that has been present since I started playing, I have not gotten close to having a single character who is completely worthy of building. Aside from all of this, the graphics are great, the gameplay is stunning, and the Co-Op feature is a fun way to help lower leveled players.
title: This game is beginning to become unplayable.

review: The game is definitely worth getting. I recommend that the primogems (in game currency) be saved up until player level 20 or so just to get a grasp of what the game has to offer. It‚Äôs a gotcha game so summons are always pretty much rigged. You gotta be lucky or spend money until you hit their pity. I know the game is unfinished but they need to work on boss difficulty when four players are able to join in together in one world. The bosses at that point gets killed in 2 seconds and there‚Äôs pretty much nothing to do after spending your daily 160 resin. There‚Äôs not really any point in co op mode because the game itself is easy to cheese through solo. They need to focus on end game more than anything else. The only thing still keeping high level players playing are the mini events. Even so, they log in for a couple of days and finish the event. I hope this game isn‚Äôt just about a lot of characters and easy difficulty. Then it‚Äôll be another trash game like warframe. There‚Äôs no point in playing with no difficulty.
title: Great game for free

review: Let me start by saying that I am AR40 at the time of this review. The gameplay and story are amazing. The gacha aspect is a hit or miss with their low rates. However, once you get past the honeymoon phase of the first 20-30 hours, you will start to realize that miHoYo designed the game in a way that limits the player‚Äôs progression in every single way possible. From the smallest thing such as crafting ores to level up your weapons to spending resin for running dungeons and bosses to get ascension materials. They limit it all. It‚Äôs like they are trying their best to prevent players from progression in an OPEN WORLD game. Some might argue that the game is design as a mobile game. The funny thing is that playing on mobile is the hardest compared to playing on PS4 or PC. Furthermore, I have never seen a greedier company than miHoYo. They made $100 million (their entire production cost) in the first 2 weeks, yet they don‚Äôt have any sort of daily login rewards outside of the initial 7 days and when they do send out codes for rewards or host events they give you crumbs - not even enough for a single gacha pull. I hope to see big changes soon because they seem so inexperienced even though they have another game Honkai Impact for the past few years.
title: Greedy company that brings the game down

review: I knew nothing of this game until my friend got into the beta. I‚Äôve been following it ever since. I couldn‚Äôt wait for its release. The game itself is fantastic. The music the story, sure it‚Äôs a BOTW clone but it does so much of its own thing that it really stands on its own two feet. The only downside I see to the game at all is the loot box style way of getting characters and weapons. But it is early. I‚Äôm only adventure rank 12. It goes to 60 so who knows what you will unlock along the way with time. That also being said even without 5 star weapons or characters I have had no real issue making it through anything so far so the characters and weapons to me are more of a skin/cosmetics thing then any sort of pay to win if anyone is concerned about that. But even with the one downside I gave it a 5 star and even wrote this review (which I don‚Äôt normally do) because the game is so fun. I own every console and built my own computer I don‚Äôt normally play mobile games but this one got me. It‚Äôs very well done.
title: Don‚Äôt normally write a review but...

review: I love this game with my whole life, mostly because I‚Äôve spent a stupid amount of money, nonetheless it‚Äôs definitely my go too game, but I don‚Äôt really think it‚Äôs a good game to recommend if you just want a chill game to play, you have to put an absolutely ridiculous amount of time to be able to get good builds for characters, or even characters themselves, and heck, you may not even get that character unless you spend money. Although I seem quite critical, theirs no doubt in my mind this is my favorite game. One point I have to say is that they are the most stingy game I have ever played there‚Äôs absolutely no way I‚Äôd be at the level I‚Äôm at if I didn‚Äôt spend money. So if your willing to play for three years and get absolutely nothing in return then this is just the game for you! But in all seriousness I love this game I feel I‚Äôve made that abundantly clear. But if you want to be rewarded for the immense amount of time you have to play and get nothing in return then don‚Äôt try this out.
title: Great game but fr tho what‚Äôs going on with rewards?

review: Genshin is wonderful and one of the best rpg games out there but there are some problems that makes this game repetitive and feel like a chore. The commission system is great for giving primo gems but 60 per day feels to little as it would take 3 days just to do 1 wish to do 10 wishes it would take a month, sure you can get primos from doing quest or events but not everyone has the time to do those everyday. I think instead of having each commission give you only 10 primo gems it should give 20 so you can get 100 primos each day after checking with Kathryn this would make 10 wishes take 16 days cutting down the time by almost half. Farming for artifacts or boss drops is really hard as you can only do a couple a day because of how low the resin cap. We have so many characters now that 160 resin for artifacts and boss drops is to little 160 resin will get you 8 artifact domain rewards or 4 boss rewards. I believe you should make the resin cap 240 so we can get more artifacts and boss rewards.
title: I love this game but there‚Äôs some problems

review:
Been playing since release, we have not had any changes or additions made to the way the game is ran. The resin is still capped at 160 while Honkai is at 240 and I'm not one to make game comparisons, but it's the same company. Honkai won mobile game of the year because of how much more fair it is and how more Genshin players have moved to it. With lantern rite approaching, we are being called greedy because we are demanding fairness. You guys gave the free skin selector to only the Chinese players that can be able to purchase a ps5 bundle while we can't. And it isn't fair to us. The rewards are still the same as ever from the start of the game with no vision to increase them. 

I have stopped playing from December 2022-December 2023 and only resumed because my friend got into it. I forgot how awful the game was. Fontaine is a gift from above, but it's not enough. We need fairness, we need stuff changed, we need better rewards because this is not gonna go on if we get triple banners. Hoyoverse is a greedy company that favors Honkai over Genshin and as much as I love both games, I have been playing Honkai more with how much better and fairer it is while signing into Genshin to only do my expeditions, comms, and resin.
title: Bump the rewards

review: This game is truly a masterpiece, honestly! I love it so much the graphics, the designs, the movements of the characters. Like, come on! You could tell the developers put so much thought into every single little detail. I‚Äôm not the type of person you‚Äôll see writing a review on every single game they play, but this game clearly has me doing otherwise. I have this game on my phone, but I wanted to see it on a larger screen. Therefore, I tried downloading it on my iPad, but it kept saying insufficient storage. I deleted old apps I don‚Äôt use, old conversations and contacts that my friends don‚Äôt have anymore, and even old photos and screenshots! I cleared up so much space, yet it still doesn‚Äôt let me download this game. (My iPad is a 6th generation, so maybe that‚Äôs why.) I really, truly love this game so much, and I wish I could play it so much! I still have it on my phone though, so yay! But, ya, the storage it takes up is a major issue! (No hate at all! I love this game!)
title: To much storage!

review: I swear, no matter how many other games I play that are ‚Äúsimilar‚Äù to Genshin, nothing is even close to comparable. The story, the art, the characters, everything is so good and fits together so well. I love the small details that you can find in the open world, like small quests and NPCs with interesting backstories. The main quests can seem pretty lighthearted, but as the game progresses and you explore the lore, it can be a pretty dark game. A lot of people often complain about the gacha system, but I think it‚Äôs about as good as other gacha systems. There‚Äôs always events going on that give out materials and currencies and they even have frequent web events that are actually really fun. Yes, it can be hard to get all the five stars (limited characters) you want since there are so many, but from the beginning they supply you with characters that are easily strong enough to complete challenges with ease. Overall, I could praise this game over and over. I absolutely love it :)
title: Best Game

review:
this is probably one of my favorite games of all time, and definitely my favorite mobile game. the graphics are beautiful, the characters have unique designs, the character models look amazing, the fighting mechanics are fun, and the story is interesting & compelling. my only complaints are how often it crashes and how it lags sometimes? im aware that this is because the game has such a big file size (which is another issue, the game is 12 GB), so i have a suggestion for that; the voice lines in the game take up about 35% of the file size (yes, really), and most players only use 1-2 voiceover languages. it'd save a lot of space if players had the option to undownload the languages they didn't use; for new players, they could choose which voiceover languages to download and not download. i'd also like more ways for f2p players to farm primogems!!
tl;dr: amazing game, but not recommended for old phones or phones with less than 60 GB of storage. it's on ps4 and pc for free, so maybe get it there instead
title: amazing!! a few suggestions, though

review: I‚Äôll start by saying this I love this game and the fandom and I‚Äôll probably continue to play for a very long time due to the amount of effort and money I‚Äôve spent, however that doesn‚Äôt mean I can‚Äôt acknowledge the flaws of this game cause if you‚Äôre looking for a game with a diverse cast of characters regarding skin tones , gender , body types, personalities that aren‚Äôt centered around one thing and various different weapons and play styles , then this game isn‚Äôt for you. However if you‚Äôre not looking for any of those things then feel free to play , just don‚Äôt get upset when every character is paper white , has the same copy and paste body or when the enemies look better and have more unique and interesting kits and designs , because hoyo is a company that tends not to care about any form of feedback offered to they by their supporters all they really care about is money lol . Also don‚Äôt mind the fact that all the children characters are little girls and that they‚Äôre are like 50+ girls and women in each region but only 6 guys . Or do mind it doesn‚Äôt matter Hoyo won‚Äôt care ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
title: Lack of everything

review:
This is my third‚Ä¶ and last‚Ä¶ attempt to play this game. 
The game starts out good with lots of things to do but‚Ä¶. Then it just peters out into glitchy lameness. 
Every time; once I advance to adventure rank 30 and world rank two; without fail, the characters start acting weird and become almost uncontrollable during battles as the view automatically changes to where you are staring off somewhere else as you are being pummeled by ‚Äúenemies‚Äù and can never get the viewpoint to face a battle or the character becomes so touchy while navigating precision steps that it does stupid things like jumping off cliffs for no reason other than I move forward and the character steps directly off the edge‚Ä¶.beside me NOT forward. 
The ruin guards‚Ä¶ why in the heck do they, in the middle of a battle with over half damage, just disappear to respawn at full power again? My character (Amber) maintains all the damage from the battle while having to beat the same exact ruin guard 3 times because it keeps respawning. 
I feel like the game is DESIGNED to ‚Äúcheat by glitches‚Äù once you reach a certain level.

I know early on this will be easier to do with the rewards in game for the launch but you don‚Äôt have to spend a dime to enjoy this game. The graphics are great the story and lore has been fantastic. There‚Äôs so much to learn and the characters you talk to fill you in on a lot of the worlds background. title: Fun and amazing

review:
- AR. 58 - playing since day 1

Honestly, the only thing I look for in a game are good graphics and design. For me, genshin is the model of that right now. Yes, I know there‚Äôs problems in the game, like any other game, and yes, I would like more endgame content, an expanded co-op feature, more resin, and a better artifact system (My suggestion is to make artifact domains similar to talent and weapon ascension domains. For example, make Emblem of Severed Fate on Monday, Wednesday, Friday, and Sunday & make Shimenawa‚Äôs Reminiscence on Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday, and Sunday. Sundays will allow you to choose which artifact set you want. This will allow players to farm artifacts the same way since you can make condensed resin on off-days while removing a layer of RNG). However, I am fine with the state of the game right now because the quality of almost all the content (hangout events are a little boring, but it‚Äôs such a small part of the game that I don‚Äôt mind) that comes out amazes me.
title: Graphics, character design, and the map are stunning ^ ^

review:
When I first saw this game, I mocked it, failing to see what was special about it. It looked like an attempt to connect an anime artstyle to an open world rpg. Months later, here I am practically addicted to this game. The world of Genshin Impact is such an immersive and enjoyable experience I‚Äôm sure most people will be able to find something they‚Äôll enjoy. There is a solid story with great characters, a beautiful world featuring great scenery and music, enjoyable battle that‚Äôs easy to get used to, and gorgeous characters you can potentially add to your party and grow stronger with. Yes, this is a gacha game, but once you start playing, it‚Äôll hardly feel like a gacha game. A lot of people put too much emphasis on the gacha aspect of the game, and end up spoiling for themselves everything that makes the game great. You needn‚Äôt focus entirely on the wishes, the game has so much more to offer. If you‚Äôre looking for a great game to dive into, then I‚Äôd recommend giving Genshin Impact a try. 
p.s. ‚≠êÔ∏èBennett is absolutely amazing ‚≠êÔ∏è
title: My Favorite Game

review: ill preface by saying i absolutely love this game. the lore, characters and graphics are the reason i continue playing. i along with many others feel like we got a slap in the face in turn for our support because of the anniversary rewards and not to mention its super predatory gacha system that feeds into gambling addictions. at worst it can take a couple hundred to get a character you want, the banners feed of your FOMO. its a shame we are treated this way because this companies audience are the reason they have reached such high places both in status and monetary gain, and by implementing a lower shop value im sure many more people would be inclined to spend. i truly love this game and i wish they took things like the anniversary as seriously as we do. players are just big money signs to them, or free marketing (as we saw when they tried preying on artists and cosplayers.) i am grateful theyre trying to patch things up now, but it still hurt knowing they truly didnt care like we did; it felt like when someone close to you forgets its your birthday or something lol.
title: MHY has little respect for their players.

review:
Ive been playing this game since February and have invested around three hundred dollars in the game. There are many things I like about genshin, but many more things I dislike about its company, Mihoyo. Mihoyo, even compared to other gacha games of lesser popularity and content, is a greedy company and this has been proven with the recent anniversary rewards.

I‚Äôm very active in the fandom and we were all very excited about the anniversary rewards, but mihoyo has failed our expectations. It‚Äôs been highly successful yet the most mihoyo has decided we deserve is a single ten pull. Some members of the fandom had lofty expectations such as getting a free features five star in addition to weapons and even more wishes, while other thought that the least mihoyo would do was simply give us a standard banner five star of our choice, similar to how they give a limited choice of S Rank Valkyries in some of their special events in mihoyo‚Äôs other game Honkai 3rd. This was the minimum of what I expected from mihoyo, especially since in earlier events such as the Lantern Rite event we were able to get a choice of Liyue four star while also getting a free ten pull.

I have other complaints, but this is the most notable as if recent times

title: Entertaining, but racist.

review: Genshin impact is the best game I have ever played! First of all it‚Äôs and open world map game you can travel anywhere you want except past the barrier. You can collect a lot of materials when your traveling and they can be used to cook or craft! The events are so fun and give great benefits, and there are codes that come out with updates and they give you lots of stuff to help your adventures! The art style, animating, and voice acting is great and high quality! In co-op you can play with friends and even when your not in co-op you can chat with them too! You can also get a lot of primo gems from doing quest and commissions! My favorite part of Genshin is wishing for characters/weapons and leveling them up it keeps you wondering what you will get next! Genshin Impact is a fun and simple game but it can also be challenging sometimes, you should install this app and have lots of fun! title: I highly recommend!!!

review: A year or two ago, I was suffering from absolute boredom. My friends, who were also suffering, tried finding games we could all play together. We met some people online via some social networking apps, and were introduced to Genshin Impact, the game with walking- no, floating- emergency food. We all quickly got addicted, but had to take a very, VERY long break due to school. During that period of time, we eventually forgot the game even existed, and ended up not playing for many months. I eventually got back into it after discovering some of my favorite influencers played it, and started grinding. The wishing system and animation is great, the characters are adorable( and, if I may, hot), and the player base is filled with awesome people. Building characters is relatively easy if you just search up how or if you know how to, but the game can sometimes be tiring. I look forward to playing with you all for many updates to come.
title: A must-play fantasy game that I adore

review: I love this game so much and have been playing since the very beginning. I didn‚Äôt really notice this issue in the beginning because i‚Äôm aware of the different cultures being offered to us and how it‚Äôs less than likely for there to be large groups of darker skin characters or poc. But given that we are about to receive an update that gives us a new chunk of world that explore (a part of the world that is HEAVILY influenced by south asian / Egyptian culture) the lack of diversity is SO disappointing. My expectations for this company are already low but if you‚Äôre going to pull inspiration from a culture SO diverse and a culture that includes skin tones of all shades, you need to match that with the characters that are playable to us as well. There are only 3 TAN (no darker than just tan‚Ä¶) playable characters that I know of and none of which are 5 stars‚Ä¶ compared to the 50+ characters that are pale or white. It‚Äôs so disappointing because it seems like something people have been complaining about a lot recently and we were still met with no improvement for Sumeru‚Ä¶ I really hope there are darker tones characters added to this game in the future otherwise I fear I‚Äôll have to put it away.
title: Diversity / Inclusivity / POC

review:
Ok so honestly this game is fantastic. The story line is enthralling and fresh. Not to mention the amazing art quality and art. I also never fail to be impressed by the writers. Everywhere you look you can find little snippets of lore and mythology. It has a little bit of something for everyone. But, it‚Äôs missing on key element; it‚Äôs incredibly difficult for casual gamers to get into. If you don‚Äôt have the time to get on almost every single day and do your commissions and battle pass it‚Äôs hard to collect the materials that you need to advance in the game. From Liyue to inazuma there is an insane leap in difficulty. And the fact is, if you didn‚Äôt invest either time or money or both into the game it is hard to advance the story. Not that a game shouldn‚Äôt have some level of difficulty but I think that it would benefit from being a little kinder for players who enjoy the story line but aren‚Äôt super into the experience of mindlessly grinding for materials or studying game mechanics. 

That‚Äôs my two cents on the game. I love it to pieces but it stands to improve in a few areas.
title: Yeah it lives up to the hype

review:
I‚Äôve always loved fantasy games and open world so when I found this game I was ECSTATIC! I‚Äôve been waiting for a really long time to receive my church mission call and this wonderful game has helped me pass the time. Yes, it is a gacha game which does make obtaining certain preferred artifacts and equipment frustrating at times, but this almost adds to the game‚Äôs charm. There‚Äôs ALWAYS something to do whether that be exploring, upgrading weapons and artifacts and talents, gathering materials, advancing the storyline, hidden or side quests, helping other players in co-op, daily commissions and weekly bounties and requests. Even when you‚Äôve done all you need or want to do in a day, there‚Äôs always more you‚Äôre able to do the next day as your resin replenishes, commissions reset, and expeditions for materials are completed. 
I absolutely love this game and can‚Äôt wait to see what the developers have in store for us in the future! Thanks for reading my review; I hope it was helpful!
title: Actually the BEST game!

review: this is an amazing game no doubt from the graphics to the gameplay to the plot to every little minuscule detail yet somehow unlike others my game tends to freeze up and lag even when I believe there to be no file corruption sometimes I run a mission and it‚Äôs too much in the game crashes and sends me back to my home screen and then I get back on and it says file integrity has not been corrupted and sends me back onto the game yet after about maybe 15 to 20 minutes it crashes again and then the time shortens to around 10 to 15 and then it continues and continues so on and so forth until I have to delete the game and reinstalled it just so I‚Äôm able to play for at least an hour until that time goes back down to measly 5 to 10 minutes. if anyone can tell me what‚Äôs wrong that be very appreciated, I use a iPhone XR and I have over 200 GB of storage so it isn‚Äôt that I just don‚Äôt know what I can be doing wrong, i used to run the game at 60 FPS but then lowered it to the 30fps and then the game started to crash even faster I don‚Äôt understand anymore
title: amazing game but....

review: I understand that many people right now are very mad at Genshin for no anniversary rewards but put yourself in there shoes you know how much money they would lose if they have given people what they expect? People were saying at least 40 pulls. Yes I understand they gave us nothing but they have absolutely no obligations on giving you anything. They could delete your account for all they care be thankful it was nothing and not something ‚Äúworse‚Äù (like changing my beautiful Venti) It may sound greedy of them to not give us anything, (which In my opinion at least they may have given us a 10 pull) and that they made a ton of money of certain characters but they need the money to pay the programmers, designers, actors, dubbed actors, and new updates, funding for other stuff like conventions or advertising. So before you go on complaining you got nothing think back and step into there shoes for once and see both sides of the situation.
title: Anniversary rewards.

review: as an ar 56 player, that has been playing since december of last year‚Ä¶ i‚Äôm extremely disappointed with the lack of rewards and communication we have gotten. the company is under a lot of fire right now but they refuse to address anything which hurts to see. i absolutely adore this game. i play everyday, it‚Äôs just really disgusting to see a company that has made MILLIONS upon millions of dollars give us such awful anniversary rewards‚Ä¶ and just rewards in general‚Ä¶ one-two acquainted fates for reaching a new ar level??? that‚Äôs insane. i‚Äôve tried to stay quiet about the awful rewards we have gotten in the past but the whole situation with the anniversary has really put me over the edge, and don‚Äôt even get me started on how the ‚Äústellar reunion‚Äù rewards are 10x better than what we are getting for the anniversary‚Ä¶ as i said i absolutely love this game the storyline, the graphics, the characters all of it‚Ä¶ but it‚Äôs really disheartening to see the company refuse to talk about what‚Äôs going on‚Ä¶ if this keeps up the game is going to end up losing popularity or even dying‚Ä¶ please please please fix your ways i would hate to see this game go down the drain.

review: Very fun it‚Äôs full of updates never gets boring very fun!a and dress ups characters and more but if your under 8 or so the game may be a bit hard for you to understand but if have someone helping you may enjoy it I recommend for all ages pretty fun but it‚Äôs very laggy sometimes and you do get kicked out at very random times but that‚Äôs fine! title: I would recommend reading if you wanna get this game

review: It‚Äôs a great game. Like many reviews say, it‚Äôs a free to roam and you sometimes get to choose between different dialogues. At lvl 16, you can play with friends(cross platform too.) you can wish/summon for new characters. If you get a character again, you use them to upgrade your characters constellation. I have seen some people complain about not being able to get a lot of characters. After a while it‚Äôs a bit harder to earn primogems, but only if you don‚Äôt play enough or do any daily commitions. The game is also a gacha related game. You get a percentage chance of getting something. So after so many wishes your gunna get someone. Once you get to lvl 30, you level slow but with inazuma out rn, it shouldn‚Äôt be too slow anymore. AND THE GRAPHICS ARE JUST *CHEFS KISS.* I mean they put a lot into the designs, maps and scenery. Cut scenes are also so pretty. Sometimes I forget that it‚Äôs not reality and sit there sad because it‚Äôs all just a game. But def recommended. Mihoyo makes really good games. The only thing I dislike it the resin and primogems

First off, I haven‚Äôt played the game too much, but from what I have played and continue to play the game is just amazing, the graphics, frame rate and dialogue are truly top notch. And with elements like the open world and polished combat you are sure to have loads of fun! I also want to address the negative reviews, pretty much ignore almost all of them, those reviews are mainly talking about how the game wont open or doesn‚Äôt have controller support. To that I would, chill out. The game has been out for like 2 days and I experienced the same issue with logging in, but after a little while I was able to get in and start playing. It makes no sense to me when people rate a games quality based on the fact they couldn‚Äôt get into it. I understand it‚Äôs frustrating, but that‚Äôs kind of a weird thing to give the game a 1 star when you literally just need to wait a small amount to play. Overall the game takes a lot from BoTW and I‚Äôed say if you download this you‚Äôll absolutely love it!
title: Possibly a masterpiece!

review: I been playing for around 20 hours now and I can say that Genshin Impact is probably the best open world RPG you can get. It‚Äôs similar to breath of the wild where you can interact with many of the world‚Äôs elements. The graphic is insanely well done and the storyline is exceptional. Game like this are free because they rely on the Gacha system to profit. There‚Äôs nothing wrong with this because the developers put in an insane amount of work and we can support them by purchasing stuff. However, if you are free to play know that in the latter stages, it will get increasingly difficult to progress without spending. I Benn playing for many hours now and haven‚Äôt reach that stage yet. So rest assured that even if you are F2P, you can have a very good time as Genshin impact focused on solo progress and PvE instead of PvP. I spent $20 on the game and progression would still be normal if you didn‚Äôt. Overall this game seems very balance and it‚Äôs clear that the developers put a lot of effort in making this game.
title: WELL MADE GAME

review:
Honestly, if you're one of the people that hate Genshin because it's "just an anime game," just give it a shot. Mondstadt, Liyue, and Inazuma will certainly captivate you with their charming environments, and it'll keep you hooked for Sumeru and Fontaine's amazing stories. The way the entire world revolves with so many small stories within it is just amazing. Everything ties into everything else, and this is only talking about the lore. If you like gameplay, you got gameplay. With 4 stars alone and some decent artifacts, you can easily 36* the Spiral Abyss, a gruelling challenge meant for endgame players. Bouncy playstyles, big numbers, this game caters to all. If you want to go a step further, there's the gacha, where you can "wish" for certain limited 5 stars that go in rotation. Every character is good in their own way, whether it be by raw damage or elemental reaction capability. I implore you to try Genshin Impact. I swear, you won't be able to put it down.

Until you're resinless.
title: Spectacular

The overall game and animations are excellent and that‚Äôs why I have enjoyed the game for the time that I could I would love to continue playing if I had enough storage üò≠ this isn‚Äôt a issue about the game just how much it takes of storage lol.

title: I LOVE THIS GAME

review: I was introduced to this game by a few of my friends. I had heard about Genshin impact, but never really felt compelled to try. When I finally did, I was quickly hooked, and I have been playing for almost a year now. The lore and storyline in this game is GREAT, and I love how deep it goes! The fighting aspect is super fun, and one thing that I love about it is that EVERY character can be amazing. In some of the other games I‚Äôve played, you‚Äôre sort of forced to play specific characters because you can‚Äôt get through the content otherwise. In Genshin, if you put time and effort into ANY character, they can become powerful. A lot of people say that it gets boring late game, and I get that. There‚Äôs not as much to do once you‚Äôve explored everything and done all the quests, but I still have fun running around and doing weird challenges. Genshin is a fantastic game that has helped me get through a tough year, and I can‚Äôt wait for future updates!
title: one of my favorite games!!!

review:
When you start out its great, the world is really immersive and you get a a lot of things to do and have fun with, especially for a mobile game. 
I‚Äôm AR57 now. Things have kinda took a large turn from there.
Late game besides the every now and then events and weeklies it just gets boring, and practically feels like a chore, and there‚Äôs really only one place to get currency for the gacha system which is a dungeon (abyss) that to be honest is practically impossible once you get to the later floors that are the ones that give you primos again, not to mention the buffs that you get really are just to urge you to spend on their gacha banners.
And don‚Äôt get me started on the lack of diversity, yes the regions are based on certain areas of the world but that doesn‚Äôt give excuse for only TWO playable characters of 50 overall to be TAN. Especially with the new region coming out based on desert and forest areas around the middle east/south asia there‚Äôs no excuse if the vast majority of the characters will be paper white üíÄ
If you wanna get into the game, great! But stay F2P, spending at least for me is definitely not worth it anymore when nowadays Hoyoverse is just making characters powercreeped over eachother.
title: At first..

review:
The game looks stunning and has fun gameplay. There are daily rewards and there seems to always be something to do even after finishing all your quests! I‚Äôm impressed that a game like this runs well on mobile aside from somewhat frequent crashes and occasional fps drops. The only negative is that the in app purchases are expensive. You need to spend $300 to be guaranteed a 5*. There is another downside that only applies to the mobile version. Perhaps the pity could require less wishes. Whenever I teleport to mondstadt or Liyue on mobile, the game crashes. I tried teleporting right outside mondstadt and then entering the city from the bridge, however when I go inside the city things aren‚Äôt fully loaded and I crash. However, on PC my game never crashes :)

Edit: This is not much of a mobile game anymore unless you have an iPad. With each update I have to delete apps and photos to try to make space. I enjoy the convenience of the phone but it is no longer playable because it requires too much storage.
title: Amazing Game!

review:
This game is super fun and I enjoy it a ton but there are two things that for some reason annoy me, 1st off the primogem situation, I have to farm hours just to make enough for one wish which I guess is fine but I wish they would just gift us some more sometimes and give a little more after some of the quests like the dragon spine in the mountains one, IT TOOK FOREVER to do that quest and only got 60 gems, which isn‚Äôt close to at least one wish, I know they need to make money because this game is free but dang gift us a little more in the mail or something. And the 2nd thing which is very controversial but the weird kinda racist outtake on some of the game play like the hilichurls, from readings online they seem to base them off people of African culture or something related to that which is very weird and not so go great, I wish they would address the issue and figure out a way to change sometime about it, but I can‚Äôt magically make that happen.
But yes this game is great in general just some of the issues related to that.
title: GREAT GAME BUT

review:
After watching an ad, I got interested immediately because of how greatly presented it was. The gameplay? Amazing! Great graphics, voice acting(Japanese dub, mmmm), effects, animations and everything else is as awesome.
 They certainly made NPCs and playable characters have a lasting impression as they can play a role in a quest and interact with each other letting us see the social connection between characters more deeply. 
Even the gameplay too, you can choose to do anything: Exploring, defeating bosses, clearing domains, fight enemies, do commissions, do quests,...There are even random events or small tasks given by various NPCs, it makes the game more interesting, you do not have to stick onto the plot too much, you don't have to follow the same route.
 Overall, Genshin Impact is a truly amazing game according to me, it may take a bit of patience and time to grind and unlock characters, it's a luck-based system, keep on trying and you'll have it.(there's no good characters or artifacts, it's just your skill that would determine things)
title: A truly amazing game

review:
I‚Äôve been poking at Genshin Impact the last couple of days. I love the graphics! The character system is really fun too. I love being able to swap between the main character and others to combine elemental powers and find new ways to take down enemies. Being able to climb every where and glide is a lot of fun too. However I will say the mobile controls are a little annoying at times. 

I love that you can summon more heroes to fill out your team. It‚Äôs tempting to use real money to keep pulling for a hero, however it‚Äôs nice that you can earn in game currency to do the same. I look forward to seeing what new heroes they bring to the game.

I haven‚Äôt been able to find anything that suggest this game can use a controller. I play on an iPad Pro and have a lot of space to navigate, but I find when running around the world it‚Äôs hard to pan the camera around with out hitting other abilities or sometimes my thumb doesn‚Äôt register when I‚Äôm tapping on powers to activate. If developers could add controller support I‚Äôd give it a 5 star.
title: Awesome, but could use controller support

review:
Initial impressions are very high but like my favorite gum it loses steam quite fast and you end up hitting a wall of grinding and tedium in order to progress. Have no fear just buy the monthly pass or spend money on a battle pass you might say? Both of these things don‚Äôt actually compensate you with progress within the game or speed up the character progression system. Even if you do end up pulling a 5* character later the resources needed to max them out make it feel like less of a good thing and more of a sinking dread of choosing between progressing and gearing or wasting thousands of resin leveling up a new character. 

Mihoyo is this game a collectors game or not? What‚Äôs the reward in spending any money here. I‚Äôve never played a game where I‚Äôve spent so much and gotten so little, I understand there‚Äôs not a lot of content because it‚Äôs new but this monetization strategy might be successful initially but will drive off spenders like me because unless I keep spending I basically have to grind endlessly just to hit a pity banner. 

Until the game improves and they make more significant changes to the resin and summon system id stay away.
title: This game is like juicy fruit

review: I hope someone out there will see this some day, the game is absolutely stunning, in my opinion it‚Äôs on par with breath of wild, and it‚Äôs as close to breath of wild as you can get on mobile but, (and I‚Äôm probably the only person here with this issue) I was raised a devout Christian, and I can‚Äôt play games with elements of magic or dark magic in them, so I‚Äôve never been able to play a game that‚Äôs as visually stunning as this, because of the sorcery and witchcraft which in my religion and culture is strongly banned. I hope one day someone will make a mobile open world game, as beautiful as this, maybe with technology as the ‚Äúsuper powers‚Äù of the characters or mecha monsters, horizon zero dawn had this concept and I still couldn‚Äôt play because I have Xbox, not play stationüòî it would make me so happy if one day, a game as beautiful and expansive as this, with legendary items and characters, could be made without utilizing magic or bloody gory violence. I think such a game would be able to increase its customer base to no end

title: READ THIS PLEASEEEEEEEE

review:
This game is an excellent, open-world RPG with co-op play, engaging story arcs, and wonderful characters.
I can‚Äôt think of a single major flaw with it and would highly recommend the game to anyone who enjoys the genre.
The story is constantly expanding and growing and you can clear 99% of the game content without spending a single Mora‚Ä¶er, penny. New characters and world regions are being added every month or so.
Special limited time-events happen often and allow you to do things from play co-op hide and seek to battle dungeons with unique puzzles and hordes of enemies.
DEVELOPERS
My only two wishes:
-Remove the world level difference for co-op play. Or make the variance a little wider to allow higher level players to join lower level players. This would be great for people with friends just starting the game to jump in and help them level up or just enjoy playing.
-Make it easier to get materials to ascend characters from later regions unlocked during gameplay. It can stink to pull a character from Inazuma and have to wait a while to significantly ascend them. Maybe there is a garden aspect similar to the serenitea teapot but easier to access in Teyvat?
-okay, third wish‚Ä¶add a third character to the limited wish banners. With such a huge character pool, it would cut down on time before a character‚Äôs wish banner gets repeated.
You‚Äôve built a great game and hired great talent for it. Thank you!
title: Excellent quality, free-to-play, hours of content

review:
I've played since the end of Venti's first banner, so I've seen lots of content from this game. Exploration is fun, elemental reactions are cool, there's so many characters that you're sure to find one you enjoy. In order to get that character, you'll need primogems. 

When you start out, you get a plethora of them via content. By the time you're AR 45 or so, those wells will start to dry up. So I recommend saving those and instead invest your daily resins (NOT the fragile resins, don't touch those until AR 55!) into leveling up characters, their talents, and weapons. This process of daily collections and commissions gets grindy and tedious sometimes, especially once you're caught up with the story. 

By then, you'll have an idea if you like the game or not. Personally, I love it. The colors are vibrant and I love the open world aspect. There is co-op, and events are held regularly. This is my favorite game, I love my Anemo characters and Kaveh so so much, I don't see myself stopping any time soon. I recommend it to my friends!
title: It's fun BUT grindy after a while

review: Honestly I love Genshin! It‚Äôs an amazing game, the detail they put into every single thing is amazing, you can tell this game is good quality. Ever since I got Genshin I‚Äôve been addicted to playing, I‚Äôve played none stop when ever I get the chance, I hardly play other games cause of home amazing it is. The characters look so detailed and the designing of the is perfect. I also love how it‚Äôs a free roam, story game it makes it so fun for many people, especially since I like to play free roam games but I also love to play story games, it‚Äôs just an amazing game all together. I also love the different ‚Äúmonsters‚Äù in the game like the slimes, their design is so eye catching and cute, especially the slimes that kind of follow you around and when you aren‚Äôt looking they attack those have to be the best, I also love the dragons design, fighting him was a blast, his designs were also so beautiful. I haven‚Äôt gotten to far yet but I can‚Äôt wait to see everything once I unlock more.
title: Genshin is great

review: Trust me Genshin Impact is a great game, it has a beautiful landscape, the lore and story are amazing, and the characters and their designs are irresistible. But the game is not for casual players. If you want a game that‚Äôs easy to play and where it‚Äôs relatively easy to gain levels this game might not be for you. It‚Äôs is also quite aggravating to play this game without spending money but it is doable. All around this game is pretty good but there are still some bugs and voice over flaws in the beginning and it takes a lot of patience to progress in the story, main leveling system, and character leveling. If you want an immersive game that can last you for a while you will probably like Genshin. The update schedule is every 5-6 weeks but don‚Äôt rush through because then you‚Äôll be bored for a while. The character attainment system is very addicting but don‚Äôt get your hopes up because you still might not get the person you want. If anyone reads this I hope it helped! Have a good day!
title: Great game but a few flaws here and there

review: some people are saying that Genshin Impact is copied off of a Zelda game, and yet one of you guys spelt Genshin Impact wrong.. and a lot of whole others were saying this game copied off of Zelda. but how? in what way did they copy? Zelda, i don‚Äôt really like it, it‚Äôs kind of boring and you only get to play one character. while in Genshin if you actually play it right, it‚Äôll be fun and adventurous, along with solving puzzles(a part in the game), and taking action. yet some of you are saying, it takes soooo long to download, or it takes up too much storage. why do you think it‚Äôs a lot of storage? it‚Äôs because they worked hard on a game and put a lot of resources to make it look good and yet your calling it a ripoff game of zelda. and it takes long to download because you need patience. anyways, other than that, great game genshin! keep it up and maybe add another nation other than Sumeru, Liyue, Mondstat, Inazuma, Fontaine, Natlan, and Snezhnaya.
title: Other ratings on here that just make my blood boil.

review:
So I am officially addicted to this game. So much replay ability is very good in a game and this game feels like it should cost money, and deserves a 5 star review. However, as with many games, there is also a problem. The problem with this one is that it fails to run well on lower end devices. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I am still addicted to this game. The constant crashes and massive lag spikes don‚Äôt deplete that much from the game itself, as they barely ever screw you over. I wasn‚Äôt actually going to write a review, until the lag spikes interrupted my gameplay. At the Luhua Pool, there is a quest where you have to help a man find his art supplies. However, my lag spike did not load that character. Or the door to the temple. Seeing as there was no door, I walked into the temple, without doing the quest and a supreme lack of oversight. I claimed the chests when they loaded and teleported out. Now I attempted the quest just because I need XP. So here I am, an idiot who opened a door with no chests. So now I can‚Äôt complete the quest. Thanks, game.
Please fix this I need it badly.
title: Great game, except for lag. and a known issue

review: I remember when I first started to play this in 2020 hard to believe it‚Äôs been two YEARs I‚Äôve longed on just about every day, I usually don‚Äôt get attached to games but now I‚Äôm like if I didn‚Äôt have this game in my life I wouldn‚Äôt be apart of such an amazing community and not only that but everything about this game is just amazing!
