Dam hard to believe I‚Äôve been playing this for two years! I remember playing this on Christmas Day trying to get that last check point and hope that my phone battery doesn‚Äôt die or worse take me back to my Home Screen‚Ä¶I had the iPhone 8 which I believe if you have the iPhone X and up you should be able to play this game without issues, I got the iPhone 13 now and it works great! This game has brought me and my friends closer
title: Just wow

review:
I started this game in version 1.1, so I daresay I know a lot about it.

The lore in this game is PHENOMENAL. I‚Äôve spent hours upon hours just theorizing and exploring the world of Teyvat to learn more about the mystery of what, exactly, is happening, and who the real heroes are. The game provides just enough information to draw real conclusions and make exploration rewarding, but still reveal major bombshells in future updates. I cannot emphasize how interesting the universe and main story is. Even limited time events like both dragonspine events, the unreconcilced stars event, and the golden apple archipelago have been packed with information, stories, and memorable moments.

. The writing for many characters can be surprisingly subtle and nuanced. It‚Äôs almost as if the game offers multiple levels of understanding everything, making the game easy for very casual or young gamers and still engaging for people who love to analyze and break apart stories. 

The environment is utterly gorgeous and only gets better and better. Exploration can feel magical. Even after well over a year of playing, I still regularly discover new things. I haven‚Äôt lost that feeling of excitement, joy, and novelty. (I think the best way to get this feeling is not to play TOO much! You‚Äôll get tired of anything if you play it constantly.)

Overall, I didn‚Äôt enter this game expecting to adore it, but here I am. Looking forward to what else Mihoyo has to offer!
title: Unique game with lots to offer

review: Genshin Impact is a wonderful but ultimately deeply flawed game. It will enthrall new players with exciting world to explore and story to follow. Up until they reach the end of the main quest to discover there really isn‚Äôt much to do. The content you can expect at that point is limited to about 20min of gameplay in the form of grinding and dailies. At which point you‚Äôre basically done. The developers are stuck in a mindset of overly focusing on short term events which add some new boss or piece of content temporarily. The problem being that it doesn‚Äôt actually net add more content, and poof it‚Äôs gone. Any other developer would keep the exiting boss fights and mini games to cumulatively add to the permanent end game of things to do. But not MiHoYo. It would appear in an attempt to pull players in with FOMO they are handicapping the experience for players. A new player today would have not experienced nearly half of the new content that had been released over the span of a year because all of that content was temporary. That‚Äôs why after a year the game continues to feel empty.
title: A lovely, but ultimately flawed RPG

review:
I absolutely love and adore this game and the characters. I‚Äôve been playing since launch and have spent quite a bit of money on this game. It was fun to watch it grow and get the appreciation I thought it deserved at launch. 

However, after one year of ups and downs with the game. The anniversary for the game is finally here and do you know what the company decided to do to show their appreciation? They give out 10 intertwined fates (Not even close to a guaranteed 5 star) and use the communities creative talents to promote their game even more. It‚Äôs honestly just so sad and disgusting because we‚Äôve had other events that have felt more anniversary like than this one. Heck, even at launch they gave like 40 wishes!! And after a year of success, Mihoyo has turned greedy. I won‚Äôt be spending any more money on this game because Mihoyo needs to show appreciate for their player base and community.  Giving away a standard 5 star character or weapon would not have even put a dent in their profits, it‚Äôs ridiculous. 

On top of all the outrage from the player base about this hella underwhelming (understatement) anniversary, Mihoyo chooses to stay quiet amidst of it all and not even respond to their player base.
title: Greedy Company

review: I've been playing since launch, and am currently AR 57. All the positives you hear about this game are true. The lore, atmosphere, music, combat, everything is great. Unfortunately, all of this is rendered null by an extremely greedy company that has consistently alienated and recently, have tried to SILENCE its own playerbase. Instead, the new content they put out hand us nothing but scraps, and endgame content is already barren as-is. They refuse to listen to our feedback, and as of the current 1 year anniversary event, refuse to give us any kind of worthwhile reward, especially when compared to other gacha games and are currently undergoing damage control by outright deleting complaints off of various social media. Not only that, but the game as a whole is taking a turn for the worse by constantly releasing new characters that have subpart/undertested kits that lack proper synergy, which is incredibly important for this game's combat system. Once again, instead of listening to our feedback about this, we're constantly ignored and basically told to "take it or leave it." If that's their philosophy, trust me, before you get in too deep, leave it.
title: As a long time player, I recommend you stay clear.

review: Hi, I have been playing genshin for a long, long time and at this point I‚Äôm on AR 50. I cannot express how much this game has helped me, through even in real life situations. From Diluc talking in riddles, to Paimon complaining about everything in her way, this game is hilarious and I even wish I could spend more money on the game, despite it not being a ‚Äòpay to win‚Äô. Then again, the fact that Genshin is not a ‚Äòpay to win‚Äô is very rare for gacha games if you will, and this makes me happy to see. Most of the things in the game depend on chance, like getting certain characters. You can‚Äôt just go to Paimon‚Äôs bargains, swipe a card, and kill Stormterror or get Diluc to level 100. In Genshin, you have to work for what you have. May I also add, that the character designs are adorable, and they keep getting better and better! The animation is the smoothest I‚Äôve ever seen in a game, and I cannot even fathom how hard the team worked to create, and are improving, Genshin Impact.
title: I love this game!

review:
I love this game and have played it for about a year.  I would give this 5 stars except for an issue that I find very unfortunate.  Rewards collection. 

Be careful when looting, their is not an auto loot setting and you can accidentally leave a dungeon without your rewards.  I recently lost high level loot after barely finishing a dungeon.  I needed that loot.  Dungeons at different levels have different ways to collect rewards.  I imagine this occurs because of different devs working on different parts of game play.  Even for something that appears as auto delivery loot often requires you hit a ‚Äúconfirm‚Äù key to get it.  That‚Äôs what happened to me - why can I leave without my rewards?  I didn‚Äôt play it just to look at the rewards.  That loot should also auto deliver to my mailbox as tons of other games do.  

Developers please take a look at providing a consistent structure to rewards collection- it would be a huge help. Then I can focus on actually playing the game!
title: Great Game - Dev needs to take a look at loot system

review: I do really like this game. The art style combined with solid mechanics and an interesting story make it worth playing alone. That said, there are things that do need to be fixed. Early on they throw a lot of free stuff at you (as most f2p games do) and there is a decent amount of content to keep you occupied. The problems start once you hit adventure rank 20 or so. After awhile the game literally becomes pay to play. You have the energy to do a max of 6 missions (depending on the mission, could be as low as 2.) you are basically given a choice, save the daily gems you get to do a free 10 summon once a month, or use them to get more energy so you're able to upgrade and level up characters and gear. Despite this I do really enjoy the game and will continue to play, but if the current resin system doesn't change or they don't add other free ways to just play the game then I will be abandoning the game. Definitely worth checking out for now. Without a few changes in the future I would definitely say pass and spare your wallet.
title: Great game at the start....

review:
The game and it‚Äôs company definitely has shown previously that it can be respectful and interesting when taking inspiration from actual cultures around the world, which further helps the feeling of diversity through its stories. Each nation is rich in lore, and characters are able to have personalities and backstories that can keep you playing. 

However, with the soon to be release of Sumeru, a glaring problem has shown itself to be the very thing I compliment the game for: taking inspiration from actual cultures. Because it‚Äôs one thing to research and explore peoples cultures to use it in a fantasy setting to show the beauty and history of it, and another entirely to then remove any ethnic features from your characters and also make one of them a straight up stereotype of a greedy merchant. This game has been something I‚Äôve followed for a year and a half, and while I was aware at the start that Genshin had a colorism problem I‚Äôm surprised it‚Äôs gone this far when I really shouldn‚Äôt have been. I‚Äôm not even really excited for Sumeru to drop at this point. I‚Äôm more just waiting to see the fanbase‚Äôs reaction and what‚Äôs going to happen after.
title: I would‚Äôve rated it 5 stars tbh

review: While I was reading the reviews I saw a lot of people saying ‚Äúthis is a P2W game!‚Äù To all those people, I wish you would take a good look at the game. This is a game that is still going. If you are joining late then I can get why you would think it is P2W because of all of the characters. BUT THINK ABOUT IT! Some of the BEST teams out there are made of ALL 4* characters! They don‚Äôt even have to be maxed or have the best artifacts. Those videos that tell you which builds are great are just telling you their recommendations, NOT a FACT that they are 100% always best with those 5* weapons and artifacts. Also, to the people who gave bad reviews because of glitching and other technical issues, please check your storage. I used to have a 16GB Ipad (which was really old) and when I tried Genshin it was pretty laggy, so it may be your storage. Sorry if anyone read all this and had no issues, but this was just really bothering me.
title: Okay. This is to all of the low reviews.

review:
Genshin Impact is so successful and deserves that all, I play the game non-stop and can never put down my phone! I love it so much and the game is just amazing. The open world to go anywhere is amazing, with the sights and the realistic touches, along keeping its own design aswell is so smart. The fact the combat makes sense and is easy to do is AMAZING!! The game is so easily good and difficult, it‚Äôs not too easy but not too difficult. Knowing I can build a dream team is awesome too, but as saying that‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs way too difficult. I have tried for almost a year now to get the latest characters but they leave too fast, and are way to hard to get. No matter how much you sit and play the game, it‚Äôs like it‚Äôs pushing you to keep playing or spend money.

Genshin has its flaws but it‚Äôs an awesome game, and the fact you need to work hard is the point, to strategize and be hardworking for what you want! It‚Äôs a 10/10 game and I definitely recommend you play it!
title: Genshin is a blessing

review: Besides the anniversary drama currently, I would like to throw in that this is a free game and you don‚Äôt even have to play it‚Ä¶ some people act like they have to play it when that‚Äôs not good at all. Having that mindset only gets you stressed. It‚Äôs ok to take breaks if you‚Äôre upset about the rewards or just tired in general. Onto my review, I absolutely love Genshin impact. I don‚Äôt like the gacha aspect, I really only participate just for, like everyone does, the characters I love, but that‚Äôs not my main focus. I think the main things I love about Genshin is the co-op experiences, the story, the scenery, etc. For me, it‚Äôs like an escape. It‚Äôs unfortunate that the community has resorted to review bombing not only Mihoyo‚Äôs apps, but other apps that aren‚Äôt even associated with Mihoyo. They‚Äôre making the community look like fools. For me personally, I really could care less about the rewards as long as we‚Äôre getting something. So Happy Anniversary Genshin impact and I look forward to the years to come <3
title: Genshin Impact.

review:
This game is not just a fight n' grind simulator, no, it is a very special game to me because ilit has everything i need. this is an ongoing/indevelopment game that gets better and better by almost every day. It has new and exciting events almost every week and most importantly: this game can be played without paying even a single dollar. yes this game is for free and the thing that got me all over this masterpiece is that this game has very caring developers who do all they can to make u feel comfortable by playing their creation. their live is not only shown by updating the game and giving us events. they express their grattitude and thanksgivin to their fans and adventurers openly by making videos events and etc.
to be honest i wasn't going to write anyhing about this game, i was just going to play like i always do but the thing that changed my mind was a simple letter from the developers thanking their players just because. YES they gave us rewards just for playong this game and this is why i love it. not because of the rewards, but because of the people who show their grattitude to us and i wanna do something to pay them back. hope tou will like this game too. Love you Genshin and Love you Mihoyo <3.
title: Love This Game

review: literally played since day one done most almost all events, the game itself is decent at best after the honey moon phase. The game play loops get boring after a while with events just recycling the same ideas over and over again, daily login, mine, resin, and i forget the last one cause its all so boring, farm artifacts because you can never get the ones you want, and roll the stats for it, this whole game is a cash grab after you run out of story, and the only end game content is the abyss, which gets boring to do. Events feel like a chore after a while just to make the game feel new or relevant, but honestly the game just feels like its a giant chore and with story quests being tied to semi monthly updates and content it loses its magic every update fast after while. Then the anniversary just shows they dont care and want money from us with a 10 wish pull item and some scraps of resources. Its honestly laughable at how little they gave back to the community after a year of supporting them. Its been a grindy ride but honestly the game is boring to me and the company that runs it is greedy, even with buffing weak characters so whatever i‚Äôll look for a new game or something.
title: anniversary is bad

review: I usually hate games like these because they require skill to play, but this game requires no skill. The amount of serotonin I got from this is amazing. I especially love the amount of voice acting in this game along with the graphics. I also think it‚Äôs a very nice feature to have a time and weather cycle going even if you‚Äôre sitting idly by. You also get to cook foods and ingredients with items you have collected on the ground or have bought with the game currency which I think is a very nice side feature. I do have a question though, I noticed that we get to form bonds and friendships with the characters but does it go any farther than that? If so I think that‚Äôs really interesting. I‚Äôve been playing since yesterday and I‚Äôm already in love with this game, the plot, and the characters. If you‚Äôre reading this to decide if you want to play the game or not, I highly suggest it. It‚Äôs not a pay to win game, in fact I don‚Äôt think there are any in-app purchases though you‚Äôll have to check.

This game is AMAZING. It takes place in a fantastic open world rich with lore, scenery, and people. The gameplay mechanics are easily learned and the player characters are all very unique. Quests are easy to understand, but difficult enough that some might take some actual planning to beat. The leveling system is simple and gets increasingly harder as you go on. There are  multiple different types of puzzles out in the world that give rewards when completed. Other features such as gliding and cooking will never not be fun to do. 
It‚Äôs truly an amazing game. 
However, it‚Äôs also prone to lag and random crashes. I‚Äôm nearly 100% sure it‚Äôs due to the massive amounts of data within the game that they let you download all of at the beginning of your journey. The crashes can take place at the worst times, but they miraculously always start you back off only a few steps from where you were. 
Other than the lag and crashing, I have nothing but positive experiences playing this game. 
This game IS worth the hype.

EDIT: after about a week of playing, the crashing has almost completely stopped, though once in a blue moon does it happen again. The lag also becomes less common, though not to the same rate as the crashing. Lag occurs mostly in battle, and while it can get annoying, it‚Äôs understandable with all of the fire, magic, and claymores being thrown around. 

Still an amazing game, just thought I‚Äôd add this.
title: GREAT game

review: I cannot believe that I‚Äôve been playing Genshin impact for over 2 years. During the pandemic, it was hard dealing w/ everything and I would get bored enough that I would just sleep to spend time. But when I found this game, it was a life changing experience! Well ‚Äî atleast a game that made my life a happy one. And because of the pandemic, I couldn‚Äôt meet my friends or play w/ them a lot. But when I started playing this game, it allowed me to join others or have others join my world to make the experience even better. Not only was the game fun, but being able to feel this joy while playing w/ others made it well over amazing. I love this game w/ all my heart and it‚Äôs one of my top 5 favorite games‚ò∫Ô∏è. I must thank you, Hoyoverse, for making this game. It really has made my life happier, even if it was in the slightest ways possible(which, may i say, did much more then the slightest of changesüòâ).
title: Appreciation of this game during the pandemic

review:
The fact that this game is free is crazy. Amazing open world adventure with a great story and fun battle system. 

But bro‚Ä¶ Honkai Star rail might be up there with FFX for best return based RPG, from the same company mind you as Genshin, and they regularly show their appreciation with excellent rewards, expanding end game content, and unique fun events. Meanwhile unlike project lead for the Honkai series David Jiang, Cai Haoyu, project lead of Genshin and Company CEO with a reported networth of 3.1 Billion dollars‚Ä¶ does not respect players. Guy straight up went on the livestream for the biggest cultural exchange event of year, the thing that lets them have favor with the Chinese government and subvert some of the national gaming laws, and said for your loyalty we are giving you a 2.8% off coupon for the next five star you sink an average of 105 wishes on (the average amount of wishes to get a limited banner five star)

I love the game. But I‚Äôm standing with the CN community as a global community member and  asking that the company to respect players for their loyalty if they say that is their reason. I mean my barber gives me a free haircut once every 10 for my loyalty punch card and I guarentee their owner isn‚Äôt a billionaire.
title: Excellent game but Cai doesn‚Äôt respect loyal players like David Jiang

review: As someone who loves free to play games this is free! Yes, I know it takes a long time to download, set up, and sign in/sign up but it‚Äôs worth it! The graphics are high and the game play is smooth. Yes commissions are a chore and the quests take a long time but it‚Äôs still pretty good, just because it takes a long time doesn‚Äôt mean the whole game is bad! I personally really enjoy exploring and figuring out puzzles and fighting! Yes you may lose 50 50 to qiqi but who hasn‚Äôt? Lol. Anyways, this game is a solid 4.7/5, takes a bit to get started but it‚Äôs fun! I met many kind and nice people here! I met people from different cultures and countries that I may have never known! So for those who put a 1 star for it taking a long time to upload or the updates are slow, the developers put their time into making this a high quality game! Plus other games are also like that. Thank you for reading this! I don‚Äôt do reviews a lot~ I really enjoyed this game!
title: Honest Review

review:
The game is really fun. There‚Äôs lots of places to explore, a story behind every character, and you can play with your friends. But there are some things that bother me.
First, the game takes up a lot of storage if you play on mobile. Second, sometimes the game gets really laggy, but it‚Äôs not really a problem for me. Third, if you really want a specific character, you‚Äôre going to have to work hard, complete a lot of quests, and save up your primogems to even get a CHANCE to unlock a character. Fourth, even though this game is free to play and you don‚Äôt have to pay real money, it gets annoying when the only option you have left is to pay money for in-game currency to buy things. I‚Äôve never spent any money on this game, but I just wish there were easier ways to get wishes.
If you‚Äôre thinking of playing this game, I would recommend it. There‚Äôs some flaws, but this game can be challenging and fun at the same time.
Sorry for the long review, but have a good day!
title: It‚Äôs okay, a few problems

review: The game is amazing the graphics the story is just amazing but they are issues. Once u reach ar 45 or higher the game does get boring and no longer fun but some might disagree. 2) the wishing system is a problem more likely the weapon banner. Adding the the path systems is extremely useless tbh like the system was fine before WHY CHANGE IT INTO SOME MORE EXPENSIVE like I know your trying make a profit an all but add this new system into the weapon banner is just you asking for more people to spend on it for your own greed. 3) going back to the weapon banner system u at the same time don‚Äôt even give good or enough rewards to make up for the your useless weapon system if u gave some actually good rewards then maybe  the weapon banner wouldn‚Äôt be useless and even if it still was useless you giving good rewards would make up for it. Sorry but I‚Äôm giving this a solid 3 if u want higher rates then remove your useless weapon system.
title: Is greed coming to them

review:
So, when I got this game I was super exited! But when it comes to those scenes? Well it stays on a picture of it, it kinda makes the sounds.. some what but I can‚Äôt see anything, it‚Äôs like the game is going to crash but it isn‚Äôt.. I‚Äôm playing on my iPad, does that have to do anything with my problem?? And when i log on, I‚Äôm logged into my Game Center account but it says I have to go back to it, and when I don‚Äôt swipe the game up and restart, it crashes but that what I have to do to play it, what‚Äôs up with that?! I wanna play the game, not stare at nun all the time or whatever, but enough of me complaining, I just love all the details to this game, it is a remake of hanikai impact, (if that‚Äôs how you spell it) although I haven‚Äôt payed hanikai impact yet, or downloaded it.. so I‚Äôm not sure how good it is compared to this game, BUT I would recommend playing this game because it‚Äôs a super good game to play, only if your interested in fighting a lot and surviving, not too too much for survival but I still love it.

Have a great day, please consider what I said. Choa~
title: Amazing but super laggy (please read)

review: I have been playing this game since June 2021 and it was extremely fun for a while. Until it started to show that the developers don‚Äôt really care about their players and only care about the money. It gets stressful and annoying and starts feeling more like a chore than anything else after you keep playing. It‚Äôs more fun if you have tons of money because that means you would be able to get the 5 star character you want. Because F2P players can spend months farming for primogems to get the character they won‚Äôt, only to lose the 50/50 and having to farm all over again and it just takes up a lot of time that most people don‚Äôt have. It would be really nice if the developers could make it more F2P friendly instead of having this as a game for whales and for people with money to just throw at it. And the anniversary gifts could be better. You make enough money from this game to give us a better thank you gift because without your community and players, this game wouldn‚Äôt of become as popular as it has. So please work on making it more fun for your F2P players. Thanks.
title: Definitely NOT F2P friendly

review: I love playing Genshin; the characters are amazing, the gameplay is satisfying and the art looks beautiful. My problem comes with everything else; barely any quality of life changes since the games release, no new end game content added but plenty of other filler stuff (teapot aka housing, new RNG based rewards to bang your head against and new characters that you can‚Äôt even use if you‚Äôre new to the game) and stingy business practices with outside game events leave a bad taste in my mouth whenever I‚Äôm not playing the game. If I had a full team of the characters I wanted and I could use them in some fun content that shows what a good action rpg this game is I would give five stars easily but as it stands I‚Äôve been playing since the release casually and I have a few half built teams with bad rng artifacts. That means I struggle with content at my world level and am constantly grinding for materials to level up, not a very fun part of the game. If you love gambling you rewards and constantly grinding the same few fights every day download away but unless some things are fixed I will not change this review.
title: Fun game, lackluster everything else

review:
I‚Äôve been playing this game, as of today, for six months now and I‚Äôve never gotten bored.  The story is interesting, the characters are wonderful‚Äîeverything about the game is absolutely stunning. I‚Äôm Adventure Rank 54, soon to be 55, and there‚Äôs still a lot to do, even though I‚Äôm an endgame player.  This game has kept me hooked for hours on end, with something different to do everyday.  Whether that be farming for artifacts, ascension materials, doing the spiral abyss, exploring, or doing quests, I never feel like there‚Äôs nothing to do.  Though the wish system is a little tedious at times, at least you have something to look forward to as you finish your commissions, explore, do quests, etc.  I now have level 90 Kazuha, Tartaglia, and Diluc, and I‚Äôm still building them, even though I‚Äôve maxed out their levels.  

Anyway, this game is wonderful and it has inspired so many people, including myself.  Keep up the great work, Mihoyo! :)
title: This game is amazing!!!

review: Sadly Genshin has a few limitations. I wish that it was more compatible with most devices but I‚Äôll take what I can get. I play on mobile due to the fact it‚Äôs not compatible with both my laptops. On mobile there are a few issues. Whether it kicks you out or just freezes. But still it is still impressive to be able to play on mobile. I think the plot and the idea of the game is good! I honestly really like the adventure aspect of the game. Getting to do and walk wherever you want is quite fun! Having the freedom to grant any of your wishes. The characters are cute! Just like any Gacha game! It‚Äôs sooo tempting to just spend primogems and money on every character. I think that in the beginning It wasn‚Äôt as intriguing but once you get past the ‚Äúfighting dvalin‚Äù it definitely starts setting in. I like how most of the quests seem to connect to the plot. The graphics are to DIE for. It‚Äôs a really great game! And I think I‚Äôm already obsessed.
title: Great game! But a few issues.

review:
I really love this game a lot. I‚Äôve never played an open world game like this and I see what people mean when it is compared to BOTW. There are so many amazing qualities about this game that I could go on forever.
My issue and small complaint is something I believe quite a few others are noticing as well; the lack of mobile to ps4 cross save feature. I currently have the mobile version but the data this game takes up is horrendous! I have a ps4 that I could play on but I don‚Äôt want to start an entirely new game in order to switch platforms. Because Genshin Impact does have a feature to transfer saves from mobile to PC, I remain hopeful that the same is given to ps4 as well.
I don‚Äôt know whether creating a Mihoyo account would allow me to transfer my data; I can‚Äôt seem to find any answers regarding this anywhere.
Genshin Impact is an absolutely beautiful and astounding game but it would be much better enjoyed if it was possible to transfer mobile data to the ps4 for a better immersive experience.
title: Great! But needs mobile to ps4 cross save

review: I know this game makes u want to stay inside and ur told go touch grass or something. But this game practically is u outside. U can take in the scenery and listen to the soothing tracks. Ever since the summer of July of last year, I have been enjoying this game. But I have some problems w/ this game. DIALOGUE and GACHA SYSTEM. Let me explain. I love the wishing system and all and its in all the other games, but ur pity to get a character is way too high. There have been times where people got a five star character on a one times wish but their pity had to be super high. Its really annoying for people who r f2p. Also the dialogue. It is so long that if I do a quest all at once it takes me at least 2 hours. I remember doing the Fontaine quest w/ breaks at least 3 or 4 hours. But overall its a really good game. It helped get rid of my pain and suffering just by tapping a few buttons
title: Great game for people who enjoy going outside and enjoying scenery but there are some problems

review: I‚Äôve been playing on and off since 2020 and every time i come back there are fun things to do but then i get bored again. Sometimes i wish that we could dress up the characters instead of having set outfits, i know that they are putting out different outfits but sometimes i wish we could mix and match. I love all the characters and the lore behind everything is really cool and ties together well, i think they should definitely add more diverse skin shades on characters from the regions that are supposed to have darker skin shades. I think the new regions are absolutely beautiful and can‚Äôt wait for the other ones the scenery from all of them are beautiful. I love genshin and again i‚Äôve been playing on and off since 2020 and if i‚Äôm playing again right now than that means that there are more fun things happening lol, but this game can be slow at times and you can get bored easily so play if you think you‚Äôll enjoy it.
title: Fun game

review:
I‚Äôve been playing since may 5th 2021, I‚Äôm a few XP away from AR 58, I log in every single day and play for hours, I have multiple high AR accounts, I play on all servers. Very clearly I love this game but there is very little skin tone diversity. currently in game there are 3 non-paper white characters. Xinyan, Kaeya, and Bennett. These are the only characters in this whole entire game including NPCs that aren‚Äôt literal white.

The current available regions Mondstadt, liyue, and inazuma are based off Germany, China, and Japan, respectively. Germany I can kinda understand but China and Japan?! No way! China and Japan are very skin tone diverse countries, although skin lighting creams and skin lighting filters are very popular in these places it doesn‚Äôt change the fact that their people have a wide variety of skin shades, I have seen East Asian people darker than black people.

and in the new region Sumeru which is based on the SWANA regions which tend to have more dark skinned people, yet in the new trailer every single NPC is titanium white, as well as some of the characters from sumeru have been leaked and they‚Äôre lighter than any other characters. This is very disappointing. Hoyoverse, Please, please care about your fans. üôÅ
title: Needs skin tone diversity.

review:
Genshin is truly a unique gem of a game. The world and art style is absolutely gorgeous. The story, for the most part, is well written. The characters are amazing and they keep introducing new ones to fall in love with. The game gets constant updates to always give you something to do or something to look forward too. 

Now to address some concerns. The biggest thing people talk about is the gacha. Everyone wishes it was more generous but I don‚Äôt mind it. If you save you can get the character you want. I only buy the bp and monthly moon but even if you took away half my 5 stars I would still have a lot. 

The biggest problem I have with the game is the artifacts. I just wish there was some way to have a artifact pity system. My poor Klee still doesn‚Äôt have a good crown even after many, many tries. But overall this problem isn‚Äôt enough to lower it a star. This game is fantastic and I don‚Äôt see myself stopping anytime soon.
title: You get what you put in

review: I really didn‚Äôt get the hype over this game when i first saw it, it looked liked every other game out there. But when i downloaded it i was impressed. The characters are well made, and the storyline is what makes this game interesting. I found no holes in the storyline, the characters are easy to play, fun to look at, and the powers are very satisfying to use. The graphics are really nice, and this game requires no money to be able to progress further, and to be a good player. The only flaw is the amount of gb it takes, and the lag. Also it can be frustrating when you are in the middle of a boss fight and it kicks you out, and when you join back you are at the start of the mission and your all your food that you used in the fight is gone. This game also requires a lot of grinding, and time, but I still can play for up to an hour and get good results. Would definitely recommend. (ps, don‚Äôt use lisa for climbing)
title: Great storyline and characters!

review: Breathtaking scenery, sensational character design, gorgeous OST, delightful combat mechanics (& visuals), enthralling storytelling, flawless voice acting, and so, so much more. Not once in the [nearly] two years since i got this lovely game have i ever considered dropping it. What Genshin Impact does better than any other game i've played is, on all aforementioned fronts, achieve the pinnacle of quality and balance each element for a cohesive extremely high-quality experience. Everything about this game is done with a polish you can otherwise only find in other high-end AAA titles. The exceptionally gifted dev team keeps outdoing itself with every installment to the game and shows no signs of slowing down. This is an experience i can wholeheartedly recommend to anyone that enjoys a beautifully written story, an expertly crafted soundtrack, an engaging and rewarding combat system, downright stunning art direction and effects, and ANYTHING else one may enjoy about a video game.
title: A genuine masterpiece

review:
The tldr is. If you don‚Äôt own a switch and always wanted to play breath of the wild, go head and give this try. If you own a switch just play breath of wild. 
If u want to play this game because of a certain character, then good luck. After 60+ pulls I‚Äôve got 8 characters, 3 of them are different characters the other five where duplicate of same person, the other 52 things from the pulls are weapons. Why weapons/items don‚Äôt have their own banner is beyond me. And if u think ‚Äúwill I‚Äôll just reroll until I get the person I want‚Äù, it takes u 30-40 minutes to hit lvl 10. Which is when u get ur second x10 free roll, so with the odds on the banners you might be rerolling for days and u can‚Äôt skip cut scenes. Yes you can play this game with any character but if your like me and a certain characters combat is what caught your eye to begin with, don‚Äôt hold your breath when it comes to getting that person

After play for couple months and getting to world lvl 6, u got to love how something just straight up insta-kill ur toons. Doesn‚Äôt matter if u have 3-4 lvl 20 artifacts and lvl 80, something still just kill you in one hit regardless if ur full hp
title: Combat 4/10 Graphics 6/10 Gacha odds 2/10

review: To be honest this game is so entertaining, and would keep me on here for hours! I‚Äôm surprised on how much effort is put into this game. Especially when it has a giant story! I honestly can‚Äôt believe how big this game grew, I could see why when I first starting playing I was mind blowed! There is so much to do here, bosses,quests,collecting characters,exploration, and even playing with others! Even tho the game dose take up a lot of space for fellow mobile players. I think it should be worth the space because of how much effort there is in this! More people should definitely try this game I‚Äôm telling you it could be the best thing ever. I think this is why this game deserves this rating and all the people that support them I mean they really deserve it!
title: Best game I ever played!

title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS GAME

review: I have been a long time genshin player. I joined in the 1.4 patch, and let me tell you, it was a blast! Not only was the game beginner friendly, but there were so many things to do at the time! I caught up to the story around the 1.6 update, just in time for the Inazuma update. I loved inazuma, there was so much to do and I have completed and maxed out that entire region. However , the game has now started to change. It is no longer beginner friendly. The character designs are repetitive and unoriginal. As of today, character designs from the new region have came out and they are horrible. Zero representation for darker skin colors , or just any skin colors other than paper white. This company supports the sexualization of young children and makes promises they can‚Äôt keep. At this point in the game, it is taking far to long to get anything done. There are many flaws in the gameplay, many of which haven‚Äôt even been reconsidered to be changed or fixed. They give out surveys monthly yet only listen to the Chinese players. Overall, I‚Äôm considering quitting and not continuing unless the clean up their act. 1/10 , do not recommend!

title: Why me? üôÇ

review: Genshin Impact went downhill after the Windblume festival. Company stopped interacting with its fanbase, released characters with really bad kits (some of which can only be improved with multiple constellations, forcing players to spend even more money on the gacha). And don‚Äôt even get me started on the anniversary rewards. 400 primos, a ten pull and a glider. Comes off as really ungrateful for a company who made 2.45 billion dollars in a year just from mobile players. The only other things we got were literal contests, the winners of which had a 10% chance to win 100 primogems. Mihoyo has no respect for its playerbase or fanartists, and calling company advertisement with minimal rewards an ‚Äúanniversary celebration‚Äù shows that. No wonder everyone‚Äôs moving to Cookie Run. For Honkai‚Äôs anniversary, mihoyo gave players a five-star equivalent for free. What happened? The company got so, so stingy when they released Genshin Impact. I love the game and it had so much potential, but with the lazy writing of the recent quests and everything i‚Äôve listen previously, my opinion of this game is getting lower than the company‚Äôs generosity. I and everyone else in the fanbase are extremely tired of this behavior from mihoyo.
title: Good game, bad company

review:
So i had genshin, and i was all about it. I played for HOURS at a time and yet i didn‚Äôt know it had co-op. Now a-lot of parents don‚Äôt like multiplayer games with people you most likely don‚Äôt know, thats fine, worrying about your child‚Äôs safety. The slight problem is that parents are most definitely going to delete the game if it had co-op installed in the genshin system. Which might default the company‚Äôs game content as a whole. 
A smart add is for a parental control,
Which would manage how much time you can play for and co-op settings which enable removal or only being able to chat with certain people. My mom deleted it for this reason. Altogether, many people cant play genshin because of co-op, and it would be nice if they added controls for parents such as these. Other than that, beautiful graphics and good characters, and controls aren‚Äôt confusing at all, just needs some child safety. 
9/10, would play again if i ever get the chance. Thank you devs for reading. (*'‚ñΩ'*)
title: Maybe a little control for parents..?

Well theres a bug or problem with that. Everytime I glide across it just makes me fall slowly and no wind current appears my screen is just stuck in one position and I cant do anything but do the plunge attack on some of my characters the worst thing possible is that I have to do this quest to unlock co op which I cant do because of this bug, anyways in more information about the bug all i could say is theres like an invisble wall that is keeping me from going any further, I cant move my screen or anything it just lets me fall after Paimons dialogue. title: I love the game! But can you please fix this bug?

review:
Genshin is a beautiful game with a wonderful storyline, lore, characters, graphics. I really recommend it (for the people who have enough storage). You can walk anywhere, other than past the red lines, and it‚Äôs just wonderful. 

However the problems. MiHoyo gives us less rewards than Honkai Starrail. I‚Äôm not mad, just kinda confused. Genshin is the one game that got popular and probably even made and transferred their players to Honkai, probably half the players in Honkai Starrail were from Genshin. Atleast give us a free 10 pull. And just like in Honkai Starrail, give the new players free ten pulls. And the event rewards‚Ä¶they‚Äôre just bad. Not too bad, but still bad. Oh, and we have to talk about Qiqi, first of all, her skill. Make it shorter. Second of all, her damage, make it better. Third, give her another sprinting voice line. Look, I love Qiqi, she‚Äôs my main. And that‚Äôs exactly why I want it to change, I want her damage to be better so that I can actually enjoy playing with Qiqi. MiHoyo, please.
title: Wonderful game but a few issues

review: This game compared to mobile games is definitely a must have. It being a open world breath of the wild style game. Exploring and grinding quite fun. The story while so far nothing spectacular is fun. The only two things that brings this game down a little. Is the gatcha system and rates. While free I wish they did things like separate the weapons from the character banner. Do what epic seven and allow multiple rerolls. So you don‚Äôt have to make a new account. Plus that would stop people selling accounts. Another thing is for people that aren‚Äôt used to gatcha game or rusty. Give them some more tips like focusing on two dps rather than the whole team. Had to start over cause I had to much fun and spread my resources thin. Trying out all the new units. Still for a mobile game this is the best of its kind. It‚Äôs about as good breath of the wild a fun but flawed game in iteself. So yeah I recommend it...... though devs can you please stop giving me 5 star weapons and just give me a five star character instead. XD

title: Genshin Impact

review: It‚Äôs a good game as long as you don‚Äôt need any actual help and you avoid the glitches. I‚Äôve been playing since January 2021 right after it was released. The game has good graphics and lots of stories, so if you are just starting you should be in the clear. However, some things to keep in mind: don‚Äôt spend crystals the last 10 mins of a battle pass, there is a glitch that won‚Äôt let you get the rewards and if by chance you email the correct customer service the answer is basically too bad so sad (in essence it‚Äôs your fault for unlocking those levels so late); and be careful completing quests and make sure you save and verify your files often, some quests will glitch and won‚Äôt let you complete them (their answer is have you verified your file?) there is at least one quest I haven‚Äôt completed because of this but that‚Äôs 1/200+ quests it‚Äôs not all but enough. Thankfully it‚Äôs a side quest and it doesn‚Äôt have any notifications about it needing to be completed. Overall it‚Äôs a good game but avoid anything too strenuous on the game and you should have fun
title: Good game, below average customer service

review:
I started Genshin Impact not to long ago, and I cannot get enough of it. The aura around it, the feeling of pride when accomplishing something- it‚Äôs a rare trait for games to have. Genshin brought me back to games. The characters play a big role in it too. The characters feel real, they have personality‚Äôs, they‚Äôre fun. The quality of the game is amazing, the way it feels real and the cut scenes are so beautiful. It‚Äôs got be so addicted, I stayed up from 3 am to now, not leaving the app ONCE. 
I personally love Venti, he is my favorite character and I‚Äôm even getting a cosplay of him! miHoYo, if you‚Äôre reading this, please bring the Venti banner back. I was very bummed when I saw that you couldn‚Äôt get him any other way. But still, he ranks top tier of my fiction crushes :).

If you want to download Genshin but aren‚Äôt sure about it, definitely do it. I cannot even describe the tips of this game‚Äôs addictiveness in a paragraph, but know it is the best game I‚Äôve ever played.
title: I am addicted to this game.

review: You cannot claim to be international yet be completely exclusive of races other than PALE WHITE. The only moderately tan characters we have are 4 stars xinyan and kaeya. A starter character and a character with a very flawed kit that is highly unpopular. We don‚Äôt just want a flimsy kind of tan side character you can throw in to please people. We want EFFORT put into these characters and DARK SKIN. This game attracts people based off of these characters and I‚Äôm sure many dark skin people and more would be highly intrigued and want to play if they could relate to a character or saw a positive representation of their culture! I‚Äôm also disappointed with the effort put into character gameplay and we should be able to know what to expect with each new patch. Let‚Äôs not forget the billions of dollars your company makes yet players have to save for 2 months just to get one character it would be nice to know early on. With your success your company needs to be fairly more generous with rewards, primos, end games content, etc. Do better! This game deserves to be improved.
title: I‚Äôm disappointed

review:
I LOVE the game so far! It really is like botw, which makes me appreciate it even more. The graphics, storyline, and everything about the world is beautiful. I‚Äôve spent a good few hrs so far without getting bored. I also like how this game isn‚Äôt pay to play. The spawn rates aren‚Äôt that good but I can live with it. You can still progress in the game with the default characters. The game itself is great, but I do have some suggestions that I think will make the game even better:

- The ability to go into every building. While the towns are beautiful and big, I think it would be great being able to walk into houses and every business.
- Have more ways of healing. Cooking is great but maybe add an inn at each town? And also, have characters revive over time after getting defeated in battle? Or you can even add a feature where characters heal little by little whenever they sit.
- Have the npc conversations go back to where you left off prior to you selecting your reply. It‚Äôs kind of annoying having to go through all the dialogue in order to read the answer to every choice.

Like I said, the game is fun. The only real con I have is that the game overheats my phone and crashes at times. I usually have to play with my phone near a fan and plugged in to keep it cool and prevent the battery from draining. Other than that, you would not regret downloading the game!

Note: I play on an iphone 8 so I can‚Äôt speak for the experience on older models.
title: FUN & some suggestions

review:
I started playing Genshin a week after release‚Äîafter a friend of mine told me he was playing, where I decided to download it and join in. Who would‚Äôve thought that a small ‚Äúwhy not?‚Äù decision would thrust me into a fantastical world with a vast amount of imagination. I cherish the idea that I had grown alongside Genshin Impact, getting to experience the world develop, while I developed my account. 
Three and a half years later and I still play. With various accounts on all servers, just to be able to experience the storyline all over again, and meeting characters that vary from Amber in Monstadt‚Äîthe whole way to Fontaine where I met Wriothesley most recently! Being able to experience the different wonders of the Teyvat world has been an adventure I‚Äôve always seemed to hold close to my heart. To each of the new accounts I‚Äôve made is a new taste and flavor of nostalgia‚Äîwhere I miss October 4th, 2020, all over again.
title: Best 3 1/2 years of my gaming life.

title: My ideas and opions

review: Genshin Impact was a fun game. It was adventurous with characters and all this fun stuff to do- but no. Here are my reasons of why I don‚Äôt like Genshin Impact anymore: 1. It takes up so much storage. Once, I had deleted ALL of my apps just to play this game and it STILL didn‚Äôt work! Even my best friend had a whole different iPad just for this to work! I know this isn‚Äôt really a mobile game but why release it on mobile if it‚Äôs gonna take up so much storage? 2. Maybe this was just me, but my quality was bad. When I played on my phone and iPad it was kinda blurry. My iPad is old, but my phone is one of the newest ones so why would it be blurry? 3. It‚Äôs racist. Notice how there are little to no black characters? The only mixed character is pretty much white washed as well. Yeah, I haven‚Äôt heard much good things about the creators of the game. 4. The creators of this game are pedophiles. I don‚Äôt have much research of that either, my best friend just told me about it a while ago but I can remember that it was a good reasoning of why you guys are pedophiles. That‚Äôs pretty much it, it‚Äôs a good gameplay, but there is just so many cons about this game and it can be glitchy sometimes. Byee!
title: No. Just NO.

review: First of all, I want to mention the racism that this game includes. The Sumeru cast was leaked, and there is only ONE character that isn't white. (The region is based off of south asia?) And Dori is a whole stereotype? Like what's going on with that? Also, the lack of communication with the fanbase is astonishing. This company does NOT listen to the fanbase or take criticism unless their own money is at risk. Also, there is a severe lack of endgame content, there's nothing to do after AR 55, and events feel repetitive and boring. And lots of story quests don't contribute much to the lore, and center around boring npcs we don't care about. Also, the rate resin refills at is way too slow. And, artifacts are NEEDED to make your characters good, but it's total RNG, and it takes FOREVER to get good ones. Also, bosses aren't getting harder, they're just getting more HP stacked onto them, and Hoyoverse is so afraid of powercrep they don't come out with more powerful characters to easily take them down. Until this game starts improving, I would advise not playing it, or spending any money on it.
title: Lots of issues.

review: If you‚Äôve played games like Breath of the Wild, maybe some of the ‚ÄúTales Of‚Äù series, this game is so good. The graphics are absolutely phenomenal. The sights to see are so beautiful, it‚Äôs so detailed and pleasing. From the graphics to the gameplay, this game is flawless. They‚Äôre constantly coming out with new characters and weapons, making adjustments so the game runs to its full capacity, and making sure the players are satisfied. You earn rewards for being adventurous and making mistakes. The developers also give you many free items in your in-game mailbox which helps a ton. There‚Äôs always new events and ways to earn primogems and mora (in game currencies) to help you out! Despite some easy glitches, such as chests sometimes not opening in co-op mode, or your friends swimming in the ground (it‚Äôs hilarious), this game is everything I‚Äôve wanted in a mobile game. It‚Äôs hard to believe that this is free to play. Start your own adventure and play with your friends!
title: If you like Multiplayer RPG Games...this is for you

review: Mihoyo seems to be making a lot of money but doesn‚Äôt like to reward their players for that donation. I have seen the charts on how much Mihoyo makes from banners and it‚Äôs amazing to think that people pay that much for characters but you would think that Mihoyo would show gratitude to the players by adding new ways to gain the currency to get said characters for free at times. In the game it may seems like their are a lot of ways to get that currency but there will come a time that players just plateau and will have nothing to do in game other than dailies and weeklies if you need them then log off for a repeat the following day. Chests are not infinite and once all quests have been completed you are left with nothing much to do. Events are a way for Mihoyo to show gratitude for the players but are lackluster once played. Events can get you some currency but the amount is lackluster if you think about how much is needed to obtain a character, plus on how much you have to wish to obtain the character you want with a 0.67% drop rate. In the end i say that Mihoyo should take better care for players as they are the reason why they still exist. They must be fair!
title: No love from Mihoyo

review:
Gameplay:
From the few minutes I played this game I could see it had tons of potential. The gameplay felt good, the world seemed interesting, and overall made me think of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, which is a good thing. The fact that it is a mobile game is impressive as well; it being free to try is probably the biggest reason to check it out and adds for it are not even overhyping it like other games have done with misinformation (RSL).
Performance:
The large scale environment combined with the console level gameplay is truly impressive with no graphical issues or gameplay bugs. With the ZBotW style gameplay, you can explore freely and see the nooks around the map and still with no glitches.
Visuals:
The performance could come down to the semi simplistic styles but that is also a catch of the game. It is colorful but controlled which makes everything distinct. I am a big fan of environments and atmosphere in video games and I hope to see a bit of variety. I enjoy darker tones and colors but I could still enjoy the lighting and colors.
Hopes:
I want to see this team tackle more types of generas with this similar gameplay and performance. I have seen a lot of fantasy games with the similar visual style and this one has done the best from a glance. However even though they have done it the best doesn‚Äôt mean they can‚Äôt spread there wings and possibly save mobile gaming from the repetitive fantasy worlds.
title: The first few minutes: my thoughts.

review:
I have seen so many mobile MMOs that I was scared this would just be a carbon copy of the others gameplay wise. I was so pleasantly surprised. There is no button you can press to have the game play itself, there is nothing to automatically move your character from place to place. You are forced to run around this world and explore which I absolutely adore. Not only that but the graphics are stunning! I don‚Äôt even mind that I had to free up quite a bit of storage on my phone just to download this, it was worth it! I wouldn‚Äôt have even minded paying for this game. I genuinely never expected the quality to be as good as this. Yes Honkai Impact is fun, but this game is on the next level. 
ALSO WHY ARE THERE SO MANY ATTRACTIVE CHARACTERS IN THIS GAME LIKE WHAT?! I‚Äôm going to be really irritated when I look at one of my sketchbooks and it‚Äôs just filled with these characters and human versions of monsters bc I totally haven‚Äôt started drawing the monsters as humans already. 
Send help I‚Äôm obsessed.
title: Favorite Mobile Game EVER

review: Genshin is fine. Aesthetic wise, it‚Äôs above almost every mobile game I‚Äôve played, and the first few hours are a blast. However, because it‚Äôs trying to be both a gatcha game and an open world game similar to others, it fails at both. It‚Äôs not good at being open world due to having to grind repeatedly, making the world feel less and less interesting by the day. And it‚Äôs not a good gatcha game by making it not worth paying under hundreds of dollars. But the biggest problem with genshin impact is how it punishes you. If you play through the game fast, it punishes you by not having any end game content, and if you play the game slow, it punishes you by having the difficulty go above what you‚Äôre capable of, making everything even slower. To get the most out of the game, you have to play as efficiently as possible while keeping a very specific speed as to not fall into the boredom that comes with moving too fast or slow, and that‚Äôs no fun. This might improve in the future, but that would likely take a year at least.
title: Not worth playing long term.

review: Coming into this game I thought i was fake when I saw the trailer on the App Store but it blew my MIND when I started playing it first of all I‚Äôve never thought in a million years that a game like this open world battle game would exist this early I‚Äôm very HAPPY ‚ù§Ô∏è I think this is the very very closest game that comes anywhere near Breath of the wild I‚Äôd BOtw had a combat system like this one I would still be playing Botw when I found out of can change the graphics to even higher same with the FPS THE GAME RAN EVEN SMOOTHER!!! And more beautiful I kinda feel guilty playing this game for free I wouldn‚Äôt complain if you charged for this game but thank you so much for making this game free a lot of people including myself can‚Äôt get the money right now but I‚Äôm happy it‚Äôs free thank you so much I‚Äôll complete this game it‚Äôs lot of fun I recommend going into settings and changing the FPS to 60 and the graphics even higher your experience will be 100% even more enjoyable thank you!!!!

review:

Playing the game myself, however, made me enjoy the game so much more. The characters and scenery are absolutely beautiful, the music is amazing, and the main and side stories are easy to follow.   I haven‚Äôt spent any money so far, and I don‚Äôt feel the need to. Eventually, I realized the gatcha rate was pretty awful. 5 stars are extremely difficult to pull, you barely get any free currency, and you need multiple copies of a character to reach full power. Eventually, I just stopped playing, thinking maybe I‚Äôd come back to it if things got better. Fast forward to now, and I check the reviews. Sure enough, it hasn‚Äôt improved. Gatcha still as terrible as ever, mechanics nobody wanted, and I‚Äôve even heard you need 20 GB of space for it. I‚Äôd say I have a relatively good storage plan, but this is almost a sixth of it by itself. That was enough for me to finally uninstall. I figured if they hadn‚Äôt fixed it yet, they aren‚Äôt planning to. I‚Äôve also heard rumors of issues of representation of people of color in the game, but I‚Äôve been away from the game‚Äôs community so I can‚Äôt say for sure what‚Äôs going on there. Either way, it hurts knowing the game could have been better, but the company‚Äôs lack of care just held it back.

title: An honest opinion on genshin impact

review: This is easily my favorite mobile game of all time, thanks to the gorgeous graphics and extremely fun gameplay. The fighting mechanics are nearly flawless (with elemental reactions being a very big contributor to the fun). The story itself isn‚Äôt the game‚Äôs greatest strength, but it is still very fun to play through and see how everything unfolds. I am quite intrigued how everything will play out in the future; it is incredibly hard not to find spoilers all over the internet! It‚Äôs hard to believe that so much content can be found in a mobile game. My only complaint about the game is the whole ‚ÄúGacha mechanic‚Äù rewards system, which makes it incredibly difficult to get good rewards from your rolls without paying money. The pity system is a very welcome addition to this mechanic, but I think the rolls should be a bit more ‚Äúmerciful‚Äù. However, even though I am completely free to play, I was able to get a five star character eventually, and despite not having many, I still greatly enjoy the game! Keep up the good work, Mihoyo!
title: Absolutely Awesome

review: The game is good in terms of play and being able to roam freely. There is a variety of things to do and characters to unlock. Plus, events and good lore. But, the rewards for such efforts are quite underwhelming and the anniversary‚Ä¶ yeah that is just 100 times worse. I mean, a total of 60 primos a day without any events doesn‚Äôt help someone get banner character back to back especially in a 6 week span. In addition, just giving people 30k mora after a survey isn‚Äôt much of anything especially for an AR55 ranked player like myself. Now, lemme get to the crappy part which is the anniversary web event rewards. 90% chance to win 100k mora and then there‚Äôs 1,000 people who only get 100 primos. That is just like giving people the middle finger after playing your own game. Plus, the developers don‚Äôt even own up to such mistake which is not a good business move on their end. Just letting it run rampant while sitting back and thinking it is not normal isn‚Äôt right. At least mend the mistakes or else it only gets worse as time progresses.
title: Game is good but reward is not

review:
The world is pretty and the characters make some fun teams, but all the designs are very chaste and puritanical compared to MHY‚Äôs other efforts. It‚Äôs also somehow even greedier and stingier than HI3, a game that was renowned for both its combat and its stinginess towards players. Lack of rewards, bonuses, a pity system that is a couple steps backwards from HI3 including a worse UI, and the ever present requirement for dupes to unlock character traits lead to a very player unfriendly environment.

The biggest claim to fame here is support that extends to console (although even that is limited so much it‚Äôs almost not worth mentioning), but the hoops they had to jump through for that means that monthly logins are awkwardly through a website that has no direct connection to the game.

Overall what we have is a game that is superficially great but ultimately fails in every single aspect once you dig below the surface. If you absolutely need a gatcha game with an explorable 3D overworld then it‚Äôs worth playing because options are limited, but other games have better combat, better systems, and are friendlier to players.
title: The graphics are nice, that‚Äôs about it

review: Goodness I am in love with this game. I have tried to leave but so far no game I've tried feels quite right. I love how it feels to play the game and I have an emotional attachment to some of the characters, including NPCs. The only problem with Genshin Impact is the enormous amount of space that it takes, especially for a mobile game. I have never had this sort of problem with any other game and it gets more outrageous with each update. Another thing is that there isn't enough things to do in late game, and while i haven't yet tried this new permanent update gameplay thing, I feel like there probably never will be enough content for late game. Also, the updates seem to be getting even more boring as they come and I'm afraid that by the time that all 7 nations are out that it'll just be repeating what happens in the first few nations. These are my only few complaints about the game, and I totally recommend it to anyone who likes open-world gameplay.

title: Wow. Just wow

review: I found this game to be an enjoyable experience. The ability to teleport between different locations is gratifying, and the ability to play for extended periods of time without breaking the device is remarkable. I am proud of the fact that I know how to play the game, however, to me, everything is always mysterious, and I wonder what is better. It is pleasant to feel a sense of euphoria each time I open the application, as I know that a mission awaits me or that I can engage in dialogue with other players. The graphics of this game are excellent and tie the entire game together. The dialogue in this game is quite unique, and the fact that I never know what is behind each task makes me enjoy every second of it. I am thankful for the chance to express my opinion on this game. I am a fan of this game, and I am thankful for your assistance at a time when you are not aware of it. I hope there will be new developments in the future.
title: Great game üíï

review:
Presented as an open world game, it really is dynamic, and it doesn‚Äôt cling to one thing or one aspect, the game has a lot of aspects and a lot of things you can focus on, like? do you want to explore the map and collect items, or do you want to build characters to defeat bosses, ect,

thought the game has a couple of downsides to it, starting with several glitches in events, the really bad rng, greedy company, and the miserable fanbase.

Breaking it down, 
the game revolves a lot around rng/luck based iteams, characters, weapons, and more, this is something most people can progress and deal with, but in late game, things like this just become frustrating and makes the game repetitive and very non-entertaining‚Äî THOUGH because of events and ongoing story quest IT IS something you can cope with,

Also, I have used money on this game‚Äî explaining this in a central way, Mihoyo is a very greedy company when it comes to Genshin, rarely do we get awards worth while, and the game truly does cater to heavy spenders, through for a casual player, I can see how this isn‚Äôt even an issue. 

One thing that‚Äôs also very frustrating is the gacha system, though, thanks to more frequent reruns, it does make things slightly better.. 

anyhow, This game has really meant the world to me for the past year, I‚Äôve been through tough times and getting on genshin and finding something to distract myself with has truly caused for an amazing experience overall, I truly recommend it.

review: I LOVE Genshin impact so much! However, the only issue I have with it is how much space it takes up. If I were playing on a PC, it wouldn‚Äôt be an issue, but I play on mobile, because I can‚Äôt afford one. It‚Äôs over 20 GBs, and takes up nearly half of my storage. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, the storyline and characters are worth it, but I can‚Äôt keep deleting stuff just to play. Again, I love Genshin impact. The art style and graphics are gorgeous, the voices are amazing in all languages, the storyline is outstanding, and the play style is quite fun and interesting, but I always end up deleting it because it takes up way too much space. Considering the amount of detail in the game, I can definitely see why it takes up so much. I‚Äôve played it for over two years, and it never fails to impress. title: Fantastic, Beautiful game!!!  But‚Ä¶..

review: I play this game mostly on PC so it‚Äôs much harder by comparison to play on my phone, even with an external controller. The screen is too tiny and the device gets warm. BUT this app satisfies the itch and allows for checkins, shopping, and claiming rewards. The developers have done a fantastic job with almost constant updates and events. Gets a little boring after you complete all the events and quests, but it takes a long time to get there. The grind is real, but I don‚Äôt mind. That‚Äôs the game. You really don‚Äôt have to spend a dime to have a good time in Teyvat and you get all you need to get through the game for free. Don‚Äôt listen to all the entitled people complaining about not getting enough rewards. title: Hard to Play on Phone

review:
Overall, Genshin is a very fun game! I‚Äôve appreciated the characters and story so far, just having fun and enjoying it for what it is. However, as Sumeru approaches, it has become very clear how Hoyoverse is going to treat this wonderfully diverse region. As a brown person myself who descends from one of the regions Sumeru is inspired by, seeing most of the characters being sheet pale is just‚Ä¶ sad, not to mention the clashing and stereotypical designs. I understand being uninformed, yet Hoyoverse has made clear effort in the past with Yun Jin, for example. Chinese Opera is a very rich and beautiful art, and they made sure to treat a character with this background respectfully and carefully. They did very well with her, creating and interesting and engaging character. The lack of care with this region is saddening and loses a lot of the depth that comes with it in exchange for cheap orientalist takes on the life and most importantly people in these places. 

Hoyoverse has the power to make this change and they should. The places that inspire Sumeru have incredibly rich histories, cultures, foods, and life. Leaving such behind will ultimately be a huge loss for the story they‚Äôve crafted.

title: AR, game content, resin and domain problems

review:
If your looking for a fun game to either pass time or invest your days into this is the game to do it with. The other review is someone who tried to launch it when the server wasn‚Äôt live yet. So that problem won‚Äôt happen for you. Back to the review. I‚Äôve played over a hundred hours during the beta and everything translates well to the base game as well. This game has full voice acting for most of the characters in the world going into this game don‚Äôt think of this as a BOTW clone. This game was heavily inspired by BOTW‚Äôs art style but that‚Äôs the only part taken. This game is built from the ground up and people can easily sink 200 hours into the game. A heads up is the company who makes this game is famous for making gatcha games. Everything in this game can be earned in game but it also can be bought with money. There is also co-op in the game. So if the gatcha style bums you out just know that the summon system is the only gatcha mechanic.

 I hope this review helps you out.

title: Very good game, but something is wrong

review:

Battle combat does get kinda repetitive, that‚Äôs my only nickpick. I haven‚Äôt got far into the game (Adventure level 10) but I wish there were more combos you can learn. If anyone played Samurai Jack: Battle Through Time, then you will understand where I‚Äôm getting at. You can spend points/coins/gems to learn new combos,
specials and etc. It‚Äôs not a big problem maybe the feature is unlocked later on in the game idk, but it will make the game a dozen times better, regardless this is still a great game and definitely will get my 5 stars!

title: Great game

review: I really wish I could rate this game higher than one star.  It has a ton of potential, and I looovvvee the idea of a wide open world with quests.  I play on an iPad, and the first problem I encountered was basic navigation.  There is a joystick control in the lower left corner of the screen, but it‚Äôs never mentioned in the help, and there‚Äôs not enough contrast that you can easily see it.  I only found it because I remembered another game with a similar control that I hadn‚Äôt been able to see either.  Once I got navigation sorted out, I advanced to Adventurer 4 and had fun doing that, but then I got to the part where I made it to Mondstadt and was given my glider and forced into a confrontation with Stormterror.  The audio is apparently corrupted because it keeps stuttering and the screen is completely black except for a few controls.  Every now and then, I see a red arrow, and I assume Stormterror is in that direction, but I can‚Äôt see what I‚Äôm supposed to be doing.  Things like this really ruin the game for me.  I will probably uninstall and reinstall and try again, but I don‚Äôt hold out hope it will help much.  I‚Äôd like to be able to escape that quest, but I can‚Äôt.
title: Lots of potential, but poor instructions...and buggy

review:
So I I got the game and decided to check it out since the ads on it were really good. I really want to enjoy the game, but the entire game is just like, "no you don't get to enjoy this". 

The intro backstory is very VERY laggy. Like I couldn't really enjoy it and no matter how many times I close out the game and reopen it to see if it'll stop the lag, it doesn't. 

The second part is the game. The entire world is literally a black void, not even joking with you. There's nothing but black void. I was heavily confused and tried accessing the game controls and couldn't find them to see if it'll fix the black screen that I'm seeing. 

Last part is that Everytime the character steps in water, (can't see the water mainly because the entire world is a black void but know it's water because it keeps saying wet) it give this bright blob of light, not letting me see the character at all and it won't go away for like half a minute. 

These are the only problems I'm experiencing at the moment so I would really really REALLY be grateful if there was a way you guys could fix this because the game looks absolutely amazing from the ads. Since it's very much new to the public, I highly understand why this is happening. Which is why I'm still giving 4stars since this is very much excusable. 

Overall, I'll be fully ready to give a 5star when these little malfunctions are fixed. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
title: Plz help

review: I love this game the characters are adorable and everything is so detailed, from the grass to clouds in the sky it‚Äôs amazing and vibrant, I love that the map it so huge! If my friend hadn‚Äôt told me this was coming out I probably never would have played it but I am glad I did! This is the kind of game that you want to play for several hours and there is so much to explore, I wish you could actually team up with online players and have a more social aspect kinda like tales of wind and Iruna does that would make this game absolutely PERFECT! title: Amazing game, however.

review: so, i'm a person who plays genshin daily, and i enjoy it lots. but i recently finished all of my quests and all that's left for me to do is boring world quests, and daily commissions, and story quests. and i enjoy the game a lot, it's just there's not much i can do anymore. i've explored pretty much everywhere, i've done the events, i've done spiral abyss, i've even done almost all of the story quests. but after i finish those, what's left to do? the four star character quest things? i've already done most of them. world quests? boring. i've been leveling up my characters and all, and as an F2P that takes time. and i get bored pretty easily. i've even almost leveled up all of my statues to level ten. there's just hardly anything to do, and i think after i get all the characters, i'll just go to honkai. honestly i just need something to distract myself with, and genshin can't really do that anymore.
title: it's good, but...

review: I started playing April of this year, and so far, the game has left be absolutely baffled. The graphics, characters, storyline, and playstyle are all magnificent! It keeps me very entertained and has allowed for a understanding of how to manipulate the characters to do more damage with artifacts and all. The story is one that is able to portray the hardships of characters as well as their journeys as they go through life in Teyvat. All of this game is amazing however, my only complaint is the lack of resin available. With needing to farm for things like artifacts, talents, and boss drops, the limited resin really makes it a struggle to do all of this at a continuous rate. I think there should be, if not more than 160 resin a day, increasing places to obtain fragile resin would be appreciated as well. That being said, this has to be one of my favorite games of all time, and I am glad that I was able to play it before the release of Fontaine!
title: Fantastic game! But...

review:
This game is great in a lot of ways. The graphics are fantastic. The combat system is sophisticated and fun. The majority of story is inspiring and deep. The world is vast with many many scenery to explore. The events have varied gameplay and great stories too.

The only thing I find problematic is that new players are missing a lot of content and equipment from past events. There are no alternative ways to get them back other than watching videos from other players. Given the quality of these content it‚Äôs really a pity. There are limited stories, weapons, characters, areas, and more. The FOMO is super strong. As the game keeps growing, it would be less and less appealing to new players as the limited content they are gonna miss keeps growing too. Some of these limited content is only for more various play style. Others contain important lore and are crucial for cohesive storytellings. The later is even worse as it prevents new players from fully experience the story.
title: Great game with a lot of FOMO

review: Hello hoyoverse! I absolutely love this app, it‚Äôs amazing and has many options to do in this game. But there‚Äôs one thing I‚Äôd love to address, characters. All characters we know are very fit and skinny. We‚Äôd love to see some characters that are a little bit more diverse then others. It‚Äôd be more open and a little more creative.
