For example, in the water, add sharks so when you swim in the middle of the water it‚Äôs a easy way for the animals to get you. Just please add some diversity to our game, xoxo, genshin player. <3
title: character(s)

review: this game is a masterpiece of modern game engineering. any way you choose to play the game, there is something to entertain according to the taste of each player. this game is also a global conversation between players from all over the world, and the game mirrors the perspectives of our planet in the game; european/american, china/mainland asia, japan/korea, which also mirrors the cultures of the players in a fun way, and the co-op opportunities and social media presance of content creators is also a global conversation. probably one of the best action-rpgs i've ever played, a new sort of model, though! the game is free to play because the "whales" pay for the game and that allows folks to play for free and get an equal enjoyment of the game. a revolutionary sort of approach to gaming. also, being on mobile, counsole, and PC means that multiple platform communities are goong through the same content regardless of the method of gameplay. quite a fascinating game.
title: global level masterpiece of a game

review: *F2P means Free to play* Genshin impact is an amazing game for anyone interested in open world RPGs. It has UNLIMITED things to do: world quests, side quests, boss fights, story quests, world exploration, etc etc. Though you have infinite things to do, you can spend a lot of time playing the game only to earn a measly amount of primogems (the currency used to gamble for characters). For example, by completing all four daily commissions, you obtain 40 primogems and a 20 primogem completion bonus. To put this into perspective, you need 160 primogems for a singular wish. Every ten wishes, you are guaranteed a 4‚≠êÔ∏è character OR weapon. After around 75 wishes, you are guaranteed a 5‚≠êÔ∏è character (or a weapon in some cases). Though the game isn‚Äôt solely about getting new characters and weapons, it‚Äôs nice to be able to obtain cool in game content without needing to pull out the credit card. Other than that, I think the game is phenomenal and I can‚Äôt wait for future updates and content.
title: Great game, but disappointing for F2P players

review: When I first started playing the game I had a lot of fun exploring the open world, doing quests, and building characters. But Hoyoverse has very clearly displayed harmful stereotypes through its reveal of the Sumeru characters along with an antisemitic caricature Pulcinella. The three current regions each have their separate representation and inspiration from China, Japan, and Germany, while Sumeru will be a ‚Äúexotic‚Äù muster of a nation. Not to mention the colorism that‚Äôs shown through the lack of varying skin tones, only two playable characters being brown thus far ‚Äî with no dark skinned characters ‚Äî which Sumeru characters so far have barely added to that number. (The majority of characters of Sumeru characters to brown ones is incredibly high). It‚Äôs very clear the company and its employees have done no research nor care about the cultures and people their work is inspired by and it shows that in incredibly harmful ways. It clearly caters to a certain ‚Äî racist and ignorant ‚Äî audience. With the racist direction Genshin Impact is taking, I will not be playing if it‚Äôs not changed. I was looking forward to Sumeru but with each reveal of what will entail is greatly disappointing. Hoyoverse, do better.
title: Racist Game

review:
Genshin Impact is an amazing game and I always look forward to logging in and exploring Teyvat. The character design is so beautiful, the graphic design on the world is outstanding and overall this is such a fun game. 
I love saving primo gems and wishing for new characters. It‚Äôs always a good feeling to get and test out new characters. I personally have a couple favorite characters that include Thoma and Lisa. They are both calming characters and miHoYo did something right when they created this game.
I 10/10 recommended getting this game- it will change your life in ways you never would have thought of.
The characters back stories are so interesting to read. They also help get into the zone of getting to know these characters. I love how everyone has a different personality. It makes the game a lot more interesting. Sometimes I wonder how the day is going to go after logging in. ‚ÄúIs Kaeya going to flirt with me today?‚Äù ‚ÄúI wonder w
title: BEST GAME EVER!!!

After they gotten popular Mihoyo has stopped caring about their players and more about the money they‚Äôre making. title: Rewards

review: When I first started this game, it truly was the most fun I‚Äôd had in a long time. The devs truly seemed to love what they were doing, and they understood what their players meant to them. But now, sitting at this games one year anniversary, I and so many others feel incredibly hallow about this game. Mihoyo no longer has respect for the people who play this game and strictly prioritize financial gain. Even while spending so much on twitter hashtags, they couldn‚Äôt once think of saying they were thankful for where their players have gotten them. They ignored complaints they received from players about how they felt regarding the anniversary rewards, they continue to ignore bugs and fixing broken characters that desperately need fixed. They‚Äôve gone as far as to block anyone on certain websites that mention the anniversary rewards. Even typing this now I fear what could possibly happen to my Genshin account for saying the things I am. It‚Äôs become an even more toxic environment than it already was and I unfortunately don‚Äôt know where I stand with this game anymore. So please, don‚Äôt waste your time with a game that doesn‚Äôt care about you.
title: Just isn‚Äôt the same anymore‚Ä¶

review: Firstly I want to say i‚Äôve never been more addicted to a game before Genshin Impact. The game is absolutely breathtaking from graphics, to beautiful scenery, and how realistic the game actually is. I‚Äôve played genshin for over a little 2 months now and I‚Äôve loved every second of it. Just recently my account got randomly deleted. The game just logged me out one day and when i tried to log back in I was not able to retrieve my old account. It simply just started me all over from the beginning where the siblings are fighting the ‚Äúunknown god‚Äù I‚Äôm really sad about this because i was so determined to finish the game no matter what. If mihoyo cant retrieve my old account, I think i‚Äôm going to be done with genshin, just because it‚Äôs such a long story/process that i don‚Äôt want to do all over again. Other than randomly deleting my account this game is on another level and I recommend it to anyone!!
title: Absolutely Amazing and Disappointed

review:
I‚Äôm usually not even into anime-style games, but you guys have really done a fantastic job here. I have yet to find another mobile game with so much content, such amazing graphics, and the playability that this game has. Just one of these factors is hard to find in most games, but you have successfully incorporated all three (and then some). It‚Äôs really quite impressive. 

You can tell there was a lot of thought put into it‚Äîright down to the line of glitter that leads you to your destination while you‚Äôre inside the city of Monsdat (I would be lost without it!). The way it curves over the landscape is awesome. I don‚Äôt know much about graphic design, but I can imagine that it took much longer than we would expect to incorporate into the game.

You would think that a game like this would have bugs, or would be funny due to the fact that it is run on a mobile phone, but it runs so smoothly and I haven‚Äôt run into a single hiccup (other than sometimes the squirrels don‚Äôt move when you approach them, so killing them for meat is easier. Not complaining there lol). 

I have been playing for several months and have not gotten bored or run out of quests to complete. Like I said, I have yet to find another game that even compares in terms of quality‚Äîand trust me, I‚Äôve looked! Thank you to the developers üëèüèª you guys have created an amazing thing here.
title: Amazing‚Äîthank you developers!!

review:
Right now when I start the game on my powerful iPad Pro all I get is a blank white screen for about 10 minutes, then music starts and I‚Äôm able to ‚Äúplay‚Äù. Upon initiating my game, the intro cutscene was 98% frozen and only offered about 3 seconds of actual footage until I got disconnected somehow from Ethernet (likely server side issues). 
	After about 6 forced restarts of a broken laggy cinematic that I cannot skip, I managed to reach a very smooth part where I could pick and name my character. After that it was a couple more seconds of broken cinematic which I somehow managed to get through on the first attempt. Then the real horror began... 
	My first open world experience was that of a 5 inch view distance and then black nothingness. All enemies were giant blobs of white light, and only some of the grounds textures would actually load in. The only part of the game that actually works smoothly and completely is the User Interface Game Menu such as talents etc etc.
	Character animation is very well done, but with all these other issues mounted up I‚Äôm gonna have to call this a game flop for IPad Pro users.  üëé I do not recommend this game for anyone using a Mobile Device.
title: Would like to love this game.

review: Overall, I am absolutely blown away with this game. As someone who has been around since Honkai‚Äôs earliest days, I knew I could expect great things from Mihoyo, but I didn‚Äôt think I could be more excited than I already was the day of the release. I remember being there for the countdown before everyone started screaming that the game was finally out! The mechanics, visuals, gameplay, movement-everything just feels absolutely amazing! There‚Äôs just one small problem I have. Occasionally, my game ends up crashing. I do play over my iPhone 8 and it tends to have a heating problem, so I‚Äôve balanced this out with lower graphics, but the game crashes frequently and I‚Äôm unable to prevent it anymore than I already have. I‚Äôve taken precautions to reduce battery usage and prevent over heating, but it will still occasionally crash! I‚Äôm in awe for this game, but I‚Äôd love for this problem to be looked at if possible for some of us who wish to play undisturbed.
title: Great game! Lots of crashes.

review:
This game is incredible! There are a lot of causal games and money-grabbing games out there, this is not one of those. This is a quality console-style game in your pocket. Best of all it‚Äôs free!

The visuals are stunning, the music is incredible, and the voiceover recording adds a nice touch. Everything about this game is a work of art.

I do have one large complaint: the game is lacking diversity. Despite having a diverse world based on various real-world countries, the character diversity is slim. It‚Äôs there, but limited and subtle. I would love to see a more inclusive character roster.

Id take away a star for that, but the reviews are already skewed thanks to people complaining about the size. A quality game like this is going to take up space. It‚Äôs normal to have to download additional content and resources once a game is installed, especially big ones like Genshin. There are also people complaining about price. This baffles me, the game is free. I‚Äôve been playing for years and only spent money when I‚Äôve felt like it to support the development of the game. But, I‚Äôve never felt compelled to.

Overall this is a beautiful and immersive game. The style is a mix between anime and Breath of the Wild. The developers are Zelda fans, so expect som similarities, but the game itself is very different, especially the gameplay mechanics. So if you‚Äôre looking for a Zelda clone, this isn‚Äôt it.
title: iPhone Gaming Done Right

review: The artists for both the visual and auditory aspects of the game have done splendid work on both the characters and the open world, as well as the music for this game. The story does have depth to it if you are willing to read lots of text, but can become quite burdensome if you do not want to play for the story. The game is great, but due to the company‚Äôs actions regarding player criticism and community feedback in regards to quality of life changes and overall stinginess with rewards, I cannot recommend anyone to play this game if you have any form of self-respect. If you want to experience being ignored and generally disregarded as a human being and want to be treated as a walking wallet, then by all means go ahead and download. If you truly want to play, DO NOT SPEND MONEY FOR ANY REASON WHATSOEVER and enjoy the game for what it has to offer without premium content. 10/10 for everything else, 0/10 for the utter lack of communication and reciprocation from the company that owns this game. Would generally not recommend playing this game to anyone, especially those who become addicted easily because of the gambling aspects of the game as well.
title: Good game, bad company

review: I‚Äôve been playing this game for 2 yrs and a few months. It‚Äôs always given me so much nostalgia with the music and he characters. Takes me back to me 2 years ago‚Ä¶and just makes me feel so sad and happy! However, I used to play the game everyday. Then my friends all quit, so I was left with really no one. So I stopped for a little too, not super long. But when i got back, there was so much content stacked‚Ä¶.couldnt clear it all, then felt sad and bad that i had even quit that I just went into an even deeper slump. title: Amazing, Nostalgic. But,

review:
Genshin is one of my favorite games ever. I started playing 14 months ago, and am adventure rank 57. I love the game so much. The characters are so cute and fun to cosplay or use, I love the open world and playing with friends. There‚Äôs tons of amazing lore. title: One of the Best Games Ever (in my opinion)

title: It‚Äôs BEAUTIFUL, FUN AND EVERYTHING!

review:
The graphics for this game are stunning, and I love that there is a storyline besides just mindless grinding. I also like that the gacha system seems fairly balanced, where it‚Äôs not to a point of being a p2w game. However, I feel as though gameplay can become slow at times, especially when you finish the main storyline quests. For example, after finishing the original stormterror quest (the one in the very beginning of the game), you need to reach adventure rank 18 or so. That‚Äôs fine and all, except there isn‚Äôt much to keep you occupied during this time period of ‚Äúin-between‚Äù (ranks lower than 18 but higher than 10) except for daily commissions and some side quests. Unless you want to do what I mentioned before (mindless grinding), there isn‚Äôt much story to keep you going. The commissions become repetitive and there isn‚Äôt much story behind the other side quests.

Still a fair 4/5 though. If you read through my entire ramble, thank you.

title: So theres this tiny problem heh‚Ä¶.

review: Claiming that the fictional regions in these games are portrayal of actual countries, yet not properly depict them is not only concerning but ignorant. Yae Miko, as a shrine maiden, should have proper shrine clothing, Nilou and Dori are not a belly dancers and therefore do not need to show that in their models, and lastly being scared to add darker skin-tone/variety to the character models. Sumeru is based off of the SWANA regions and Natlan is based off Indigenous North America, yet you make the models shades lighter than Mondstadt‚Äôs NPC and characters, a German-portrayal region, and Sumeru‚Äôs archon #FFFFFF. You even make the enemies be shades darker than the playable characters, which makes me and many others believe that you view anyone with a darker tone (not the tan you slapped on Dehya, Cyno, and Candace/ Kandake) as antagonistic (ie Xinyan‚Äôs storyline and scenes from the GAA). It‚Äôs showing that you could not care for proper representation, design wise and even the pronunciation of some characters‚Äô cultural names, and care for some loose change. You were supposed to shine this region but now you are making us waiting for the umpteenth redemption for Natlan, which majority of your players have little to no expectations for already.
title: Lack of Proper Representation

review: Game play is good, amazing graphics, i like that its a collectable type game and that its open world. However, there is a few bugs needed to be fixed, improvements, and disclaimers that should be made. This game requires a lot of storage! It does not only take up 4GB of storage, as you progress it takes up wayyyyy more than the app store tells you, i am up to 15GB. Secondly, everything takes forever to load and should be made easier to log into your account and quicker download times. And another easy fix is make it easier to get primogems if your going to make it hard to pull characters that you actually want. Getting enough primogems for a 10x pull can take hours if you dont have any quests to do! Also adding a skip button for dialogue might make the game easier to speed run so that might be why they dont add it, but it would be helpful sometimes for useless dialogue and scenes players do not want to listen/ watch through.

title: It‚Äôs good but a little tiring

review: I started playing this because my ex partner did. Whenever I‚Äôm not playin Fate/GO I love to play this! The character designs are gorgeous and it‚Äôs a well thought out game. The only thing is that it takes up a lot of space. Ok so update- I wanna say the game is really well designed and creative HOWEVER I really hate that with all the updates this app takes up 18GB of data on my phone.. the updates also take a really long time, but I don‚Äôt know if that‚Äôs because of my low storage because of the app. I continue to play since I have Mona,venti,Diluc ,Jean,xiao,Hu Tao, and Childe but it‚Äôs very unmotivating to have to wait 5 hours for an update to not even work because you don‚Äôt have enough storage. title: Love it

review: This is literally the best game ever made. It has a interesting storyline, and enough fighting that it‚Äôs not boring and not too hard either. I also really love the graphics and the music, it really is very calming. I also like how it is very user-friendly, for example there are tutorials and systems that allow you to get free characters so that you have protection. Plus, the characters have a lot of backstories, too, each with their own unique personality and amazing features. One of the things I like the most is that it‚Äôs free. I know a lot people like to spend a heap of money on games, thinking that it would help them, but seriously, this game is just as interesting and fair without money. The only thing that is kinda‚Ä¶ not good about this game is that it takes up A TON of storage. But of course, that‚Äôs fully expected with such spectacular gameplay, graphics, and storylines!
title: This is the single best game in the world. Period.

review:
Firstly, I genuinely do recommend this game. The beginning of the game is so much fun and there‚Äôs a bunch of content and stuff to do! You get a lot of  in game currency and you‚Äôre able to get a bunch of different characters for free! The graphics are stunning, it‚Äôs satisfying when you level up your characters, theres a bunch of different activities, and lots of events. However, the reason why I didn‚Äôt rate it five stars is because of the endgame. After playing for a while you exhaust the content and it gets really grindy and theres not much to do. Of course, there‚Äôs events and all that kind of stuff, however besides that there‚Äôs really only the spiral abyss.
My recommendation is to take the game slow, enjoy it in the beginning! If you don‚Äôt like the endless grind at the end you can always just come back to it later when there‚Äôs more content. So while I do recommend the game, just be aware there‚Äôs not much to do in the endgame. :)
title: Amazing beginning, but drops off

title: Amazing!

review: I starting playing Genshin Impact back in March 2021; I downloaded it in a mediocre hotel room over crappy wifi after having seen the millionth ad for it. I have not been disappointed. Although, some of the ads are quite questionable in nature and don't represent the game well enough, I assure that it's a great game. It's a very wide-open map with plenty of things to do and explore; (I've even tried to get my partner to download it so we could go on Genshin dates just because it's such a expansive world map.) The problem that comes with large maps and plentiful content though is the amount of storage it takes, but it hasn't been a major problem for me.... yet. I'm also grateful for the many platforms that can be used to play GI; I play on mobile, but I'd like to play on PC as soon as I can. There's so many options and opportunities in Genshin. I highly recommend downloading it!!! üò©üëç‚ù§Ô∏è - Owl
title: Thrilling adventure!

review: It's have to be the best game I have ever played in my life! I got addicted to it so fast! I haven't found a glitch in the game yet and I've been playing for a very long while. I'd like if the banners stayed up a little longer for farming purposes. The game is very large but I know it can't be helped. The quality of the game and the graphics are amazing I have no complaints at all! The one problem is that effects me the most is that you can't climb on a wall that is faces more towards the ground, but that isn't a very large problem which proves my point that this is an amazing game! I will say that some people may find this game boring and not intense enough, but from a personal perspective I found many games boring and needing to be more action packed. When I found this games I knew I could take my time because theres nothing that makes you rush besides the banners. Once again, great and outstanding game Mihoyo!
title: Amazing Game! <3

review: The game itself is absolutely fantastic. The characters, the storyline, the graphics, it‚Äôs all great. The main reason why I can‚Äôt give it a full five stars is both because of the community and miHoYo. All of the drama surrounding the first anniversary is being handled terribly on both sides. I can understand why people are upset, the first anniversary was a highly anticipated event and it fell short. The rewards were mediocre at best, and the web event only benefited a very small number of people. MiHoYo has also been censoring people by removing the signature feature in-game, and by removing posts and banning people in Discord and on HoYoLAB. I don‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs right at all, but I also believe that the ridiculous backlash from the community was completely unwarranted. Particularly when it comes to the negative reviews that are being spammed both on Genshin, as well as on Honkai. Overall, it‚Äôs a mess of a situation but if you‚Äôre a new player who wants to get into the game then do it. I would highly recommend it, just avoid the community at the moment.
title: Honestly

review:
The game‚Äôs graphics and music are beautiful and the world is fun to explore, but once you‚Äôre done exploring and doing the quests there isn‚Äôt much to do. Most end game content uses resin and you use a day‚Äôs worth of resin in like 15 minutes. 

The rewards the game gives you are negligible and embarrassing when compared to other gacha games. AR rewards are nothing considering how long it takes to get AR levels after 50. Getting primogems is difficult and is required to get characters in the game. The likelihood of getting characters is very low and the pitty system doesn‚Äôt even guarantee you the character/weapon you want. And there are no deals or bundles in the shop that help you get characters. This is very disappointing as players have the potential to enjoy the game so much more if their favorite characters were more accessible. 

The game is enjoyable and has potential to be far better. It is worth trying, but at the moment I would suggest new players not to buy anything in game as everything is overpriced and simple not worth what you pay for.
title: Lack of content + poor rewards

review: I love genshin so much. The people, everything! Especially the gacha. I just need to say something, why is there only one blasian character? Xinyan isint even included in the story. If somebody makes a genshin charcter blasian to people say you‚Äôre ‚Äòblackwashing‚Äô. They just heard the word white-washing and made up ‚Äòblackwashing‚Äô. Besides that, the anniversary rewards. I feel like mihoyo is a greedy company and don‚Äôt care about the people who play it. First of- the anniversary rewards. What is going on‚Ä¶ 1 intertwine fate and 300 mora. 100 primo gems just to a few people out of millions. This is not fair. It‚Äôs not even a single one pull. Other gacha games have done way better. Like 10 pulls every day for the week, a 5* of their choice, 70 wishes, 100 wishes, etc. Mihoyo is one of the biggest gacha games with free play and RPG. Even the maintenance rewards are better. title: Amazing, but-

review: Genshin impact is a great game! The main story is very interesting, and the details and work that was put into the game is amazing. The acting is perfect, and the art and animation is breathtaking. The character designs and personality, not to mention the backstory given to each character is so cool. If there was a sixth star, I‚Äôd give it 6 stars, but there is only one problem. Maybe it‚Äôs just my fault for playing on a tablet with only 32GB, but it takes up half of my storage space, and it‚Äôs always a hassle whenever there is an update (Not to mention the frequent game crashing). To sum it up, I think this game is amazing, definitely my favorite game I‚Äôve ever played. The only thing that is wrong is that it takes up a lot of space for someone with an 32GB device, so if you have lots of storage on the device you‚Äôre playing on then you will enjoy every second of the gameplay.
title: Amazing! But there is one thing that bothers me.

title: Best game ever.

title: Best Gacha Game I‚Äôve Ever Played

title: Amazing game but I have this one problem..

review:
Writing a review just to counter the 1 star comments I‚Äôve read so far. Yeah, storage can be a problem if you don‚Äôt have a device which can handle a big game like Genshin. Considering the game graphics and quality, a high storage is expected and is definitely not grounds to rate it a 1 star (you can‚Äôt both have the cake and eat it). I can assure you from experience, having the right device and a decent wifi can give a wonderful gaming experience. For those complaining about spending too much, it‚Äôs a gacha game and akin to gambling. Critique your spending habits, not the game. For tired parents deleting it for the sake of your kids, I guess your frustration is valid. I do agree Zelda and Genshin have some things in common, but personally I haven‚Äôt played Zelda so I can‚Äôt comment on that. 

Having said this, it‚Äôs a great game! Love the lore, attention to detail and almost all features are ftpüòÅ

title: Best game EVER!!!!

review: Fun game, i can honestly say i dropped more hours in it than i expected. Very dynamic play style and the first mobile mmo to feel like an actual mmo. A lot to do and a fantastic story. Now why my review is 2 stars. Reward scaling is ridiculous. You have a game mechanic called your adventure rank which governs in game difficulty and level caps. Every time you gain a rank you get a reward to help with the new difficulty. Except, the rewards are useless by the time you reach that adventure rank. They would have been useful maybe 20 ranks ago. You can only get meta characters and weapons through very low chance summons. With maybe 2-3 banners up for 6 weeks. It takes at least 50 summons for a guaranteed 5 star. Summon mats are not easy to get so youre grinding for a month just to get maybe 20 summons. Improvements‚Ä¶allow players to grind for characters and character constellation materials. More banners! Larger shop for in game currency and purchasable currency. Better weapon acquisition system for 5 stars. Logical reward scaling for AR40+ ‚Ä¶System to grind for cosmetics
title: Fun but overall is lacking in crucial areas

review: I‚Äôve been playing since release and sure the game has come a long way from then compared to now and I thought they would eventually increase rewards and gifts esp for f2p players but seeing the anniversary rewards is just‚Ä¶ really? A lot of us spent money in release because we wanted to see how far the game could go and how great it would become and fell in love with the game and the only thing you can give us, the people that gave you the money, is 10 wishes? Seriously? A whole ten wishes for your first anniversary. That‚Äôs trash. Even the CN players are frustrated and the company won‚Äôt listen. I spend a fair amount of money every month on this game and even though I don‚Äôt mind the rewards because I‚Äôm p2p, I‚Äôm genuinely frustrated for those who don‚Äôt have the money to spend. Give back to the people that got you this far. I really hope that mihoyo ups the rewards and does something for the community cause eventually people will leave the game to seek out another that gives to the players (ex. Cookie run where they give a ten pull and over just for update compensation or minor errors that are fixed, do better mihoyo).
title: It was great at first

review:
I‚Äôll admit ‚Äî I‚Äôve never been interested in the mmorpg-style of online games, and I had no problems initially disregarding Genshin Impact because of its mainstream hype during the year. But to my surprise (and slight chagrin), the game turned out to be incredibly engaging! I‚Äôve never been so invested within an open-world setting before and the fact that certain adventures and events are ‚Äúunlocked‚Äù throughout the months allow the environment to not feel stale or boring like most other rpg games. 

Honestly, I haven‚Äôt stopped playing it daily after downloading it only a few days ago, and after thoroughly enjoying it for a while, I couldn‚Äôt believe that a game with this much world building, fantastic art, game mechanics and story was listed as a free app! I could go on and on with how much I love this game, but just know that you will not be disappointed when exploring the world of Genshin Impact!
title: Extremely addictive and breathtaking!!

review: This app is a great app. The visuals are amazing and the story is the best. Three characters have very cool designs and you get a lot of freedom. There‚Äôs also lots of things to do so you don‚Äôt get bored! Such as hangout events, wishing, daily commissions, world quests, story quests, archon quests, and much more. This is a great game and I‚Äôve spent quite some time on it. Its truly addicting. But, there are two main problems that I‚Äôve had so far. First, let‚Äôs say I‚Äôm running toward a mountain or a hill. When I get closer while I‚Äôm running, it takes a while to load. Basically, its just a solid color and takes a while for it to get its actual texture. That is really annoying because as I said, the visuals are amazing and I would love to see them. Second is crashing. I crash so much and I gotta say it really gets on my nerves. Thats really all I can say, thanks for this great game and I also recommend getting Genshin Impact.
title: Its fine but...

review:

The feelings and memories you can receive from Genshin Impact are remarkable. Exploring and battling with friends, choosing a companion to use for your entire journey‚Äî it‚Äôs the best thing someone could ever experience. Thank you, Mihoyo! title: IMPORTANT!! READ!

review:
I love this game but I had to take a star off for everything that is bothersome in this game. 
1st is paimon. There needs to be an option to completely replace or mute paimon without muting the other characters. Paimon is not a guid nor is she a good companion. The way she is used to further the plot is annoying at best. If the traveler has a voice, then WHY do we need this flying piglet to speak for us? This is not how you do the ‚Äúsilent but deadly‚Äù troupe. There‚Äôs a long list of issues I have with paimon but I will leave it here.
2nd: the lore. This game loves to shove lore down your throat at every given turn. Lore being in some story quests are fine but I play the events to get primogems, not find out about razor‚Äôs parents. This could‚Äôve been explored in his story/hangout quest. Why they felt the need to add it just as a new map launched is beyond my understanding. There‚Äôs just way too much lore and too much forcing a connection with npcs. I don‚Äôt care about them, I want to find my sibling.

Oh and the drop rates for gacha are despicable.

review:
The fact that people are giving this game one star because of the skin colors of characters in game is frankly ridiculous. It seems snowflakes are getting offended on behalf of the Middle Eastern community, many of whom have expressed time and time again that they love how their culture has been shown and that they appreciate the new Sumeru region. 

This game is honestly beautiful and a joy to play. The graphics, music, and gameplay are all on a totally different level than most mobile games. I‚Äôve been playing since launch and just played through some of the Sumeru update with it‚Äôs whole new map and new story quests, and I am in total awe. I didn‚Äôt think the exploration could get any better but it did. The story quests have also improved in writing and I was on the edge of my seat the entire time. Exploring the world in this game is truly a magical experience.
title: A truly beautiful game, Sumeru is amazing!

review:
I have been playing since beta. I like to put time into a game before I write a review. I can honestly say I have fun with this game. I have played on all available platforms (PS4/PS5, PC, iPad, Mobile). This game is perfect when traveling or visiting family or friends out of town as you can take it with you wherever you go! The gameplay is great, You can always hop on and off as you please. I would say if you enjoy anime aesthetics and gameplay that resembles something like Zelda BOTW and the like then this game is worth your time. It is a FREE to play game so if you are on the fence, download it, try it. Literally nothing to loose, and you may gain a game you enjoy playing. If you ever feel like spending money on it you get characters/ weapons for doing so. If not you can still earn them by playing the game. Not sure what else to say. Go try it for yourself!

Thank you for your time.
title: One of the best games on the market

review:
I don‚Äôt really understand why this game is getting so much insensible hate. it has beautiful graphics and a very interesting storyline, beautiful character designs, etc. I can see that much time and effort was put into this game. And thank you for that mihoyo. I love all the games mihoyo created, honkai impact, tears of Themis, etc. 

  I love the aspect of farming very hard to get a five star character and feel very proud of myself when I get them, I know that you either also have the 50/50 or don‚Äôt get that five star character but that just presses you on to grind harder and it‚Äôs not like that character disappears forever after that banner, they get reruns so you can just easily farm and save more for them. 

  All the characters have a lot of effort put into their design, personality, and their weapons, my favorite characters overall are kazuha, Kokomi, Ei, yoimiya, shenhe, keqing, and a few more. I don‚Äôt see why people hate character and go as far as writing hateful comments about those characters or to the people who actually like those characters, I may dislike sucrose for her over shyness but I don‚Äôt go as far as writing or giving hate to people who like her. 

I‚Äôm very excited for the up coming updates to see what mihoyo ha sin store for the game, I‚Äôm very very excited for Fontaine with Lynette and lyney. 

Thank you so much for creating this game!

review:
I‚Äôm not the type who usually enjoys MMORPG‚Äôs, they‚Äôre incredibly grindy and boring for me. However, Genshin Impact is one of the games that has changed my view on MMO‚Äôs. Not only are the graphics and characters great, but the story keeps your interest. I can‚Äôt wait to see how far this game will come along!!

Couple suggestions though!!

Is it possible to have friends on other servers? I wasn‚Äôt able to locate one of them because he was in Europe, and I was in the American server. If not, definitely should be a thing! :)

Another thing that would be really neat is romancing characters in game! Going on dates and gifting them things.

Some other suggestions would be to make talking to friends more accessible, even if we‚Äôre not in co-op, it would be nice to talk to the ones online. 

I think the co-op mode definitely needs some tweaks, but it‚Äôs getting there. It‚Äôs not the greatest game for co-op, because there‚Äôs a lack of things your friends can do with you. We should be able to do more quests with them. It would also be nice to be able to have avatar emotes in game. 

Another thing I think could need updating, is the camera option. There‚Äôs a lack of poses and features for it, as a creative person, it would be nice to be able to take more photos of my game and with my friends! 

But all in all, you guys did a really good job with this game, though there‚Äôs still a few things that need to be tweaked.

title: Really great outstanding game but

review:
First off, I love this game and I feel it is an incredible feat with a lot of fun aspects to it. However, after playing for 3 years, there has been a pattern of the developers ignoring their game‚Äôs community input. This isn‚Äôt meant to be entitled, but it‚Äôs frustrating that after three years, we are only starting to get quality of life improvements that people have been asking for for years. Their sister game, Honkai Star Rail, that is made by the same company, but has a different development team shows a lot more interest and love towards their gamers with rewards and actually listening to input from the community for what they want to improve the game. 

I love Genshin‚Äôs gameplay and story more than HSR, but their head developers really need to heed their audience more. HSR‚Äôs developers are listening and they have implemented all of what Genshin‚Äôs community has been asking for for years, but GI‚Äôs developers can‚Äôt even be bothered? Again I love this game and I have nothing but love for the creative team, but the heads in charge need to start paying attention before they end up losing their audience.
title: Disappointing communication from Devs

review:
When I first checked out this game in the App Store I thought it would be another one of those poorly made mobile games with the same concept as always. Genshin Impact does not fail to change that. Graphics/Gameplay wise don‚Äôt feel bad at all. The game can get immersive and keep you busy if you‚Äôre into rpg games. The character design as well as the environmental design is eye catching as well giving a ‚Äúlifting-mood‚Äù to me. 

The dialogue isn‚Äôt that interesting but the voice actors sure do make it like it doesn't matter what they say. They did a good job trying to pick voice actors for the characters.

In conclusion I definitely do recommend everyone to check out this game if they‚Äôre bored or tired of the same old poor designed mobile games. Genshin Impact so far has definitely changed my perspective of mobile gaming but there‚Äôs always some downside of it. Let that reassure you that it shouldn‚Äôt stop you from enjoying it. 4/5 (no ducks in the game)

review: This game is beautiful and I appreciate the amount of talent and creativity invested in it; its graphics, story line, character development, opportunity for growth, and events are well executed. I honestly cannot fathom how people can expect a game of this caliber to be 100% free. I happily spend 5$ monthly for the Blessing of the Welkin Moon and it has made obtaining primogems easier. I feel like the price is more than reasonable as I easily buy games that cost $60/80 (+for collector editions), as well as their subsequent $20+ add ons. With Genshin, the difference is that it‚Äôs constantly evolving. I don‚Äôt just finish the game and move on to the next one, maybe pulling it out in the future to replay. With that said, I‚Äôm also not collector player and I‚Äôm playing it to enjoy it. So, while I do want some of the banner characters and I save my gems accordingly, I appreciate my odds and I‚Äôm not overly invested in obtaining every character.

title: Twin problems

review:
One of the few games I feel is truly free to play. Every character feels likeable and everyone is certainly playable. There are no real powercreep and no punishing leaderboards, but there is something for the min maxxers out there.

The world is massive, the quests are what I can only call addicting. At least most are, I would say if you don‚Äôt like a lot of dialogue uh, me too, there‚Äôs a huge world with nobody speaking that you can escape into so that‚Äôs nice. 

Gameplay loop is repetitive but probably one of my favorites of mobile games. There is grind but honestly? I‚Äôve played worse grindy games that didn‚Äôt give nearly enough payoff. Probably the grind only seems bad because most of the game really isn‚Äôt. 

It‚Äôs also beginner-friendly. I‚Äôve been playing since launch but my friend got in 3.2 and he‚Äôs now near 100% the entire map. There‚Äôs a lot of quests and things to do so it can get really overwhelming but really this is just an open world game that comes out in installments. Pick a direction and go. 

Nothing lives up to hype unless it‚Äôs a game that really really meshes with you, but I would argue Genshin comes very close to being one of the best games. 

But most importantly you can FISH yeah that‚Äôs right baby gotta reel em in fish want me women hate me I‚Äôm far behind in debt due to all my MASSIVE FISHING RODS gotta fish baby fish to live live to fish-
title: The Best Mobile Game

review: We supported this game for three years and we get slapped in the face with absolutely no rewards. News flash 3 pulls is the equivalent to getting absolutely nothing. You can not tell me this fine when star rail (another game by the same company) gets a amazing 5 star character for FREE. In this game we get absolutely nothing. No actual good event, no endgame (the spiral abyss does not count when we are at a high enough level to beat it in an hour for each update which again is more than 12 days), No permanent modes. We literally have to pay for content or spend months to get it. What‚Äôs so funny is that the content is a character and a weapon, like seriously!!!! We have a multi billion dollar company and that‚Äôs all we get!!! When are we gonna wake up from this fever dream that we got from COVID and realize that this game has gotten worse. For this new to this game I‚Äôm sorry you‚Äôre hearing this complaint but just leave the game because after you get caught up there is nothing to do but wait a year for the story to actually progress. Have as much fun as you can guys because we will soon wake up to reality.
title: 3years3pulls

review:
I would like to say THIS GAME IS AMAZING!
The story line is interesting and mind blowing, the characters have amazing backgrounds and designs, the combat in the game is addicting. I‚Äôve been playing this game for well over two years and there are some things that really bother from the moment I‚Äôve started playing. First my main struggle is the storage. The amount needed is insane, I understand this game is very detailed well made but if hoyo could somehow do something to make this game not take all my storage that would be amazing. I know you can get this game on other devices but I don‚Äôt currently don‚Äôt have any other devices able to have this game besides my phone and I‚Äôm pretty sure other people deal with this problem too. 
Second the resin, resin is the main source to claim rewards and items to play the game and I think 160 is not enough and I believe it takes 20 hours for it to all replenish. 

Those are really the problems that bug me but other then that this game is so worth it and very cool!
title: My review

review: So this game is actually AMAZING. You can explore and adventure throughout the entire game. There are just absolutely beautiful graphics and characters to discover. This game is basically perfect!‚Ä¶ except for the storage and updates. If you have an older device you might find that this game is capable of taking up half of your storage alone. But it you‚Äôve got plenty of room on your mobile device, you won‚Äôt have any trouble with this game. Now for the updates, I love them! The only problem is that every time genshin updates I have to wait for my phone to update the app ( with it open and on ) for up to an hour! I really love genshin impact i just wish it would be a little less of a hassle to play. But keeping in mind that it has such amazing gameplay it is understandable why it needs so much storage, especially since it‚Äôs mobile accessible.
title: Storage and updates

review: Genshin. I first started playing couple months ago and at first it was really good. The graphics is amazing, voice acting is top tier, and the story line is great. The problem starts when you advance and become and decent player. It takes a long time to complete challenges and upgrading your character becomes really Grindy and boring. The wish system is bad in my opinion. It takes way to much primogems to get a five star character. The only reason I would grind was to get primogems but no matter how many countless hours of grinding and over thousands of primogems I haven‚Äôt gotten one five star character. It‚Äôs so rigged and the chances are way to low. Back to quest, some is unnecessarily long with barely primogems rewarded, the texts get extremely long and boring. A lot of the time I wanna punch Paimon because she‚Äôs the most annoying thing in the game. My advance to improve the game, add a lot more creatures and animals because it doesn‚Äôt feels Livy, make the grind and rewards much better, MAKE WUSHES COST LESS.
title: To much grinding

review: This game blatantly lacks representation and is a horrible example for creative characters. the world building is great sure, but having the character be based off of REAL LIFE places such as Europe, china, japan, the middle east and so forth you'd expect some sort of rep, correct? there are a total of 4 dark skinned characters in this game who are all the same exact shade. Not to mention the lack of body types and physical attributes, you can‚Äôt argue that this is a ‚Äúanime game‚Äù because so many animes have brought forth creative designs and interesting concepts. Artist all over the place who make Ocs and redesigns do a better job than the actual staff who design and write the characters in this game. The characters designers must be very delusional to think nobody notices this or cares, they support horrible voice actors as well who have done racist and concerning things. Overall i wouldnt recommend this game as someone who is AR 56 and has been playing for YEARS i do not recommend this game unless you want to loose money, be associated with a pack of losers, and then be extremely bored when you finish all the in game content. Thats all <3
title: Racist game

review: Let‚Äôs all agree that Genshin impact is a fun. Yet. Pretty fantastic game that can be played on ps4, ps5, mobile, and pc‚Ä¶ BUT‚Ä¶ There is one problem with the pity system in the game (read to understand) you simply have to wish (pull/spend some game currency for a character) about 75-80 times to hit soft/hard pity. Just to get a 5 start character/ weapon. Now‚Ä¶ I just wanna say that it‚Äôs not fair to the F2P players. (Free to play mean no money spenders on the game) that they have to work SO hard to get the character that they want. It literally take months for a F2P player to get 10 pulls on the banner. And once they have enough for a 5 star, they might lose the 50/50 which is annoying‚Ä¶ (losing the 50/50 means‚Ä¶ not getting a different 5 star character; a different one that‚Äôs not on the banner) Genshin impact is basically easy for the people that pay REAL MONEY. Don‚Äôt get me wrong. I love this game. But getting primogems (wish currency) is the HARDEST THING TO DO! üò≠
title: Player since day 1

review: I‚Äôm sorry did I do something to offend the developers? Because I swear I‚Äôm cursed with artifacts. I‚Äôve played this game since day one, I have poured blood, sweat, tears, and dollar bills and what I received in return is a big laugh to the face. I love this game I really do but I‚Äôm starting to feel the burn out. Artifact after artifact after artifact and any good ones I get turn to straight garbage, every single time. Time from time I‚Äôve given you guys the benefit of the doubt and I understand it‚Äôs all rng but at this one point there is a developer that has locked all crit rolls in my artifact because I no longer get them and this all stated to happened after the team switch. So tell me what have I done? How have I offended you? Do I not give you enough money to atleast get a really artifact once a millennia? Tell me oh developers what I‚Äôve done so I can correct the wrong I‚Äôve made. Or at least change the rng settings for artifact to be a little more kinder?
title: What did I do?

review: As i said loved it in the beginning. I‚Äôve been playing since launch of the game. AR 59 now. The game is beautiful when you start out and you have loads of content to play through. But once you reach AR 45 (ish) it becomes a repeat of dailies and waiting for next patch. The next patch is just a repeat of past events. One reason i still play this game still is because i have friends who can play this on other devices but even then it takes up so much space on their end. I wish the devs would make up their minds if they would want to keep this a mobile game bc the dont want to make end game content due to ‚Äúanxiety‚Äù yet they have these time limited events for weapons and v important lore. Like ‚Äúyeah you would‚Äôve known if you were playing in december ‚Äú üôÄ god forbid you take a month or so off the game. Now you don‚Äôt have enough to wish for the limited character and you missed the limited event. Don‚Äôt forget you didn‚Äôt get the event sword ‚úçüèª‚úçüèª‚úçüèª but adding end game content (other than dailies, using resin, or abyss) is anxiety inducing ok üëçüèº
title: Loved it but

review: before i say anything controversial, i‚Äôve been playing genshin impact for about two years now. this game is beautifully designed, and i couldn‚Äôt recommend it more. though, there are a few things that i want to talk about. as i‚Äôm sure you‚Äôve seen before, there is almost no content for endgame players. seriously. sure, it may take a while to get there, but for the people that have, it can be really dull. secondly, the wishing system. (this is how you get cool weapons and characters.) getting primogems as an endgame player is a pain. sure, you can go exploring but that only gets you about 1~5 gems every chest. the only way to get a ton is the spiral abyss, which has stupidly difficult mechanics. even if you somehow save a load of primogems, there is still a chance you may not get the characters you want. there are a ton of f2p players that are incredible at this game don‚Äôt get me wrong, but i honestly feel like the majority of players can agree that this is mainly a p2w (pay to win) game. i know that these developers need to get their money somehow, but baiting people into buying stuff is just wrong. there would be so many more genshin players if we were able to get characters easier. once again, don‚Äôt get me wrong, this is a fun game, but i regret spending money. enjoy new players (: ad astra abyssosqe!!
title: read this before you play (:

review: I want to start off by saying how amazing a game genshin is- and i 100% recommend people to play it‚Ä¶ if they can. When i first started playing it was only around 5gb which was a lot- but manageable. I currently have an old model of iPad with only 32gb of storage. Now with the app at a total of over 14 gb, it makes it almost impossible to download, and, if i want to play it, i have to delete almost everything else on my iPad. Now don't get me wrong- i LOVE the game- i just really wish that the developers could find a way to make it take up less storage- although i understand that with how detailed the game is, that making it online would make it even more laggy. I also think that the wishing system is a bit flawed considering my friend got 2 5* by ar 10, and i‚Äôm sitting here with a pity tartaglia at ar 50- buuut thats probably just my luck :,). Anyways, its a great game overall!!! Thank you for making this, we love it! <3
title: Great game but has some issues

review: 5*->4* because of the rates. Makes me want to stop playing tbh. This game has such miserable rates. Don‚Äôt even get your hopes up for a certain banner or you‚Äôll be crushed. Saved 60 summons for a certain banner.. nothing. The only way you‚Äôll get it is if you have 180 summons saved (which takes forever) to be able to hit both the normal pity and then the banner pity. Absolutely disgusting when you can‚Äôt even level the constellations of these characters until the next banner hits (if you have wishes saved and skip on any other cool summons...) Good thing the art in this game and the exploration help to make up for the trash rates, hence my rating. The grinding is a drag but luckily it ends when you hit cap level & get the needed artifacts. However, this game could be so much better if it weren‚Äôt so stingy on wishes and drop rates. They‚Äôre hard enough to obtain as it is‚Ä¶ I get wanting the game to last, but there are other ways to do this.
title: TRASH Rates. Awesome game

review: When I first got Genshin impact, I thought I wouldn‚Äôt really like it ( I‚Äôm not big on rpgs). But when I fought my first fight, I knew I would love it. There‚Äôs so much to explore and so many different ways to play the game, I‚Äôm never bored. A really good thing is that you don‚Äôt necessarily have to pay to be good at the game, you just need skills. And the game never pressures you, so you have all the time in the world to get better at whatever it is you need. One small complaint from me, though, when you‚Äôre in a cutscene and you leave the game, when you rejoin you have to watch the cutscene all over again. But overall, even though the game might seem challenging at first, it gets easier as you learn different things from the helpful npc‚Äôs. One big thing that you can notice is the graphics. They are amazing! Sometimes better than pc graphics. 10/10 Amazing game, great for all ages.
title: Amazing game

review: I know this is a very fun game because I always play it on my friends iPad. But when I finally got enough storage cleaned up (10gb) I downloaded it on my own iPad, nothing worked. The problem is that even though I had enough storage and everything, it said ‚Äúinsufficient storage space‚Äù. I gave up and tried to download it on my phone. No ‚Äúinsufficient storage space‚Äù error but right after I clicked on the gateway to play the actual game, it kicked me out. No error message or anything. Just after the ‚Äúheadphones improve game‚Äù message, the screen turns white and just simply kicks me out. I cleaned out more space than I needed, reloaded and re installed the app multiple times, as well as resetting both devices. I hope somebody can reach out to me as soon as possible because I am really hoping to get to enjoy this game.
title: Doesn‚Äôt Load and Always Crashes, Never Got a Chance to Play.

review:
Very appreciative of how I notice the clock counting down to maintenance. And then once it happened, I found some work to do and came back just moments ago to find what was an estimated 5 hour update with 90 gems per hour and still got more gems than the time was worth.

I like how feedback is actually taken in as it‚Äôs a huge part of what sets this apart from other games like it. Is it perfect, no, most things aren‚Äôt. You‚Äôll definitely want to invest in a controller for your phone if you‚Äôre like me, however, the cross platform accessibility is a huge plus. 

The game is charming in visuals and for a mobile user (once again üòÇ) it‚Äôs on the top of the ‚Äòputty games‚Äô.

As a lover of the old LoZ, FF, and the old platformers, it is its own game. Not to say it doesn‚Äôt borrow mechanics heavily, as literally MOST games do! but it also makes it its own before presenting it to you in an optional play for play or play and pay to play.

In that regard, I was never forced down an ad, a reminder that could spend money, or any real roadblock in the main game.

However, I‚Äôm told the curve flattens out once the story is done and you are faced with a slower progression. I‚Äôm fortunate to play games slow in progression but quick and numerous with farming anyways so it‚Äôs a treat.

Give it a try, and at the cost of a download, install, and 10gbs of space you‚Äôll find out if it‚Äôs a good fit for you.
title: I like where this train is headed.

review: I have been a long time player of genshin and probably will still play for awhile more. With this recent dehya banner and my summons on it I have come to realize how terrible it all is. Not only did they release dehya as one of the worst characters ever released the rates of getting the character/weapon are so terrible I can‚Äôt continue to condone and spend money on this game. For frame of reference I spent a minimum of 354 summons on her banner and her weapon banner (about 120 on weapon and 230 on her banner) which if you look at in the store is equal to $900 of summons. Yet with all that I only got her once and her weapon once. That is not okay. The summon rates are too atrocious for me to support anymore especially if they are going to release a character that me and many others have been looking forward to for a long time now in such a horrible condition. The game is a good game overall but the horrible summoning rates and price of summons just kills any interest in supporting this game monetarily anymore. You can play the game but I would suggest never spending money on this since it will all just go to waste.
title: Game scams you for all your money

review: I've been playing this game since April 2022 and I , am in love with all the characters and regions. Mondstadt is charming, Liyue is exciting, Inazuma is stunning, and Sumeru is so full of life that even Sumeru City is lined with plants and NPCs! This game has wonderful designs, great humor, exciting adventures, adorable creatures, intricate storytelling, etc. I highly recommend for everyone of all sorts for all sorts of reason. Min-maxers for the character builds and spiral abyss, shippers for the many exciting relationships between characters, artists for the beautiful landscapes and intricate character designs, very angry people for all the things to be mad at in this game (abyss mages, spiral abyss floor 12, fatui, the chasm archon quests, artifact rolls, banner rolls, etc.), and even people with good luck can benefit from their good luck because of how. many. things. in. this. game. rely. on. luck. (i.e. artifact sets, artifact substats, artifact stats, artifact substat upgrades, solvent rolls, banner rolls, 50/50s, crit%, talent books, mob drops, and MORE). Basically this game has it all and I love it so much.
title: Favorite game

review: Ok so to start this game is amazing, the graphics are really nice and gameplay and lore is creative and fun, the main problem that most players have is that the primogems and resin system is really bad. Once you get into higher adventure ranks it‚Äôll be even harder for people to get primogems for wishes which is really bad altogether for a gacha game and to top it off the resin system is also really bad when players want to buff up their characters. You get 1 resin every 8 minutes and it‚Äôs terrible for people who need anything from any kind of domain, please Mihoyo at least upgrade the primogems earnings and resin time. Free to play players won‚Äôt be able to enjoy this game without a difficulty spike and since they are free to play they won‚Äôt want to spend their time buffing up their characters, I beg of you Mihoyo please make this game gacha system easier, you will still get millions even if you add more ways to get primogems and resin.
title: I‚Äôm going to be really honest here..

review:
Hello genshin impact and the genshin fandom! I would really consider your help if your not busy currently. I apologise if im wasting your time, but i just wanted to say that i have been experiencing some issues which is my own fault due to my internet. But it has caused me a really big issue in here! But on other notes. I really love your game! And it deserves all love and recognition. I cant wait for some new updates on this!!
title: issues

review: I‚Äôve played this game for the past year, albeit I took a couple months break. Everything about this game is amazing. From the lore and storyline to the voice acting, combat, and open world - it‚Äôs seemingly a AAA Action RPG title, that‚Äôs free to play. The only gripes I have is the lack of content in some patches, which some call them ‚Äúfiller‚Äù patches and how hard it is to get Primogems (premium currency in-game) as a free-to-play player. This is coming from someone who has a ‚Äúpay-to-play‚Äù account AND a free-to-play account. Aside from that, I‚Äôm grateful for a game that keeps me excited to play everyday and new content from patches to come. Genshin Impact is the only game I‚Äôve consistently played for the past year. Every other game I‚Äôve played, even if I logged hundreds of hours into it, gets stale. However, Genshin Impact doesn‚Äôt. Thank you Mihoyo and the Genshin Impact development team. I can‚Äôt wait to try Honkai Star Rail.
title: Best Mobile Game

review: This has become my favorite game. I am disabled and it helps me pass the time I‚Äôm confined to my bed. I love finding treasure and oculus as well as solving puzzles. The combat isn‚Äôt my favorite part but it‚Äôs fun. It‚Äôs a pretty well thought out system so that for people like me who aren‚Äôt crazy about grinding for artifacts or can‚Äôt afford the best weapons or units or constellations can still play all of the content and do reasonably well. Nothing in particular feels insurmountable even with basic units. I love that they added finding chests and oculus into the anniversary rewards though as a budget player I wish they had given out a free 5 star for the anniversary or done double artifact drops or given out 100 wishes like other gatcha games. I will continue telling others about the game and recommending it to my friends and family members but I will let them know the issues as well as the perks.
title: I love this game

review:
I really, really love this game. It has kept me company during quarantine and (I play on my phone) has let me explore something absolutely stunning without the need to buy a console. The soundtrack is perfect and I find myself listening to the songs just to relax or to relive the moments of the story, a story which is actually pretty well written for a gacha game. I spent quite a bit on this gem of a game and I do not regret it. But gosh, what are the rewards for the anniversary? I wasn‚Äôt expecting a lot but this has just made me feel awful, it‚Äôs plainly underwhelming. I don‚Äôt understand why, what‚Äôs the need to reward your players with what‚Äôs very close to nothing? The rewards‚Äô page in game doesn‚Äôt even say that it‚Äôs the actual anniversary. It doesn‚Äôt feel like it is, in fact, since the game is pretty much empty as of now. I can‚Äôt wrap my head around it, everyone is disappointed or outraged and I‚Äôm just incredibly sad. 
I don‚Äôt want 100 wishes or a 5 star selector, I just want to feel like I‚Äôm actually celebrating. Like a year actually went by and we reached this milestone together. I love this game but all of this is awful.
title: The anniversary.

review: The game when I first had download it it was working pretty well nothing was wrong everything was running and going smoothly and I have been playing for a while so when they said that we had to update it again I did and it wasn‚Äôt working so I tried to delete the game and reinstall it when it was done reinstalling I had opened up the game end it was working for a little bit then a few seconds later it started glitching like my screen was frozen and somethings will take forever to open up at first I didn‚Äôt think it was a big thing because it would only happen like a little but then I was playing and end it got me out of the game I didn‚Äôt know what had happened so I thought it was me and I accidentally get out the game but it wasn‚Äôt purposely got me out I come back in the game and it‚Äôs glitching more I could hear the attack sounds when I wasn‚Äôt making an attack end it was so lag this all happened today.
title: Started out good and then when I updated it it started glitching

review: I like genshin impact it‚Äôs my second oldest game played the thing is even after all these years I don‚Äôt find it amazing mostly because a lot of stuff is hard to get like the wish‚Äôs and characters and they don‚Äôt really give you the opportunity to earn it like how you just finished a quest and all of a sudden you need like 20 more levels to go to the next one and the chests just give you artifacts so you can barley get any wish‚Äôs ,also you would need to spend a lot of money like for different character outfits and you could use money to buy wishes so it‚Äôs not amazing but it‚Äôs not horrible bc at the end of the day you still could find loopholes and you still can get lots of characters depending on your luck ig and it still gives top notch graphics and I love the characters so yea it‚Äôs not ‚ÄúTHE BEST GAME EVER‚Äù and it‚Äôs not ‚ÄúNO ONE CAN TOP THIS‚Äù but it‚Äôs not ‚ÄúWORST GAME EVER‚Äù or ‚ÄúRIPOFF‚Äù it‚Äôs more like ‚Äúyea I would totally play this‚Äù
title: It‚Äôs not AMAZING but it‚Äôs not HORRIBLE

review:
Update: Controller support has been added with update 1.3: I originally gave the game 3 stars, but have increased to 5. Thank you developers for listening! This is definitely my favorite game in recent years. 

I‚Äôve been playing this game since it came out and it‚Äôs been one of the best I have played in a long time. It‚Äôs just getting started and there‚Äôs already so much awesome content. However, I‚Äôm giving the game 3 stars because of no cross save with consoles and no controller support on mobile. If I would‚Äôve know cross save and mobile controller support would have been an issue, I would have started the game on my PS4 instead of my iPhone. I usually play about 3 hours a day, but I would play a lot longer if I could use a controller with my phone. Even better, allow cross save so I could continue on my console. Now that I have a PS5, I feel like I‚Äôm missing out on playing on a big screen.
title: Finally got controller support!

review:
I haven‚Äôt played this game up to Fontaine as I accidentally deleted my account üòå (I should make a new one-)

But it‚Äôs such a whimsical experience when you first start playing, the graphics are more then outstanding! And the storyline is just the same! But as you continue going through, it‚Äôs just not the same.. Maybe it‚Äôs because at the start you were playing just for fun! And to unwind with the amazing soundtrack but after a while it becomes a grind. Which I‚Äôm all for! But I got burnout very quickly well playing this game. Once I got to the nation sumeru, the nation of wisdom. I just couldn‚Äôt play the game anymore so I took a break, then came back played the longest archon quest of my life! Then took another break.. For a VERY long time and when I tried to get back in multiple times but my account was just gone I logged out not deleted my account but I guess I must of just deleted it? 

That marked the end of my Genshin Impact journey.
Mondstadt: 7.5/10
Liyue: 9:10
Inazuma:10/10
Sumeru: 3/10 (btw I‚Äôm probably bias because of the fact I quit in Sumeru it is such a beautiful nation)
Fontaine:??/10
Chasm quests (NOT WORLD QUESTS): 10/10
World quests:1/10
Gacha: 10/10 very interesting..
Fighting:10/10
Artifact farming:9.5/10 Ik that‚Äôs odd

Even though this game does have its gripes it is still such a great game! I would say a solid 4-stars! So close to five though if it weren‚Äôt for the burnout.
title: A Breath taking game but..

review:
This is definitely the best game on the App Store, but honestly that‚Äôs a low bar to clear. Genshin impact is easily on my top 10 favorite games of all time! Genshin impact has a massive world brimming with life, characters that have depth and feel real, deep yet simple combat and story that had my jaw on the floor. Genshin impact is known for its gacha and for good reason, because it‚Äôs gacha is one the worst I have ever had the displeasure of witnessing, it‚Äôs less about getting lucky as it is getting 80 pulls and having a 50% chance to even get the character. For scale I‚Äôll give you the numbers, one pull is 160 primos, each day you have daily commissions that give 60 primos and events will typically give 50 primos per day. So each day you get 110 primos and each pull is 160 primos so you will spend well over a month gathering primos trying to get the character. Absolutely horrible.

If you have not downloaded this game then you are missing out.
title: Super awesome! But it is a gacha

review: I love Genshin I think it‚Äôs a fun game, but the wishing is frustrating. I get it‚Äôs a gacha system where you don‚Äôt get what you want most of the time, but the fact that for me at least since I‚Äôm f2p it‚Äôs frustrating getting primo gems and to make it worse I‚Äôm a lazy player. For wising on a limited character event banner it was where after your first 10 or 20 pulls you would get a five star, but know it takes a lot more wishes and the chance of not getting the event five star character is high so there‚Äôs a chance that your hard work into getting the wishes is for nothing. I really want Alhaitham but it‚Äôs hard for me to get him since I don‚Äôt have the primos and I don‚Äôt know how to get more primo without buying more and my chances of getting him are low because it has it know where in 90 or more wishes you can get a five star, but most likely not the event five star. Also Hoyoverse seems to love Honkai more than Genshin know, so Ima just spend my time on Honkai instead of Genshin from know on.
title: What I don‚Äôt like

review: I was hesitant to try Genshin Impact at first, but within the first few minutes of playing I knew I was going to love it. The map and scenery is gorgeous, and I love to roam around and also admire the music soundtrack as well. Character designs will make you obsessed, they are absolute beautiful and every character has their own unique color scheme, and idles. Only few problems is at a low AR (Adventure rank), there is a lot of quests, but the closer to you get to a higher AR, the less there is to do. Over time, it‚Äôs harder to obtain primogems to spend on characters. There is only so much to do, and sometimes even when you finish spiral abyss, archon & world quests, it‚Äôs still extremely hard to earn primos and stay busy with the game, or get the characters you want. But, the game is very entertaining, and I definitely still recommend it even with these minor flaws.
title: One of the best gacha games!

review: Ever since I started this game I was just glued to it. I got qiqi, my first 5 star in just 20 pulls and I was happy! The archon quests were so fun and exciting, PLUS the world quests were all so creative! I got so many primos and free wishes, and I saved for zhongli and got him, guaranteed. Overall, I was happy. My limited 5 stars collection was growing and I finally made it to the end of the current archon quests available! Then, everything went downhill. I had finished most of the world quests and archon quests and I was getting kind of bored, cause I had nothing to do now for primos and entertainment (besides my dailies, which only gives me 60 primos a day and spiral abyss which only happens every month) It was also hard to save for characters now because I‚Äôve basically explored everything and already claimed the primos. Now all i could do was 1. Do my dailies 2. Spend my resin and that was about it. I also went from getting 8k+ primos a month to 2.2k primos. Mihoyo please show some love to your endgame players :(
title: It was fun

review: ok i adore this game and play it often, but can we please talk abt how stingy they are with the primo gems among other things? take honkai star rail as an example. its another game of the same type produced by the same company. they recently got a free 5 star character for winning some award. all we get when genshin wins an award is 400 primos max (a little over 2 pulls). like im sorry, WHAT? and also, for the anniversary (most recent was 3 years) we got a total of 20 pulls. in hsr for their upcoming anniversary (1 year) they're getting a 5 star selector??? mind you these 2 games are extremely similar. especially in terms of wishing. the pity system is the same in both games so it's not like 5 stars are just not as hard to get therefore making them cheaper to give out for FREE. no. they rarely give anything for free and when they do it's the bare minimum. they rlly r just money hungry and obviously don't care enough about their players as they should.
title: too stingy

review:
1) Loyal Genshin players have been asking for months for Genshin to increase resin count/lower resin time to make up for the increased amount of domains to farm. They have not listened or made adjustments.
2) Design team puts in research and effort in making characters properly represented by the cultures they are inspired from (Liyue = China, Inazuma = Japan) but does not give the Middle East, North Africa, and South Asia the same treatment. Whereas other regions are representative of specific countries, the region of Sumeru is an orientalist mess, taking from various different cultures in countries that are separate from one another.
3) Design team is allergic to creating characters with melanin. Other games such as BOTW, Dislyte, etc. are able to create culturally researched characters with varied skin tones. 2 out of the 48 playable characters in Genshin, including the ones from Sumeru (a region with NPCS and enemy bandits with darker skin tones) have skin tones darker than a paper bag. 

As the game developers continue to show blatant disrespect to feedback from their fanbase, I am no longer supporting Hoyoverse as a whole including their future games.
title: Lazy design team with little to no regard to player feedback.

review: i will preface this with i love the gameplay. i play every day, am currently ar 54, and love exploring! BUT. there are some HUGE issues that are entirely unacceptable. despite being a mobile game maker, mihoyo makes this game impossible for mobile players. my game will crash ~every 15 mins or if i teleport more than like 5 times. this makes it difficult to do co op with others, because i will just freeze up and i either have to be kicked so they have a full team or they wait a few mins for my game to start back up (neither solution is that good). the updates also take up an outrageous amount of storage, and to update i have to delete pictures and apps to be able to play (i cant even imagine how it will be with all 7 nations). these issues have to be fixed because at some point these issues might grow so huge i have to stop playing (i know mihoyo doesn‚Äôt care, but if you are considering downloading this on a phone, please make sure you have tons of storage or can transfer to a computer if needed).
title: amazing gameplay, but giant issues

review: I give this game a 5 star because this game makes me feel so much better and it‚Äôs so much fun whenever I‚Äôm bored or lonely and I have nothing better to do, my mom will always tell me to get off my phone Bc I play it way to often and I need to take a break, but y‚Äôknow what? I play all day under my blanket and don‚Äôt gone out unless bathroom, eat, or water. It is my favorite game in the universe. My favorite character in Hu Tao, sadly‚Ä¶ I didn‚Äôt get her.. and I started to cry after she left but I still have another chance in the future, but still, SAD. Anyway I hope to play this game forward on in life because I put a lot of Effort and work in this game. 2020 was the first year I started, and I only had 3 characters, traveler, And the 2 starter pack people. Anyway I just really love This game but the only thing I need is extra time to get the character on the banner.. anyway that‚Äôs all! (2021 dec 14) ;)

To start off this review please know that this is a gacha game. The content isn‚Äôt necessarily pay to win but it will definitely make it easier. Being a F2P player will definitely ask for a lot of grinding. With it being a free game the gameplay is more than enough. On the same level as mmorpg‚Äôs you would buy. The reason for my rating is the lack of end game content. Millions of players have been constantly playing since the release who are now in the end game. We are getting bored. It‚Äôs becoming a chore to play the game at this point. The lack of any decent anniversary rewards doesn‚Äôt make it better either. Expect nothing but stingy-ness from the company. They only want your money and don‚Äôt care what their consumers think. They also show favoritism to their Chinese consumers. Also currently now putting out censorship on all their forums resorting to any negativity towards the anniversary rewards. Mihoyo is a joke. I would still definitely recommend this game if you‚Äôre looking for a game to explore a new world and NEVER spend your money.
title: It‚Äôs an above average game

review: I‚Äôve been playing this game for a long time, and I‚Äôve also contributed to the amount of income the game has received. Not only me, but others too, have given their love and devotion to the game. So you can imagine how we felt, when we were given rewards that weren‚Äôt up to par with our expectations. The rewards do not thank us for the dedication and love we‚Äôve shown so far. It almost feels like mihoyo does not care about the players they bring in, and the ones who are still here. Not only have we been disappointed yet again by the greed of this company, but we have also been given characters with terrible kits recently. These characters, the company still chooses to not fix. So far any attempts to give them constructive criticism have been in vain, because they have all been ignored. We want to be able to stick with this game, but it‚Äôs been getting a bit hard to stay. Especially when you have the company completely ignoring our concerns and inputs. Im not telling new people that they should play this game, but I‚Äôm saying that they should be prepared, because it might get worse from here.
title: Really mihoyo?

Also, the lyre from the Windblume Festival is really nice to play. I‚Äôm able to play my friends songs and whatnot. I can‚Äôt forget the voice actors/actresses‚Äô outstanding jobs! They‚Äôre so on point with the voice lines and dialogue, and it probably took a long time to make it so neat as it is now. Keep it up! Love the game üòÑüòÑüòÑ
