review: This game is honestly one of the best games on mobile, I‚Äôm not surprised it came from the creators of Honkai Impact. I don‚Äôt see it as a Breath of the Wild clone, it has its own uniqueness and even with similar functions when controlling the character I barely even think about the similarities. My only gripes with the game are the lag in certain places, especially when fighting against lots of monsters. The lag mostly happens whenever I use Klee. The voices and dialogue are great as well, but there are some places where the dialogue box either doesn‚Äôt match up with what the voice line of the character is saying or it‚Äôs incorrectly saying something. (For example, I am using the male character for the game, but Paimon refers to me as a ‚Äòshe‚Äô when talking about going into Stormterror‚Äôs Lair.) Overall not too bad of an issue, since this doesn‚Äôt happen all the time, but it would be wonderful if you guys could fix some of these bugs. Thanks!
title: Great Game

review:
AR 40 here
No matter if you are a hardcore player or a casual you will eventually hit AR 30 and you will start to run out of meaningful things to do in Monstadt and Liyue then you‚Äôre left with a few options, scavenge the world hope there‚Äôs a respawned chest or one you‚Äôve missed, wait for daily commission and resin, or pay the absurd price for resin that also increases in price. Don‚Äôt forget about co-op, with only 180 resin a day you can do 9 domains with your friends! Even if it took 10 mins to do one domain thats 90 mins of gameplay that you would have to wait 2hrs and 40 mins to even do one domain. You can play the game casually but if you don‚Äôt hit AR 40 your world bosses won‚Äôt drop parts that are randomized that gate your characters talents. We ask for more food(resin) they give us a bigger bowl what a joke! They are trying to address everything else but avoid resin and won‚Äôt tell us why or when. Even if you love this game can you justify 0.6 rates? Don‚Äôt get haggled with their little changes and their so called ‚Äúevents‚Äù that barely give anything... They will empty your wallet anyway so why can‚Äôt we ask for more? Oh right we ran out of money need whale friends to help!

review: as much as I love Genshin impact and I‚Äôve been playing since it released I‚Äôm pretty sympathetic towards the developers, I know that Genshin is adding more and more and some stories are lacking or getting repetitive. I don‚Äôt really expect much considering the graphics are pretty good, but small details can be pretty noticeable such as ultimate animations looking the same or main story quests having the same repetitive lines, also it‚Äôs getting pretty hard to play without some sort of help (probably me or it‚Äôs the long dialogue) a lot of Genshin is just long long hour long dialogue and although some of it is interesting a lot is filler or useless. Another thing is that I get genshin is they keep piling up, every time I open genshin it‚Äôs another long event I have to get through or story quests for a couple 20 primogems (in game currency) and I know the company is working on another games but for such a long project like genshin piling up fillers or useless stuff isn‚Äôt very fun
title: love the game but it‚Äôs getting repetitive

review:
genshin has brought me a lot of comfort since i started playing back in february, and being able to wander around a different world than my own has brought me a lot of happiness. though i can understand why people have their gripes about certain things, and i do too, for me personally the good far outweighs the bad.

i adore the characters and story, you can clearly see a lot of thought and care put into each design, not just in the characters but in the environment as well. and the story itself just feels so big and grandiose to me, since we've barely scratched the surface of the tale being told. i'm very much looking forward to seeing how the plot plays out!

though, this game is not without issue. once you get pretty late in the game there's not a whole lot to do, you can wander around but past ~AR45 there's a good chance you've explored most of the area already. there are constant events which is great, but they're never permanent and there's only so much substance they provide. 

all in all, genshin impact is a great game, though it takes up a lot of space i'd say it's well worth it if you enjoy open world exploration and intricate storylines, and if you're willing to wait for new content to be added once you reach the end of the currently available archon quests.

and to mihoyo, keep up the great work!
title: man i love this game

review: I absolutely love this game but the only thing I don‚Äôt like is the 50/50 system I find it pretty unfair for the people like me who have bad luck and end up always losing their 50/50 Im currently on a 50/50 and I really want hu Tao (who is a upcoming character really awesome dps) but I‚Äôm on a 50/50 because I accidentally got another character called xiao or maybe I wish there would be a re funding system where if you got a character by accident you can return them and have guaranteed again of course you can‚Äôt re fund them all the time just 30 days after you got them or like 20 days it would be a lot more helpful hopefully in the future they can do something to fix this issue it‚Äôs really upsetting to get a character you do not want I love xiao but I love Hu Tao way more and it upsets me that I might not get her in this year of 2023 since she barely comes back to the game
title: SO COOL

review: If it was just for the story, I‚Äôd rate this game 5 stars. That being said, I‚Äôm giving it a 1 star rating, now why‚Äôs that? For those who aren‚Äôt familiar with this game, the devs of this specific game give horrible rewards, despite the fact that other games this company make give great rewards. I don‚Äôt know why they hate the fans of this game so much. If you‚Äôre okay with getting meh rewards and you just want to play for the story‚Äî then go ahead and play this game. However, if you‚Äôre expecting a ton of rewards, let‚Äôs be honest guys just play Honkai impact or Honkai star rail. This game had the potential to be AMAZING. But they NEVER in the over 3 years this game has been out, going on 4, ever listened to their fans feedbacks. We all deserve WAY better. There is still barely any end game content to do once you finish the story, and they don‚Äôt even give a fair amount of rewards compared to the other games this company makes. It‚Äôs truly such an utter shame they disrespect the people who once loved and supported this game more than anything else.
title: I USED to love this game at the beginning, but it fell off very hard

review: I love Genshin so much, and spend so much time and effort into it. The graphics are amazing, and I‚Äôve bonded over this game with friends a lot. The only thing I feel like you need to go more in depth in is the storyline. It starts off amazing, but then near the start/end of the inazuma quests, it feels like just stuffed together to be able to create newer, hotter characters. And don‚Äôt get me started on how much storage it takes up..yikes. Less things to do as a higher AR player, and even though i am very exited with the new 3.0 update, the characters are disappointing. With barely any colored characters, it‚Äôs hard to to really be SO happy with the game. Not to mention the primogems system. With spending 100$, you can‚Äôt even get to hard pity. The community is also pretty bad, but I don‚Äôt feel like I should blame it on HOYOVERSE. But again, maybe I should. In anyway, HOYOVERSE is a very money hungry system. Don‚Äôt spend money on it, and enjoy the game.

title: good!

review: This game is a great open world RPG and I personally very much enjoy it. There is so much content for hours and hours but that also means it is a time consuming game. This also means taking a lot of storage so every time it updates it usually takes up more storage each time. This game is also free which is great! There are in game purchases that are able to be bought which is nice because nothing is locked or restricted behind purchasing those items. There is a point where after you clear most of the content, you must rely on updates, events, exploration, and daily things such as Serena teapot and daily commissions. This may seem like a lot of options but, exploration takes so long and can burn you out easily. This game is most likely good for mature 6-8 year olds and most likely suitable for average 9+ year olds because there is no blood and minimum violence.
title: Read it all!! This is an honest detailed opinion

review: This game is open world yes, but they lack endgame extremely. If you‚Äôre looking for a game with good endgame then pass along as this game only offers 4 floors called the abyss. It is four floors and refreshes only once every two weeks. That it‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs the only endgame they have. Also, they don‚Äôt have guilds, pvp, or actually dungeons. Only these things called domains which take about 3 minutes each to play. Don‚Äôt waste your time on this game until they add the things listed above that they‚Äôre missing. If a game doesn‚Äôt have good endgame then it will die faster than the company thinks. Plus the community has been asking for these fixed including a fix to the resign system since day 1 and they haven‚Äôt addressed or properly fixed the issue everyone is having. There are multiple better games out there as this one is incomplete with the terrible lack of endgame content. Once you get there you will see that there is literally nothing left to do. Pass on this game and go find a game with good endgame content. You can thank me later.
title: Almost A Good Game

review: Genshin is honestly peerless in its category. Imaginative, massively broad in scope, graphically beautiful, satisfying to optimize and learn. The greatest challenge facing Mihoyo at this point is endgame content, which can feel somewhat limited and repetitive after several months of dedicated play. However, that is not nearly enough to condemn it, and Genshin has been a daily part of my life for over 400 days now. I even decided to run a second account from scratch to relive the story and see what luck it would have with the gacha system. The fan base can be uncomfortably fanatic sometimes, but you can probably avoid the odd ones and find a good niche. My largest caveat is about the gambling experience of gacha, which some may not struggle with at all. If you are like me, this game can become a major outlet for creativity and stress relief. Would download again if I went back in time.
title: A Titan for Good Reason

title: excellent open world game

review: I generally don‚Äôt write reviews, so I‚Äôll try to keep this short. Genshin Impact is definitely my favorite mobile game I‚Äôve ever played. I definitely would recommend it to just about everyone. The mechanics in the game are easy to use and leveling up actually makes sense. This game is basically a crossover of Nino Kuni, if you‚Äôve ever played it, and Skyrim. I absolutely love this game. So, now on to a few issues I‚Äôve found. This game takes up about 10 gigs of storage, making it impossible to make room for. I‚Äôve practically deleted my whole iPad for it. I‚Äôve also found that the game will randomly crash at points, making me have to open it up and wait for it to load each time it crashes, and it‚Äôs quite annoying. Besides those few things, which I hope they can patch, Genshin Impact is a fantastic game. Thank you so much for reading this, and please go download it and give it a try!
title: My Favorite Game, but a few Issues

review: I have givin this a five star because I love the game and everything in it, though I cannot play it on my phone because of storage problems. I've enjoyed it all overall. Though there is one issue. It's the re rolls that are a but of a problem for me. I've been trying to get Hu Tao for three whole re runs. My first one was terrible. My second, I was suppose to have her but then the gacha ripped off on my primos that I worked so hard to getting and at this point, I'm starting to give up. I don't know if the game hates me or anything. I've never waisted a dime on this game. And yet i still don't have Hu Tao. I'm really starting to lose hope. The next time yall give Hu Tao a rerun, at least give her a event or something. If y'all can do this then that would be very greatful and I'll forever love this game to its fullest extent. I'll keep playing it! And I'll never stop loving it!
title: MY THOUGHTS AND PROBLEMS

review:
First of all, I can't believe this game is free to play. It's expansive, includes TONS of characters, has interesting and interactive world building and the lore is is unique. Maintenance is always rewarded generously, and there are CONSTANT events going on. You seriously can't get bored of this game.
 
However, it's poorly optimized and doesn't run well on most devices, which is why I play mainly on my PC. I wish we were allowed to limit render distance so the game would run better. I also wish there were more options for customizing the settings, such as eliminating all the animated grass. I just don't enjoy how it looks personally. 

Otherwise, the gameplay is fun an innovative, they add new mechanics (such as my favorite new mechanic: fishing!) and the daily commissions are extra incentive to play daily. I always have quests to do and areas to explore. I look forward for the content to come! Thank you Mihoyo :)
title: A few issues, but overall a good game.

review: Its amazing to me games are allowed to collect and store troves of personal information. This app wants total access to everything on your phone. Why does a game need to access my contact info? Why does it need to have the ability to access, modify and even delete any photo on my device? Its insane that so many people don‚Äôt understand the consequences. Some random person in china can look and examine every single photo on your phone, copy and save said photo without notifying you. Snap a pic of your ID for employment or other reasons yep this company now has your ID. A sexy selfie for someone. Yep they have that as well. There is no restrictions because you have given permission under the false guise of ‚Äúerror reporting‚Äù or other problems. You think they can only access game related photos but no they get all your photos. Also they get access to your info like emails, phone numbers, age, device info like OS and OS version so they can exploit vulnerabilities. Even worse if you play on PC. Absolutely zero reason for a game to need this info outside of ID theft and stealing period.
title: Hoards troves of personal data

review: This game is extremely stingy for no reason. It is a great game which is why it got a 3/5 stars. It has three main problems. One is that it is a game that forced you to log into the game everyday with its resin system combined with a slim chance to get good gear it takes more than a month to fully complete your character. The second problem is that it is super stingy and greedy right now is the anniversary event for a game that has been out for two years you would expect the game to give us a good reward, but no it gives us a single ten pull     ( you need 90 pulls to get a guaranteed 5 star character) and a trash event that I would assume takes 2-3 hours of boring story that I don‚Äôt care about. I have seen games that make way less money than this game and is way more generous. It is greedy also in the sense of that you need to pull 90 times to get a guaranteed 5 star. The. Once you get a 5 star you only 50/50 chance for your desired 5 star which is a problem because it is extremely hard to get primogems in the late game. So overall this game is extremely mid and needs to be more generous.
title: Stingy game

review: At first I kept getting ads and assumed it was the same thing, you know the drill, get the ad, don‚Äôt try it because of assumptions, then play it and it‚Äôs great and you‚Äôre addicted! title: Wow!

review: There‚Äôs barely any diversity in the characters which makes it really boring. All the characters are incredibly pale and even in the leaks for Sumeru they are all pale. Really disappointing especially because I was looking forward to seeing diversity. With recent leaks I‚Äôve been even more upset. Sumeru is supposed to be based off African and South Asia and yet you wouldn‚Äôt be able to tell from looking at the incredibly pale characters. Another thing is there‚Äôs so much lore in limited events that if you don‚Äôt play for every event you‚Äôll miss out on so much. I took almost a year off of the game and as it turns out I missed some HUGE lore dumps like Scaramouche being introduced. It‚Äôs really disappointing to not be able to even play the quests you just miss out completely!! title: Amazing game

review: I completely love Genshin impact. I‚Äôve been playing it for almost a year, and first off, the characters are all very good and the GACHA system is pretty good . The characters are super detailed and all unique. The combat is smooth, and the storyline is engaging (yet it is unfinished) And the game is pretty F2P friendly, if your not trying to collect every character. title: My favorite game

I do love the free rewards when you first join :) I do have to say (so far) after about adventure rank 45-60 there‚Äôs not a lot of content left to play but there‚Äôs still a lot of stuff you can do even after there‚Äôs not a lot of content coming out and I do love welkin! I do wish there was more ways to obtain primogems as an F2P but overall the game really has no flaws to me! I do enjoy the new patches ever 40ish days! title: AMAZING!!

review: This may sound clich√© or dramatic, but two months ago I lost my grandmother to kidney failure. She was my best friend in the whole world and I went into a deep state of sadness. My friends texted me about Genshin Impact, so I tried it. I immediately fell in love with the character design and the The Outlander Who Caught the Wind story quest. I‚Äôm not saying that this video game fixed my sadness but it did make me feel more joyful. Although some may say Mihoyo is not genserous to their community, you may be saying something in the ballpark of the truth. Nevertheless Mihoyo has represented that they could build an uplifting community from scratch. Though there are a multitude of reasons I play Genshin Impact, I mostly play for the experience and for fun. Personally I have become very emotionally invested in this game and I have not been disappointed. Thank you to Mihoyo for brightening my world and other‚Äôs. You truly are great.

title: Game‚Äôs too big for its own good (Mobile player here)

review:
I have never reviewed a game before, but I had to for Genshin Impact. My phone is constantly full of games that I download, play for a week or two, and get bored of and delete. Genshin is definitely not going to be one of those. 

It‚Äôs an absolutely beautiful open world with great character designs, good plot, and lots of side quests to keep me interested. Even better: it plays like a solo player game and doesn‚Äôt constantly throw pay-only opportunities at you. I feel like I can play in peace without having to make a bunch of ‚Äúfriends‚Äù in a guild I don‚Äôt care about or never able to do anything really fun without shelling out real money to get to a certain VIP level. Really, the only downside is the fact that it eats my battery up and I have to plug in to keep going. But the fact that I want to keep playing even plugged up to my too short charger just shows how great the game is!

Highly recommend!

One, the game keeps crashing, now this problem I can understand because the game is new, there‚Äôll be some bugs. Not to mention the reason it keeps crashing could be my phone‚Äôs problem, not the games. However, the next problem I‚Äôm 99% sure is the games fault. I can‚Äôt login. I used to login using Game Center, but whenever I try to login it says ‚Äúthird-party not registered.‚Äù I don‚Äôt understand this because, first off, I‚Äôm using the same device so it‚Äôs not like I‚Äôm logging in from a completely new device. Secondly, Game Center has always worked, so why is it saying that now? I really want to login into my account because I‚Äôve made decent progress and don‚Äôt want to have to start over from the beginning. So please, if you know a way to fix this, please do share.
title: Can‚Äôt login

review:
As a new player who just reached Adventure Rank 23-24, the game is super nice so far. I like the graphics, mechanics, and mechanisms. Finding quests to complete is a blast and I would recommend this to 1 or 2 of my friends. 

However, I do not like the fact that the chances of getting a five star, let alone a new character, is super hard. I did receive Noelle from the beginner banner, but even after saving up to 30 Aquant (sorry idk how to spell it) stars/ gems, I have yet to get a single new character. Also another common issue is the storage mobile players such as myself will probably run into this issue at some point. I had to offload the app and sign in again with my old account just to continue playing. I was informed this game was available on the switch, but it wasn‚Äôt released at all. 

Overall: If you have a gaming console or computer please use it instead! If not, you can buy more storage or offload app to see if it helps!!
title: The game itself is not bad..but‚Ä¶

review:
So I have been playing Genshin since February, and it was like love at first sight. The graphics are incredible, especially for a free game. The character designs are beautiful. The open world factor of the game makes everything so interesting. Honestly I could write a ten page essay why this game is the best, but I also came to make a suggestion. My only issue/ complaint I have with the game is that you can't add friends from different servers or play co op with them. For me, this is really frustrating since I have a lot of online friends from Europe or just friends who like servers where they're from better. I feel like there might be a reason why you can't add friends from other servers (like difficulty connecting in co op, etc.) but if it's possible, I really think it would make the game more enjoyable. 

Happy traveling!
title: One of the Best Games I've Ever Played!

review: This game is so much fun! There are lots of characters and quests. There‚Äôs always something to do! It‚Äôs really fun! The only issues I‚Äôve experienced are that it takes 5 to 10 minutes to get into the game. This isn‚Äôt a horrible issue, and its worth the waiting. It just gets a little annoying some times. The other issue is that I can‚Äôt watch videos. In the being cutscene and all the other cutscenes it freezes and the voice gets staticky. This is super annoying! I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs like that for everybody or just me, but please look into it. Other than these things the game is amazing! I really recommend it to others! And it dose take lots of storage, but it‚Äôs totally worth it! If the developers just look into these couple issues, the game would be perfect! It‚Äôs the best game ever! Keep up the great work developers! <3 <3
title: Amazing! Only a few things wrong.

review: I see a lot of people complaining about the primo gems thing, but if you are grinding out the game and are willing to buy the welkins thing you can get almost a wish a day for a month (28 wishes) by also completing all the commissions. And if you need some primo gems just grind out dragon spine I got like 300 primo gems from the quests alone and probably another 300 from all the chests and then 100 for all the achievements and like 50 for all the waypoints so roughly 750 primo gems from dragon spine alone not counting the frost bearing tree rewards. If you are going to complain about lack of in-game currency on a game that offers it for free in practically everything you do then you need to get your priorities straight, however if you are going to complain about getting Qiqi and a skyward atlas instead of any good reasonable 5 star then I‚Äôm all ears.
title: Good game the in-game currency system rewards patience

review:
So.. usually when I see games like this I expect it to be a knock off version of something, or its just not a type of game where you say ‚ÄúHey, I love
this game so much I play it multiple hours a day!‚Äù Yeah no. But over the past few months or more, I have been getting dozens of ads for this game. Of course, I would always skip it. Assuming its not gonna be enjoyable. But just about 2-3 maybe 4 days ago, I finally gave in and downloaded it. Usually I guess how a games going to be based of the ad, and most of them basically lied so far. But, this one was actually pretty nice. There is so much to do, and its so fun to play. All the characters are super unique and cute and I think its just a really good game! One of my favorite parts about the game are the wing glider things. I just like walking off the edge of the cliff and flying off. Very fun, would recommend.
title: Better then expected!

review: I‚Äôve been supporting this game since it‚Äôs release and has not done a thing to get my account back due to losing it because of their bad security. It‚Äôs absolutely horrible. They clearly don‚Äôt care about their service because they are over here answering irrelevant questions (Aka obvious trolls) and won‚Äôt bat an eye to those who need actual help. There are multiple reports of people getting their account hacked because of their bad security and the furthest report said they got their account back after 5 months. Company says there‚Äôs different facilities for each problem, then why is it taking so long? Why am I constantly seeing reports of people saying they haven‚Äôt gotten their account back after 2+ months? It‚Äôs horrible and just straight up neglect, I paid money on this game so of course I would be uneasy, they need to take better care of their consumers if they actually want players and at least fix the security ONCE AGAIN. That 2FA is not enough to stop hackers from entering and from a big company full of talented coders, they should know that by now.
title: Bad customer service and horrible security

review: I made review but it was removed or didn‚Äôt go through. They is many people in the community also some artists who wish that Venti was female then male. PLEASE Just make Venti into a female character already. It's abundantly apparent; especially from how outsiders to Genshin lore treat the character, that Venti is 100% perceived as being female. We know that all archons are considered genderless beings, agender but we all wish to address are Goddess/Queen Venti as she/her and clam Venti as Waifu which the term means wife. Venti is everyone favorite Archon we all love and wish for a hangout quest for them. The "lore" would require minimal changes and not even new voice actors for Venti at all. The narrative, fan art, disposition of the character isn't particularly gender neutral and the fact that the "ELF spirit" has taken the form of a friend means a lot but who said Venti couldn‚Äôt just alter the gender to be female counterpart to they friend the nameless bard. The form doesn't even need to be changed to pass off as female. Venti has been embraced by fans and content creators who clearly do not know the lore, but refer to Venti as "she" in their content. Until it happens 1 star rating.
title: To: mihoyo

review:
I enjoy this game A LOT. I play it for HOURS!! I love the graphics and everything. This game is just immaculate lol. Anyways there is one thing that annoys me a whole lot and it has to do with quests. Basically I am tired of getting stuck on a hard quest and then my Co-Op goes away like why. I‚Äôm just strolling through the map then a quest pops up so I press navigate. Then I realize the quest is way to hard  and my characters aren‚Äôt strong enough to beat it. What bothers me is that I cannot cancel the quest. I have been stuck on this quest called Trials of Tranque or something like that, but it‚Äôs so hard and I can‚Äôt pass it. Now my Co-Op is gone (has been for like 2 WEEKS) and I can‚Äôt play with my friends until I beat this quest that is way to difficult. So I‚Äôm just asking to please add a feature that lets you cancel quests.

Thank you for reading :)
title: I love this game so much but there is one thing...

review: Even though I rate this at 5 stars, I don‚Äôt recommend playing it on the phone because it runs at far fewer frames than on PC or a console and the game chews through your phone‚Äôs battery. Go grab Genshin Impact on PC or on the consoles and you would enjoy the game much more. This game is very much like Breath of the Wild in terms of being a sight seeing simulator, which is a good thing if you love exploring and searching for secrets, puzzles or random battles. If you didn‚Äôt like Breath of the Wild, Genshin Impact might not be your cup of tea. The rates for 5 star characters is extremely low but you can probably beat the game with the free characters given to you. So far the game does not have a pity system for 5 star characters so beware of spending any amount of money on the game, you could spend hundreds or thousands and not get a 5 star character. Avoid spending a lot on the game and have fun with what you‚Äôre given.
title: Excellent game on PC or consoles

review: This game is stunning! Exploration is a pleasure because you never know what you‚Äôll find; the story is decent, and it‚Äôs really satisfying to pull off elemental reactions! I do have some gripes though. As a F2P player, getting new characters is hard. You can (mostly) only do so through wishing (gambling). It probably is possible to progress to end game without a super diverse roster, but I only have two archers and I can‚Äôt increase the level cap of one because I haven‚Äôt made it to a certain region. This brings me down to one useable archer. This could pose some problems with bosses, and this is where I have to wish. Trying to get new characters is hard for F2P players because you get little more than 60 primogems (currency to buy wishes) daily. To make 10 wishes, you need 1600 primogems. This is how the game entices you to spend money. If you are prone to a gambling addiction, do not download this game!
title: Great game, but be wary of the gacha system

review: Genshin impact is the best game I have ever played. First of, its art style is beautiful and personally, I think that someone‚Äôs first play-through is the most fun experience ever. I remember when I got the game a year ago, I was immediately amazed and hooked on the game from the very first cutscene, just due to how quickly they jump into the story. All the characters are amazingly thought out and detailed and different. If it weren‚Äôt for playing Genshin Impact, I would have never found out about my comfort character; Klee! There is honestly so much more I could rant about to tell you how great this game is, but I myself am not a fan of typing, so one last thing I would like to say is that it‚Äôs an incredible steal. The fact that you can get so much gameplay from a free game is amazing! If you aren‚Äôt usually into anime, I still highly recommend this game. :)
title: Simply amazing!!!

review:
So I had this game before but deleted, so I thought that I could just get it back and log in to my account. When I downloaded the game I opened it and logged into my account. Afterwards it kept saying, not enough space available. I deleted some apps that I wasn't using, mind you I have an iPhone 12 with 64GB. It kept on saying not enough storage so I deleted some old messages and photos, after went it through,  I was excited to play the game again then it told me that I had to download the full version then I said sure then it started downloading. Probably like 15 minutes later it said insufficient storage. I got mad because I was tired of it then went to my settings then checked my storage, just to see 61GB of my 64GB used. At this point I couldn't do anything because the 31GB worth of stuff on my phone was important so I just deleted the whole game. So basically I just deleted half my stuff for absolutely no reason. 

It really looks like the new version of this game is not meant for phones with 64GB.
title: Takes up all your space and ask for moreüò°

review: I got Genshin Impact one day when I was bored and got a few ads for it. To my surprise, the game is actually incredibly fun! I love playing with my friends and doing quests around the world. You can practically never get bored, because there‚Äôs always something to do. I have run into a few problems as a mobile user though. I am unaware wether it‚Äôs my account or the way I set it up, but I‚Äôve tried on multiple devices (iPhone, tablet, laptop) but it appears that something is blocking me from getting the daily check in reward. My friends have set up accounts in different ways and it works, but then they will be unable to make any purchases. There may be some small issues which may just be problems with the accounts and not the game, but otherwise, I would totally recommend it to almost anyone!
title: Great game, some small issues

review: From beginning to end, this game is so enticing! Beautiful artwork and design to entertain new players, with a great ‚Äútutorial‚Äù phase the is seamless. As progress goes along, the game continues to bring entertaining plot, enemies, and extra gameplay. Whether you want to casually walk around talking to characters and go fishing, or spend more time diving into the detailed work of designing your own world and playing the in-game card game based off of beautifully designed characters, or if you like to grind your way to strength and power and defeat the ever changing Abyss, there is always something to do! I have been playing for over 2 years and the only thing that ever keeps me off the game is huge life-events. Even then, there is almost always enough for the daily check ins that build into great rewards over time.
title: There‚Äôs nothing like it on the mobile market!

review: I love this game so much. All though every time I play it, eventually something happens and I have to start a new account. But that‚Äôs fine! I just think a few things could be added to the game. 1. This one is about the traveler. This game is very creative. But what would make it even more creative is if the traveler had different attack animations for each element. 2. We‚Äôve all seen the little Japanese cushion seats in the Komore Teahouse and Kamisato Estate. What if u made it so we could sit on them? And finally 3. We know there are beds in genshin. We‚Äôve all seen it. But what if we could SLEEP on those beds? I‚Äôm sure if the game were exactly like real life every character we have would be exhausted because they get no sleep. Pls Hoyoverse take these into consideration and pls if u can‚Äôt do all of them pls do at least one. These are minor things I really wanna see in the game!
title: Genshin

review:
First off let me say that I love this game. I have played gacha games for many years but have not found any as immersive as Genshin. The music, the scenery, story, gameplay and characters are amazing. I play just about every day. That being said, there are some things that could be added or improved.

1. Weekly boss battles don‚Äôt need to cost resin. They are only playable for rewards once a week and the resin they cost could be spent on other things such as artifact quests, wits, material and mora quests.

2. Resin either needs have a higher cap or a faster refill time. Both would be preferable as that would allow for more game time between updates.

3. I also think it would improve the game to have occasional quests that offer up free new four and five star characters/ unique weapons/ skins (like the quest for Barbara‚Äôs summer skin for example). Other games do this and still use the gacha system to release characters. This idea would help with the oft heard lament that game content gets finished too quickly. The interesting part of this idea is that it could be used to encourage exploration or could require players to visit multiple regions.

4. Certain characters in the game get a lot of negativity due to having not aged well as the game has progressed. These include Amber and Qiqi and would benefit from buffs to improve gameplay
title: Great game but I have some suggestions

review: I love the game it‚Äôs really fun and so addictive. I have been playing for a year now and I was supposed to write a review at the time but I was so busy playing the game. I have a few suggestions but there isn‚Äôt really much to change. I look forward to future updates and can‚Äôt wait to see how all the stories and the game develop. -I wrote this a while ago. Quite some time actually but I was just wondering when you were gonna make it available on MacBook or any Mac computer at all. I‚Äôve been playing mobile and it‚Äôs hard to download new versions and different stuff because of the storage. It‚Äôs quite annoying but it‚Äôs not your fault. I was just wondering if you were ever gonna make it available to any Mac computer because I‚Äôve been waiting. It would be greatly appreciated if it was available on those platforms too.
title: Game lover

review: (Before you read this text some parts can may be spoilers) This game is very good and awesome there may be a lot of graphics that makes you lag an all which of course takes a lot of storage but you can say that it‚Äôs worth it! I have been playing this a month after it was created and it started off not so good but it eventually fixed now I love it! This game is about adventure and you can also learn real stuff that is from other countries. I don‚Äôt really want to spoil it but of course there is characters according to the images, and you can trust me that you can either LOVE these characters or either adore them. And again, you can be in a adventure and learn things about different country and the things or stuff that you will see or you can learn, about partial things that you learn about this game, is true in real life.
title: Very good and awesome!

review: I‚Äôm sure many people have heard of Genshin Impact by now, and I have to say it‚Äôs for good reason. This game is genuinely so fun and immersive to play, plus the characters designs and backstories baffle me with all of their detail. Of course no amazing game like this doesn‚Äôt have problems, and I will say Genshin Impact has its fair share. If you‚Äôve played / are currently playing it you might relate to this, but I find that theres not a lot of content in the game at the moment. When you first start playing the developers introduce you to this fantastic world and story, but after you‚Äôve finished all the quests you‚Äôre left a little empty handed. Nonetheless, this game never fails to be amaze me and keep me entertained for a good while. Do keep in mind it takes quite a toll on your storage space, but if you have enough storage to download it then I highly recommend playing this game.
title: Amazing

review:
I don‚Äôt normally write reviews, I also don‚Äôt normally play games on my phone but honestly this game has been awesome! The lack of mandatory in-app purchases and ads alone, paired with really high quality graphics, music, voice acting, and story really make this feel like a console game....that I‚Äôm carrying in my pocket. I only stopped playing because I had to complete a *ton* of side quests to level up in order to move the main story along ‚Äî I don‚Äôt love the level requirements for certain things and wish at least the main storyline followed the characters‚Äô current level. (That‚Äôs the only reason it‚Äôs not 4 stars for me!)

Otherwise, if you‚Äôre looking for a game that is a similar format to Zelda: Breath of the Wild, this one is it! (Obviously, not actually breath of the wild just with the enemies, quest systems, and other overall systems are similar). I was seriously addicted to this game for a few weeks and absolutely cannot wait for its release on Switch.
title: Really refreshing!

review:
I started out a month after launch and everything was REALLY fun (exploring, meeting new characters, engaging with the community), but after a certain point it feels like Mihoyo just stopped caring about its playerbase and went completely silent. 

End-game players have been voicing their opinions about how they feel and what they should add since the earlier versions of the game and nothing has been done whatsoever, just some small updates that are so niche. It‚Äôs gotten to the point where I just log in and do commissions because there‚Äôs literally nothing to do after completing abyss, 100% exploring, and waiting for resin recharge. 

I can still voice my opinion without all the Genshin Knights saying to just quit the game. But after all the countless hours and money i‚Äôve put in to this game it‚Äôs only fair that I get to do so. In all honestly i‚Äôll stop supporting this game with my money and if a better game comes out, i‚Äôll drop this one. But for now i‚Äôll keep playing‚Ä¶
title: It WAS a really good game imo

review:
Okay im not one who‚Äôs like mean. well okay no i am pretty mean but its always unintentional or its towards someone im close with so they don't take it personally. But Mihoyo,, the anniversary rewards :(

I want to keep playing and i plan to play until the very end!(unless smth happens that makes me change my mind) Just, you can make up for the rewards,  i still have hope. Like maybe a special anniversary Wind Glider! Or maybe a special food recipe! Maybe even primos‚Äî Now dont get me wrong,  the new web event for the anniversary was super cute and i love it.

I love the game, the story line, the characters, the bosses, enemies , everything! i didn‚Äôt really have any friends but now im in a small social group of classmates because we bonded over genshin!

Hmm, players really like that lantern rite ‚Äúpick a 4* liyue character for free!‚Äù event. And honestly what about that again? Maybe we can pick a 4* character from all the regions? im not sure but these are just some ideas ive seen people online hype about.

Im excited for sumeru! Ive seen some people say that apparently its based off of the mountains in Java Indonesia! Ive had ideas(purely guessing) that Sumeru is like a dessert and its main city/inhabited place is like an Oasis! And that they have an underground water source, and thats since its the nation of dendro, its full of greenery.
title: love the game to death but..

review: I started playing this game nearly a week ago and I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE love it so much. The graphics, the story. It‚Äôs all so amazing. I‚Äôve never seen a better RPG combat game. It‚Äôs so amazing that when you put your mind to work or together you can create a game like this with so many wonderful qualities. I was never really in to combat games before but now I love them. I do have one little edie bitty problem. When I go into Mondstadt it will load every single place in it a bit slow and one time when I was experiencing that problem at the adventurers guild I got stuck into it because it wasn‚Äôt done loading yet. I know that was very dumb you could say but I‚Äôm still young. Overall this is one of the best combat games of 2021 and it came out LAST YEAR. That‚Äôs just my opinion. Anyway, miHOYO keep making these amazing games. I hope to see more from Genshin impact in the future.
title: O.....M......G

review:
Honestly, I had no idea what to expect going into this game, but I am very impressed with what you can do. It plays like Breath of the Wild, in terms of exploration and item creation, but it also throws in elemental effects and statuses. You acquire different characters through the story, each one with an assigned element and fighting style, and by switching your party members you can create various effects both in combat and on the environment. There‚Äôs a huge area to explore, even if you don‚Äôt work on story quests immediately. The only issue I‚Äôve encountered so far is that it does make my phone overheat if I play too long, and then the game crashes. But you can also play on other formats, so if your phone can‚Äôt hack it, switch to PC or console versions. 

All in all, I definitely recommend this game for anyone who like games with a focus on exploration and experimentation.
title: Best F2P experience I‚Äôve had on my phone.

review:
Okay so aside from this one critique (and it‚Äôs a big one) I love the game and it‚Äôs story... WITH THAT SAID; The adventure rank system and story progression system is WAY TOO NERFED. Instead of having a natural story progression block like just your characters levels and them being too weak, they have an outside Adventure rank level that you have to level up to progress the story... THIS IS HARDER THAN THE STORY. And for why? It literally takes you out of the experience and makes you feel like you‚Äôre doing grueling tasks. Why does it take a full week to unlock a mere 4
20 minutes of gameplay. It forces you to explore the world, which... understandable I guess but what‚Äôs going to be the fun in exploring the world if you‚Äôre forced to just so you can... play the game? 

But... other than that, the story, from what I‚Äôve been able to play, is super immersive. The character design is very well executed, and aside from the one huge overarching punishment for actually doing the story, it feels like the game rewards you in other ways :)
title: GREAT GAME... but...

review: Probably after a few days of writing this Genshin impact will no longer be on my phone. Why? Not because I dislike it but it‚Äôs because of the space. This is one of the best games out there and for free! But the amount of storage this takes is just too much. To anyone reading this the only way you can enjoy playing this game is with a device  of 100gb or more or using a PC. To us fellow 64GB users it‚Äôs over there‚Äôs nothing we can do. I‚Äôve only had happy moments playing Genshin. I love drawing the charcter I‚Äôve bought welkin twice and even won it in the raffle they did for their anniversary. Oh and happy anniversary Genshin impact since as of writing this it‚Äôs your anniversary. Maybe in the near future I‚Äôll play again but for us poor people only time will tell. Goodbye Genshin hope to see you soon.!
title: Goodbye Genshin and the great memories we had

review:
Don‚Äôt play or support Genshin. Play and support Honkai Star Rail instead.

Hoyoverse (Genshin developer) prioritizes attracting new players, rather than catering to its‚Äô existing and dedicated fan base. Any time a new patch comes, we are greeted with boring and mindless events, and lackluster rewards. Every anniversary we are given pathetic excuses for ‚Äúgifts‚Äù. Recently they gifted players 3 wishes for 3 years of Genshin. Which is actually insulting. Not to mention we hardly get ANY Q.O.L changes that players have been asking for for years. Compare Genshin to Honkai Star Rail and the differences are astronomical. All the Q.O.L changes that Genshin needs, were present in Star Rail on DAY 1. And Star Rail continues to add these changes every patch. In fact we get changes that we didn‚Äôt even know we need. Not to mention Star Rail rewards are incredible in comparison. In fact, Star rail has gifted more wishes in a single normal update than Genshin has for an anniversary. Recently Star Rail gifted a FREE limited 5 Star character with 20 free pulls in the next update. Genshin is just pathetic at this point. 

Don‚Äôt play or support Genshin.
title: Decent game with potential. Horrible developer.

review: This game is extremely fun when you play with friends because you can help each other in co-op and just run around doing some exploring. I never used to have a lot of time for genshin, maybe once a week I would play which was usually on the weekends because all the domains would be open. So sad to say but I only had like 4 characters decently built, meaning their talents were sitting at 8-7-5, 5-7-4, 8-9-9, 4-4-4 and that took me 6 months of actually farming. Before I would just pull for a character in the current banner and use them. Now I have 7 characters built with really good damage and did my first triple crown within September! My point is if you don‚Äôt have a lot of time this game isn‚Äôt for you lol. After a while you get burnt out because you‚Äôre running around doing the same thing with each login.
title: Good but watch out for burn out

review: This game is a great game at the start, there are many challenges and lots you can do. But from playing Genshin impact  around 1 1/2 years I‚Äôve never gotten a 4 piece set! And it makes my characters very weak. Which does not gives me the best feeling while playing in the game. It‚Äôs also very annoying to get artifacts. I have been trying to get a 4 piece set for so long. Ever since my characters could fight over a 90 leveled monsters Ive tried so hard to get the right artifacts. And when I got the right artifacts, it always gives me defense or health. It‚Äôs just like you‚Äôve been doing something that u really wanted to complete for a long time but failed at the very end. I‚Äôve tried many times but always ended up like this. If u are a f2p player it would be very hard for u. It has a very different game experience from a person who uses money in games and the f2ps. I feel like I have always been so unlucky ever since I started the game. It‚Äôs just so frustrating. Great game but for me, I am about to delete this game.
title: This game is fun

review: My friends and I all play this game together and we spend pretty consistently on welkins, battle passes, and crystals for summons. We love this game, but one of us has had a super simple email issue (which should be the easiest thing in the world to fix) and has spent MONTHS trying to get it resolved, to no avail. There is NO ONE at hoyoverse helping customers. No phone number to call, no text chat option, NOTHING. Just some lame automated forms incapable of dealing with the most basic issue. Not being able to play with our friend has made us all slowly lose interest in the game and want to quit altogether. What‚Äôs sad is if it wasn‚Äôt for this tiny issue, we‚Äôd have all kept playing and spending not even knowing that hoyoverse was so negligently cutting corners with customer support. Don‚Äôt let these giant corporations keep getting away with rolling back even the most basic features. A live human customer support department is the LEAST a multi-billion dollar company owes its loyal player base. Billions in profits, but you can‚Äôt afford rent at a call center? Do better.
title: Nonexistent ‚Äúcustomer support‚Äù department

review: In all honesty, this game is amazing. Genshin Impact was a favorite of mine for almost an entire year, I joined in April 28th of last year. And the first 7-8 months were amazing. But, almost 2 months ago, the game has felt more like a chore then just something you can do in your free time. I haven‚Äôt played at all. There have been times when I did log in but it was all because of curiosity. And I only spent 15-20 minutes online. The last time I‚Äôve been on was a whole 2 weeks ago. If there was just a change in the daily commissions so they could be quicker but at the same time a fun activity to do while your bored, then it would be nice. Another thing, is that with the artifacts, it is SO hard to get something remotely okay for a character. If they could fix it to make it a little easier, it would be amazing.
title: Could have improvements!

review: I hate the new Chasm quest and the fact that other players including myself can‚Äôt unlock the archon quest without completing it. It‚Äôs a very long and tedious quest with a lot of mini quests involved in it and it can be very complex to solve. Mind you not everyone has the time to complete this within a day as they have other responsibilities. I also feel bad for players who have to leave the game for months due to their personal lives and can‚Äôt enjoy the archon quest without dealing with the chasm. In my opinion it seems like the chasm quest is like a spin off the dragon spine and while dragon spine was fun I don‚Äôt think players care for a spin off. Since the chasm quest is so tedious and you can‚Äôt enjoy the archon quest until it‚Äôs complete it takes the fun out of the game also for me and many other players. I think they should have made the quest either less elaborate or let players unlock the archon quests without having to deal with the chasm. So players can choose when to play both. The chasm quest is just really frustrating and I‚Äôm sick of trying to complete it at this point.

review:
I‚Äôve played Genshin for pretty much over a year nowadays and it‚Äôs become moreover boring during the latest gameplay. 

Although I appreciate and admire Hoyoverse and everyone whose work on Genshin Impact, in the long run, Genshin becomes a tedious process moreover than a game.

The quests to complete in order to participate for events feels like a chore, a task. 

Genshin Impact is a fun open-world RPG with a creativity and spark like no other that can‚Äôt be replicated so simply but if you take the gameplay, it‚Äôs not all that it plays up to be.

The wishing system is also a major drawback. It seems rigged for the amount of wishing in order to attain a five-star, a top tier, just for better gameplay.

Which seems like a massive pushover, because although the gameplay is enjoyable to an extent, the fact that you‚Äôre practically forced or furthermore pressured into wishing for better characters and weapons to better the gameplay is a grand cinch.

As much as I love the gameplay, the lore, the visuals, the characters, etc. The cons, in my opinion, outweigh the remarkable prospects by too much.

Thus causing a currently former-player to delete itself as a whole. I‚Äôm considering re-downloading because I‚Äôve become to miss the 
gameplay but the constant rubbish this app provides is a weighted score.

Best of luck and wishes to everyone who plays and the team who created such a novelty.
title: Genshin Impact is pretty fun, but there are tons of setbacks that absolutely ruin the game.

review: i really like this game and play it many hours a day. only when i tried to complete a quest it was a bugged quest. i got a quest not that long ago, ‚Äúthe chi of yore‚Äù and didn‚Äôt start the quest right away. however, the past few days when i have looked at the quest and tried to navigate to the ruins, the navigation thing wouldn‚Äôt show up on the map. today, i looked up a quest guide on how to do it, even though the navigator wouldn‚Äôt show up. i defeated the ruin hunter, found all three fragments near the geo statues, and collected the final chest that was supposed to bring me to the next part of the quest. only it didn‚Äôt. i saw on the quest pop up on the side of the screen it changed the quest to ‚Äúinvestigate the ruins‚Äù for a split second before the pop up changed back to ‚Äúfind all three fragments near the geo statues‚Äù. the quest doesn‚Äôt work at all now, and there‚Äôs still no navigator. not only that but i wanted to continue the new moonlight merriment event only to find out i can‚Äôt until i finish the chi of yore quest because there is a character from the chi of yore quest that is in the moonlight merriment quest. if there‚Äôs something you can do about this please do it. moonlight merriment is a timed event so i would like to complete it before it‚Äôs over. i also know there is a lot of other people with this similar problem. please fix bugged quests.
title: nice game, lots of bugs though

review: I know this is going to sound crazy but I have never played any game like how I have played Genshin Impact before. It‚Äôs so evolved that my approach to game playthrough, play style and strategy for an action rpg have completely changed. I have never set goals like this for a game where it gives you an actual sense of accomplishment for achieving something while still keeping the progressive difficulty realistic enough to keep things spicy. It‚Äôs difficult to put down because once you download it and start to get a grip on things you end up unlocking ANOTHER neat feature that adds to the depth and dynamism of the world of Teyvat. Even if you don‚Äôt fully experience immersion like when reading or listening to something this experience will grip you into something comparable to Infinite Tsukiyomi; a blissful world of beauty  and danger in your wildest anime dreams.

review: I give this 3 stars but my few problems are that I have enough storage on my phone to download thsi then when you get inside the app you have to download another thing which when I tried it said I had insufficient storage so I deleted most of apps losing all my Proggress in them and data just to realize this is a glitch I wasted all of that time deleted 47 apps for this. title: I‚Äôm Obsessed!

review: Genshin Impact is a great game, I love it, but in my state where I live there is barely any people who can afford storage to get the app. The app waste many of your storage to those who can‚Äôt afford much storage. If you got genshin impact on the computer it doesn‚Äôt waste much storage but once you get it on the phone and play a lot, and a lot, it starts wasting your storage. If your in a state like Japan, you get probably all the storage you can have, but some people are in little states that don‚Äôt have much money to afford storage for these kind of games. Besides the storage problem, it‚Äôs a completely amazing game. I play this game up to probably 4 in the morning. I wouldn‚Äôt say I‚Äôm obsessed with this game, but I when I‚Äôm bored and have nothing to do, I play this all day. It gives away my stress to issues I have and makes something enjoyable! I would have gave this app a 4-5 stars but I only gave it 3 because of the storage problem. Love the game!
title: Read please (my opinion)

review:
I recently started playing Genshin a few months ago and I love how there is so much to do !! I‚Äôm currently AR 49 and I enjoy fighting in the domains and defeating bosses. 

However, I wish that there was another way to earn more primogems faster for F2P players. I understand there are daily commissions and new upcoming events that distribute some primos when you partake in them, but it is only enough for a few wish pulls.

A 5 star character is guaranteed when you reach 90 pity on a banner, and a lot of primogems are required in order to reach that number. If you have Bennett‚Äôs luck, (like me), it is really difficult to obtain new 5 star characters when you only get one every 80-90 wishes.

It would be nice if the developers can increase the amount of primogems us F2P players get so we have the opportunity to have as many new 5 stars as possible (or at least lower the guaranteed 5 star rate chance when wishing).

Other than that, the graphics are so beautiful and I love how there is little to no lag as a mobile player. Although this game does take up a lot of storage, it‚Äôs really worth it.

Overall, I definitely enjoy everything Genshin has to offer and I am looking forward to more updates in the future !! 

Thank you so much MiHoYo for developing such a wonderful game ! ‚≠êÔ∏è

title: umm.

review: Let me first say that I love this game and it‚Äôs art style, characters and mechanics. However I‚Äôve put hundreds of dollars and grinder for hours and hours over the span of months and have only achieved 3 five star characters. I understand it is a random drawing with low odds, but wow the amount of disappointment ive had considering the time and money ive put in this game is astounding and frustrating. Also there‚Äôs been an issue in this update where the character switching mechanic does not respond either at all or very very delayed to the point I‚Äôve lost domains and challenges because the buttons will be frozen or I get a ‚Äúcan‚Äôt switch character in cool down‚Äù when in fact, I have not been able to switch my character for 60 seconds. I feel like I get an issue similar to this almost every month now. Anyway, overall a great and beautiful game but I‚Äôm beginning to feel that it‚Äôs not gonna be worth my time or money for a while
title: Love it but still a few issues.

review: I usually never review apps or games of anything but wow, this game is SO AMAZING! And FREE!? I have always wanted to try and find a good, open-world RPG for mobile and came close to a few good ones but never one like this that hits the nail directly on the head! Countless hours of gameplay, good story, lush open-world, and BEAUTIFUL GRAPHICS! And again... completely FREE! Overall this game is so good, I would easily pay $15-$20 for it after knowing what I know about how good it is. The one thing that would really be the cherry on top of this deliciously crafted masterpiece, is if it were to have controller compatibilities. I know it‚Äôs still early on and still in the process of being fully developed and tweaked but, if later on down the road you could use a controller to play; that would make this the %100 best game I‚Äôve ever played on a mobile device. So please, in the future, maybe try to find a way to make that happen! :) A+++

review: Genshin Impact is the best game I‚Äôve ever played in my phone, it‚Äôs graphics are astounding for a mobile game, the sound effects are high quality and, unlike most games, the voice actors are impeccable. The story so far is looking promising, and the game plays very smoothly, and on top of that it‚Äôs very fun, whereas with other mobile games I give up out of boredom, but with this I just want to play more and more of the game. review: This game is fun as I play it on my PC a lot. However when I take it to the mobile experience it is actually unplayable. I downloaded it on the iPad 5 generation which is well capable enough to run it, however it doesn‚Äôt work well. The download process is smooth, but the screen is just black in most places where color would otherwise be. In game, aside from constantly crashing, you actually can see in a small radius, but anything far away is just covered by the black screen. This radius doesn‚Äôt redeem it though because in fights, like the ones with storm terror for instance, you literally can‚Äôt see anything and the entire screen is black aside from icons. The same goes for dungeons as well. I really hope Mihoyo fixes this because my iPad is easily capable of running this even if it does have to be on the lowest settings. I don‚Äôt feel the need to buy a new iPad to play a game with a bug that can be fixed. This same problem is on my iPhone 6 as well.
title: Doesn‚Äôt work well on iPad 5th gen and iPhone 6

review:
I‚Äôve been playing Genshin since 2020 and I will say it‚Äôs an amazing game filled with beautiful unique characters, amazing graphics, top notch scenery and interesting quests. But the storage is what discourages many people to play. If you don‚Äôt know the app only takes about 3 GB but all the updates and game data TAKES MORE THAN 30 GB. ONLY DOWNLOAD IF YOU HAVE A SUBSTANTIAL AMOUT OF STORAGE. My friend had to delete every single app, all her photos and all her data from her device to play Genshin. But the storage isn‚Äôt really hoyo‚Äôs fault so here‚Äôs some tips to free up storage-

1. Delete unwanted photos (especially videos) from your device.

2. Delete or offload apps you know you don‚Äôt need or don‚Äôt need at the moment.

3. (This is NOT for mobile players who can‚Äôt even get into the game rn)
Go into Genshin‚Äôs game settings click resources and delete old quest data and cutscenes.

4. Switch to a different device like laptop or pc.

5. Take the risk to reset your device then re download Genshin and log back in.

6. Buy a new device with more storage (for i pad/ tablet users) 

-and that was it! I really recommend playing Genshin especially if you played other mihoyo games like honkai this will be a new and wonderful experience for you!
title: Great game! But the storage takes up a lot, anyone thinking to download please read.

title: Its THE BEST GAME IN THE UNIVERSEüëç‚ú®‚ú®

review: This game is all about exploration and elemental combat. The story is creative and the characters have a ton of charm and detail.  Towards the end you have to use limited resources to farm dungeons for better equipment for your characters. Rewards daily play, so despite the gacha system the most beneficial thing you can do for your account is play frequently. Gacha system requires saving game currency diligently or spending real money to get the best characters with the best designs, abilities, and damage potential.  I have been playing since day 1 and have invested tons of time into the game. I haven‚Äôt spent much money since they give out game currency in events.  I have amassed a lot of good characters due only to my time investment.  New players will have a harder uphill climb to endgame content due to their lack of time investment.  Amazing game, A+. The art is insane.
title: Pure fun with a heavy endgame grind

review:
I started this game from launch and it is by no means perfect. Time gated content, bad end game loop, slow resin regeneration, and more. They are all valid issues but one thing comes to mind. What other mobile game has this good of graphics, story, and gameplay? None that‚Äôs what. If you rush your progress in this game you will run out of things to do, but why rush? This incredible open world RPG is the best on the App Store. And yes just because there is gacha systems this doesn't mean you have to spend money to win at the game. I‚Äôve never dropped a single dollar on this game and have had average luck on pulls and I‚Äôm still beating the hardest content in the game. I recommend to give this game a try if you have 30 minute down times here and there. It‚Äôs definitely not a game to play for 5 minutes like some other mobile games. 

Best wishes,
Mondstat Traveler
title: Relaxing and fun

review: Hello Mihoyo, I believe this game of yours is truly fascinating and really addicting. Now, in the game there are many places to transport and I am really grateful for that. But, there are a bit of commissions at dawn winery and it can be a bit of a challenge sometimes to get there with such quests such as the food delivery. And i get it! It's supposed to be challenging yes, but I think it might be a bit difficult for new players since their stamina wouldn't be as high as a AR. 50 player. And to get to the winery from the statue is a bit far for them. So I was wondering if you could add a teleport waypoint a bit closer to dawn winery but not exactly at it. Like maybe on the cliff behind the winery. That would help with the slime commissions too. Then it's a win-win for everyone. That's just my opinion though, at least think about it if you want. Other than that, great job with your game!
title: Yello

review:
Best game to play across many platforms, and it‚Äôs quite an enjoyment for its story, characters and it‚Äôs gotcha system. You can still enjoy the game in full without paying a single dollar, and you can also enjoy the game with buying in game currency to boost your playing time with getting stronger 5 star characters and what not. But you can still get them doing the old fashion grinding for Primogems and save up for the chance of getting one of the weapons or characters you want. 100% of the game is accessible for free to play players. You don‚Äôt have to buy anything to even enjoy the newest events. 
*Right now there‚Äôs people rating this game a 1 star due to not being happy with the anniversary gift from Mihoyo, which I find their actions very petty* I‚Äôm a semi P2P for their characters, but I‚Äôm not mad about the gifts. They could‚Äôve just not even do the event*
title: Best free game!

review: For a game that‚Äôs free to play I would 100% recommend. The storyline is well written, and flows greatly with the scenery and characters. The amount of playable characters that were written have been done so well! The amount of descriptions for each, and the immense details that have gone into their outfits amaze me. As an artist it makes me quite jealous. It takes up quite a bit of storage, but it‚Äôs worth it if you don‚Äôt have a PlayStation or PC to play on. For a game that you can play on the phone/tablet, the graphics are wonderful. The Gacha feature can be troubling to understand and deal with for those that really want that 5 star character, but I do hope they come home! If anything is confusing just know that there are plenty of people willing to help you out, log into co-op after reaching AR16 and get to beating those bosses! Have fun traveling!
title: Wonderful in All

review:
This game gives off vibes that remind me of Breath of the Wild. And for a company that makes mobile games to do that.....outstanding. I do have some things I would like added or changed. Most importantly, I want to be able to pet the cats and dogs. They follow you around for a short while and all you can really do is...run around in a circle around them. I would also like it if there was a dodge mechanic in the game and not just dashing. I also think when you level up, overtime, the quests, commissions leylines, and all that stuff give you should give you more EXP. But thats about it. Amazing game.
Quick update
I no longer play this game on mobile, I instead play on PS4 (PS5 when it‚Äôs released on the console). I do prefer to play on consoles 100% of the time. Just a quick update that‚Äôs all. Still great game
title: Masterpiece....but definitely can use some changes

review:
My friends and I were talking and one of them told me to download this game. I looked at it, thought it looked sub par at best, like DDLC visual novel graphics, but 3D, which are good graphics, just not animated, as I thought this should be, but I downloaded it anyway, because my friend was often right about good games. I WAS BLOWN AWAY. The graphics are amazing, the voice acting is good, the game mechanics make me want to cry with how perfect they are, and the characters, even the npcs that never have any big impact are so well written that I almost felt bad for Timmie after using MCs  on his pigeons accidentally, no mad he made me any other time. I‚Äôve been playing it everyday, and the story made me cry, it WAS SO EMOTIONALLY CHARGED. Also, I‚Äôve gotten obsessed with cooking every dish the game had to offer, because they sound amazing.
Download this game, you will never regret it.
title: Idk how, but this game changed my life

review: I have been playing this game for over two years now, and I‚Äôve stuck through it with every single update. Until this recent one. My iPhone only has 64GB of storage, and when each update is like 3GB+, I always have to delete a lot of my other apps to make room for this one. But this update especially, even after I deleted 10+ apps, photos, text messages, and everything you can name, the game still told me I had insufficient storage. I seriously love the game and I have spent a good amount of money on it, but I just really can‚Äôt continue regularly playing it anymore (since my laptop isn‚Äôt good enough to run the game), and I‚Äôm seriously really sad. I really hope that Hoyoverse can fix this issue soon, because Lantern Rite especially is my favorite annual update and I don‚Äôt want to not play this game anymore because of a storage problem.
title: Love this game, but inconvenient for mobile

review:
I KNOW, we ALL know that this company does not care about their fan base at all unless it‚Äôs a ‚Äúgame removal risk‚Äù. During the first anniversary, it was proven that they‚Äôll only listen to their fan base if their game it at risk to be removed from the App Store with the negative review bombing that occurred. 

One of the most anticipated characters, who happened to have the slightest hit of melanin (news flash she isn‚Äôt even that dark, unfortunately) is treated HORRIBLY when it comes to how her play style works and how much damage she‚Äôll do. A content creator sent them a message about a bug (the ‚Äòbug‚Äô being that her ultimate attack being cancelled if you jump), and want to know their response? ‚ÄúJust don‚Äôt jump during her burst‚Äù (burst = ultimate attack). 

Really? That‚Äôs their response? If so many people are complaining about something, FIX it. Especially for something like this. Hoyoverse, the company, only listen to Chinese servers and players which is honestly terrible because a handful group of players shouldn‚Äôt be the reason why some things happen or not.
title: Does not care about their fan base

review:
As an avid breath of the wild player I was so hesitant to play this game, as I'd heard so much controversy. It looked SOOOO similar, but when I picked it up on pc to play it for myself, I can definitely say the devs played botw, then decided to make their own game using the same assets and a semi-different main plot. As you play more, though, you can see how they've grown into their own separate universe, and how they've molded into their own specific game; and not just an anime botw.
You can see and appreciate the changes they've made to go out of their way to say, "Hey, just because we used another game for inspiration doesn't mean we're a bad game." It's not a bad game at all, and it's got a lot of inspiration from other games as well, such as WoW. It's got blatant inspiration, yes, but ultimately it's not a ripoff of any game. Highly recommend, but play it on pc. The fact that it's free boggles my mind.
title: Believe it or not, it's not a total ripoff of botw.

review: Hi there. Day 1 player here. The recent announcement of no engame content has left me baffled at how disrespectful this company is to the people who supported it the most. Ive spent 2k plus on this game for characters that now i realize i never needed. Grinded away to level characters that now never even mattered. This game is going to die and you have noone to blame but yourselves. Keep pandering to your player base that doesnt spend money on the game and watch how that affects your investors. Dumbest marketing decision i have ever seen a company make. ‚ÄúHere lets not give the people who support us the most anything thats actually fun to do, should work out great!‚Äù Idiots. Absolute idiots.

title: Amazing but not amazing

review:
for genshin to incorporate different real life cultures and regions into their game, you‚Äôd be surprised that the characters from sumeru were even from there at all. sumeru is supposed to be based off of the SWANA region, and while, yes, it‚Äôs not supposed to be mirror images of one another, asking for skintone representation with this new in game region shouldn‚Äôt even have to be an ask- it should have been implemented from the get go.

but alas, out of all the characters that have been leaked for sumeru 3.0, only ONE character is of a darker complexion, and she‚Äôs rumored to be a 4 star. you have 50 playable characters and only 2 are of darker complexion. there are also 0 five star characters of tan-darker complexions.

i‚Äôve spent over $3,000 in this game alone, but sumeru is where i draw the line. as someone with darker skin, seeing a middle eastern inspired region have most characters literally neon white is a slap in the face to me and others too. skintone representation is not just a western issue. people all over the world have all sorts of skintones, it‚Äôs high time hoyoverse starts incorporating them into genshin impact.
title: misrepresentation of SWANA people

review: I‚Äôve been a console gamer/PC gamer my whole life. Occasion mobile gaming on early iOS like fruit ninja/angry birds era but never thought I‚Äôd actually enjoy mobile game until I got my Backbone for my iPhone 12 Pro and downloaded Genshin Impact. It runs really smoothly BUT I would love to see better optimization for the graphics on iOS cause my iPhone is a hot brick after running the game for an hour (granted I like running it on all low graphic settings except medium render and 60 FPS). After about 1.5 hours to 2 hours you definitely start getting lag. Also would be awesome if they included dual touch and controller features in the mobile version as opposed to choosing one or the other, like what Backbone has in their platform iOS app. Otherwise, been having a blast playing coop cross platform with my friends on PS5, which I‚Äôd never thought possible as a longtime gamer.

review: Once you get started up it‚Äôs pretty fun, the motive of the game is to defeat monsters, complete quests, participate in events, and get new characters in this vast open world of Tevyat. For me personally, this game is very fun for exploring, getting characters, saving for the characters, and getting all the items you need for them! You can spend money on this game but I assure you, you‚Äôll do just fine without money with enough experience and skill. The most you can spend n this game is about a month learning to get the basics down, at least for me that is. I totally recommend it if you like open world exploration, quests, frequent events, and new characters every update!

title: Most addicting game ever

review:
Overall, Genshin impact is great. The graphics and the sound are amazing, the characters are really well thought out and planned and the quests (for the most part) are interesting. 

But I do have some genuine concerns. It isn‚Äôt MacOS friendly, the quests are originally long for veteran players and then are cut in half for new players, and if you take a break from Genshin you will miss a lot of things. I took a break before after Inazuma. When I first started in Inazuma I was overwhelmed with the quests. I was desperately trying to catch up with the fog island and other islands. I still haven‚Äôt unlocked Enkanomiya. I was getting bored of doing the same exploring, trying to max out explorations, collecting offerings to the god of the region,  finishing off quests to unlock more new levels to explore, and a similar character design for new characters. 

It also made people who played mobile switch to pc because of the amount of storage needed. I am Ar 55 and I have been playing since last march. Over time my experience has switched from ‚Äú Oh this is so fun! I love playing this. It‚Äôs so fun.‚Äù to a ‚ÄúI have to do this. I have to do this otherwise I‚Äôll miss ___. This quest is so long, I just want to go to *new region*‚Äù

I love this game. It‚Äôs a beautiful game with a beautiful story behind it. The game feels like it‚Äôs  on a slow decline. I want to be able to start playing again. 

Thank you
title: Not fair for players who started earlier

review: I love this game, i've been playing for 2 years now and i can say the story line, combat, and characters are well designed and written. There happens to be one issue. As of writing this there are 52 in game characters yet only 2 of them have tan skin. And out of those 2, one happens to be a black stereotype. With the new update of sumeru and future updates i would like to see some characters with actually dark skin because of this region being based off of places with people who typically have dark skin instead of the usual white skin tone. many of the characters coming out have lighter skin than the ones from monstadt (based of germany) which is very upsetting to see. additionally theres no plus sized character except for npcs. as someone who is plus sized i hope to see a plus sized character very soon. i hope these issues gets changed soon and we happen to get more diversity.

I spend at most 5 a month for the daily pass. Some months I don‚Äôt spend at all and I have to say, my characters are great! Compared to many other games out there, I would recommend this game over and over again as the best game!
