review: As a free to play player, I‚Äôve been with this game for 5 months now. I love it, used all my free time just to explore and farm and roam around. Sometimes I get bored, but that didn‚Äôt stop me from playing. This game has a co-op mode, which allows players to travel to other player‚Äôs world as well. I love to help out new comers and whoever needs help. It was fun making friends all around Genshin. So many new contents coming out, I‚Äôm so excited, not just for the content but the amount of free primogems that HoYoLAB gives us. As a f2p, I love free primogems. I log on, do daily works then explore. Trust me, if you are bored, feel free to join other‚Äôs world and explore. There are so many ways to earn primogems and the fact that I lose every 50/50 makes primogems even more important. Don‚Äôt mind the fact that I spend 6 hours a day on this game. title: F2p

review: I love Genshin Impact, and have been playing for over a year now. I do sometimes get bored at the end of versions but always come back. The graphics are great, and the character designs visually are stunning. Characters themselves have been a little disappointing as of late, but only when compared to the main damage dealing units. One problem I do have with the game is the storyline. Much of it feels emotionless, and the protagonist always wins so far, making the game feel very much like a Disney show. I think that if the developers made players more connected to them, and made it so that at one point or another, the traveler has to face something different, not just a boss battle, but maybe something more emotional, such as a character in the game dying, and not just super suddenly. Aside from all that, everything about this game is great, and you should definitely give it a try.
title: Pretty good

review: Genshin Impact is a fun and addicting game, you could possibly spend hours on it if you have the time. The storyline is also well written and I‚Äôve spent almost 2 years playing it, so it does have a ton to offer but the lack of skin diversity is sad. With Sumeru coming out I was hoping they wouldn‚Äôt continue to white wash their characters but I expected too much from Hoyoverse. Having the new Sumeru characters based on real tanned/dark skinned historical figures (as I‚Äôve heard) and be incredibly disrespectful to take high inspiration from them, yet not give the characters the correct skin tones shows a lot about the company already. I love this game and have spent a good amount on it too, but I‚Äôve chosen to stop giving them money (and to those continuing to spend I‚Äôd urge you to also stop). This game is near and dear to my heart but it‚Äôs frustrating to see Hoyoverse coming out with regions that have people with tanned/dark skin and white wash the characters even after multiple complaints from their own community of players.
title: It‚Äôs fun but‚Ä¶

review: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, Genshin Impact is a very beautiful game with very uniquely designed characters! Although, I just have one recommendation to make. What if you guys added trading to the game? Then it would make getting materials easier! I know there is Co-Op mode, but you could also trade weapons, and even characters including four and five stars. But, the catch is that you also need to give the person you‚Äôre trading something. Say, for example, you wanted to trade someone for, let‚Äôs say a weapon, then that means you would also have to give the person you‚Äôre trading with a weapon too. This would also help increase people‚Äôs trust because you can‚Äôt complete the trade unless you also give something to the person you‚Äôre trading with. This is just a suggestion/recommendation, thank you for your time!
title: Very great game! Just one recommendation‚Ä¶

review: This game is beautiful in almost every aspect! The visuals are absolutely stunning and the lore is very well written. My favorite part of this game is listening to the amazing soundtrack, which is capable of evoking many emotions. Also, fighting style of the game is quite fun and easy to understand. This game has gotten some bad reviews from players who wanted better chances with the gacha system, however, it‚Äôs important to consider that this is one of the only ways for the company to make some profit. There were also many complaints about poor anniversary rewards, but I don‚Äôt think that will lessen your playing experience with the game. The download and update time may take longer than other games, but it will all be worth it in the end. Hopefully this review will persuade you to download the game. If it did, then happy playing, Traveler!

review:
Honestly ahead of its time. Super smooth gameplay on mobile (as well as on PC - i like to switch between the two). I usually like mmos, rpgs, action/adventure so this ticks allll the boxes for me. The gameplay itself is really fun, and even if you don‚Äôt want to spend a dime, the free characters are plenty. But to be honest, after you‚Äôve spend a dozen hours, what‚Äôs a 5$ monthly card? People are willing to pay 10-20$ for a 2h movie, so spending 5$ a month on extra fun spread across many more hours is definitely justified. Afterall, people creating this game arent volunteering. But that 5$ is absolutely not necessary. I like the game enough to put money on it - but I only did that after I had sunken an easy 30h+ on it. No money? No problem. Fun & some to spare? A bit of extra fun so why not. 
Bit of coop for dungeons, loads of story quests, events & gorgeous graphics!
title: Worth it

title: Beautiful game but company is greedy and doesn‚Äôt listen

review: Thank you so much miHoYo for such the BEST anniversary ever! We having such a good time together! I really do find interesting in this game and you‚Äôre doing great about it! title: 1 year anniversary reward

review: The couple recent characters that have been released so far (Yoimiya, Raiden Shogun, Sara, and probably more to come) have been underwhelming in terms of their performance and kit design. This is displayed in the case of the Raiden Shogun, who‚Äôs the most hyped character with the new release of the Inazuma region. Her base form at C0 performs terribly compared to other characters within the same element and support role, but becomes viable at C2, which requires players to pull more, resulting in more spending. On the same topic of elements, she is one of the weakest elements in the game, which is electro, which deserves a buff to compete with the top elements. Past characters felt good at C0, and didn‚Äôt require further investment to compete those of the same role, but that has changed in the case of the Raiden Shogun. I do not think that it was a coincidence that a top up bonus reset was aligned with the character‚Äôs release, as if Mihoyo knew that the Raiden Shogun would encourage players to spend even more. This is bad practice overall for the players, especially for F2P and low spenders.
title: Character performance shouldn‚Äôt be locked behind a paywall

review: The game is amazing and I love the graphics and gameplay behind it I really do. I have been wanting to play this game for a long time since I heard of it and when I went to first download it I was so excited and then I got hit with 7gb update or whatever it was. I just recently decided to make room for it and I needed almost 10 GB of storage and I know ‚Äúit‚Äôs not that much‚Äù but I don‚Äôt have any expanded storage so I‚Äôm limited to 32 GB of storage and I don‚Äôt want to delete games that I like and have been playing forever but I got rid of some that I knew I could easily get back but had to go farther and clear so much stuff off my phone it freaks me out to see the screen empty. I thought the game was going to be extraordinary and with its graphics yes it is, but I still think 10GB is too much for a single game, and it even misleads you by saying it‚Äôs only 3GB at first, I‚Äôm being generous giving it three stars because it is a good game but just please fix how big it is or do something about it.
title: Good but had a BIG problem

review: Excellent, immersive gameplay. Frequent updates. Quick and effective hot fixes. Devs respond to feedback. Diverse and unique characters. Only real complaint is the time it takes to update the client from App Store. Perhaps it‚Äôs just my internet but I gotta start the update process at the beginning of my day and watch it to make sure it finishes. Be nice if character switches didn‚Äôt drop characters during Dvalin fight but it‚Äôs not actually hard content.  <INSERT RANT> Nobody really states this but your artifacts basically define which characters you should build. Drop rates are consistent, yes, but stat rolls are horrid and fixed to grant much higher chance for all the least desirable values. Can‚Äôt ask for more from a gacha game though. It‚Äôs more about the grind and less about the gameplay. Late game is not for elitists set to obtain the perfect sets in a timely fashion. Best be prepared to stick to a character and a dungeon for the long-haul else you will be disappointed.
title: Best part of 2020

review: It truly is an amazing game and I was blown away by how beautiful it is and how expansive it was! It really reminded me of Aura Kingdom when I played it a long time ago and it had that beautiful immersion as well, just minus the advanced features that this game has. Only one thing I really would like, and I can‚Äôt emphasize this enough, is that there should be a cross region adding feature. Majority of games like these do have cross adding from different regions and countries, so I was confused as to why it wasn‚Äôt a feature on here. Some people have a bunch of friends from a different country and they can‚Äôt play multiplayer due to the locked region. I think it would be an amazing thing to add! Other than that, it is an amazing game, and I look forward to more updates. Hopefully later on in development the creators make it available to add people from different servers!
title: Amazing with new possible features

review: Most of the 1 Star Reviews are complaints for lag and just saying the game is ‚Äúterrible‚Äù with no reason why. It crashes occasionally for me, but only when I teleport to a town with a lot of graphics to load, the game lags and crashes for people either because their internet cant handle it or their device is out of date. There are also many complaints about it taking up ‚Äútoo much storage‚Äù and using ‚Äútoo much data‚Äù. Genshin Impact is a high quality game, therefore it requires a larger amount than most other mobile games for storage and data. I have also seen complaints saying it takes your money because you have to ‚Äúpay to win‚Äù. I have been playing for 245 hours, and have not spent a single cent, and I have already completed at least 95% of the game. All Im saying is this is a well made and beautiful game.
title: Very Good

review: I love Genshin Impact, for too many reasons to count, and I feel that it‚Äôs truly a good game, but with patience. A lot of this game is waiting, waiting for the daily commissions (quests) to reset, waiting for bosses to reset, etc. It‚Äôs not easy to get started on this game when you don‚Äôt have the patience to grind out your adventure rank (player level) and complete long, convoluted quests. I find that playing the game casually is the best way to get started, as opposed to sitting down and doing every single quest and storyline available in a day. Saving Primogems, which allow you to roll for new characters, is also very prevalent if you aren‚Äôt just playing casually or you really really want a specific character. I would recommend not spending primogems at all until a desirable character like Bennett or Sucrose is on a banner to get you started with another four star character.
title: Good, but patience is required.

review:
I‚Äôm not someone who is into anime (TV/movies or games), so when I saw people raving about Genshin Impact and decided to give it a shot, I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd be able to get into it... but I did. It doesn‚Äôt feel half-baked or like it was built for mobile; it‚Äôs a real, open-world game that just happens to also be available on mobile - that‚Äôs genuinely impressive to me for a new game.

That being said, my only complaint is the lack of controller support (which it sounds like may already be in the plans for the future). The touch controls are far better than most other adventure games that I‚Äôve played on iPhone, but I‚Äôd still much rather play with a controller personally.

My last bit of praise is for the granular adjustability of graphics settings - that‚Äôs something that I hope to see more of in future games (instead of just ‚ÄúLow‚Äù, ‚ÄúMedium‚Äù, or ‚ÄúHigh‚Äù settings).
title: Excellent game, one complaint

review:
I love this game so much, like way too much my life is this game! The characters are amazing, the storyline is also amazing. If you like adventure and anime this is the right game for you. This game includes various quests, and you‚Äôll meet characters along the way, with 4.0 half way done, that means 5.0 is coming in around November I don‚Äôt wait! The only thing is that primogems are so hard to get, as an F2P player I can barely get a 5 star without grinding, you have to pay for characters. Some people are like you can‚Äôt finish the game without paying but it‚Äôs completely free other than primogems of course. I wish that primogems were cheaper and you would fix bugs! XOXO, Me!

title: ADDICTED

review: But I‚Äôm still wondering when are they going to reveal who Paimon actually is. I mean she‚Äôs going some markings of some kind of god. title: This game is great

review: Firstly I want to start off with primogems. Everyone needs primogems to obtain new characters and weapons. I am having a very hard time obtaining them. However there are quest you can do to get them.. but they are hard. Once you complete a hard quest, you only get at least 20-60 primogems?! Sure there are 4 star characters, but spending the money I have spent, I am still not getting the character and if I don‚Äôt or do, I should get my money back. This is unacceptable. It‚Äôs great at the start but once I didn‚Äôt get a character or lose a 50/50 the grind still continues. And everyone is counting on Hoyoverse to create events that you can earn primogems. Im not trying to beg for a character, but my account is kinda weak and without her, I‚Äôll remain weak for god knows how long.

title: Great game but it hates specifically me

review:
Honestly what can I say, Hoyoverse claims to listen and care about what it‚Äôs viewers but that‚Äôs a blatant lie, and instead chooses to listen to the people who agree with the company. It‚Äôs ridiculous and I‚Äôm personally tired of it. Out of the 50 playable character we have only TWO darker skinned characters, them being Kaeya and Xinyan. Every single other one is lighter skinned, as of recent it seems to be it‚Äôll stay like that. What a joke, after the game being released and playable for two years they have yet to any other type of diversity in skin color. Hoyoverse is capable of doing more, there are characters that are inspired by Japanese culture, ( Arataki Itto being my example) they researched the significance of certain parts of his outfit, drawing close detail. Why can they not do the same with adding darker skinned characters? It‚Äôs not a impossible task, they have done it twice, which is the bare minimum. There is darker skinned asians so it‚Äôs not like we are asking for the impossible. 
Overall I‚Äôm upset at the lack of caring Hoyoverse seems to demonstrate. They do not listen to us.

title: Ill pay $70 dollars right now

review: I downloaded genshin to play with my friend. I thought it would be a nice surprise to her. At the time, I was extremely fixated on Cookie Run and was trying different games out for some variety. At first, Genshin became a game I played once or twice a week, depending on how I was feeling. But, as I got more and more into the game, I eventually lost my addiction to Cookie Run. To set the setting now, however, I became absolutely crazy over Genshin, it fueled my hunger for a game to spend rainy days playing. Honestly, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a bad thing. Playing Genshin hasn‚Äôt effected my grades. In fact, I got better grades than before. Although, it can keep you distracted from homework! Overall, Genshin is a great game. Im trying to make my friends play it too. Hopefully, genshin does not have to same fate as Cookie Run bevsuse I do intend on spending money.
title: The unsuspecting game that stole my heart

review: I think Genshin Impact is a great game but there is a few features that I wish Genshin Impact had. One of the features is that for example lets say I was raising Noelle and when I was crafting I used all my hilichurl masks and thought that she only needs omnious masks so I should use all my stained masks when I am crafting but then I got Chongyun and I stopped raising Noelle because I thought Chongyun was better. title: Great game but‚Ä¶

review: I love Genshin, probably my favorite rpg. It‚Äôs amazing! Even though we dont get to many wishes and primos easily, it‚Äôs still fun. The story is engaging, the voice acting is amazing, and all the characters, no matter what rarity, work well. Even Amber, Kaeya, and Lisa (the starters) are awesome to play with if you build them. I love the new Inazuma update (SO PRETTY!) and all the new characters. While trying to get characters can be frustrating, you always get more chances to get the characters you want, and buying the primos and stuff is not necessary to have a good time playing the game. I did buy some stuff and one point because I really badly wanted a character, but even if I didn‚Äôt get that character, I still would have enjoyed the game. Please give it a chance! The one star reviews are mostly people complaining about what they got for the anniversary.
title: LOVE IT!

review: The only reason it‚Äôs a 3 star is because of the company itself. They hadn‚Äôt have any black characters, other than xingyan, who is basically a stereotype. They don‚Äôt listen to feedback from their players and don‚Äôt care about them. So many people has paired a lot for this game, and take the Anniversary rewards for example, gave us almost nothing. After we gave them support and helped them gain billions of dollars, not even 1 wish could be made. This game is extremely greedy and stingy, possibilities racist too. But the gameplay itself is really nice, like any open-world game you would expect, the storyline is kind of bland in my opinion, but you would like it if you were more into puzzle indulged games. There are barely any other body typed characters in the game other than npcs, most of them having hourglass bodies and being super thin.
title: Eh

review: i‚Äôve played this game since the launch day and i was pretty amazed by it. the launch day rewards were so bountiful. now that it‚Äôs anniversary, i kinda expected more from it. it‚Äôs frustrating, all we get is some primogems and 10 intertwined fates. barely even enough for 20 something pulls. like come on! this is a multi-million dollar company and all they can give is this?! what frustrates me more is that the devs of genshin doesn‚Äôt communicate with the community. it‚Äôs like they throw away the community‚Äôs feedback. the community of a game is like it‚Äôs backbone. once you take that away how will it able to operate? i know that this game isn‚Äôt entirely p2w (pay to win) you can enjoy the game by being f2p (free to play). but it‚Äôs looks like the devs cater more to the people who spend money. well it makes sense since they need our money to pay their bills or something. since the community isn‚Äôt being heard, they‚Äôre finding ways to get the devs‚Äô attention. from giving a 1 star or attacking their sister game honkai impact 3rd. i do want to keep supporting this game, but if the devs don‚Äôt communicate with the community it‚Äôs honestly a lost cause. i know they won‚Äôt see this review, but i just needed to get this off my chest because it really is frustrating. i just hope that they acknowledge this and do better. i‚Äôm not getting my hopes up, but the least they can do is acknowledge this matter.
title: kinda disappointing‚Ä¶

review: To be honest I‚Äôve had this app downloaded for quite some time. Today I decided to start playing, and the process of downloading the data takes a bit long, but it‚Äôs 100% worth it. Its only been 3 hours of playing this game, and it‚Äôs really different than your average game. The quests, powers, skills, etc. I guess I can say I‚Äôve taken a liking to it. Although I‚Äôm just a newbie, I can openly admit that this is one of the top games that deserve all its recognition. title: - love it

review:
This is wonderfully developed, the characters are unique, have a backstory, wonderful voice actors, etc. Before downloading, here are some things to consider:
- as this is a large game with demanding graphics, does your device have enough space? Will it have enough space for future updates? How old is your device and do you think it can handle such a game?
- this is a gacha game! The ‚Äúcool‚Äù characters are locked behind a system that is like gambling! While download is free and the content is beatable with the free characters, there IS the option to spend money in game to get the character and/or weapons! Please consider that you may not get what you want!

Now, onto the reason that this game gets 4 stars instead of 5: security! Most of the community lives this game, yet there is no 2 factor authentication! People have spent hundreds or even thousands of dollars on this game, only to get easily hacked! Please fix this small issue!
title: A Well Developed GACHA Game

review: Genshin impact is one of the best rpgs out there by far. It has amazing quality, as well as many fun aspects. One of my favorite things about the game is that it has a pity system. A lot of people complain about it but I think it‚Äôs nice. How the pity system works is that the 90th thing you roll will be a five star character. I love this because it tells the players that they will get a five star. It‚Äôs almost encouraging. Also, I love the designs for the characters. They look so cool and are fashionable. Some of the bosses can be annoying and all, but that isn‚Äôt really relevant. One of the few problems that I have with this app is how the game gets more dry in the later ranks. What I mean is there‚Äôs a lot less to do other than roll for characters. But I‚Äôm sure mihoyo it working on fixing that. I think genshin impact is an amazing game and would recommend you play it.
title: One of the best rpg‚Äôs out there

review: This is a stunning game and impressive for a phone to run smoothly. The mechanics of the fighting are well thought out and interesting enough to keep playing. I have only one gripe with the game and I‚Äôd be willing to change my rating from 4 to 5 with one change; add Xbox one controller connectivity to the mobile version, also please change the button mapping with B and A for the menus. It really throws me off playing the pc version when I have to hit B to choose an option, I‚Äôd prefer if it was A. I‚Äôd still want A to be jump when actually playing but in the menus A and B should definitely be swapped. The only thing that would make me play more at this point is the fact I hate touch screen controls for action oriented games even though the touch controls aren‚Äôt necessarily bad, but controller connectivity on the mobile version of Genshin and Honkai would seal the deal and land you guys a 5 star rating from me.
title: Beautiful design and mechanics but...

review: The game itself is so fun and i‚Äôm in love with it but here are some problems I have with Genshin Impact. First, I‚Äôve started this game in January and am already AR level 42 in a month which I didn‚Äôt rush anything. I feel like the game won‚Äôt be as fun when I reach the max level and is sad that the game only will last about two or three months. Second, I did not get my pity? I made over 90 wishes and did not get a five star. Third, I wish the resin count would refresh a bit faster because nowadays if there is no event or no resin to use, there is nothing to do in the game. But I absolutely love the Lantern event right now so please keep up the good work and maybe add more levels or things to do towards the end of the game when you are at a high level. I‚Äôm sad i‚Äôm coming towards the end of this game and I wish for the fun to never end !!
title: Great but Some Inconveniences

review:
I like the game. I hate that it has a gacha aspect, but honestly, at least in the beginning, they give you enough currency to attempt some of the rare heroes. I got the one I wanted in two tries, so maybe I was lucky or whatever. 

People draw a lot of comparisons between this and Breath of the Wild‚Äîthey‚Äôre not wrong. But that game was never able to hold my attention. I picked it up and put it down within an hour. I‚Äôve been playing this game for the past 3 days and have yet to get bored. The pacing is great, the design is amazing, and the characters are unique. 

The only thing that irked me is the complete and utter lack of diversity. No POC. And I know these areas are based on Japan and China, but this is fantasy. I myself am Black and loved in China for some time. And while I was there I met many MANY Black, Indian, and other POC sooooooo.... ya‚Äôll can do better in this area. That‚Äôs all I‚Äôm saying. If you‚Äôre planning on adding some diversity, please let me know. I‚Äôve tried to convince some of my friends to play and this is one of the major reasons they cite for why they will not. I myself didn‚Äôt try the game until now for that very reason. This is 2020. We exist. We always have. Please let us see some representation in these games. If there can be a Yoruba character in Fire Force, you guys can add some color to your game. 
That‚Äôs the only reason I have this game 3 stars. 

Thanks for taking the time to read.
title: So Far So Good

title: Why does it need to take so much storage

review: the developers of this game are known to have made another game called honkaii starrail. whenever a new feature is requested for this game, it is added to honkaii and not genshin impact. there is also a wishing system in genshin impact, as it is a gacha game. it takes 90 wishes to get a five star, which is the rarest and usually best type of character or weapon in the game. it may not even be the five star you want. and 90 wishes costs 200 dollars if you‚Äôre not purchasing it for the first time. it takes 10 wishes to get anything good. so here‚Äôs my point: as a ‚Äúthank you‚Äù to the players of genshin impact for playing for YEARS, the developers gave us 3 wishes. 3. that can‚Äôt get you anything useful to an even somewhat experienced player. but the genshin impact team knows that we will keep paying money in this expensive game, so they don‚Äôt care about us. they only care about the money. do not download, trust me. otherwise you will be disappointed multiple times, as i and many other players have been many times before.
title: the devs don‚Äôt care about you or me.

review:
I want to preface this by saying I love this game- I‚Äôve been playing it every day for almost two years and it‚Äôs been fun to experience each new update. But I‚Äôm AR 60 (i need a new hobby i swear) and the lack of endgame content is rly getting to me. Abyss resets every two weeks. I essentially log on, do commissions, spend resin, MAYBE do an event if there is one, and then log off. I‚Äôve become really bored and the only things i really look forward to are new areas to explore (I have everything explored >98%). 
I also feel like I‚Äôm not as excited for new characters as much. Anticipation is built up for new releases and they almost always disappoint. I‚Äôve gotten every character I feel can help me advance in the game and now I don‚Äôt have anything to look forward
to.
I also feel like this game has a huge lack of diversity but that would have to be put in a whole other review.
title: I love this game, but..

review: This game is one of those games I thought I‚Äôd delete after playing for 5 minutes, but oh boy was I wrong! This game really let‚Äôs you explore across the map, upgrade your characters, let‚Äôs you play with your friends, go on exciting quests, and etc. This game also has well detailed and cool characters with their powers and skills being detailed with amazing graphics. There‚Äôs also something called a wish system where you can pull characters. They also have a really nice service where they give you a birthday cake on your B-day. This game developer also added a lot of detail to every single region where you can talk to al,ost every single npc characters. The text and voice-over language can be changed to Chinese, English, Japanese, and even Korean. This is definitely a 5-star game no matter how you look at it.
title: Top Star

review:
First of all, it takes up WAY to much storage and my iCloud storage is basically almost empty now that I got rid of this stupid game. Second of all, it takes SUPER long to load and even if you have sufficient storage it takes forever to download anything on the game like if your updating it or just for the first time getting the app. My friend somehow kinda liked the game but she still has a few complaints about the game, She claims that the game tends to kick her out and it also takes a long time to load for her as well. She also wants an update where u can get a pet or just pet the animals. But that‚Äôs not really a complaint, we just like animals. Overall this game has great quality and is a pretty fun game to play and it keeps you entertained. However, the storage is terrible because you could get rid of like 7 apps from ur phone or whatever device you play on and it still might take a really long time to load or just not be able to download at all.
 Peace‚úåüèº
title: Roblox is better

review:
I havent spent a dollar on this game, and it's very enjoyable. However, the amount of time you have to pour into this game to be able to really enjoy it is suffocating. Most endgame players are pay to win, and don't spend more than 15 minutes on this game a day. With genshin, you either have to pay with money, or with time. A perfect example of this is a free weapon in game called 'The Catch.' It's the best F2P weapon in the game, and it takes hours to get. Obtaining the Catch is boring, and most would much rather just spend money for a better Pay to Win weapon, Engulfing Lightning. You could, of course, get the Engulfing by grinding, but that would most likely take months to get enough in game currency to get it.

Overall, I enjoy this game, I enjoy the grind for better kits for your characters, and the grind to get more characters. But it can be insufferable to farm for hours on end daily.
title: An F2P Endgame Player

review:
I love this game and almost everything about it. I wanted to address an issue I‚Äôve been having regarding the game crashing every time I try to play on my phone. Usually I play on ps4 but a lot of the time it is occupied by other family members. I‚Äôve been playing mostly on mobile for months and never had any issues until recently. Every time I log in to the game, in less than about 3 minutes the game crashes. I‚Äôve never had this problem before but at the same time my phone could also be the issue. 

Another thing lots of other players and myself ask for is a higher resin cap and more primogems. My expectations for this happening, however, are low. Also please buff Amber she deserves it. 

Overall though I love this game as well as many players and hope to see many great updates in the future as I am very excited for version 2.4.
title: I want to address this

review: I had a lot of fun playing genshin, and it‚Äôs been a wild ride, but following the latest update I can‚Äôt bring myself to play without feeling mocked in a way. I‚Äôm Afghan, and seeing the total exclusion of people of color in Sumeru honestly hit a little too close to home for me. Upon playing the game I was so surprised to see characters with names like Farod‚Äînames I‚Äôve grown up around‚Äîhaphazardly stitched onto pale skinned characters with European features. I‚Äôm honestly baffled‚Äîthey clearly put so much research into North African and Middle-Eastern culture, but intentionally cherry picked on the most important part of any culture: the PEOPLE. It honestly feels like the company is saying, ‚ÄúWe like your funny clothes and food, but we don‚Äôt want YOU.‚Äù Die-hard fans will sling insults and complain that ‚Äúit‚Äôs not about race‚Äù‚Äîbut they were singing a different tune in defense of Yunjin‚Äôs character during previous updates. I am upset because I really like the game, but I‚Äôm not going to continue to pool my time into something that clearly doesn‚Äôt want to see people like me in this world. :(

review: I love Genshin Impact, but I‚Äôm gonna be real. They don‚Äôt really listen to the players reviews at all. Only major problems like character lags are really addressed. The game does force you to do things as well and it bombards you with quests. The wishing system had left me completely unsatisfied. Especially with 50/50. The game is over all a great game though. Graphics and the stories are amazing and intriguing. And it makes me want to continue. The quests are amazing and nicely put together. But some like Dream Nursery is just way too long. review: The game is great. It‚Äôs one of the best open world mmorpg that is available on mobile. The voice is great, the character designs and other stuffs are all great and I enjoy playing it. However when I was trying this out on mobile, it took around 7gb and it‚Äôs understandable but once I logged in the rendering distance was around 5 yards and the background is just black. When you see a special affect like getting wet or catching on fire, there would be this lighting affect that‚Äôs really bright and will probably make you look away. The cutscenes are laggy. Also when your fighting Storm Terror for the first time, you‚Äôll be blind so it‚Äôs hard to kill it when you can‚Äôt see. If you managed to scare him away then the whole game will just turn black like when your fighting the dragon and you won‚Äôt be able to see anything backgrounds or anything. review:
I started playing Genshin Impact maybe a month after 1.0 was just released. I instantly fell in love with the game. In my personal opinion, this game is 10/10. Not many characters were out during this time, and not many quests were available, but i still enjoyed it. The graphics of this game are good. I cant say incredibly amazing, but i will say that its definitely on the better side of graphics. From the small little gestures of characters to the interesting lore, it all just pulls you in. 

I have stopped playing this game for about 2 years now, but from time to time, i will redownload just to get the same feeling i did when i had first joined. This is definitely one of the most interesting ( in a good way) games i have ever played, and i am glad i had taken notice of its release and downloaded it.

Once I like something I usually like it for a very long time so I do know for sure that nothing will get me to drop this game, but that doesnt negate the issues we do face. small things like design choices to animation lagging, tons of bugs, too much space and not a lot of things to optimize their storage issues. review: This game is still beautiful and full of amazing stories. However your met by a huge lack in diversity. Everyone is the same skin tones even when they‚Äôre from across the map. I guess there‚Äôs 3 in total (kaya and xingxling) but seriously where‚Äôs the diversity?! It‚Äôs hard for me to even immerse myself in hearing a story when every character in sumeru should of been mixed tones but nah everyone looks like they are all from the same place. Every single npc and character look the exact same, on top of the lack of diversity there‚Äôs just all the other crap they‚Äôve left behind. Where‚Äôs the pvp, the co op things, there‚Äôs just nothing to do with my friends making the game and characters boring. I hardly play now that tower of fantasy is out. title: It‚Äôs just not 5 stars anymore

review: As a lover of RPGs, I‚Äôve always searched for one that fits all the needs I have and expectations. Interesting story, good battle mechanics, cool characters and a small bit of sandbox playing. Genshin hits all the marks! The story isn‚Äôt the whole game which allows you to just run around and battle if you don‚Äôt feel like doing the next quest yet. I enjoy the battle mechanics of switching characters and building damages. And the way you build characters actually makes you have to think about what you‚Äôre doing. Speaking of characters, their design is cool and I enjoy most of them, I will say, it is aimed at a specific audience, so the female characters outfits and designs are a little too waifiu for me. And the sandbox playing, once you get far enough, you get a home you can customize and take care of! Genshin is a good game, with a few issues, but overall enjoyable and exciting.
title: Pretty good, do recommend!

review: I want to begin by saying, this is one of the best games you can play on a mobile device and it is Cross play compatible. That makes it very unique and opens it up to a lot of potential that unfortunately I don‚Äôt see it living up to. At the beginning this game is FUN and a lot of it. Here‚Äôs the downside: once you spend your hard earned money to get the dream build and grind your heart away to get the perfect artifacts for your characters you will have NOTHING TO DO. The combat in the game is literally perfect, but the co-op experience leaves much to be desired and mihoyo doesn‚Äôt seem to have any intention of improving the endgame experience. I appreciate so much about this game, but find myself picking up different titles more and more. Each update I come back hoping that something fresh will be brought to the game, but silly, limited time games that have little to nothing to do with your characters are not it for me.

Personally, I think it‚Äôs really fun to grind for characters and strategize how to use your resin on certain days. There‚Äôs also so much lore to look forward to! review: This game baits you into their world of beautiful artwork and great adventure. BUT you have to spend a lot of money to get 5 star characters and the best weapons to go with that character. They bait you on wishing for characters that don‚Äôt mean anything in the endgame. The endgame for this game is abysmal. There is nothing to do besides daily adventures and they‚Äôre a chore. The company is stingy with their rewards that they give to players, when other companies easily give out 90 wishes to each player. It is terrible how greedy the company is to their player base. Mihoyo is now quickly losing their player base because of their 1 year anniversary rewards. After 1 year of playing, they only give 10 wishes. 10. That‚Äôll get you if you high roll on the .5% chance a 5 star, but if you‚Äôre the majority of the player base you‚Äôll get a really trash 4 star. It‚Äôs terrible how greedy a company can be with this game, and how they give no content or wishes to their player base. It‚Äôs terrible and the company needs to see what they are doing to their player base because they are driving them out.
title: Bait

review: I have been playing this game on and off since October 3, 2020.  At the beginning, problems existed, but I was sure they would be addressed in future updates.  One year later, and there hasn‚Äôt really been anything.  This game has amazing combat, but no reason to fight.  It has a good story, until it stops being good.  The gear progression is great, but it‚Äôs locked behind an ‚Äòenergy bar‚Äô called resin which limits the rewards you get (unless you pay freemium currency).  And speaking of paying the developers, if you do buy the premium currency, you hardly get anything.  I can‚Äôt remember exactly what the number is, but to guarantee getting the character you want, you need to pay well over $100.  And each character has 6 ‚Äòconstellations‚Äô that increase their power, requiring you to obtain that character 7 times total to unlock their full power.  I‚Äôve seen people pay $1,000 and still have constellations left to unlock on a featured character.  You will enjoy the game playing it casually at first, but prepare to ditch it later.
title: I wish I could rate this higher

review: I have never played anything marvelous as Genshin Impact. I wanted some calm, relaxing game yet thrilling and adventurous, it may take a lot of my storage, but it‚Äôs worth it. Every character is unique and I never get bored of playing it. The real big problem is, it crashes too often. At first I didn‚Äôt really care, because I can alwa just go back and continue, but as time goes, it‚Äôs starting to crash me out even more. For example, let‚Äôs say I played the game for 5 or more minutes, but if I touch Paimon or Character Button (upper right corner) it glitches then immediately crashes me out. I was in love with this game so I just thought it was fine, but things are getting a little too annoying for me.. Although the game is amazing, if you read this, please fix it for me. Thank you, developers.
title: Excellent but a few problems

review: First off I have to say I love the game and I can‚Äôt take one flaw and rate it poorly, but if you can‚Äôt play multiplayer without completing quests you should be able to drop them and this is optimized by the Trials of Tianqiu. Can you please make it possible to quit quests or at least make it so you can still play multilayer without completing them because me and my friend were very excited to play this together and so far we‚Äôve waited 2 days after reaching adventure lvl. 16 and I still can‚Äôt finish my side quests.
title: Trials of Tianqiu

review: I never write reviews, but this game just deserves one. Genshin Impact is an extraordinary game. I‚Äôve always wanted to play a game like this, but I never had a laptop or computer to play with. Thus, I used my iPad to play this. Because it‚Äôs not compatible with my device, the gameplay is rather poor, but do-able. My iPad is a generation 5, and overall in good condition. It has 128 GB, and the game (so far) took up 12 GB. The worst thing that happens is that I crash every time I go into my characters, parties, and sometimes cutscenes. The cutscenes buffer and glitch out, but to fix this is simple: go into your tabs window by either swiping up or double-clicking your home button, depending on your device, (where it shows all your open apps) and then click back into the Genshin Impact tab. Do this every time you buffer or glitch out. It‚Äôs rather annoying though, how I have to always long back into the game and load it up every time I crash. But, it‚Äôs bearable. I hope I get a better device soon so that I can enjoy this game better. Great job, MiHoYo!
title: Better than Expected!

review: Sure, the game is indeed fun but once you hit AR30 you‚Äôll come to a realization that the resin system is poorly implemented and doesn‚Äôt even compare to other gacha stamina-like systems. You have to waste more money just to achieve your weekly battle pass objective. The drop rate on the characters you want are lower than any other gacha game I have played and funny enough the pity system only kicks in after 90pulls which is about $200 and you don‚Äôt even obtain your 5-star character you want but a 5-star Weapon instead. They aren‚Äôt even going to do anything till people have complained enough about their bad practices, even the Chinese community have rated this game a 4.7/10, so that should tell you something since the game is created by a Chinese Company. Either way, they aren‚Äôt going to release any updates till Nov 11, so a month of being in a pathetic state till they maybe fix the game. I suggest you stay away from the game for a few major updates and then come back to play it and hopefully the game is in a better state.
