I went back to the area where I installed it and I saw in the description that it‚Äôs recommended to use an iPhone 8 Plus or later so I practically can‚Äôt play this game. Oh well.
title: Why does this app do this to me?!

review: It‚Äôs an amazing game, really, I‚Äôve honestly gotten addicted to it, (Also Yelan is my everything) although earlier today when I was doing a quest there was this one bug I came across, basically everybody keeps referring to my MC as a ‚Äúhe‚Äù although I picked the female MC. They‚Äôve done this many times, like when they mention the MC‚Äôs lost sibling and use ‚Äúsister‚Äù although my MC‚Äôs sibling is a male. It‚Äôs beginning to annoy me somehow. It just gives me some sort of discomfort, please fix this. Also, as I mentioned Yelan earlier in this review, I also hope you can make an Act II to her story quest (Umbrabilis Orchis) reflecting a lot more on her past, Act I was a bit disappointing, I wanted to know more about her, not just about her work and such. I also hope you can make a hangout for her too. I get that her character revolves around being all mysterious, but I really want to know more about her.
title: Wrong pronouns and labels

review: In the beginning of the game the world feels so rich and inviting, with Mondstadt being your first place to explore its not hard to fall in love with the game. But as you level up and fight and explore the world of Teyvat, trying the new characters you get along the way requires more time. By time I mean hours grinding for artifacts, level up books, level up materials, and getting a weapon that actually works on the character. I still play the game and have fun, but not being able to deal damage like higher level players can be daunting, especially if your self-conscious about not being good at something like me. If you don‚Äôt mind having to waste away at the repetitive grind, then play the game. But if getting 7 defense top stat and perfect bottom stats annoys you then maybe this isn‚Äôt the game for you. But I personally believe that when you start playing this game, you will find something fun to do.
title: My honest opinion on Genshin Impact

review: I see so many people unfairly rating this game because it takes up too much storage or just doesn‚Äôt work on their device. This game does take up around 20 gigabytes, but it is a big game. You should not expect to play this game if your storage is gone or you have an old device that cannot support it. Aside from that, the game is great, with plenty of cool updates that reward you so you don‚Äôt get bored. All though there are in app purchases, you can do pretty much everything in the game without them. A lot of people are complaining about the diversity of the game, however Hoyoverse is a Chinese company, without as many types of skin tones. They do have characters that are black, or have darker shades of skin, but they are also trying their best, as characters have to fit in with the story.
title: storage?

review: As someone who had been wanting to play Genshin for a while, I was really excited when I finally had enough storage for it. (I would‚Äôve had enough if I didn‚Äôt have Project Sekai, also recommend playing that <3) but past that, it was worth a year+ waiting. As someone who is still somewhat new to the game, (AR25 as of writing this) I‚Äôve found the story line pure perfection. I‚Äôm not going to spoil anything but the archon/world quests are great with sometimes plot twists. The map is so detailed, and I‚Äôm very impressed this is free. There is also many characters to play, my favorite duo is Layla and Barbara if you‚Äôre curious. (to use on my team) I‚Äôve also met nice people on there in co-op. I would recommend getting genshin if you have the storage to, its completely worth your time and storage <33
title: Absolutely would recommend you play it <33

review: Reaching AR57 and sinking multiple hundreds of hours across 1 year, this game's engaging gameplay and combat is unparalleled for me. The thing is, the developers have no desire to reward long time players. With no drive to add an endgame, any player who wants to build the strongest characters or wanting to pull on Gacha is completely worthless now. There is no point to try to improve if you can already clear the Spiral Abyss and its super disappointing. I will always suggest players to try out the game because it really is one of the best games I've played, ever. Just pull for characters that you like, thats it. You don't need to have the strongest team cause its not necessary which is very upsetting. I wish they cared more about the game's long-term health. If you like story, you will find a LOT of it in this game, where it is the priority over everything else in the game. Combined with limited-time events, this game pushes a lot of FOMO for players. Beware before you start this game, do NOT get too attached cause the Hoyoverse devs do not care.
title: Hoyoverse, you have something great, don't kill it

review: I like the game a lot. The play style is really fun and smooth, the tutorials make sense, the storyline is really cool, the characters are awesome, etc. The thing I don‚Äôt like is how the events work and how much time you really have to put into it to uncover the storylines. Each day it kinda pressures you to do all these tasks and complete all these events in a short amount of time and unless you want to spend hours playing it it‚Äôs hard to do. Some people like playing video games for hours. I‚Äôm not one of them. It‚Äôs still fun to play but hard to really get into if you‚Äôre busy. And I wish the gacha system was better. More frequent reruns and no 50/50 would be a big improvement. I don‚Äôt really want to compare it to honkai impact 3rd but I do wish it was more like honkai‚Äôs gacha system. Still fun though. If you don‚Äôt wanna spend money you‚Äôll still have a really great time.
title: Overall good‚Ä¶

review: The game looks great and handles pretty well but there is something weird that I just can‚Äôt find anything out about.... whenever I start playing there is a dark, massive void bubble around my character.... it‚Äôs almost like a dome that‚Äôs about 5-10 feet (10-20 if you count both sides) and about 15-20 feet up. I don‚Äôt really know if this is some sort of setting or maybe a glitch but it really hinders the open world feel of the game since I can‚Äôt seem to say any of the world, plus the water also is a void where there would be water there is just dark nothingness, if anyone knows anything on how to fix this it would mean the world to me since it takes so much of the fun away. Just to recap there is a bubble about 10-20 feet across and 15-20 feet up that blocks out all of that you can see plus the waters a void so please tell me how to fix it, thanks
title: The void... I need help with it....

review:
Your first 10-20 hours of this game will be really enjoyable. It‚Äôs challenging at parts, but satisfying to overcome. It‚Äôs beautiful to play and you‚Äôll be hooked.

BUT once you hit AR 30, you‚Äôll want to break something. 

I like hard games, Dark Souls, Hollow Knight, blah blah blah I think they‚Äôre fulfilling. But you will see that some boss battles are designed so poorly that you will actually dread playing. There‚Äôs no satisfaction when you‚Äôre done. Just exhaustion. And yes I‚Äôm mostly talking about OCEANID.

Go ahead and fight every other boss. And then fight Oceanid. You‚Äôll see what I mean. Trying to ascend your hydro characters will literally ruin your day lol

There‚Äôs no other explanation for this super long and drawn out battle full of unavoidable damage, unskippable boss monologue, and unhittable enemies except for really poor design. At the very least, shouldn‚Äôt this kind of ridiculous battle be end-game related? Not something you do as your everyday grind?

Ugh. Obviously I just got done fighting them. Oceanid rant aside, co-op and World Rank are also busted. If you rank up too quickly early on, the bosses will be too strong before you can even ascend your characters. You will be stuck. The game becomes actually impossible. You‚Äôll have to join other people‚Äôs worlds or be carried to get anywhere again.

So many things go beyond challenge and straight into bad design.
title: For the love of god, please fix unbalanced fights and co-op

review: This game is one of the best games out there especially for mobile. The graphics are great even on an iPad. It keeps you intrigued with all the stories you could do. And overall, the gacha system is one of the best qualities of the game. It keeps you hooked and gives you a sense of fun to see which character you could get. The people who cry over not getting the character they want should expect that. Giving the game a bad rating just because you didn‚Äôt the character you wanted is so immature. The plot of the game is also good too. How you have the ability to choose which twin to use is fun. One thing I would like to see is being able to see what you‚Äôre typing on mobile. I can‚Äôt wait to see more regions be introduced and for us to slowly be able to get closer to the end of the story.
title: Lovely Game.

review:
Since I‚Äôve played a bit more I can give a more earnest review. The dialogue needs a lot of work. When you select a pre-printed response the auto response doesn‚Äôt match what was selected. When going on adventures it says to look around but nothing will be present when I leave and do something else and return then there sometimes is the objective I was searching for. This may be a glitch. Only pet peeve is the dialogue, please be sure to review and ensure the auto response matches the pre set options. Also why does the little fairy assistant talk for the main character. If I, the main character, have my own voice (as seen in the voiceover section) then why not input that voice into the gameplay? 

Out of all the games out for mobile players this is by far the best. It lags however early and just for a second. So far the gaming is smooth, everything look great and I can definitely get lost it in. The story line is entertaining and the scenery is breathtaking:)
title: So far I‚Äôm in love

review:
This is a well made game. It runs smooth on my iPhone se2020.  The environments are rich eye candy, making exploration the most fun part of the game. 

The story is pretty nice, but it is easy to lose focus due to the bordered sandbox style of the game, yet it is easy to get back on track with the menu of quests and the ability to have navigation to lead you to the right point. Fights are not boring, but gets a bit reputations. . .yet the game doesn‚Äôt revolve around fighting all the time and there is a ton of others things in the game to keep it feeling fresh.  

Regarding gotcha. . .I have never spent money on this and never will. I am pretty satisfied with what I have and still have fun! Some of the fights are a bit harder due to not having a plethora of five star everything, but with some patience and ingenuity, you can do what you need to advance in the game.
title: Fun game. Can be free. Rich experience!

review:
Hello, 

I think the game is amazing but for me I personally felt that the coop function was lacking. I had joined with another friend and thought we would be able to explore together but it seems that the exploration depending on who‚Äôs leader really only benefits one person when it comes to chests, waypoints and even statues. I can‚Äôt investigate anything on my friends map nor can I help with the specters or tasks, which I did not think would happen. Another friend of mine had explained the devs made it this way so people couldn‚Äôt loot resources on other peoples maps which makes sense! However is there a way you can add a function that allows people to do these things (quests and chests, waypoints or even statues) depending on relationship points? >.< might not be possible and might be asking too much but asides from the coop function I really enjoy everything else there is!
title: Coop >.<

review: I have to say... this game is absolutely gorgeous. Everything about it is extremely eye pleasing. I was looking for a game like this for ages, and I‚Äôm so glad I managed to come across it before servers launched. There have been minor glitches I‚Äôve experienced, but nothing that effected the quality of the game in any way. I do have a question though...or more of a suggestion. I keep receiving Tons of Mora coins as rewards and such, but I can‚Äôt find anything to spend it on? This could just be because I haven‚Äôt gotten as far as others in the game, but nevertheless it would be cool to be able to do more with them. Otherwise, this game has far exceeded my expectations! Particularly in the lore and character design (I have to say, Venti, Noelle, and the main character are by far my favs in terms of design!) I cant wait to see what‚Äôs in store!
title: Breathtaking

review: It‚Äôs easy to see why this is the second most popular game right now. It‚Äôs like Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Attack on Titan clashed. Open, inspired, breathtaking world. Astounding voice acting. Characters that are actually like-able. Storyline that keeps you immersed. The list goes on. The true achievement of this game is the fact that it‚Äôs on mobile. If I wouldn‚Äôt have played it myself I wouldn‚Äôt have thought it were possible. Yes it takes up a lot of space, yes it‚Äôs not worth downloading unless you have a newer generation phone that can handle it, and yes I‚Äôm sure some people will complain that it‚Äôs not an MMO. But if you‚Äôre a fan of the RPG genre with a ton of exploration, collectibles, crafting, lore, etc. this game is a must download. 6 hours in and I can wholeheartedly say that it‚Äôs a masterpiece. Thank you developers for giving us this crowing achievement in mobile gaming.
title: Lives up to its name.

review: My friends and I have been playing this game non stop, I first only downloaded it on my iPhone 8+ not knowing I could also download it on my pc. Since then I‚Äôve been grinding away trying to reach rank 16 to play with my buddies. I‚Äôve had 0 issues with this game and it runs so smoothly on my phone although it does have a tendency to make my phone pretty hot. My friend had some complications on his pc but that‚Äôs another issue we have. For IOS it runs beautifully and the game itself is beautiful. The music, the characters, the cinematics, and the gameplay are all so well thought out. I never thought I could play a game of this caliber on my mobile device, I‚Äôm excited to see what else is in store for mobile gaming. Kudos to the creators! I‚Äôm in love! I‚Äôve been getting all of my friends to download the game, I can‚Äôt wait till we all reach level 16!
title: You need to download this game!

review:
This game is still superb after this time and its a free to play monster! Play on my phone at work and on my ps5 at home. My only distaste for the function of this game is the lack of things to do while in coop. Theres really just bosses, exploration, and the card game to mess around in. And the teapot. There should be epic weekly quests to do or long raid fights. Domains are easy when you coordinate with your party. I love playing support roles in groups and my team and I just mash through domains. 

Id like too see a dungeon system in Genshin, with mini bosses and then the final boss. Story attached to each dungeon giving us a reason to be there. Even better if you guys can man each players individual character converse and talk among eachother in said dungeons scenes. And more teapot content, raise the rank from 10 and increase capacity please!!
title: Fontaine is Here

review: I‚Äôve been playing genshin forever and I‚Äôve loved every second of it. I love the characters and all the little technical aspects but the only thing I hate is the lack of primos üò≠ my account is ar 56. I‚Äôve done every quest there is to do most my areas are at 100% exploration or at least in the 90s and aside from character trials and events and daily commissions it‚Äôs hard to get a lotta primos or find something really fun to do but I love when events come out and there‚Äôs new stuff I just wish I had more I could do beside raise characters right now but still I love this game and there‚Äôs nothing that could make me stop loving it. I‚Äôve played for so long and lookin back on how I used to play or thought was good is so much fun. I‚Äôve gotten so many of my friends into genshin and it‚Äôs more fun then ever helping them and showing off lol!!
title: Love it

review: I love genshin a lot and overall is a very good game though a few days ago I was logged out of my account I‚Äôve been trying to login since to because I was very excited to play with the new characters it kept saying that my login was wrong even though I had checked and everything had been correct I‚Äôve been playing genshin almost ever since it was realesed I‚Äôve spent money multiple times on my account on genshin so it is a huge inconvenience to not be able to play especially since I‚Äôve gave money I gave money to play not to get logged out of my account now it won‚Äôt even try to let me login to my account it is forcing me to make a whole new one I spent a really long time to get the characters I have and the level I‚Äôm at if I don‚Äôt get my account back I would like to have my money refunded and I hope that this glitch can get fixed I would really love to continue playing genshin impact.
title: Logged out of my account

review: I‚Äôve played for about a year and I have loved almost every minute of playing, but I‚Äôm losing interest. I feel like this game is becoming a chore and that is something that needs to be changed. The change could be as simple as fixing the resin cap to making more enjoyable puzzles. Sadly, my real issue with Genshin is the storage that it takes up. I know it says 3.5 gb, but with all the other updates and things needed to download such as voice lines it can be at least 20gb. I will say I also have only 64gb on my phone and I can only play mobile which is making it increasingly harder to play. I‚Äôm worried for all those will stop playing because of the new Sumeru update with the predictions of how much gbs that might be. I love playing this game even though I have had burn outs from playing. I want to continue, but with this storage issue I think my time is coming to an end pretty soon. Hoyoverse, please optimize the game or compact the game because I don‚Äôt know how we can continue at this pace.
title: I‚Äôm having trouble loving this game still

review: Genshin Impact is an amazing game, for sure. There are tons of incessantly entertaining quests (which are very interesting, also), beautiful graphics, amazing characters, and not to mention an incredibly interesting fandom that‚Äôll never cease to be creative. I started playing after my friend discovered it, and somewhat reluctantly opened the app. I was immediately dazzled at the graphics, dialogue, and easy gameplay. As time went on, my interest peaked. I‚Äôve never really liked video games, as I‚Äôve always seen them as repetitive and boring, but after Genshin Impact, I now like one video game! A true accomplishment! Anyways, the system in which you obtain supplies is somewhat questionable, up to luck and how much in game currency you pay. But the pros outweigh the cons by about 10,000 tons, so be sure to get it!
title: How is this game Ad free and costs no money?

review: I just started playing this a few days ago and it‚Äôs become one of my absolute favorites. The details of the storyline, the graphics, the phenominal voice acting, the beautiful chracter designs (Amber‚Äôs got to be my favorite), everything was well made and overall amazing. However, there are problems with it crashing and lagging. When I first opened the game and it was the first opening cutscene, I had to restart my Ipad four times because it kept lagging and froze to the point where it crashed. I also noticed that I could only play the game for roughly 20 minutes, and then the game crashes. It happens all the time, and I hope you guys can fix this issue. This is one of the best games I have ever played, and it would be even better if you could fix the crashing/lagging issue as soon as possible so I, and many other players, can get the full experience without interruptions! Amazing game :)
title: LOVE THIS GAME! However...

review: Honestly this game has been a good game to play to take up free time. It‚Äôs well animated and the attention to detail is really nice for a free game. Yes you can spend money and get all the characters you ever wanted and build them up but honestly the game gives you a lot of free wishes and chances to get your favorite characters for free. The story has been amazing so far and I‚Äôm really excited to see how much it branches out in the next few updates. I actually wish they would slow down on the new character introductions because I want to get to know they ones all ready out more. But it‚Äôs always nice to see the next big fun character they make. This has been one of the few games that has managed to keep my attention and not be deleted off my phone. I really think you should give it a shot.
title: Best use of free time

review: Let me start off by saying I‚Äôve been playing Genshin since launch day. It‚Äôs one of my favorite games. The world building is fantastic, the characters are interesting and lovable, and the gameplay is fun and challenging enough to keep you interested. However, the game has a ton of issues. Once you reach the later game stages, the gameplay stagnates. There isn‚Äôt much for returning players to do and daily quests/rewards don‚Äôt scale with your level. The game is built to give you just enough rewards to keep you playing, but never to help you succeed. Five stars are almost guaranteed to be locked behind paywalls when you reach the late game. On top of all this- and the reason I‚Äôm writing this review- is the fact that Genshin and Mihoyo give basically zero rewards to players. I‚Äôve earned more from maintenance rewards than I have from the first year anniversary event. Genshin makes billions of dollars and gives their players next to nothing to encourage them to spend more money on gambling. I honestly can‚Äôt in good faith recommend this game to new players anymore.
title: Cash Grab Gacha

review:
do i like genshin? yeah, it‚Äôs a great time passer. i‚Äôve been playing since childe‚Äôs first banner, and have enjoyed it so far. however, the game isn‚Äôt exactly f2p friendly, and the game pretty much baits you into spending money. yes it‚Äôs f2p, but only if you want it to be. however, not all characters you own are guaranteed to be the greatest.

however, if i do see any specific flaws with genshin, it‚Äôs would probably be it‚Äôs repetitive writing. all female characters are very similar, being overworked individuals with little time to themselves. the male characters aren‚Äôt much better, but with recent additions of arataki itto, im starting to get my hopes up a bit more. however, with the story behind shenhe‚Ä¶i don‚Äôt have much hope. yun jin seems pretty cool, though! 

the first two nations of mondstat and liyue are pretty neat, and have a good plot surrounding them. however, when we get to inazuma‚Ä¶the writing is‚Ä¶lacking. the plot line was predictable and it didn‚Äôt have many major twists, even after that‚Ä¶the main villain (the raiden shogun) was dumbed down to a dango milk loving innocent woman‚Ä¶seriously? she lead hundreds if not thousands to their deaths, and even killed off signora. i understand that the goal is to meet the seven to find your lost twin, however, inazuma had so much more potential in villains AND characters. 

anyways #liyuestayswinning
title: yeah

review:
I was recommended this game by a sweet boy over at GameStop when I was trying to figure out if I should try and purchase a PlayStation (EVENTUALLY).. 
Me; a current iPad user who is fully taking advantage of this beautiful game... and I am consistently speechless. 
Even though I was concerned about not being able to efficiently play the game without an controller. Genshin really did amazing with allowing me to be successful while using the controls via iPad (touchscreen).  
I could not wait to play this game and I am just ultimately shocked with the performance and easy utilization of playing cross platform with touch controls.
Although I feel that using a handheld device may be more difficult to navigate basic foundations of the game (locating quests, using combos, dealing with a small screen). The game is truly converted to a form that makes me.... speechless.
Mihoyo and the team did a beautiful, outstanding job with the cross platform diversity and conversion to held held.
I hope I‚Äôll be able to see this beautiful game on large screen one day...
And keep in mind, they the adventurers run slower so you can see the detail and beauty of the game. 

iPad 5.
Rare lag (only when there is a change in Lands).
Make sure to update. 
Make sure to close all apps before playing.
title: Speechless... (iPad Platform)

review: When I got the game and read the reviews, it didn‚Äôt seem all that bad, however: I have had to delete more then eleven games/apps off my phone to reduce, not eliminate, the severe lag in imagery and audio. Although the game animations are very well established, it‚Äôs not worth it. It took up so much room in my phone my contacts had to be deleted and my group chats wouldn‚Äôt work. The last straw for me was when I found out my camera and my flashlight didn‚Äôt turn on. Immediately, I deleted the game and wrote a review. Now, I must retrieve all my contacts, apps, chats, etc. It‚Äôs not an online roleplay game, at least, that‚Äôs what I thought I was getting. I only had the app for a few hours so I‚Äôm not sure if you can invite people to your game. Also, though the character art is beautiful, you can only access two characters per gender. It‚Äôd be much more profitable to make custom avatars so people can have the option to complete tasks and roleplay at the same time. Most importantly, please rid of the lag. It is absolutely unnecessary to sacrifice so much for a silly game that‚Äôs not even the slightest addicting.
title: Why??

review: Okay, me personally, I love this game. I‚Äôm OBSESSED. The characters are amazing, the gameplay is smooth, even with bad internet, the game runs pretty well. I love the lore, the character designs, and it‚Äôs honestly the best game I‚Äôve ever stumbled upon. However, I do have one reoccurring issue, thought it‚Äôs very nitpicky, it‚Äôs the events. Now, I love the events, but, the game cramps important lore in limited time events that, after the event ends, is not acquirable anymore. As a lore player this really ticks me off. There are also some things I wish would‚Äôve been done differently, like how I wish you could view event cutscenes/ special art inside the game, but again, very nitpicky. Overall very fun game 10/10 would recommend. (Hoyo please let me pet the dogs pls pls pls pls pls I‚Äôll literally pay you to make that a feature pls)
title: There is no better game tbh

review: I‚Äôve been a fan of Hoyoverse ever since the release of Honkai Impact 3rd, and Genshin Impact exceeds beyond my expectations. The visuals are breathtaking and the game is paired up with a beautiful soundtrack corresponding to the region you are in. Every character‚Äôs personality is shown through their gameplay and attacks, which I find unique. Note that it does take a lot of storage. After all, Genshin Impact is made to be an open-world experience, so it‚Äôs no wonder why it‚Äôs not best supported on mobile. However, the twitter community that lurks in the Genshin community will never fail to amuse me, as they trip over the tiniest things. Most of the one star reviews are coming from toxic people who are salty from not understanding basic RPG mechanics. Please consider trying out Genshin Impact! Novice Traveller, beware of the hidden monsters and prepare to decease them all!
title: Amazing job, Hoyoverse!

review:
I can‚Äôt get to the part where the game actually starts and it‚Äôs been a long time. 

I spent a long time in Wi-Fi down loading and once I had set up my account I spent more time than that downloading. The game said it was all ready to go so I left Wi-Fi because I had spent a long time there downloading. I‚Äôm on a cellular net work and there‚Äôs no reason it shouldn‚Äôt work on my iPhone 11, current software.

 But then my first downloads on Wi-Fi amounted to over 3 GB. There was no notice that I was going to have over 11 GB more to be downloaded. If I had seen that there were almost 15 GB of data to be downloaded I would‚Äôve chosen not to spend all of that time download it when I could‚Äôve been spending it doing something else. So I just deleted the game without even trying yet after looking at some gorgeous graphics and great reviews because I‚Äôm not actually able to get the game to run without shutting down and starting the download again (The app is stuck on the download because my machine doesn‚Äôt want to download 11+ gigabytes over cellular).

 So I don‚Äôt know this might be some really amazing stuff but it‚Äôs obviously not designed to be easy to start up on mobile platform for iPhone. 
If I had high-speed Wi-Fi Internet where I live this might be a completely different situation. I may decide to try the download thing some other time on Wi-Fi when I can just let my phone sit for that long and not actually be doing something like updating its iOS. Or not‚Ä¶
title: How to rate not playable?

review: I love this game from the amazing storyline to the excitement I get while playing. I love that I can co-op with others and make friends and help people do stuff like commissions and other quests, I have met probably one of the best friends I‚Äôll ever make on this game. I also adore the graphics and the absolute beauty in the sort of mystical world I get into whenever I play this game. Sometimes when it‚Äôs late and but I can‚Äôt fall asleep I‚Äôll go on genshin and explore the mountains to sort of calm down and get ready for bed, normally near jueyun karst or somewhere in inazuma, but the point is that just playing the game, even if it‚Äôs not for fighting or getting exp, it still seems to have a positive affect on me and many others. I highly recommend this genshin impact, once you start really playing the game you‚Äôll never want to stop.
title: I‚Äôm truly amazed.

review: The game is really good, I know many players are just giving it 1 star rn because of the anniversary rewards. Honestly what happened was that many fans(from what I have seen) got really greedy over the anniversary rewards and expected way too much. Sure I admit, I was a little down about not getting primos but you still get free wishes, which is still really good. Some fans have also taken it too far recently by harassing the VAs and blaming them for everything(which I find stupid because they are there to voice characters not make decisions for events). The game is really great and the story is really good too! The main problem is that many of the fans are children or act like children so they get upset when something does not go their way. Great game mihoyo keep up the good work!
title: The Game is Great Fans are overreacting

review: The games event giveaways have gotten worse over the time I have played, and even the feedback I and others in the community continuously give has been ignored. The artifact farming is bad, the weapon banner is a HUGE money grab (more than other aspects of the game), and the cost of primogems is crazy expensive. Even though the players have spent millions of dollars on this game over its first year, to celebrate, Genshin decided to give away less than what you can get for first downloading the game. In addition, they had raffles for players who were willing to work for them by drawing artwork or making videos promoting their game. Other gacha style games give their fan bases a ton of free stuff on anniversaries, but Genshin out here turning their gamers into free work mules for our rewards. It seems that Genshin is caring less about the gamers the bigger they get. They issued a statement saying they would ‚Äúdo better‚Äù in the future, and if they do I may raise their rating. For now, I give it a one star. Let‚Äôs see if they keep their word.
title: Doesn‚Äôt Appreciate it‚Äôs community of gamers

review: I honestly can‚Äôt get enough of this game! This is my first time playing a gacha game, and because of this game I haven‚Äôt really played any other because of how much time I spend on this one. I even have Genshin on my PC and iPad just in case I‚Äôm on the go. There is so much Genshin Impact has to offer and eventually if you get caught up, more updates will come to give to the players! The view and graphics are gorgeous and fits perfectly with the soundtrack, which is also incredibly pretty! And the fascinating details on each characters and cinematic scenes gives it a whole unique aspect. I could go on to share my love for this game, but that‚Äôs all I have to say about it at this moment. And well since this game is still coming out with so much more updates, I can‚Äôt wait to see what Mihoyo has to offer :) ‚ô°
title: Favorite Game Right Now!

review: So I‚Äôve played this game since Day 1 and at the beginning there‚Äôs so much to do with a beautiful open world to explore. However, this all dies down once you hit level 50 where at this point it all just becomes a mindless grind. At first it‚Äôs tolerable but over time there just ends up being nothing to do since there‚Äôs no end game content. Couple with the fact that there‚Äôs no interaction between the community and Mihoyo and the terrible anniversary rewards, it just feels like an empty game run by a terrible company that doesn‚Äôt seem to care about its players. I keep playing the game because I‚Äôve already invested a lot of time and unfortunately money into it but really if you seem interested in playing, I‚Äôd suggest finding something else. You‚Äôll find nothing but disappointment here. The only thing that keeps me going is the waifus haha but other than that it‚Äôs best to find something else to play.
title: Great game with a lot of problems

review:
Genshin Impact is a colorful rip off of Breath of the Wild. It has a main story that lasts a few weeks. After that, you can do boring daily quests, do monthly events you can finish in 3 hours, grind for artifacts a couple of times per day that takes about 30 minutes to complete until you have no more resin. There is NOTHING to DO in this game. Once you finish the main part it‚Äôs 20 minutes a day and you‚Äôre done with everything you can possibly do. 

The characters are great, a lot of fun and interesting ways you can play them. Strong ones will take a few months of saving up free primogems to roll for them so do that WAY in advance. If you‚Äôre spending money to get the characters you want expect to pay $200 per character. It‚Äôs a very very expensive gotcha game. 90 rolls and you got yourself a five star character, maybe not the one on the banner, maybe not the one you want, maybe they‚Äôre not even useful but you can just buy more in game currency for the second round of 90 pulls and then after 180 total pulls you will definitely have the character you were going for. Weapons are different. You can spend $3000 and not get the weapon you want so don‚Äôt even try. 

Genshin Impact is a lot like Final Fantasy 14... the first verson, the one they blew up because it was garbage. And even that had MORE freaking content then this game. 

Beautiful, great characters, occasionally fun, not a damned thing to do with it.
title: Very pretty, no content

review: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, this game is amazing with each character‚Äôs unique skills to the layout of the world. Once you get to about AR 30, the game essentially turns into a waiting game.  Each day comes with 160 Resin which will fully replenish after a full 24 hours. It also comes with a daily quest reward of 60 Primogens. These Primogens are your average currency in order to pull or ‚Äúwish‚Äù characters from a randomizer. One pull is a staggering 160 Primogens.  To get a full ten wish stack, you need 1600, and after finishing all the quests, you‚Äôre only way to get continuous PG is through daily quests. It takes a full month just to get ten wishes and you may not even get anything you want. World Chests can sometimes give from 2,5, and 10 Primogens, which in the spectrum of wishes is a low offer. Mihoyo, please do something about Primogens like make the daily quest rewards larger.
title: A Waiting Game

review:
So i have a few fun games(roblox and minecraft.) but i was really looking for a fighting/adventure game that was online. My cousin introduced me to this amazing game, saying "(insert name here) your too young to play genshin." At the time, i was only nine, so i lisend to her. But i was earged to play after seeing all the cool charecters and weapons online. So soon enogh i downloaded i and started playing. I already knew what would happen at the begin with paimon, because my cousin let me play that part. It took about 30-1 hour to load the stuff in game, but i had no problem waiting. There was this one charecter, Venti, who i instantly fell in love with. The only problem was: he was taken away from the game. So the new fontaine update has made me so happy because, VENTI IS COMING BACK!-Laura H. 

P.S thank u hoyoverse for saving me from all life boredom.
title: Saved me from bodem

review: My favorite game of the year so far to be honest. I‚Äôve put a ton of hours into it. You hit a wall at adventure rank 38-40 where materials are near nonexistent and progression comes to a screeching halt. The devs create an absolutely amazing, beautiful world yet there‚Äôs no incentive to go explore when chests don‚Äôt respawn. Rewards for EVERYTHING in the game are too little. Resin required to progress and acquire gear with a super slow timer to get more. The gacha rates are some of the worst in the entire industry. Please please please increase rewards across the board and give us a reason to play the game daily for more than 10 minutes. People will stop playing even if they have the characters they‚Äôve always wanted if there‚Äôs nothing to DO with those characters. Weekly bosses shouldn‚Äôt have resin cost. Multiple active banners should be a thing. I‚Äôm holding on to hundreds of wishes because the banners only showcase new characters and forget older ones. So much love and attention went into this game yet it cripples itself at nearly every turn.
title: Incredible yet greedy game

review:
I absolutely love this game. The graphics are amazing, the story (aside from side quests) are amazing, the characters are amazing. I love this game. I started playing in 1.4 and I was addicted. I love all the regions and the unique characters with their own complex backstories. Mondstadt is so beginner friendly, liyue had such a cool story with the reawakened god, Inazuma is so beautiful as well as it‚Äôs teapot realm, Sumeru looks so cool and the story was just crazy. The whole stuck in one day thing was so cool.

(I took a 6 month break when sumeru was released) with the new region, Fontaine, I‚Äôve fallen in love with this game again. I love the swimming mechanics because they‚Äôre so smooth and the exploration underwater is just chef‚Äôs kiss. The architecture in Fontaine is really pretty too and I just love the look of it.

I can‚Äôt wait for future updates to Fontaine and the next two regions!
title: AMAZING

But representation aside Genshin has a great storyline in my opinion, there lots of stuff to do (until you hit a certain adventure tbh) the story quests have loads of detail, the lore is really good they have hangout events with characters and they have character quests as well all in all its pretty good. Another thing that could change is the fact that at like at forty there becomes little to do
title: Fun and immersive

review: Whether we‚Äôre talking about In game rewards or anniversary rewards the game gives barely to nothing. If my calculations are correct that is less than 0.10%, and on top of that, it‚Äôs only going to those with artsy talent. From what I‚Äôve noticed when genshin released they gave humongous awards such as 10 fates (wishes) but, as it started gaining more popularity the rewards seemed to take a serious downfall while in the beginning we would get 1600 primogems, now your lucky to even get 60. As more people began to realize how un-fair this is, people began to leave for other games such as cookie run kingdom, bandori, etc. Quite frankly, I don‚Äôt blame them, for all the genshin community puts into this game we at least deserve a ‚ÄúANNIVERSARY‚Äù reward that measures up.

title: VIVE LA R√âSISTANCE

review:
I love this game to bits! I can‚Äôt get enough of it..but there‚Äôs still a few issues tho:

-The monsters...Fighting monsters are entertaining but it gets annoying when the monster leaves you alone at random..then you try and fight it again and guess what? It‚Äôs entire hp is back up. This frustrated me during some quests with difficult bosses..

-The frame rate...Even with strong internet connection, it sometimes crashes due to the graphics. I thought it was my storage at first but no...If I am with many items and I am fighting many creatures and their animations and stuff, as well as fighting animation of the character, can crash the game or if I am talking to npc‚Äôs..the game can bug out before crashing. I apologize if I ramble but this was a main issue I had.

-loading time for cutscenes, areas, etc. can be a bit buggy and force me to restart my game..this too is frustrating since it can reset quests and interactions of characters..And even erase progress I have gotten..also some things don‚Äôt load completely in, example..Investigating a barrel and something pops out but it doesn‚Äôt appear at or it appears later..or it crashes the game, and cause more problems in playing.

I apologize if I am complaining..But thank you for making this wonderful gift of a game! I fell in love with it and I can‚Äôt wait to see what more it holds.

title: Extremely fun

review:
I love the game I really do but there are some complications, from the stereotypical designs to the lack of representation and not ftp friendly gets me to not fully enjoy the game experience.

Let‚Äôs start out with the little things, yae miko and a few other peoples outfits are extremely stereotypical and disrespectful to the culture. You change the outfits of the women characters to make them more acceptable for men (fan service). Next there are hardly any dark skin characters in this game, and when there are they‚Äôre extremely white washed. The ‚Äúdark skinned‚Äù aren‚Äôt even dark skinned, they‚Äôre just a minuscule amount.

Now we have come into mobile players, mobile players can hardly play your games because of how many files you need. Most of them can‚Äôt even have social media apps because of the amount of files. 

Then we have the ftp (free to play) friendly part. This game REQUIRES you to spend money if you want a good character because the pity system is hard. The pity isn‚Äôt the problem, the primos accessibility are. You would have to play for hours on end every day to even have a chance of getting a 5 star from zero pity, not to mention the chance of losing 50/50‚Äôs comes into play. It‚Äôs really inconvenient over all and I hope hoyoverse will consider fixing these issues.
title: This game is not Free to play friendly nor is it mobile friendly.

title: Remarkable

review:
I‚Äôve been completely hooked on this game since I downloaded it almost half a year ago. The art for it was just beautiful so I thought I‚Äôd see how it was. My gaming experience has always been limited to puzzle games and I have terrible hand-eye coordination so I never imagined I would have so much fun with this type of game. I love exploring the map and finding all the little extra pieces that seem like secret discoveries. They team based play has really been enjoyable as well; I like being able to combine the different elements in my attacks. The graphics and artwork are amazingly done for a free game. I really enjoy  the storyline and events as well. It keeps everything interesting. I also like that you can invest as much time in it as you want to.
All in all, I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs a 10/5 stars.

review: Ive been playing since launch and I cant lie i used to love the game, but I hate to say it but this game isn‚Äôt what you all think it is, you‚Äôve probably read from either reviews ‚Äúamazing open world!‚Äù and other things like ‚Äúf2p friendly!‚Äù its just not true.. i guess the game is enjoyable to alot of people but this game is just so repetitive.. theres not much content after 30 ar and ive gotten to 50.. theres also alot of characters back in the time for example diluc he was way more op than any other character and people just p2w their way to get it i mean f2p 100% have gotten it, but chances are slim.. the open world is cool and all but most of the time all you do is just try to get all the waypoints, wisps and all those stuff which is super time consuming and not at all entertaining. title: This games is great an all but‚Ä¶

review: The ost and the graphics of this game are absolutely amazing and breathtaking! I just wish the management let the devs take breaks from updates, since they have to crank out new stuff every month :/ The Inazuma act felt rushed with lots of plot holes, if they took their time, the story would‚Äôve been god-tier! Not to mention it‚Äôs hard for the devs to insert new characters, mobs and events every month since programming this stuff takes time! Patch 2.1 was very rushed and the events didn‚Äôt feel like an anniversary, just another old patch for the Moonchase festival. Speaking of anniversary, the rewards were a little bit underwhelming, the management could‚Äôve done better for their community! Overall, I love Genshin and I won‚Äôt stop playing it until the end. The game has so, so much potential! I just wish it could be brought out by the management more :(
title: Good rpg, bad management :(

review: I started back on April 13th, 2021 and it was definitely a fun game. You can find a ton of new enemies, and explore places you may have never seen before. It is definitely fun while you have something to do. (ex: quests) Leveling and getting materials and artifacts are definitely some of the harder parts to playing. The burnout for Genshin Impact is real, and once you reach about AR (Adventure Rank) 40-45 or so, it will start to get boring. To some, logging in to the app will only seem like a chore. To others, they may still somehow enjoy it. Or even quit. I myself quit the game on about May 21st (or 22nd) of 2023. While I will miss this game, I no longer have interest in it and fail to log in daily to do my Commissions, other Quests, the Archon quests, and more. If you intend on getting  game, just expect that after a while you may get burnt out of it.
title: Good but it can get boring

review:
As mentioned in other reviews, the gameplay loop is satisfying. The characters are well designed, aesthetically at least, (let‚Äôs not talk about how unbalanced some of them are gameplay wise) the environments and stories are fun and interesting. The latest issue comes down to the anniversary rewards. Now, of course, this is just the symptom of the overall greater problem. Another symptom is the aforementioned unbalanced nature of some premium characters, releasing in an almost unplayable state, which is honestly unacceptable for how much most have to spend to receive said characters. MiHoyo just doesn‚Äôt care about the players of their game, and the aniversary is the biggest and latest example of this. They are a giant company with no doubt endless resources, and yet they choose to waste them all on stupid things like fishing. 

In conclusion, if you haven‚Äôt played this game before please consider everything I just said. This company cares about one thing and one thing only, money, even at the cost of ripping off their players.
title: Very Good Game Ran by Horrible Company

review: When the game first came out I did not download it because of how much data it took up and because it seemed too ambitious for a free game. However I eventually downloaded it because of one of my friends and I was shocked. The game is an open-world rpg and every bit of it is beautiful. The graphics, the soundtrack, and the storyline which I‚Äôm heavily invested in because there is so much to uncover. Even though it is not complete (new regions/chapters of it have yet to be released) I have not gotten bored of it. This is because even if the main story is not complete there is lore in every aspect of the game (item descriptions, side quests, events, characters). Overall I definitely recommend you to download it or at least try it out because I‚Äôm sure you will also fall in love with it.
title: One of my favorite games

review: The moment I downloaded this game I‚Äôve been playing it non-stop. The animations is very nice, the environment is beautiful. Very likable characters and not a dull story. There are many things to do in this game and its surprisingly never boring and the biggest reason for that would be combat. The many different characters you can obtain with their unique abilities and animations makes playing this game very exciting. I love all the backstory the characters are given ,as well, as it gives them a little more depth than just ‚Äúanother character‚Äù. Very well done voice acting, I‚Äôve never felt like the dubbed English was cringey lol. The voices suit the characters very well. I could go on and on. In summary this is a pretty great game and it drove me to write this review. I never write reviews.
title: Probably the best easily accessible anime game on mobile

review:
Despite the copying, this game has it great graphic and sounds. However, the gems system is what is reducing the gaming experience. Quick background, this game would ask you to use real money to purchase gems in game, so you can get for better characters or weapons. But please know, they are like a draw for prize system, so you don‚Äôt just get what you wanted. And after 3+ months of game play, and spending hundreds of dollars in games, I am 99%sure that the operator would check inventory of gamers to make sure you always not get what you want in the draws. Why? They want you to keep spending more time in game to build your team and most likely to spend more money down the road! If you don‚Äôt plan to spend anything, good luck, because you will be experiencing less than 50% of this game given the most fun systems are only for the better characters they provided. 
Just let this company go back to its own country and earn their people‚Äôs money already.

title: Dumpster fire

review:
I‚Äôve been playing mobile titles for about 12 years now. I‚Äôve seen hundreds upon hundreds of them come and go, and there are many that are brilliant. This title is effortlessly among one of my favorite mobile games‚Äîand games in general‚Äîof all time. It proves that a free-to-play title can have a business model that isn‚Äôt aggressive or exploitative, and that the base free experience doesn‚Äôt have to be a struggle. 

The graphics are astounding in how vibrant and crisp they are. The frame rate is silky, and the combat is so responsive. I‚Äôve found myself gleefully running around in random directions, curious about what I‚Äôd find next. All of this, and it fits in my phone. An experience this well-done fitting into a device that can slip in my pocket is mind-blowing.

Thank you. Thank you for proving that the free-to-play mobile space can be a great place to play.
title: An absolutely monumental achievement.

review: I‚Äôve been a long time fan of Honkai Impact so I was excited when I found out they were developing another game I knew it was gonna be great. Honkai Impact has always blown my mind how far they push mobile gameplay, to see Genshin Impact go even further is unbelievable. This game functions like a full game and has so many tasks to explore and secrets. I‚Äôve only been playing for a few hours and have already collected tons of lore snippets to read. Yes it‚Äôs a gacha game but it‚Äôs also an incredible game to play free and I‚Äôve been happy with my rolls even without spending. Knowing the devs history with Honkai, I don‚Äôt believe the micro transaction system will wind up being too money hungry to enjoy. Obviously it‚Äôll take some consistent game time to keep rolling but with this gameplay I am A-Ok with that! Amazing job guys you really know how to impress

review: I have been playing Genshin since around 1.3-1.4 (I'm not quite sure), but I stopped and had a hiatus. It became popular again so I started playing again at around 2.5-2.6. title: Amazing game

review:
For a free game Genshin is actually exceptional. Beautiful scenery, AMAZING osts (I‚Äôll sometimes just stay in Windrise to listen to A New Day with Hope and Qingyun Peak for Clear Skies Over Liyue because they‚Äôre that good), and intriguing lore. The gacha aspect of the game also isn‚Äôt half bad in my opinion. Moreover you also don‚Äôt need to spend money to get the characters/weapons you want (they may be somewhat stingy, but as a F2P I can still gather enough primos for characters and weapons every other version).
My only complaint about the game, and this is a common one for players reaching AR 56+, is the lack of endgame content. It gets a little mundane once you‚Äôve completed your exploration and world quests, and the only updates are events and new patches. Nevertheless, lots of love to Genshin and those who share the memory üòåüçµ
title: For a free game Genshin is exceptional

title: Best rpg game ever.

review: When I began playing this game I was enamored with the storyline and characters. The play style was fun, and I couldn‚Äôt get enough of it. One of my biggest concerns with it however is that there‚Äôs no representation for darker skinned people. With the various real life places and cultures this game is based off of, I would expect at the least, a few darker skinned characters. Out of the 50+ already released characters, there‚Äôs two darker skinned characters. Even then they‚Äôre only a few shades darker than the pale characters and have been white washed in official art. Heading forward I‚Äôd like to see regions with only / more dark skinned characters. Brown and black people exist! While this may be a fantasy game, Yunjin is proof that the developers can and will sink in time for cultural research. This just doesn‚Äôt seem to apply to darker skins and their cultures. It‚Äôs immensely disappointing and makes it hard to even wish to continue playing Genshin Impact. The lack of diversity is just suffocating!
title: Not enough representation

review: This game has proven again and again, that it doesn‚Äôt care about representation, taking concepts from other countries, like in Sumeru, and then refuse to have darker skinned characters of a solid culture. Liyue is based off of China, Inazuma is based off of Japan, Mondstadt is based off of Germany, yet when it comes to Sumeru (and possibly Natlan, which is not surprising with this company) it‚Äôs not based off of one country or culture, rather a mix of Persia/India/Middle East?? Then the outfits are stereotypes and poorly designed, there are so many beautiful attires and cultural clothing that could be used, not to mention skin color is important. This stealing of different cultures to fit a stereotype, then making the characters white to top it all off is outrageous, it‚Äôs not hard to do so, out of 50 ish playable characters only 2 have a darker skin, and their skin isn‚Äôt even that dark to begin with. This game gets millions in revenue every single banner, they could hire other artists that are part of the culture or make their own research?? Yet they refuse to do something so bare minimum?
title: The racism???

review: I‚Äôve been playing for 8 months now, and you should download it as long as you have space. It may take only a few gigabytes to download but it gets up to 20+G. Watch out. Don't play on an old phone (I used to play on an iPhone 6 it was horrible.) You get constantly kicked out, but I'll start talking about the positives. Amazing graphics? Check. Interesting plot? Check. So much to do? Kinda check? It gets a little boring endgame, but they still update every month with new updates!! Interesting characters with backstories? Check. Hidden lore? Check. Characters to simp for? Mega check (bro Xiao tho...‚ô°) Don‚Äôt simp too hard and waste your college savings. It's the perfect game. They come out with new content every month and every year there‚Äôs a new region! So download it. Now.
title: Favorite thing is the open world!!

review: Ok hi I have been playing genshin since it‚Äôs release in September of 2020 and it is a really good game I swear but there are some things I think that need to be fixed. I am ar 57 and play on both pc and mobile and and I gotta say yes the events are super fun but other than that all I have been doing is doing commissions and other than that farming wood for my teapot. I also feel like other late game players agree that the resin system is pretty much well just broken. Daily we get 160 resin. Weekly bosses each take 30 resin. There are 4 weekly bosses. That counts up to 120 resin used for weekly bosses ONLY. And if you need to farm let‚Äôs say weapon ascension materials the most you can retrieve is probably 2 runs in the domain. And this is not counting fragile resin recaps or condensed resin or what. But seriously the resin system is broken and so and so. Other than that the game is amazing and I really enjoy it.
title: Great game but..

review: despite being a free game, many have spent hundreds and even thousands of dollars trying to get characters from the gacha, which still has horrendous rates on the banner. i mean, how else would you make money right? i also feel that players deserved more on the anniversary. i remember when there were fewer players, the community rewards were very generous, and now, they‚Äôre not enough to do even a pull; it‚Äôs a death wish for those that are F2P.  the game gets repetitive when you hit late game, only doing comms, daily resin, maybe bp etc. i was expecting more from the Mihoyo marketing team since Genshin has grown exponentially, even becoming one of the most played online games of 2020, despite its age. even though you can still enjoy the game without your favorites, it doesn‚Äôt excuse the problems with Gacha games. the graphics are beautiful, the storyline is great. although, i still think there‚Äôs much to improve on. i would give it a 4.5/5 if it treated their players a bit better and fixed the marketing issues.

title: Great game

review: For me there is no other word I can use to describe this game other than masterpiece. It truly is one of the best games I‚Äôve ever played and can‚Äôt believe how incredibly well it runs on mobile. The attention to detail is ridiculous, graphics are eye candy, the music is serene and well thought out in terms of placement in the game, the dialog isn‚Äôt boring and there is plenty to do and collect. There is a great mix of missions that range from taking a while to just a few minutes so you can always be progressing even if you can‚Äôt play for very long at a time. I‚Äôve never played a free game where I wanted to spend money because otherwise I borderline feel guilty for playing for free. This is how in-app-purchases should be, make a great game so I ‚Äúwant‚Äù to spend money, not forced to. These developers deserve IAP because of the sheer quality going on here.
title: Masterpiece

review: I got this game maybe a month ago, and I absolutely love it! I have spent multiple hours on it, with intriguing stories and awesome characters. With the open world and side quests, there‚Äôs never nothing for you to do. However, the beginning area is laggy on my phone(I have an iPhone 7+), but it got better as you exited that area. It does lag sometimes to where when you open chests, you have to wait a while for the items to pop out, or for enemies to spawn in ley lines, but I‚Äôm sure it will be fixed in recent updates. title: I love the game but..

review:
This game looks soo good and based on what people said (anime Zelda) I got excited to play it. After downloading the game I entered the game to 1/3rd of the screen blacked out. I thought it was normal at first and continued playing. However, paimon (an npc character) kept pointing to the endless void and commenting on the ‚Äúview‚Äù. At one point there was a roar in the distance and paimon described whatever it was to be something huge, again I couldn‚Äôt see anything but a blacked out background. I was so bummed because I missed what to me sounded like a dragon flying above me?

 Anyway the game plays out like a 90‚Äôs game who has to load every single pixel, imagine silent hill but with a black fog instead. Some animations also turned into a bright glowing white orb that covers my whole entire character (I don‚Äôt even know why or how). All in all I‚Äôm pretty sure it‚Äôs not a bad game, but it needs to be heavily fixed before I can play again. I play on my iPad Pro so this might not be the case for other devices.
title: Why does it load like silent hill (but with a black fog)?

review:
The most amazing game I‚Äôve ever played in my life. It‚Äôs defiantly a grind game, but it‚Äôs not pay to win like many people says. I‚Äôve been playing the game since version 1.3 and never spent any money on it. I‚Äôve also seen a lot of bad reviews because the game takes up a lot space or lags a lot, but it‚Äôs not Genshins fault that you‚Äôre playing it on a potato. 
   The music and scenery in this game are breathtaking, as well the gorgeous character designs and intriguing plot. But with that being said, the game has been lacking a lot in updates, with event reruns and features that no one really wanted. Not to mention the absurd lack of anniversary rewards. But despite this, nothing can deny the unimaginable joy that this game has brought into my life. It has something for everyone, and you will not regret downloading it.
title: Amazing

review: Genshin is a game I downloaded a while ago, I got introduced to it by my teacher. It‚Äôs a good interesting game which allows you to do more than 1 thing at a time. If you don‚Äôt want to do a ‚ÄòArchon quest‚Äôs‚Äô you can do story quests, or world quests and what not. It has VERY good graphics but I recommend playing with good internet if your doing an archon quest or a story quest if not it‚Äôs most likely to glitch. I‚Äôve never liked gacha games but when I first played my first thought was ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not leaving this game anytime soon‚Äù. I do wish that getting primogems was easier once you‚Äôre a higher adventure rank but it‚Äôs fine. I did have to stop playing for 4 months since my iPad was getting fixed in the us. But appart from that it‚Äôs a really fun game. So exited for Heizou to come out!
title: Second game I‚Äôve played for over 5 months

review:
i‚Äôve played this game since before the chasm update, and it was pretty fun. one thing i always liked was the culture within the nations of tayvet. everything was true to life and beautiful. my complaint throughout was the lack of black and brown characters, but i was assured that if i waited for nations based on black and brown countries, this would change. but honestly? the upcoming sumeru update looks nothing like was promised. instead of being mostly based on one culture, it‚Äôs an amalgamation of dozens of cultures. and even then nothing is accurate to the real cultures, only stereotypes. but the worst of all is the blatant whitewashing. npcs from the area are paper white, and upcoming characters appear to be the same, with the exception of one character who looks tan AT MOST. with all the detail put into prior regions, i find it really distasteful that when it comes to a black / brown region, the minimum research is put in in favor of more ‚Äòappealing‚Äô whitewashed culture and characters.
i want to love this game but the complete lack of respect is too much.
title: disappointing

review: The music, characters, and gameplay are super amazing and I know that I‚Äôll continue to play this game for as long as I can. However, despite this game still being somewhat recent and not even close to completion, this game takes up so much storage that every time there‚Äôs an update the game says I have to free up storage before downloading the new update. I suggest that players are allowed to clear data related to events after the events expire and are allowed to clear cutscene data after viewing them. Of course, players should also be allowed to re-download them. I know there are other games that allow this, and it‚Äôs super helpful. Aside from this issue, this game is, overall, super fun and beautiful and I strongly recommend people play this.
title: Amazing game, takes up storage though

review: This is truly an exceptional game - I would maybe compare it to a mix of Breath of the Wild and old-school WoW, with outdoor scenery, music and breadth similar to the former and a grinding mechanic like the latter, but in most ways better than both games. Grinding more fun than in WoW, and more interesting variety of scenery than BotW, plus the very fun character switching mechanic. As people have said, you really don‚Äôt need to spend money to advance and have fun - I haven‚Äôt spent a dime thru level 70 of my main character, and I‚Äôm actually feeling guilty about it. If there‚Äôs any criticism, it‚Äôs that it is maybe too easy sometimes, but it is an appropriate difficulty level for a casual mobile game that you might only play in 10-20 minute chunks. Special shout-out to the interesting geopolitical perspective that comes through.
title: believe the hype

review: I‚Äôve been playing this game for awhile now (adventures rank 29) and it has been amazing. There are only a couple problems that have made me contemplate deleting the game. The first is the amount of crashes on mobile. This game crashes every 5-10 minutes making it almost impossible to play. I have contacted the game developers, but have not gotten and answer. The other big problem is the leveling system. There simply isn‚Äôt enough quest in between story mode. This makes extremely hard to climb up in rank and discourages a lot of people. I would hope that they would at least fix the crashing problem or extend the amount of time the game will stay open, but I doubt this will happen anytime soon. Overall the game is great and it looks really good on mobile, but drives me insane. Also the buying system in the game is against you. Having to spend around $15 for 10 wishes.
title: Great game Big problem

review: This game is absolutely beautiful! The graphics are amazing and I truly feel like I‚Äôm in control of my character. However, I prefer playing on my iPad, and none of the beautiful graphics show when I play on my iPad. The only thing I see is my character, the minimap, and the rest of my screen is entirely black. Even on the home screen before I press start game is entirely black. However, I knew that that couldn‚Äôt be all this game promised so I downloaded it on my phone, and it was marvelous! Everything was well designed and I could see the graphics really well. Unfortunately the game took up too much space on my phone and I could no longer keep it, so now I can‚Äôt play due to the nonexistent graphics on my iPad. The only reason this app is 4 stars is because I don‚Äôt feel like I played enough to determine its true worth and that my iPad cannot give me the full experience.
title: Wish I could play more!

review:
I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact and was told by an online friend to play this game. Apparently my friend abandoned the game due to his lack of playing games, and he mention to me there‚Äôs too much religion in the game, and he hated the game. Dang dude. It‚Äôs like literally a game you need to play for little to few days if you want to like the game. Some people has no self-restraint when it comes to playing games. ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Anyways, my point is I am in love with the game, story and dialogue is good so far, acting is interesting, and as an artist that draws, and paints traditionally, and digitally. I am impressed with graphics, animation, and art style of the characters. Paimon is so cute and the other characters. 

What could use some improvement is that I‚Äôve been experiencing some lag. While playing which is interrupting my game experience, and also the app crashing is another problem which I gave this game 4/5 stars.

title: it Surpass my expectations

review: This game is awesome. It‚Äôs aesthetically beautiful, a great story line, and extreme fun. I love that it‚Äôs an open world type of game play as well. You not only get to follow the gameplay but go off and do whatever you‚Äôd like to do on your own. I‚Äôve been debating for a while whether or not to get this game and I‚Äôm really glad I did. I haven‚Äôt been this invested in a mobile game in a LONG time. There is a lot to do in the game and they don‚Äôt make it extremely difficult to reach certain levels you need to be able to continue on with your quests which is awesome. I haven‚Äôt noticed any annoying ‚Äúyou have to buy this to do this‚Äù type of things in the game either. Everything you need is easily obtainable through game play. I think my favorite thing in the game is the wind gliding, it‚Äôs really fun and relaxing lol. 10/10 I definitely recommend.
title: It‚Äôs beautiful & so fun!

review: This is a free to play a game that has the most elbow grease put into it that I‚Äôve ever seen. While far from perfect, with a limited number of characters - the gameplay by itself has the most effort I‚Äôve seen put into the core game, to deter from the common monotonous gameplay of other games of its type. MTX are present as well as the common Loot rarities and content-based leveling up ‚Äì but none of this is necessary. In terms of game interaction there are a lot of borrowed elements here, however some of the games design decisions in interface are so well thought through and refined for a F2P game. My one criticism is that you won‚Äôt run into a point where there is legitimately very little to do. I think this is going to round out over time with more characters in weapon types, however they aren‚Äôt here yet. Also the world itself can use more variety.
title: Big effort F2P Game

review:
In the dimly lit bar, the bustle of the world outside faded into the background as the soothing notes of an audible piano echoed through the still air, creating a serene atmosphere. I sat there, my mind lost in thought, almost frozen in time. I felt the stranger's presence beside me, but I was too lost in my own thoughts to notice his offer at first.

With a slight tilt of my head, my eyes met his, and I was lost in a moment of hesitation. The bar's bulbs cast small shadows on his features, adding an air of mystery to his appearance. Despite the exhaustion that permeated my body, my mind was suddenly aware of the smallest details.

I shook myself out of my thoughts, a small dull mutter emitting from my lips, ‚ÄúA drink is a drink..."

As I took the small wine glass from his hand, I hesitated for a moment, but took a deep breath and settled into the moment.

The faint warmth of the glass in my hand, the soft touch of my lips against the rim. With a deep breath, I let the comforting sensation wash over my throat, the warmth of the liquid taking its time to reach the deepest parts of my being. As I sipped, I felt myself relax into the moment, my eyelids fluttering with the familiar, pleasant sensation.

With a small smile of satisfaction, I leaned back in my seat, feeling a bit of exhaustion melt away. Still, the weight remained in my chest, oozing like a puddle of thick tar.
title: Genshin ate my dog.

review: I have an iphone 6s and i‚Äôve never had problems running games like this with large open worlds (heck, i play dragon raja using data all the time). And though the description says it‚Äôs recommended for iphone 8 and up, its pretty much unplayable and, trust me, it‚Äôs not even worth trying if you have an older device like mine. first of all it crashed a bunch in the beginning. after the crashes i was finally able to get to the downloading screen. but after it downloaded the cutscenes lagged  so bad i had to close the app. once the cutscenes were over i got to the game play and to my surprise the entire environment wasn‚Äôt loaded. there‚Äôs just a huge void and you can only see a tiny portion of the world at once. not to mention it takes about 5 minutes to load the game every single time. from the reviews, it sounds like a great game and I want to give it five stars. but, until i can actually play the game, i‚Äôll leave it at two stars for now and hope it gets fixed
title: Virtually unplayable for older devices

review: When I first pre-registered, I honestly didn‚Äôt know what to expect, but I can say for a fact that I am addicted! I‚Äôd visited the Genshin Impact website several times, and even though I missed the beta, I‚Äôm still satisfied that I stuck along to experience it! It has the vibes of an anime Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, but with the character collection aspect(s) of an anime gacha-style game (i.e. you spend in-game currency that you earn or purchase in order to roll for a chance of obtaining new characters as well as items). The way the music changes when running or in combat is amazing~ Honestly, even though there‚Äôs micro-transactions, if you explore enough, I feel like you could earn anything- Just have to be willing to put in the time for games like this! Also, I have my hopes up regarding controller compatibility for the mobile versions!

This app also take up a lot of storage, you‚Äôd have to delete a lot of apps and photos to keep up with the updates. But if you do get the game it‚Äôs enjoyable, for a while for me at least. But the game is fun and I‚Äôd recommend it to anyone that likes open world types of games!

title: Toooooooooo much talking

review:
I don‚Äôt typically write reviews, but this game definitely deserves one. 

First of all, the art is incredible. If some characters are a tad lewd, just change their outfits and stop crying about it. They have free secondary outfits for the more exposed characters. They look good. The terrain looks amazing, and the animations are smooth.

Second, The gameplay mechanics are really interesting in the way that it‚Äôs not super simple. If you can‚Äôt figure it out, that sounds like a skill issue to me. Not a game issue.

Third, the music. Being a musician for over a decade, and being invited to national competitions, I feel like I have the right to judge very critically here, so here it is: I‚Äôve never had a game inspire me so much just with the soundtracks. I mean, I listen to them almost daily. Not just because of the classical feel to it, but the culture and the ingenious composition of every individual piece written for this game. I can‚Äôt find a flaw in it. Not a one. 

Fourth, the character selection is massive for a mobile game. Every one has their unique backstory and abilities. 

It does tend to heat up my phone a bit, but that‚Äôs to be expected running max settings. I‚Äôm getting a phone cooler so I can play for more than an hour at a time.
title: Okay, here we go.

I never thought they would Intentionally release a bad character in regards to her kit. Honestly, I never thought they would make a tan five star in fear of sales dropping‚Ä¶, but turns out I was right. They are even putting her in the standard banner after her limited rate up, which makes about 0% sales. They do not care for people‚Äôs criticisms and or input when it comes to any of their characters. I‚Äôve emailed them plenty of times to be met with, silly emojis and terrible feedback. Understand your playing a game that is not very diverse and the company being very degrading towards its paying players.

review:
I‚Äôm the kind of person who doesn‚Äôt know how to like things a normal amount. Nevertheless, I downloaded genshin and expected to like it a normal amount. 

What I‚Äôm gonna say will UNDENIABLY make you think I‚Äôm a loser‚Ä¶ and I accept this: If I could spend every waking hour playing this game, I probably would. I love the characters, the combat, etc. It is perfect for escaping the unyielding weight of being alive. 

The only thing I don‚Äôt like is how oversexualized a lot of the female characters are, but me complaining about it isn‚Äôt going to change it so it‚Äôs a rather moot point. The gacha system could be complained about, but the way I see it, it‚Äôs not necessary to enjoy the game and therefore is not worth mentioning. If you get super heated at losing a game of chance, maybe‚Ä¶. idk like touch grass or something LOL.
title: This game is ruining my life. I love it.

For the regions they‚Äôre based on you can make the argument that it makes sense. And you can make the argument that with more regions being added soon we can possibly see more people of color. But with recent leaks of the Sumeru characters all being light skinned while only one of them has darker skin. Not to mention that one of the characters is a harmful stereotype, it makes the company look as if they don‚Äôt care about adding more skin tones and creating diversity in the game. There should definitely be a greater ratio of darker skinned characters then lighter skinned in the Sumeru update. The NPCs should also reflect the region by not all of them being white passing.

title: I like it a lot

review: First let me state that there is nothing wrong with Genshin Impact itself. It is a beautiful game. The music, the characters, the regions, and the quests. My problem is with the company who created the game, mihoyo. Today genshin players should be celebrating Genshin Inpacts 1 year anniversary, but instead the focus is on the terrible rewards we got. We got a cute little interactive movie, going through our journey of genshin impact. But the actual rewards where horrible. 10 fates, which you can only fully acquire if you log in every day for the next week (which is also the same rewards we got during lantern rite) 40 primogems and 300 mora. Mihoyo was generous enough to give big streamers 15k primogems for its anniversary, but the other players get absolute garbage. for a multi million dollar company, they fully can afford to spare 1600 primogems to each of their players. I hope mihoyo is actually listening to their players demands and requests because if they continue to treat their players like this, their game will no longer be successful.
