title: artifacts

review:
First of all, I want to say how funny the one star reviews are. ‚ÄúGive me Klee or die,‚Äù definitely gave me something to laugh about. 

The game is amazing. Even though I‚Äôve done all the Archon Quests currently available, I still find things to do, like exploring parts of the map I previously ignored.

The updates and events have satisfied me, giving me something to look forward to the next day when I log on. The newest event, Midsummer Island Adventure (I think), is great. I love the fact that if you grind a bit, you can get a beautiful Barbara skin. The Echoing Conchs tell many stories, and the quests about the past people who lived there are captivating. 11/10 Job on the event.

I really don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs anything wrong with Genshin Impact. Some people say that it‚Äôs ‚Äúhomophobic‚Äù that they don‚Äôt have a certain character because they are a certain sexuality. It‚Äôs not about your sexuality, it‚Äôs just the rates. You might get a few more of a certain character because that‚Äôs what the random generator gives you. You‚Äôre not special because you get bad artifacts, plenty of people spend hours grinding for artifacts and get many trashy ones (me included).

Overall, great work. I‚Äôve loved this game from the second I picked it up.
title: Great game! ‚ú®

review: This is definitely one of my favorite games, the characters, the graphics, all of it is great. review:
Genshin Impact is an absolutely phenomenal rpg. All the hard work put into it really shows! The graphics are outstanding and the sorry line as well as the game play do not have words that can properly describe how amazing this game is. Not to mention the background music!
Although I can‚Äôt say that this game is without some false considering that nothing is perfect. Whenever the game is updated my BP level resets from its current level to zero once again. title: Genshin Impact

review:
For a mobile phone game, this is phenomenal.

Hell, even for a console or PC game, the open world experience is very immersive and captivating. 

The gameplay is solid, and although it incorporates more traditional gacha-style game progression, it does so in a way that isn‚Äôt too obnoxious. You can easily progress whether you spend real currency or not.

A lot of the fun for me is in the story and the gameplay. It‚Äôs surprisingly good story and character voice-overs will keep you entertained, as an RPG should.

My biggest complaint is probably that is just a bit too open world, and there aren‚Äôt too many activities to keep your interest for more than an hour or two at a time. This is a fine game to help you relax, but as a grind, it can be kind of boring. 

There is a lot of ambition to this game, and I can‚Äôt wait to see just what they plan to release in the upcoming months, especially in terms of multiplayer. For what it‚Äôs worth, there is a lot to do right now, and I recommend diving in now while it is so popular. 

To summarize, it‚Äôs among the top 5 most gorgeous mobile games you can play. Cross-platform, and very little bugs and gameplay issues, but you will spend a lot of time exploring and wandering the big open-world, so be prepared for a lot of silence and atmosphere.
title: Absolutely amazing!

review: I have been following this game for quite some time now and now that I can finally play it, I can say proudly I am not disappointed. This game is fantastic even on mobile, though the small controls are a bit hard to get used to. Still this game performs well and looks amazing. My only problem with this his game is the gacha rates. They are extremely low and you would have to spend $200 for a pity pull and that‚Äôs not even guaranteed that you would get a 5 star character and could just be a 5 star weapon. There needs to be some tweak to the gacha system or even increase the rates at this point. Other than the bad gacha rates this game is fun and honestly you don‚Äôt need 5 star characters to beat endgame content, 4 star heroes perform just as well as long you have pulled multiple of them to ascend them.
title: Only drawback is the gacha system/rates

review:
I love the game. Genshin Impact is a open-world game meaning it has a lot to explore and that awesome, it definitely needs a long time before you get extremely good at gameplay but it‚Äôs really fun!

The games textures and scenes are beautiful and cinematic. The graphics are extremely high quality and can be adjusted to get a smooth gameplay. There is such a diverse amount of character that you may need to favor everyone! The quest and battle that goes alongside the story is so exciting. You explore new bosses, add new mobs to your archive, encounter new enemies and find ingredients for recipes!

The storyline is awesome with the Traveler being from a different world, and with the Traveler always trying to find clues as to where their lost sibling is, it spikes more excitement!

I love this game, but the more you play the more boring it kind of gets. If I'm being completely honest, the game gets less exciting because when you reach a high AR (45+) you'd have lots of equipment and gears and eventually you‚Äôll get overpowered and thats where the fun is lost, but this is a definite 4/5!!!!

I recommend if you like playing along with storylines, open-world games, characters to collect. I hope any new players enjoy the game and give feedback, it will be very helpful to the developers!
title: my opinions and reasons about genshin

review:
Basically what the title says, if you don‚Äôt have lots of storage or the best gaming setup you cannot play this game well. It crashes constantly and when it doesn‚Äôt crash you spend most of your time grinding for artifacts. It takes a lot of time towards this game for any reward, to the point where it‚Äôs debatable if it‚Äôs even worth it. 

Most of the cutscenes are lackluster too, with the same 10 preset animations mixed and matched to tell a story. Presets are fine, a great way to push out content faster for the masses, but the preset animations are clunkly and super boring. Genshin needs more dynamic preset animations if it wants to tell most of its story through cutscenes. Old characters are super ugly and have snappy animations, but the creators make no effort to improve them, instead focusing on putting out newer and prettier content.

A lot of the problems with Genshin Impact are foundational, and it‚Äôs clear the company doesn‚Äôt actually care about the game but sees it as a cash cow. It‚Äôs extremely disappointing as a longtime fan. Many of us have to give up playing because it‚Äôs just not possible for our devices anymore. I‚Äôve been a fan since October 2020, and recently had to say goodbye to my account for good because of a glitch so bad it crashes every time I start the game.

There‚Äôs a lot more reasons to why Genshin Impact isn‚Äôt great anymore, but I think you guys get the point.
title: Super Buggy and Very Lazily Made

title: Plz read hoyoverse

review: This game has cured my boredom many times and there are too many good things about the game to mention. I am in love with the graphics and the attention to detail in the game. The storyline and plot is perfect, it catches my attention every time. I just want to say that when you‚Äôre a beginner, sometimes people will join your world and help you fight bosses. This always made my day because at the time I was about AR (adventure rank) 18 and it helped me so much to get EXP, artifacts, and other important resources. At first, it may seem overwhelming considering how many options and possibilities you have but one thing that I did was research. This helped me to figure out where I can find things, different battle tactics, how to use something properly, and much more. Thank you so much for making this game:)

Okay let me start off by saying Genshin is a really cool game, the characters and stories are awesome, the graphics are amazing and the fact that it makes you use brain power to get to certain points instead of just buying things makes it even better, but the issues I have with it are 1. It takes up literally my entire phone storage to just download it‚Äî I mean, I deleted every single app I could off my phone to play it one time and it felt like my phone was on fire. I have an iPhone12 and if I‚Äôm correct this isnt an old or outdated phone. And 2. There is hardly any diversity in the game. Other than characters that are extremely problematic, theres about 1-2 people in the game that aren‚Äôt white as snow. Theres a lot of cultural offense in the game and its been getting ignored for the longest time. But other than those two things I dont have that many other problems with it.

review: Please implement a pity system for artifacts. It‚Äôs very tedious to grind for an ideal artifact. With each character requiring different type of artifacts, I feel very discouraged to draw more new characters. This is especially true for the most recent update. I thought that‚Äôll I‚Äôll find the fire I had when I first played Genshin. However, I soon was reminded how frustrating the artifact system is. I don‚Äôt feel Genshin as it is right now will keep me. The system can be as simple as re-rolling the  primary stat of each artifacts. I‚Äôve been playing a new game called tower of fantasy(ToF), and I really like some of its mechanics. ToF is not as a good game as Genshin, but their pity system reflects what a gacha game should have. I don‚Äôt mind spending tons of money for C6 chars(I already have), but I do not like to spend 2-3 weeks for one single ideal artifacts. I know I am not alone in this.  Please do something, I don‚Äôt want to give up on genshin.
title: Artifacts

review: Hoyoverse has disappointed many including myself with the launch of sumeru and it‚Äôs cast of orientalist designs and mostly pale characters. They enjoy using the aesthetics of real southwest Asian and North African cultures, but don‚Äôt bother to represent the real people who live in those regions. I was planning on spending money on this game until I saw what a disappointment sumeru was going to be. Hopefully they‚Äôll have learned their lesson before Natlan. But I doubt it. They‚Äôre extremely colorist, with their darkest character barely tan. Candace, who was based off a real woman, Kandake, is an extreme letdown to fans who were hoping to see a dark skinned woman represented  in game. In summation, hoyoverse is egregiously wrong to inaccurately lump these distinct and beautiful cultures into one mishmashed  amalgamation and then not even represent the people from those cultures. Some may say ‚Äúoh it‚Äôs just a fantasy game!‚Äù Why is it that people of darker skin tones aren‚Äôt allowed in that fantasy then. What is so ‚Äúunrealistic ‚Äú about melanin that characters can‚Äôt be dark skinned?
title: Profiting off Real Culture

review: I absolutely love this game. The amazing visuals, the complex and intriguing storyline, I love it! I know this game is originally meant to be played on console (I think, I just know that is wasn‚Äôt originally created for mobile), but there‚Äôs an issue that happens a lot to other mobile users. Sometimes when I start up the app, it just gets stuck on the title screen that says ‚ÄúGenshin Impact.‚Äù Sometimes, when i actually get past that screen, the game crashes before I can even start playing! I know, it‚Äôs on mobile and mobile doesn‚Äôt usually work as smoothly as console does, but it would be really, REALLY helpful to play a game that doesn‚Äôt crash every time you teleport somewhere. I would‚Äôve given the game the 5-stars it deserves, but I‚Äôm giving it a 4-star because of this lagging issue. It would be really helpful if you read this, thanks!
title: Amazing Game, but...

review:
Look, this game is great. The graphics are‚Ä¶okay on mobile. But we need more content in this game. Also, with the upcoming region Sumeru coming out, I except there to be representation for the culture of where Sumeru is based off of. It‚Äôs not that hard to do, it‚Äôs a simple request. Also, you guys NEED to try and shrink the app size. You will lose more players each patch if you don‚Äôt. Our storages cannot handle that much. Also, when I mean representation I mean not stereotyping characters. I also mean adding more diversity. Yes, there can be white colored skin tones but not everyone should be white skinned. title: Disappointing

review: the company, hoyoverse, only cares about money and not their customers satisfaction. they already have billions of dollars yet are thirsty for more. the currency used to pull for characters gets way too hard to get after you reach a certain level. the game has multiple regions, and the upcoming region, sumeru, is supposed to be based off of an area with primarily dark skinned people, yet they‚Äôve only made 3-4 characters that are slightly tanner than paper-white in the whole GAME. they represented other cultures, like china, japan, and germany nearly flawlessly, yet their idea of representation for the middle east and south asia is completely stereotypical. the only tan characters that genshin has included have ALL been 4*s, and it‚Äôs easy to realize that hoyoverse is making these characters a lower tier than the others because they think that they won‚Äôt get as many sales as the light-skinned characters. the company doesn‚Äôt even care about keeping people interested, and more fishing people of their money.
title: money hungry, and bad representation

review: The lack of characters with darker skin is absurd. With a whole new nation coming out soon with extremely pale skin doesn‚Äôt make any sense at all. Yes, not all South Asians have darker skin, but when you‚Äôre making a nation that is a mixture of ethnicities you are expected to put in some effort. You cannot highly research nations with predominately pale skin and respect it but disrespect a different nation because of their predominately dark skin. A new leaked character‚Äôs design is extremely orientalist and disrespectful. This company had plenty of time to make a simple change of giving Sumeru characters dark skin and not disrespecting the many cultures it includes, but chose not to. They are disrespecting so many people and should be allowed to get away with it. Do not play this game if you are expecting great representation for POC with dark skin. Their dark skinned characters are filled with stereotypes and they do not know how to properly give good representation. It‚Äôs a shame because of how incredible this game is but the flaws cannot be ignored.
title: Terrible Representation for Darker Skinned People

review:
Hey! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

review: The largest problem of this game in my opinion is the gatcha system implemented and the normalization of this system in the industry as a whole. Genshin impact has been one of the most influential games this past year with everyone being inside and due to the pandemic, and subsequently trying and playing new games, Genshin has thrived in this new gaming industry with a astronomical 2 billion dollars made from mobile platforms through in app purchases. While the game may be free to play, and many of the players being ftp, the effort put into making scummy mechanics and having many of your favorite characters locked behind unrealistic odds of obtaining, limited time availability, on top of the egregious odds of pulling said character or weapon. It‚Äôs just culminates into a horrible system of unlocking new characters, and thereby having ‚Äúfun‚Äù in this game. While I have no qualms with the actual gameplay and the overall world in this, it is largely overshadowed by the gatcha system.
title: The biggest problem

review:
Honestly, this is the most amazing game I have ever found for a phone. I need this to have a contract with Nintendo or something so I can play on a larger screen! 

The world is MASSIVE. The gameplay has its complications, but that is to be expected considering it‚Äôs played on a phone screen. Aside from that, it‚Äôs easy to navigate how the game works. Gameplay is smooth (I have had a few freezes but closing and reopening the app brings me right back to where I froze, no lost gameplay!). 

The graphics are beautiful. Character designs at unique. Voice overs are smooth and sound great. The quests are easy to understand and follow. I do wish there was a bit more of a tutorial, but it was pretty easy to figure out on my own. Still wrapping my head around what elemental power beats what but I‚Äôm sure the internet has the answer.

title: Primogems

review: For a game that asks you to invest time, effort, and if you want to, money.... a lot of it for some people... the account security is just pitiful, I have seen so many cases of hacks in this game that it makes me scared to spend money or co-op at all. review: The game design is amazing, the progression is just right for all levels of video game players low-medium, the graphics are perfect in every way, the music is super chill and when u get into a adventure or battle scene the music turns into either a semi-tense semi-adventurous music, and I overall love the game. But anything with that much godliness must have something wrong with it, the game has a mega download file and it will run through battery levels, getting four star heroes is fairly easy but getting more than one five star hero is almost impossible unless you pay or put in a lot of time and effort, which I‚Äôm not saying is a bad thing because the five stars are very powerful so it makes sense for them to be rare, I have t even gotten one lol. title: I love it but...

review: I don‚Äôt know what engine this game is using but it is definitely not well optimized. At least please support different rendering options. For previous iPhone you can lower down the graphics resolution as well as details such as shadows and renderings such as water and grass. I saw the minimum requirement is iPhone 8 and I thought I can give a try on my iPhone 7 and it just crashed after every 10 minutes, especially during a combat or walking inside a large city. I do like the big open world and stories but many other open world games are much more smoother than this. Please consider adding adaptivity to different phones and make it faster. At least for me if the game is running smoothly I can tolerate some level of graphics quality. Otherwise it‚Äôs just too annoying when the game crashes. Actually I can run most of other RPG games in the App Store without any problem using my iPhone 7 but this one is just so hard to play without suffering from lagging.
title: Too much lag and does not support low resolution

review:
I‚Äôm playing this game on an iPad Pro, and the game is in bad need of controller support.  As it is, the game is difficult to play simply because the on-screen controls are uncomfortable on a large screen.  For a game which involves platforming and aiming and which also has a PC port and a PS4 port, ignoring controller support is inexcusable.  Hopefully, this will be patched in soon -this would warrant a few more stars for this review.

The gacha system for obtaining new allies is brutal - some of the lowest rates you‚Äôll find (0.6% for a 5*).  They don‚Äôt seem to be super generous with currency at the moment, so you should go into the game expecting to be playing with the story-provided characters and one or two other 4* characters unless you commit to whaling.

The game occasionally decides it wants to take several minutes to load (on a white screen), so if that happens to you, you probably just need to wait a few more minutes before trying to restart the game.  It doesn‚Äôt happen EVERY time you load the game, but I‚Äôve encountered this several times so far.  Bug?

Frustrating controls and brutal gacha aside, the game looks very good for a gacha game and is actually fun when you‚Äôre not wrestling with the clunky controls.  To me, the game feels more like Sword Art Online: Lost Song for the PlayStation Vita than anything else - right down to the flying in Lost Song and ‚Äúsingle player MMO-like‚Äù feel that all the Vita SAO games had.
title: Needs controller support and some optimization

review: You know what, I know I haven‚Äôt been here since the start but I‚Äôll say that this game has really been one of the best. The elemental attacks to the burst of the characters, their unique features and even animations. All of the nations, the gliders, signature dishes, even down to little companions you can equip! I also enjoyed all the nations. I can‚Äôt wait for more to come in the future, the newer characters really showed me impressed, the bursts have became more insane, I really love this game a lot! Also the events you can participate to either get rewards or different 4 stars made me happy to at least upgrade the different 4 stars I already have or get new ones. Though I‚Äôll admit I‚Äôm kinda jealous of how majestic the characters look.
title: This game has honestly been one of the best I played in a long time!

review: Okay so the first problem with this game is the content, if you‚Äôre a new player then there‚Äôs so much content that it‚Äôs overwhelming but if you‚Äôre a high player then there‚Äôs not enough content, 2nd problem, the resin system is what allows u to get things for your characters to ascend them and get artifacts for them but you only get 160 resin and a lot of the things cost a lot of resin so often times you won‚Äôt even be able to get enough materials and the domains give terrible artifacts 90% of the time so you usually spend all your resin trying to get good stuff but don‚Äôt and you run out so u have to spend the in game currency to buy more or get one of the things that restore resin but both options only give you 60 resin which isn‚Äôt gonna be enough and the resin only gives you 1 per SEVEN minutes! You‚Äôll have to put a lot of time and effort into this game if you want a good account and some of the characters aren‚Äôt that good. Yeah so it‚Äôs a 6/10 for me it can be fun if you have good stuff
title: READ (PUT FIVE STARS JUST SO YALL SEE ))

review: This game is lovely. I absolutely love it. I started playing April 7th 2023 and have been playing it ever since. review: I love Genshin Impact, but I am not able to download it on iPad. It takes up 30 gigabytes! (Like, why?!) But it is an awesome game! I downloaded it on phone and the stories are really detailed and very interesting. The characters are really cool and has very amazing abilities (including Tighnari, Keqing, Rosaria, and e.t.c) The nations are really interesting because it is very beautiful and very large! (Including the Inazuma, Sumeru, Monstadt and Liyue) They also have very unique names (like Zhongli, Baal, Nahida (Kusinali), Focalor (which is going the be the upcoming hydro archon), and Venti. But yes, I do have some suggestions for the game. 1. MAKE IT TAKE UP LESS STORAGE!! 2. Add more nations, including a cryo, pryo, and hydro. (Well yes you are gonna add Fontaine which is a hydro nation.) 3. ADD MORE CHARACTERS! 4. Make the quests a bit easier. I literally cannot unlock the Inazuma because of Danesleif! Please and Thank You!
title: Too much storage, but is an excellent game.

review: This game might look like a cheap Breath of the Wild Free-to-Play, but it is honestly anything but. I downloaded this game on a whim and was fully ready to uninstall it as soon as it bored me, but after hours of gameplay I can say that I was wrong and this game is actually very fun. The play-loop is very engaging, I don‚Äôt feel the need to spend a cent on this game, and I honestly feel overwhelmed by the amount of items I receive and I wish there were less rewards lol the only downside I can think of is the amount of items you receive make all of the menu‚Äôs constantly have notifications lmaoooo it‚Äôs super fun and is super engaging, but if you‚Äôre looking for something to itch the scratch that BOTW left you, this is not the game for you. It is so very different in every way besides the aesthetics, just give it a chance and see.
title: Looks like a BOTW clone, Plays like a dream

review: This game is amazing! High quality-check, amazing characters-check! There‚Äôs so much more, but I‚Äôm keeping this simple. The game is amazing and all, but for new player or concerned parents, I‚Äôll get to the flaws, sadly. The game is amazing and all, but it takes up a LOT of space, I recommend a computer or PlayStation for this game. I use a computer mist of the time, and it goes smoothly, until I get to cutscenes. My computer heats up like the sun. Sadly there are a bunch of glitches too. There‚Äôs the famous head glitch, where it glitches into the characters head, I know scary. That‚Äôs all I can think off as of now, but like I said the game is amazing! I highly recommend! (P.S. If you want to do co-op mode, good luck. Barely anyone will let you in, or maybe it‚Äôs just me- but the co-op system is not as popular)
title: Amazing but‚Ä¶

review: Genshin Impact is a fun and immersive RPG that features beautiful scenery and extremely detailed characters. The storyline is interesting and deep for once in a gacha RPG, and MiHoYo releases new characters, events, and free rewards fairly often which helps keep the playing experience interesting. There‚Äôs only one problem with the game, and it‚Äôs a fairly large one and that is the sheer size of the thing. On a beefy pc or console, this game is absolutely stunning. Mobile devices, however, simply don‚Äôt contain the processing power or storage to keep up with the constant updates, high graphics, and unbelievably large map. It is definitely not recommended that you get the game on a mobile device, but instead install it on a computer or console via the Epic Games Store. The game itself is great and addictive, even; it just does not have a place in the world of mobile, pocket-sized, less powerful devices.   Basically, get the game and play it; despite its ‚Äúanime/waifu/husbando‚Äù outlook in the gaming world‚Ä¶. just not on a mobile device.
title: Great game, simply unplayable.

review: First of all, I love this game! The graphics, the story, the characters, everything. But I only have three suggestions. The first suggestion is about wishes. I work so hard to earn primo gems, but when I get to 10 intertwined wishes, I only get weapons. It‚Äôs rare for me to even get one new character! Could you guys just make it easier for players to get characters? Please change this! Another suggestion is that players can get boats. I keep on trying to get to islands in the sea, but it takes wayyyyy too long with my Cryo characters. If we (players) got boats in the game, it could be more exciting! And maybe some times along the way, the players could meet sea monsters! This is an awesome game and I really recommend it, but again, also just some suggestions. Have a great day!
title: This game is awesome!

review: When it comes to mondstadt, Hoyoverse focuses on one country/culture for inspiration. (Germany) When it comes to liyue, Hoyoverse focuses on one country/culture. (China) When it comes to inazuma, Hoyoverse focuses on one country/culture. (Japan) But when it comes to sumeru, all of the sudden the SWANA region (which all have unique and significant cultures) gets meshed together into a single monolith. Not to mention the sumeru characters are all either stereotypes, orientalist, or just straight up have no resemblance to a SWANA culture. Another issue is the fact that there are no dark skinned sumeru characters or NPC‚Äôs. I am well aware that people come in all different shades and some SWANA countries have people that are fair-skinned but that still does not excuse the fact that the majority of people from the SWANA region are tan, brown, black, etc. It‚Äôs really disappointing for Hoyoverse to put love and care into each nation in the game and pay very careful attention to each culture but when it comes to a predominantly brown country/culture they just become lazy and ignorant. Do better.
title: racist and orientalist

review: I had 3 masterless starglitter and got a four star, which is supposed to give you 2 more starglitter,  which would have given me 7, enough to wish again, but I didn‚Äôt get any more starglitter from that wish. To add to that, I was doing the spiral abyss, and got 3 ‚Äú50 primos‚Äù messages after doing floor 9 which would have given me 150. After that, without checking my primo amount, I did floor eight so I could get the one star from chamber two that I hadn‚Äôt gotten yet, and I got 100 primos for that. In total, even if I‚Äôd started from 0 primogems, which I didn‚Äôt, I would have had at the very least 250 primogems, but by the end of that I still only had 179, and I‚Äôd started from 29 primogems. I hope Mihoyo fixes and recompensates us for these problems.
title: I think the reward system is broken, not happy

Raiden and Beidou can‚Äôt work in a team comp at all and we‚Äôre falsely advertised for raiden to work with her. Kokomis kit is a complete joke for a 5 star, and the way they have handled criticism of their game is laughable. Anyone that speaks out about it has their comment deleted deemed a ‚Äúbot‚Äù. title: Poorly handles criticism and doesn‚Äôt fix major issues in their game

review:
I cannot in good faith recommend new players get addicted to this game for the last two reasons. I will update this review if developers actually listen to feedback. Reasons as follows:

This is game is gorgeous from it‚Äôs art to its music, and it is a technological achievement that it can fit on your phone and still be as expansive and open world as it is. The characters are all memorable and lovable, the combat is very colorful snd fun, and the story and lore are very interesting too. 

The developers will not listen to your suggestions though and will even try to censor you on their social media platforms that allow it, so don‚Äôt expect any improvements. The game will also try to milk you of every penny you‚Äôre worth with tempting mechanics such as getting resources faster, getting characters you want more often, and of course making your characters stronger which can cost you upwards of thousands in USD. But worst of all the studio will use community artists and cosplayers as advertising and pay them little no compensation in exchange. This behavior is a complete 180¬∞ shift from when the game first launched, showing that now that they‚Äôve made money they no longer care about the players.

So once again, I do not recommend this game. It‚Äôs a highly addictive time waster. But if you don‚Äôt care about being mistreated and you have deep pockets to burn, by all means play away. I just think your money can be better spent elsewhere.
title: Cannot recommend this game right now

review: Ok so, don‚Äôt get me wrong I love the game, the story line, everything. There‚Äôs just one thing, why are there so many female characters? That‚Äôs an enormous ratio. I seriously don‚Äôt get why? What about all the people who have a preference for men and like playing as male characters? It doesn't make any sense. I know I‚Äôm not the only one bothered by this. As someone who likes to play as male characters at least make one more archon a boy. Like please? I mean I was happy with 3 archons being boys and 4 being girls, but now it‚Äôs 2 boys and 5 girls. There‚Äôs literally double the amount of playable characters that are girls than boys, why make the dendro archon a girl too?. üòê
title: No males..?

review:
This game is amazing! :) The worldbuilding is spectacular, and the plot is amazing. You, a Traveller from another world, gets separated from their sibling and goes on an epic quest around a magic world? That‚Äôs so cool! The characters are so cool, and marvelously detailed. The graphics, even on a mobile device, are actually amazing! Not to mention the gacha aspect, which puts luck when getting characters and weapons for the game! This game does take up a lot of storage, but it‚Äôs much worth it in my opinion. If you enjoy fantasy, open world, RPGs, gacha rolling, and/or magic, this game is for you! Huge credit to Mihoyo for making such an amazing game!!

Edit: Since writing this, so many spectacular updates have come out! Seriously, this is a top-notch game. Anyone and everyone should give it a play, you won‚Äôt be dissatisfied!
title: Incredible!

review: The game is amazing. I love it but there are too many things i dont like. I wish that it didnt take up so much room. Every time i want to play i have to delete almost all my apps just to play. Also i dont like how you can only get 5 wishes per month. Its annoying and I wish the app would also give diversity when getting wishes. I keep getting the same items and its annoying, also it crashes sometimes too. Back to the diversity thing, its annoying when i get 5 debate clubs in a row. Also I wish the tasks where easier, as in the instructions. I had to watch a video just to figure out the in the mountains task bc it was so hard to understand what I had to do. I still havent completed the full task bc of how hard it is to stay warm and fight the bosses on a time limit. I do love this game, its fun and has many great adventures but there are too many difficulties to enjoy it too the fullest
title: Lovely but..

review:
The graphics are amazing and the storyline is very entertaining. I used to think that higher drop rates were needed, until I realized that it was easier to get five stars by doing one times wishes. At least for me.  It might take more wishes, but it is much more convenient than saving up and doing one ten roll only to get a very low chance of a five star. Plus, getting 160 primogems is much easier than getting 1,600 primos. I usually just spend the primogems when I get them, unless new characters are making a debut in a new update; for example 1.5. 
Many of the features are like Zelda, but what is most important is always the storyline, and the fact that the rpg game is free. I never paid this game once, and I don‚Äôt think I will need to.
title: This is a good game, I will include some ways to get more 5*s

review: Okay, so I‚Äôm not usually one for mobile games but after a few recommendations thought I‚Äôd give this one a shot. I came in expecting to be disappointed but now I can not stress enough how much fun this game is! The story is fun to play along with, defeating bosses is challenging but not impossible, and the graphics are shockingly good considering it‚Äôs a mobile game. I would have given it five stars were it not so hard to obtain five star characters. The wishing system in this game is designed so that you have to spend real money if you want to get strong playable characters. However, even spending $100 will only get you about 40 wishes which sound fine until you consider that there is a .6 percent chance of actually getting one of those great five star characters. But other than the absurd impossibility of the wishing system, this game is addicting and I would absolutely recommend it.
title: Super Fun Game

title: Amazing game !

review: Everything else in this game is great from the combat to the exploration even the in game events are a blast. None of these excuse the bad, frustrating, and cheap design of enemies in game. Some hide behind shields all day without engaging the player, and others shoot from range constantly disengaging the player if you go near them or are placed in unreachable locations or will raise themselves up to where you can‚Äôt reach them without aimed shot while taking a barrage of missiles to the face. Finally there are the power armor enemies. These enemies will unleash a flurry of attacks, (or spin to win your face) that will stagger and juggle you in the air meanwhile not caring about your normal or charged attacks. Often these enemies will stay just out of your range until you run out of stamina and then wail on you for free. The best part is they can just back away from you outside of your range while you normal attack them.
title: Poor enemy design

review: So I‚Äôm gonna be honest I didn‚Äôt know what to expect from this game. A friend suggested it so I downloaded it and started playing. I got addicted to playing even though I enjoy multiplayer more than single player. There are many great characters you can play with, and all have their own unique abilities. The only complaint i have is I would like to hear our main character‚Äôs voice in cutscenes, but otherwise its a great game limited at times, but amazing fun. There is puzzles to elemental reactions as well as a crafting and cooking system. Not everyone might agree with me, but i suggest just trying it out for yourself. They also added an multiplayer system you just have to get through a certain bit of the game first. Well anyways neat game and I‚Äôll continue to enjoy it even if I‚Äôm stuck on mobile version of the game.
title: Great Open World

review: I want to start by saying I love this game. The characters, gameplay, storyline, and scenery are all great, however the game is not very F2P friendly sometimes. To gurantee a 5 star character you want, you‚Äôd need to save up 180 fates, or ‚Äúpulls‚Äù, and certain characters are only good with constellations, requiring even more pulls. To get a 5* character to the max constellation unlock, it could take over 1000 pulls. On another note, there is the weapon banner. On the weapon banner, you need 80 pulls to gurantee any 5 star weapon, and 270 to gurantee the weapon you want.  Specific 4 star characters and weapons are never guranteed, even though you get a random 4 star every at least 10 pulls. As an f2p player, you have to miss out on many characters to gurantee the one you most want.
title: Good game, but requires you to spend money

review: I have been playing this game for 2 years and I just now got a five star character. While my friend has been playing for way less time and has gotten 3 five stars. I think the wish system should be less random, and there should be a wishlist on which character you want so you have a higher chance of getting that character. I also think it should be easier to get primo gems, or make the wishes cost less primo gems. Also, you should be able to get guaranteed characters if you pay. Say five dollars for a four star, and 10 dollars for a five star? I just think the wish system is very flawed and need to be reviewed. Other than that the game is great! Honestly it is my favorite mobile game, and the only problem is the wish system (which is unfortunately a big problem.))
title: Make the wish system better!!!!!

review:
I really like this game. I play it with my friends, the story is great and so are the graphics. Over all a really nice game. The one thing I have to complain about is how much storage it takes upüíÄ. You have to delete almost half the apps you have downloaded on your phone, most of your pictures, and MAYBE you‚Äôll be able to load your resource data after an update. It‚Äôs ridiculous. It takes an hour and a half to update the game and like 30 minutes to load the resources and right at the end it warns you that you don‚Äôt have enough storage!? Storage for what? It‚Äôs not like I‚Äôm storing a missile in my files. Roblox takes like 8 seconds to update and it has more stuff than Genshin Impact ever will.
All I am saying is that Genshin needs to fix how big their games are and how much storage they take up, it‚Äôs a good game I just think that the storage issue is silly.
title: Good game, way too much storage.

review: Dude‚Ä¶ Genshin impact is like if animal crossing, standard battle game, and amazing graphics all had a kid and then enhanced times a thousand. It‚Äôs amazing. BEAUTIFUL graphics, a massive world to explore, a ton of characters, and so much more for FREE makes it an easy best-of-all-time. It‚Äôs not even pay to win, you can ofc pay for primos and things, but it‚Äôs definitely not required or needed to advance. The character designs are immaculate, and the whole concept of the game is just brilliant. I‚Äôm not at a high AR, about 25 or so, so my quests are piled up pretty high at the moment‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve heard that higher ARs don‚Äôt get many quests/things to do though‚Ä¶ but with the new update i think things will get better! If the devs keep up the spectacular work, and use fan input, this game could become even better than it alr is. :)

Genshin impact is a great game. It‚Äôs pretty good for people that has gambling addiction hahah. I am very grateful for the free rewards and how it‚Äôs f2p (free to play) friendly. 
Why not a five star rating review? It‚Äôs because sometimes the game can be frustrating. 
The artifact and wishing system is great and all, but I have a little complaint. 
Artifact system: it‚Äôs good and makes perfect sense, but why not give the players a gadget (that we can get from an event) that lets us have better rolls? For example, I want an artifact to roll into crit damage. I will equip the gadget, then the screen will be my inventory. I will need to click on the artifact that I want to roll into crit damage. After I click the artifact then press ‚Äúconfirm‚Äù, the next roll will roll into crit damage. 
Wishing system: sometimes it can be really disappointing‚Ä¶ like losing the 50/50. I lost the 50/50 with every character. Why not lower the hard pity to 80? It can be easier (because we free to plays don‚Äôt have much primogems haha) and more exciting to roll. The weapon banner system is really‚Ä¶ not free to play friendly. How about make the weapon banner‚Äôs system just like the character banner‚Äôs system? 
Sorry for the long review. I recommend you play this game if you have lots of free time or want something to motivate you.
title: Great game!

review:
FIRST, i am a paying player.
very generous and very happy to support good developers.

MUCH about this game is simply amazing...
next gen AAA title for tablets and phones.
graphics 10
audio 10
combat 10
characters and voice acting 10
design and polish 10 
controls 8 (need controller support on tablets)
story and events 8 (lots to do, much repetitive)
crafting 6 (simple, but useful)

game is ideal for those that just want to explore!
VERY large world, good story, cool characters!
...
Sadly, the shine does wear off soon...
the 'oh look... found another tree' gets old quick.
customization 0 (does not exist)
loot 0 (100% of loot is ingredient, no useful equipment)
armor 0 (does not exist)
weapons 0 (100% of weapons looted are junk... ingredients)
skills 4 (each character only 2 skills, no skill trees. 6 perks to unlock but require duplicate characters.)
...
for me, after a while the lack of loot and meaningful rewards hurts ... 
LOTS to explore, NOTHING worth finding. 
virtually everything you get as loot is either trash or ingredients... there is no real 'loot'. 
game DESPERATELY needs better loot/rewards.
SPECIALLY at mid to high levels.
make exploration FUN and REWARDING... not pointless.
add some randomized "useful" loot in the world. (ie 4 star min).
add weapons with 'effects' or bonus stats to the world.
add some minor cosmetic items to earn or find.
title: beautiful, vast, bug free ..... epic exploration!  BUT...

review: This game is pretty good! I‚Äôm surprised it‚Äôs free without a bunch of ads and pay-to-win stuff everywhere. Any other app would lock stories, features or characters behind money locks where you must pay, but everything is free and gives you sooo much to do. Very pretty world and nice character design. The mechanics are easy enough on all platforms but I just have 1 complaint: the stamina. It‚Äôs a bit low, youre average human can swim/run/climb for more than 20 seconds. Especially swimming, I drown when Im in the middle of a lake. Also, I dont think there should be stamina while gliding, the glider is doing all the work. Unless different gliders have longer stamina? It‚Äôs not much of a complaint, it doesnt get in the way of gameplay. I dont have much complaints for this. Good job, 10/11
title: My First 5 star

review: The game is great. Well, at least for the first few weeks of gameplay. Good graphics, interesting story, entertaining characters. So why am I giving it a 1 star review? Terrible updates, painfully annoying gacha system that only works out of pure luck (you could pay hundreds and thousands of dollars and it would never guarantee an item you‚Äôd want to get), and don‚Äôt even get me started on the recent anniversary ‚Äúevents‚Äù. We didn‚Äôt even get a special character or interesting new storyline. There are other things too, such as random glitches, horrible fishing system, overly difficult quests and tasks that give no hints as to what you‚Äôre supposed to do, excruciatingly long amounts of unnecessary and uninteresting dialogue, and unending cycles of spending hours and hours just to buy a single wish, only for it to be another 3 star sword that you already have. So in summary, if you want to have a few weeks of fun, then eventually realize that the game is just not all that great, go for it.
title: The game is amazing‚Ä¶ for little while

review: It‚Äôs a great game with good graphics, but it‚Äôs disappointing. Incredibly hard for F2P (free to play) players to get enough Primogems to get characters. The rewards for reaching AR 50 and up are incredibly unfair considering how long it takes to level up. The resin system is slow and it takes way too long to raise characters and weapons due to that. Daily commissions and the Welkin pass don‚Äôt even equal one wish a day. The company is also terrible at communicating with their players and community. The most recent story for the new region Inazuma seemed rushed and boring. They made it out to be much more than it was going to be. Most recently is the one year anniversary rewards, they are like a slap in the face. Players have spent millions of dollars, and hundreds of hours on this game. They deserve more. The company doesn‚Äôt take criticism and doesn‚Äôt listen to players valid complaints. Overall this game used to be fun but now the company seems to be money hungry and seems to have completely disregarded their players and the community.
title: Disappointed

review: Super fun. I recommend watching a few tips for beginners when you start so you know the best ways to use your resources. If you play a few hours a day you will level up pretty quickly, however never rush! Spend your time focusing on your current characters and how you can make them stronger ‚Äî rather than leveling up higher because you‚Äôll seriously regret it. The higher your AR rank is, the harder your world level will be. The scenery of this game is beautiful as well as the music for each area. A lot of detail was put into making this game and I really love that. Co-oping is available except for when you do the main story quests and a few world quests. Have fun and don‚Äôt feel obligated to spend!! Save your money and don‚Äôt fall into gacha gambling!!!
title: Warning you will be a gacha addict

title: I think they would add character trading

review: I am in love with this game! The graphics are amazing and so far I have had zero lag, it runs smoothly. It reminds me of BOTW, but better. I really love the game mechanics, combat, and exploring. I do wish that there were avatar customization options for the traveler, I‚Äôd love to be able to dress them up and really make them ‚Äúmy‚Äù character. Having event outfits and accessories would add a lot of fun, and more things to collect and work towards. Also mounts to earn and collect would be pretty amazing. I really appreciate that I can play it on my phone and the pc, it is really nice being able to play on two systems. If you like BOTW, beautiful open world exploration, cooking and crafting, collecting characters and unlocking interesting lore and stories, get this game!!! I think anyone that enjoys rpgs will enjoy Genshin Impact.
title: Best mobile RPG ever!

review: I am I‚Äôm love with this game as someone who always is looking for a new game that‚Äôs exciting has great animation and that has a compelling story that makes me want to follow it and played more to find outWhat was gonna happen this is the game this is a game of been waiting for for years like I have no words for how beautifully it‚Äôs animated the voice actors that are in it like some other voice actors also voiced in some of the best animes out there and that‚Äôs not even it just everything flow so smoothly my only complaint would be is that lag sometimes is if you‚Äôre in like a bottle with more than like three or four like Hillitrils or creatures like that but other than that it‚Äôs really beautiful there‚Äôs a lot of really cute character is a lot of really relatable story lines the jokes are pretty funny and all the characters look amazing
title: I have no words

review:
This game is so much better than I ever thought a mobile game could be. My fianc√© and I are obsessed. I‚Äôve played 60 dollar games that weren‚Äôt so well made. Absolutely amazing.

Edit.

Once you get to about adventure rank 30 (took my fianc√© about a week and I‚Äôm almost there) the game time gates you hard with the energy system in the game known as resin. You will get to a point where you login and use your resin and do your dailies and you won‚Äôt be able to grind end game content until your energy refills (and it‚Äôs very slow). I still think this is an incredible game that I would recommend checking out but unless changes are made to that system I think a lot of people will lose interest because they literally keep you from playing the game.
title: I changed my review and here‚Äôs why.

review:
Honestly, the thing about me is that I play games if their story sparks an interest, like Halo for example. And from what I‚Äôve saw, it looks good, and I was right! This has such a unique and beautiful art style, the likes of which make me want to recreate it in Blender and such. Its gameplay is really good with the bursts and such, and characters are unique, and you can tell by their amazing VA‚Äôs and designs. 

Though, my main complaints are how sometimes, the enemies will attack and get you stuck in a ‚Äúanimation stun‚Äù where‚Äîfor example‚Äîa ruin guard would start to spin and it would keep attacking you immediately after the knock back animation.

Overall, I would recommend the game to those who like an interesting story and good characters like Zhongli, the Shogun and Ei, and many others.

The AppStore says it‚Äôs 3GB but then you have to download another 20GB just for game data since the map is so huge and there is so much to explore. title: Amazing‚Ä¶ but gacha system needs work

review: Now I‚Äôve been playing Genshin since October of 2021, however, I tried to play it back in 2020 but got bored of it very fast, but then got back into it a year later. I‚Äôve spent a pretty good penny (SO MUCH) over the years but mostly in 2021 since I began to gain an addiction to it. The pre events were very fun and enjoy to read through and do, but now it‚Äôs been getting pretty boring; even the characters (new). Maybe it‚Äôs just me getting bored of the game but even so the new characters being presented just are not appealing to me at all. Now location wise I really enjoy Liyue and etc, but Sumeru is just boring to me and I feel like too much is going on in that area. Sometimes the events can be fun, but it‚Äôs very few now. Lastly, if you would like to play this game please do you might find it enjoyable but don‚Äôt really spend 1000s of dollars in this game because it gets repetitive after awhile.
title: Gets Stale

review:
In my opinion, Genshin is a very visually pleasing game. There are many cool-looking places to take a screenshot, or to just sit and look at. The devs did a very good job on the music and visuals. But, the places to explore are pretty boring. There are basically only 3 things to explore throughout the entire world, a flat grassland, a forest, and a mountain. The game feels very repetitive and copy-pasted. The puzzles are pretty bad too. The puzzles don‚Äôt feel like puzzles, they feel like annoying chores you have to do to progress in the game.

The enemies are also repetitive. It‚Äôs fun to fight a boss the first time, but it gets very annoying to fight the same boss throughout the entire game, but with a longer kill time. You could fight any boss in the game at level 1. Doing less damage or having worse gear doesn‚Äôt make the bosses harder, it just makes them take longer to defeat.
The crappy combat doesn‚Äôt help the game either.
The combat is very spammy. All you have to do is attack and dodge, and it gets very boring. 

This game is a very obvious copy of Breath of the Wild, but worse in terms of gameplay. In BOTW you had many ways to kill enemies, but in Genshin, there‚Äôs occasionally a barrel to avoid spamming through a whole fight, but that‚Äôs it.

Gameplay deserves 2 stars, but the visuals bring it up to a 3.
title: Good visuals and music, but not fun after a while

review:
I would have given this a four and a half star review, but unfortunately thats not possible. I love this game, and realy, I‚Äôve fallen for the undeniably amzing graphics. There are, however, prices to pay for that. While the graphics are wonderful, fully downloading the game takes up about a sixth of my current storage. I‚Äôm unable to download more than a few games at a time in order to keep myself in the range of my overall storage. I believe this is due to the high quality graphics and voicovers.

Other than that, my only complaint is that there is no trade system between non-npc players. I would love to trade characters and food, as well as barter and sell things for in game currency. 

The game also, while having a wonderful friend and co-op system, does not save quest progress in co-op, which is arguably the reason most people quickly obtain it. I know that I worked twice as hard to unlock adventure rank 16 just so I could get help on some of my quests, which ended up being for nearly nothing.

The quests are amazing and captivating, rewarding and fun. I have fun runninv theough temples and solving puzzels in my free time. This game is extremely rewarding, addictive, and fun. From wishing for new characters, to making mushroom skewers, this game has much to offer.

title: genshin fell off

review: This game is trash. After 2 full years of trying to love this game, it‚Äôs only failed me miserably. The developers don‚Äôt fix issues other than nerfing characters that you worked hard/paid for. Whats the point in nerfing a single player game? Idk‚Ä¶They don‚Äôt value your time or money. You get half a pull per day doing dailies and your drops are still terrible at the latest of the stages of the game. There is hardly any coop and quests simply don‚Äôt work in Coop mode. Additionally, enemies get scaled to become much more difficult without any increase in loot in coop. Save your life and money. I‚Äôm considered a pretty moderate whale because I‚Äôve invested my time and money into getting the things I‚Äôve wanted in this game In hopes for more. However,  after all these countless hours and honestly money invested, I can finally say that the developers are greedy and only want you to spend, spend, and spend. If they ban me for this review, I will charge back my card as it was false advertising.
title: Don‚Äôt waste your time or money.

review: Listen. Genshin Impact is a great game. The devs made it possible so everyone could play this game for free. IMAGINE if it were a paid game and cost money. title: Awesome game

review:
By far one of the greediest gotchas I have ever played with its low rates, lack of primos (end game), no daily log in rewards, a stamina system (resin)that is so bad, and content that is not only temporary but also time gated, so even when you do have time to play you cannot complete the event in one sitting ( I can see a couple reasons why they do this, but as a person who doesn‚Äôt have so much free time it is a huge inconvenience)   I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this game to almost any just due to the amount of time you would have to invest and how lucky you would need to be, you are better off playing a different game or reading a book or doing literally anything else.

P.S a word of advice for if you do decide to get the game because it looks great or you like the characters and the story please do not spend money on this game you would have to spend 300$+ to get anything guaranteed and if you are playing on mobile not only will this take up over half of your phones space it will also melt your phone.

review: This game is so fun, there are so many things you can do daily even after you finish the storyline that's out so far. The gacha system seems somewhat fairer than some other games, except for how you buy wishes. On your second buy of the most expensive primogems, you don't get enough gems for 90 wishes, which guarantees you a 5* character. Also, you can't earn enough primogems in ONE DAY for one wish. you usually earn like, 60 primogems just from daily quests when you need 100 more for one wish. If the price was lowered, a LITTLE bit more, like instead of 160 it was like, 100, that would be better. but yeah, the way is to get you to buy things. so if you're as peeved about this as me, toss in your hat and buy the moon blessing and get 90 primos extra a day.

review:
I‚Äôm playing on PC, which is identical to the mobile game, and so far it‚Äôs pretty great. The story is engaging and there‚Äôs tons to do outside the story. I‚Äôm still very new to the game at adventure rank 12, but I‚Äôve put in probably about 10 hours. My progress is very slow, because there‚Äôs just so much to explore that I keep getting sidetracked wandering around the map finding new things midway through the story missions.

As far as p2w elements, I‚Äôm sure this game has them, but at my level of progression, it‚Äôs hardly even noticeable. To get new characters, it seems you have no choice but to pay for premium currency or whatever, but even with only the characters you get for free, it still feels like I‚Äôm playing premium game.

Also, my phone won‚Äôt run this game, but it‚Äôll run on pretty much any PC with integrated graphics.

title: I love the gameü•∞! but this is stupid.

review: I can‚Äôt stress how good this game is. The mechanics are amazing and I have yet to find a noticeable flaw in any part of it. This games open world concept and diversity of characters and powers reminds me a lot of Skyrim or Fable. The voice acting is enjoyable and I like the plot that has been given. Of course something I notice over and over again that I absolutely love is how the characters don‚Äôt necessarily run out of materials. Like how Amber doesn‚Äôt need to stack up on arrows because she materializes them with no usage of stamina. This game is easy going and very beautiful and detailed. I also haven‚Äôt come across a point where I get tired of playing, everything about this game is addicting and entrances me every second. By far has become my favorite game I have ever played on a mobile device even if it‚Äôs a large app.
title: Best game in a while

review: You‚Äôll start this game out thinking it‚Äôs just a good looking game that borrowed breath of the wild‚Äôs mechanics, but once you get into it, you‚Äôll realize how stupefyingly amazing this game is. This masterpiece has tons of great voice acting, an in depth intriguing story, and a well made combat system. This game is jam packed with spectacular locations, beautiful architecture, and interesting quests. The map may very well be as big as breath of the wild. Character movement is fluid and combat feels perfect. So many different towns that put breath of the wild‚Äôs four tiny villages to shame. With different architecture types and so many interesting places to visit. This game kills my battery but it‚Äôs worth it. Even just the landscapes are spectacular. I really can‚Äôt heap enough praise onto this game. Definitely the best mobile game I‚Äôve ever seen.
title: Unbelievable

review:
Ok so I‚Äôd normally play mobile games but as I was searching for game to play with a friend came across this one. Ended up playing for 4 hours when I was on way to snooze town. Now it‚Äôs a game I‚Äôm gonna be playing in between mmorpgs I play on my pc. 

So what makes this game really great is anyone who into Zelda will instantly get nostalgic feelings as it will remind any Zelda fans about Zelda. Due to Graphics and the overall plot even though it‚Äôs kinda mundane as in the plot it‚Äôs going with is like any other game like it. But normally it‚Äôs hard to screw up this type of plot so it always good. 

So the combat is really interesting you first select between 2 siblings to play as. Then once your through the first couple introduction quests you get your first combat companion, what is a fire elemental archer. But unlike traditional games were they out in the open world there not around. Because you got to switch to said character to use them in combat. Personally think it‚Äôs unique but honestly don‚Äôt like it but it is unique so whatever. 

Personally hope it comes to either steam or epic game store because being able to play on pc or even on my Xbox. Would make playing the game 10x easier as I‚Äôm not accustomed to mobile games but do enjoy checking them out.
title: Great mobile Game

review:
I love this game so much!! The bad reviews don‚Äôt even have a reason to be rated like that. Just because you didn‚Äôt get the character you wanted doesn‚Äôt mean you can take out on the devs. It‚Äôs completely randomized, guys. They don‚Äôt monitor and pick every wish individually. 
     Anyway, I love the new event that was just released! I‚Äôm so, so glad Arlecchino is playable! I love her character so much. I hope the Damselette (Columbina) is the next playable Harbinger to be released! I love her design (as we‚Äôve seen it) and can‚Äôt wait to know more about her specifically.
     Although, I am slightly disappointed that we didn‚Äôt see Dainslef in Fontaine, as I enjoy his quests and the Traveler chapters the most, the Archon Quest made up for it in every way possible.
     In summary: Great app! Keep up the good work!

review: I'm gonna keep this short cuz I'm not one for reading long reviews personally, but a lot of characters seem to be forgotten or just plain out filler. review: This game I downloaded since 2020 has been the light of my day every time. I love the riddles and the exploration and how many plot lines there are and how they make so much sense. Exploration has been my things since I don‚Äôt know how long and being able to play this game is everything I need. The music, the scenery is all so beautiful. The creativity they must‚Äôve had to make a game this well developed and entertaining but able to make you figure out stuff on your own and understand difficult situations is even better. title: Best game I‚Äôve ever played.

review: I love this game. It always puts a smile on my face just doing daily commissions because the game is so fun to play. I truly love how beautiful the game is, I sometimes get lost in the beauty of the world around me. My favorite spot for sightseeing has got to by Liyue harbor, I sometimes like to switch to characters from Liyue and do a photo shoot there because it is so breathtaking. The quests are almost endless and even though I am AR 55 I still have not finished every major quest in the game. I also love how you can get so invested in characters, just learning about them and discovering which ones you like best. It is breathtaking and I appreciate it so much. If you are still considering downloading the game after reading this review, what are you waiting for? Go for it! You will not regret it.
title: A phenomenal game.

review:
This game had so much potential to be amazing when it first came out. But all of that potential was squandered and isn‚Äôt being used anymore by hoyoverse. If they care about anxiety then they should remove 50/50 from the limited banners because it gives players anxiety or they should have system to where they add a way to get the character(s) you want without going through 50/50 like how they have the chart course thing for the weapons, they should do that with the characters as well. Plus from what I heard Sumeru is filled with stereotypes, I‚Äôm not middle eastern or SWANA but I feel bad for players that are. I am annoyed with the lack of black/dark skin characters since I am Blasian and it infuriates me that there are only 4 characters that barley even look like my skin tone, with closest one being Xinyan who is called ‚Äúscary‚Äù for her rock star theme attire by the people of Liyue harbor. Please add more diversity and please fix the banners Hoyoverse.

title: They don‚Äôt care

review:
i don‚Äôt know how anyone can give this game less than 5 stars. i‚Äôve been craving a good mobile game that is console-like & genshin impact delivers. open world, main quests, side quests, combat, puzzles, backstory, graphics/scenery, for goodness sake even the soundtrack is amazing. the best part? unlike most console games, the developers keep adding more gameplay. i‚Äôm talking whole chunks of land with new characters, enemies, mechanisms & of course quests! oh & it's free! absolutely no ads & no need to spend $1. i honestly want to give the devs money just bc lol. TYSM for this gem üôè

if i was forced to criticize, i wish all doors could be opened. atm, it‚Äôs rare to be able to go inside a building. it doesn‚Äôt need to be over the top with chests & NPCs. it just make the gamers feel more immersed & adds more to exploration.
title: BEST mobile game

review: I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact since the release of the game back in 2020 and was always defending the company whenever people had issues with Hoyoverse, but after the 1st anniversary it was obvious they didn‚Äôt really care for their international fanbase outside of China. Although the game itself is high quality and fun, to me it‚Äôs distasteful when sumeru is coming up and is clearly influenced by South Asia or Middle Eastern regions but the characters are as pale as paper, while this itself isn‚Äôt a huge issue if you look at it alone since some people from those regions do have pale skin; the issue is that when you look at almost all the characters there are only 2 out of 50+ characters are tanned or dark skinned while the majority is fairly pale. Many POC‚Äôs are just asking for some representation and accuracy especially when majority of the characters have at least some cultural significance in their outfit designs. I hope they will listen to the fanbase soon and fix this issue.
title: How long will it take for some diversity?

review: This game is very fun. I cant lie, it very detailed, the quests are fun, co-op with your friends is also fun. But there a lots of things that MUST be worked on. Number one, the amount of storage this game takes up. Now this may nit be a problem for people who have lots of storage. But when I play on a iPad that only has 32GB it‚Äôs completely unplayable it‚Äôs so hard to play without worrying about your storage, I have deleted the game many time and have re downloaded it many times as well, just to play. Not to mention the pity system it not the best. F2P people have a hard time reaching pity and now even knowing if they will win the 50/50. Also when playing on mobile devices, when trying to log on the geo element takes a long time to load. And did I forget to mention? You are always being kicked out of the game. It is very annoying and not fun to deal with. MIHOYO PLEASE FIX THIS!!
title: It‚Äôs good but..

review:
First let me say this game is an amazing game. The story is a great story and is worth every bit of time sunk into the game. 

Second of all, to everyone that is going to give a 1 star rating for 1 year anniversary rewards. Take a chill pill. Mihoyo doesn‚Äôt owe anyone anything. Honestly, they are giving way more than other gatcha games out there on their 1 YEAR anniversary. 10 wishes is more than plenty to everyone. Stop bash rating a game just because you are unhappy about something that a developer decides to give away for free when they could literally make you pay $30+ for the exact same thing! Not only that, but Mihoyo could have simply given us nothing! Take a chill pill and stop bash rating a game for something they are giving you for free.
title: Ignore everyone trashing about the rewards!

review:
I have been playing Genshin Impact since it was released and am currently halfway through AR56! I have rarely had problems with lag except when my internet was being bad or something like that (although I do have the Iphone 12 Pro Max so that might be a bit more why). However, I also used to play on my Iphone 8+ and it still worked just as good! 

While there are definitely some annoying things about Genshin Impact (hard to farm for primos at later levels, not-so-great English translations, bad weapon banner drop rates, etc), it is still a very fun game!

I recommend that if you‚Äôve just started playing, to really take your time with it! Enjoy farming and doing quests, don‚Äôt rush too much or you might regret it! It‚Äôs truly a great game that I absolutely adore :)
title: Amazing Game

review: My iPad is only a year old and struggles to play cinematics at all. Many issues on the speed and performance. I did download it on my ps4 and so far I love it. I am still new to the game but so far it feels like it has the potential to be a masterpiece. It reminds me of several games, including breath of the wild, but it also has its own unique vibe that is pretty fun. Paimon can be annoying at times, mainly for the constant reference to herself in the third person. Again though this game has pulled me away from some big triple a titles, as well as others like warframe. My only fear is that it may get a bit repetitive, like warframe did. However I love the freeroam, it helps with that issue. Over all, a great game highly recomend, ifyou have a console, or the newest and best tablets/phones to play on.
title: Doesn‚Äôt work well on ipad 6th gen, but it is GREAT still

review: It‚Äôs a nice game, and if your okay with a game that takes up about 30 something GB then I recommend it. It was pretty easy to get into for me and the character designs are very pretty and the large open world map was really cool! I did have to end up deleting it because it took up all my space on my device and as broke and anxious middle schooler I didn‚Äôt wanna ask my parents to buy me more storage just to keep it, but I still have my HoyoVerse account so if I get a device I can download it on with a lot of space I can log in with my account and pick up where I last left off, which I really like. What I‚Äôm trying to say is that it‚Äôs a good game but I think you should only get it if you put enough time into the game to justify the amount of space it takes up.
title: I like the game, but it takes up to much space

review:
Hands down this is the best game I have ever played!!! I love the characters, love the design, I love the fact I get to run up to the enemy and actually fight it myself instead of just pressing a button and it hits it for you, I can time where ever I want and have so many awesome things to do in the game, not gonna lie so many hot characters to with crazy backstories, there is no way to get bored in this game, there are sooo many cool quests and so much detail in the game it gets you hooked!!! If your looking for a really awesome game that will keep your attention, look no further.. ‚ÄúGENSHIN IMPACT‚Äù is the game
For you!!! This game is by far the best game I have played since segas sonic the hedgehog, mortal combat, etc‚Ä¶ back when sega was cool!! Its whole story line is amazing!!!! My whole family plays‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüî•üî•
title: Best game of all time

title: Stuck at that one challenge‚Ä¶or challenges

review: I‚Äôve played genshin for a while and have seen how events and updates are managed and while things will naturally get stale at a later point in the game, there is a lot that can‚Äôt be solved through events. To my knowledge there are around 50 unique playable characters in genshin however only two of the cast have a different skin tone from the majority. This issue is also incredibly apparent within npc design as well, where no one has a complexion that varies from pale. For a game with such a massive audience and focus on culture, lack of representation and diversity seriously drains the life from the game. Obviously none of the countries are replicas of real ones however seeing places like Mondstadt, Liyue, and Inazuma take inspiration from actual places on earth makes it even more disappointing for events to have no diversity in skin tone when they have npcs from Sumeru. This can easily be added
title: It gets tiring

review: I‚Äôve been playing since xiao‚Äôs first banner released in 2021 and I‚Äôve sunk quite a bit of money into this game, so it was a big deal for me to delete it. The main reason for this was size. The game was taking up 23 GB in my phone- over a third of my total storage space and 10x the space anything else I had downloaded. That alone wasn‚Äôt a problem bc it ran fine before the update, but when the 2.7 update came out it wouldn‚Äôt update no matter how much stuff I deleted, making the app unusable for me. Another main issue was the lack of late game content. Even before this problem with the update I had not been logging in consistently bc there simply wasn‚Äôt anything to do but farm. I‚Äôll likely get the pc version once I have my pc up and running, but it‚Äôs still very frustrating since I preferred the mobile gameplay
title: Just deleted after playing for over a year

review:
1. The ability to block incoming attacks there is a meter/gauge for how many attacks you can block before the enemy breaks the guard and if you block at the right time you can parry the attack and deal the same amount of damage that your enemy was about to deal. 

2. The ability to dodge incoming attacks instead of having to dash/run to avoid the attack there can be perfect dodging that slows down time (just like it was in Honkai Impact). 

3. The ability to interact with things such as boats so you can conserve stamina and using specific characters ability‚Äôs to move around like how the traveler (you the player) can make a tornado the tornado can be used to fly up in the air or maybe even be thrown around but the you can only do that when you‚Äôre not in a battle.
title: Adding mechanics

review: I recommend this game whenever I talk to people and am totally obsessed with Razor. The scenery, plot line, character design, and more are so breath taking you‚Äôre sure to be frozen in admiration. I love the serenitea pot and how it serves as a perfect getaway to interact with your favorite characters and creatures. However, the primogems are overpriced and barely get you anywhere in the game despite being needed to advance. I finished the existing archon quests within half a month and am looking for things to do. I can‚Äôt earn primo gems even though a ton of them are needed to do even the tiniest thing. I don‚Äôt have the kind of money YouTubers have ( I can‚Äôt afford to spend thousands of dollars on a game just to risk not even getting the character -which is supposedly common- I want).
title: I really love this game but...

review: So the game itself is really amazing. So far I love the characters, the storyline, everything. But, lately, I've been having issues when I'm fighting. If I stray too far from the original point of the fight, the monster I am fighting will stop fighting me and walk away, and when i chase after it, all its hp will suddenly regenerate. This is a huge problem when it comes to fighting the lawachurls or the ruin hunters. Second, lately there's been a glitch when i try to play any domains. After a certain point, monsters stop appearing. Even though they won't appear, the timer will not stop and the monster count won't tell me I'm done. So I end up failing the challenges. This happened while I was in the Midsummer Courtyard and while I was in the Spiral Abyss.
title: Amazing story and characters, but

review: Ok here goes. I made an account in May of 2021. And then I proceeded to quit an hour later. Come November of 2021 I‚Äôm pretty bored. I decided to download genshin on the ps4 and started from scratch. I ended up playing for 15 hours then quitting. Then November 2022 comes around and I want raiden shogun. I manage to find my old account and pull her. And I quit. Feb 2023 I end up using my PlayStation account (the newer one) and get lucky and get Hu Tao. I play for a bit. Then I quit. And then I get Furina in like November(on the ps account), and then I end up playing a bit and then quitting for star rail. Then I get a ps5 for Christmas install genshin and end up blowing 60 hours in like 3 weeks. Long story short, this is the kind of game that makes me log on because something new was added and then log off for months until something new comes.
title: Genshin is a game.

review: I play on pc but hop on my phone from time to time. This game is addicting, the world is beautiful and amazing. The story is intriguing, gameplay is ehhh but still fun (but I predict the gameplay might die down in the future). Although this is a gatcha game the chances you‚Äôll get someone good isn‚Äôt rigged. A lot of my friends including me started with really good starter characters (Xingling, fischil, and Barbara) without having to pay a single dollar and two of them even got venti. Other people might have their horror stories of exaggerating saying they remade 10+ accounts for good characters but I highly doubt it since I got it on my second re roll and my friends never had to. The game is still in the works but gosh is it amazing. Always something to do and isn‚Äôt promoting its stuff to say (HEY BUY THIS BUY THAT) like other obnoxious mobile games. I recommend playing on pc since the graphics and control is more interactive and visually pleasing if you have a pc.
title: For a game that‚Äôs known to make average mobile games this is actually a keeper

review: I downloaded this game just to play every once in while like when i‚Äôm bored and just need something to play. I have a fair amount of open space in my phone, not too many photos, or apps, but when i downloaded the game, it asked me to free up space. Yeah, sure, okay, makes sense because this game isn‚Äôt exactly for mobile. But LORD HAVE MERCY, this game was asking me to throw away my whole LIFE for space on my phone for me to even be able to play the game. Also, I get it, the game is basically endless, but god. But, when i did have space, I actually played the game and enjoyed the storyline and everything. A very satisfying game, but, this game asks for a LOT of attention if i need to throw away everything else just to play it. But, if you do have space on your phone, totally, play this game. Amazing. But it might be better to just play on pcüòºüëçüèº

review: Not gonna lie, when my cousin first introduced the game to me, I was little skeptical cause I‚Äôve never played a game like this before, but it all changed quickly after I saw Paimon‚Äôs little face. This, in my opinion, is probably one of the best games I‚Äôve ever played.
