One thing that‚Äôs kinda ehh for me is the fact that 50% of the community are simps and the other 50% are people obsessed with spending their money to swipe. There is that one part of the community tho which are the Twitch streamers. For example, Antony Chenn, Jake Tuonto, Dish, Asian guy streams also known as Atsu, Bwapp, and many more make the community amazing! So overall, I think the game is amazing!!
title: Amazing!

review: The game in total is beautiful and has amazing grapics. The pity system might be a little crabby, but that‚Äôs the fun part about the game! Even if you don‚Äôt get the character you want, there are re-runs and in the meantime you can farm artifacts for your favorite characters. Everything about genshin impact is great. But it‚Äôs just the people on the game making it harder sometimes. There are toxic people in the game and they can be really mean. But it‚Äôs online and you can just leave the game. This is why I love genshin impact. One more reason is the story quests and voice lines! The actors put in a lot of effort to have so many voice lines. It‚Äôs so crazy like the event with Clide and Xingyan, they have extra voice lines! That is a lot of work and that is why I love genshin impact!
title: Great game!

review: This game is fun and amazing for a game that‚Äôs free, I see a lot of complaints about how it‚Äôs not f2p, however, I‚Äôm a player that hasn‚Äôt spent anything on the game and I still have plenty of fun getting some of the characters I want. However, as a f2p player I don‚Äôt have the luxury of getting all the characters I want. It takes time to get all the primogems you need to get one wish (especially late game). Not to mention wanting to get a 5 star with no pity when it‚Äôs not even guaranteed you‚Äôll get it. For Hoyoverse, I think a great way to make the game better would be to either lower the price of wishes, or to give out more primos during events like anniversaries or maintenance. Especially since it‚Äôs already a very successful game that‚Äôs made a lot of money.
title: Love it!

review: My younger sister told me about this game after we were talking about our favorite type of games. I love questing and story line type of games. I haven‚Äôt gotten addicted to a game since wizard101 years ago. I downloaded this game at about 1 in the morning. I couldn‚Äôt stay off my phone until I made myself go to bed at 4:45 in the morning. The next morning I went right back on and started playing once again. I absolutely fell in love with this game. It is a game that keeps me entertained and it‚Äôs super helpful when it comes to questing. You do feel rage sometimes when playing because of certain bosses but it‚Äôa beyond worth it! Thank you to the creators of this game! It‚Äôs amazing! Keep up the great and hard work!!
title: Best game I have played on mobile

review:
I‚Äôve been playing Genshin Impact since it‚Äôs release in September of last year, I‚Äôve dedicated myself to the lore and quests and i‚Äôve had so much playing this game and can tell the artists and developers worked really hard on the story and plots.  I‚Äôve bought for Mihoyo many times, i‚Äôve spent hours upon hours on this game because it really is a fandom I enjoy being in. 

Yet now we have the anniversary and Mihoyo doesn‚Äôt reciprocate their player‚Äôs kindness. New players are granted ‚Äú free 20 pulls‚Äù and supposedly a guaranteed 5 star, when old players get thrown a bone and just deal with it. Mihoyo do better really, i‚Äôve never written reviews but even i‚Äôm upset about this. Millions of people have dedicated themselves to your games and even support your new releases, but we can‚Äôt get free primogems? It‚Äôs all we ask and you get money every single day, yet you‚Äôre throwing concerts (In the middle of Covid-19) and making music videos advertising your game when you don‚Äôt even respect what you have. 

This is obviously my opinion and if any new players are researching this i do advise you think about it before playing, sometimes even why you play you can lose interest and thats ok! But really think about devoting yourself to the game, because after a years worth of playing and progress ive made along the way doesn‚Äôt even seem worth it now.
I need to see better Mihoyo, really.

-Sunny :)
title: Think about it before playing:

review: Genshin is amazing don‚Äôt get me wrong, but there is one minor problem I have. That is that it takes up a lot of space on my device. I play on an I pad, and it runs great, yes. I have multiple other games on my I pad to so whenever I try to update genshin to fir the newest update AND to keep playing it, I end up getting a notification that I do not have enough space on my device. So then I end up having to delete a lot of other games and things I have in my I pad just to keep playing genshin, and most of the time I end up having to delete more important things on my I pad because I still will not have enough space. It‚Äôs a real bummer that I have to clean up a lot of space just to keep playing genshin. Yes I know it‚Äôs a great game and has great graphics yet its a real bummer having to do that.
title: Amazing! But‚Ä¶..

review:
The game is fun when you sink a lot of money into it, and I think that's the purpose.

The story takes too long to get through, then when you do get through it, you're stuck walking around the entire map trying to find chests or fighting the same boss for the tenth time that day to get materials to level up your character and/or weapons. (Items you can conveniently buy in the store)

The event menus get confusing because they put lock symbols over both parts that will come in a few days and parts that need a requisite mission (however if you've seen the message of "available in 2 days" before clicking on an event that needs a requisite mission, you often assume it's just gonna be available in a few days)

The characters started out pretty strong, you can remember them. However, newer characters? They don't feel as though they have unique personalities, they feel as though they've reskinned beloved characters hoping to get people to throw their money at the new ones too. It would be more preferable if they focused on the characters they literally don't put into the storyline (like the One black character) than releasing the 10th polearm user.

Overall, I've sunk too much time into this game that I feel like I can't stop or it would've all been wasted. Don't fall into the same trap.
title: Massive grind, forgettable characters. Eh.

Just let me know if there another hovoverse game that takes up only around 10 gigabytes please. Everything else is awesome though. Including the person reading this. title: Would‚Äôve kept playing but‚Ä¶

There is a MULTITUDE of things to do. People might say ‚Äúoh, finding treasure is to hard, puzzles are too hard, getting good artifacts is too hard‚Äù that‚Äôs exactly what makes this game fun. title: Im Playing until the final cutscene

review:
i got this game off a recommendation from a friend and i think they created a monster. i‚Äôve had genshin for around 6 months. i‚Äôm AR 42 and could say i have pretty good luck with the gacha system.

the graphics and music are incredible, as well as the team of voice actors. so much thought goes into the lore, world, and characters that it blows me away. i‚Äôm playing on the iphone se 2020 and my game barely lags. my friends with older phones experience some lag, but that‚Äôs to be expected. 

the gacha system- well- i have decent good luck (Diluc, Keqing, Zhongli, Jean) compared to my other friends who play. the game‚Äôs main currency, primogems, can be bought as genesis crystals then converted, or you can grind every day. personally, i‚Äôve never spend a cent on this game (f2p, let‚Äôs gooo) and i think if you‚Äôre willing to work hard and grind, you‚Äôll be fine. 

overall, the level of detail is astonishing. i can‚Äôt imagine ever NOT playing genshin haha. if you have an old phone, you might experience some lag, but genshin impact is 100% worth it. i recommend to anime fans like myself especially because of the japanese voice over ü§å the game is so well done and i love it. thanks mihoyo :D

title: A request

review:
It really does seem like a beautiful game, however, I can‚Äôt fully enjoy it. At first it ran kinda smoothly, the sky and surrounding terrain was completely black, so I couldn‚Äôt see anything besides the area around me. But once I got farther and had to actually fight, my entire screen went black so I couldn‚Äôt see anything. I logged in and out of my account, restarted my tablet, and did whatever I could to see something but my screen is still completely black. I can still run and attack, but I can‚Äôt see anything. The cut screens are also very glitchy, I can‚Äôt watch them without one of them stuttering and shorting out. So I have to log out and log back in every time it does :(
It‚Äôs such a beautiful game, but I really hope some of these bugs get fixed so I can enjoy it. I have an IPad 5th gen, so I don‚Äôt know if that‚Äôs the reason why it‚Äôs bugging out, but i really hope this gets worked on in the future.
title: Bugs

review:
Alright, so I pre-ordered this game a few months back, and now that I‚Äôm playing it, I‚Äôve noticed a few things. It feels, and plays, like a retextured version, of Zelda Breath Of The Wild! I‚Äôll list a couple of things I noticed...

1. The stamina bar, works exactly like the Zelda games‚Äô stamina bar, and when you climb something, it‚Äôs undoubtedly similar.

2. The storyline is even similar, a person who is close to the protagonist, gets captured by this godlike being, and it‚Äôs your job to rescue that person.

3. The game has gliders, literally gliders, they function the exact way the gliders in Zelda do.

4. When you switch over to a different character, such as someone with a bow, it works the same way as in Zelda, and with a tank class, if you hold down the attack button, it will send you spinning as a special attack, and eats up your stamina, oh, and guess what? It works the same way as Zelda.

5. The enemies? They almost aren‚Äôt even retextured, they just all look the same as the enemies from Zelda.

6. The game, is fun, and has an engaging storyline nevertheless, but it only has so little unique features to not get a lawsuit from Nintendo. Overall, fun game, but a little sus on the original side. 
 
-Your friend,
  Grimm

title: Forget the bad reviews

review: Genshin impact is a great game with good lore and interactive gameplay however the hatch‚Äôs system ruins it. It kills off a players motivation. When you pull for a character there should not be a 50/50 a one in 90 chance is small enough and by putting in 50/50 the chances of getting the character that you want is 1/180 chance. I spent 5 bucks on this game but I‚Äôm not spending a cent more. Why should I? When I know I‚Äôm not even going to get the character that I want. The artifact system is even worse. Not only is it difficult getting the artifact you want impossible to get good stats and substats are a complete scam. RNG ON TOP OF RNG ON TOP OF RNG is too much. The devs should try playing their own game and feel the frustration of grinding weeks only to get a duplicate of a character you don‚Äôt want. Kills off players joy.

title: I don‚Äôt want to leave this review

review: I‚Äôve been playing genshin impact for about half a year now. In the beginning, it was fun and relatively easy- it was also easier to get primogems - I think you all know where this is going. As you progress, it becomes harder and harder to get the five star character you want and the game can start to feel like a chore. Unlike some people, I do enjoy grinding, though the resin system stops me from doing it all at once. The visuals are gorgeous, and overall it‚Äôs a really nice experience when you start playing. I see a lot of complaints about the odds of the gacha system, and that‚Äôs it‚Äôs a quick cash grab for the company, but honestly you don‚Äôt need a five star to do well in the game until towards the end, which by then you will definitely have enough primogems. Overall, it was great in the beginning, less great towards the end.
title: Lack of endgame content

review: Yes the game takes up a lot of space but it‚Äôs really worth it. I mean- the lore is amazing and there‚Äôs little pieces of hidden stories if somebody took time to look into. Sure the gacha system might not give you what you want (me who lost every 50/50) but there‚Äôs always a rerun of characters. Some people just don‚Äôt have patience. The whole world exploring is fun and the quests are challenging to give you a actual experience that you won‚Äôt forget in a while. The cutscenes are amazing and the drawing animations are smooth! Though if you really want to download it make sure you have enough space, and also the games full story isn‚Äôt finish yet, just a heads up (and once you finish it all the grinding is kinda pain but it‚Äôs worth it)
title: My thought

review: In genshin impact there is a character named Xinyan. At first she seems like a perfect example of representation. But when you actually get her in the game she‚Äôs a walking talking stereotype. Her favorite dish is Spicy chicken, she‚Äôs seen as ‚Äúloud‚Äù and ‚Äúannoying‚Äù by people in Liyue. People are often afraid of her because of what she looks like. This isn‚Äôt the first time Hoyoverse has made a stereotypical black character. In their other game called Honkai there is another stereotypical character named Carol. She doesn‚Äôt like going out because she‚Äôs afraid of getting darker(as in skin tone) . Also in the webtoon for this game Carols mother makes an appearance. Carols mother is a dark skinned woman who is very stereotypical and a prime example of the SBW stereotype. As a black person who plays genshin impact, seeing how hoyoverse portrays people that look like me makes me feel uncomfortable. The game could go with out all of these stereotypes. The game could also go without slavery. But that‚Äôs a entirely different subject.
title: Stereotypical black character(s)

review:
I‚Äôve been an avid player since April 2021, have put hundreds of hours into this game and log in daily - it‚Äôs safe to say that I‚Äôm really passionate about genshin impact. yeah, I love the game as a whole, but among other issues such as little to no endgame content being added, there‚Äôs one more thing that sticks out.

everyone‚Äôs seen the sumeru leaks. usually I don‚Äôt stoop so low as to leave one star reviews for petty matters, but unlike the one year anniversary incident, this isn‚Äôt petty. this is about representation and blatant disrespect for middle eastern culture. I should never have held such high expectations for hoyoverse or the release of sumeru. the disappointment I feel is on me for having those expectations in the first place, especially when they‚Äôre directed at a company that shows no regard for variety in skin tone whatsoever, but I‚Äôm not alone in feeling it. all I can say is this: hoyoverse, do better. do your research before basing a whole nation off of real people and real cultures.

title: Addicting

review:
I write this on the game‚Äôs first anniversary, during the midst of that public relations debacle. I have played every day for over 6 months, and have in doing so completed every bit of content in the game, spending a little along the way to support the developer. Playing free is definitely doable, and would still grant a rewarding experience to anyone that does so - until you reach the nonexistent end game.

Yes the game is still in persistent development, and new content is being added regularly. However, there are many missing elements that are basics in modern games of this type, and has almost a complete lack of end game content! I submit ideas and changes regularly as feedback. With the resources the developer has accrued from their first year I sincerely hope they begin addressing content problems instead of continuing their marketing blitz.
title: Good start, no endgame

review: ive been playing this game since a few days after is came out in 2020 and mihoyo has got to be the greediest company i have ever seen in my life. this game is NOT f2p friendly in any sense of the word, and these recent anniversary gifts are just a joke. for those unaware, they locked the community rewards behind a gacha in which you have to provide free art and/or promotion of some way in order to enter (said community rewards are not even enough for one single pull). the in game rewards you ask? one 10 pull that you have to wait 7 days to get. 10 pulls in this game is literally just 9 dupes of three star weapons and a dupe of a 4 star character if you‚Äôre LUCKY. they know what they‚Äôre doing and they‚Äôre actively silencing and ignoring fans from all over the world who are upset about it. if you want to play a game that ACTUALLY cares about their playerbase, i suggest dragalia lost and cookie run. despite being gacha games, they‚Äôre still eons more appreciative than mihoyo.
title: don‚Äôt waste your time

review:
Updated for current patch 2.1 ‚Äî‚Äî
From 1.0 to 1.2 was the greatest time period of Genshin. Everything fell starting with Lantern Rite if you ask me‚Ä¶ The items we received for that event are the same as our current one year celebration, which is sad. I played for a whole year, sat through things I did mot want to play, in hopes that MiHoYo would get better. They did not, and this especially proves it. Get out while you can, since I can only see this game being used as a cash grab for them and their other projects. Want something to change? Quit and watch other people play instead. For me the turning point was the TL being changed to represent the Dendro Archon as using female pronouns. While it could be the English TL team being pepega, if it is real, it just proves how much of a cash grab this game is. Why have a male archon and make little money compared to the 2.8 million Raiden made in 2 days? All in all, only play this game if you won‚Äôt spend any money. They simply do not deserve it.
title: I quit.

review: I really like the game and I would give it five stars ‚Ä¶ but it takes up to much storage. At first it only took up a little but then it asked me ‚ÄúDo you want to get the full blah blah blah‚Äù I said no and then after a while it asked again. I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúWhy not?‚Äù Then it said  that my storage was to full and at the time I was pretty low on storage so I deleted A LOT. My next Oc is named Kaito. Her quirk is ‚ÄúStargate‚Äù. Basically she has the power of summoning Zodiac related things. So I also invented ‚ÄúGalaxio‚Äù. It was for my Oc‚Äôs who use galaxy/space related things.

title: Please read.

review:
One of the best open world games I‚Äôve ever played. There is an actual story and the fun part is, alot of plot twists. I didn‚Äôt think I would enjoy it so much and here I am, dedicating an hour into the game to do some quests. 

Now, it does get repetitive especially when you finish major quests and don‚Äôt have anything else to do other than daily quests. But there‚Äôs much to explore and personally I think the game is more for the casual players who prefer relaxing games.

If you‚Äôre more of a hardcore player (video games lover I guess) then you might want to look the other way because I‚Äôve seen too many constantly complaining on the lack of game content when Genshin is still primarily a mobile game (playable on PC and PS4/PS5). 

I do wish there was a better gender ratio for the gacha characters. The game isn‚Äôt just made for wife simps; it‚Äôs massive because there‚Äôs all gender players playing. It would be nice if they released more male characters and also make more of them more ‚Äòbroken‚Äô like the female characters. After playing for some time I kinda realized the males had more broken support and barely any good DPS, so please consider this Hoyo.

title: Genshin is truly a masterpiece

review:
Have loved Genshin Impact since I started playing a few weeks ago! Great graphics, fun story, excellent voice acting, and challenging mechanics.  And it doesn‚Äôt seem to be P2W (pay to win). The gachas are, at least, clearly explained. And the translations are done with cultural sensitivity so they make sense and are often quite eloquent. 

My only gripe is the controller interface. I‚Äôve played a number of these style of games on my phone and the joystick on Genshin is incredibly frustrating. I‚Äôm really hoping the devs read these reviews and fix it. It prevents any sort of accuracy in your movements and is often so frustrating I stop playing or avoid certain quests. 

But the game has been enjoyable enough to keep playing despite that rather large issue. Highly recommend.

Afterwards when I tried logging back in with my new fresh storage device I had to verify my email and it wasn‚Äôt mine anyway it was a temporary one. title: Genshin impact one of the best games out right Now!!

review:
Genshin impact‚Äôs visuals are truly amazing!! They‚Äôre so mesmerizing and gives you a feel for each region. Monsdalt has a cozy welcoming vibe to it that makes it the perfect starting point of the game. Liyue is very traditional and full of culture and it‚Äôs exploration is fun and creative. Inazuma has a mysterious, dangerous but beautiful scenery that is also full of culture. Sumeru is packed with nature and it gives off a youthful lively feeling. Finally, Fontaine, in my opinion, is a perfect mix of all the other regions. It has the same cozy areas as Monsdalt(the Melusine villages), Liyue‚Äôs regal-ness, Inazuma‚Äôs scenery, and Sumeru‚Äôs flora and fauna. That being said, Fontaine is also its own region and I believe it‚Äôs story quest is its best feature so far(also the character design is chef‚Äôs kiss‚ú®) 

Thank you for reading my reviewüíú

title: Beautiful game

review:
Genshin Impact is an amazing game! The storyline is immersive and incredibly interactive, as well as all the character‚Äôs personal stories. The combat is super cool, but sometimes hard to avoid. !!! PLEASE READ !!!

title: This is an amazing game.

review: Genshin Impact is a wonderful game, and is wonderfully put together. The gameplay is amazing and the graphics are stunning. However, after reading these reviews I‚Äôve noticed one very common thread: After AR 45 it gets boring and repetitive. As someone who is now Adventure Rank 54 I can say that at one point this was partially true. However as of recently, I‚Äôve found myself drowning in quests and storylines that I need to do and having no Idea where to start. This is not mean negatively at all, by the way. Although I‚Äôm also a player that doesn‚Äôt have to much free time to play the game, but I do think that as of recently genshin has been putting a lot of effort into keeping the game from getting boring and repetitive.
title: The Only Game I‚Äôve Truly Enjoyed

review: I started playing Genshin back in February and been obsessed ever since! I really wish there was more customization tho. Kinda like Tower of Fantasy. Like maybe an event where you make an artificial human (similar to Albedo) and then you get to customize it. You also have a few attacking presets for that character to use depending on what weapon they use. You also get to choose the weapon like bow, sword, etc. It would be realllllly cool if Hoyoverse adds more customization. But it would also be nice if they had better endgame content, more chances of getting better artifacts, more resin, more primogems (like a login thing in game), and more chances of getting the character you want. But overall, it‚Äôs a good game.
title: It‚Äôs amazing! I have a recommendation

review: I enjoy playing this game but the characters, especially the new characters of the newest nation Sumeru, need work. There are very few characters with ‚Äúdark‚Äù skin. They‚Äôre only considered to be dark skin because they aren‚Äôt a shade of pale white, like the majority of the characters are. The new Sumeru teaser disappointed me extremely, there are many new characters with only 2 tanned ones. Not to mention the colorism this company has, as their only darker skinned characters constantly get white washed in official art, and get barely any screen time. Take Xinyan, a character of Liyue for example. Not only does she get white washed in official art, but she gets barely any screen time in the game and only gets featured during limited time events. In conclusion, if you‚Äôre going to make a game with many different countries, represent the citizens of them correctly.
title: Needs more diversity

review:
This game used to be the only game I would play. I would play it literally all the time, but after a couple months of playing I deleted it. After playing it I realize ITS KIND OF A PAY TO WIN TYPE GAME. You can still be a F2P but it‚Äôs not fun. If you don‚Äôt spend any money then it‚Äôs  almost impossible to level up characters and have fun. I love this game and the characters are cool and creative. But I have a problem. There‚Äôs only one black character???? Can we pleaseeeeeeee get some representation? Anyways, it was a fun game but in my opinion it‚Äôs not worth playing all the time just to still be bad at the game. If you‚Äôre willing to become an absolute whale then go ahead Genshin is great for you, but if you‚Äôre looking for a fun F2P game then you‚Äôll  be bored and frustrated out of your mind.

P.S Genshin is a F2P game, but if you want to get really good you have to spend a lot of money or spend every waking hour on the game. It‚Äôs just not worth my time to work all time on this dumb gacha game.
title: Fun at First

review: I love this game a ton, and have been playing for a few months. I am absolutely astonished by the graphics and details this game has in stock, and the plot and characters are super interesting. The only things that i would say aren't exactly satisfactory are, 1: getting characters. getting characters that are less rare (4*) is easy, but when it comes to getting a limited character (5*), the gacha rates are t e r r i b l e. If you do your daily commissions for a year, you still have only ONE five star character guaranteed. 2: The artifact system. This is a good system, but it is really hard to get anything you want with it, sometimes taking hours to get even one good artifact. Other than these, the game is amazing, with tons of interesting plot lines and amazing character designs. Overall an amazing game! :)

title: Amazing game but‚Ä¶.

review: Genshin Impact has been one of my favorite games to play in the past year. The characters, lore, story, and gameplay are all 10/10. With that being said, I do feel that us players deserve more rewards in game, especially for the 1st year anniversary. Miuhoyo can spare us a free five star and a couple of Multis but I digress. This game is an amazing ride and I highly recommend anyone to pick it up if you‚Äôre looking for a game to put a lot of time into. Make sure you don‚Äôt over spend because it can be tempting. My favorite character so far is Tartaglia and every character is different and super interesting. Again, I highly recommend it.
title: What an Incredible Game

review:
Amazing gameplay and I love the world and character designs, but at the end of the day it‚Äôs much more fit for PC. On mobile the game has been lagging more and more frequently with each update (I‚Äôm using an iPhone XR), and people who play on the PS4 say teleporting from area to area takes ages. The game also claims to be 4GB but in reality is over 12GB on my phone, since the 4GB doesn‚Äôt include all the ‚ÄúDocuments & Data‚Äù. Storage-wise this is a nightmare for me since I only have 64GB to start with and I have photos and messages that I would like not to have to delete just to make space. Good news though is that you can switch to playing with your mobile account on a PC, though this doesn‚Äôt work with PS4.

Get the game, just get it on a PC and not another platform!
title: Great game but in the long run better for PC

But even when I can get the controls to work on my iPad it crashes a lot, consistently it‚Äôs crashing when I try to enter the domain for the mondstadt gourmand quest. I would love to be able to play this on my iPad or iPhone so I don‚Äôt have to bring my laptop to work with me when I just want to play for a few minutes at break or lunch, but the crashes make it very difficult to play.

title: GREAT GAME 100% RECOMMEND

review:
Wow. Just wow. I'm not at all a fan of Anime/Japanese style RPGs, but this game is incredible! Graphics are gorgeous. Movement and combat are well polished. Story and writing are good, and the English is perfect. And the attention to detail throughout the game is superb! Being able to really go anywhere - climb walls to the tops of buildings (and then glide down from them!), get on top of tree stumps, sit on benches, climb cliffsides, swim in rivers, anything - is awesome! And being able to attack and damage many things in the world too, not just barrels üòù.

And no auto quest completion, movement, combat (that I've seen so far anyway)!! üòÄ

This is how you do an RPG!

I think the only complaint I have so far is being able to level up from items - to me, coming from an old school RPG background, that's just a cheap way to do it. Doesn't require any skill or thought (unless they make it so the items can only be acquired through combat, completing quests, exploring, and character interaction/diplomacy, but so far I've seen the items delivered in mail as gifts). I know that's how games are done these days to keep the kiddies hooked, but really, this game already has so much in it to keep you interested, I don't think that element is necessary.
title: Beautiful

review: Okay, so if anyone is looking for a good open-world adventure tame for mobile genshin is 100% the way to go. The lore is awesome and so is the play styles. Other than that, genshin is an overall great game if you need a game to waste time. However, there is one other thing that drives me insane, and it‚Äôs how long it takes for a specific character to rerun. For example, it has been over 450 days since she came out and the game has been out for no more than 900ish days. It does take a while for a specific character to return, but there are many lovable characters to choose from if you don‚Äôt want to wait as long.

title: Review

review:
It‚Äôs free to play, but it‚Äôs also pay to win.  If you wanted to get the character you desire and max its level and constellations, it would cost you $1,500 worth of primogems.  That doesn‚Äôt even include a top tier weapon or the best artifacts to make the character powerful.  Of course you get free currency as you play, but you‚Äôd have to play for years to significantly gain. It‚Äôs quite sickening how little you get for the money they charge, but apparently enough people fall for it.  You can‚Äôt customize characters and not every character has an alternate costume, either.  

Nevertheless, it‚Äôs a fun game with great graphics and stories that never end. There‚Äôs no ‚Äúwinning‚Äù the game, only the battles and challenges, but then what happens to all your assets when the game finally comes to the end of its lifespan? You never really own anything.  It‚Äôs a game.
title: Awesome game but freemium scam‚Ä¶

review: Love the game I have been playing for about 3 months now and have had a lot of fun. A big problem though is free to play players get screwed over. I play about 2 to 3 hours every day and I only have 4 legendary characters. It is extremely frustrating when you play all the time but bearly get anything back. Not only that but I'm at AR rank 48 and theres nothing left to do i finished all of inazumes quest which took me about 4 days and now im back to just waiting for events and doing commissions. Not only that it takes forever for resin to regenerate. For a free game it really makes you pay money to progress at all  and don't get me wrong its a really fun game at the start but later in the game it gets really boring. Just wish they would add more stuff and more chances to get primogems.
title: Free to play players

Also the rewards in the game are not enough, especially for players that can‚Äôt pay (me). title: Few complaints but so good!

review:
I‚Äôve been playing the game since launch and have consistently bought gnostic chorus every time it was available, every time I would get a name card, special weapons only accessible when buying the chorus, and some other stuff.  Along with it came an additional 20 levels boost for the battle pass. 

I would always finish up my battle pass around lvl 30 and buy the chorus and it would finish the battle pass at max level (50). I recently bought the chorus and didn‚Äôt check on the update and notice that they were only giving out a 10 level boost instead of 20, but they still charged me about $20 in USD. 

I‚Äôve spent a good amount of money on the game and I kinda expect my money to be worth my while, but as of late it‚Äôs been really disheartening to see that the Genshin branch,  is starting to prioritize money instead of their players. 

I wouldn‚Äôt be writing a review if it was only about them charging me more for less than before, but it has become more about the Genshin branch and their questionable decisions.

P. S. The same can‚Äôt be said about Honkai, a game by mihoyo that I‚Äôve also been playing since launch.
title: Fewer rewards, Same price

review: This game is amazing, from the map to the storyline to the events. Everything is so well thought and put out, though the newer stories are a bit rash but still good. I don‚Äôt understand why some people are so mad over the anniversary rewards, it‚Äôs not that bad. 10 wishes are fine and even better now since they moved it up to 20 wishes. Everyone who is putting 1 stars for the game, do you guys realize that when Genshin reaches below like 1.5 stars it gets remove? What about the people who still wants to play the game and can only do it on mobile? I swear some of you people are the most hypocritical and selfish people I have ever seen. Like be mindful of it. You may continue to do what you want but you might regret it later.
title: Amazing game

review:
I absolutely love this game. The characters, the weapons, the story, everything! I think it's a wonderful game filled with breathtaking art and adventures. It's perfect, and my heart belongs to many of the characters. 
 
But one thing. It's very hard for F2P players to get decent characters and weapons. I myself am not F2P, but the fact that it takes 3 days for a F2P player to get enough primogems for one wish is ridiculous. The fact that the pity for a guaranteed 5 star (doesn't count if featured or not) is 90 is absurd, especially since it's so hard for F2P players to get primogems. 

I don't really have any other complaints. The game itself is wonderful. But another fun suggestion would be to add more poses for the Kamera, such as sitting, laying down, etc.
title: Love this game, but..

review: There is a lack of consistency in production quality. It is clear the company cares greatly for the finer qualities such as artistic design, music production, and lore writing of this game. However, there is such an apparent neglect for the meat-and-potatoes portion of this game such as quality-of-life features, replayable content, meaningful co-op features, and end-game entertainment. There has been virtually no meaningful attempt to improve these aspects of the game for the past year. Many others have expressed frustration about the lack of anniversary pomp or rewards, but I personally don‚Äôt care about that. The company can make their own decisions. However ,the frustrating part is the lack of communication from the developers to address and acknowledge the community‚Äôs gripes. I regret having spent thousands on this game to support a company that appears to care more about milking money than fostering the goodwill of its player base.
title: Good game - poor execution

review: for starters, the game is great. great graphics, gameplay, plot, and characters. however, the game is heavily p2w (pay-to-win) and if you‚Äôre f2p (free-to-play) it takes forever to get enough materials to pull in the gacha for the featured character. also, the game takes a great portion of your storage space. i have no more than 20 characters, i have hardly any of the map explored, i‚Äôm not far in the story, and the game already takes almost 40 GB of storage! if you have the time, money, and storage space, i recommend this game. the map is beautiful with breathtaking graphics and there are tons of things to find and interact with. gameplay is fun and simple, and you can also connect your phone to a controller and play from there is it is more comfortable for you.

review:
Where are the darker skinned people? I spent money on this game and surely would‚Äôve spent a lot more if they released realistic skin tones. Not everyone should be pasty. Not only that, but unrealistically pasty, like condensed milk. It‚Äôs just lazy at this point, and I think the developers and the company are cowards. Realistic and Darker skin tones don‚Äôt only appeal and represent plenty of people, it just makes the game far more relatable, even for people like me who have light skin. It‚Äôs repetitive, and not only that, the writing of the game is also repetitive. Game is trash. Will be playing Legend of Zelda botw. Game is low key racist but at least we got more skin colors. Genshin‚Äôs writing is so corny anyway. Felt like I was watching an old, tired sitcom appealing to people with the brains the size of my nostril. 

It‚Äôs not that hard bruh. Plus most of the character‚Äôs color pallets work so harmoniously with darker skin, an incredibly missed opportunity. Game went down the gutter and playing it reminds me of the smell of acid reflux burps. Garbage and spoiled eggs. 

Mechanics are also repetitive. Got old so fast, and I had been playing since the game was released to the United States.

I would rather spend cash buying elephant dung over and over than buying the in game currency for characters I can hardly perceive without wanting to slam my forehead into my knees after jumping off a twelve story building.

review: First off, I‚Äôd like to preface this by saying that Genshin Impact was my favorite game up until the controversies with Sumeru characters. I tried so very hard to see the good in the company, but I can‚Äôt. I can‚Äôt overlook the very blatant racism in their choices of skin tones for the characters they create. They are stealing cultures from South Asian and Middle Eastern countries, and applying them (incorrectly) onto white characters. None of the Sumeru characters should be white. I am just so sick and tired of the lack of representation of skin tones in this game, and its disgustingly racist fans on top of it all. Not only are they colorist, they are also using stereotypical traits of cultures and tacking them on to characters (i.e. Dori, etc.) This is just completely disrespectful and offensive to the cultures they are stealing from. This game started off with a very promising future, but seeing how it has gone, If you are looking for proper representation, I don‚Äôt recommend playing this game.
title: Lack of Skintone Diversity and Misrepresentation of Cultures

review: So.. I‚Äôve been playing this game for a while now, nearly about when it first came out. It was fun at first but now the wonder and euphoria I got from the game has subsided. There really isn‚Äôt enough to keep me entertained all the time. You can only do so much in coop and playing single player all the time can get pretty boring. The events are nice sure but those are still limited. Not to mention, Hoyoverse is coming out with a new region, Sumeru. I think Sumeru NEEDS to have proper representation. I want to see people of color. The whole of Sumeru SHOULD NOT be white. Sure, some pale people would be there‚Ä¶ but the whole of Sumeru? I do hope that Hoyoverse listens to their community and adds proper representation of the region. There is no excuse not to add the representation and we should not have to wait until Natlan comes out when we‚Äôre not even guaranteed darker characters for that region either. Considering how this issue has been handled thus far.
title: More representation and more stuff to do!

review: For starters, I love Genshin Impact. I love the characters, the lore, the play styles, almost everything about it is so incredible. However, there are a few flaws that make playing a bit of a pain. For starters, the resin system. With a single resin replenishing every twelve minutes, twenty being needed for artifact and material domains, fourth for boss fights, and thirty or sixty on weekly bosses, it all is just a bit to slow. Secondly, the artifact rolling. When a person wishes to farm artifacts, chances are they are going to get a hp or defense one, or perhaps something different in a domain where hp or defense ARE what you want, the algorithm is poised against it. The chances of rolling into crit rate/crit damage is also quite low and it‚Äôs just a royal pain to have to do the same domain over and over again.
title: A genuinely great game, with a few fixable flaws

title: I love the game but..

review:
I have been playing Genshin Impact since update 1.1. From the moment I loaded into the world, I knew the experience was going to be unlike any other game I have played on mobile. The is SO MUCH CONTENT and the world is filled to the brim with quests and lore for you to experience. 

Characters in the game unique, quirky and surprisingly balanced (except for Bennett, everyone loves Bennett). 4-Star characters are monstrous when built properly (Nigguang, Razor, Rosaria).  Combat is addicting and rewarding. The elemental resonance system encourages players to use unorthodox play-styles and experiment. Did I mention artifacts? Which allow you to customize each individual aspect of your character‚Äôs stats? Like I said before, SO MUCH. 

The micro-transactions are there for those who do not want to grind their life away. Yes, constellations are pay-to-win-ish and make every character infinitely better. But, the rerun banners exist so that free-to-plays can earn them over time too. The game is co-op, buying things only makes you win harder. 

If you are looking for a nearly endless, open-world, beautifully designed action-RPG, definitely give this game a shot!
title: Refreshing Combat, Incredible Art-Style

review:
Summary: 
I‚Äôm a semi-old player who will highly recommend this game but watch out for primogems, they can dominate your experience sometimes. Also the storage is a lie. 
‚Äî
As somebody who‚Äôs been a player since the original Venti banner, I‚Äôm addicted to this game hands down. It‚Äôs a unique and creative rpg game with a immersive world which really grips you into the game even more than it already would have with the characters, voice acting, story, scenery, fanbase, events, etc... .

 I can‚Äôt help but feel like a lot of the gameplay revolves around finding primogems at the point where I get excited to get even 2 from a chest after scavenging for an hour. I understand primogems are an important part of the game especially when it comes to getting characters you want, my friends who don‚Äôt spend money on this game complain all the time about how they feel pressured into investing money into the game when they clearly don‚Äôt want to. 

If you‚Äôre considering downloading this game watch out for primogems, don‚Äôt let them take over your experience with the game.  (also the game takes up *way* more storage than it says it does, it claims like 3GB but it‚Äôs really like 11GB)
title: One of my favorite games, but primogems...

review:
This is by far the best Mobile RPG I've ever played, and the fact that it is cross platform with PC is really amazing.
The history is good, but it seems to go nowhere so far. 
The characters awesome but they are not customizable, you gotta pay to have skins.
I've spent some money on it just to be able to level up quicker and get some extra rolls, but I'm not planning to spend any more on it because the chances of pulling what I need are too low and what you can get spending real money is not that good.
By the amount of surveys they send every month it seems that the devs are trying to listen to the fans, and that's good for the development of the game and Mihoyo's reputation nobody wants another EA Games around.
title: Best Mobile RPG, Devs need to listen to the fans.

review:
Honestly, I wanted to like this game. My friends talked about it a lot and seemed really into it. They described it as a Breath of the Wild meets Waifu gacha and, as someone into gacha games and BotW, I was interested. But I played about ten minutes and was immediately bored of the gameplay. It felt like there was simultaneously too much and too little to do. Overwhelming in visuals yet underwhelming in actual substance. A stunning world that just felt so empty. 

The constellation/upgrade system didn‚Äôt make any sense, the controls were finicky (archery is impossible), running the game tanked my battery, and, like I said, the world ‚Äî while beautiful ‚Äî was just boring. Playing on PlayStation didn‚Äôt make it any better. I get more entertainment scrolling my Twitter for fanart than I do playing the actual game. It‚Äôs a pretty package with nothing filling it. And that‚Äôs not even mentioning the questionable practices of the dev company. Save yourself time and money and just search the Twitter tag for pretty fanart.
title: Just look at fanart tbh

review: I loved this game from day one, it never really gets boring because of the new content that I look forward to! I always recommend this game to everyone I know, and so far, everyone loves it! Co-op is fun because it always bring me and my friends joy. The open-world is so much fun to explore and brings me joy when there is a new region available. Even once you‚Äôre out of resin, you can always find something else to do with friends or just by yourself. This game sits in a special part of my heart as it has brought me happiness and newly formed friends. I hope this game continues running in the future and eventually comes to an end with a storyline that gets your blood pumping! Happy 1st Anniversary, Genshin Impact!

review: I stopped gaming a few years back because I couldn't find any games that could grab my attention like they did when I was younger. The last time I played a game this much was back in 2013, when FreeRealms was still a thing. My boyfriend introduced me to this game back in February and I have absolutely fallen in love with everything about it. Sure, the dailies might be a little repetitive, but that just might be the only complaint I really have. I've put so much of my time and money into this game and haven't regretted it for a second. The characters and their abilities are amazing, the stories are amazing, and the art is incredible. I'm so excited for all the new content to come!! Would absolutely recommend this game :)

review: This game is one of my favorites because of the great graphics and the variety of things to do. My main problem with this game is the extremely low rates of getting anything, not to mention how expensive it is to farm domains and bosses.  I mean, I get it‚Äôs necessary for companies to make money but they could up the rate so that it doesn‚Äôt take 90 wishes to get a five star character or item. Also what happens when you get C6 on a character but keep getting their constellations, there should be something that allows one to exchange constellations for another character or something... because they are just wasted primogems that sit around in your inventory. Other than that, great game and I can‚Äôt wait to see the other areas!
title: Great Game!

review: I was very impressed by this app! It is extremely fun yet gives a challenge to people. All the characters are unique. It also takes a lot of combos and power-up which makes this game even more in depth. This would have been 5 stars except for the character policy. So you get 6 free characters and the rest are earned by spending primo gems (special currency) that they give you for little things such as opening chests and completing quests. However NONE ( except for the 6 free characters) of the the characters are guaranteed. In fact I spent 20 dollars to get one character and I still didn‚Äôt get him. And it‚Äôs not really worth spending 20 bucks on reruns or characters that you‚Äôll never use. Even though they do have a pity system, it takes 100 wishes (which is really expensive) to come into effect for a 5 star character.
title: Super fun, but....

It's great they constantly work on the game and try to improve it but when I can't play it anywhere but my home because it drains all my data downloading half the internet and won't let me play without it, it gets annoying af. title: Time investment not a money investment

review:
-1 star for having one of the worst gacha systems I‚Äôve ever seen in any mobile game - on par with FGO and DX2 in terms of pure greed - in a game that‚Äôs probably meant to compete with console titles (otherwise why else would they give it crossplay and market it towards a non-gacha audience?) and doesn‚Äôt need to be anywhere near as stingy as it is. Cut the greed out.
Other than that, the game is quite interesting - a major open-world 3D game that can be played on-the-go - that manages to add dignity to the mobile gaming market, which is mostly filled with garbage apps that are clearly meant to pander to casuals with large wallets and minimal scruples. If companies won‚Äôt make high quality games like this of their own volition, then consumers need to vote with their wallets and make it happen - Genshin Impact should be the start of a new rule, rather than just a footnote.
title: Worth giving a shot

review:
I love this game so far. I‚Äôve put in probably 5 hours, and it hasn‚Äôt tried to burden me with micro-transactions. The art style is beautiful, and the story is good. Like others have said, it‚Äôs reminiscent of Breath of the Wild, but is far from a copy cat. It manages to stand on its own without relying on the ideas of others.
The only thing I can complain about is the lack of controller support. For a game that has controller mapping on the PC and console versions, it‚Äôs strange to me that the IOS version doesn‚Äôt support it. I have a Steel Series Nimbus controller (along with Xbox controllers) that I could use if the game featured controller support.
With that said, the in-game touch controls aren‚Äôt bad, and the combat feels intuitive. I would still love to see controller support, however.

Thanks so much to the developers for creating this piece of art!
title: Needs one small improvement!

review: You've heard all the praise I'm here to talk about some of the issues I have with the game. For one the game is too large, it takes a mountain of storage space not just for mobile but for all other platformers too. This is a hard game to play if you 1. Don't spend any money and 2. Have a more experienced friend to help with the nightmare that is artifacts. The gacha part is a little skewed too. There is no pity cap like most games (ect. A super rare character after 100 wishes). This means it's possible, and has happened alot more to me and others then I would like, to spend a easy 100$ and not get the item or character you wanted. None the less I would like to play the game again if I didn't have to download 150+ GB of game on my pc.
title: Amazing game but non the less still a gacha game

review:
Aside from the gacha system for characters it‚Äôs a good game and I hope it gets better with more content and story. 

Despite the backlash of it being a ‚ÄúBOTW‚Äù ripoff it really isn‚Äôt. There are aspects of BOTW in the game like climbing, gliding, graphics, etc. However the story and gameplay is different. So to the people who dislike it for being a clone, play first.

Overall I am very happy about this game. The need to use money is optional and the game gives you a decent lineup of characters at the start to handle every encounter. My only hope for the gacha system is the occasional gift or event for players to use it from time to time.

I would highly recommend this game to my friends and I can‚Äôt wait to play more.

Is it just me or does the game start treating you like the twin brother? 
I mean, I chose to play as the twin sister, but suddenly the voice dialogue ie Paimon said I was looking for my sister aka me, instead of my brother.

title: It‚Äôs Amazing~ A good single player open world rpg.

review:
I downloaded the game today and have been playing ALL DAY LONG. I honestly love these types of games and can never get enough. When they said open world, they really meant it. I spent hours simply just exploring and grinding. I usually hate to grind but this game changes each monster battle every time. I love the flying aspect of the game as well. 
Some issues I noticed: sometimes the character's feet will glitch through the ground, also the voiceover sometimes does not match what it says in the text. 
They're not huge issues but can take someone out of the fantasy of the game.
Also got some cool loot early on thanks to the developers and their freebies. sadly, i am still a student so i have other responsibilities to attend to, but I can't wait to keep playing again tomorrow
title: Addicting AF

review: I have been playing this game since it came out, and even though it feels near impossible for me to make progress or do good damage anymore, it holds a dear place in my heart. I don‚Äôt have the words to describe the wonderful graphics, story, and characters properly. The only issue is the community and occasional lag, and sometimes lacking progress can feel a bit overwhelming. For example, some of my friends had one of the nations explored on day one and did every quest first thing. I, however, have a lot of mental issues and thusly can‚Äôt focus on doing such things, so a lot of the time I get nothing done and feel very behind. It‚Äôs overbearing. But that, of course, is not the game‚Äôs fault, and I highly recommend it!

As a pc player from the first patch up until now, I can safely say many issues that have been around since 1.0 are still problematic. Firstly, this game has very poor overall representation having only a few lightly tanned characters and the rest being so white they glow in game at night. All the characters are extremely skinny with very conventional body shapes. There is also a very apparent lack of fun, repeatable endgame content. Another, albeit smaller, issue is the fact that important story altering lore is hidden in limited time events with no way to replay them. We are barely given any rewards from the company for our loyalty and continued support and the game has become increasingly pay to win. It has become increasingly hard to enjoy the game and remain free to play. However by far the biggest issue is the communication between the players and company. We are routinely ignored when we ask for these issues to be fixed.
title: i have thoughts

review: i love this game sm, it‚Äôs actually AMAZING, the open world and detail and quests are actually mind blowing, i‚Äôve logged on day after day and played for hours, i‚Äôve spent so so so much money on this game too it‚Äôs just so addicting and i rlly do recommend it. the problem is how bad the rewards are for things like the anniversaries, this game is incredibly stingy and barely gives you like one or two ten pulls, they make everything overly expensive and force you to spend a lot for the smallest rewards, it‚Äôs very tiring, what do u mean only 800 primos a 4* skin and mora ( not even 1 ten pull ) for buying a genshin collab ps5? or only 20k primos for buying a WHOLE CAR from a collab with genshin, i could save that many on my own. title: Mixed feelings but very good game

review:
I absolutely love this game, it is extremely addicting, and there is so much too explore!  
The characters of this game are well designed, but some like Candace have been white washed which I believe is unnatural considering that she is based off of a real person.
I love the music and I think it has a lot of thought into it. The design is realistic and detailed, which is partly why I love this game. 
I like most of the characters play styles like Kokomi, soft and smooth or Raiden, fast and dangerous. But then we have people like Dehya and Itto that have very aggressive play styles and don‚Äôt cause as much DMG as others.
I love the fact we have daily challenges, so that way players can have something to do during their play time. The quest are very long but share the pasta of many characters like Xiao and Zhongli.
title: Great!

review: This game is amazing, the characters and graphics are all beautifully done. It‚Äôs a very addictive game and i‚Äôve spent more money then i would prefer on this game but i do play it often so it‚Äôs worth it igüò≠. But just some feedback paimon explaining every little detail is very annoying and the lengthy dialogue ends up with me just skipping through the story although when I was paying attention the story was very interesting but it just was too much work for me to read all the dialogue üò≠. Additionally I wish we had the option to change the travelers gender because I picked aether and now i wish I picked Lumine since I prefer girl characters and I don‚Äôt want to restart and lose all my progress.
title: Love the game just some feedback !

review: I love this game. I really do. It‚Äôs fun and There‚Äôs tons of things you can do to entertain you. But one thing I think can be more useful is to have an option to un- level characters or really reset them. Over time from wishing I‚Äôve gotten characters that has proven to make me stronger, but I have other characters that have been leveled up so much all the resources are wasted. And over time as you level up, getting materials becomes very difficult which makes it harder to get stronger and personally enjoy the game overall. I think being able to un- level characters for a certain price can make it easier for new players who don‚Äôt have the grasp of the game just yet still be able to enjoy Genshin.  I hope this idea is considered eventually
title: A suggestion for game play

review:
If I could give it 10 stars I would. I played games for years and never left a review. Genshin deserves a review. After more than a year of playing, this is it: The scene, open world - AMAZING, the music is breathtaking, the characters, the story, beautiful and interesting. The grind can take some time, end game is still out there, but frequent events, updates and new zones, especially this last one, Sumeru, is what keeps me coming back. I am absolutely in love with Sumeru, its story, the characters, I log in and get lost in this world, for me its therapy. I play on my iphone since I don't have time for other consoles and it runs great. Also I never payed a dime on ingame currency, all this totally free. 
Devs keep it up, big fan of your work!
title: 5 star game

review:
I don‚Äôt have this game on iPhone but on PS and I gotta say this is one of my favorite games to play during my free time. The music in the game is amazing including the battle music, the characters in the game are really fun to play with, and the story is really good. Their is no ending but their are character story‚Äôs and hangouts which are very fun. You do got to grind a lot and work on a good team but it‚Äôs still worth the grind no matter what.

One of my favorite characters is Xiao which is one of the good characters to play as and he does this dash attack that does a lot of damage depending on the artifacts u put on him. The artifacts can be annoying to get bc almost all the time u get crap but still it‚Äôs worth the grind.

My main team I run and had since the I got the game is Xiao, Bennett, Fischl and Zhongli. I run this team so Bennett can buff my characters which is his special attack and it can also heal my team, Zhongli‚Äôs amazing shield and his special attack, Fischl‚Äôs bird named Oz and Xiao‚Äôs special attack his dash.

I really love this game and it really helped me when I had nothing to do on PS and I recommend u should get it too and it‚Äôs free on IPhone, PS, PC, etc.
title: Best Game I‚Äôve Ever Played

review: I love this game, but I‚Äôm probably going to uninstall. I keep getting stuck because the combat (which I don‚Äôt much enjoy in the first place) is too hard with the basic characters and the gatcha system mostly gives you the same character over and over and dozens of low-level weapons. If I want to progress, I‚Äôm going to have to spend hundreds of dollars for a tiny chance at a good character. I‚Äôm what they call a casual gamer. I want to explore and do quests and maybe do a little bit of battle here and there. This game is gorgeous and the world is amazing and I wish I could spend longer in it. But I‚Äôd rather pay $60 up front for a complete game than download a game for ‚Äúfree‚Äù that is impossible to finish. Also it takes up SO much space on my mobile phone, and kills my (brand new) battery.

title: add more brown and black characters

review:
Genshin was amazing in the beginning I feel because it was something new to the mobile experience, and was similar to BoTW. It began as a great open-world game and was fun to explore until the exploration ends. Like sure, they are adding more content and you could get your exploration to 100%, but it‚Äôs pure desperation at that point. All you have left to do after completing the mediocre story and boring side quests is to grind endlessly for artifacts and materials for your character to become stronger‚Ä¶ and for what? The content doesn‚Äôt get any more challenging once you‚Äôre at a good point with a few characters which does take a while, but not long enough, because you‚Äôll eventually catch up with the content eventually. 
As a former whale, I definitely ask that you proceed with caution when you want to spend on this game because in the end, it just isn‚Äôt worth it. It feels like there‚Äôs no love put into this game at all.
title: Been playing from the start

review:
I play on my iPad and it tends to crash a lot, especially when on co-op. Also I‚Äôve never gotten a 5 star weapon or character, but those are my only complaints. The graphics, the storyline, the gameplay, the monsters, the skills, etc. are just so good that I don‚Äôt even care that it crashes so often. It just makes co-op hard which I‚Äôd disappointing but it‚Äôs whatever. My friend got me to download it and now my sister has it too and so does another of my friends üòÇ It‚Äôs honestly kind of addicting too which may not be good but it‚Äôs a very enjoyable game. Would definitely recommend. Oh yeah, I‚Äôm also sad that you can‚Äôt kill the dogs or cats.

(Update: I haven‚Äôt been able to play in over a week now because it crashes immediately after I log in every time. Im very disappointed. WHY DOES IT CRASH SO MUCH?!!?!)
title: Lags on mobile but still a great game

review:
overall, i absolutely adore this game. while i do have some frustrations‚Ä¶mainly regarding the absence of playable characters in your world (how fun would it be to be able to chat with klee or thoma everyday?!!) and also the slightly disappointing end to the inazuma archon quest (it‚Äôs not bad by any means, it just wasn‚Äôt entirely on par with the liyue quest‚Ä¶..), i couldn‚Äôt honestly give this game anywhere below a 5 star rating. i‚Äôve totally fallen in love with it, spending countless hours playing. not only is the story pretty fantastic, but the game itself is really beautiful and quite often i find myself running around like an idiot (still perfectly entertained). there is so much to do and so many characters to meet and fall in love with‚Ä¶the vast majority of them have touching backstories and are truly a joy to interact with (my favorite has got to be kazuha). 
i may be slightly biased, as this game is one of few things that got me through one of the more difficult periods of my life, but i will say this: to anyone questioning whether to get this game or not, i absolutely recommend. give it a try, and maybe you‚Äôll fall in love with it as i have!!

title: YEHA

review:
Genshin Impact is probably the most fun I‚Äôve had playing a mobile game in years. It‚Äôs graphics, world design, battle system, and characters are all amazing and unique. My only gripes with it are: When I‚Äôm just opening up the app, it takes at least a minute to load (load meaning where you see the MIHOYO screen, then GENSHIN IMPACT), and that whenever I switch my party around, without fail, I know my game will crash. I don‚Äôt know why it does this, I‚Äôm assuming it‚Äôs a bug. I‚Äôm hoping it will get fixed soon, but I love this game and want to watch it grow.
**EDIT:** As much as I love Genshin Impact, it‚Äôs becoming downright unplayable on a mobile device. PLEASE do what you can to fix this
title: Love this game, but...

review:
I absolutely love this game. I‚Äôm currently AR 41 and have still yet to run out of things to do. I typically play on PC more often but when I‚Äôm out of the house and have time I like to play on mobile as well. 

I was reading through some reviews while the latest version updates on my phone and I realized a lot of people compare this game to Zelda BOTW which I can understand to a point. But Genshin Impact is so unique in its own ways. I personally love BOTW as well but Genshin Impact is constantly evolving and making this game absolutely amazing. 

I also noticed many people upset over the summoning system to get new characters and such. Must be their first gacha game lol. That‚Äôs typically how these kind of games work. It takes a lot of patience. If you take the time and do all the quests and find as many chests as possible, you‚Äôll easily be able to have enough gems to get yourself a 5 star character or more. It is absolutely not a pay to play game. On the contrary if you are interested in paying to play it most definitely speeds up the process.

With all that being said, I adore this game. I am so happy I get to play this game as it continues to grow and expand. Keep up the great work Mihoyo!

I‚Äôve been buying the welkin‚Äôs pretty frequently for the last year or two, but since they refuse to improve the rewards and give us the quality of life we‚Äôre looking for, I‚Äôve decided to stop buying the welkin until further notice. title: Rabbits and pick up

review: So the game‚Äôs graphics and characters are amazing, but as the game grows and there are more stories, more regions to explore, and events to keep up with; it becomes tiring to continually play. Especially for new players. I believe that the game is more enjoyable to build characters rather than read a long story and most of the story takes up storage, which I understand, but I end up not reading it and only burning through just to start a new event. Plus when new characters are released, if a noobie gets it then it‚Äôll be hard to acquire items and boss materials because it may require the story quest finished or maybe the player is too weak. But if you like exploration games go for it, I still play the game.
title: Great but‚Ä¶

review: The story is good and all but the character skills are terrible.  Almost all the skills of new characters are copy paste from an existing one.  With the last character they added, they tried something new and created the most dysfunctional kit I've ever seen.  This character was shown in their stream saying that it worked for some reactions, when in reality it didn't.  She doesn't even work for what they said on their own stream!  She is a 5 star (more expensive) that does not even compete with 4 stars.  And above all this, the company does absolutely nothing even when everyone is on social media asking for a fix, not even an announcement.  This company does not listen to its players at all unless they are a threat for them.  And this is just using one character as an example, there are more cases like this and they have NOT done anything, just ignoring their playerbase.
title: Characters

review:
Dehya has so many glaring problems with her kit in terms of gameplay and numbers. And instead of fixing those issues, Hoyoverse would rather make her a standard character and move on as if that validates their decision. Very scummy and unfair to all the players who‚Äôve been looking forward to this character. If they do this to Dehya, they‚Äôll do it to more future characters as well. 

Please buff Dehya. It doesn‚Äôt even take that much effort. Either rework her kit so she‚Äôll actually have a role somewhere or simply give her better numbers. Who cares if she ends up being OP? It‚Äôs a casual PVE game, not a competitive PVP one. The characters that we spend money for SHOULD at the very least be good. How can a multi million dollar company come up with something this bad? It‚Äôs almost like you hate money, you hate the people who play your game, you hate your own game and characters and just want some of them to be trash for no reason. 

Please buff Dehya and fix her.
title: #JusticeForDehya

title: The game is great! But my complaints:

review: I have a love/hate relationship with Genshin impact  at this point. On the one hand, I am absolutely enthralled with the exploration, characters, and story of this beautiful game. On the other, there has been no endgame development since launch, a good portion last few characters have been disappointing, and almost all decisions made since the release of inazuma have been for the negative. It feels like Mihoyo has stopped listening to the cries of their player base which is disappointing considering their previous attention to meticulous game balancing and reward distribution. Sadly, it seems that this trend will continue if nothing is done. I truly do want this to be a game I‚Äôm able to enjoy for years to come, and I hope that the talented devs at mihoyo can realize what‚Äôs going wrong. Cheers
title: So much potential

review:
It‚Äôs completely unacceptable what they‚Äôve done to Yae Miko. They have actually scammed people by essentially nullifying the effects of her second constellation. I‚Äôm f2p so I have her at c0 but I still spent hard earned primogems and precious resources to level her up. Only for this shady company to completely nerf her in the next patch under the guise of a bug fix. I have a hard time believing they made this ‚Äúfix‚Äù thinking that it actually made her a better character. In every situation, it‚Äôs a nerf. They made people pay money to get this character to higher constellations and then nullified the effects of a constellation that people paid for. Even disregarding the c2 issue, this change made her a much worse character overall. 

I really hope they at least revert her to how she was pre 2.6 patch. It‚Äôs unbelievable that they even thought this was a remotely good idea. Stop trying to scam your loyal player base, be a better company.
title: incompetent at best, malicious scammers at worst

review:
The world is lush and colorful with a serene sound track. However, outside of that the combat is monotonous. The only thing to do is farm material drops once a day until minions respawn. Any other ways to progress your team are locked behind pay/time gates or gacha systems. The way they progress the story is about as exciting as watching paint dry. It‚Äôs a lot and I mean A LOT of reading while the camera pans or jumps around to try and keep you engaged. On top of all of that the developers do not communicate with the community. They rarely fix any bugs/broken characters and spend all their time making newer stronger characters to sell you. For which the odds of receiving any 5 star is 1% or lower that is including a guaranteed pull for a 5 star after 90 pulls. So the odds are actually far worse than that. 

TLDR; don‚Äôt waste your time here you will only end up frustrated and with less money than when you started.
title: Beautiful art and music, story is 90% visual novel

review:
Many games I‚Äôve played before this one at the start allowed people to play and enjoy the time put into it without feeling like you have to put money into it to get the fullest experience 
 Only to soon make it next to impossible to get enjoyment without feeling like you have to pay once in awhile 
 But in genshin you never have to pay anything and your never locked out of things. There‚Äôs a character you want and didn‚Äôt get them they will come back and you can try again or there will be a plethora of others you can get and you don‚Äôt have to spend a dime. Sure it may take longer but it‚Äôs possible to get what you want with just the resources in game and I appreciate that.
title: A nice gacha

review: Overall the story is nice the characters are good the game runs very smooth. Though playing this game does drain your battery extremely quickly. Sometimes the fighting can get extremely annoying, for instance when there is a mob on top of a mountain, if they fall or you push them off instead of dying most of the time they just respawn with full health. Which is extremely annoying if you‚Äôve spent the past 5 minutes taking down their health. Another problem is if you push them too far from their spawn they start walking back and then immediately regain full health even if you follow them and attack. This is extremely infuriating especially when you just pull them from dodging or via their own attacks. You don‚Äôt have to be far AT ALL in order for this to trigger.
title: Great game some problems

review: They really hit it out of the park with its breath taking clips, story, and scenery. The voice actors did an amazing job and the characters look spectacular. I‚Äôve been playing ever since the beginning of the month when it was first launched and have never gotten bored of it. Every single update release also have something both interesting and amazing especially the new events, areas, bosses, and just all round new content (Don‚Äôt forget the new characters too those are important). Genshin is also better than most open world games out there because the story ark doesn‚Äôt get boring nor is it overwhelming, it‚Äôs just the right amount to satisfy the community as this is just the beginning.
title: Best open world mobile game

review:
For the first 15-20 hours of playing this game, I had an amazing time with it. The gacha rates were predatory, sure, but I was able to have fun with what little the game gave me and made it through the main story loving every part of it. As you begin to get to the end however, there is nothing left to do. Chests do not come back, so there‚Äôs no point reexploring the world. Resin recharge is too slow, so obtaining items to level up characters or getting good artifacts is mostly just a case of waiting for your resin to come back. The new events really don‚Äôt fix anything. They‚Äôre too short, offer too little rewards, and don‚Äôt add any good repeatable content to the game.

So overall, I wouldn‚Äôt bother with this game. It‚Äôs fun for a while, but there‚Äôs nothing to do anymore other than wait for more updates that continue the main story. Overall, this game felt very disappointing after the initial honeymoon phase. Save your time and look elsewhere.
title: Not worth it in the end

review: I love the game, I really do. The characters are neat, I love the open world roleplay style. It‚Äôs really fun to play this game. The only problem is that the first time I got this game I had black screens for days and then when I got it again a few weeks later, it works and I can actually play the game but I crash every like 30 minutes. I lower the settings (which you can only do after completely a long story tutorial instead of being able to do it as soon as possible to make the game smoother) but it still crashes. title: The gameplay is great, the technical difficulties are not

review: I have had this game for less than a week and I‚Äôm already in love. It‚Äôs asthetically pleasing, the combat systems and elemental reactions are outright amazing, and the storyline and level progression are top-notch as well. I only have one single suggestion, and it‚Äôs that when you are playing on single player you don‚Äôt need internet connection. I don‚Äôt really know about the inner mechanics so this might be a fundamentally impossible change, but if we could have the option to turn off multiplayer and play single player without internet connection that would be nice. Now, this is only a quality-of-life thing and in no way negatively impacts my opinion of the game, it‚Äôs still a wonderful game. It‚Äôs just a little thing that would be nice to have.
