title: please stop whitewashing characters.

review: Genshin is great but we all have suffered from burnout. The game has wonderful characters and vivid fantasy elements. But once we see a new asset we scramble to speed through it. Though I‚Äôve been playing since 2020 I do recommend it. But take it small doses. Genshins new characters look great but can be clunky and could use some minor adjustments. But the downsides keep piling up you can only buy costumes if you put real world money into it or pray they are free. You can absolutely lose the 50/50 and wait until the next rerun but you‚Äôll wait forever if only the characters are successful and get in more money because of ‚Äúcollectors‚Äù. But the events can be new and fun but sometimes they are old events with new kinds of paint. I love Genshin to bits‚Ä¶ would recommend to friends? Ehhhh‚Ä¶ maybe. Only if the time is right.
title: Burnout & more

review:
genshin impact is an awesome game although i have a few issues with it.

1. the storage is too high. as a mobile player, i can no longer play this game anymore because of the storage issues. the game is simply too big and unless the devs somehow fix that issue, i am putting my genshin account on a hiatus.
2. the pity system. everyone who plays knows the pity system is a bit sucky, especially with the weapons banner. i know you guys need money, but honkai star rail system is so much better and user friendly.
3. skip option for dialogue and cutscenes. okay, i get that you put a lot of hard work into this game including the cutscenes and story, but some people simply dont want to spend hours clicking through dialogue, especially if its super redundant. 
4. please fix dehya i swear please
5. the artifacts are trying to kill me i swear. again, the stair rail version of this is so much more user friendly, i dont want any more DEF mainstat artifacts please
6. the cultural representation is definitely a bit low, a more diverse set would be very fun to play

thats about it, thank you devs for such an amazing time playing this game.
title: genshin impact

review: i‚Äôve been playing this game for well over a year it‚Äôs great it‚Äôs a open-world MMO and has a gacha system but you don‚Äôt have to get into that i still wish they would fix a few things like the standard banner and to add things to not make the game stale like a infinite spiral abyss but it‚Äôs just has good graphics and is just fun to play as a new player but the veteran players know what i mean when i say it gets stale when they give out minimal events and story quests and they also some characters power-creep other characters which is sometimes annoying when u get like a diluc or a klee then say hu tao out powers them i know that how they make money but it‚Äôs still annoying that‚Äôs what i think about it .
title: Great game read if u want to k ow about how it gets stale or about power-creeping

review: I got a new iPad hoping I can play Genshin impact with a bigger screen, also because I didn‚Äôt have enough space on my iPhone to download Genshin impact. When I got Genshin impact on the iPad I was so excited to have a bigger version of my phone to play on and to see the beautiful scenery. Unfortunately that wasn‚Äôt the case. When I started playing on my iPad I had terrible lag in the background graphics and nothing was rendering correctly. For example I had to get close to the building or tree in order for it to not be blurry or just a solid color. I hope that genshin is able to fix this problem so I can play on my iPad without being frustrated that the graphics are bad.
title: The graphics on my iPad Pro are bad

review: When I first started playing Genshin Impact, it was arguably the best game I‚Äôve ever played to the point I would abandon other games just to play Genshin Impact. However after about 2 months, I got to AR 50, the content of the game became repetitive and boring and resin really became a problem, especially when farming the artifacts. I could literally be stuck farming artifacts for weeks spending over thousands of resins just to get a decent set for my characters while also having to also spend resin on talents, mora, experience, weapon/character ascension materials. The developers must either increase resin regeneration rate/decrease resin cost, or rework the artifact domain to guarantee good artifacts in some way possible.
title: More endgame content and resin system rework!

title: Very good!

title: Awesome game but ‚Ä¶.. just a few concerns

review:
This game is awesome. The graphics are incredible in every aspect of the game. It‚Äôs somewhat hard to understand at first but game play is pretty easy. 
 It‚Äôs nice that when you wish for a character if you get multiple of the same character you get constellations for said character which unlocks better abilities. 
However, it‚Äôs annoying on event banners that you can still continue to get that same character after you‚Äôve received all the constellations which I think is pretty crappy. There should be a cap on getting a character once you‚Äôve received all of its constellations so you can receive constellations for different characters. I understand it‚Äôs a gatcha game but still. Reward your players better especially the ones that put money into the game.

title: From a Venezuelan traveler

review:
Great game, I love the open world style and that the game is free(which is why this isn‚Äôt 3-stars). The only problems I have with the game are as follows:
1. No controller support at the moment. This would solve SOOOO many control issues I have with the game.
2. Enemies regenerate life when returning to camp. Sounds ok right? Well not if you happen to cross the threshold that their dog chain allows them quite frequently. You could be battling a harder enemy only to be flung out of it‚Äôs reach and lose interest in you, making you lose your progress in the battle.
3. Climbing and gliding controls are odd. This could be in part to the camera angle, but the controls themselves are finicky. Sometimes I jump off of something and expect to glide only to tumble to the ground. Sometimes I want to climb something to escape but the character won‚Äôt even grab onto the thing I am trying to climb. This could possibly be fixed with future controller support added.

Anyway, I don‚Äôt want to come off as a hater, I really do enjoy the game and look forward to them adding more content later this month, perhaps even something listed above. I want to see this game succeed and would recommend trying it out.
title: Good, but a few key improvements, at least for mobile

review: Amazing Amazing game I have been playing it since it first launched and I plan on playing for much longer. It‚Äôs a free game when other games (like Zelda) that have a similar gameplay cost $50ish. I will always thrive about this game and the characters and designs and gameplay. However, it does sometimes seem like the makers of the game take advantage of the fanbase and don‚Äôt give all they could to show the gratitude to people who have made this game as popular as it is by playing it since the beginning and bringing friends to play it. The anniversary award was a joke and getting characters and weapons seems to be a lot harder than usual. Would like them to maybe respect us as people like they did in the beginning.
title: Amazing but

review: The gacha system is really unforgiving. 90 wishes for a guaranteed character and then you have to win that 50/50 chance of getting the character on the banner or not. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs fair at all and it‚Äôs a total cash grab but that‚Äôs only if you care about getting 5* characters. (I personally spent way too much. Don‚Äôt get sucked in.) Otherwise the game is pretty fun. There‚Äôs plenty of quests to do and it has a very interesting storyline. It does make my phone hot. Before I upgraded, my iPhone 7 was basically overheating and it made my game lag. Now that I have the 10 it‚Äôs much better. Oh and lastly yes it is similar to breath of the wild however since I‚Äôve played both I can tell you that they give off a completely different vibe. Both games are amazing and even though they have a few similarities playing them is completely different. Don‚Äôt listen to people who say it‚Äôs a rip off botw lol. (Yo fix the anniversary rewards)
title: It‚Äôs nice (edit: greedy company 1*)

review: I have been playing since day 1 and have spent a good deal amount of money on this game. I will give kudos to the developers for the open world design, but I am rating this 2 stars overall because of the number bugs and issues these game has. Normally, this isn‚Äôt a big deal since bugs are present in every game. The problem is that the developer, Mihoyo, refuses to address these issues or even acknowledge them. A simple ‚Äúwe‚Äôre looking into it‚Äù or even ‚Äúno‚Äù would give many players a peace of mind and closure. There‚Äôs no community manager and no attempts to foster any sort of interactive relationship with the players. The relationship between the players and Mihoyo is comparable to an abusive relationship. I am already taking the initial steps to get out of this abusive relationship by refusing to spend any more money until the developers become more responsive.
title: Disappointing lack of communication

review: This game is phenomenal but hindered by a company that went from generosity and camaraderie with its player base to silence, lessened rewards, and making each of us feel like a kid whose parents forgot their birthday. I NEVER spend money on gacha games but given the fact this game shows off as a passion project full of life, I wanted to support the company while also becoming increasingly interested in investing my time in this. Regardless of greed from our part as players, the lack of recognition of such a successful year due to their developers and the player base is just amazingly pathetic. Heck they even used to give our milestone rewards for millions of new players and now we look at not even enough rewards to level a character we own, but those ingredients we don‚Äôt want to farm, or even get more than a 10 pull comprised of 9 blue weapons and a 4*. Get it together.
title: Love the Gameplay - But MHY needs to respect players

review: Genshin Impact is an AMAZING game, although I ran into a huge problem recently. On the quest ‚ÄúEmpty Abode‚Äù there is wind barrier, ok? So I had Venti open it then while i was on the trail to Stormterror‚Äôs Lair I teleported to the nearest Statue of The Steven (because I was dying) thinking ‚ÄúOh, it will let me continue when I get back‚Äù But, no. Now I cant continue the game/make progress with the game and had to make an entire new account because of it. So in all it‚Äôs a great game, really! But Im super bummed that I had to entirely restart because of one mistake! So my idea would be to make it so you can restart quests/redo them with less of a reward, or specifically towards the ‚ÄúEmpty Abode‚Äù quest, make it so once the 1st wind barrier is opened it says open. Other than that, I love the game! Amazing plot, amazing characters, AND especially amazing graphics! Keep doing what you‚Äôre doing, because it‚Äôs awesome! :D

title: To p2w

review: Genshin Impact is now one of my favorite games. Genshin is smooth playing, beautiful, and has very few glitches that effect game performance. I also just had my birthday and I was greeted with the best surprise. There‚Äôs so much lore too! I‚Äôm so happy to be part of this game. I‚Äôve gotten to do so much and I haven‚Äôt payed one cent. title: An Absolutely Awesome Game

review:
I have already put over 30 hours in to this game and am loving it so much. Great story. Incredible artwork and art design second time none. This is my favorite looking game maybe if all time. I love the character designs. The gameplay is varied and super engaging. And it‚Äôs free!

I plan on supporting the devs because I am having so much fun but this game packs a TON of content without spending a dime! 

Another impressive thing to me is how amazing this looks on my iPhone 8 Plus. Kind of an old phone but it runs and looks like a legit PS4 game! And I‚Äôm so excited about the PC mobile cross saves. I can play this on the go and then kick back and enjoy the incredible art and world design on my big computer screen and it looks incredible. Just try it out. I am so in love!
title: Absolutely BLOWN away!

review:
This is the best mobile game premise I‚Äôve ever seen. Open-word MMORPG with anime visuals, just awesome. The gameplay is excellent and entertaining, and the story in actually very well-though. However, there is currently too little to do, since the story and side quests are very few and the update rate is horrendous. 

But my biggest complaint is the broken gacha system. F2P players get barely any premium currency from quests and events, there is no permanent log in bonus, and the banners are extremely expensive. Also, the rates to get the characters you want are too small, and you need 90 pulls to get a mercy character, which might not even be the one you want. Very disappointing. Seriously, if this game wasn‚Äôt gacha I would say it is one of the best games ever made, mobile or otherwise. Please Mihoyo, make Genshin Impact more F2P-friendly. I really want this to give this game a 5-star review

review:
This game is a really good game and beautiful and loved it at first but end game, gacha rates and progress of characters are the worst I‚Äôve experienced. Enjoy the story but quit after that if you are F2P player.

At first this game is enjoyable but once you get to Adventure Rank 40+ and done everything it is all about maxing out and grinding till you drop game.

End game materials will take you YEARS to complete because 1 character might take 6months to max out even if you‚Äôre the luckiest gamer in RnG history (materials are so rare and RnG + can only be farmed once a WEEK).

Gacha rates are sooo LOW that the developers refused to show the drop rate and made it to 50pulls guarantee which sounds good to many but really it‚Äôs just saying that mandatory 50pulls for your S hero so whale if you want 7 of them to max out or to even be viable to end game bosses.

Also you need many good different heroes to play because of elemental properties for different enemies. The free heroes are trash and boring.

Hero progression is one thing to worry about but wait there‚Äôs more!! you got artifacts with RnG base stats, what about weapons? well Yeah! you need good weapons too!.  So grind till you‚Äôre wallet is empty or grind till you say it quits.

This game is soo grindy with little rewards, it will stress you more than relax you. RnG is the worse and very P2W/Whale focus game.

Enjoy the story but quit after if you‚Äôre F2P.
title: Pay to Win Whaling game

Of course there are side quests you can start by talking to NPCs anywhere if they have a blue exclamation mark above them to earn in-game currencies. Overall this is a very good game and I would highly recommend it to anyone who likes open-world exploration, adventure, good animation, and great storyline.

review:
I‚Äôm very disappointed at hoyoverse‚Äôs lack of diversity within the skin tones. Time and time again, fans have made it clear that they want more variety in skin tones. They want the characters from regions where dark skinned people live, to be represented within the game (especially if genshin is taking inspiration from those regions). 

The absolute refusal to add any character that is darker than the in-game characters (xinyan and Kaeya- the only two tan playable characters) is unacceptable. If you are to create a region that is based off of the Middle East and parts of Africa, then make the characters reflect that. Pale/tan are not the only skin tone in these regions and, if anything, darker skin tones ARE MORE COMMON in these areas. There is no reason that some non-African people are DARKER than these African inspired characters. 

The lore, the culture, the music, everything else that has been released for sumeru has been wonderful. It seems to capture the culture that Sumeru is inspired by wonderfully. But the character designs do not match that. You cannot go around and use REAL PEOPLES culture for profit and then turn around and NOT INCLUDE THEM in your game. This amount of disrespect is unfathomable. Please do better to represent the real human beings that play this game. Otherwise, you‚Äôre telling them that you outright hate them and will ultimately loose money from them. 

Do better.
title: Lack of skin tone diversity

review: i started genshin about 4 months ago, and i‚Äôm ar50 rn. the amount of detail and effort put into the game is shown every single day i play, from the connection of characters (one of ambers voice lines is connected to eulas special dish, chongyun and xingqiu have similar vision designs) the beautiful music transitions, from idle to combat to boss music, the voice lines of characters when the environment changes (changes when it‚Äôs raining, sunny, windy, morning, evening, etc). early game may seem boring, but after you reach adventure rank (ar) 12, daily commissions start and it‚Äôs easy to see how this game is so appealing. the open world system of genshin lets the player get lost in the world, discovering beautiful scenery and fun puzzles. the game can be played casually, without the character caring about damage or bosses, just running around and finding chests. although the wishing system may seem unfair, the player can easily rely on starter characters to get through ar25, and beyond that if the player is still continuing through the game, they probably have dedicated some time to it. genshin is an extremely fun and immersive game, and i love it.

review:
Title: "Locked Out: Genshin Impact's Storage Woes Keep Players at Bay"

As an eager enthusiast eager to delve into the world of Teyvat, the insurmountable storage requirements of Genshin Impact have been a formidable barrier to entry. Despite my anticipation to experience the game's immersive gameplay and captivating storyline, the sheer size of the game has rendered my device inadequate for the task.

Frustratingly, before even embarking on the adventure, I find myself locked out due to insufficient storage space. It's disheartening to miss out on the opportunity to join the millions of players exploring the vast landscapes and engaging in epic battles within Genshin Impact's enchanting universe.

The inability to even download the game highlights a significant issue faced by many potential players who are constrained by limited storage capacities on their devices. It's a missed opportunity not only for players but also for the game's developers, who may be inadvertently alienating a portion of their audience due to this storage dilemma.

In essence, the towering storage requirements of Genshin Impact not only pose a hindrance to current players but also deny aspiring adventurers like myself the chance to partake in the excitement and wonder of this celebrated game. It's a lamentable situation that underscores the importance of optimizing storage efficiency in game development to ensure accessibility for all players, regardless of their device limitations.
title: Too much storage

review: I don‚Äôt hate the game. Been playing this game for over three years. The new f2p player experience is amazing but if you wanna be a serious player just don‚Äôt. Being an end game player myself I literally have nothing to do. I have maxed nearly everything. AR60, 100% exploration, got every achievement, did every single quest, got all rewards from teapot/tgc, lvled every character to 90. I have done basically everything I could. The only thing I could do rn is build every single character and I don‚Äôt have the motivation to do that. I am no speed runner. Everything in game takes me a little bit to do. I am however a completionist.  A few words I can describe this game as a late game player is greedy, repetitive, yappersville, colorism, and boring. I will be pulling for Arlecchino and then quitting since she is my favorite character and have already saved a lot for her.
title: Save your storage:/

review:
This game time and time again refuses to give rewards to their players! Three years of support from their fans (and monetary support mainly, I‚Äôm sure) and three pulls for thanks! Maybe one for each year? That‚Äôs terrible! I think hoyoverse wants players to leave Genshin and go to literally any one of their other games. 

Of course a business is a business, and it makes sense to prioritize profits! But what genuine harm does giving a free five star character do? Not enough to stop them from giving one away in another game, apparently. What harm does adding more things to do for people who have already played through permanent content? Not enough to stop them from implementing it in another game. I could go on, but that would be a waste of my time.

All in all, give players a reason to play and let them enjoy it! Reward your audience so they feel some type of way and continue to play. 

Honestly, getting busier with work and literally anything else to do, I don‚Äôt really play Genshin anymore. I catch up every month or so when I have time, but I tend to only do surface level stuff. That said, I have some friends who play a lot and I used to be into it as well. Just super disappointing to see. I‚Äôm pretty sure I‚Äôm just going to stop playing Genshin Impact altogether and find another open-world, quest-based game to enjoy.
title: Fun game, money hungry

review: I hadn‚Äôt been playing for a long time and I decided to try with my progress restored. But when I added my exact same password and email it constantly said error. I do not recommend this game. Another thing is it takes way too much storage space. The stamina bar is maxed too low at the start of the game, and that makes it really hard to do what you want to do. Another thing is the 7 are too far apart. I had to travel 2658 meters just to get to the nearest of the 7 to monstadt. The characters and graphics aren‚Äôt really accurate, and the gameplay takes way too long. I hate the idea you have to level up your adventure level, because it takes forever. I mean, why should there be so much advertising in this game with so much of the good stuff but none of the bad stuff. That technically is bad advertising. I really wanted to play this game but now I can‚Äôt. Again, I do not recommend this game.

The events are repetitive it‚Äôs either fight the same enemies over and over or fight a boss you have already beaten multiple times. review: I never would have thought that I‚Äôd ever be able to enjoy a Gacha game, but Genshin impact is out of this world. The world is massive and gorgeous and every character is fun to play. The best and worst part about this game is the combat. It‚Äôs fluid, flashy and fun, but it‚Äôs far from challenging. Enemies don‚Äôt bother dodging your attacks and you can just rank most of the enemy attacks, the pve system is built around trying to kill a certain amount of enemies in a certain amount of time and it takes a lot of fun away knowing that the only good way to build your characters is damage upon damage. Being a tank for your co op teammates is useless because you can just have someone heal the health back while dishing out crazy amounts. There should be another Meta other than just stacking crit damage and crit chance on every character.

title: I think I might have found a glitch but otherwise it‚Äôs pretty good

review:
Gave a 1 star review because mainly of account security issues. The company has had two security vulnerabilities exposed in the past few months already (mind you, this is a company founded in 2012 and has had lots of experience in these types of games). First one was how easily hackers could grab your phone number if you linked it, and the second was your email. And now, apparently, there‚Äôs a way for hackers to get your name from your linked social media accounts (especially Facebook) very easily as long as they know your password.

The community‚Äôs been trying to push for 2FA because security is important. Imagine spending a hundred or so on an account and that it can easily be hacked through brute force. They don‚Äôt notify you if your email/phone number gets unlinked either. And what‚Äôs more, they‚Äôre most likely aware of these, but haven‚Äôt fixed them. And they haven‚Äôt made an announcement addressing these issues.

At this point, making an account is all at-your-own-risk. Until they fix the vulnerabilities and start listening to the players more often, only then will I change this review.

Yes, it‚Äôs a great game with great characters, amazing design, wonderful music and a fun rpg element to it. But that all comes at a cost that your account can be taken out of nowhere.
title: Security issues mainly, and not willing to listen to major feedback

review: Don‚Äôt read any further, just download it. It‚Äôs honestly incredible, there‚Äôs no reason this shouldn‚Äôt be on Apple Arcade or cost money. review:
Genshin is an amazing game and I enjoy it and it‚Äôs very creative but I do have one complaint. The regions are based on several different cultures but with the recent showing and reveal of Sumeru and the talk of new character rumors, we have a lack of colored representation in the game. Sumeru is based on a couple regions and those regions do have tan and darker skinned individuals in them. If you are going to make a region inspired by a culture and specific race then make the characters and NPC‚Äôs match the people living in that region. It‚Äôs just respectful and makes sense.

We love the game but there is a lack of diversity in skin tones and we need a change. Please listen to this, you will profit more if you make characters that match the current region at the time. I know that‚Äôs important to your company.

title: skin tones

Looking at the same skin tone over and over again is boring, all the designs are starting to look the same and it‚Äôs very disappointing as somebody who has spent thousands of dollars on this game. I do not plan on contributing a dollar to this game until the issue is fixed. Do better. Listen to the players who come from the cultures you are supposed to be representing because clearly your team can‚Äôt put in an ounce of research before designing a culture-heavy character and are only thinking about money.

title: Recommended should play

review: listen, i love this game. it has beautiful character designs, character stories, an interesting plot line, fun events and the graphics are beautiful. genshin is truly a successful rpg game that i have grown to love! i‚Äôm ar 53 and have spent over a thousand dollars on these lovable characters and beautiful weapons. it‚Äôs grand. BUT. the company truly does not care about its community or players. the rewards are small and cheap, they ask artists for free promotion and art in exchange for 100 primogems (not enough for a single wish), and time and time again they are expressing that they will do fhe care minimum when rewarding players and artists in the community. most of us have spent thousands of dollars promoting and playing this game, and it‚Äôs a spit in face from mihoyo to give so little in return. i do not recommend u get hooked on this game as i did, and for other artists i 100% recommend you refrain for working on art for them for as little as 100 primos. your art is worth more.
title: great, but.

title: Love you but maybe be nicer to your community

review: First time leaving a review because I‚Äôm frustrated to a point that I want to delete the game even though I spent quite a lot of money on this game already. The game itself is pretty good, but their customer support is beyond horrible. The game is supposed to work on multiple platforms which includes PC, PlayStation, and iOS devises. However, a simple task such as unlinking your PSN account is nearly impossible (that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm having problem with) because first of all, you have to email them in a specific format. If you are lucky enough, they will send you an automated email which requires you to fill out all the information, but that‚Äôs not the end, after you submit it, they don‚Äôt respond to your request at all! I‚Äôm so freaking disappointed at their customer support. It feels like they are a company that only wants to make money through in app purchase and don‚Äôt care about anything else!
title: Customer support is horrible!!

review: I‚Äôve been playing for a month or two now and I love this game! I used to play on mobile and it felt almost impossible to do anything with the controls! review: I love this game, and my review would be a 5* if not for a few problems. First off, as many can see, the characters are not diverse enough. Maybe, on the standard banner, pity could kick in early as most people don‚Äôt wish there regularly. My last suggestion would be to make primogems more readily available. Once you reach high AR, I‚Äôd say around 50, the ways to get primogems are ver limited, in daily commissions, events, and a few other ways. Otherwise, I highly recommend it - Its definitely a game that will keep you awake playing it, or hanging off every minute waiting for a new update.

review:

review:
literally like there‚Äôs no poc rep they‚Äôre all paper white‚Ä¶game starts to feel grindy and chore-like in the endgame because there‚Äôs nothing to do except for abyss (hard enemies on a time limit to defeat). great graphics and story, detail is amazing too, but everything is behind paywalls. sure, you can play F2P, but what about when your resin reaches 0? title: I love this game !!

review: There have been numerous problems stated by the Genshin community such as, the fishing system, and the anniversary rewards, although I do debate that the fishing system is moreover a new mechanic to the game, and should be taken granted the fact it could be improved, although I do agree with the anniversary rewards, it could use a bit more generosity, the best idea for me is a free standard five star weapon and character, I also debate that genshin is still worth playing but needs improvement, I argue about the designs and storytelling of genshin, designs and storytelling that moreover aren‚Äôt creative, repetitive, and sexual, I also believe that the cutscenes should improve, they should balance their over-all difficulty, and add different and diverse mechanics to keep the flow of interest going, for now I have rated this game three stars.
title: Current State of Genshin Impact

review: I want to make this clear, I gave the game 3 stars not because it‚Äôs a bad game, not because it‚Äôs boring, not because it‚Äôs bad in general. I gave this game 3 stars because of the constant crashing and lag I have. I seem to have only about 5 minutes of time before the game crashes and I have to start whatever it is I was doing again. It‚Äôs an amazing game with an amazing story and stunning graphics, and don‚Äôt get me started on the amazing character design. And I know that I am not the only person like this. Some people just can‚Äôt afford to buy new laptops or new phones. So I‚Äôm really hoping that this coach bug can be fixed. Other than those problems, I would have given this game a 5 star rating.
title: Not a bad game

review:
Have several months experience playing on mobile since launch. Runs alright on iPhone 10x but after a short amount of time it gradually heats up to the point of almost burning the hands IRL even on poor settings. As well as draining battery rapidly it also takes a lot of storage and will definitely take up more as areas are released. 

For a Mobile Game (or gacha, for that matter) it requires a lot of time to farm materials or do dailies/weeklies as there is no way to auto stages or teleport straight to dailies. You also constantly switch host instances to farm. Gacha has good pity but actually getting rolls is a real chore and devs are stingy with rolls such as Anniversary having pitiful rewards.

The game has good gameplay and interesting characters but from a technical point and as a mobile game it has shortcomings that made me have to drop it until I get a proper PC.
title: Great console game poor mobile game

review:
So I know that to have the best game performance is to have an iPhone 8 plus and up, but I know that you can do better, Maybe allow Settings to tweak in the game performance as in Low, Medium, and high quality and how much FPS its being used as in now, I think that would be a great idea for other people with other mobile devices to enjoy the game without experimenting any other sorts of Game errors.
Last but not least this might of not come but its just a suggestion to let Xbox and MacOs Players be able to play this game as well, I think it would be very fun for other people to be able to play with friends with different cross-play platforms.
Over all this is a great game and I love so much.
title: Suggestion....?

review:
I love this game and the graphics. I don‚Äôt mind some of the bugs and they seem to be ironing those out more and more. 

I even so far don‚Äôt mind how much of a grind leveling is because it‚Äôs sort of fun, but I think like other reviews the pay to win aspect will come out the longer it‚Äôs played. I also would rather monetization focus on customizing, skins, clothes, avatar hair options and how you look, and open up a little more of the nice weapons and characters drops from wishing. 

My largest issue isn‚Äôt one everyone would share, and I think I might even get made fun of for how I feel about it, but I wish in the story I wouldn‚Äôt be forced to ‚Äúworship‚Äù the statues in order to progress. Maybe it‚Äôs just the wording. I don‚Äôt mind leaving orbs but I don‚Äôt like being forced to participate in a game religion even if the game is focused on it. I didn‚Äôt have an issue with the story at all until I realized leveling the statues requires ‚Äúworshipping‚Äù them and that‚Äôs not ok with me. 

I might stop playing entirely because of that but will see if I can still progress if I choose not to do that part. 

Suggestion: change the words from ‚Äúworship‚Äù to ‚Äúleave an offering‚Äù 

I think that would help a little to be honest, and might help other people like me be more interested in the game.
title: Good Game, Some Issues

review: The game is so beautiful. The graphics are amazing and the music is insanely good for a game. There are a lot of quests and places to explore when you start the game, but once you get to a higher rank, there isn‚Äôt a lot to do. I am adventure rank 58 right now and have had 100% exploration since adventure rank 57. I also have no more quests to do and wait tediously for new regions and characters to be released. I often get bored and stop playing for a while because there is nothing to do, but I always come back when a new region/character is released. I also want to mention that the game takes up about 29GB of my 60GB storage, so there isn‚Äôt a lot of other stuff I can do on my phone.
title: Would have rated 5 but there are a few things to note

review: Genshin Impact definitely nails soundtrack and visual design. It is the most beautiful game I‚Äôve played and it honestly surpasses the visuals of Honkai Starrail (their newer game). HOWEVER, genshin can definitely get boring and repetitive after a while if you play for too long. It‚Äôs meant to be a quick game that you can pull out on your phone while you‚Äôre bored. Not a full on high investment sort of game. I think people really need to understand this and just quit complaining about endgame when you can just play another game. Hoyoverse  isn‚Äôt  going to do it sadly since they never intended for this game to be played extensively. If they wanted they could easily fix all issues with this game and I really wish they would, but I guess hoyoverse doesn‚Äôt care that much about genshin to do so. ( game design-wise not art/ lore)

title: Stick with you till the end<3

review: I started Genshin April of 2022, and i'm still playing. I went on vacation for a while and deleted it because i never played but I got it back in June. I have seen some people that have completed what's available, luckily I'm not that far yet. I came back just in time for the Sumeru region and i wasn't even done in Liyue so I still had a lot to do. Since then I've finished Inazuma and am now moving to Sumeru. My only complaint is sometimes my AR was to low to progress the story so I did a lot of grinding wich got boring. But i got past it and it's all good again. There are daily commissions to help leveling and tons of world quest that bridge the AR gap I try to save them for when Im stuck or bored.
title: Best game I've played as of now

review:
I felt compelled to write a review after my experience with the ‚ÄúCake for Traveler‚Äù birthday cake award. I missed the login on that day (not unheard of for someone to be busy with family on their birthday) and now I don‚Äôt get an exclusive cake for that whole year. Contacted customer support and they proceeded to basically belittle me with emojis in their response and basically ‚Äúlet this be a lesson to login everyday traveler‚Ä¶.‚Äù Blah blah‚Ä¶.

I understand I‚Äôm not going to get the cake but to make me feel even worse with their response didn‚Äôt help. I‚Äôve been supporting this game for 2 years now, despite their horrible 1st anniversary reward.

Basically this game has beautiful music, beautiful story, but it‚Äôs bittersweet because it‚Äôs ran by an extremely greedy, predatory company that doesn‚Äôt care about it‚Äôs players. I‚Äôve played many gacha games and if it wasn‚Äôt for this game‚Äôs story, I would have done myself a favor and left it a long time ago.
title: Horrible customer support

review: I have tried many times to use this game as an escape for reality and a fun fantasy adventure, but the lack of representation in the models truly astounds me. Dark skin is not represented nearly enough in any of the characters or regions. I am under the impression that the pyro nation to be introduced later in the game is supposed to represent indigenous Americans (my people) and from the comic involving Vennessa we have seen that they are‚Ä¶ almost all pale and redheaded? The Sumeru region that is coming to the game soon, supposedly taking influence from South Asian and North African cultures, has been represented by NPC characters who share the same extremely pale skintone as 99% of the rest of the characters. I fear that this problem I have with the game will only get worse as more updates are released. I and many others who feel misrepresented by this game will not continue to play it if this keeps up in the future.
title: Lack of representation makes it impossible for me to get into

title: Well

review:
Hello to the devs, im enjoying the game quite a lot. You made a really neat world and im happy that im able to be in it as lumine :D
However, i would like to acknowledge this issue:
im in the middle of a world quest and I. JUST. CANT. CLEAR IT.
that in itself would be fine, but unfortunately i cant enter co op mode and farm materials for my talents now. This is so annoying im considering quitting the game. I googled the problem and many other people were experiencing frustration as well. In my opinion, this could even force players to avoid world quests. If you fixed the system so that players could enter co op mode in domains even in the middle of a world quest, that would be amazing and remove a huge stressor from the game. Thank you.
title: Please help mihoyo please i need it

review: I very much love the idea of this game, however I feel like there are so many pointless events and updates instead of continuing the actual story. The game takes up so much storage that somewhere in between the release of Sumeru and Fontaine, Genshin Impact is going to lose a very large amount of players due to the amount of storage this game is because of random events that have nothing to do with the main story. Another problem, and this one is just my personal opinion, is that Ei‚Äôs story quest was really bad. She should‚Äôve went around trying to right her wrongs and apologize to her people rather than taking pictures and buying food with the Traveler. The graphics and main idea of the game are quite amazing though, but with the way this game is being made, it will probably lose like half of it‚Äôs players by the time it‚Äôs complete.
title: Good game but there are some issues

review: The game is literally 12 and up on the App Store. I started playing this game when I was 13, and I was heavily addicted. At first, I thought this game was cute and really well made for a mobile app. But quickly, I fell down a slippery slope of spending mostly all my allowance on this game. I would spend at least 50 bucks on each banner. It wasn‚Äôt healthy, and before long it ruined my mental health. I couldn‚Äôt take breaks from the game, because if I did I would miss out on a bunch of content. Again, I was only 13 this was quite literally an addiction. This game should at least be 18 plus, at the end of the day it‚Äôs a form of gambling. I would get sort of a rush from wishing, then when I actually got the character I wanted, I would feel empty. Then I would do it again for almost every banner. Miyoho should be more upfront about this instead of letting minors basically gain gambling addictions.
title: This game literally causes gambling addictions for minors

review: Genshin impact is great game but the way it‚Äôs handled can be really bad, mihoyo already had two big scandals in less than 2 months, first not letting the character that have sold the most work with a really great support that its already in game and even giving fake advertising of a character to then just change it based on a ‚Äútranslation error‚Äù and second after 1 year making billions the anniversary rewards and just nonexistent just 10 wishes when it takes 75-90 wishes to get a 5* and running some art/cosplaying event for $5 dollars price, i don't think a cosplay is worth just $5. Mostly every gacha have really good rewards for anniversary, Genshin is not one of those. The game is really good until you get to the point you run out of content and i would advise to not spend a single dollar on it just be a F2P and you will have more fun and you wont feel as robbed.
title: Great game but‚Ä¶.

review: The game is beautiful; combat, reactions, quest, they‚Äôre all intricate and fun BUT, mihoyo. Has been neglecting its game and it‚Äôs communities voice. MILLIONS of people are fed up with their FIRST anniversary. The lack of buffs to seriously highly underused characters, the resin system being unbearable making it difficult to even play the game for extensive periods(this is heavily in-forced and inflated once you hit AR30-35 where it starts to pick up and become insane exp and the amount of you get from domains and how much resin they consume making it rapidly difficult). For example some who is AR55, it‚Äôll take them several MONTHS of daily grinding and using all your resin and fragile resin to progress to the next level. This is literally how ABYSMAL things are. Mihoyo you guys need to make changes asap or you‚Äôre going to lose hundreds of millions. And if your new.. I wouldn‚Äôt advise getting to invested into this game until they start doing some much needed changes
title: Mihoyo needs to change..

review: The game has so much potential but it‚Äôs just a gacha game they don‚Äôt care about anything but you paying them. The resin system holds you back from playing and makes co-op play practically useless. The rate on characters is super low so even if they give away 50 wishes good luck getting anything useful. Honestly I would love the game if it was an actual game and not a cash grab. You‚Äôll log in do your dailies maybe use your resin if you still even care at this point and then log off. Tbh I wouldn‚Äôt spend any money on this game because it‚Äôs basically just gambling with a very low chance of winning and the ‚Äúendgame‚Äù is highly dependent on you having good option of characters and a lot of resin spent which you only get so much per day after that you have to pay to play more basically, once resin is gone the game is just running around attacking random enemies.
title: So much potential

review:
everything about genshin impact is just a solid 10/10. but, when it comes to quests, it can make you almost uninstall the game.
what quest am i talking about?
the trails of tianqiu valley quest. the fact that you're stuck in singleplayer until you defeat it has made SO MANY players (including me) furious. most people were about to just restart their game, trade accs, etc. it's almost impossible. many people just want it removed or atleast let you have access to co-op mode (like with the lost book quest or the guili plains quest). the main problem is the tower to the left. it's easy when you're 5 levels higher than the opponents, but on world level 5,,,, it's almost impossible.

title: This is a really amazing game to play but I have one complaint.

review:
I'm not going to lie, I'm always skeptical of free games like this because there tends to be the 'pay to win' kind of feel with them. However, I'm AR 30 and I haven't had to make a single purchase to get everything. I've been able to earn everything through the resources given. 

However, even though the graphics, game style, and story are amazing, the bugs are getting worse. I understand the game is only in 1.2 right now, but the bugs started increasing after the event update for Albedo. When I first downloaded it, I never had any issues, but now it seems to be crashing every 10-15 minutes and it's annoying having to reload. If these bugs can be fixed, that would be great!
title: Amazing, but a couple issues

review: This game is overall amazing. The quality is incredible, the shading, the art, the voice acting, the storyline, everything is amazing! And while this game is really great, anytime there‚Äôs a cut scene where you see something happening‚Äîlike the very beginning for example, the noises and visuals get all fuzzy, but nothing else does this. Another thing, this is just a suggestion, but when you‚Äôre actually playing as the character, maybe add the sky and water. It‚Äôs just black and that‚Äôs slightly irritating, but it can be played without. Anyways, great game overall!

review:
I‚Äôve been playing Genshin since November 2020, and while I love this game, it‚Äôs not a sustainable one. There is a point where the game is simply not worth playing because there is so little endgame content. Compared to Honkai Star Rail, Genshin looks like a lackluster cash grab. 

I‚Äôve spent my fair share of money on characters, and while I don‚Äôt regret it, I expect my voice (and others in the community) to be listened to and respected by the company, which it does not do. As a consumer, this is a slap in the face. I will no longer give my money to Genshin because not only is there basically no content for veteran players, the continuously disappointing updates makes it hard to keep playing. It‚Äôs obvious that there‚Äôs a lack of effort on the devs side to keep up with player demands, and both my time and money are better spent elsewhere. Do yourself a favor: don‚Äôt spend money on this game, and if you‚Äôre a new player, quit.
title: HORRIBLE endgame

I hope you have just as fun of an adventure as I did! :) and also‚Ä¶it did take up 25G of storage but in my opinion it was worth it!

title: Amazing game but it gets on my nerves sometimes

review:
Okay so where do I start. This is by far one of the most beautiful games I‚Äôve ever seen on mobile. The graphics are gorgeous and the scenery and vast expanse of world exploration is amazing. The freedom to move and explore is unmatched compared to most available games on mobile. You can even play it on console and pc, the cross-play feature is amazing and allows me to play with all of my friends again. Now my favorite part I have to say though is the gorgeous story outline I‚Äôve seen thus far and I‚Äôm only a rank 21 as I write this. 

But I have to say. The reason that brings me here to begin with. The reason I didn‚Äôt rate the game five stars. As ai traveled through the beautiful city of Mondstadt, I saw this gorgeous black and white Labrador like dog. It was jumping around and playing and dancing, and I couldn‚Äôt help but stop and watch as it walked up to my character and sat down staring up at me. 

Only. For. Me. NOT TO BE ABLE TO PET IT!!!! This is bull and I demand to be able to pet the bestest boi!!!! 

To summarize... I would like to be able to pet the dog. Please add this. 

P.S 

I really love the game! And I appreciate everything y‚Äôall do. Thank you for your time.
title: I‚Äôd had have rated it a five but...

review: Please note that this is a review specifically for the iOS version of Genshin Impact. I usually play on PC via Epic Games and absolutely love it (I‚Äôd rate 4.5ish). I decided to clear out the 3.5ish gigs on my iPhone to download Genshin here so I could play when I can‚Äôt use my PC. However, what they fail to mention anywhere that I can see is that the iOS version is a demo. After downloading and playing through the very limited amount of content, you must additionally download over 15GB of additional content to continue playing. This prevents me from using the app, as I am at AR45 and have long since played through all of the demo content available, and I cannot afford to sacrifice 1/4 of my phone‚Äôs storage to a game I already play on another platform. As a side note, while in the LOADING SCREEN, my phone heated up quite a bit, which is extremely unusual for it.

review:
Genshin Impact has been an amazing game since release with stunning graphics on a cross platform game for mobile, PC, and later on Playstation. Music is amazing. I have been waiting for a game just like this to appear on mobile. I have spent a good amount of money and time on this game. I have started nearly a year ago.

I will give my opinion and thoughts on the situation in regards to the one year anniversary. Yes, people should have high expectations for rewards but don‚Äôt be going overboard with the complaining when it does not meet your expectations. I expected more but was not surprised and I am content with what we got plus the extras. 

Looking at other gacha games especially Honkai Impact, their one year anniversary rewards were underwhelming too. Each year did improve or get better so we can expect next year rewards to improve as well as going forward. 

Again Mihoyo keep up the good work in developing the game forward. Looking forward to the adventure in the other regions yet to be released. I hope to continue to be playing this game years down the road as I love all aspects of the game.
title: Amazing Game

review: The art work, the story, and the voice acting are all very engaging and well done. I‚Äôm so impressed with this game considering it‚Äôs free. Even if you catch up with the story you never run out of things to do, there are always extra events going on as well as daily commissions. Not to mention grinding for artifacts and ascension materials T.T You can certainly get great characters and weapons without spending money, the free 4-star weapons are really good especially if you remember to level them up! Great game, but be weary if the fandom. There‚Äôs a lot of children who through tantrums when they don‚Äôt get their way. I try not to engage too much and just enjoy the game for what it is.
title: Engaging story, loads of extra content

title: The next game that can positively take up ur time

review:
The anniversary rewards only made the end game players quit. As an AR57 at the moment, I was actually looking forward for the rewards but the rewards ended up trash. Even the lantern rite event rewards are better than this whatever ‚Äúanniversary‚Äù rewards you call it.

There‚Äôs also nothing to do as an end game player. Most people just log on, do resins, dailies, and log off. And this repeats everyday for most end game players. I‚Äôve been repeating this cycle for more than 4 months now and I‚Äôm extremely burnt out. There‚Äôs barely any content and barely anything to do when you‚Äôre at the end game stage. Even the story quests seems extremely rushed on the 2.1 update. 

As a player that started playing two days after the release, this game is starting to go downhill. It‚Äôs not even that bad to just give us better rewards, especially when there are low spenders and f2p players struggling to keep saving.
title: The anniversary rewards and end game

title: Disappointed but not really surprised

review:
For context for those that dont know about the Sumeru situation:
A while ago (at the time of writing this) 5 new characters were leaked for the new region which is based off of EGYPT (keep that in mind). Out of these 5 characters, 4 of them were light-skinned. Normally that wouldn‚Äôt be a problem, but considering that Sumeru is literally supposed to be based off of Egypt that‚Äôs ridiculous. There are currently a total of 2 playable characters currently in the game that have darker complexions. so far thats 3 counting the new character. Fans were hoping that we‚Äôd get more with the release of Sumeru and Natlan but it‚Äôs looking like that won‚Äôt be the case. So Hoyoverse, if you want the nations to be culturally accurate, ADD MORE DIVERSE CHARACTERS.

However, I understand why this happened. Unfortunately, colorism is still very rampant in our society, especially in Asian countries. It‚Äôs just unfortunate that even one of my favorite games isn‚Äôt an exception to this.

title: It has its issues

review:
I started playing this game a little over a year ago for about five months, until I deleted it for storage. I re-downloaded it about three weeks ago and fell in love all over again. Genshin Impact's plots and character dialogues are beautifully written, coming from a writer. The tiniest details from the landscapes and animals, etc., are breathtaking. From the whoosh of the characters' dresses to the movement of the grass as your character walk, it's amazing. Now, I'm still just a teenager but this is hands-down one of the best games I've played. I do have a few suggestions, but I would still love the game even if you guys don't add them.

1. Maybe a clothes shop? That sounds immature and childish but I would love it if I could dress Amber, Lisa, Kaeya, etc., in customized outfits. 

2. Customized storylines? It would be amazing to be able to have my character have a romance or rivalry or strong friendship with another character in the game, such as Kaeya or Venti. 

Those are all the suggestions I have, keep up the great work! To anyone who likes fantasy, adventure, mystery and dystopian role playing games, I would highly recommend this game.

I don‚Äôt know how it works but I hope you can fix this issue because, 17 GB? That‚Äôs way too much and only 3 regions (Monstadt, Liyue, Inazuma) have been out. It‚Äôs so fun to collect all of the characters and grow to be a strong player. Just 10/10 so much fun. Definitely something you could loose yourself in and play for hours!
title: Must have RPG

review: As a game depending on new story elements, Genshin could do well to focus on complementing each game chapter with actual effort put into its banners, a lottery system that updates with desirable characters related to the story. Instead, the developers at miHoYo put out very slim percentages for the chance to actually get those characters. In addition, they keep railroading its community engagement through forced PR narratives that do not address players‚Äô concerns with actual content and gameplay quality issues, instead preferring to talk only about its shiny new content that does not address the underlying concerns. Lastly, the latest anniversary update has incensed many with paltry offerings and little acknowledgment of the community support that has taken miHoYo this far since a year ago. They have essentially ignored any and all feedback in favor of promoting a long marketing scheme, and for that it was inevitable that there be pushback critique.

But, god forbid, the community has fun with a bug like Kokomi‚Äôs water glitch? Immediate action. Mihoyo deliberately ignores your feedback, asks for your money, and withholds any sort of substantial reward for playing this game for an extended period of time. I recommend you spend your time on a game with a better dev team that cares about what you say even if you don‚Äôt regularly spend thousands of dollars.

title: Anniversary event

review:
To start, I‚Äôve been playing this game for 322 days and before this I‚Äôve loved it. But now I realize just how much Mihoyo hates the community. Despite making billions of dollars, this company shows over and over again how much they hate their players. Not only do they refuse to give us satisfactory anniversary rewards (despite, once again, making MILLIONS every single month) they also started censoring anyone who talks badly about said anniversary rewards on their social media. It‚Äôs difficult to get pulls in the endgame and for a company that makes so much from the players, you would think they‚Äôd be nicer to us. But no, mihoyo remains greedy instead of doing what literally every gacha game does: give us good anniversary rewards as compensation for helping them get this far.

Also, mihoyo is very predatory and refuses to release a roadmap or any knowledge about future updates so that people will be more likely to spend money.

title: An amazing game ruined by shady business tactics

review: Everything about this game is amazing. There's absolutely NO ads (or at least none that I've come across in my few hours of gameplay), it's FREE, AND it's open world. The whole time I'm playing this it feels like I'm playing a game on console or PC, it's so extremely well done. The graphics are wonderful, character designs are beautiful, even the enemies are designed extremely well. It's overall an extremely beautiful game and the gameplay makes it feel like I'm actually playing it on console. If this game ever makes it to the Switch, god knows how many hours I will put into it. Gameplay is amazing, it feels extremely natural during combat, running around and collecting things across the world feels awesome. It's so satisfying to play!
title: Amazing Game

review: The scenery is gorgeous and the characters are amazing. I can‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs a free game while similar games such as Zelda are $70? I think that‚Äôs a little ridiculous considering Genshin is much better in my opinion, with updates all the time, new characters and new places to explore. You can also join your friends and beat bosses and farm domains together. The only thing is that the game is big, so some updates take a long time. Lastly, Genshin announced on January 14, 2020 that it was going to be released on Nintendo Switch. I‚Äôm a little disappointed that it never released and I‚Äôm hoping that someday I will be able to play it on my Nintendo. I understand that it takes a long time though.
title: Amazing game

review: This is pretty much my comfort game, I love it so much. The concept and characters are absolutely genius and so well crafted. But, on the concept of characters‚Ä¶the lack of diversity is pretty much my only issue with this game. As someone who is white, but is apart of the Hispanic community, I‚Äôd love for the next region, Natlan to have more diversity, especially with the region being based on places like Mexico. Please Genshin, a little diversity isn‚Äôt gonna kill you. And I swear to all that is holy, if the god turns out to be white, I‚Äôm going to jump off a microwave. MAKE MORE CULTURALLY ACCURATE CHARACTERS, PLEASE. YOU ALREADY HAVE PUSHED ME TO MY BREAKING POINT WITH THE CANDACE CONTROVERSY. PLEASE GENSHIN, I LOVE YOU BUT I CAN‚ÄôT, AND WILL NOT TAKE YOUR BLATANT RACISM LIGHTLY. Thank you for coming to my TEDtalk.
title: Beautiful game but one issue

review:
I've been playing for over a year. I do enjoy most of the content and the characters. However, I don't enjoy the way I feel treated as a player. As someone who has played Honkai Star Rail since its release, I've seen a huge difference in the way players are treated. And with the release of 4.4 and it's underwhelming rewards, this only worsens. But that doesn't mean giving me "better rewards" just this once will fix this. It didn't last time, it won't this time. Scraps won't be enough to keep this under the table. Clearly nothing was learned and we were just given very little to shut us up. It feels upsetting and disrespectful. Not to mention the upsetting rewards we have gotten in the past for getting Genshin Game of the Year awards not just once but TWICE and for multiple categories.
All of this compared to Honkai Star Rails rewards this last GOTY event.

More in-depth issues I have seen/experienced:
ÔªøÔªøÔªøMore endgame content doesn't mean more challenging content, just something else to do on a weekly basis to let veteran plavers do something.
ÔªøÔªøÔªøBetter rewards, it shouldn't take 3 patches to guarantee a 5 star (if you lose 50/50) when there's 4, soon to be 6, featured banners every single patch.
ÔªøÔªøÔªøOld events stay in the storage? Then THEY SHOULD BE PLAYABLE, even with a fraction of the gems rewards

title: Great! Just a few issues..

review:
I‚Äôve been playing for 2 years, and I can safely say this game is great. The world is beautiful, the character designs are great, and the combat is great. Though the story can feel a bit monotonous in the beginning, and sometimes a bit rushed, it gets a lot better the more you progress. The wishing system is also nice, including a pity system. If you‚Äôre familiar with the genre of gacha games and are really looking for one to invest your time in, genshin is the one!

Something that you should know is that every update is about 2gbs big. There is an update about every 42 days, excluding one version which had a delay, so just make sure your storage is prepared!
title: Great game! A few issues

review:
Ok, this game is my addiction literally!! I‚Äôve been playing this game for the past 7 months and it‚Äôs the first thing I do every morning! This is a great game and I love it but I hate this new thing where I need to be connected to the internet. Now the game that I can play on the go is no longer a go game it‚Äôs a stay-at-home game. Not everyone is a pc or console user. Me and most others play mobile (which I recommend) so if you could go back to how things were before because I would like to play this game while waiting for the bus/train or waiting for class to start. 
I still love this game 100% but please go back!!
title: I love this game but this wifi update has to go!!!

review:
Don‚Äôt get me wrong I love this game and I would totally recommend this game to other people, But it takes up like a large amount of space on my mobile device and it started getting a little boring. I have very limited space, And Genshin technically takes up almost 1/2 of it and it‚Äôs really annoying to me because I barely have anything else to play when I feel like it so I have to delete Genshin and add the game I want. Then delete the game later on and add Genshin back. But the only time I really hate it is when I need to update. Also when I‚Äôm also in co-op with my friends, I feel like we should be able to talk to certain people instead of them leaving then coming back. 

But either way it‚Äôs just fine, ‚ù§Ô∏èLove ya
title: Great game! ‚Ä¶But

review:
Genshin is an amazing open world rpg with great graphics and an interesting storyline. At first, I really enjoyed the game and it‚Äôs gameplay, but I‚Äôve been playing for almost a year and I‚Äôve grown to strongly dislike it. 
The gacha system is horrid, even if you pay to win you have to waste over 100 dollars to get enough pulls to reach pity (since the 5 star chance is so low) and if you‚Äôre free to play you don‚Äôt even get one wish a day through daily commissions. You have to grind chests and play events that honestly have gotten repetitive and boring. The only good thing about the game is the characters but since the gacha is so awful you can‚Äôt even enjoy that.
Also, the anniversary rewards were absolute garbage.
title: Great game, absolutely horrible gacha and rewards

review: I've been playing genshin since the beginning and i love it but, the lack of character representation is heartbreaking, before sumeru character leaks, characters were extremely pale, yes being pale is fine but for characters who work on a boat for hours a day to be as pale as paper, is extremely colorist and unrealistic. the sumeru characters completely lack representation. yes, pale people exist in the swana region but not every single person. most people for multiple reasons are tan and it's stupid how characters like kusanali, al haitham, and tighnari are paler than the characters in mondstat. this company makes millions of dollars, it's not hard for darker skin tones. the few times characters have been tan, xinyan for example, you made her extremely stereotypical, southern, plays guitar, described as loud and scary. in your other game honkai impact, the character carol and canon black woman, says that she hates her skin tone. that is extremely colorist. please fix this.
title: more representation

review:
i, as an addicted player have to say that genshin for sure needs improvement. events are able to be cleared (for more experienced players) in a day. there needs to be more events, or at least if there isn‚Äôt more events added they need to be spread out more. sumeru, a region that is supposed to be based off of middle eastern and south asian cultures/areas, had from what i‚Äôve seen all light colored npcs. it‚Äôs disgusting. i know that genshin impact is a game based in china, and people there haven‚Äôt seen much of darker skin tones, but this simple fact shouldn‚Äôt excuse the lack of representation. there are only two darker colored people in genshin. sure, it‚Äôs some representation. but those areas are based in germany and china. there isn‚Äôt even a darker toned person in inazuma. 

also, new players suffer with genshin. for example, a banner out for a character from inazuma is running and a new played wants them. they only can get that character to level 20 and then from there can‚Äôt level them up more until they go through the long story, and about the time they get to inazuma they probably don‚Äôt care anymore.

i hope genshin actually listens to their community, especially when it comes to more variety. i really hope that hoyoverse isn‚Äôt just some money hungry app, and actually cares about their fan base.
title: change is desperately needed

review: Alright, I love the game so much, I play a while to try to get new characters and unlock new places, but if you have a PC, I would recommend you get it on there, because the first day I started playing Genshin I used mobile, and the second day I decided to read some reviews (I don‚Äôt know why) and I saw this review that PC has better graphics, and oh my god, that review was not lying, it might just be my bad WiFi but I got kicked out of the game a lot on mobile, so I decided to try my PC and it has better graphics, it doesn‚Äôt kick you out, and (in my opinion) the controls are much easier, so if your going to download this, I would recommend you use a PC ( If you have one)
title: Great game, but

review:
So co op.... it‚Äôs very limited. You can‚Äôt do quests, open chests, or do certain dungeons. Like the Temple of the Lion, Temple of the Wolf, and things like that. You can‚Äôt even do quests with other people nor can you open the chests. Even if the person who works you joined open a chest, you don‚Äôt get any loot.

 Also, there should be something like a gifting system or perhaps a trading system. For example, when you have too much of an item and have no need for it, you can always trade it with someone for something you actually need. 

However, the graphics of the game is on point! It‚Äôs so breathtaking, like the graphics and gameplay are so well put together!! The characters are nice as well and I really love the game. 

The anime aesthetic plus the open world adventure is so also well designed. Another feature that I (and probably many other players as well) like is the fact that you can mark places. It‚Äôs so convenient and easy to use. The only reason i put 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the co op being limited but other than that I‚Äôm in love with this game!
title: Trading/Gifting System & Co op

review: I know a lot of times you see reviews and wonder if they are paid. I promise you this one isn‚Äôt. This is the most fleshed out mobile game I have ever played and that‚Äôs AMAZING considering it‚Äôs Free to Play. The game has a slightly smaller region than BoTW but plays pretty much the same. The difficulty isn‚Äôt too crazy which is kind of a shame, but it has a really cool world to explore and some puzzles to handle along the way which aren‚Äôt crazy in difficulty but decent enough for, again, a free game. Now obv, it has micro transactions but the great thing is that they all basically feel cosmetic. The game gives you 5 characters for free through the story missions and never makes you feel like you need to purchase something to eliminate the grind. All in all, great game. Kudos to the developers.
title: Excellent Mobile Game

review: At first I wasn‚Äôt even going to get this game especially on iPhone. I saw it pop up on the store and though ‚Äúwhat the heck, let‚Äôs give it a shot,‚Äù and I am truly happy I did. The game plays extremely well and I love that the mechanics are similar to BOTW. I am extremely shocked that a game that looks this good plays that well on iPhone. I was looking up comparisons on the pc version and phone version graphics wise, and phone version is lighter color wise while the pc version is a little darker, and that‚Äôs it! This just goes to show that a phone game can have good graphics and run well. I also love all the quests, being able to cook, collect characters and to be able to climb. Super excited for version 1.1!

title: like the game, not the storage

review:
This is honestly one of the best iOS games I‚Äôve ever played. The graphics are smooth and visually appealing, the musical score is very peaceful and easy to listen to for long periods of time, the world is large and filled with plenty to do, and the game doesn‚Äôt have some ridiculous tutorial that takes an hour to explain very basic mechanics.

The battle system is fun and engaging, and actually allows the player to use some timing and tactics to liven up the fights, unlike so many games these days which just have auto battle, defeating the whole purpose of playing. This game is really well done, and has been very difficult to put down. It also doesn‚Äôt bombard you with ads or in-app purchases. Really outstanding!
title: Outstanding

review: I‚Äôve played this game for quite a bit, and fell in love with its animation, quality, and effort put into the storylines. It keeps bringing more and more lore to the fandom, feeding the adoring fans who love the adventures. Other than the factors that this is generally a good game, you can also socialize safely, since they beep a lot of slurs, keeping this app kid friendly, although id still recommend that a child should be 10+ to play (only cuz the alcohol). I LOVE THIS GAME, its basically how my hermit self meets people. Along with the event! And OH MY GOODNESS, they bring a lot more spice and lore!!! I adored the lantern rite, and a lot of the new regions recently added. Ive never been more satisfied with a game lol. So yes, 10/10, I totally recommend.
title: .‚Ä¢Introvert HEAVEN‚Ä¢.

review: I‚Äôm currently 13 and have been playing since I was 11. I started playing when I got my PlayStation for Christmas on the year of my parents‚Äô divorce. This game was my escape, my coping mechanism, and took the stress away from everything. This game is so fun and has helped me through an insane amount of drama. Me and my friends play this game and we play for hours before getting off. I cosplay as mainly Genshin Impact characters, and I have a whole shrine of Venti. The story is so interesting and never quits going and being fun. The characters are so well written and are all so diverse through design and personality. I love this game with all of my heart and it‚Äôs been a huge staple in my life.
title: The most life changing game

review:
As stated in title, 30gb for a mobile game is insane and this game does not have complex enough graphics/mechanics for it to be that intensive. 

The game is written like a highschool essay that is also written by a chat bot‚Ä¶ I mean the dialogue is just bad. 

The company and game has a problem with racism (re: no dark skin characters besides ‚Äúprimitive‚Äù enemies, quests and dialogue in sumeru is just plain racism towards Middle Eastern cultures). 

There are a lot of characters and scenes created for fetish content and it‚Äôs only increasing. Not to mention the weird amount of child like characters in tiny outfits with baby voices. 

The one thing that kept me playing was the fighting mechanics. I really enjoy the interaction of different elements and fighting with multiple characters. Until they kept making characters that were not fully fledged or maybe just intentionally poorly designed. I understand balancing the game but I think creating balanced characters instead of really OP characters and then a bunch of really useless recycled ones would make the game more enjoyable.

I really liked this game when it first came out (I am AR 58 so I have played for a while) but it has just become less polished, more fetish/pedo centered, and overall stagnant with the event, quest, and co-op mechanics. A disappointment to say the least
title: Full version of mobile ver is 30gb

review: first of all i love this game. ive played it for about two years and although i am taking a break from it, the game is great. i love the map, the characters, music, and a lot of other things about genshin. however, the storage is a lot to handle, i have a 64 gb phone and genshin took up more than half of it, so i had to delete the game on my phone and move it to my ipad which is 128 gb. it is an open world rpg with lots of quests and along with the map getting larger, i dont really think that the storage problem can be fixed. but, i feel that if it could be fixed to a size that most of the people playing wont have to worry about storage all the time, it would be great!! other than that, i also think being burnt out is a big problem as well - after around ar 50, i feel that theres just a constant routine of daily commissions, farming resin, sometimes spiral, and repeat. i think it gets really boring after. a while and thats one reason i am not playing genshin atm. i just hope that it can be more exciting for late game players and we wont have to worry about storage as much in the future.
title: great but can be better

It was a nice game to take things off of my mind and was nice when you could just look around and do random things when you were bored. I have to say the graphics and smooth animation of the game is just outstanding. I always find satisfaction whenever I play this game. It has provided me tons of options. This is not your typical GATCHA game. They made the game so that you can easily get high rated characters without having to spend anything. I have invested money into the game trying to get my favorite characters and to my success, I was able to get the one‚Äôs I wanted. I definitely recommend this game.
title: Amazing

review:
Genshin Impact has probably the best storyline I have found, yet! But I have a few suggestions. 
First of all, dead characters, such as Guizhong, should be made playable (while dead of course). It would deeply make the story more interesting. 
Another suggestion is, when you release the next chapter of the ‚ÄúDain Quests‚Äù (K‚Äôhanriah Quests kind of thing) I would wish you to make the story a little more exciting than the past ones, since we are now going into the Fontaine arc. 
I have liked things you have implemented for the gacha system in HSR. It would greatly be appreciated to update the Genshin System to those HSR Gacha standards.
Thank you for reading, and I hope you have a blessed day!
title: Excellent!

review: Genshin Impact is a great game to play alone and with friends. For new players it‚Äôs an endless world of exploration and characters and storyline. However, the game is way to big for its own good, Mobile players struggle with downloading the game and I find myself constantly having to delete and reinstall it before a big update (a trick I use to trick my storage into thinking it‚Äôs less than it is) Half the time before a big update I can‚Äôt enjoy the game for a few days because I need to clear up storage. It‚Äôs honestly so annoying but I‚Äôm willing to put up with it for how good of a game it is. It‚Äôs a great game but updates such as letting players delete files from older updates that they don‚Äôt need anymore would be nice.

There is serious whitewashing problem in this company and I do not like it. Xinyan, the one black character is near my skin tone when you color pick and I am a (fairly tanned) white person. I know it isn‚Äôt my issue but representing others is still important and I want to make others feel represented. In my PERSONAL *OPINION* all of the characters need to be made a bit darker to make them more accurate to someone‚Äôs actual skin tone.
