title: Love it but farming primogems are way too hard

review:
This game is good. Great, even. I spend a lot of time on it and enjoy the open world aspect, storyline, and even the ability to build characters and make them do loads of damage. But it‚Äôs taken a downhill plunge with the release of Sumeru, a nation based on the Middle East. The environment, music, and even the recipes are amazing! But the time and effort gone into these characters is highly disappointing. Even Candace / Kandake, Dehya, Cyno, and Nilou are disappointing. They are our ‚Äòdarker skin‚Äô rep and as a paler person I am a lot tanner than they are.

Middle Easterners can be pale, but when a game is filled with already pale individuals it‚Äôs less of adding inclusivity and more of being intolerant. I‚Äôm scared for Natlan, as that‚Äôs a region I‚Äôll be able to relate to because my family‚Äôs culture is from the countries it‚Äôs based off of. I hope Hoyo can actually improve on the designs for Sumeru in the upcoming updates and go above and beyond for Natlan and their culture.
title: Sumeru

review: My cousin has told me such great things about this game, but I downloaded it yesterday and everything was going smoothly until it started downloading data, and it‚Äôs been two in a half days and it‚Äôs barely at 12.0 and I‚Äôve been waiting since 12:15pm (yesterday) for this thing to finish, my sisters has gone so much faster than mine it‚Äôs probably finished but she downloaded hers at 4:30 pm (yesterday) and it started going faster and faster without the app being open. I have tried keeping the app open for about 2 3 hours, and I‚Äôve tried closing the app and not opening it for about 3 hours and I have tried not even using my phone for about 5 hours. I just want to play the game and it won‚Äôt let me!.
title: Why so long?

review: We all know the game was created in China, that‚Äôs where the magic happens. One thing about China is the beauty standard is pale skin, Very colorist and overall strange. We get that‚Äôs what you guys love and find attractive, but that isn‚Äôt the same for the fans. We enjoy genshin gameplay and lore. Another thing is skin tones and areas the map is based on. Of course, Sumeru is based of Southeast Asia, and south Africa. The skin tones there are darker, not white enough that they are glowing. Out of the entirety of Sumeru, there is ONE tan character and of course, as expected, she is a four star like the other tan characters. Would it really hurt you to make more realistic skin tones? Especially in Sumeru because of where it‚Äôs based off of. Though the beauty standard in China is extremely pale almost, white, Most of your fans see the beauty in darker skin tones and would love to embrace it. Do better Hoyoverse.
title: Disappointed

review: This game promised me a great diversity of characters to interact with, but so far I have hardly met anyone that resembles me. I have seen the videos with the devs talking about all the extensive research they have done on different regions in the world to base Teyvat off of, but despite all this they are seriously lacking in any actual skin diversity. It feels unfair to advertise as a diverse world when only a fraction of people are represented. And this upcoming land of Sumeru, from what I‚Äôve seen is supposed to be based off of SWANA culture but all the npcs we have so far have only fair to pale skin. I know there is a lot of color diversity within the SWANA region but to not have at the very least a single npc who is colored feels discriminatory and colorist. Until Hoyoverse fixes their colorism problem I strongly cannot recommend this game to anyone. This is a shame because the story and music is wonderful, but without any of that promised diversity the story falls flat.
title: Lack of Diversity

title: All time favorite!

review: Honestly, the gameplay, music, plot, and characters are all very unique and intricate. The two major issues I have for this game are the size and the lack of rewards. This game, currently, is 20gb in size. A lot of mobile users do not have that type of space! Secondly, as hard as players work to receive their rewards, they do not get much. Being that Genshin Impact is one of the top games of this year, they should be earning money based off of the gameplay of users and their ranking today. It‚Äôs a huge let-down, and it‚Äôs is too obvious that they want players to spend and spend until they can‚Äôt any further. Otherwise, good game for the most part, and this was in no means meant to criticize any of the workers who make this game possible. Just my issues and concerns :)

title: Most Beautiful Free Game

review: the game entices you in as an early player by lots of rewards, but as you progress onwards you realize that you get little to no meaningful rewards after your initial download. endgame content is nonexistent, and long term players suffer. big spenders, low spenders, and free to play are all rewarded the same way: not at all. truly the one people who benefit from spending money on the game are streamers and content creators. the anniversary rewards were a slap in the face. instead of mihoyo listening to their worldwide fanbase, they censor us, ban us, and delete any negative opinions about them. i have played this game for an entire year, and the way they handled the anniversary has severely impacted my view on the game. instead of giving us rewards, they had us COMPETE to get a measly 100 primos. the game does not care about players. if you were considering playing: don't. it's not worth getting addicted. it is not rewarding.
title: game doesn't care about players

review:
Look, it‚Äôs pretty fun at first but once the shininess wears off it ends up just making you feel jaded about time and any money you may have put in. The end game is non existent. The story writing was never great but the pacing also takes a nosedive after the first few chapters. The world feels shallow and empty once explored. Artifacts are basically an impossible and unsatisfying grind. Multiplayer is poorly implemented. It seems that most of the developer time is spent on temporary events which is why the game has failed to significantly improve in the year since it‚Äôs launch. 

It‚Äôs not NOT worth your time, but guard your heart and don‚Äôt get too invested. If you‚Äôre tempted to spend money to ‚Äúprogress‚Äù your account - don‚Äôt. You‚Äôre just rushing towards feeling like there‚Äôs no game left. On top of this I‚Äôve just lost all my faith in this company so I personally don‚Äôt feel comfortable spending anything more here.
title: Don‚Äôt fall in love

review:
I started playing this game almost a year ago and in this time I have experience varying eras of this game. At first it was actually really quite pleasant. Each patch they added something the community had asked for, they buffed a character that felt underwhelming to the community, and they even had a road map at the start of the game. 

Now a year later a lot has changed and not all of it was for the better. We no longer have a general idea of the game‚Äôs direction and what new characters are upcoming in a timely manner. The log In rewards we had at the start of every new patch slowly went away, and now even when we ask for minor fixes to characters (not even buffs) we go ignored. 

It‚Äôs a crying shame to see that this is the path this game went after showing so much promise, but I cannot in good faith recommend this game to anyone. It has a predatory gacha system much worse then traditional gachas, and their marketing ploy is to get people to have buyers remorse/ regret not pulling for a character. 

And to top it all off to reward players who have been playing for a long time they give us absolutely nothing, and  then try to silence us. I will be deleting this game off my devices once if gotten my money‚Äôs worth off the welkin moon and will not be returning unless there are some serious changes.
title: Problematic at best

review:
Gonna keep this one shorter since my last one got removed

Basically the newest story came out of nowhere and was rushed. If you‚Äôve seen Key anime, it‚Äôs like that. Nice beginning. Good character design and music, awful ending with random plot points coming out of no where.

Not to mention them ignoring player feedbacks. Just search up Raiden, Sara, Yoimiya, electro buff, or ‚ÄúBeidou and Raiden‚Äù. all the above characters are weak in game and the company ignores us. Going so much as not letting us comment during a live stream and being emote only. The company has been getting more and more predatory with questionable gaming practices, and then there‚Äôs a community of white knights going ‚Äúoh booba sword‚Äù ‚Äúyummy thighs‚Äù and defending this game. It‚Äôs been just going downhill lately and it seems it will continue. Oh and my last review going into details about one character got removed, so there‚Äôs that.
title: Rushed story, terrible devs who doesn‚Äôt care about player base

title: Amazing game! One suggestion

review:
TLDR; Your results may vary. It‚Äôs a fine game if you don‚Äôt mind busywork questing. Maybe with more time it gets better, but it‚Äôs not my job to make me interested in playing :D. 

The game is okay, but I couldn‚Äôt really get into it. The visuals are nice in a clean ‚Äúbreath of the wild‚Äù like style. The characters are fine for standard Anime tropes. The elemental interaction system is a neat feature as well. The problem I have is everything feel like busy work. Walk here do this. Now walk all the way back. Good job, do it again. I spend more time walking and teleporting (when you find warp stones) than anything. The open world is pleasant, but feels empty, and I have no desire to ‚Äúexplore‚Äù it. However, it‚Äôs a free game and for zero dollars you get an open world time killer with a grind you may love or hate. No reason not to give it a spin and see if it‚Äôs your kind of game.

title: My Suggestions!

review:
I‚Äôve put about 8 hours in this game, and so far I‚Äôve enjoyed every minute of it. Whether it‚Äôs the beautiful graphics of the open world, the fluid-like gameplay similar to BotW, or the Gacha system, it has been a pretty awesome experience! People complain about the probability rates of the Gacha system but that‚Äôs how RnG works. 

Now to the part I wanted to complain about, Co-op mode. The main reason I wanted to play this game was to enjoy it with my friends as we progress through the story, however that was all put to a stop once we got to rank 16 (the rank requirement to start co-op). The options were so limited for my friends that I thought they should‚Äôve just left this as a single player game. The only thing they can do is participate in my dungeons, loot materials such as iron chunks, and explore the world with their story progression being halted. I was hoping we would be able to progress through the game together, but that hope sure did get squashed. In the future, I am anticipating some major improvements to the co-op feature to make this game more enjoyable for the player and their friends.

Other than that this game has been a delightful experience

Thank you!

However, I‚Äôve realized that it‚Äôs very VERY easy to get your world level up while your character‚Äôs are still low level. Right now I‚Äôm struggling to kill the pyro/cryo regisvines and the Oceanids because my characters are about +10 levels lower than the bosses. I love the game but, honestly, it‚Äôs not very first time user friendly. At least, not for me it hasn‚Äôt been. title: It‚Äôs a great game but..

review:
My favorite game! However, one of my favorite parts is mastering all the recipes I can cook. But there‚Äôs no way to differentiate between the ones I‚Äôve already mastered and the ones I still need to work on without going through all of them. I think some sorting options for mastered and unmastered recipes would be really helpful!

Secondly, I‚Äôve been having the same issue repeatedly. Every time there is maintenance to be done, it will tell me a day before it happens and not let me log in until the scheduled maintenance is over. So instead of waiting 5 hours, I‚Äôm waiting 19-31 hours. And I don‚Äôt even know which one it is, because it doesn‚Äôt specify AM or PM either.

So, while this is my favorite game, I‚Äôm getting really tired of having these problems.

title: The best game of boredom, honestly

review: I absolutely love this game! The ambiance, the visuals, the story, for gods sake the story! I love the concept of the game. For anyone who is interested in playing Genshin Impact, I‚Äôll explain the story. You start off traveling through different worlds with your brother or sister (depending on what sibling you pick), before a strange god blocks your path. The god takes your sibling, and strands you in Tevyat, stripped of your powers. You then meet your traveling companion, Paimon! The two of you start to travel through the land, visiting the Archon statues within the regions. I love that this game I open world. In a fairly new player, and I‚Äôm still on the mondstat part of the story. But, I‚Äôve already unlocked a lot of Liyue and Sumeru.
title: Yes. Just yes.

review: The game overall is stunning, beautiful music and scenery and just amazing lore within the game. The only main problem is just how you can‚Äôt say that you will be basing one of the regions of Egypt or India and just make all of the characters white or pale. If you want to make good representation of every region, go further and expand your horizons. Adding more skin tones and more diversity in the game will not only bring more attention to it, but more people to relate to a certain character. Candace was based of a *black* goddess, and she is simply tan in her game design. It doesn‚Äôt make sense, seeing how this is such an amazing company, you all can do better. Not to mention the amount of beauty Indian culture has and with the art style and animations you as a company, you could‚Äôve expressed the beauty of cultures in a new way
title: Diversity

review: I don‚Äôt usually write reviews but I‚Äôm writing one to contrast those that say this game doesn‚Äôt have enough content. I‚Äôve played this game since launch and while I will admit that at launch this game didn‚Äôt have enough content, that is no longer the case. The game currently has 4 major zones, each with their own side quests and zone story to play alongside the main story. During and in-between story arcs, they also have countless events that are usually staggered to be back-to-back with other events. If you‚Äôre getting into the game now, you have an enormous amount of content to choose from and probably won‚Äôt be bored any time soon.
title: Countless Hours of Content

review: I love Genshin! I remember how excited I was when I first started playing, exploring Mondstadt and Liyue. The Inazuma update was as stunning and beautiful as the other regions, and I was really looking forward to Sumeru. However, I noticed that many characters were extremely pale and white. Now, why is that a problem? Sumeru is the region based off the middle east/desert. The people who live there should have dark and tanned skin. Making them pale is erasure of what could have been good representation. Also, their outfits contained many themes of orientalism and therefore do not respect the real-life cultures of the middle east/north africa. Genshin was such a wonderful game before this update- I hope that Hoyoverse will at least consider changing things about the characters to be more respectful to the irl people and cultures.
title: Wonderful game- except for Sumeru

Hello,

title: A great game, although some things I‚Äôd like to change

review: Genshin Impact is one of the most fun rpg games I‚Äôve played in a very long while. The variety of characters and their abilities is extensive (though the gacha system is as dangerous as ever), combat is fast paced- generally what you‚Äôd expect to sum it up. I love the story, and playing through it is thrilling... when the game lets me play. One of the most frustrating things for me in ANY game is a level block. After you finish a story quest, you can‚Äôt progress further until you reach a certain level, and the slow level progression is aggravating. The game is fun enough for me to keep playing despite having to grind after every quest, but if you have little patience and prefer speed-runs, this is not the game for you.
title: It‚Äôs a fun game, but story progression...

review:
When this game originally came out, I wasn‚Äôt able to access my PC for a couple days, meaning I had to play on phone. As I saw that it barely fit within the phone recommended model (8+), I prepared myself for a lag fest. But suprisingly, it didn‚Äôt lag at all! Granted, it caps out at 30 FPS, but I honestly could care less, since 30 and 60 look similar to me. When I went to play it on PC, my computer sounded like a turbine engine, and the game would frequently lag at medium settings. So, I‚Äôve probably played the mobile version more than the PC version. 
Aside from the anecdote, the gameplay is great, and any fans of open world games have to give this a shot, PC, PS4, or Mobile.

review: This game is quite literally everything I‚Äôve wanted in an RPG for ages. It has the potential to set the standard for years to come. Graphics, combat, soundtrack, story, everything is spot on. If not for characters and gear, than for more ‚Äúresin‚Äù (energy to complete actions). Let me be clear though, you don‚Äôt have to spend anything to enjoy this game. That said, if you don‚Äôt, you WILL miss out on any number of things, and regardless of what you‚Äôve heard that‚Äôs OK. The game is still fantastic at its core, and designed for successful progression whether you spend or not.

i love the storyline and how the lore is processing, but with sumeru releasing, most of the characters are pale white. you changed your company name to expand globally and make 7 nations all based on different regions but cant even give proper representation?? and even with the characters that are tan, theyre still whitewashed like candace. adding on, characters like kaeya and xinyan are the only 2 playable dark-skinned characters in the game so far yet theyve been whitewashed multiple times too by hoyoverse themselves.
and another note, the wishing system is horrible. if youve played this game you know how frustrating it is to wish. for those that dont know, its most definitely not free to play. you have a 50% chance of getting the limited 5* on the banner within the first 90 wishes but if you lose to a standard character, then you will get that limited 5* character guaranteed. so if you have bad luck, you will get that limited character within 180 wishes. primogems that can be converted to wishes are really time consuming to farm for bc they dont give that much primos in events or rewards. and considering my luck, ive wished on 10 different character banners and i lost on half of them, thus most of them were guaranteed.

title: Best Game Out There

review:
This game is absolutely stunning when it comes to graphics and art! 
The gameplay is really smooth, the storyline is interesting, and the characters look amazing, they each have their own abilities. I legit have nothing to complain about when it comes to this game. It is very high quality when it comes to a mobile game and I don‚Äôt regret downloading it! The developers really did pay attention to detail when making it and I appreciate it. There is a lot to explore and the game will probably kill a lot of boring time (and your phone battery) which is a good source of entertainment. 

And the fact that this game is free makes it all the more amazing! ‚ú®

Also I can‚Äôt help but think that this game is really similar to The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild on the Nintendo Switch. So I would say that this is a decent alternative if you can‚Äôt afford Breath of the Wild.

I would suggest that you make a lot of room on your phone before downloading the full version of the game. It does take up quite a bit of space and it would be annoying if the game was slow.
title: Amazing RPG game!

review: We LOVE Genshin. BUT we were recently logged off accidentally and are now unable to log back in due to ‚Äúpoor network quality‚Äô‚Äù this is crazy because we were able to log in to the same account on a different device on the same network. (I would continue to allow my daughter to use this device if it weren‚Äôt needed for work) After reaching out to the developer via email and receiving no response, we resorted to the internet and have tried everything from deleting app, resigning in, upgrading WiFi service in house and resetting an iPad to factory settings. Still, my work iPhone is the only device that doesn‚Äôt get the poor network quality message. Rather upsetting as we have spent hundreds of dollars for in app purchases on this game. I would give the game 5 stars if this hadn‚Äôt happened.
title: Great game but MAJOR issues

review:
I love this game, but it crashes so much on tablet that it‚Äôs actually impossible for me to complete some quests. There are multiple times when I‚Äôve been unable to complete my commissions for the day because the game crashes and resets my progress every time. 

I usually don‚Äôt mind the constant crashing‚Äîits fast enough to just start the game again, but when the crashes get in the way of the actual gameplay it‚Äôs infuriating. I‚Äôve been unable to advance in the story quest for almost a week now because I cannot progress past a cutscene without crashing and having to start it all over. 

This is deeply frustrating because currently this is my favorite game and I love everything else about it.

title: wow

review:
When the game is going well it‚Äôs so enjoyable! There‚Äôs a ton to do and the style is beautiful! I genuinely enjoy this game but there are major flaws to the point that I‚Äôm considering quitting. 

For instance, the secrets of tianquin quest is a random quest that is almost impossible for people to beat unless your world level is still low (look online and see for yourself). That wouldn‚Äôt normally be an issue but it will lock you out of coop mode indefinitely until you beat it. Unfortunately, there‚Äôs no way to back out of the quest if you accidentally start it. This isn‚Äôt a new issue, it‚Äôs been reported to mihiyo well over a year ago and they‚Äôve done nothing to help, leaving a ridiculous amount of people locked out of coop mode. 

Btw, before you say to yourself ‚Äújust git gud‚Äù, this quest I mentioned is notably harder than any boss fight I‚Äôve experienced in the game. It wasn‚Äôt play tested enough.
title: Amazing game but major issues

review: Honestly, at first I thought it was a BOTW copy, but once you get past the first bit, the story completely changes! I love to play and it combines many different types of games. For example, it has a collecting part to it (with the characters), an adventure theme, it also has a Battle Pass, and soon they‚Äôll be a housing part of the game to it in the 1.5 update! There‚Äôs so much to do in this game, and still not a lot of the actual game is out! Plus, it‚Äôs free! There‚Äôs also co-op mode, which makes it TWICE AS BETTER! You can team up against bosses, explore together, or just mess around and have fun! There‚Äôs also SO many other small quests! Please get it, I‚Äôm sure you won‚Äôt regret it.
title: Please get this!

review: Overall this game is phenomenal! The art, and just dedication is what really brings out the extraordinary gameplay. But, the summoning for five stars. This is really the only complaint I have. The rates for 5 stars (just one) can be under .600%! I‚Äôve seen people blow off hundreds of dollars just to get maybe one five star. For a free to play player like myself, this takes away a lot of the excitement when a new banner comes up. It‚Äôs so devastating that people have to make new accounts again and again just because they can‚Äôt spend money. Just general advice, you should make the percentage higher, or at least make a guaranteed five star pull for beginners. The whole game is great, but the constant reliance on recharging to get a good game play ruins that, and makes it less enjoyable.

title: Amazing

review:
I‚Äôm addicted to this game. The open world of Teyvat and Archon quest story pull you in immediately. There‚Äôs an incredible cast of characters that are all lovable and unique. Even though I‚Äôm free to play, I don‚Äôt have much trouble obtaining the characters I want. (It does take a lot of time investment to obtain enough wishes for them, however.) Each nation in Teyvat is based off a real country, and you can see how they use real aspects of the culture and architectural designs of the nations. And the music is some of the best I‚Äôve ever heard, in any game. 

By far the greatest game I‚Äôve ever played on my phone or iPad. I couldn‚Äôt recommend it enough!

I feel like this was sudden and that I was additionally unprepared- the worst possible combo I could have had. I would really appreciate if the game added that back. Thank you for your time.

title: WINGS!!!

review:
It‚Äôs known that Genshin Impact‚Äôs regions are based on countries in the real world. Mondstadt is based on German culture, Liyue is based on Chinese culture, and Inazuma is based on Japanese culture. The upcoming nation, Sumeru, is rumored to be based on Middle Eastern, Southeast Asian, and North African cultures, yet rumors, leaks, and speculations about the game have shown that there are a lack of darker toned characters. In my opinion, to have a game based on real-life countries and yet only have not even a variety of skin tones is completely outrageous and unrealistic to the real world. The lack thereof doesn‚Äôt only make the people (npcs & playable characters) have limited designs and seem repetitive, it also causes an increase of anti-
blackness and colorism within the fandom. Change needs to be made, characters need to be more diverse for many more reasons than I have stated. To be a multi-million dollar company and yet not listen to the fan base is completely wrong.
title: Only 2 Dark Toned Characters?

I‚Äôve played a lot of games just like this and never have I had one that cheats so much or gives the creatures the advantage. You need to fix this problem because every time I get knocked out of a play area I have to go back and start all over from the beginning with the monster. That‚Äôs a load of bull. Why does the monster get to regenerate health and I have to go into my bag while I‚Äôm getting hit. There is no way to win. I think your game is set up so you have to pay to win and I‚Äôm not spending money on a game where the creatures have the advantage

title: Amazing, but a few problems

review:
The first few hours are nice. There are some very well done mechanics and it is a very good open world for a mobile game.
Then the gacha gets you.
At higher levels every aspect of the game forces you towards spending money.
At Adventure Level 45, there is maybe 20 minutes of content a day, while loot is meager. 
The resin system limits all aspects of player and gear improvement. Spending money or not playing are the only options. Spending a LOT of money. 
You are forced to only level a character or two at a time because it will take months to level all of them, or you can spend money.
Rolling for characters is deceptive. To actually get all of the features, you must successfully roll for a specific character 7 times (6 for the free ones). A couple recent characters were not great until you rolled them a couple times. 
The combination of all the intentional limits on loot and character progression turns this from a good game to a horrible money grab. 
The character banner events successfully use ‚Äúfear of missing out‚Äù to coerce spending because normal drop rate for anything but low level junk weapons miniscule. 
It was probably an early sign that this game was predatory when many people started and abandoned accounts when their free initial rolls failed to produce the first good characters.
title: This game is good until it becomes predatory.

review: I want to start off and say that the game play is beautiful and well thought out. As far as the game itself I liked it. But downloading it was already a lot of space. 2-3 GB + and additional 8GB after the Demo. Then after about a week of having it on my phone.. nothing on my phone would work. So I went to investigate... peviously I had only been using 95GB total worth of storage and phone functioning space... all of a sudden I was using 200.5 GB worth of space and my phone was heating up and crashing all the time and it was burning my iPhone battery. I deleted the app. Immediately my phone went down to 100GB worth of space. I was looking forward to playing this game but it‚Äôs unrealistic and sad for it to burn my iPhone XS like this üò¢. If there is a further update that fixes this feature I will reconsider.

title: Amazing, but one problem

review:
This game features gameplay that you'd see on a $60 Console/PC game, but it's a free-to-play mobile game. The combat system is very smooth, intuitive, and just feels really good to play. On top of that, the game has beautiful, stylistic graphics and effects, as well as beautifully animated cutscenes. 

If you are the story type, you will find satisfaction in the depth of the story this game features- but you will find that you can also go off explore the large, open world to your heart's content, your curiosity constantly rewarded with hidden chests and challenges that make the detour worthwhile. 

This game has a little bit for everyone, and I think once you pick it up, you'll have trouble putting it down.

review: They made a region based on the middle east but won't even represent at least half of the characters properly? She looks like a westernized forest elf, like she could be Klee's cousin or something. If they were going to make her pale, then they should've made her clothes more culturally significant. A simple bangle and bodhi leaves does not cover that. I don't think I even need to go into detail about Dori. How are you going to be orientalist as an Asian company? The colorism is also holding the character designs back. Take one look at Tighnari and tell me he wasn't designed to have tanned skin, he's literally outside all day. The character design team is doing so bad right now. It is so bad. I wanna give you a zero, but that's not possible. So I give you a one.

review: Hoyoverse after having almost every character have the same skinny anime character body and face shape with skin tones that are LIGHTER THAN MINE (i‚Äôm white) and completely unrealistic for actual people, even in areas that are meant to be based off of southeast Asia and northern Africa (areas of the world where more people have darker skin tones), and making the only 2 out of 40+ characters that have darker skin still extremely pale, one of them is described as ‚Äúexotic‚Äù and ‚Äúmysterious‚Äù, the other is ‚Äúscary‚Äù and ‚Äúthreatening‚Äù, and still expecting people to not notice/care, especially when said characters are constantly lightened in official artwork, and to pay 100+ USD for the 50/50 chance of pulling a character in their game, when they are an extremely rich company that could easily add diversity to their characters but they still refuse to out of fear of losing money from racist/colorist players:

review:
Genshin Impact is one of the most popular games in the world, and it‚Äôs not hard to see why. The graphics and the gameplay can be quite appealing. The characters‚Äô designs are unique, yet still absolutely beautiful. And the stories are great!

However, there are a couple things I would like to be improved upon. For one thing, I feel like the reward for reaching AR 60 should be increased. Players have worked hard to get to that spot, only to earn as much as one could easily by doing their daily commissions and completing easy tasks. I don‚Äôt know. It just feels a little disappointing.

The weapon banner also irks me quite a bit. The fact that you have to lose the 50/50 TWICE in order to guarantee you desired weapon is a little absurd. I believe it should be like the limited character banner, when you only have to lose once.

There‚Äôs not much else to be said. I suppose better anniversary gifts would be nice, but us players can‚Äôt force Hoyoverse into giving what we want.

But this game truly is a wonderful experience. If you‚Äôre interested in the game, you should totally give it a try!

if you‚Äôre going to download this app, just be wary parts of it are complicated and it will drain your battery if youre on mobile (like i am). the controls are something you would have to kind of get used to but once you understand them it becomes natural to you. starting out, get any chests you can and pick up everything in sight, it will all have a use eventually. even if you dont think it will, believe me, it will.

i think that‚Äôs pretty much it for what i have to say about this game.

I‚Äôve been playing for about a year and four months by now. I love this game and everything in it. I started Genshin at the peak of my depression, and it helped me out of it. Every single system and part of the game has so much heart put into it. The world is expansive, but not empty. The story is heartfelt, and though it may operate on a cosmic scale, it feels deeply personal. The gameplay loops are satisfying and they have a constant sense of progress. title: Changed my Life for the Better

review:
Game was a lot of fun but the direction of their design is poor now. They will create a problem and then ‚Äúsell‚Äù you the solution. 

A lot of their new characters are designed around potentially being viable in the future (cyno and dehya) instead of with current content. Using in game currency or real money hoping something might be usable in the future is bad and developers shouldn‚Äôt be rewarded for such poor design.

Likewise, a great number of character base kits are balanced around the user having multiple copies (constellations) to boost their base kit. This makes having the base kit clunky and not user friendly. This was not really seen in the older units and is a newer trend to encourage people to spend real money.

Overall, the game was fun when the company could take user feedback and admit they messed up (like with Zhongli) but with new characters such as Faruzan and Dehya they have ignored the community and have deliberately given these characters (products) clunky and poorly designed kits that require months of in game saving or hundreds of dollars to ‚Äúfix.‚Äù

TLDR: company was good at launch but has been shifting to focusing on creating problems and selling their users the ‚Äúfix.‚Äù 

As always, this is my opinion based on my experience with the game and your mileage might vary.
title: Was fun but poor design now

review:
Addictive, fun, massive map, amazing combat system, decent story, and amazing characters. The only thing from this game you could ask for is consistant content to binge. It is a lot like destiny in that aspect which is nice for some players who are more casual who don‚Äôt want to feel like they are missing out like they would in other games like WoW. 
I have been playing for around a year and a half and I have loved every second (aside from losing 50/50 of course) 

I would recommend to anyone looking for a casual single player game.

The new cast of characters is almost all whitewashed. Sumeru is supposed to be a region based on Middle Eastern cultures and countries, which has a very big population of tan people, so would it really be that hard to make some more playable characters more tan? Yun Jin is a perfect example of how Hoyoverse was able to represent Chinese culture appropriately in the game, so is it really that much more of a hassle to represent other cultures other than their own? They‚Äôve claimed to have done their research on the region and the Sumerian landscape and environment is amazing, but the characters are terribly executed. Would it be a problem if the workers needed to put a little more thought into their designs? Something has to change if I‚Äôm going to continue playing this game.

title: I love this game

review: Genshin Impact is a beautiful game with unique characters, a wonderful open world map, and interesting story line. (No I am not a bot) I give this game 5 stars for those reasons and I love playing the game. However, while I am pretty apathetic towards the anniversary rewards (I have never really been one to hype myself up too much), I can understand the backlash from the community. I think MiHoyo could do more in terms of listening to their community and I hope they will make these improvements in the future. However I think it goes to say hate the creator, not the game. The game truly lives up to most of its hype and I am looking forward to continuing my adventure in the future.
title: Genshin‚Ä¶

review:
Genshin is a beautiful game. From world design to character details they do a brilliant job of making the world feel alive and fun to wander. The story is a bit slow in the beginning but as you go on the story fully invests you to the point you can‚Äôt put it down.

Huge problem though, if you‚Äôre f2p it‚Äôs pretty rough, especially later game. The game is based off a gacha system which means you only have a slim chance at getting the characters or weapons you want. Those chances don‚Äôt come very often if you‚Äôre f2p. It can take a f2p user a month to get you a 10 pull which will get you something decent, not great. 

As a result it‚Äôs better to avoid thinking of it as a f2p game. The best price in the game is for a monthly pass called Welkin. You spend  5$ USD and gets you a solid sum of gems per day, cutting down the amount of time for a 10 pull to about 10 days. 

Still, if you want to get the characters you want, even with Welkin, it‚Äôs either an investment of time and patience or your wallet. Mihoyo knows what they‚Äôve developed is addictive and fun to play and they make sure to drain their users for it.
title: Amazing, If You Pay

review: I overall love this game, but in the end, I ended up needing to delete. Now I do lots of animating of sorts, and even that takes up a lot of storage. I needed to delete lots of my projects to download this game because it just took up a huge amount of storage. And because of this, I needed to delete because I couldn‚Äôt expand my storage amount. Now obviously there‚Äôs no changing this, but I just want to let everyone know that this game is a huge amount of storage space. even though this is the case, this game is absolutely amazing. title: love the game <3

review: As a PC/Console game on mobile it's pretty good. Great visuals, music despite its lack of originality. Gameplay loop at its core is fun. However the extremely predatory monetization is just awful. Terrible rates and stamina system. It's like they don't want hardcore people to play yet try and force them to stay. Disappointing considering all the feedback they received during closed beta and the more fair & sustainable system in their previous game Honkai Impact 3rd. Baffling considering they reduced the amount of currency you can earn in Abyss from the beta considering the atrocious rates. Well below industry standards. Sad to see that they pushed monetization to the limit for launch, damaging dedicated long term investment in the process. Story is also unimportant with unskippable cutscenes. Let the players decide if they want to pay attention to that annoying cringe. Please do better.
title: Artificial Shackles, Gambling, and Regression in Consumer Friendly Monetization & Longevity

review:

title: Great game!

review:
This game is awesome. Has some slight graphics requirements so u can‚Äôt run it on below average PCs on good setting, but even tho I play on the lowest possible, the graphics are still awesome. The story and lore and backstories and great, and the foreshadowing for the plot lines is great. The quests are fun and the combat is diverse.

Now for some of the issues. Once you get to late game, around AR 55+, there is a severe lack of content to the point where I myself only play for 20 minutes a day because the dailies are all there is to do. Mihoyo does a good job of pumping out fun events so that is mitigated sometimes. 

Overall, I recommend this game highly. Be careful with ur money tho.

review: I have been dealing with this issue for several months. Someone hacked my account and made purchases on my account. They also have an energy systems called ‚Äúresin‚Äù which limits what you can or cannot do everyday. title: Warning before playing

review:
I have been able to play to the first city. The game looks wonderful, but it does not run well on my older iPad Pro. The starting white screen takes a minute to load the title (which is a terrible sign), and nothing renders after that except for instructions on how to start the game.

In game, the cinematics are incredibly laggy and stutter. When I‚Äôm able to move the character, I can only see within a few feet of my character. The entire background is black/void. Water is black/void. Lowering the settings does nothing for render distance except make the graphics more blurry. Eventually, you will get to a forced encounter, where the game does not render anything, and you cannot continue.

This seems to be the problem with anything but iPhone 8 and up and the newest iPads. If you have an older device, don‚Äôt bother downloading it until they fix these performance issues/bugs.
title: Lots of bugs and performance issues.

review:
This is honestly a great game! When you become an endgame player you might get a bit bored, but with every update comes new events! You can always participate in events and there is a Gacha system. 

!IF YOU ARE A CHILD DO NOT SPEND MONEY ON GACHA IN THIS GAME!

It is not worth it because nothing is guaranteed. If you get to 90 pity you will be guaranteed a five star, but if you are wishing in the limited banner, you are not guaranteed the limited 5 star when you get to 90 pity. You can either get Qiqi, Mona, Keqing, Diluc, and Jean or a weapon. It is a 50/50 chance. But don‚Äôt worry, if you have enough primos you can get the limited 5 star guaranteed! The next five star you get will be the limited, so keep on grinding!

Some people are complaining about storage. I agree a bit but some people are like ‚ÄúfiX uR gAmE‚Äù and giving the game 1 star. At least play the game first!

Someone also said that they couldn‚Äôt get past level 25 which probably means adventure rank 25. You have to do the Ascension Quest first.

Overall this is an awesome game!

review:
Update:  with version 2.0, I am sad to report that the game is near impossible to play as it crashes so much.  I can‚Äôt play domains, co-op mode, or change parties without the game crashing.

I love this game.  It is a lovely open world exploration rpg.  Very f2p friendly (but chip in and buy the $5 subscription if you like it).  My one criticism is that the game crashes all. The. Time.  Particularly when accessing any menu.  I once had it crash 12 times in 20 minutes while upgrading weapons and such.  Other than that, great art, fun gameplay, and engaging, amusing story.  

As you progress in Adventure Rank, there is a point where it gets grindy because world level automatically increases.  So if you are just running around having fun, the world gets too tough for you to live in.  You have to make sure to spend your resin every day to keep up.  Still, though, quite fun.

title: Getting Boring Fast

review:
My phone overheats enough that I have to ice it to play, but oh my is this a game. Graphics are beautiful, character stories are captivating, and missions are unique and challenging. The open world has endless areas to explore, and updates keep bringing us more. The main plot is a fun story that has kept me playing for hours.
I would love to see more character stories that we can interact with in the open world in future updates, like you did with the intro to Razor, and maybe a way to work toward collecting characters I want rather than solely the random draw, but even still, this is an incredible game. None of its flaws are large enough to interrupt gameplay. Keep it up, I‚Äôd love to see more!

title: Personally The Best Game I‚Äôve Ever Played

review:
Honestly, this would be five stars if it weren‚Äôt for co-op mode. Overall, Genshin Impact is keeping most of my friendships, well, friendships. It‚Äôs really beautiful, and the characters, um, you well get the point. 

I literally love everything about this game‚Ä¶well almost everything.

Let‚Äôs start with co-op mode. 

It‚Äôs really bad, not gonna lie.

Need some primogems? Wanna do a primogem domain with your friend? Nope, sorry!

You want to do a world quest? Nope!

You want to do that one really annoying commission where you have to give that dude radish veggie soup? Hint: Can‚Äôt submit item in co-op mode!

Do you want help with an event? No way! f2p loser.

Need help with a story/archon quest? Try again.

Do you see what I‚Äôm getting at? You really cannot do anything in co-op mode but artifact domains and material domains. You can‚Äôt even do every commission!

Next- primogems

After ar 40, (I‚Äôm ar 43) if you do your quests and actually do things in Genshin, you really can‚Äôt get primogems anymore, it‚Äôs really hard.

Glad I don‚Äôt do my quests I guess.

You can really only get them from commissions after that.

Other than that, it‚Äôs really good!
title: co-op mode and getting primogems

review: So, I‚Äôve been playing genshin since it launched and I think I‚Äôm ready to finally give a review. Let me make this short and sweet for those with short attention spans. The game is stunning, beautiful, and fun. You would think that would be a 5 star right? No. WHATS limiting it is their ‚Äúgreed‚Äù for profit. It feels like they don‚Äôt even wanna give us anything. As a person who has played cookie run I honestly feel as if we should get a little more. In cookie run, if you get a duplicate of an event character you get crystals! And you get like materials for your cookies almost everyday. I don‚Äôt want to compare, but I kinda have to when it‚Äôs this much of a different in community givings.

title: Really good game! One problem though

review:
This GACHA game is an absolute waste of your time. At first, you'll be sucked into a game that promises open world, beautiful graphics, amazing music. It‚Äôs true, the game has all of that. However, the more you play, the more you find glaring flaws in this game and just how greedy the company owning this game really is. 

So many characters come out with scuffed kits, which is terrible since you need to save for a long time or pay money to get them. The balance team is nonexistent. There is absolutely no end game content aside from spiral which resets every two weeks and takes an hour at most. Resin is a huge limiting factor and a lot of your character progression is linked to rng of artifacts, since they make or break your character. The story telling for this game has turned into a dating sim with horribly written storylines and terrible rushed pacing. 

Also, this game has a problem is censoring anyone who doesn‚Äôt agree with them. They are truly following the ideals of their motherland. 

Anniversary was an absolute joke and just goes to show that the company views us as nothing but promotion bots. The rewards are abysmal and there‚Äôs no communication from mhy about anything. 

Do not play this game and do not give the company any money. They do not deserve it.
title: Promising game run by greedy company

review:
This is one of the greatest game to come out, which is also free. People are crying because the pity system is too high, but at least there is a pity system. These players have never seen something like Fate Grand Order, which didn‚Äôt have a pity system and you could play for a year without getting a 5 star. And you keep playing because 5 stars are valuable so I bet that even that you complaint about the pity system, you count down to the moment it is guaranteed. 
Stop been children over a free game, if you decide to pay, that‚Äôs on you. I love this game and would hate to see it go down because people are entitled.
title: Great Game Childish Players

review: If you are a player who wants to get decent anniversary rewards or in general this game isn‚Äôt for you. Genshin Impact is a game that barely gives primos to players for free. Some of the bosses are also a pain in the but when you need to grind materials which is only from those bosses. My experience might not be the same as others considering the fact I was ar 32 but I hope this gives you a idea of the game.

title: Great game! But..

review: I‚Äôm AR55 and have been playing since last December. For how long I have played this game and for how much time i‚Äôve invested in my characters and spent money to obtain said characters, the developers of this game, despite now being worth approximately one billion dollars now, do not care about their player base and do not communicate with them. The game lacks end game content, end game rewards, and especially lacks new and interesting gameplay despite being out for a year with a new update every 6 weeks. Not to mention the latest story quest centered around Inazuma was terribly written and felt incredibly rushed. I love this game very much but for how much time i‚Äôve put into this game it all feels like a waste. There are other games out there worth your time. Do not spend money on this game and take things slowly if you truly feel you want to play Genshin Impact.

title: Amazing game, small issue

review:
I love this game. The graphics are great, character design is amazing, but this is the best way I could find to ‚Äúfile a report‚Äù. I don‚Äôt even know if this is actually a report because it‚Äôs happened to so many people but I‚Äôm doing it anyway. I have been farming for Hu Tao for a while. Once I got 20 wishes I went straight to Wishing. I did my first 10-Pull and Xiangling and Chongyun (forgive me if I spelled those wrong). title: 5 Stars, but one thing...

review:
When I first started this game I thought it was simply a Zelda copycat, which isn‚Äôt exactly a bad thing, but this game has a ton of depth and support. There is a ton of content available, even to those who play for free. Plus you aren‚Äôt bombarded with ads every few minutes to ruin the immersion. 
The fighting aspect is very responsive and with the different elements coming into play, switching out team members and using strategy vs. just wailing away at the enemies is recommended, not to mention very fun! 
Whether you want to free play just to pass the time or want to dive deep and pay to get the most out of the experience, this game is great!
title: More impressive than I thought

review: Amazing work. I would recommend this game for any open world game lover, rpg lover, or both. And to all the people who is about to say crap about how this game has a bad rolling system, just don‚Äôt, because you can clearly win while still not spending a single dime on this game. You can also beat the game perfectly fine with the starting characters. You know how the starting character works. You literally have a free 5 star character off the bat. The rolls are just for people who want to test their luck for another character. And I can almost guarantee that even if you are free to play, you can prob get a five star character with the free amount of primo gems you get through the game.
title: Amazing work

I‚Äôm not saying I deserve a oh wow here you can go but i think there should be a way to skip a certain part of the storyline. title: Great but

title: ONE OF THE BEST GAMES

review: With the number of people 1 star reviewing or leaving the game altogether over the v4.4 rewards I had to drop a deserved 5 star review. It‚Äôs insane how greedy and selfish people are becoming. Ten years ago, we would have to pay $60 in order to get a game with this a deep of story and lore, graphics quality, and advanced mechanics. The fact that content is added regularly keeping the game in a constant state of play is amazing in itself. WE GET IT ALL FOR FREE. The game is a great game regardless of rewards. If you have played it yet, ignore the 1 star reviews , it‚Äôs nothing but crying from people who feel they are owed everything despite providing nothing.
title: It‚Äôs a AAA Quality Game that‚Äôs FREE

review:
The reward for playing this game and being dedicated for 3 years is 3 wishes. In the worst case that is 1.6% of a 5 star, but it is 2.8% for the average amount of pulls for a 5 star. They are essentially rewarding players less than the maintenance reward for playing the game for 3 years.

Honkai star rail has gotten a free, limited, top-tier, meta 5 star for winning game of the year. A lot of people are saying that these two games can‚Äôt be compared but they are both the same genre (gacha) made by the same company. Genshin should give their players something similar because it is unbelievable that the reward for supporting this game for 3 years (while also ignoring the voices of players asking for basic quality of life changes that HSR was released with) is frankly a slap in the face.

Currently China is unfollowing Genshin in response to this tone-deaf ‚Äúrewarding‚Äù done by Genshin. I‚Äôm not sure if the EN community will get any compensation for this as it is common for Genshin to compensate the CN community much more than EN. Players in EN should follow what CN is doing and try to get change from Genshin because the player base deserves more than what they‚Äôre getting now.

I will change this review if Genshin does properly compensate the players and reward everyone for their support.
title: Horrible rewards, Ignores player voice

I like Genshin Impact a lot, but we have no rides at all to get around the map! If we could have like a horse or cow maybe to get on a quest or buy, it would be so much fun! We could also go to open fields and catch (tame) horses that we can get to ride and go to a shop or barn to add the horse to our horse collection or horse list. 
Having horses would fix a lot of stuff and especially getting around the map and exploring. I bet if the game added horses that would be some more people playing Genshin Impact. Please, Please, consider this recommendation!! Thank you so much for reading! ü´∂üèª

title: Game is amazing

review: Genshin is an amazing game honestly. The world is big, there are many characters, and the gameplay is solid. Fighting is nice and fluid, but banner reruns are slow. The game is gacha game so be prepared for high investment and time. With the most recent addition to the game being Dehya, I am very disappointed with the game. All throughout Sumeru none of the characters impressed me as much as Dehya, yet Mihoyo released her in a state where she brings no value to your team. How could they miss the mark so much? The characters are the reason people play this game, so to have one release in such a poor state is very disheartening. I fully understand that not every character should be op, but this is downright sad. I am thankful that powercreep has been left to a minimal though. I hope Mihoyo rethinks their balancing of Dehya in the near future.
title: Disappointment in Recent Characters

review:
Love the game. Paimon is super annoying, shut the voices off for a better experience. The reason I game 4 stars instead of 5 is this. The game is fun, but the wishes don't pay out well. Free to play players will have a very hard time getting 5 star player or weapons. You will get some, but good luck. Also there's just nothing to do after you finish the story line. Just grind and level up, but the truth is you only need level 70ish characters to beat the game with ease. The domain farming for artifacts is pretty lame, super hard to get what you want, you might have to hit the same domain 50 times and still not get it. 

A pvp option would definitely liven up the game for end game users and everyone else.
